One area as an example of Chung and Hoan being accommodating was with my diet. I am a vegetarian and this was no problem for Hoan to handle. All meals were delicious and provided me with more food than I needed. The combination of one night staying in a hotel and the next with a local family was brilliant. The host families were friendly and welcoming. This system gave a perfect balance for privacy one night and engaging local culture the next. The motorcycle that I was provided was nearly new with just 12,000 kms. We had absolutely no mechanical problems encountered on the way. Please do not hesitate to book your next motorcycle adventure with Mr. Chung. You cannot have but a terrific journey!!Lennard Jorgensen, Danmark

Motorbike tour of north Vietnam. This was a true adventure, and our guide Tan was fantastic. Incredible awe inspiring scenery day after day. You must be able to ride though - many hours on the bikes. We did around 1400 km over 8 days on narrow passes - exciting riding. Excellent brand new bikes!

Mountain motorbiking in country Vietnam. Our time was limited so Mr Chung customised a 4 day itinerary to suit our schedule. He was very fast and efficient with email communications lead up to the holidays and also arrange a instant transfer through to the airport at an additional cost but not much. They stored our luggage whilst we where away.Our tour guide, Quinn was well spoken and had very good english skills. My experience on a motorbike was only 3 months (only obtaining my Provisional just recently in Syd, Australia).We were offered a choice of bikes and chose two Honda XR125 as we are tall and my Husband believed the extra suspension hight and higher seat position would be more suited to the journey. This proved a good decision as the terrain can shift quickly and the country roads are like swiss cheese. This is a fabulous way to see this amazing country and our trip included two home stays which we much preferred over the one hotel stay.fantastic all round but you need some riding experience as the traffic in Hanoi and the country requires a lot of concentration. I would also suggest for you to bring your own helmet for that piece of mind.the only suggestion I would recommend is that there is debrief to happen at the end of the day or at the start on where you would travel and for the home stay to reduce the amount of food served. We felt like we wasted a lot of food because we just could not eat the amount of delicious food they served up.

Three day tour along the river and through the mountains. We had a short trip, only three days but it was a lot of fun. Our guide was Voung, who was amazingly accommodating and very knowledgeable of the area. He led us along the river west of Hanoi and then up into the mountains. He made sure to keep an eye on us and rode to our skill level. When one of our group fell ill and couldn't continue on his own Voung sat him on the back of his motorcycle and continued the trip, even with the little bit of off-roading he was in complete control and our party member was completely safe. He was very easily able to suggest a shorter easier route that still took us through beautiful scenery when the full trip seemed too daunting for our ill friend.  While our trip was cut short it was still fun. It was well planned out and each stop came at the perfect time. Meals, hotels, and gas was paid for but you should still bring along money for when you stop at little shops and want refreshments. If possible I would definitely take a longer 7-8 day tour to take more in.

3 Days of Awesome. This trip was truly amazing, it was me and two of my friends who just wanted to have a great time and this trip did that and more. Voung was an amazing guide and also extremely accommodating unfortunately I was sick so after the first day I couldn't continue riding but Voung put me on the back of his bike and took me the rest of the way. I would 100% recommend this trip for anybody who wants to explore Vietnam.

Extreemly enjoyable, well organised 8 day tour. I wanted to do a motorbike tour of Vietnam. After contacting Motorbike tour expert, the quick informative response from Chung was just what I required. After booking the tour, my two sons come along as well. The experience was brilliant, a tick off my bucket list, an unforgettable tour. Motorbike tour expert will be highly regarded, and if you are thinking of doing a tour around Vietnam I highly recommend them. Also, big thanks to Thon, our tour guide, very informative of terrain and offering options.

11 Day Ho Chi Minh Trail. Just finished this amazing tour filled with endless stunning scenery, the most lovely locals and most importantly great food! Our profession and passionate tour guide Johnny tended to our every need and was very flexible when we wanted to customise or itinerary. We hit up all the tourist spots that we passed but more importantly learnt about many small local towns that mostly go unnoticed. Even though we didn't go off road, we still rode on various terrains (on a scooter might I add) and we always felt reassured and relaxed even when things didn't always go right. I highly recommend this tour company and I urge everyone that wants to visit vietnam to do a motorcycle tour!

Amazing 8 day Motorbike Tour of Northen Vietnam. My Friend and I decided to do a tour of Vietnam and her son recommended that we take a motorbike tour. We are two middle aged women that had never been on motorbikes before, but I have got to say it was one of the best experiences of my life. We covered 1,000 miles over 8 days riding pillion passenger up into the mountains and local villages from Hanoi up to Sapa, our driver's Tan and Tu both were both excellent helping us and stopping at regular intervals to take beautiful photos and observe local villagers carrying out their daily jobs both young and old We met local village people in traditional dress and told of their customs and ways, We stayed in homestays (local village houses with their family's) and ate local food The scenery was amazing and the local people very friendly I will never forget the experience and would recommend Chang and his team to anyone wanting to experience the true VietnamThanks again Tan Tu and Chang for this great experience

Excellent & Worth Your Buck - Seeing Vietnam Via Motorbike. I highly recommend this motorbike tour company for anyone wanting to experience/see Vietnam and to do so in an unforgettable way!I went on a spontaneous trip to Vietnam and had less than 24 hours to plan out this motorbike tour. I emailed nearly 5-6 different companies but Motorbike Tour Expert was the company which replied the quickest and was extremely patient with all my queries. He answered all my questions promptly and was more than happy to entertain my requests down to the kinda things I wanted to see (countryside, paddy fields, temples, pagodas, villages) and also try some local food en route these sites and throwing in some off road fun as well! Like i said i traveled alone so price was a huge factor, i wanted my money's worth and it only cost USD 140 (ALL INCLUSIVE - meaning unlimited food/drinks throughout the entire 1 day journey) Other companies for a solo, private tour easily cost nearly USD 190...I advise you go in a group if possible to further push down prices.A special shout out to my new friend/tour guide, Mr Chung for such hospitality. He had good English and able to give some background knowledge of the sights he brought me to see so i was able to learn loads about the culture and the history of Vietnam! He was also nice enough to welcome me into his grandma's village house where we had nice Hanoi beer to take a break. Getting to step foot into a traditional Vietnamese house and having fermented pork and a cold drink was great! He also made sure that throughout the entire journey I was adequately hydrated, always ready to offer me water bottles, stopping by roadside shops to get coffee/sugar cane drinks! And, most importantly I felt incredibly safe...he always had me in his rear view mirror making sure i was keeping up. And especially as we weaved thru Hanoi traffic making our way out and back into the city...he always gave clear signals and checked on me!What was it like? Well, first he fetched me to his shop where i got fitted for helmet and gloves. A lot of choices for sizes and styles...and really can tell that they don't cut back when it came to safety wear. Also, there are several types of motorbikes to choose from - i went for the Honda XR125 which was incredibly comfortable for off road and kept in great condition! It's clear this is a company that was not just experienced in terms of the trails/sights but also one that took seriously the motorbikes' maintenance which was something I appreciated!The ONLY regret I had was that I didn't have a chance to go on a LONGER motorbike tour. I'm seriously considering coming back in the future to do a longer tour because of how much fun i had! Not to be missed!(RODE THROUGH HANOI COUNTRYSIDE ON 8th MAY 2015)

Expert personalised view of Vietnam from a motorbike!. We booked this company due to the excellent reviews and tips from Trip advisor contributors and we were not disappointed. My husband and I did the 2 day/1 night tour to Mai Chau. I am not an experienced rider so I went pillion behind Huon (pron: won) for the first hour (in busy city traffic) then went behind my husband for the rest of the trip and leisurely watched the countryside go by as I clicked away on my camera from the back of the bike. Day 1 was 6 hours riding, stopping every 90 mins to see a sight or a snack break. Day 2 was 8 hours, a longer way back to Hanoi through the hills. The homestay #6 in the Viet/Thai village was excellent in hospitality and the food we were served. FYI- Main meals are included in the tour price, towels are supplied at the homestay. We took a backpack each with a jacket, (sanitiser) aeroguard, camera, spare t Shirt, that's all you will need. Try the house made Rice Wine with dinner, it is potent- like Japanese Sake. When our hostess made us banana pancakes for breakfast and then gave me a Thai back massage before waving us off on the bikes- I knew we would have to return here on our next trip. On the bike rides we visited a chop stick factory- just because I was interested Huon arranged this for us. We stopped for crushed sugar cane juice, again because I was interested in the crushing machines you see in every town. My husbandliked the hammocks hung at one of our rest stops...so he and Huon tested them out for a snooze, with the locals! I cannot recommend this company enough, great value, personalised everything, Huon answered every one of my many questions about everything for the whole 2 days. I felt we had extra incite into the local customs and people because there were just 3 of us. The tour cost us $100USD per day and $30USD for the Homestay. message me if you have any questions.Querky note: the Homestay is a house on stilts ie: no downstairs walls, but free WIFi! WiFi is everywhere in Vietnam, bring your iPad.

10 Day Northern Vietnam Tour Off/On Road. Truly a once in a life time opportunity. 2 best mates, 10 days, 2 brand new CRF250L bikes and some of the most breath taking scenery this world has to offer. Coordinated by the professional, organised and trust worthy Chung we set of with our guide "Brother Tan" for 10 days of adventure from Hanoi, travelling off and on road the riding was as challenging as we demanded and our every need was catered for.Good food, Cold drinks, clean and friendly accommodation, Wifi at every stop to share our stories and all for an affordable price which included a support vehicle.I highly recommend Chung, Brother Tan and the entire Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert team enough and look forward to frequently returning in years to come.Thanks for the memories.

Excellent way to experience Vietnam!. Did a 6 day NW Vietnam tour with my brother and a guide on Honda 125 dirt bikes and had a thoroughly enjoyable time. Thon, our guide, was excellent and had our safety as his top priority. The riding, the accomodation, and the food were all well organised and a great experience. Booking with Chung was very easy. He was understanding and accommodating. Highly recommended!

Amazing trip to Sapa. Chung did an excellent job working with us to ensure an amazing vacation. We did a 5 day tour from Hanoi to Sapa. All of the hotels and homestays were excellent and the bikes were great. Any small problems with the bikes were quickly resolved and we were sent on our way. Would recommend.

Special Way to Experience a Country. I can't thank Chung enough for organizing such a special trip. I'm a beginner at motorbike riding - I got my motorcycle license in the U.S. the week before this trip and my only experience had been riding around a parking lot. There were some insane challenges on this trip, but all of them have become amazing memories. I did a 5-day solo trip with Hoan. Request this guy by name, because he did everything possible to make this a memorable trip for me. Hoan became a good friend during this trip and I owe him so much thanks. He showed me so much local culture. I think we had a stretch of two days before I saw another tourist, and he took me to every "local" spot he could. Besides the amazing scenery in North Vietnam, one of the best parts of the trips were the "home stays", where you stay with local families (and if you're like me, drink a ton of rice wine with them). The last night of my trip, I stayed with Hoan's family, who are truly special people. I will never forget my visit with them. And good lord - if you like food, Hoan is the guy you want to travel with. He knows the best local food in the country. Someone should give him his own show on the Travel Channel. So, definitely book your trip with these guys. They really took care of me. And if you are given the option between a home stay and a hotel, pick the home stay every time. You will not be disappointed.Thanks, guys!

Excellent 1 Day private Motorbike Tour from Hanoi. I did this tour on March 15 2015. During a recent 7 day work trip to Hanoi, I had one day spare without work commitments so I begun searching for someone who could take me out of the city on a motorbike tour. Let me start my saying I absolutly recommend this trip for someone with a short time, and ill explain how I can to end up having an unexpected swim in a rice paddy! I came across Chung from Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert online via their website, and after reading some good review on trip advisor I got in contact to check availability and what sort of equipment was on offer. Chung responded within about 12 hours, saying he could take me on a 1 day tour, explained the suggested tour and gave me two options of bike to ride. As im a bit taller then most, I chose the Honda CRF 250 (other choice was a smaller XR125 bike). A note on the bikes - if you are not taller, and are doing just the day trip, you will be fine on the XR125. You will rarely get to a speed that requires the 250, its really for comfort if you are a taller rider. Chung arranged for one of his colleagues to meet me at my hotel. he arrived on a Bike as most people do in Hanoi, and waved down a taxi and instructed the taxi on how to get to their office and garage, about a 20-30 min cab ride (not far, but traffic is slow in Hanoi) Once I arrived, Chung paid for the Taxi (as agreed as part of the tour price) and showed me to the bike I was riding for the day. Some info on the Bike - The bike was an immaculate and perfectly washed clean. Chiung takes great care of the bikes, and has to import them from Thailand at great expense as he cant buy them in Vietnam. He does this purely because taller tourists request bigger bikes, and Chung really appreciates the quality gear. I will come to learn through out the day how rare these 250 dirt bikes are - as we travelled through villages out of town, kids pointed and ran out to the road to see the bike, while riding back in to the city in the afternoon, people on scooters would ride up next to me and take photos on their phones. I didnt see a single other bike of this size and type the whole trip. Anyhow, after arriving at the office / garage, Chung gave me a helmet, and riding gloves. I had a choice between full face or open face. Going back to jump on the bike, I asked CHung to let me have a 5 min test ride to get comfortable on the bike (never ridden a dirt bike before, only road bikes). Chung of coarse had no issue with this. We set off for about a 45min ride out of Hanoi, to a local Pagoda where Chung took me around and provided a great tour and knew a lot of detail about the Pagoda, and what each element represented. We stopped for tea and a snack, before heading off further out of town. Chung stated taking my through small dirt roads which begun to wind through rice paddies, each side of the track. Things started to get a little muddy on the tracks, and I had a blast on the big 250 bike having never done this sort of riding before. Getting confident, I found myself coming up behind Chung too quickly and snapped on the brakes on some slippery mud, and the front wheel went out under me. I found myself being launched off the bike, but fortunately, landing into a waist deep rice paddy canal. Chung was ahead of me, but had obviously heard my stack, and quickly stopped and ran over to help me prevent the bike from falling down after me. We both pulled the bike back uplright, and I climbed out of the Canal, by this time Chung was completely beside himself with laughter, and begun taking photos of me pouring water out of my shoes and scraping mud off my soaking jeans. Knowing how well Chung takes care of his bikes, I was very worried about his reaction of my stacking the bike, but he was totally fine and just wanted to be sure I was ok. As I was soaking wet, Chung offered to go past his father in laws house which was only a short ride away to clean up. I took him up on the offer, and as we arrived I was completly humbled by his families hospitality. Chungs 83 year old father in law welcomed me into his home, offered Tea, oranges and chocolate after I had cleaned up. I met the whole family, and by the end we had to leave they were inviting me to stay for the family wedding in a few weeks - wish I could have done! After getting photos together, I couldnt thank Chung and his family enough, before we headed off on the bikes again, before we stopped for the best meal I had while in Hanoi for lunch. We continued through rice paddys, small villages and towns on the way to 2 more temples which Chung again took me through and explained the significance of many elements. Heading back towards Hanoi, we stopped for coffee at a local cafe, before the slog back into the traffic of Hanoi. Chung was a fantastic tour guide, took me to some fantastic places with no other western tourists, took me into his family home, and had an absolute blast on the bike getting through some muddy dirt roads. Absolutely would recommend this trip, if you only have a short time in Hanoi and want to get out of town to see some of the real Hanoi life out of the city centre. Its a unique tour, you wont see many other tourists, if at all, at most of the locations. Great gear, great tour, great guide. Highly recommended, hope to return back sometime and do a longer tour with Chung. At the end of the day, I offered to pay for some of the damage I did to the bike (bent plastic fender) but Chung refused to take anything, and I felt very bad because of the great way Chung takes care of his bikes.

Trip of a lifetime. Just got back from a great 6 days exploring NW Vietnam. Setting the tour up with Chung was a breeze and Johnny was a great guide.The bikes were in great shape, not a single issue with any of the 3 bikes.Johnny picked out some great food for us along the way, gave us iinfo on the areas we were rolling through and great insight on the way of life of the people. His English is excellent and he was always ready with a laugh and a smile.The roads were for the most part excellent, and where they weren’t they were fun. What’s a little mud? Riding in Vietnam is interesting, twisty mountain roads, rolling through villages and towns, slowing down for water buffalo in your way.A couple of towns were a little touristy for my taste, but beautiful scenery near by made up for it. Since the other evenings were more out of the way, the accommodations weren’t exactly 4 star, but hey, that’s part of the experience if you want to be off the beaten path.I’d been trying to get a motorbike trip in Vietnam off my bucket list for a few years, and Chung and Johnny definitely made my trip a success and better than I even dreamt about.

Go well and just go do it.. Great experience, highly recommend the tour I did, expertly organised by Chung and guided by Johnny for five nights around the North and west of Vietnam. You get to ride through villages and areas sufficiently unspoilt that the kids waving and shouting hello make you smile as much as the twisty roads, dirt trails and the general ambience of being out there in the sticks.I was solo traveller and joined a small tour. Johnnie was an excellent guide, fun and personable with good interpersonal skills and a command of English that will forever be better than my Vietnames, importantly he could assess riiding ability and design a tour to suit everyone.You have to bear in mind that the remoter areas simply cannot offer, currently, some of the luxuries that the tourist destinations offer but hey what are you there for...if not to experience them before they do have KFC's and burger kings.?When I go back I will ask for Johnnie to be the guide and I hope be within a larger group with the same riding aspirations. Cannot fault the bikes, the organisation or the people. This is one of those stop wondering and just do it tours that you won't have cause to regret and will carry memories of great moments and experiences away from. It would be 5* from me except that I'm a whingeing pomme and had to show the Aussies how to drink rice wine....I failed.Go well and just go do it. Chung and Johnnie will look after you.

4 day trip to sapa. I have just returned from a 4 day tour up to sapa from Hanoi. It was an amazing experience. From the minute I made the enquiry, the service has been excellent, Chung replies to emails with lots of information. Tan was our guide and his knowledge of the country is excellent, as is his English. Everything is organised for you and the whole trip was incredible. I would thoroughly recommend the home stay option too, it was just spectacular. The bike was brilliant according to my husband ( I was pillion) and Tan was very sensitive to the fact we are experienced bikers and wanted to see and do as much as possible.

Memorable experience, Hoan Vulinh was a great tour guide!. I loved this trip so much. I had never ridden a motorbike but Hoan was very patient and in the end I was feeling very confident and managed to enjoy the lovely scenery, awesome food, and great friendship with this excellent tour guide, i recommend this trip very much!

9 Day Northern Loop Tour. What a fantastic week it was. From the moment we left Hanoi we new we would be in for a treat. Setting off on the new CRF250's it was easy to out run the traffic. Vuong our guide was most helpful during the trip making sure we had plenty to eat and that the accommodation was satisfactory. After the first day we mentioned we would like to do more off road and a quick call to Chung and Vuong said it was not a problem and our itinerary could be changed. Unfortunately a few days in and the weather changed dramatically but yet again it was not a problem changing our destination.First rate holiday and look forward to going back again.

Motorbike virgin - 1 day learning trip (Jan. 2015). Hello everyone,I was doing my Exchange Semester in Thailand (I am from Germany) and I was very interested in doing a motorbike tour in the North of Vietnam to see the beautiful scenere. The Problem was, that I have never driven a motorbike before. After I called Chung and we had a short conversation I decided to book a one day private tour to learn driving. To start learning driving in Hanoi might sound crazy for some People but I thought that might be a interesting experience :-)First Chung brought me to a place near his bike shop and explained how everything works. Than I could drive around and get some experience... expecially with using gears and so on. After I felt confortable with the bike (well, as confortable as you can after driving a motorbike for the first time) we started the tour. We drove around the see some villages. temples and ricefields. I was suprised how good he new the area. We have taken small nice roades and I could stop whenever I wanted. During the tour we had great Food and after the tour he invited me to have a beer togehter.As me budged was limited I couldnt do another tour for some more days. But if I had had the Money... I would have done it for sure!! Doing a tour with Chung is probably the best thing you can do in Vietnam :-)

A great experience in a beautiful country with experienced guides. Just returned from an 8 day trip with 9 riders in central Vietnam and we've had a wonderful time. Great scenery, magnificent places to visit, marvellous food and two guides who miraculously seem to know every trail and road in Vietnam! Chung's service during the planning phase was outstanding and the service and commentary provided by our tour guides - Vung and Tommy was exceptional. No problem was too small for them and we loved meeting up and dining with Vung's extended family. The bikes were great and the provision of safety gear (elbow and knee pads) was welcome as was the focus on the safety of all members of our tour. We organised a truck to carry our belongings and I think this is a great idea. Thanks also to our driver Hung for his great support.We're already talking about another tour in northern Vietnam in a few years!Sincere thanks again Vung, Tommy, Chung and Hung for an experience we won't forget!

Stop reading the reviews and book the tour. These guys are the best, Chung and Johnny are really cool laid back guys and if you like rice wine; you're in luck. The bikes never skipped a beat and three punctures in as many days wont stop johnny looking for a tobacco bong. One of the best experiences in my life, hands down; having johnny's local knowledge and translating skill made the trip for us.

Cung and Chung were awesome!. I literally just got done with the 6 day Northwest VN tour and it was one of the most unforgettable and best experiences of my life. They really know how to take care of you and keep you safe. Thank you Cung!

Amazing way to see Vietnam. Rented a couple bikes from Chung and it was a great trip. I threw Chung several changes and problems, but he handled them all very professionally with excellent, clear communication. I appreciate all he did to make my trip so wonderful. I will be back for more, thank you so much!!!

See the real Vietnam. Absolutely fantastic tour. As a group of 6 friends we do a motorcycle trip every 2 years. We had originally decided to tour Thailand but due to troubles there early in the year we changed the location to Vietnam. The email contact we had with Chung from Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert was first class with all the information we required quickly relayed back. He was very helpful and informative. We did an 11 day tour of North Vietnam and took the option of a support truck to carry a spare bike and the luggage. Good mix of on road and off road riding. Guides were excellentCan't recommend Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert enough. In my opinion a motorcycle is the best way to see the country.Well done to Chung and his team really enjoyed the experience, highly recommended

6 Day ride loop from Hanoi to Sapa. Did a private tour with just the guide "Jonny" on this six day tour on new XR125 bikes. It was a fantastic trip. Great variety of terrain, flat and hill country. The homestays were awesome ! Jonny was a great guide - aways trying to make the trip better, interesting, experiential - but keeping it safe ! Higly recommend Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert Co Ltd. Chung runs a great operation !

8 day / 7 nights tour. A great tour with friends, experienced Asian motorcycle travellers, through and round the northern loop.. Even in trying conditions.. nothing to do with our host and guide.. can't do anything about the weather.. we had a most excellent time! Thanks Chung for delivering everything you said you would... The Leo Boys will be back for more next year !!Cam on!

The Best Way to Discover Real Vietnam. First time touring motorcycles in Vietnam after touring by motorcycle extensively in SE Asia. The whole experience was handled in a very professional way and our 8 day tour was seamless from start to finish. If you are looking to tour in Vietnam then you would be hard pressed to find a better operator. Thank you Chung for an unforgettable experience in a truly beautiful country

11 day tour on two new CRF250s with my brother on the 8th of October. Thank you Chung for a great 11 day guided tour of North West/East we were on great CRF250s so we got to get into places you would not get to on normal bikes.After having a very bad experience with HC Travel two years ago in Costa Rica it was relief to book with a company that carried out what we agreed by email and more,they were very relaxed friendly and would tailor the tour to our needs.We had a great time and Voung was a good guide with a good sense of humour Thank you

Best thing we did in Hanoi. My husband and I spent a week in Hanoi for our honeymoon - Chung and Johnny's one day motorbike tour was above and beyond the best thing we did. Not only was it a blast to see the countryside on a motorbike (though riding through the downtown area was terrifying albeit a fascinating experience), but the guys took us to some incredible spots we never would have experienced without them. We drove on dirt roads, past women knee-deep in small streams hunting for snails and men walking their buffalo. We learned about the graves spotted through the farmlands. We had tea with Chung's grandfather in a typical Viet home. We ate a huge lunch in ancient Duong Lam village. We drank incredibly coffee on the side of the road. And when we moaned a little about having seen way too many pagodas and temples on our trip, Chung said, "trust me on this one" and took us to the most beautiful (quiet! tourist free!) pagoda we'd ever seen. Basically, it was everything you would want from a tour - off the beaten path, led by locals and filled with stunning scenery and good food.Don't just trust me. Read the rest of the reviews here. It will be the best decision you make on your trip.

North Vietnam motorbike tour. Had one of the best experiences of my life in North Vietnam (ba-be, Ha-giang) motorbiking. Personally my friend and I had little experience, but were able to handle all sorts of terrain with the bikes provided, thanks to the help of our guide Hoan.Heres a short clip:http://youtu.be/ySrmWORRCaIKudos to Hoan, Chung Can for the great experience.

Best experience in Vietnam. This summer I did a 5-day motorbike tour with this company. I would totally recommend this company to other tourists. We started in Hanoi and stayed the first night next to Tac Ba Lake (beautiful!). After this we drove to Ha Giang, Meo Vac, Ba Be Lake and back to Hanoi. Our guide (Quynh) was an enthousiastic guide with lots of stories about the history of Vietnam, the nature and other things. The people from the homestays were friendly and fun and the hotels were great. The food was really good and at every place where we stayed for the night, there was a great view. After the trip to Vietnam (I went from north to south), I still could say this was the best experience of the whole trip. If you would like to see the real Vietnam, I would totally recommend this company to you.

5 day tour to Ha Giang. Lifetime memories! We had an amazing trip. Myself, a mate plus our awesome guide Hoang took on the trip to North East Vietnam. Over 1000km on their new Honda 125 enduro bikes was awesome. We visited Thac Ba Lake, Ha Giang, Meo Vac, and Ba Be lake. One of the definite highlights was arriving at Thac Ba Lake on the first day's riding and staying with Hoang's family. We arrived, dropped our gear off then rode the bikes to the lake to go for a swim. We arrived just on sunset to an amazing view. The hospitality of Hoang's family was so good too - lots of rice wine!Hoang was such an awesome guy to travel with and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.Can't recommend these guys highly enough!

Could not have wished for anything better - 6 day NW Vietnam tour - August 2014. What a brilliant tour! 1000kms over 6 days with a group of 7 from Australia, led by Luke and supported by Sy and Hero. The bikes were great, the riding and scenery were fantastic. We had three home stays during the tour and two hotel stays. We encountered a variety of weather across our trip, and the scenery really was breathtaking. The roads were good, particularly the hills winding up to and out of Sapa.But by far the best part was sitting around at dinner reviewing the day, learning about Vietnam and its beautiful people and chequered history, and sharing meals and rice wine with our home stay hosts. We had some very big nights ("one more, one more") as well as some quiet time when we needed it.Luke, Sy and Hero were brilliant hosts. They coped with all our different requests and adjusted the tour as we went along to accommodate extras, such as a trip to the China-Vietnam border. They joined in everything we did, as well as taking care of the bikes and all the safety elements for such a trip.Chung was our main contact during the organisation of the tour. We changed the length of the trip several time as well as the itinerary; we emailed back and forth often as we asked questions and refined the arrangements. Chung responded so quickly every time and was incredibly patient and helpful.Do your homework regarding what you need to bring with you for such a tour. The guys will help but you need to give your comfort some thought. 6 days in the seat can bring out the aches and pains and you need to allow for any sort of weather.We feel we have made lifelong friends with these guys. We are already planning a return trip.Carolyn and Trevor PillansHobart Australia

Amazing tour. We did the northeastern loop with vietnam motorbike expert. In 5 days we visited Thac Ba lake, Ha Giang, Dong Van, Meo Vac and Ba Be lake. The trip was amazing and exceeded our expectations by far. The landscapes that we saw after we got some distance from Hanoi were amazing, my personal favorites are Thac Ba lake and the area around Dong Van and Meo Vac. We had Vietnamese food for every meal which was very tasteful. The local people are amazing and friendly and since the area isnt that touristic they seemed surprised to see us at times. Our guide, quynh was a great guy and took good care of us.Even though our holiday in Vietnam isnt finished yet this will probably be one of the biggest highlights

If you want beautiful Vietnam, you've just found it.. A buddy and I decided to go with MTE for an 8 day tour from Hanoi to Hoi An. Setting up the tour was a breeze, as Chung promptly answered all twenty something emails I sent him. Minutes before we set off, we decided to change up the tour, taking one day off, and the boys at Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert were very accommodating. Our guide Cuong jokingly (or so we thought...) told us that he is known as the King of the Ho Chi Minh Trail. This is no lie, as every time he recommended a particular road (as opposed to a road we had planned) we were led through jaw dropping scenery, and amazingly fun, twisty mountain roads! Listen to his suggestions!If you love being on two wheels, this may well be the ride of your life. If you're not experienced at all, the boys will slow the pace and take you through quieter roads, and even give you some quick lessons. Don't let a lack of experience push you away, but of course do be careful out there. I absolutely recommend this trip if you want to see the real, stunningly beautiful Vietnam, or if you're up for a great adventure, or if you're looking for some of the best motorbiking roads in the world, and don't want to worry about a single thing!

Great Company, Amazing Experience!. My two brothers and I did a seven day/six night trek through the northwest. It was my first motorbike trek, and I have found a new favorite way to travel! Amazing scenery, fun roads, and friendly homestays made this trip an experience that I will remember fondly for years to come.As for Motorbike Tour Experts, they were consistently great. We booked everything before we arrived in Vietnam, and Chung was incredibly helpful with the planning. Before the trip, each of us had a bit of experience riding scooters but none riding manual gearshift motorbikes. Chung included motorbike lessons in the package and was willing to let us all try our hand on new Honda motorbikes. When it became clear that two of the three of us weren't confident enough on the bikes to handle Hanoi traffic, Chung was able to provide two automatic scooters for us, and we felt much more comfortable driving these. The tour also included airport pick up and drop off, which was a pleasant perk.As for the tour itself, our guide Tan has 6 years of experience as a guide, and his experience definitely showed. He kept us entertained and feeling safe throughout the tour, matching the pace of our travel to our confidence on the bikes. Regular stops for photos and cool drinks to stymie the hot weather definitely made the ride more enjoyable. Overall, I would highly recommend touring with Motorbike Tour Expert. We saw beautiful parts of Vietnam that we would never have been able to find on our own. Definitely a trip to be remembered.

The best part of a fantastic trip. Do you like motorcycles? Do you like riding them through spectacular scenic landscapes? If so, you should contact Chung and the guys at Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert. My girlfriend and I did a short two-day ride to Mai Chau and this was literally the best motorbike ride I'd ever done. My only regret was that I didn't stop more often to take better pics with my DSLR of the amazing towns we rode through, it was like riding through an issue of LIFE magazine.

superb experience, beautfil country and fantastic organisation. What can I say...these guys are incredible. Brand new bikes, an experienced and authentic guide and incredible scenary. They bent over backwards to build an itinaray that would work for me and my three friends. We all had different schedules and arrival and departure times, but they made it effortless. And they also tailored the tour which was great. I recommend them whole heartedley and I can be contacted at garethclear@gmail.com as an external validation. A couple of thought points for anyone considering the 8/9 day tour: I would insist on staying in sa pa for more than just an afternoon. It's beatiful and one of the highlights. This gives more time to get out on foot and hike/explore. Some of the 'hotels' you stay in after 200km ride are a bit generic and dull. Where possible adjust the intinary to avoid these and stay in homesteads The conclusion of the ride at lake be po (sp!!!) is great. but again there is is no time to explore and enjoy the peace and tranquility, or take a boat ride. I would build in time for this but most importantly just enjoy the riding and the views. Just an exceptional experience

Very accommodating and helpful.. The tour was fantastic. I somehow managed to wrangle a private tour on a brand new bike; the company picked me up from my hostel and dropped me off after the tour. The guides are very professional; they helped me and explained Vietnamese culture to me and also left me alone when I wanted to be alone. It has the potential to be a very intense experience; on a tour with people you don't know in a culture you're not familiar with, but Motorbike Tour Expert's guides were fantastic in helping me relax. Halfway through the tour we were able to change route to a more scenic/challenging view because we were making good time and my guide decided I was experienced enough to do it. The flexibility is a real deal-breaker.Overall, fantastic tour. I'll definitely be back and can't recommend these guys enough.

Vietnam motorbike tour expert. We took a day tour from Hanoi,really enjoyable and a great opportunity to see some village and rural life around Hanoi. The tour guides were very friendly and helpful, the bikes were new Honda XR 125's and well suited to the tour. The tour got into rural areas very quickly and was at a relaxed pace, I can highly recommend Vietnam Motorcycle Tour Expert if you want a closer look at Vietnam life,very enjoyable and good value.

Unforgettable experience.. I approached this adventure with zero background riding anything except scooters, but my tour guide was remarkable patient, fun, and kind. I got a great bike, Suzuki EN 150 and felt extremely comfortable and confident after the tree days of driving in the North East of Vietnam.
great. i have great experience here even though i cannot ride motorbike then i need sit next to one of my tour guide, but it is great anw

Private Day Tours: Biking fun. My wife and I didn't know what to expect when we decided last October to spend the Chinese National holiday on a motorbike in Vietnam. We contacted Chung and his team by email from Shanghai and from that moment on, everything went smoothly and pleasantly. We took up a three day tour to Northern Vietnam and it was incredible. The hotels where we stayed were marvellous and very well taken care off. These people are true professionals. Me and my two sons loved the whole concept. They are already pressing me every day for a return to this great place.

Amazing 6 day motorbike tour northeast Vietnam. We went riding on a six day, five night tour from Hanoi to Ha Giang in a circuit in January 2014. We went as a family group of six, plus one, which made it even better! (Thank you Bruno!). We all had a great time, the trip was very scenic and gave us a great look at Vietnamese life outside the city. The mountain scenery was spectacular, and the steep windy roads were a great place to ride.It was fun to see the village life too, and the villagers were very friendly. Our tour guides, Quynh and Kip, were fantastic. They looked after us very well, and were very knowledgeable about the regions culture and history, and had a great sense of humour. The food, coffee and beer everywhere was great! We really were well looked after! We stayed in homestays and hotels, and all were very good. While we rode every day, we also went on scenic, relaxing boat trips, and walked to the market. The whole trip was a great adventure, the guides were extremely helpful and good company, we would definitely do another trip with them. Chung who we arranged the trip with was also great. He was easy to communicate with and we booked the hotel in Hanoi and the Halong Bay trip with him, and everything was excellent. He took great care in making everything work out well. I would highly recommend them all! We had an amazing adventure and would love to go again!

Totally Recommended. I love motorcycling and I love getting up close and personal to new and exotic places - this will definitely go down as one of my most memorable adventures and proved a great bonding experience for me and my son.We did a 3-day Northern Vietnam tour out of Hanoi from Feb 12 - Feb 14. The tour group was really professional, our guide was easy going and great to work with, the countryside was awesome, and the people we met along the way were so friendly and welcoming. The only downer was the weather, but given it was mid-Winter and we were travelling through the mountains, I can hardly hold that against anyone. In fact, the challenge of beating the weather deepened the richness of the experience, and it wasn't something that a couple of extra layers of clothes and a 1m length of plastic wrapped around each leg couldn't fix.If I could visit Vietnam again in the warmer months, I'd definitely want to go for one of the longer rides; and I'd be bringing a few more mates along too. This is an experience that has to be shared.If you're an outdoors sort of person and like going beyond the typical tourist hotspots, this is definitely for you.

The best week of Motorcycling. I can not say enough of our incredible bike tour. We did the Amazing Bike Tour with 2 other friends in November 2013, and we loved every second of it. Everything was simply incredible and every day had countless highlights; The roads, the home stays, the tours & sight-seeing, and especially all the people we met. It was brilliant. Oh, and the food......wow, it was so amazing!!! And not a single issue with getting sick.We had virtually brand new Honda XR125's and they were great to ride. You don't need anything bigger for these tours. Our guide Chung was brilliant, great fun very easy to get along with. I can honestly say I could not have seen or experienced so much of this beautiful country without Chung.We are planning to go back again this year to tour another region and will be taking more friends to share this very touching and enjoyable experience. Thoroughly recommended!!!!

Awesome Experience!!. Alan and his team were absolutely amazing - I can't recommend this tour highly enough. I came from the USA with very little experience riding a motorcycle. My guide Chung took excellent care of me - from showing me riding techniques to ordering off the Vietnamese menus. The hotels and restaurant choices were great, and it was truly an unforgettable experience. I'm looking forward to my next motorbike trip soon! Many thanks to Alan and Chung for an unforgettable week in northern Vietnam.

Fantastic three day tour. My two sons and I (a 60 and two 20 year olds) did a three day two night short tour. Our bikes were brand new XR125L Hondas which were perfectly suited to our trip. Our guide Tan spoke excellent english and led us out of Ha Noi into the countryside and over some excellent byroads through magnificent countryside in the hills and plains and along the lake. We overnighted at a home-stay village which was an excellent experience, and a hotel. As vegetarians we had excellent local food throughout the trip. Our goal for the trip was to experience and see the life of the Vietnamese culture away from the bustle of the city. Tan was very easygoing and a veritable wealth of information on culture, history and language. The riding was not challenging, anyone comfortable on a bike would be fine. Of bike gear we brought along our own jackets and gloves. Being January it was cool and misty in the mornings with warm days and we had no rain. Our route being mostly back-roads was away from heavy traffic which made it easy to relax and enjoy ourselves. I would love to do one of the company´s longer tours into the border regions with Laos and China, however we had short time, and this tour was a highlight of our time in Vietnam.

Motobike Tour in Northern Vietnam. After my first trip to Mai Chau with Chung, I decided to do another one with him. And I was completely satisfied like the first time. The tour was well organized, in time and overall very exiting. They are taking care on security (equipment was provided), the new Honda XR125 are perfect for such a trip. What I really like is to be flexible in all cases. So he was following my wishes, had stops for fotos, using dirt tracks, did a boat trip and get the full vietnamese experience. I was impressed about local introduction, he was aware about the important details for the region. I was several times in Vietnam, but doing a well guided tour on a motorbike is the best way to discover the country and get in touch with the locals. I'm sure you will find tour agents with lower prices, but the money you spend with Motorbike Tour Experts is well invested. You dont have to take care on additional expenses, nearly everything is included. For this year I intend to do an additional tour with a few friends to Sapa, and of course again with Motorbike Tour Experts. Rico

Absolutely Awesome. Brilliantly organised trip. Best thing was that our tour guide improvised the tour depending on what he felt we were enjoying most, and Chung Can was extremely efficient and organised with the planning.This is so much more than a tourist packed routine tour, helped with this region being practically untouched. I really hope that the area we visited stays this way as there are few beautiful areas left so natural.

Hanoi north to the Chinese Border. My 7th trip exploring by motorcycle in different parts of the world In my view the best organised formidably and seamlessly Extremely enjoyable and instructive my guide properly sensitive to my needs
Also the best value for money of the 7

A bike tour in Northern Vietnam. My wife and I didn't know what to expect when we decided last October to spend the Chinese National holiday on a motorbike in Vietnam. We contacted Chung and his team by email from Shanghai and from that moment on, everything went smoothly and pleasantly. They came to meet us at our Hanoi hotel with a brand new Honda 150, spent time planning with us the itinerary and advising us on every issue we had. The trip itself was unbelievable. We rode through beautiful country and enjoyed the views and the nice people we met everywhere.We definitely recommend this way of touring Vietnam and the services of Vietnam Motorbike Tour Expert.Guy

Amazing. Minh was an amazing tour guide who new everything about everywhere in vietnam
And made our trip incredible. We left feeling like we saw absolutely everything that we could have for the trip.

Unforgettable Motorbike Tour!. Me and my friends were guided by Minh all day through gorgeous secluded landscapes in North Vietnam. We chugged through verdant fields under the shadow of lonely mountains for several hours that zipped by. We stopped in small villages with wonderful people, as well as a hidden Buddhist temple carved into a cliff; accessed by river crossing with pole-pushed boat! Minh was accommodating, informative, and took us in like we were one of his own beautiful family. Thanks Minh!

My favorite in Vietnam. First of all, Minh is great for two very simple reasons : he made us discover Vietnam in its most spontaneous awesome aspect and secondly he thought me to ride a bike without causing death along the way. My friend and I (two girls) we were looking for non touristic things to do, we went to different guides but it was always very "set up", then we met Freebird Adventures, we took bikes and rode with Minh through those beautiful landscapes, rice fields, waterfalls, hills, villages, houses, basically in all those places you would normally miss in those way-too-organized-tours. The whole trip was spontaneous, personalized, we got to decide what we wanted to do and at what pace to make the most of it. Once the tour was over, we even decided to buy a bike from Minh, he gave us all those tips and advices we'asked for so we can keep traveling on a bike by ourselves, because to be honest there is no better way to visit Vietnam than riding a bike through the country, starting with Minh.

Birthday Trip . I came to Vietnam for my 36th birthday. I wanted to relax and enjoy parts of Vietnam that tourist may overlook. I happened upon Minh's Free Bird Adventures and it was the best thing about my trip. When you show interest Minh will come and meet with you, he listens as you describe what you'd like to do and how long you'll be in Vietnam. From start to finish he made me feel like I've known him for years, and his positivity is undeniable. I saw the beauty of Vietnam and Vietnamese people. To top if off because it was my birthday he welcomed me into his home with his beautiful family, and made me feel like a faraway relative!! Forever thankful for the experience and the kindness shown!! Highly Recommend!!!!
Amazing trip. Amazing trip with amazing crew I went with my best friend and Minh showed us best landscapes so far I've ever been Just incredible good I'm going back next year On two wheels !!

Second tour with Freebird Adventures. We have used freebird adventures for the second time in four years. We sêe the real Vietnam ,visit small villages,home stay ,great food and stunning seanery off the beaten track .

Best day ever!!. I had an unbelievable day with Minh! My three friends and I went on a one day trip with him passed the city and into the mountains. He was nice enough to let me and my friend ride along behind him since we weren't able to drive the motorcycles. He had a great personality and was really friendly.He picked us up from the hotel and we made our way to areas where only the locals would go. We stopped by various places to eat where they served us amazing food, took a swim in a lake with water buffaloes, and got to see the countryside. I would highly recommend this to any traveler who wants to get away from the city life for a day (or more)!! Minh is an amazing tour guide and definitely knows the right spots!

One of the highlights of my summer in SE Asia. I have been fortunate enough to have many adventures in several SE Asian countries this summer. My one day tour with Minh turned out to be one of the best of them all! It was hard not to feel like I was seeing just the tourist side of Hanoi. The museums and old quarter are great, but I didn't feel like I got to catch a glimpse into local life until I went on the moto tour. Minh was a great guide, helping me with my moto, explaining different aspects of the culture, answering my questions and showing me a side to the Hanoi countryside that I would've never seen on my own. There were many special moments that I will remember for the rest of my life. If you can do only one thing in Hanoi, I recommend you do this!

Unbelievable trip. If you can ride a bike and not afraid of getting a sore butt this is the tour for you! I had been to Vietnam before but didn't see half of what we saw with Minh as the guide and on a bike, the only way to see the beautiful country!

Great value for money . My friend and I went on a bike tour with Minh who runs the place. He's a charming lad and really helpful. We completed a 4 day trip around some interesting places. Everything was great, he took us through some rural roads visiting the true North of Vietnam apart from the touristic areas which we really enjoyed. The bikes we rode were brand new and really smooth even on the worst(best) roads. Hands down the best time I spent in Vietnam.

6 Day 6 Night Fantasy Tour. My partner and I just completed the 6 day 6 night fantasy tour of north vietnam. It was a truely amazing adventure. Minh our guide speaks great english and is a fun, knowledgeable host who seems to know every person along the trip and every back road and adventure. We experienced all the culture, scenary and sensational food this country has to offer. If you love riding bikes and want your own personal tour of northern vietnam, then Minh and Freebird Adventures is for you. Thanks Minh. It was a pleasure meeting you. Pete and Wendy. Australia.

Best Mototour Ever. Unreal mototour ☺My son & i did the 7 nights 7 days tour along the Chinese border, we can't thank Minh enough where he took us was insane, the country side tracks home stays & food was awesome.

The April 27th 2016 Kangaroo Boys Trip. Recently 5 of us blokes from Melbourne Australia did a boys trip with Mihn. It was undoubtedly the best trip we have ever done. Mihn made us feel so welomed & looked after us in the best way. Took us to the best sight seeing places that we could ever dreamed of. The food & accommodation was excellent. The people we met could not do enough for us. The road & off road rides were awesome, something for all to do. It was no doubt the best way to see Vietnam with Mihn. The motor bikes were brand new & excellent, perfect for the environment. The tour organisation could of not been planned any better, it was like clock work from the first day. The only thing we regret is, we only did 6-7 day trip. Knowing what we know now we should have done the 9-10 day trip. Thanks Mihn for everything. You were the best Champ.We will definitely be back from Mario & the boys.

Amazing scenery, great guide and good bikes. I also was on the Boys bike tour with Paul. Had an amazing time. Minh chose a route that would be impossible to find on any map. He made sure we were all safe, though he pushed our abilities when he thought we could handle it. He also planned a few surprises... Crossing a lake with all the bikes loaded on 2 small barges was a highlight I will never forget.

Boys bike tour.. After agreeing to join a group of more experienced riders for my friends 50th birthday tour of Vietnam I wondered what I was getting myself into. We arrived at Hanoi airport to be greeted by Minh who immediately made us all feel very welcome and at ease. After a short amount of acclimatising in the old quarter we jumped on the overnight train to Lao Cai where our bikes awaited us. Over the next 5 days I experienced the most memorable and at times exhilarating moments of my life culminating in an adrenaline rush, navigating the traffic of Hanoi back to Minhs place. The most beautiful scenery, isolated villages and countryside were a true reflection of Vietnam. We had comfortable homestay accommodation and a wide range of food experieces; at times not for the faint hearted. The whole trip was a true sensory smorgasbord perfect for the adventurous soul. Minh is a confident relaxed guide who is dedicated to maximising his guests experiences. His relaxed and confident manner, experience and flexibility when required makes you feel safe. I had an awesome time. I would thoroughly recommend Minh to anyone wanting to do such a trip.

Great tour of North & Central Vietnam with Minh. My daughter and I decided to do an extended tour of North & Central Vietnam by motorcycle in April this year. After finding Minh & Freebird Adventures on Tripadvisor the holiday was arranged with Minh via emails for a 6 day Northern Tour and then a 10 day Hanoi to Hoi An tour with a short break in between the 2 tours. Minh met us at the airport took us to dinner and made sure we were ok and also took us to lunch before the trip. We rode some 2800 kilometres over the 2 journeys and it was a great experience seeing the countryside and the people. Minh is a great guide and a real character always urging us on, whether it was riding the bikes or eating as he loves his food. You can't put into words what we experienced you just have to go and do it. One of the best motorcycle trips I have done so far. The bikes were well maintained and all you needed for the terrain, food was excellent and a great guide who always went out of his way to ensure you were having a good time and gave you an insight into the people & places we visited. This was my 3rd trip to Vietnam and it is an amazing country with friendly people that I wanted to see more of on a motorcycle which is the best way to see it up close. Thanks Minh from Fast Loris & the Old Water Buffalo for a great experience.

Great Vietnam with Freebird Adventures. We did a trip, My parents and I, during 8 days with Freebird Adventures and it was Amazing. We started from Hanoi, with one Landcruiser, and we did all the North, to see all the country side, the villages, the local people. Everything who represents Vietnam !! It's worth it !What's more the guide Minh was really nice, friendly, always in good mood ! And he knows a lots of things about his country ! Even if my parents didn't speak english, he tried to make sure that everyone has fun !i'll recommend it, so far !!

Great day out exploring rural Vietnam!!. I did the one day tour from Hanoi, the trip took several hours with a couple of hours each way travelling to and from Hanoi but once out the countryside it was well worth it. Travelling by motorbike meant that you got up close to rural Vietnam and its people. The guide Minh was really friendly and informative, making sure that fun was had by all through out the trip. A fantastic way to see the country, would love to do a longer trip myself and would throughly recommend it.

Look no further!!! This is the one! . If you are in Hanoi and want to see the real Vietnam look no further! This is the man to do it with. Stayed in Hanoi as a base for nearly three weeks. Wanted to do some sort of bike trip and was recommended Freebird Adventures by See you at Lilys Hotel and hostel. So arranged a meeting with Minh to discuss required trip. As soon as we met you could see the passion he has for his business. Nothing was too much trouble and we soon had it all sorted. As my nephew was with me and had not riden much Minh arranged for some lesson time for him in a secluded spot to get used to the bike (always thinking of your safety and comfort) once he was confident we arranged time to leave for our journey from Hanoi up to Sapa. Well the next 7 days were amazing the country gets better and better the further you go and all the time Minh is making sure all is well and you are happy. This man knows every inch of Vietnam it seems. Everything is planned for you so you just need to take it all in and enjoy. The views, scenery, food and accommodation were all fantastic,, couldn't of asked for more the man is a legend. Full of joy, funny and informative. Never at any time did we feel we were not being looked after 110% at the top of this amazing journey we had a day and night in Sapa then caught the night train back to Hanoi. What an awesome trip. Can not recommend Freebird Adventures more, so if you are in Hanoi and want to see Vietnam for reel contact Minh and have the trip off a lifetime. You will not be disappointed!! Thank you my friend I will see you soon! And remember KEEP GOING NEVER GIVE UP

Vietnam as it should be!!!. I had an amazing time with the motorbikes!! This is the best option to see Vietnam as never before. On every corner, village or road there is something new to experience. I loved it very much and Minh is an amazing tourguide. If you are in Hanoi... Contact him and he will show you the places! Greets Mr. Fish!

In one word, 'spellbinding'.. In a few more than one, one of, if not the greatest trips I've ever done. From Minh's expert guidance on motorcycling for absolute novices like myself, to the most amazing and authentic Vietnamese foods served in the friendliest and most welcoming venues and homestays - Water Buffalo is a particular gastronomic delight, to most astounding sights, scenes and smells of Vietnamese countryside that few tourists not on his tours get to see - saw just 2 other Westerners across three full 9 hour days of driving - this is a must do, never forget, god damn incredible opportunity to actually feel like you experienced the Vietnam that the locals enjoy.

The only way to see the real Vietnam. . What an incredible adventure. Minh the main man is amazing. From before we arrived to after our trip we were looked after. Completing a 7day6night adventure without a problem. In fact the only problem for me was it had to end. Minhs knowledge and passion for adventure is second to none! The things we saw and the places we visited I cannot put into words or photos just how incredible it was. And as for Minh well he is just a legend of a bloke. I suggest giving Minh as much information as you can regarding your own riding experience so he can work out the best possible trip for you !!! Do yourself a favour, contact freebird and get ready for a once in a lifetime experience... Or as for me it will be many experiences!!

The Real Vietnam. We did a 2n3d with Minh who is a guiding legend. He's fun and great guy, knows his way through Regional Vietnam and made our trip interesting, fun and most importantly SAFE. The Hanoi city streets are crazy but somehow it all works and the country side roads are challenging for different reasons. Don't let this put you off. Minh will tailor the trip to suit and if you take your time .. As we did every day... There's no stress. Home stays brilliant and a real change of lifestyle. If you have a sense of adventure. This is a must do.

Incredible. Wow - I'm not sure there are any words to describe the 4 day dirt bike trip I took with Minh. Minh (Owner of Freebird Adventures) and I took a trip in and around the Hanoi area, stopping alongside the Laos border, national parks, mountain villages, and beautiful rivers/lakes. From the picturesque mountains, to the national geographic-like scenes of farmers at work, it was absolutely breathtaking. Minh was the best guide I could have asked for. He's an incredibly seasoned tour guide, and knows the ins and outs of every road, village, local delicacy, etc. In addition to being extremely knowledgable, Minh is the nicest person you'll ever meet, which made the trip even more enjoyable. An all-around great man. We rode at our own pace without rushing, and stopped to take photos along the journey (enough Facebook cover photos to last a lifetime). Minh even had a go pro on his helmet, capturing a large part of the ride. If you want to see a completely different side of Vietnam - one that takes you off the beaten path - then this is the trip for you.  Thanks again, Minh! Keep going!

Amazing experience. One of my holidays i won't forget. 3 of us decided to do a 6-day motorbike trip in North of Hanoi. after extensive reviews of 7 potential guides, we picked Minh and we cold have not picked a better guide!.we did Hanoi to Sapa with the night train (great experience and good sleeping) and then we did 6 days of biking. approx 800km in 6 days, which is not much as we took it easy and did 90% of dirt road. The landscape was absolutely amazing. we met so many vietnamese people, local farmers and many friendly kids. Nothing like tourist trap. We went in villages where they don;t see any "white" people riding noisy bikes ! Minh is amazing. he cares about our trip, safety and want every day to be a special day and a memorable adventure. He is friendly, hard worker, attention to detail, and focus on safety (e.g. ensuring that we ride on track which are safe for our level of expertise)He did organise a amazing cake and local performance for my birthday (and i was not expecting anything).- Home stay / local hotel were prefect.- food: great local food, great variety, always fresh and east as much as you can. everyday Minh organise some optional surprises (intestine, frog, etc) with no obligation- bike: great condition. 150cc was the right size- landscape: amazing- difficulty: not easy and everything was feasible/safe. we were slow when needed and Minh was giving us adviceIn summary, i recommend 100% FreeBird with Minh. ONe of my best holidays

Minh - Vietnamese Tarzan. As it always happens, I had to choose from a few motorbike travel companies but I picked Freebird Adventures because I felt like this tour company was not too big, and therefore there was a higher chance of me getting more attention as a customer. And I was right. During my short term contract in Hanoi, I really wanted to get away from the city and enjoy the fresh air, and see non-touristy places. I just wanted to explore…so I called Minh. We met up and discussed the possible options. He gave me some ideas for the itinerary so I went on my first 3D2N tour with one of his Yamaha Taurus bikes (semi-automatic). And those three days left me speechless. The waterfalls, the people, the roads, the rice fields, the food, the stories…it was so authentic I had no idea it all existed. It was a good ratio between distance and time to actually discover outside of Hanoi. Not too long after my first trip, I called Minh again to see if we could do another tour, this time longer and with a bigger bike. I was ready for a crazy adventure. Together with two other English guys we have conquered close to 1000km on our Hondas XR150 around Northern Vietnam. 6D6N Fantasy North Tour was…a real fantasy. I saw roads that I never thought were real, I tried delicious food that I will probably won’t be able to prepare myself and I have met sweet minority women in colorful ethnic clothing as if they just came off the pages of National Geographic. Vietnam was all in front of my eyes, I could experience the raw beauty of the North from the seat of my motorbike. Seeing the simple life of Vietnamese people was truly life changing experience. These experiences would not be the same without a friendly tour guide, who knows every single corner of every single mountain. Minh truly is a Tarzan. His job is literally to make you happy. During his custom tours, he will make sure that you are happy and relaxed, and at the same time challenged and empowered! Hw will tell you stories and jokes, so don't be surprised if you end up being good friends in the end of the tour:) If you chose to go with Minh, you better keep going and never give up! It is worth it, because it is excellent.

Best Tour I've taken. I would like to say I am seasoned traveler. I stay away from tourist tours and love the local ones. This trip was far and away the best experience I have had traveling. You bike the most unique trails in Vietnam. Stay in small villages where the locals treat you with love and make you great food. Our tour guide Minh has become a lifetime friend I will visit him next time I'm in Hanoi. If you are thinking of a MX trip THIS IS THE ONE!!!

Day Trip - Well Worth It!. My wife and I did a one day tour with Minh as a last minute thing and we couldn't have been happier. I had the Honda XR150 and my wife had a semiautomatic moped type bike and while we were absolutely sore by the end of the day, the experience and the views were amazing and well worth it. To say that driving in the city traffic was a bit daunting would be an extreme understatement, it was one of the most nerve-racking thing I've ever done. That being said, it was quite an experience and Minh is looking into providing vans for future customers to avoid the headache. The vistas outside the city were breathtaking, be it the hills of the country side, driving over floating bridges, or the villages. Minh and his brother's personalities were great and they made the trip a memorable experience that we highly recommend to anyone with a background in motorbikes/mopeds.

Rural Vietnam made accessible.. Riding with Minh I've experienced:- The harrowing flow of the Hanoi's traffic- A race through the countryside.- A temple in the hills only accessible by a leaky boat.I wouldnt want to spoil the rest of the trip that Minh has throughly throught out but considering I only did a one day tour it was only a tidbit that leaves myself wanting to stay in Vietnam that much longer to see what Minh has it stores on his longer adventure. I would definitely book with Freebirds again if I'm ever in need of an adventure.

THIS IS IT!!!. Stop searching and book here!!! A 6 day trip took us to the real places that other tours won't take you. Made new friend & the most excellent memories forever!!! Thanx so much to Minh & co. for the experience!!! I will be back!!!

Minh is a stone cold dude. We went 2d1n with Minh from Hanoi and had an absolutely fantastic trip. We saw tonnes of rural Vietnam and enjoyed riding dirt track, back lanes and past some of the best scenery Vietnam has to offer. Minh was a total professional,a hub of knowledge and a really caring and passionate guy. He is also very funny. Live your life, get on a bike with Minh. It's a winner.

a true adventure. recovering from cancer i wanted to do something unique with my partner.we both felt this was it.minh is the man.he took us to his family home to try on all the gear to make sure it fit and we were happy.our week long trip i could go on and on about but I'm not cause that was our trip and no two trips are alike.minh was a total gentleman if you had a problem or not happy with something he will bend over backwards to fix your unhappiness.a fantastic trip that we would love to do another trip with.highly recommend the homestays the best food we had.thanks minh we will treasure the memories.the rest of you what are you waiting for?

Minh was amazing. Right, if your reading this you get 100 points as you've just stumbled across pure gold. My partner and I got back from 3d2n with Minh today and we can not recommend him highly enough. He took us to unique and hidden places way off the tourist track. He cares deeply about Vietnam and the culture and will take you to real homestays deep in the countryside. He was fun, friendly, safe, accommodating. Again, we could recommend him more. If you haven't ridden for a while or don't currently ride, do consider how full on driving in and out of Hanoi is. But it's so worth braving the city streets to benefit from the countryside beyond. Thanks again Minh, keep it Japanese ;)

Epic 4 day motorbike exploration of lush wildness & culture!. What an adventure!! As soon as i met Minh i felt comfortable, under no pressure to buy a particular tour, his friendly & positive nature is refreshing. He listened to my ideas, what i was passionate about, what i wanted to see, what i wanted to do & custom built an epic experience for just me.Free as a bird that’s exactly how i felt, passing through the incredibly vast and variously rich landscape infused with locals & their daily way of life. We went to a beautiful village where the residents built all their houses on stilts from the trees they had cut down, stopping to meet families & play with children, riding over Indiana Jones style bridges, challenging mud slopes, & fast dust tracks, over clean, blue & green rivers swarmed in greenery, rich with the sounds of wildlife. Passing stunning vast plantations of sugar cane overlooked by jagged rock formations, 360 degree views standing on top of the dynasty gate, (awesome!), barefoot climbing up the middle of a naturally widely stepped waterfall, swimming in rivers, praying in temples, trekking up hills & around nature parks, visiting markets, meeting welcoming families & bunkering down in home stays, on & on i could go. Wow! I honestly cant believe i did this much, it's just thrilling what you can experience in 4 days. Minh's mechanical know how, respect for others & knowledge of the rugged wilderness means you can go pretty much anywhere & do pretty much anything. Highly recommended, book with confidence, miss the crowds & get the personal touch. Thanks for giving me one of my most memorable journeys through Narm. See you again smt soon my friend, northern loop or Hcm trail next time!!Ride out & Rock on!!

The #1 Motorbike Adventure Tour in Vietnam!. The Freebird Adventures Motorbike tour was by far the best 2 days of our entire trip through Vietnam.My partner and I only had 2 days and we really wanted a great adventure on motorbikes. Minh took great care to help us out and custom make a fantastic motorbike experience for us. What stood out for me was the personalisation, but more importantly the local knowledge and helping us see and experience real Vietnam. Everything from amazing home stay accommodation and incredible local food. We wanted the the 'off the beaten track' experience and that was exactly what we got.All the Freebird Adventure team are great. Their friendliness and fun attitudes made the whole experience one to remember. They took care of everything. Big thanks to the Freebird crew! We are already planning a return to do a bigger tour :)

One day motorbike tour from Hanoi. Since I was pressed for time, I only went on a one day tour with Minh. It was fantastic. You can tell he really loves his job and knows what he's doing. He'll take you to all the best spots that tourists don't even know about. The one day tour is awesome but if you have more time and are down for an adventure definitely take the three day tour.

Greatest experience of my life . Me and 6 of my friends went to Vietnam to do a 6 day adventure with Minh, from the beginning we took a night train too Lao Cai and that's where it all began, we then went to Sapa, son la, and many other places average tourists would never get a chance to go. beautiful people, unbelievable scenery, Minh always made sure we were happy and gave us the chance to experience the real Vietnam, the food was unbelievably delicious and we got to try anything and everything, the hotels were awesome but the home stays were even better,.( plus a few surprises Minh throws in on the way) I am so greatful we got to experience everything, there is not one bad thing I can honestly say except it had to end. Thanks Minh for everything you did for us, we will never forget you and the friendship we made. Free bird adventures will not disappoint you would be silly not to do it.
6 day ride. Minh took us on the biggest adventure iv been on, everything was awsome from the food to the scenery cheers minh you absolute legend.

Amazing 3 day adventure. I can't say enough good about the awesome 3 day tour with Minh. He has explored and found beautiful remote areas of Vietnam which he adeptly shares with you. You would never see this on any other tour. I was not a skilled rider, but he took the time to teach me. His judgement about suitable terrain for his riders is spot on. He has mad skills on his bike ! Trust his judgement, he knows what he's doing.I should have left my GoPro running the entire time as every leg of the journey was memorable and beautiful. The waterfalls, rice paddies, rivers, emerald green hills, water buffalo, birds, the people ...were amazing. Don't be lame and forget your charger like I did.The home stays were really good. The food was excellent! I loved trying local fare which couldn't be any fresher. Farm to table and then some!It was truly and extraordinary experience. I can't wait to go back and explore other areas with Minh. He is an excellent guide and knows his bikes and routes well.

An awesome adventure!. The best way to see the real Vietnam. A mate and I took a 5-day ride with Minh through North Vietnam and it was spectacular. Incredible scenery, fantastic people, delicious food and even the rain couldn't dampen our spirits (well, the rice wine - aka "talking water" - also helped). I would absolutely recommend Minh and Freebird Adventures to anyone who wants to get out of the cities and see this magnificent country and its people, who really make a trip to Vietnam an experience and not just a holiday. Worth every cent!

Awesome 3 day tour. My brother Tony and I took an amazing 3 day tour with the great Minh through some of the most spectacular scenery I have come across. The food, the scenery, the smiling faces, the bridge crossings, the home stays and always friendly people was fantastic. Thanks Minh

North Vietnam . My friend paul and i have completed another week long bike tour with Minh and Freebird Adventures we travelled from Hanoi to Ha Giang highlands and passing through Ba Be lakes on the way back to Hanoi. Once again the scenery was spectacular the people friendly and the food was teriffic especially washed down with a cold cold beer at the many roadside shops we stopped at. The weather was great, hot and sunny we enjoyed staying at Homestays my favourite as you get to spend sometime with the friendly locals. Minh looked after us with his usual great care i look forward to my next journey with him and Freebird Adventures as we say keep going never give up cheers Minh
