Best thing i did in Vietnam!. i cannot thank Minh enough for the amazing experience. I went on a one day tour with him and not only did he show me an amazing, adventurous side of Vietnam, but even welcomed me into his home, took me to some great cafes in Hanoi, and was such great company. Do a tour with Minh, you absolutely won't regret it, it was a day I will never forget!

Great offroad trip around Hanoi. I am heading to my second trip with Minh, and I cant wait to get there. He is very mindful of your riding skill level and knowledgeable around the area. You will have an adventure that you will not forget. I enjoyed every moment. 100% recommended!

3 day motorbike trip - great guide, great sights, great food - and most of all great fun!. Minh is a great guide. He speaks good english (with some aussie expletives thrown in) and will answer any question you ask about the country with his honest opinion.I'm a 44 year old female who didn't really ride a motorbike before hand. I went on a 3 day tour with him - on my own. He gave me a driving test before we left to make sure I was competent and checked the bike throughout.He was fabulous company & took me to some amazing places (rivers, mountains, temples, rice terraces, villages, farms, lakes). Going direct is much cheaper than booking through an agency (maybe half price?)Accommodation was in local houses, and sharing their (very tasty) meals with them.This was the last thing I did before I left for home - and it really made my holiday for me. Thanks Minh!

Great experience. My girlfriend and I were only in Hanoi for a few days, so we contacted Minh and asked about a day tour. He came to our hotel that morning to sit and speak with us , asking about what we'd like to see and offering suggestions.A couple of days later on the day we arranged, we set off and were guided by Minh through the chaotic Hanoi rush hour traffic but he had us onto the back roads in only a short time. We had an amazing ride through villages, past rice paddies and fields of lotus blossoms, lakes, a pagoda, up to a mountain view of Hanoi and much more. Along the way we stopped regularly for refreshments and photo opportunities.My only cautions about the day are:-Put sunscreen on regularly, as the hot sun and wind can burn you quickly, and/or wear a long sleeve shirt-If you plan ahead bring your own mx gloves, and even your own helmet if possible-If you aren't used to riding a lot you may find it a tiring day. Stop regularly and drink plenty of water-Get Minh to organize a good cushion or padding for your pillion, especially if they aren't used to riding either.Regardless of the above, we had a great day and saw sights most tourists would not get to see, when we come back to Vietnam again we'll definitely be organising another trip with Minh. He is very friendly, professional, and accommodating and made sure we had a great day!

Another great bike ride in rural Vietnam. My friend paul and i had another great bike ride around the border area of the highlands of vietnam and china with minh from freebird adventures once again minh came up trumps with the out of the way places lovely homestays and outstanding scenery i dont hesitate to reccomend minh and freebird adventures as we say keep on going never give up cheers minh

Best bike trip ever!!. Myself and a few friends found Minh in Hanoi and asked about the tours he offers. Minh gave us a complete run down on what he offers and it sounded almost too good to be true.From the moment we left the adventure began...and what an adventure it was!!Minh took care of all the arrangments for us from food to routes to accomodation and even bike maintenance (when we needed it ).Minh showed us a side of vietnam that i wouldnt have thought to travel to myself, Im a seasoned visitor to Vietnam and i couldnt recommend this tour more. Ive told everyone who will listen!! If you have the chance I would strongly suggest doing one of Minh's tours it was an experience of a lifetime. One I wont be forgetting anytime soon. Ive already booked 2 more trips for 2015.Happy travels.

One fine day in Hanoi countryside. I contacted Minh for 1-day motorbike private tour around the countryside of Hanoi as I wanted to experience something different than the hectic city lifestyle in the downtown. I just explained to him briefly about what I wanted to go see and he know best where and how to get there. It was a very warm and long day riding on a motorbike, but it was a worthwhile to see not only local livelihoods, e.g. rice paddies, livestock, fishing, weaving and stunning sceneries but understand how Hanoi sub-urban areas have been changing in the last decade--this is my personal interest and there is no way I can get this from books or movies. I was very impressed by his English, biking and multi-cultural skills got from long years of running various kinds of tour. Most important, local people were nice and allow me to take photos of them just because they know Minh or feel comfortable with his friendliness. Above all, rather than just a one-day guide, he is a good reliable friend. Thank you, Minh :)

Six day dirt-biking trip to North of Vietnam with Minh - incredible experience. There are a lot of motorbike tour companies operating out of Hanoi, and before our trip I did a lot of research to try and work out who would give us the best experience. I have to say I am so pleased we found Freebird Adventures. Everything about the experience, from the initial emails with Minh was extremely friendly and professional. I took an instant liking to Minh because of his obvious desire to show people on his tours the 'real Vietnam'. So many operators claim this - but Minh really means it. We were a group of four people including my wife who was to ride pillion on my bike. Initially Minh was concerned about my wife because his nature is to try and make sure all his guests are happy, however I assured him she would be fine. Being the thoughtful guy he is, Minh actually had a seat welded up with cushions that attached to the back of my bike to make sure my wife was comfortable! Amazing service and dedication to customer's needs. The bikes Minh arranged were brand new CRF250L dirt bikes, perfect for what we were after. The trip itself was unforgettable - stunning scenery and the opportunity with Minh to really get off the tourist trail, meet the locals, try the regional food and have an amazing adventure. The best parts for me were the challenging off road sections and going through the local villages where you can really see everyday life in North Vietnam, staying in the homestay at Bebe lake and getting the bikes across Bebe lake on the boats! We literally saw only a handful of tourists the whole time we were on the road, so we certainly felt off the beaten track. Another thing that was also really good about Minh's tour is the fact we rode up towards Sapa over the six days but then got the overnight sleeper train back meaning we had more time riding towards the North and didn't have to do the ride back to Hanoi. If you go on this trip, ask Minh if you can stay at the homestay outside of Sapa, beautiful place run by a really nice Aussie guy and wife. Million dollar view as Minh would say. Finally, a word about Minh. Minh is an incredibly kind hearted and honest man who will not stop until everyone on his trip is happy. We had a couple of dramas on our trip: my brother and I got sick (because we ate something Minh advised us not to - our fault) and he handled the situation as you would expect from a top notch professional tour operator. He helped us get medicine and find a place to rest (my brother was incapacitated for about six hours) and he adjusted our itinerary at the drop of the hat. We also had a problem with one of the bikes and Minh simply pulled into the next town and had it sorted in no-time. Minh is also a very funny guy and kept us highly entertained with his views on many different topics and stories about Vietnam. To sum up: Dont think too much, be a man, do the right thing and go on a trip with Minh - you will not regret it!

Best Moterbike Tours in Vietnam. We did a full-day motorbike tour in and around Hanoi. It was me, my wife, our teenage daughter, and our family friend who was traveling with us. Minh is the best! He will cater the tour to your needs, and knows so many interesting and beautiful hidden gems in and around Hanoi. He did a great job of pointing things out and sharing about life in Hanoi, especially to our teenager. She learned more on that tour than the rest of the trip put together. It was a real highlight of our visit. I see his videos online now, of the longer, multi-day tours he takes people on out in the countryside, and I am very jealous! One day I'll go back, and I will be sure to book another tour with Minh.

My older brother, from another mother!. My older brother, Minh! Such a great character, I met Minh on my first week in Hanoi, me and my friends wanted to explore around Hanoi and we contact him through Lili´s agent and went on an amazing tour the day after. Being around Minh is so simple and easy, you just have to keep on going and never give up, so easy! Minh took us on a tour around Hanoi and we discovered the true Vietnam culture and nature on motorbikes. It was one of my favorite moment staying in Vietnam. After The trip I rented my own bike from him for four months. Minh was there for me 24/7 if something was not going correctly, I could always count on him and his company for all kinds of help. My experience in Vietnam with help from Minh, who I now call my older brother, would not have been nearly the same without him.

North Vietnam with Minh!. We had a fabulous time exploring the North of Vietnam with our wonderful guide Minh! We seen the most beautiful scenery and met some great locals! Minh encouraged us to try traditional Vietnamese dishes which were all fabulous! This trip was the highlight of our Vietnam holiday and we will defiantly be back to see more of their beautiful country the best possible way- on motorbikes guided my Minh!Minh- Thanks again for such a great holiday! It will never be forgotten! We will be back!

Great Guide, Wonderful Experience. My wife and I had the chance to make a 2 day motorbike tour with Minh and I daresay this is the best memory of ou 3 weeks in Vietnam. Minh is a great guide, passionate about his work and his country, and always enthousiatic. He is also a person that you can trust. We strongly recommend him.

As free as a bird. We took a 5 day motorbike tour with Minh in March last year. We were on a 9 month trip around Asia and the 5 days we spent on our bikes with Minh was one of the best things we did on our travels. The sense of freedom you get from being on the bike and riding through the countryside was incredible.  Minh was a fantastic guide and so passionate about motorbikes and Vietnam. We felt safe on the bikes and managed to negotiate the crazy roads of Hanoi quickly. He took us completely off the beaten track on our way up to Sapa, staying in home stays and eating at truly local restaurants. The trip was as much of a culinary adventure as it was a motorbike tour. We got to sample many local dishes at road side cafes that it would be hard to access if we were travelling solo.  I would highly recommend the trip from Hanoi up to Sapa. The changing scenery was phenomenal from lush plains and lakes to winding mountain roads, passing through many villages along the way. Minh is very knowledgeable about his country and people so we learnt a lot along the way too.Thanks again, Mihh!

Freebird Adventure - THE ONLY WAY TO SEE THE REAL VIETNAM!. Me a 3 of my good buddies made the greatest decision when we choosing Freebird! Our guide Minh was absolutely phenomenal. He took care of everything from bikes, hotels, food. buses, trains, boats you name it, he had it covered so when we got on our bike we had nothing to worry about but enjoying our ride. He showed us the most beautiful and remote places in Vietnam and we stayed at the unique places I have ever seen. Not only was our ride great, Minh spoke very good english and was very good at filling us in on the history and other great info along our whole trip. My experience with Free Bird and Minh was top notch and I HIGHLY recommend this adventure. It truly was life changing!!!

Look nowhere else for the best time you can have in Vietnam.. Minh will show you the places you don't hear about in Vietnam. Places more beautiful than ha long bay- home stays with real people and back roads the whole way. Best time in my life- and I've traveled to a lot of places. Love you Minh thanks for everything- Dylan

More than just a trip: A JOURNEY. 5 days in Northern Vietnam: from Ha Noi to Sapa, through an infite series of breathtaking landscapes, most of them reachable only with the impecable guidance of Minh. A trip for everyone, as even my 60 years old dad could easily accomplish. The only proper way to visi Viet Nam!

North east region motorbiking. It was such a great experience led by Minh for a ten days trip around the north eastern region of Vietnam. The countryside, people, historical places and the convenience at budget hotels was truly amazing. I am now looking forward for another adventure towards south of Hanoi to Danang maybe.Thank you Minh for such a memorable trip.Dr Hamdan SallehMalaysia

Experience the real vietnam. We booked a 4 person 9 day tour with Minh through a mutual friend of ours. Minh is passionate, funny and takes you to the nicest places in (northern) Vietnam. Accomodation was included. About 50% of our nights were spent in hotels, the other 50% in homestays. The homestays were generally nicer for a more genuine experience, eating and sleeping with/around locals. We got to see a traditional Vietnamese dance and a massive waterfall while staying at homestays. Beautiful!Food was also included, great and plenty of food. Don't be surprised when you find yourself in front of a plate of various unspecified pieces of meat. Dog, buffalo, chicken feet, pig intestines.. After a while you learn not to ask what it is anymore.Then the sights.. incredible. Going over bamboo bridges, through fields, past massive gorges and lots of waterfalls, temples... You will be muddy, sweaty, have a sore bum and be going to bed early, definitely worth it!Highly recommended, Minh we had a great time, despite one of our group... :)Never give up, be a man and fck the Chinese government.

Choose your own adventure. I took a three day moto tour with Minh out into the hills and villages from Hanoi.I would highly recommend this company as Minh is just a champion tour guide! He runs it all independently and has plenty of ideas but leaves it very much up to you, as to what your tour takes in.If you're looking for adventure, I'd say it's a pretty sure bet you'll find it here.

Memory of a lifetime. My girl friend an I went on a six day trip with Minh as a guide in the north west of Vietnam in January 2013! It was rainy and cold most of the time (close to freezing temperature on the summits), but without question the best trip I have ever made. While Minh took us on winding backroads, we met intresting people, ate great food and learned alot about Vietnamese culture. Oh, and the driving was AWESOME! Do not miss out on an experience like this!/Oscar from Sweden

Best fun riding with Minh. We went riding from Hanoi to Sapa with Minh in late 2013, I can honestly say it was one of the most enjoyable trips to go on. It rained nearly the whole time, and we both had a small crash each, but Minh has a great personality and is a pleasure to spend time with that the rain didn't even matter and just added to the adventure. We ate all sorts of local foods, went to hidden waterfalls and villages that you would never have known about by yourself, and had the best trip.Crazy Minh is the man, I can't recommend him enough. Definitely go with this guy. Love ya MinhMardy & Katie

Free bird adventures. My mates and I went on a 3 day bike tour with Minh as our guide, we got to see amazing places and stayed in back packers. I would highly recommend this trip, and look forward to doing it again.

Awesome 3 day bike trip. Had a sweet time doing this bike trip with my 4 mates from home. Had Minh take us out and about, through the rice fields, mountains and all sorts of terrain before finally arriving at his home. Great time spent with the family, only regret was it was all too short, I could have stayed there forever! Was exactly the experience I wanted from Vietnam and was amazed I actually found it. Went on to spend another 2 months in Vietnam as a result of this great trip. Cheers Minh, all the best bro!

Crazy minh!!. I had a 3 days trip with our friend and guide Minh. Not only we discovered wonderfull hidden landscapes of vietnam but we also enjoyed simple relation with all our host: nice local dishes, local wine and tea (a must try!! ... both ;-)) and all night party !!! Yes! even in the deepest countryside of vietnam. Minh from freebird adventure made everythings according to what we wanted, we absolutely havn't the feeling to be in a fully organized and usually boring tour where it is too easy to be enrolled in. It was one year ago and we still have big memories from these 3 days. I do warmly encourage those who wants to have an authentic and intense introduction to vietnam countryside to contact minh asap!!

An excellent way to see the real Vietnam.. We spend 4 days doing a tour round Northern Vietnam with Minh and it was the highlight of our trip. We really enjoyed our first night in a small homestay where the food was outstanding and the local people were great. We also enjoyed going off he beaten track down tiny little roads to see amazing views and experience the real countryside. Minh also gave us a great education on Vietnamese food getting us to eat things we wouldn't normally and certainly wouldn't have know how to order. The best was the pigs intestine which I honk may be an acquired taste! I would definitely recommend doing a motor bike tour with Minh to give you an amazing experience of Vietnam.

vietnam by the seat of your bum. My son,friends and i have been lucky enough to have made three great motorcycle trips with Minh,. everyone of them has been an adventure of their own. The sights ,sounds and smells of Viet Nam cannot be experienced from the inside of a bus or the dreaded mini van but by best of all on the open road, on a motorcycle with the smells of rural Viet Nam wafting around you. The many roadside stalls that we have stopped at are an adventure on their own as the people want to know more about us than we can ask of them Minh is very handy with the many dielects of the Vietnam language great for when you are in the hills or indeed over most of Viet Nam.The scenery everywhere you go is spectacular but as always the good places are the hardest to get to but well worth it, the dirt roads ,floating bridges and the suspension bridges Minh knows where they are.I have found MInh to be a very honest person who takes great pride in looking after his clients and their wellbeing that they become great mates which says it all. I would not hesitate to recommend Minh and Freebird Adventures to anyone its the best way to travel as we say, go hard, enjoy the ride and never give up you wont regret it cheers Minh i will be back again

Great time with Minh. had a blast with Minh from Freebird Adventure. Me and my Nephew had a great time seeing part of Vietnam that most people only dream of, Minh knows all the best places to eat..... took us to the best Noddle restaurant in Hanoi, we ate Cobra in the Mountains and Water lily's in the low lands, drunk Rice wine with the locals at a little lake fishing village.I hope you decide to use Minh if you are doing a ride in Vietnam, I Know I will be doing a lot more riding with Minh
The best way to see Vietnam. Had a great tour, we saw the real Vietnam shared local experiences and had a fantastic time. I would recommend Minh and Freebird Adventure anytime.

What a way to see vietnam. Our trip was absolutely amazing minh took us to places that arnt on the map he took us to remote villages that hardly anyone has been to other than the locals he also made sure that we paid the correct value of food and souvenirs this trip was 10/10 and cant wait for our next trip

Highlight of our trip!!. My boyfriend and I took a trip guided by Minh throughout the country-side and it was by far, the best experience we had in Vietnam. There are places he took us which I can't even identify on a map but are close to some of the most beautiful places on earth I have seen. He also set us up with amazing families to home-stay with so that we get the chance to really meet wonderful people along the way. The food we ate was fantastic and the cultural experiences were things you simply will not see in other tours. Touring with Minh was like touring with a knowledgeable and enthusiastic friend!

The only way to see Vietnam!. Absolutely awesome! Minh took myself and two friends on 6 of the most action packed days of awesome sights and good dirtbiking fun through the north up to sappa and back to Hanoi. You wouldnt see half of the places if you tried to do it on your own and Minh makes sure every day is a totally different adventure to the last right down to what you eat and where you sleep.Will definately be back soon to do another tour!

Top 1 thing to do in Vietnam.....Thanks Ming. Myself and 4 mates did a 6 day bike ride with Ming and without a doubt it was the best experience I have had in Vietnam or indeed anywhere in a long long time. Not only did we see some of the best countryside, we got to see it from the locals perspective on dirt tracks, half built roads, river crossing (on the bikes of course). I can't stress this enough.........motorbiking with Ming is the only way to see Vietnam. Absolutely amazing scenary, Ming himself is a great great guy and did everything he could to ensure every day was amazing. I can't write enough praise for this trip, it was spectacular and for the first time I literally have not a single negative thing to say and that is saying something for 5 guys (one of whom never rode a motorbike before) over 1000km and over 6 days. Awesome....thanks again Ming.

An amazing experience you will never forget!!. What an amazing trip! There are endless possibilities of sites and places to visit and Minh could not have been more helpful is suggesting these. During our trip with him to Ba Be National Park, his personality and attitude was second to none and subsequently, we have stayed in contact following our trip. His enthusiasm and love for his country helped make our experience one we will never forget! Although we only spent 3 days together, Minh was more than happy to help organise and suggest attractions for the remainder of our time in Vietnam and contacted us during this time to see how we were enjoying. He was such a genuine person and one I would now consider a friend. Contacting Freebird Adventures is a must during a trip to Vietnam!

Amazing trip, Beautiful country. Just returned from a 6-day motorbike trip through Ha Giang Province in northern Vietnam. Minh guided my father and sister and I through some of the most beautiful country I have ever seen. The riding was long and challenging, but totally worth it. Gorgeous mountains, valleys, waterfalls, villages, markets, delicious food, it was a trip of a lifetime. Minh knew every road like the back hand and was able to reroute us and change our accommodations at a moment's notice when we had to alter our planned trip midway through. He made sure to get us good deals on hotels and food. To anyone who wants to get out of the tourist traps and off the beaten track I highly recommend giving Freebird Adventure a call. I'd recommend having at least intermediate riding skills, but even though my sister was a beginner, Minh coached her through the whole way and by the end of the trip she was riding like a pro. Make sure to eat some water buffalo. And try to go through Meo Vac on a Sunday so that you can go to the big market. Go on this trip ASAP, you won't regret it. Motorbike is really the best way to see this part of the country.

Are ready to see the real Vietnam?. I had the pleasure of meeting MInh by word of mouth through mutual friends. Over the course of about 2.5 months, I traveled through a few countries in SE Asia, and my experience on my Freebird trip is easily at the top of the list. I will forever remember this experience for the rest of my life. MInh will take care of everything from start to finish. He met us at the airport upon arrival, and helped us settle in the first day in Hanoi. Then my friend Jackie and I set off one what was to be an amazing adventure. We did a 7 day trip from Hanoi up into the then mountains and valleys of Northern Vietnam on the 100cc bikes. Each hour, of each day, became more beautiful and jaw dropping. I would think to myself, "How can this get more beautiful?" then within the next hour we would drive into another magical landscape. The people and families we met and stayed with were just as amazing. I loved staying with friends of MInh in their homes, having family meals, and fully embracing a culture that was new to me. Food! I love Vietnamese food, and Minh will show you some fun stuff I am certain you have not tried before. As far as the technical aspect of riding the moto bikes - its AWESOME. Get ready to push your limits and be on your toes, or in the mud! Minh will not take you out of ability level, but I assure you will he will quickly help you become a more skilled riding each day. I plan to return to Vietnam with some of my boys, and do it again on dirt bikes. in the words of minh "Don't think about it, just go"Again, thank you MInh.

Please read before leaving Hanoi. What a fantastic city! Bia hoi, banh cuon, bun cha, communism lurking around the corner, I could go on. But the best part is Minh. He will take you out of the city on a motorcycle, a dirt bike, a moped, or maybe even an elephant (ok, he doesn't do elephants) and will make your jaw drop. It would be hard to describe all of my adventures with Minh, but in a few words: lakes, mountains, rice wine, national parks, drinking rice wine in national parks until one blacks out, waterfalls, jumping off waterfalls, sleeping beside waterfalls while too hungover from rice wine to climb said waterfalls, and he even took us to the village where he grew up so we could visit his mom. I spent one month in Vietnam and the 6 days with Minh are the days I will tell my grandchildren about.

Trip of a Lifetime.. Did a 8 day motorbike ride with Mihn last year. It was fantastic. Visited rural areas outside Hanio meeting some lovely people through home stay and seeing some beautiful scenery. We were a group of 5 including a grandfather, his son and grandson. Mihn made the whole trip exciting and one of the best holidays of my life.

Real Vietnam. We went to Hanoi and had the motor bike tour booked, honestly I was quite nervous, because I only had one motorbike lesson. But didn't expect that I was going on a tour that was going to be the Best 6 days of any holiday I was ever on. It was a different world, the scenery, food, people, traditions, culture was all amazing and I believe the only fault was the end of the trip. Minh is a great guy, shows you stuff that normal guides don't, he was very patient with us, we were all learner drivers and understood what we were capable of. Downfall of our trip was we had the best tour at the start and then had to deal with the organised tours which where all a let down. When I am back in Vietnam it will only be for the motor bike tours, hopefully with Minh.

Highlight of our Vietnam trip. Minh is the perfect tour guide for anybody looking for a unique, authentic, and flexible tour of Vietnam. It felt more like exploring the inner reaches of the country with a close friend than being on an organised tour. Loved the mud plugging and wedding crashing. Hell of a time!

8 days Hanoi to Langco, Hue, Hoian. Jeffrey,Vincent and I (Raymond) book the above trip last October. Minh is our tour guide and he has done a very good job by showing the best sceneries and the vietnameses lifestyle in the countryside.I sincerely thanks him for the mission completed and well done. Cheer!

The real North Vietnam. I was privileged to belong to a group of senior riders who were guided by Minh through a part of Vietnam many tourists have and will never will see. From windy mountain passes, to busy urban Hanoi roads and their suicidal truck drivers, dirt goat tracks to dusty roads under construction, bamboo bridges to river crossings that test the water resistance of your boots. Learning of the various ethnic groups that reside in this part of Vietnam and the smiling faces of the school kids and younger ones who wave enthusiastically as you pass. I have yearned to go back and do it all again and will one day so rest assured Minh you will be first to hear about it

Absolute MUST DO in Hanoi. We met Minh on a whim and from the very start he went out of his way to make us comfortable and accommodate us. He arranged completely everything for us and we had a blast together seeing Vietnam from a local's perspective. We rode bikes around, visited locals and off the beaten track pagodas, and had a great homestay experience with him. He helped us branch out and try some wonderful foods that we would not have encountered otherwise. He became a true friend and I recommend that anyone in Hanoi reach out to him. Our experience in Vietnam would have been completely different without Minh's help. We are so glad that we met him!

Amazing Experience, a must try. Vietnam is a mind blowing country with amazing landscapes and people and if you want the real deal, the true experience there are not better way than with Mr. Minh who truly loves his country and will show everything it has to offer. I recommand the trip to every person that like adventures and want to see the real vietnam. 2 Thumbs up

Absolutely mind blowing way to experience the immense beauty of Vietnam!. I was recommended by a girlfriend back in the states to link up with Minh while I was traveling to Vietnam so once I arrived at Hanoi my friends & I put our trip in his hands & wow did he just blow it out of the water! I was traveling for a total of 5 months & this section of my trip was the most eye opening. Some of the scenery we got to experience was unlike anything I've ever seen before & the most incredible part was that we were only able to access these spots with the guidance of Mihn on the motorbikes. He is passionate about making sure each & every traveler is enjoying every minute. Each day was quite an adrenaline rush, but he paced it perfectly. We experienced the true Vietnamese culture, saw breathtaking views, witnessed the beautiful lifestyle & had tons of fun! I'm so happy to say Mihn truly made our trip to Vietnam unforgettable!

Great service, great value, GREAT TIME!. A couple of buddies and I went on a two day, one night motorbike trip with Freebird Adventure Company and we had a great time. Minh arranged everything for us--bikes, gas, home stays, meals, everything. All we had to do was tell him the length of the trip, and he took it from there. His knowledge of the country side was tremendous. We were out in fairly remote areas, and he always knew where to take us and where to find beautiful spots. Great time!

Words don't describe the experience we had.. Not only is motor bike the only way to go but Freebird adventure is hands down the best you can find. An experience of a life time and one you will not forget. Its been two years and I talk about it often and the memories are the best of my life so far.

The only way to see north vietnam. This was the best experience of my life. The scenery was spectacular, the offroad riding was tons of fun and the food was amazing, it's as much a culinary adventure as it is a motorbike one.
Ho Chi Minh trail with Minh. We had a great adventure with Mr. Minh. He took us to a month long ride through the country and we saw true Vietnam. Great guy and excellent guide.

Dynamic and filling. Would recommend this tour- the host was exceptional, a smart young girl who went above and beyond in the tour by giving us historical and interesting info about the food and she told us about her life and traditions. The food was exceptional and most of all, unforgettable!

Very awesome. A must do. . I would totally recommend going on this tasting tour. A great intro to vietnamese food, and our guide, Mia, was so helpful and energetic, and informative. A lot of the places we visited were definitely ones we wouldn't have gone in without a local, and it's good way to learn about many dishes you can try in hanoi. We got the evening tour and we were only 7 in the group so it was very easy to get the guide's attention. Definitely 20usd well spent.
Yummy tour. Went on a food tour in a small group. Lissy our food tour guide was very good. Knew her thing.Each one was so delicioso. Would recommend to do when one is in Hanoi.

Amazing Introduction to All That Hanoi Has to Offer!. We had an amazing time with our guide, Kiwi, today. It's evident that she really loves her job and is passionate about delivering a great experience to her groups. From funny stories, food preference personalization, and the history of the dishes it's clear that she won't leave you disappointed! I consider myself a fairly seasoned traveller, yet even still hitting the streets of Hanoi as a Westerner can be intimidating. Where should you even start? After eating in the city for 4 days I didn't feel like I quite "got it" until my time with Hanoi Street Food Tour today. I highly recommend this tour.

Amazing tour and delicious food!. Myself and 5 other friends did the walking food tour at night. It was an amazing experience led by a great tour guide. Our tour was led by Cherry and she was a very fun and nice guide. Crossing the street is no easy feat in Hanoi with all the scooters riding everywhere seemingly without any rules, but Cherry ensured we stuck together and survived. The food itself was very good and we were brought to many local restaurants that we may not have known or tried otherwise. There was a large variety of different foods and many interesting neighborhoods we walked through. I would definitely recommend anyone to do this food tour. You will definitely not leave hungry!

Wonderful!!! . We actually took 2 Hanoi Street Food tours in one day! The first morning after we arrived we did the morning Hanoi motorbike tour with Nga and Sam. They promptly picked us up from our hotel at 8am to begin the tour. Nga asked if we had had breakfast- which we had but I mentioned in passing we hadn't had our coffee yet.. she took us to a typical Vietnamese coffee shop and treated us to coffee! It was so wonderful having the motorbike tour on our first day- Nga was a wonderful tour guide- very informative and took us to many places to understand and learn about the city! And her and Sam were great drivers too! I was a bit nervous riding the motorbike in Hanoi traffic but shortly into the tour I began to love it- it was so a fun way to see the city!! In the early evening we took the walking street food tour with Moon. Also, another great experience! Moon is so much fun! She is great at explaining the food, how it's made, and she even wrote down the addresses and what we ate so we could return later in the week, which we did to a couple of places!! We loved everything about the food tour- such a great way to taste the typical foods and learn about Hanoi food culture!! Highly recommend both tours!!

A must do for foodies in Hanoi!. We were also luck enough to have donut on our tour. We loved the walking, local tips and all the food was fantastic. We tried and loved everything and our tour guide was passionate and fantastic. We had plenty of laughs along the way and learned how to safely get around the crazy local roads so we definitely recommend a guided tour on day 1 to learn the essentials from the experts!

Hanoi Street Food Tours by Scooter - Great Tour!. Overall great tour! Our guide Nga was knowledgeable, friendly and spoke excellent English. She was very flexible and didn’t have all the stops planned ahead of time so that she could incorporate our opinions and also avoid anything we had been to or was planning to do outside of the tour. We mentioned that we loved ice cream so she made sure our last stop included some! The food options were plentiful, tasty and very diverse- some of the best food we had during our time in Hanoi. What was unique about this tour was that we got to try food that was outside of the typical “must eats” in Hanoi. We felt safe at all times with Nga and her group of scooter drivers, and enjoyed the mix of sightseeing and eating. We would definitely recommend Nga and her tour to anyone, and would definitely do it again next time we are in Hanoi!

Best Guide Ever!. We're a group of friends from Hong Kong in Hanoi supporting our kids in an inter schools sports event this weekend. The kids are entertained in the evening, so we took this evening food tour on scooters.Our guide was Vivienne. I've been on many scooter tours in Saigon, Danang, Siem Reap and Phnom Penh and this was one of the best. Vivienne looked after us so well. She is full of knowledge of the city and the food and restaurants she took us to.Highly recommended. Ask for Vivienne.

Amazing tour! Thanks Mia!. My boyfriend and I went on this tour after seeing it well-reviewed on a number of sites. It does not disappoint and definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Hanoi! Our tour guide, Mia, was fabulous and took us to a number of spots we never would have found on our own. She gave plenty of info and the tour was sociable and fun! Definitely check it out!! Bia Hoi!

Excellent. After reading the reviews, we booked this tour and were not disappointed. We tried all the traditional foods at 6 differrent locations each with their own specialty. The experience was very authentic. It was one of the best ways to learn about the Vietnamese culture and cuisine. Our tour guide was so friendly, funny, knowledgeable and she did a wonderful job explaining each dish and making sure we knew what we were eating. We had a great time!

Highlight of Hanoi. We had the pleasure of having Donut as our guide on a night food tour in Hanoi. She is incredibly funny and shared with us some very interesting history and attempted to teach us some common phrases. Donut managed to navigate our small group through the crazy traffic in the Old Quarter and shared some of the amazing food that is on offer. It was interesting, entertaining and certainly a hihtlight of our time in Hanoi. Thank you Donut for showing us this side of Hanoi

Fun night out and great food . Our guide Cherry was great, she provided lots of information about the different foods and insight into Vietnamese culture. All the food stops were delicious and to places which would be difficult for a tourist to find. Well worth the experience! Thanks Cherry :)

Excellent introduction to Vietnamese street food, do not miss!. I did this because everyone raves about street food in Vietnam, yet when you actually hit the ground and try to get some it's confusing as hell if you're a westerner. Our guide, Alisia, did excellent job of explaining what each of the 15 (!) foods was, how Vietnamese eat it and the end she gave us a great list of all the foods we've eaten.For the price of 20 USD this was definitely a wonderful thing I won't forget!

Entertaining tour guide (Donut), good variety food. . Did a walking tour with my husband as part of our 4 week honeymoon in SE Asia. Tour came recommend to us by another couple we met on the Indochina junk.Our tour guide was Donut. We had 1 other young couple (also on honeymoon) and 3 young ladies - great size group. Had 9 different foods. All very delicious! My favourites were the egg coffee, donuts, sticky rice ice cream, bhan mi. My husband loved the dried beef salad and Bun Cha. Donut was very funny & sociable. Great English & engaged us all in conversation. She also gave us great history lessons. At the end of our tour, Donut wrote down all the foods we had tried. Did the 11am tour and finished just after 2pm. Walking was not too strenuous - now experts at crossing the road.Def recommend. Thanks, Donut!!

A must-do in Hanoi. My husband and I booked a tour to experience the best of Hanoi's street food, and this tour did not disappoint! Each stop featured a delicious dish, accompanied by a helpful explanation of ingredients and/or significance to Vietnamese culture. Some of the stops were fairly mainstream - like a more prominent bun cha restaurant. Others were hidden gems, found at the end of narrow hallways or above seemingly residential entrances. In other words, we went to places we would not have easily found on our own. One highlight was trying our hand at making thin rice crepes under the stoic instruction of the shop owner. She finally cracked a smile when one of the guys succeeded in lifting a crepe whole after watching his first attempt disintegrate. The final product - rice crepe, egg, and minced pork - was delicious. If you can, ask for Donut as your guide - she was enthusiastic, knowledgable, and a ton of fun. The final stop for a banh mi sandwich may have been one too many, but by the end of the tour, our group was happy and very full.

A great way to taste delicious street food. We did this tour with 6 others and it was a great group. All the food was delicious and there was plenty of it so come with an empty stomach. On top of the great food experience it was fun to hear of our guides stories and share travel tips with the other members of the group. Put it on the "must do" list for Hanoi!

Blew us away. A wonderful first night exposure in Hanoi. Our first night in Vietnam and this tour through Urban Adventures didn't disappoint!! Guide was generous in tips for walking around in Hanoi. Took us to five different venues to eat various courses ending up in a great Vietnamese café away from the tourist craziness. Egg coffee is an interesting alternative. Was great try things with the confidence of recommendations from a local. Very highly recommend. Definitely a shock to our westerner perspectives but do take a big breath and dive into Hanoi, we grew to love it!!

Really interesting to try!. Went to street food tour on our first day in Hanoi and were really happy. Food was tasty and so different, we came into such places that we'd never even notice in the street. You need to go there really hungry, because they offer lots of food to try and we were full after second place. Coffee is delicious. Sometimes it's hard not to pay attention to dirtiness, but it's Asia :)

Top Night. We did the 5pm tour with our lovely guide Lua. It was a fun couple of hours spent with a good group of people from different parts of the world. Thoroughly enjoyed the food, most delicious. Went to 9 different places, many of which I wouldn't have tried if not on the tour, but so glad I did.Highly recommend this tour.

Very Average. Our guide was lovely but we paid US$90 for three of us and we found the food very average, some of the venue's disgustingly dirty. This is OK for backpackers but cannot recommend for anyone who appreciates good quality food.

Wonderful guide and great food!. Lizzie was a wonderful guide. We had a group with 3 Koreans, 2 guys from Switzerland and myself (from the US). There was a nice variety of food. I definitely tried some things that I would not have tried otherwise. Everything was good. At the first stop, the Koreans put a lot of these really hot red peppers in their soup. The Swiss guys put less and they were really HOT!!! The Koreans did not eat the red peppers. They just used them to flavor the broth. The Swiss guys didn't know that and ate the peppers. I only put one little piece in to flavor my broth at another place and it was almost too hot to eat.

Best thing to do in Hanoi!. Our tour guide was Cherry. She was the best. So friendly and loves her job! The food was amazing and diverse, you won't leave hungry! Great sized groups too(we were 5). This was my favourite food experience in Vietnam.

Great food and great guide😀. My sister and I had a great time on this food tour. It was our first motorbike tour and traffic can seem crazy but our drivers Phoenix and Ha were very competent drivers. Phoenix was excellent at explaining the different foods and telling us about the city and life in Hanoi. We even learned some Vietnamese phrases! Great fun!

MUST DO THIS!!!!. This was such an awesome experience. By far the safest and best way to get the real taste of Vietnam. Our tour guide was so fun, approachable and bubbly. She had so much knowledge about the food, the country and the history of Vietnam. We got to sample so many different cuisines and even had a chance to test our cooking skills at a few stops. The food was so delicious and for the rest of our trip we had 10-15 different places we could comfortable dine in - breakfast lunch or dinner. There was a huge variety that catered to any dietary needs. It was well worth the few dollars we paid and we were SO full by the last few stops (make sure to wear your stretchy clothes). This tour has now made me search food tours in every place we visit. I'd do this tour a hundred times over. The groups were a comfortable size and we all got along great. This also gave us an awesome tour of the city as you walk from place to place. The walk was short and easy (it help the full tummy - trust me, you will welcome movement half way through). Definitely do this tour!!!!!

Amazing experience!. This was a fantastic idea: you get on a scooter with a guide and drivers and you tour the old neighbourhood of Hanoi, stopping at various street food places to taste local specialties. Not only was the food delicious, but our guide was A-MA-ZING. She explained a lot about the food, but also about Vietnamese culture. Her English was excellent and her sense of humour just as sharp. Although the little shops and restaurants may look risky from a "touristic stomach" point of view at first, it is really safe, healthy and qualitative. This formula allows to see the city without sweating too much in the heat, while stopping at places we would not even have noticed by ourselves, having great conversations with our guide and tasting absolutely amazing food. This concept is great and this agency masters it to perfection. A MUST DO!!

Fantastic food to with Miss Moon. A perfect way of exploring the city and Miss Moon was the perfect guide. Friendly, helpful and informative, she guided us with entertaining good humour around a delicious range of local food places. Not to be missed!

An afternoon well spent. We had a fantastic afternoon sampling the many different types of authentic street food that Hanoi has to offer. Our guide Phoenix was terrific, she spoke perfect English, was witty, knew all the best places to stop and was able to use her general knowledge to give us a guided tour of the Old Quarter. I'm not huge on trying new and exotic foods however I had a really enjoyable experience and would recommend Hanoi Street Food and Phoenix to anyone!

Brilliant introduction to my trip. I booked a street food tour on my first day in Viet Nam, before the rest of my group arrived as I thought it would be a great way of eating great food without having to dine out alone but also a fun way to meet new people and discover the area. I am so glad I saw the recommendation to book a tour with Kim Tours as it was just near my hotel and they had a tour departing within an hour or so. I did the evening street food tour. It was a bit disorganised to begin with as there were too many people so we needed 2 guides and one group departed a bit later. As I was in that group, I missed out on going to the water puppet theatre, but luckily this did not matter as I was able to go another day. We went to several places, mainly throughout the Old Quarter. It was the Saturday of a public holuday so the place was buzzing, the night market was on and the streets were largely closed to cars which was helpful. We also went to a few places around the top of the Hoan Kiem lake. We tried a great range of food, mainly traditional Ha Noi specialities but the guide adapted it for our group - for example, one man asked if we could have Beer Hoi so she arranged it. Some places were small and we would never have visited them or even found them on our own. We had a go at making rice pancakes, we sat on teeny tiny stools and we learned about the traditions and history of Viet Nam and Ha Noi as well as eating great food! I can highly recommend this must-do tour - to the extent that I probably bored the rest of my holiday group when they arrived by mentioning it frequently!

So delicious . Our eat feast with Mark was a highlight. We started early enough to see the street food market where all the fresh produce is sourced. Freshly slaughtered chicken, pork, water buffalo, chicken, duck, quail, live frogs and fish and all the veggies and spices. So vibrant and colourful. Mark tailored the food to us - each place we stopped offered something unique to the restaurant. Delicate fish soup, chicken with medicinal herbs cooked in a can, prawn pancakes and more, plus a stop at a coffee house. A wonderful experience. Thanks Mark!

Fantastic "must do" in Hanoi. My sister and I did the Three hour Street food tour by motorbike. It was a last minute booking and we were so glad we did it. It was the highlight of our time in Hanoi.Our guide Phoenix was fantastic ! We did the lunchtime tour and were met at our hotel by Phoenix and another rider Daisy and travelled by motorbike all over the city to various local eating spots to taste the amazing food of Vietnam. We were so lucky it was just us on the tour so it was like our own private tour.At each stop she told us all about the dishes. The motorbike ride was exhilarating to say the least !!! But we felt very safe as they were both excellent riders and knew the city well. It was also a mini tour of the city as we rode to each destination. The food was DELICIOUS!! Number one tip do not eat before you go there is so much food. It was so fantastic and definitely worth doing.

It is a must do..... We had a great evening with a small group of fellow tourists. We enjoyed many new dishes we would never had tried on our own. Our guide 'Donut' was informative and had a good sense of humour.
Yum. A very tasty experience.. A must do for anyone, especially if you are a lover of food... :)

Motorcycle Fullness. This was a great way to see different parts of the city, especially the old quarter, and also to get a taste of some of the local specialities. My guide on the night was a very knowledgeable woman called Nga who was able to answer all my questions, of which there were many. She took her time to explain the food, the locations and the history of the areas we travelled to.I would recommend that you go on this tour in the early part of your stay in Hanoi so you can have a chance to go back to places you particularly enjoy.
Great. Great, especially for the first arriving days. Great guide and many stops. You will continue until you are full
Best street food ever. Must try the signature foods of this beautiful place if you have chance. Tons of way to cook the noodles and all worth to try. Love it a lot

A must-do in Hanoi!. This is one of the best food tours I have ever been on. It is a great way to explore Hanoi's Old Quarter and sample a wide range of the city's staple street food dishes. I would highly recommend it as part of any Hanoi itinerary. The tour also included plenty of interesting facts about Vietnamese culture and tradition, as well as information about the food.Our guide - nicknamed "Cherry" - was wonderful and even wrote down all our emails at the end of the tour so she could send us a full list of all the dishes we tried and restaurants we visited, as well as some additional recommendations. We left very full and satisfied!

Wicked tour. This tour was fabulous - we had Teddy take us around and she was awesome. She shared her knowledge of food and places to eat giving us tasters of food that were delicious. She is an amazing guide and this tour is a great way to experience street food.

Trust this tour - its the best!. Definitely recommend this tour! We took it on our first night in Vietnam to acquaint ourselves with the the local cuisine and street food. Teddy was our tour guide and we did the 3hr walking tour in the Old Quarter, beginning at 5pm. Teddy was simply amazing! Just trust her. She knows. What I loved about this tour, was that Teddy was so flexible and chilled out. She would suggest "we will go here and try this next" explaining the next stop, but then at another place she would say "you choose what you want individually" based off the menu, while still suggesting some ideas. We tried food at 9 different locations. Come hungry! Plenty to eat. I even put my hand up to try a few things knowing I only could have a few bites because I was so full, but this was no problem. Teddy also was happy to answer any questions we had about life in Hanoi or just to talk about food. Thanks for providing such a great tour - you do a awesome job. Now we feel ready to go out and eat our way around Vietnam with some base knowledge.

Best tour ever. We are a vegan couple. We were afraid to go to the tour but Moon the guide was fabolous. She made us a self made vegan tour and we tasted the best vegan food in Hanoi for sure! She was so friendly and funny and we actually enjoyed it so much.Highly recommended!!!

The best way start a trip in Vietnam!. It was our first day in Hanoi and we both vegan. Moon was a perfect guide. She took us to the most authentic places with the best vegan food. Furthermore, she made us a list of the places we visited with the names of the dishes. We recommend to everyone who wants to experience a delicious and cultural adventure.
Yummy. We tried it several times and each time it was just delicious food. So I recommend to everybody - absolutely great.

Great food, Sightseeing and Philosophy. I joined a walking tour one Saturday in September 2016. There were only four of us, myself from England, an American man, and two women, one from Korea and one from Hong Kong. Our guide was Miss Moon, whose English was very good, and whose enthusiasm for what she was doing was obvious. We had over 10 dishes in almost as many places in a tour that lasted around 3 hours (but felt shorter). It was also a good introduction to the old part of Hanoi. Miss Moon explained the philosophy behind why certain ingredients were used in the food, which certainly added to the experience. It probably would not have crossed my mind to go in many of the places, some relatively well hidden or not obvious. At the end she wrote out a list of what we had eaten, and where. A most satisfying tour.
Great fun. Had a blast. Delicious food and great company. My partner is vegetarian and she was fully catered for. Our guide was very easy to get along with and made it a blast.
Take the visit!. This is a must attraction in hanoi. Come hungry! The guide is with good english and you have 8 stood.

Great time with Kiwi!. Great tour. Ate so much we were all stuffed. Went to 6 places and had over 8 dishes. Kiwi was our guide and had a big smile on her face the whole time while she made sure we were all learning and well taken care of. Food was super flavorful. We took the vegetarian version of the tour. None of us got sick from the food, but it's a street food tour so there were some uncooked veggies that were surely washed with tap water. Made us a little nervous but we all felt fine the next day.

Must do!. Donut, our lovely guide took us on the walking food tour through the old quarter. We ate so much good food and went to street restaurants that we never would have known about or would have been game to try. Donut promised she would keep feeding us until we couldn't move and she certainly did that! Such a great experience and a great guide. Donut made the tour really fun and was able to answer our questions and even wrote us a list of all the places and dishes we tried along the way. Highly recommend!!

SO MUCH GOOD FOOD! . You must do this, especially if you are new to Vietnam as it will help you navigate the local cuisine and also the busy streets! Make sure you fast before! (And after!)My guide was a young lady called Lotus. We were recommended to get a guide called Miss Moon, but Lotus was brilliant!For about $60AUD we visited 7 local street traders and restaurants, starting at Lotus's favorite Bun Cha ta (grilled pork noodle soup). From there we walked and ate our way through many different dishes and with help from Lotus I felt like a (stuffed) Hanoian by the end! Some of my favorites were the Banh Cuon (rolled rice flour pan cake with pork, mushroom, onion and fried shallot), as well as some of the sweeter dishes such as the Bo Bia (rice flour crepe roll with shredded coconut and fried sugar shards) and the Vietnamese doughnut. Lotus helped to describe each dish and how to enjoy them with the sides and seasonings. Tips - definitely go in the morning so that you have fasted over night (don't eat breakfast) and so that you can use the rest of the day to digest all the food! I went on a solo tour but you can do group tours with up to 10 people too. Book through Kim Tours and ask for Lotus. 74 Hang Bac Street, Hanoi. 0996 960 188 / +84 966 960 188 (Int'l).

A must while in Hanoi. Great walking tour with a lovely guide called Lissy from Hanoi. Excellent food and experience. You go into places that otherwise you would completely miss or not dare to enter. All of the food is clean and great. Better than in many restaurants. Happy street food hunting!

Did it. Loved it. Wished we'd done it on Day 1 in Hanoi!. We did this activity on our last day in Hanoi but we wish we'd done it first thing, as it really does give you the confidence and knowledge to order street food from the tiny outlets! On your own!Our guide was Lotus and she was great, she even wrote out all the places and dishes we tried on a bit of paper for us to keep - a much appreciated gesture.We didn't want to join a group so we paid the few extra US dollars and did a private tour at a time that suited us, which is a good option for people with limited time in Hanoi or perhaps families. We were also able to complete the tour in just over 2hrs rather than the advertised 3hrs which was ideal in the heat.We did this on the recommendation of many of our friends and we'll be recommending it as the No. 1 activity too!

Do it!. Cherry our guide was amazing and very accommodating of food requirements from our group. Good group size with 5 people on our tour. All of the food was super delicious with a good range of places. Plenty of food on offer, with the adventurous eater catered for (not me). Highly recommend

So much delicious food and drink!. A friend and I had already done a food tour in Ho Chi Minh City, and we were told that the flavours vary between the North and South, so we had to do another food tour on the back of a scooter. Scooters are such a big part in Vietnam, it felt a shame to miss out on the chaos.Our tour guide was Nga and 3 other well trained scooter riders. They immediately put us to ease. They were all very chatty and friendly, and knew a lot about the local history. As you would expect, they also knew a great deal about the local cuisine and where to find it.We hit up 14 or so stops each with different types of food or drink. The food was delicious, and the flavours differed from the South. We ate a lot, I wish i hadn't eaten on the day before the tour. They'll happily recommend more restaurants at the end of the tour, and if you're still hungry, let them know and they'll take you around to other restaurants -- I very much doubt you'll still have enough room for food after the half way point :)This is a must, and definitely do this on your first day so that you've got time to eat again or try the recommendations later on in your trip.

Great experience with Laura. Laura took us to sample delicious street food (and drinks) in 7 different locations. She did an extraordinary job explaining about the ingredients used in this varied and distinct Vietnamese cuisine. All venues are within short walking distance from each other. Highly recommended!

Excellent street food tour with Cherry!. What a great tour. Highly recommended. We would never have tried all the things we tasted on our own. Cherry was a fantastic guide who taught us all sorts of interesting things about Vietnamese food, culture and Hanoi. Thanks for an amazing evening, Cherry!!

Unforgettable!. We did the 6pm food tour on scooters and it was absolutely amazing. A few people in the group had some reservations about the safety of taking a tour on scooters but the lovely Vietnamese ladies who took the small group of 7 of us around were experienced, safe and stable drivers and within minutes everyone felt calm and safe. It was a fantastic experience to do the tour on mopeds as it not only gave an authentic experience of hanoi but it meant we could reach some farther out places that you would not have got to with a walking tour. We tried around 7 food dishes, hanoi beer, egg coffee and rice wine. I would recommend Nga as a guide if possible as she was an incredibly funny and intelligent young lady who not only ensured we had so much fun throughout but also gave an insight into history and politics in Vietnam which was very interesting.I'd recommend this tour to everyone - young, old, couples, friends and solo travelers. It was our highlight in hanoi - thank you to the wonderful team!

A must in Hanoi. We went on a few food tours in Vietnam and this one was the best. Mia was an amazing guide - funny, friendly, knowledgeable and fantastic with our two kids. We learned so much about the food and the Old Quarter. I was afraid that 3 hours might be a bit too long for kids but the time just flew by. A walk in chaotic evening Old Quarter, stops at several family restaurants in narrow alleys and incredible variety of delicious food (and drinks) - it was a perfect evening. Highly recommended!

Thank you Donut!. We did the nightlife walking tour, around 2.5 hours with our guide, Donut. The food was fantastic, and was great to learn about the places and history of the different places. We ate at the same place that Obama went too, and Donut stopped to make sure we all tried Bia Hoi too. Definitely not to be missed when you're in Hanoi. The only thing I think wasn't excellent was the banh mi at the end, but that's partly because we were so stuffed.

A MUST do Hanoi activity . We did the street food tour on our first day in Hanoi. It was a great was to get to know the city, food, culture and meet a few people. Our guide Mia was incredible - so smiley, knowledgeable and caring. The food was delicious at every station. Definitely go hungry!

So fun. We did the 4 hour street food and sight seeing tour. Worth every penny. Tour leader spoke excellent English and was very knowledgeable about food, culture and current events in Vietnam. We felt safe on the motor bikes. Best experience in Hanoi.

Best experience in Hanoi. We did the 3 hour scooter food tour with our 9 and 11 year olds. This was such a fabulous experience. The girls riding the scooters listened to everything we needed and delivered 100%! A must do while in Hanoi.

Amazing food along the streets of Hanoi. I went for this food tour as it was recommend by friends beforehand and I'm so glad I did. Went for the group tour at 6.30 and was in a small group of 6. Our guide Alisia was very friendly and welcoming. She spoke good English and was very knowledgeable about food and the city. Everything we ate was delicious, although my personal favourite was the bun cha. The tour ended with a local favourite of egg coffee, which is considerably better than it sounds.

Great way to learn about Vietnamese food! . We did the 18:30 street food tour. We thought we will be in a group but eventually got a private tour. Our guide was Teddy who was just fantastic, explaining every thing to us and teaching us the names of every dish. All of the places we went to were good. We never would have visited them by ourselves. The tour was 3 hours long and Teddy kept offering us more and more things to try out. We highly recommend the tour for experiencing true Vietnamese food.

amazing experience, do it on your first night in Hanoi as you will definitely want to return to most of the restaurants. Our guide Teddy was great, she had good control of the group and everything went smoothly. The food was really amazing and its a great introduction if you are new to Vietnamese food. We went back to 4 of the restaurants throughout the rest of our stay. Highly recommended

One unique Hanoi experience!. Got to experience where and how the locals eat. Our guide, Lotus, is a sweet, charming girl- very patient accompanying elderly women in a walking food tour. She led us inside modest establishments and we discovered surprisingly good food inside. The place where we ate Bun Cha was my favorite - the meat was addicting!While walking from one place to another, we get to know how Hanoi is at a Friday night -vibrant and full of contagious energy! It is lovely to see both tourists and locals interact and have good conversations. This is definitely a must-do for all Hanoi tourists!

Highly Recommended Food Tour!. A group of 5 of us booked this tour and were in a group with 6 other people. Our tour guide, Kiwi, was so friendly, outgoing, knowledgable, and smiled the entire time. The tour began at 6:30 and was finished around 9:30 or 10. We walked all over the Old Quarter to sample different types of Vietnamese food, which was absolutely delicious! The only downside is that we got super full before the tour was over. This was our fault for not preparing ahead of time, and speaks to just how much food you eat! Highly recommended.

My favourite things.... informative and delicious!!. Miss Moon (very cheerful and informative) took our group around to several places in the heart of the Old Quarter. The food was great and eateries were more than happy to accomodate people with special food requirements. Well recommended for anyone visiting Hanoi. Would rate higher if I could.

Enjoyable evening in chaotic Hanoi !. Good fun night out on Hanoi with a good mix of food to try. Our guide was called "Doughnut" and was very funny ! Definitely worth doing if you have a few hours to spare.

Miss Moon you rock. Miss Moon has made Hanoi a very memorable visit for me. We spent a memorable few hours visiting local establishments sampling great food. Miss Moon's attention to detail and quick wit added to the experience. I find myself smiling when crossing roads thinking "sticky rice" and when making a decision about where to eat? What would Miss Moon do? Perfect day thank you

Brilliant tour - a must do in Hanoi.. Makes sure you haven't eaten before you start this tour, you will not go home hungry! We had seven different stops each one different and accompanied with details of how the food originates and why it's traditional etc. Our guide Lizzie, was amazingly knowledgable, super friendly and very accommodating to everyone in the group. At $20 pp this a massive bargain and a great evenings activity . Highly recommend...do it!!

Great Customer Service. We booked an afternoon scooter sightseeing tour for our family - 2 x adult and 2 x kids.There was a breakdown in communication and our tour was changed to a food tour, which wasn't ideal for our kids.As our tour guide was only following instructions we contacted the manager/owner on our return and explained our concerns.We couldn't have asked for better service and he offered us a discount for our inconvenience.The food tour we did was great, it that's what you wanted!As I said great service and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend!

Not great. Took this tour with my wife on first evening in Hanoi.Called to book a private tour. When we got there, told we were in a group tour and even though we still wanted the private tour, we were convinced by staff the group tour would be fine.We ended up in a group of 10 people, with the other group being 6. The organization and splitting of groups was not impressive. Overall, food was quite poor. We have been all over Vietnam and tried other food tours, so maybe that's why we knew it wasn't great.. Everyone in our group was so confused when, after dessert, we went to have banh mi (viet sandwiches). The order was totally off. Nor would locals eat like that.Our guide was really kind though and all smiles, but honestly she sounded really scripted...Did not feel genuinely engaged, but i felt bad for her.Overall the disappointment was the quality of food and organization of groups. If it is your first stop in Vietnam though go for it, maybe you will enjoy it.

Excellent Experience . After arriving in Hanoi from Halong Bay we were a little tired and couldn't decide what to have for dinner. The choice was a bit overwhelming so we are very glad we stumbled across this tour. We paid for a ticket about 5 minutes before the tour started. We had a fantastic guide, Teddy who was very knowledgable and spoke excellent English. Everything was delicious and we ate at places we would have never found or had the opportunity to experience. We sampled a wide variety of local specialties and Teddy explained everything in detail, while also giving the group a chance to chat and relax. Very good value for less than $55 AUD for both of us we had 8 things to eat (6 main dishes), two desserts and drinks (beer and coffee) all inclusive. Teddy was kind enough to write down the restaurants we visited so we could go back. Bun Cha, crab soup and sweet coconut rice paper roll were the highlights. Would highly recommend the tour for any traveller and guide, Teddy.

Very recommend tour . We take this tour, when we book our trip to Vietnam. I think this tour is a mandatory tour when you visit Vietnam, if you can do it on the first day is better. You can know about the Vietnamese food and also to see the real street food of the Vietnamese people.

Fantastic street food tour with the lovley lotus! X. Me and my husband decided to do a street food tour whilst on honeymoon we went for the group option was was lots of fun there was 2 other couples we all got on and was nice to chat whilst we wondered the streets to the different places Lotus was amazing very sweet girl very smiley loved venturing into places you wouldn't even know we're there! Nice fresh food I was worried about a tour as I suffer with a sensitive stomach but all the food was delicious and cooked well Thanks louts you were amazing!!!

Fantastic Tour! . Just finished off our street food tour in Hanoi with the lovely and charming Mia. So incredibly happy with our experience! Mia was full of information about everything to do with Hanoi and the foods we were eating on the tour. It's felt fantastic to interact with local eateries as a foreigner. Best of all my partner and I were well accommodated as vegetarians. Mia's English was amazing, couldn't have asked for a better guide. Thank you so much for this wonderful experience I'll be passing on all the information to anyone travelling to Hanoi! 10/10!

Interesting and fun. If you're "very" adventurous and not overly picky about restaurant appearances, then consider this. On the other hand, if you're not all that adventurous with food and restaurant appearance, this might not be a good consideration for you. I'm very adventurous and my wife is somewhat adventurous and we were bought a bit concerned if we would have stomach problems. We didn't. However, honestly, almost all of the 7 restaurants we visited were really dirty and the apparent food handling practices were of concern. We've traveled to many countries and recently completed a food tour in Ho Chi Minh City, so it wasn't as if we've never been in a similar situation. We expected a better selection of restaurants, given the thousands of choices. Beyond the appearances, candidly, the taste of the food was good, but not great. In it's favor, the tour was very inexpensive and overall it was a good experience in terms of learning.

Do it! . We did the three hour walking evening tour. Our guide was excellent! She spoke extremely good English and gave us information on the history of Vietnam as well as the food and drink. The food outlets chosen were varied and clean. We tried 5 different food outlets plus ended the night with egg coffee. The walking was minimal, the food was great, the guide was excellent. Highly recommend.

Great a must do. We arrived in Hanoi yesterday lunch time and did this tour at 5:00pm - it was great! Had sent an email a week or two prior to organise the time, but know people came and booked earlier on the day. There were 10 people in our group which was a good size and allowed everyone to talk when we ate at different places. Our guide was Mia, she was amazing and so friendly!! We ate lots of food and had a few drinks. Mia wrote out a list of all the places we ate and the food we had. We are really happy we did this tour first up in our trip. For only $20US it was great value.You may want to buy another drink along the way as we drank our first water pretty quick due to the heat.Had a great time, thanks Mia.
Great tour. We went to the cooking class and puppet show. We had a great time at the cooking class and great seats at the puppet show. Highly recommend the cooking class everyone had a great time.

One of the first things to do in Hanoi! . We scheduled a private tour for 4 (as some of us are vegetarian). The private tour cost 100$ (so 25 each). The regular tour is 20$ per pesron. Both tours go to the same places. Our Guide was Lotus who was lovely. The dishes we had were absolutely amazing! It's a great introduction to Vietnamese food and places in Hanoi.

Great tour through the many streetfood stalls. We had a tour with 'Lotus' who was very kind and gave us a great insight into both Hanoi/Vietnamese streetfood as well as life! The tour is a helpful guide through the many different dishes and stalls available in Hanoi. Definetly recommended for your first evening in Hanoi as it helps you when discovering streetfood stall some more on your own!

Private tour highly recommended. Did a private tour with Teddy today. Would definitely recommend this tour (and especially Teddy as a guide) - you get one on one. You really get so much information about Hanoi and their culture that it is well worth paying the extra $5USD over the group tour.
Excellent. Tasty, varied, authentic food and lots of it, caters for vegetarians, and Miss Moon is, as countless others have mentioned, a complete legend- friendly, funny and knowledgeable.
Good way to try new food. We went on a food tour with "Donut". She was an excellent guide and we truly enjoyed the tour. It is a great way to see the city and to try lots of new food

Mia deserves a medal!. Thank you to Mia, our lovely guide for our tour recently. We got the deal at a cheaper price as there were meant to be 10 of us, only my husband & I turned up so it was a private tour in the end! Mia did a fantastic job at walking around with us explaining everything so well as we went. She is very much adored by all the places she took us too and this proved to be very welcoming. Crossing the roads with 'sticky rice' call will stay with me forever! Thank you again for a great time!

A must do when visiting Hanoi. We ended up doing this tour as we had an extra night in Hanoi we needed to fill. It turned out to be our favourite experience in Hanoi. The tour takes you to places and restaurants that you would never know or think to venture to without a tour guide. Our guide was Mia, who was extremely warm, friendly, easy to talk to and had great English. Mia was also very informative about life in Vietnam which made for very interesting conversations. We were in a group of 6, including myself and my partner. This makes for a very personal experience with the other customers on the tour. We were happy to chat and meet new people, however, I would say that if you are not interested in meeting or talking to other travelers then it could be slightly awkward at meals as some of the tables are very small and intimate. I wouldn't say I have the most adventurous palette and I still thoroughly enjoyed nearly every dish. We even returned to one of the restaurants after the tour as we loved the food so much! We visited a total of 7 restaurants and one street vendor. There is a lot of food though so go hungry.

This streetfood tour is the BEST. Thanks to our guide, Mia, for a wonderful private tour. We opted to have a private guide and move at our own pace. The trip was informative, and there was more food than we could eat (and we can eat a lot!) Absolute value for money.

Awesome Tour, great guide, good food. Our Background:We are a german couple and normally we are not really fans of tours. Often its very touristic and not a "real" experience because they take you to places were they can make more money. Or the tour guide asks everyone the same questions and you think "hey he/she just has to ask that and has no real interest in you." This agency is the no.1 on TripAdvisor so we were a bit suspicious if it will be another "mass processing" experience.The tour:Our tour started at 5pm and there were 10 people waiting in front of the office. They split us in a 6 and in a 4 people group. Me and my partner were in the group of 4 and our guide was Alisia. She was great. From the first moment it didn't feel like a typical tour. It was more like a friend is showing you around in Hanoi. We tried the egg coffee, some soups, salads, spring rolls, beer and so many other things. Everything was very good and yes we ate real street food. It was not extra cooked for the tour and at the most places there were no tourists. There was enough to eat. The other couple couldn't eat up everything. Conclusion:We are really happy that we booked this tour. Great food, fantastic guide, good value. Why couldn't be every tour like this?

One of the best tours that I have ever taken.. I have enjoyed Viator tours on several continents. The 'Half-day Hanoi Old Quarter Food Tasting Tour' was the least expensive tour that I have ever taken. To be honest, this gave me a little concern but this turned out to be the very best tour for Value. Our guide, Xui, was a very knowledgeable and likable young man who gave us great insight and information into everything from the food to the neighborhood. We had skipped lunch and I did not expect that 'food tasting' would amount to dinner but, was I wrong about that! We stopped at six places. The first was a restaurant where we had grilled fish and Bun Cha. It was plenty to eat for the six of us. At each of the following street food stops I expected to eat less, as I was getting full but, the entrees were so good and so different that I kept eating! Our fifth stop was for coconut ice cream and sticky rice - doesn't sound very appealing, right? It was absolutely extraordinary! The sticky rice is steamed in banana leaves and it is bright green. The coconut ice cream with shavings and whipped cream made this dessert a big hit! Our last stop was for egg coffee.
