Unbelievable yet again...very heavy and thick but, it was like egg nog coffee, two things that I love! The food was worth far more than what we paid for the tour. The tour lasted about three hours which was just perfect. Definitely do the evening tour!!

Great food and culture tour. We went for the 5pm tour, I might have taken the more later ones as this amount of food was a lot and all I wanted in the end was to sleep.We stopped at 9 places, all very tasty and authentic. Our guide Alisia was brilliant, with excellent English. she shared a lot of her personal experience with us.All in all great value.

Great food at venues we would have otherwise passed on. . 4 stars as it wasn't absolutely spectacular but was good fun all the same. Our guide Lizzie was really nice but as she was fairly new to the job. It can be forgiven that she wasn't probably quite as outspoken as another guide may have been. She did know exactly where she was going though and her English level is good. You do get to go to pretty authentic venues with the tour and the food is really good but I think if your worried about hygiene then you may want to reconsider. It was strange as at some of the street food places, they were empty bar the tour groups from Hanoi Street Food Tours but having said that, the food is still good. You do short walks around the old quarter to each venue. It's a tight squeeze at pretty much all the places you visit! We got to try bun cha (noodles and pork), nom thit bo kho (beef salad with papaya), banh cuon bo (steamed rice rolls with beef), various deep fried items (can't remember the name but it had fried fermented sausage, fried spring rolls, fried pillow rolls and a fried doughtnut with mung beans), rieu cua (crab meat soup noodles), sticky rice with ice cream, glutinous rice with shaved ice/coconut milk and a creme caramel, bahn mi and egg coffee. We are definitely more used to nicer restaurants so it was a great insight to the street food world and you're taken into food venues you would have never thought of going into.

A Must Do. We were recommended this tour by other travellers during our recent time in Vietnam. We signed up for the street food motorcycle tour and we were not disappointed. We were picked up at our hotel by our guide Phoenix and then travelled to 6 different locations to try the different street food around Hanoi. The amount of food, and the knowledge of the guide was well worth the money paid. Only a light dinner was needed after the tour. We can not recommend this tour enough if you are ever visiting Hanoi.
Wonderful!. Miss Moon was brilliant. Knowledgeable, funny, informative and ordered us great food. The whole tour was brilliant. Bring your appetite.

cherry was great! . We really enjoyed the tour the food and the company. she is very sweet and has great English!! took us trough the allies of hanoi into places we would never go alone. highly recommended

Over the moon with miss moon. We did this tour at the start of our Vietnam trip. There were four other people. Making it 6 in total.With Miss Moon as our guide, we visited 6 locations each with their own specialty. Miss Moon was a great guide, providing lots of information about the dishes we were eating and entertaining us with her anecdotes. Our only advice is to begin the tour on a completely empty stomach, as we made the mistake of eating breakfast beforehand!

Fantastic. We had Teddy as our guide and she was great. Tried around 10 dishes from a variety of restaurant types. We had a group of around ten. Sticky rice with ice cream was amazing. Thank you Teddy!
Great. Loved it and Mia was perfectThe food was amazing and I ate at places I usually would never have touched

Greta fun tour, with excellent food . Fun and informative tour with Hien (Cherry!) who was a great laugh. Covers the bases of Hanoi street food (including great Bun Cha) and is a decent walking tour of the old town as well. Would recommend if you want to figure out what's what on the street food menus. Thank you!

Street Food Tour $20USD. Worth every penny and more!! Incredible amount of food consumed. (Please do not eat before hand!!) Miss Moon shows you an incredible amount of Vietnamese food, fresh and traditional cuisine. With some light history and local knowledge included (eg Sticky rice!! LOL). Be aware! Miss moon will have you leave with a full moon!!
Great tour. We had a great time with Mia -the best tour guide! We enjoyed different kinds of Vietnamese food and it was really good. Mia is very friendly, funny and knowledgeable- She's great!

Night scooter "foodie" tour. Great fun, safe as houses, went to about 7 different locations all the food was great and more than enough to fill you up. Annie and Jess were our guides both knowledgeable and genuinely lovely people. Pointed out more than just places for food and then gave us recommendations for places to go out and drink later. Loved every minute of it.

Yum. There was different food we tried and it was all very yummy! It's cheap $20AUD However for the amount of food you get it would cost you probably less than $5AUD. The bonus was having an English speaking tour guide showing you the good places and how to eat the different dishes. It goes for 3 hours, we wished it was quicker and that we did a private tours so we could have been in and out of the places quicker. I would highly recommend the street near the cathedral. There is a deaf man across the road making these amazing sugar cane and coconut rolls! His little mobile set up was called BO BIA white with red writing-Ah soo good! And just up from him on the cathedral side there is a place doing amazing fried foods- seriously try them all (52 ly Quoc su)Our tour guide Michelle was great!!

Absolutely authentic!. My boyfriend and I did a food tour with Cherry on 17th September and we had a true taste of Hanoi! Cherry was very passionate and brought us to all her favourite local shops in the old quarter. Out of all 10 food items, we enjoyed ALL 10! Thanks again, Cherry, for taking care of us so well! Everyone should give this tour a go when in Hanoi!

Awesome walking food tour - go on an empty stomach. Our family (2 adults and 2 children) absolutely loved the Hanoi Street Food Tour. For three hours, we ate our way through lots of dishes and discovered the most popular dishes in Vietnam. Our guide was professional and bubbly, and our kids especially enjoyed chatting to her about the culture and the food. We liked that we went off the beaten path to eat at the many street restaurants and felt like a local. Well worth the USD$25 per person, which food and drinks are included. Would recommend grabbing your friends and family to do this tour. 5 stars for sure!
Worth going. Definitely worth trying, The guide Vivian took us to places that only locals would know and shared with us knowledge the correct way of eating.

Don't miss this.... We did the Hanoi Street Food tour privately for $25USD per person (2 couples and 1 single) and it was worth every single dollar. You can do the public group tour for $20USD per person if you prefer - great option if it's just a couple and you would like to do it with more people. Our tour guide Cherry (Hein) was the perfect mix of professional and personal. She was sweet, funny, very knowledgable and had a great sense of humour - she made the evening such a delight. We tried all the traditional foods in places we never would've dared go on our own. Cherry made sure every thing was made fresh for us and we were also able to participate in one of the cooking options. Cherry was fantastic with dietary requirements as one of our group could not eat mushroom and shellfish she ensured that she was catered to at every stop. Definitely wear some comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking - at the first stop you will take off your shoes, but no more after that. It took about 3 hours total and we were so satisfied at the end of it - perfect portions! I couldn't recommend this company enough and make sure you ask for Cherry!
Amazing!. We came back Hanoi this September with friends. We booked a street food tour for 3hours around old town. Such a beautiful city with lots of streets and delicious food! We will be back!
Fun time!. Miss Molly gave us a wonderful tour and this was the only chance we had to try a few of the items from Hanoi. Really great way to quickly get a broad overview of the Streetfood.

Teddy (our guide) was awesome!. Great experience. A lot of fun. Teddy's first tour and she was awesome. So knowledgable and funny. Made for a good night. Would definitely recommend to anyone considering it!

Great fun!. We did this tour a few weeks ago and for US$20 found it great value. Our guide, Donut, was really well-informed, great company and spoke perfect English. She led us through the old town to six different restaurants where we tried local food, had a quick try in a kitchen and got a good feel for the area around the lake. It was a good orientation as, on the following days in Hanoi, we were aware of where to find nice bars and restaurants. Rounded off with a beer in a street side bar, I would recommend this tour to any first-time visitors to Hanoi who like Vietnamese cuisine.

Excellent way to sample Hanoi's finest cuisine. Amazing food and a great way to meet people. Even if you have largest appetite you won't be disappointed. Our tour guide Teddy was fantastic and I would highly recommend anyone in Hanoi to do this tour.

Food tour with Kiwi. My two friends and I were in a small group of 7 people led by our wonderful food guide Kiwi. I won't even go into the details of the foods we sampled, all I can say is hat everything was amazing and we are so glad we booked this tour. There are several places we wouldn't have thought to go in to and it is well worth having a local guide. I want to spend more time talking about our guide Kiwi. She was great right from the start. Introduced herself to us ( she is studying food engineering so you know you're in the right hands) and had us all introduce ourselves to each other so we felt like a little family sharing our meals together. She is knowledgeable, funny, interactive and most of all personable ans left a great impression on us all. At the end of the trip we got a list of all the places we had visited along with her personal suggestions for places and foods we hadn't tried. Was an evening well spent in great company. Thank you very much kiwi :) 5star experience !!!!Your friends from London
Great Food tour in Hanoi. We really loved the tour, foods and miss moon, it a must for visiting Hanoi, great city with great people. We will do the tour again

Night walk with the best guide and great food!. Although this tour it VERY VERY based on who you get as a guide I highly suggest Vivian, she is the cutest guide and walks at a good pace. She also makes a note of stopping at "notable landmarks" in between food stops which is a really nice treat and gives your stomach some time to settle. A couple of nice points of the tour were the fact that when you take a tour like this it pushes you out of your comfort zone, you will eat food from places you probably would not have had you juat walked by them. So you really experience the best Hanoi has to offer. Also by being with a tour you get priority service and the guide is fluent so communicates easily with the restaurant owners. Yes you may go to some "dirty"(but delicious restaurants. This is Vietnam as a whole though so deal with it.

Street food tour. Lots of walking but a great way to quickly get a sense of what is nearby the hotel. Great way to learn about the local's version of 'fast food'. Sample local beer, crumbed pork, bread rolls with pork, BBcue meat and ice cream. Like all tours much depends on the tour guide and how well they interact with the group.

Thank you Mia and Hanoi Street Food Tour! Amazing time.. This is a must do if you are in Hanoi. We booked the 5pm street food tour, and Mia was our guide. We called the day of to put our names in for the tour and it was no problem at all. The groups are small, 10 people max, so it's an intimate group and wonderful to meet fellow travellers. The price is spot on, you could probably get all this food for half the cost but you'd have no idea where to go or what to order, so for the low fee of the tour, it's excellent value for money. Mia was organized and spoke excellent english, she was great at keeping us all together (like sticky rice!). She shared so much about all the foods we tried and the Vietnamese culture and conversational with all of us, also curious to know about our various backgrounds and customs. I heard all the guides are great but Mia was fantastic and I highly recommend her. The tour lasted 3 hours and we went to 6-7 places, water and beer or beverage of your choice is provided, and at the end, Mia wrote down everything we ate and locations so we could return if we wanted to (the next day, we went back to the banh mi spot, it was delish!!). Each stop was unique and different. Not only should you go into the tour with an empty stomach, but go in with an open mind. This isn't a rich country and you won't be eating on silver platters - the best part of the cuisine in North Vietnam is how they prepare, serve and consume it. Become a local for a few hours, put all your worries aside, and you'll love each and every bite you try! I loved how we had a chance to try making the silk pancakes at one of the spots too, that was really fun!

Great intro, friendly guides. We tried this tour on our first day in Hanoi, our guides were nice and gave us information on the dishes we had. They were very accommodating and patient with our slow paced group and we had fun trying different street food. I almost gave this tour an average rating because of a bad experience on our last stop (which was really dirty). But overall, this was a great experience and we loved our guides Daisy and a trainee (I'm so sorry for forgetting your name!).

Amazing Street Food Tour. Our guide Alisia guided us through the amazing small alleyways of the Hanoi old quarter where we experienced a huge range of fantastic food. Alisia was very knowledgeable and funny. She answered any questions we had (not only about the tour) and was very personable. The food was plentiful and delicious and we met some great fellow travellers. Would recommend to all.

Absolute must do......!!!! : ). A lot of fun and you will go to places that you would never know existed. We took the 11.00am tour (tip skip or have only a light breakfast) We meet our guide Mia who was very sweet and offered great tips regarding how to eat some of the food and also the history and correct pronunciation of some of the meals : ) Essentially you will enjoy a 5 or 6 course meal at totally different food stops. All the stops specialist in a particular dish - so you are getting the best. Weaving through the city and back alleys was a lot of fun, and I would highly recommend this tour. This is not a particularly taxing tour in regards to walking - and in fact it's nice to walk all that yummy food off.....!!!!

Excellent guide excellent choices. My dad and I took a private tour -$30 pp for about 3 hours. We went to 7 different places and tried things we probably wouldn't of and learned the right way to eat them. Our guide, Lotus, was fantastic. The other bonus was walking through alleyways we never would have ventured on our own and seeing more of Hanoi.

Hope you're hungry. The tour guide was friendly and informative on all things Vietnamese. We visited 7 places all with different dishes and lovely taste of the area.The tour lasts 3 hours but by the end you're full and satisfied.It's a great way to spend your evening and also a nice way to get to know the city and learn some places to eat.

Another great experience (This time with Cherry). This is our second trip to Hanoi and we could not go to that wonderful city without linking up with Hanoi Street Four Tour again. This time we were very lucky to have Miss Hiem (or Cherry) take us on a memorable food experience. From Bun Cha to Egg Coffee, the food and the guided tour was excellent. Hanoi at night is a buzz with smells, sounds and lights. It's one of those things you need to do to when you go to such an amazing place. If you are a little worried about venturing out in a new city, like one as busy as Hanoi, don't! Jump onto a Hanoi Street Food Tour, learn about the city, learn how the cross the road and enjoy the flavour experience.

Best way to experience Hanoi food!. So we've heard about the food tour and it's time for us to experience it! Id say this is the best way for you to try all the specialities of Hanoi food but the downside is that u gotta to do it all in one night so do pace yourself! Monie and Annie were our tour guides for the night and both of them are very lovely - they are very knowledgeable with the food and also history of Hanoi, which makes the whole tour very interesting, and hell they do know how to ride a bike skilfully! We managed to try 7 different types of food for that night. I'd recommend this tour to anyone who is travelling to Hanoi for the first time :)

School trip. I had so much fun with all my friends and teachers and my family. I have never been on a plane until last week. It was so amazing the food was fantastic there the people were so friendly and loving.

Great experience that ends on a weird note. We had an amazing experience last year. You get a ton of food for your money and this tour also serves as an excellent walking tour of Hanoi. You hit most of the big sites. The food is extremely varied based on your host, so you get a chance at the best of everything and then they take you to a few of their personal favorite spots. The only odd part is the last stop. Every tour ends at a place in old town Hanoi for egg coffee and Bahn mi. The Bahn mi was one of the worst I have ever had anywhere. We figured out later that the business is owned by the tour operator. If she is still doing them, request "Money" as your guide.

Great Private Tour. Money guided us through her favorite spots in Hanoi's Old Quarter. We were well fed, learned a lot about the city and enjoyed the personalized service of the guide. A great value and well worth your time and money! Wonderful way to learn about they city.

Best start for your stay in Hanoi. A three hour long food walking tour with Miss Moon was the best possible start of our nostalgic stay in Hanoi. Good and interesting food and drink experiences in different little places as well as recommendations for more good places to eat (which we tried later). Professional and humorous comments from Miss Moon created a good atmosphere in our group of eight people from different countries. Happy to recommend this tour to others!

Evening tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour around the street stalls of the old quarter of Hanoi.Our guide Vi was exceptional, her knowledge of the local food and her personality brought the whole area to life for us.

Not a good experience. We think it was because of the national holiday, but our experience wasn't good. Our guide left our group after the 2nd restaurant we were going to had no space for us, and had us join another group with a second guide. Now we were even more people, so I'm assuming they didn't take us to the best places. Some things we had were good, most were average.

Fantastic night! . Our guide Phoenix was great fun and very knowledgable, and we had a fantastic night trying all the amazing food and seeing the sights of Hanoi. There is truly no better way to see the city then from the back of a bike - I would do it again just for that!The food was so good we just about rolled off the bikes at the end of the night.Highly recommend this tour when in Hanoi!
A must do attraction . The food is a must for anyone wanting to learn about the Vietnamese culture. We ate delicious food in places we would not have been to and we learnt how to eat it and why.

Great way to explore and taste your way around the Old Quarter. Lilli our guide was delightful- she led us to hidden street food gems around the Old Quarter. All the food was delicious and Lilli was happy to make adjustments along the way to meet our food needs/intolerances. We went to many places we otherwise wouldn't have and now have a new appreciation for Vietnamese food and as such have been more adventurous in trying other foods as well. We kept going until we were full and with teenage kids that can be a lot. Essential for any visitor

Lots of fun!. The walking tour costs $20USD or 440k VND per person.We got there about 15 minutes before the last tour (at 6? 6:30?) and booked it on the spot. Our tour guide was Kiwi, and she's seriously the cutest! She took us to 7 places. Along the way, she'd share with us fun little stories whether it be about history or her life. Anyway, I discovered a lot of new Vietnamese food on this tour and am glad I went! My boyfriend and I came pretty hungry and couldn't finish all the food we were presented with. Although I'm not sure if anyone else in our group had that problem. At the end, she even gave us some recommendations for other great foods in the area. If you have the time, I definitely recommend a street food tour!

Same same, but Different. Miss Moon was wonderful. She did an excellent job of showing us a lot of the same same types of Vietnamese food that you can find in so many places in the Old Quarter. Her attitude and thoroughness of explaining each dish was different than many other guides we have had on similar tours in other cities. She always took great care to ensure that we were "sticky rice" and stayed safe as we roamed through the busy streets. Overall, we definitely recommend.

Eating can't get any better. The Hanoi Street Food Tour was amazing. Our guide, Kiwi, was cheerful, informative and went out of her way to help us. Walking around Hanoi at night time can be quite scary with all the traffic but Kiwi helped us feel comfortable and safe.The food was excellent. 10 types of food at 7 locations. They were all excellent. The best thing about it was that you eat at places you would never think about going to. The tour really takes you to all the best spots that only locals know about.Highly recommended to anyone thinking about joining.

Eat Like a Hanoian. This is a must do in Hanoi. Guide Phoenix took us to places we never would probably go to. Knowledgeable about the culture. Authentic delicious food! Also took us to a couple of landmarks.

Don't eat breakfast! . We had an outstanding tour with Miss Moon! The tour has a great balance between information about the food and ingredients used in the dishes we tried and life and culture in Ha Noi. Miss Moon was also very helpful in explaining some of the nuances of the Vietnamese language so that we didn't make as many fopaux when we were trying to say little phrases of Vietnamese, such as please and thank you! We were a group of 4 and did the 11am tour with four other travellers (total 8). I recommend that you skip breakfast so that you can enjoy all of the stops! We emailed the night before and arrived at 10.45am to arrange payment. All very relaxed and easy. Thank you Miss Moon!

Fantastic tour, not to be missed. We loved everything about this tour. It was informative and the foot was great. One table was near a smelly drain but we put that down to the "experience". The group was small and well run.

So many new flavors. This is an absolute must when in Hanoi. Ms. Moon was knowledgeable and engaging during the entire tour and we could not have been happier with her recommendations. She even showed us the proper way to cross the street (not as easy as you think). The flavors we experienced were otherworldly. We've all had Pho but not like this. The explanation of the traditional ingredients made it that much better. Check out the pics and feel free to ask questions.
will do this again. you have to take this tour with the guide. the guide will show you the in's and out's of the food attractions in hanoi!

Come on an empty stomach!. Our guide Ms Moon was fun and animated, giving us snippets of Vietnamese culture, interesting anecdotes, helping us correct our Vietnamese pronunciation by explaining the difference in intonation of the words, and introducing us to awesome food! Ms Moon also wrote down the shop names & addresses along with the dishes we sampled so that we would be able to find our way back again. Great tour for those who don't know where or what to eat and are afraid of getting overcharged when ordering on their own.

Superb scooter night food tour. We had a wonderful first night in Hanoi with Nga and Annie.My girl friend was a bit reluctant to travel by scooter through the crowded streets but by the time we got to our first destination she was much more relaxed, these girls do know how to negotiate the traffic with finesse. We also managed to take in a little sight seeing as we moved between restaurants.The girls are very informative and are excellent tour guides.One of the highlights for me was the Vietnamese coffee best I have ever had!The food was amazing too! Would we do it again? YES we wouldJamie and Jan

Definitely worth your time!. It was a very interesting experience, and one that we wouldn't have been able to do without our amazing tour guide, Cherry. We sampled about 8 dishes of Hanoi street food throughout the 3 hours. Make sure to come on an empty stomach as there is plenty to eat!

Fun way to see Hanoi . Ms moon like everyone says was a lovely tour guide. We got to learn about the local food and places in Hanoi. The experience was very authentic. Also it was very nice to hear about the cultural aspects of how Vietnamese live.. Which ms moon gave us a great insight about. We all left very full.. 20 dollars well spent!

Excellent Tour- but expensive and long. We were very nervous about riding the motor bikes for this tour- we are risk adverse and don't do that many adventurous things. However, the drivers felt like they knew what they were doing (it still felt dangerous at some points) and it felt safer than I imagined. The bikes travel in packs, but they did get lost a few times or not know where we were going. I loved that the whole tour is run by women and that all the drivers are women.The food was great and the guide's English was impeccable and she was friendly. However, the tour could have been 3 hours instead of 4- it felt a little long and we were all incredibly full.After being in Hanoi and traveling throughout Vietnam, we realized the major con of this tour is the cost ($60). The food in Vietnam, including these restaurants is excessively cheap. This tour company must pocket a ton of the money, as we were also expected to tip the guides and the drivers (hoping they get paid in more than just tips).

Kiwi was the best!. Our guide Kiwi made our evening streetfood walking tour one of our favourite evenings in Vietnam. The range of food she got us was amazing, and and went into the history and culture of Hanoi, and at the end, basically discussed with us how to not get scammed / what we should be paying for things which was incredibly useful. Do this tour early on in your trip and you won't regret it.
Must do tour. Give people an opportunity to really know our local food, very tasty and must see. I take my business friends all the time they have good time!

Great group and host!. Ms Moon was one of the best hosts I've ever had on a walking tour/food tour. She was informative but hilarious and Engaged all the group and made it such a fun day. All the places we went were expertly picked and I was so impressed by every stop. I would highly recommend joining this tour, I was travelling alone and it was great to get some direction for places safe to go!!

Awesome tour with sunny. Our guide sunny who cares us very specially. So it was nice time for me. I hope to meet again her next time. Also If she come to my country I will treat her. Thanks Sunny~ was lovely time. I don't forget forever~

Hanoi Nightlife Tour by scooter. We had a wonderful time with our tour guides Nga (aka Money) and Annie. We weren't really hungry but they were very accommodating with the itinerary and drove us around the city for sightseeing a little more. We had a lot of fun hanging out with Money and Annie - not only did they introduce different foods to us but they were also very informative, answering all the questions we had about Vietnamese pop culture.Highly recommend this tour with Money and Annie!

Lovely food. What to say... U must try Vietnamese food..
Fresh vegetables with meat, noodles.. Etc
I think most of shop I visited where local people go.
Specially food with rice paper- forget about the name of food 😢
It is very delicious and cannot forget.
I will visit Vietnam again and one of the reason is their food.

Fabulous introduction into Vietnamese cuisine. We did the food tour at the beginning of our trip and would do it again. Kiwi was a great guide and took us to places we would have probably never entered. The food was awesome & we had a very nice group. After the tour we weren't scared to enter local restaurants anymore ;) the more basic they look, the better they are (usually :p)

Must do. Ha noi food variety is incredible not to mention the taste! This tour is REALLY worth it. Three hours of delicious food with all the information about it. One of the best things I've done in ha noi

Food Tour = Excellent, Sunny the Guide =Amazing!!!!. You are sitting here at your computer wondering if you should spend the money to book a tour to eat food. The answer is YES! Honestly, I wasn't even sure if I liked Vietnamese food, three hours with Sunny made me realise how complex, diverse and delicious the local Hanoi food is!! From teaching me to use chop sticks, getting me to try new dishes, explaining every ingredient in each item, Sunny was a wealth of information! On top of all that she patiently answered my ignorant cultural questions and was generally just a delightful person to spend the afternoon with- I'll be back! But in the meantime--- what are you waiting for call up Hanoi Street Tours and make sure to ask for Sunny!

Great food and tour of the city . We decided to do a food tour of Hanoi after seeing all the different corners with food. We definitely recommend this as a way to try all of the local street food as well as get a great tour of the city. We had Sunny as our tour guide and she was energetic, fun, willing to answer all of our questions and took us to her favorite local spots. As everything is paid for ahead of time, each stop was easy and she would order for us. Highly recommend to anyone in Hanoi!

Great Fun. The 3 hour walking tour was a great way to sample some food that you could easily miss on a short trip. Ms Moon, our guide, was in great spirits as she weaved us through the Old Quarter trying out the menus she had prepared earlier.A must-do for any visitor to Hanoi.

Really tastefull experience! . We did the tour with Mia, a student from Hanoi. She really showed us a good time by taking us to places you will never think of yourself. All the food was lovely! Also she is very funny and intelligent, which makes the explaining during the tour great! Big compliment for Mia!

Amazing experience!. This tour is perfect for families with older kids. Our tour guide Vi was fantastic and certainly showed us the heart of Hanoi where we got to try local food and see the local sights and history. We did the private tour at $25 per person but we paid in VND. Big thumbs up and a must!

Awesome tour, Must do in Hanoi!. Our tour guide Kiwi was really nice and lead us to many places with amazing food. She gives a lot of interesting information about the food, but also about life in Vietnam.If you want to try many different kind of dishes in Hanoi, then taking the tour is a must do! The price is definitely worth it. You get a lot of food and drinks (water, beer, coffee, etc.). It was an awesome experience.

Overwhelming . A real insight into how the hanoians live, cook and work. Tasted real hanoi food not created for tourists, ate with the locals in places we would never had found. Had our own private guide who showed us through his friends home. Couldn't have asked for a better Insight into their culture.

Hanoi Street Food Tour. Miss Moon's tour was wonderfully informative and thoughtfully planned. Even though I had tried many of the foods before, the places we tried brought each dish to a new level. We would have never stumbled upon the places she chose and we are so glad we started our Hanoi stay with her tour

It's a joke. Horrendous, worst experience I've had in a long time.. Call me a freak but I was anxiously waiting for the tour to finish to go back home and write this review. This is definitely not a food tour, there's very little if anything about food. If you are a foodie or have a slight interest about food you will waste your money and most of all your precious time in Hanoi. If you know nothing about food all you gonna get is a few dishes that have nothing to do with delicious vietnamese cuisine. The places are random, really random and level of organisation is non existing. The guide is saying irrelevant things about eg. how you can get scammed by taxi drivers rather than anything food related. It's not like I didn't know what I'm getting on a plate as being in Vietnam for a couple of days and doing a bit of reading I knew very well, but hey... saying 'this is bun cha it's very famous in hanoi, oh really how come you know it already?' just doesn't do the job. The guide was friendly but certainly with no interest or knowledge about food. Leave alone the fact that being a vegetarian you'll hardly get to eat anything. I got some sort of noodles with leftovers of crab in it and wasn't even told what was it supposed to be?It pays to do your research and pay double or even triple and leave with a full belly and knowledge.I seriously think I would have given a better tour in Hanoi only after doing a little bit of research online. I gave it a shot as I was thinking 70$ for a food tour is way too much but now I so regret I haven't put down the money for a real experience.It's not fun, it's not organised, it's not infomative.. oh I could go on about it for ages. Just don't waste your time.

Great food and experience. I went on the street food tour a couple weeks ago, and it was a lot of fun! There are tons of food places in the Old Quarter of Hanoi, but there's so much to choose from it can almost be overwhelming. The tour was a great way to get to try a lot of different kinds of food in places I may not have otherwise visited. Our guide, Vi, and her trainee were both really friendly and knowledgeable, as well. As other reviews have pointed out, you could get the food itself for way less than the amount you're paying, but the real allure is having the tour guide to navigate the streets and give you some information about all the different foods.

A great experience. Fantastic time with our guide Cherry who was fun, professional and very informative. Tons of really interesting food, you won't leave hungry! Places that you probably wouldn't normally go anywhere near but they do have excellent food. Don't have a big lunch if you're coming in the evening!

Fast before you feast!. Just back from a street food extravaganza led by the enthusiatic and knowledgeable guide Daisy. A real mix of sweet and savoury street food delights, none of which we had tried before. Many of the eateries were off the beaten track and as tourists we would never have found these hidden gems. An all round fantastic experience, which represented good value (considering how much food we consumed!). Highly recommended as an immersion into Vietnamese cuisine.
Great time and food. Really enjoyed our tour and learning about the street food of Hanoi. Ms. Moon was our guide and she was great and made sure we all had fun and left with a full tummy.

Great time exploring Hanoi with Pixie. My friends and I started out our trip in Hanoi with a walking food tour with Pixie. Not only was the food amazing but the experience was unlike any other. Pixie was an absolute delight - her English was great and she did a wonderful job explaining each dish and making sure we knew what we were eating. She also gave us some insight into Vietnamese life! I would definitely recommend this tour. It ended up raining pretty hard when we started out but we got some ponchos and just kept going! Just remember, it's street food so don't expect high end restaurants!

Delicious!! Kiwi is an Awesome Guide :-). My wife and I booked the group tour for our evening meal, the tour was best thing we did in Hanoi and the food was soooo delicious, Kiwi was an awesome guide taking us to 7/8 different places. Most of the places were little small local spots that you would probably not find on your own. They are also tuning the tour to your individual requirement, my wife does not eat beef so was given a variation of the salad minus the beef and as I do not drink coffee, I was given iced tea. Some others also had more strict dietary requirements and were very nicely looked after. Very thoughtful and for some people probably reassuring to know. I highly recommend the tour as a fantastic way to take a dinner in Hanoi.

Fun and tasty evening. Great introduction to Vietnamese street food, the culture and the Old Quarter. My husband and I pre-booked for 25$ each. It was worth it. Sure you can get cheaper food going by your own but our guide Donut took us places we would not have found ourselves. With very short time in Hanoi we got to taste a lot of different courses. The food was high quality all around, we tasted everything and had no stomach issues later.Our guide Donut was great, we had a fantastic evening with tasty food, knowledge, fun and laughter. Highly recommend to take the tour one of the first day in Hanoi but go hungry!

Great way to get your head around Hanoi street food. My girlfriend & I joined a group tour in the evening with Daisy. It was our second night in Vietnam and we were still orientating ourselves with the sheer choice of food available to us in Hanoi. The tour was perfect to start honing in some specific dishes - which we then ate more of during the rest of our trip. Daisy was super enthusiastic and great company for the evening along with all the other travellers. Would recommend as one of the first things you do!

Must-do activity while in Hanoi. My wife and I booked a private evening dinner tour and couldn't have been happier with the experience. We arrived at the office as scheduled, were treated professionally and met our guide Sunny. From there we were taken on a three-hour adventure to taste the incredible street cuisine of Hanoi. We dined at places off the beaten path that we'd have never visited otherwise, and were filled up with sumptuous food that defied the often modest surroundings. Sunny was a superb guide combining both a warm personality and keen knowledge of the cuisine. She made the tour feel special, and from the moment we started we knew we were in good hands. This is an must-do activity while in Hanoi that should be enjoyed by all visitors.

Delicious Hanoi. Cherry was a fantastic guide and the selection of different good stops was a nice mix of sit downs plates and on the go snacks. It really helped us figure out what we liked. I came away with two favs: sexy papaya salad and spring rolls

Awesome tour despite the wild weather!!. We had a brilliant tour around the busy streets of Hanoi, tasting many of the iconic dishes of the region. Our guide Sunny was very friendly and knowledgeable and really added to the experience, we also managed to take in some famous sites of the city between dishes. The weather was pretty wild with pouring rain but this didn't stop Sunny from giving it 100%. Thanks for an awesome day.

Absolutely fantastic. This was undoubtedly one of the highlights of our tour of Vietnam. Miss Moon was our guide and she was amazing. She made the tour so much fun! I would definitely recommend this tour.

Experience Hidden Hanoi. We visited eating places that you would never find on your own. Known only to the locals, these establishments were down dark alleyways, up back stairs and genuinely hidden away from the tourists. They were also packed to the rafters, amazingly diverse and an experience not to be forgotten. The food was surprising and delicious, the people were welcoming and warm and the tour guide was knowledgeable and entertaining. It is a must for anyone who wants to experience the local cuisine. It gave us a whole new perspective on the market.
Amazing evening with Mia . It our first time in Hanoi thank you Mia for the cool evening ever she show us around Hanoi we ate a lot of food it our first experience and we love it

Great Tour. There were only the two of us on the tour as well as our driver guides, two girls from Hanoi. They were super friendly and nice. The pick up at the hotel worked perfect and we had a great evening riding through the city and trying different foods.We did a number of scooter tours during our trip through south East Asia (in Saigon, Phnom Penh, Siem Reap and Hanoi). All of them were great as the let you experience a city much better then from a tour bus but this one was definitely one of the best we had.Our guides were very professional and drove us around town safely but at the same time treated us like friends. It was also very nice to talk to them and learn a little bit about life in Hanoi as a local. One of them was working at a bank during the day, and also doing cooking classes.No need to be afraid siting on the back of a motorbike in the crazy traffic all the food even from the smallest food stalls is safe and clean. We had no problems so no need to be afraid here either.

So full and so good!!. Amazing!!!!! The tour was amazing. We were already in Vietnam for 2 weeks before we did the tour so had already had a lot of vietnamese food but this tour was still well worth it! The food was delicious we had a really great guide (Miss Moon) who provided really good explanation of the food and the area. Loved it!!

Amazing guides. We had an anazing tour through Hanoi's Old Quarter. 7 stops with amazing snacks and Vietnam specialties.The tour guide Daisy/Thao was kind, cute and awesome at introducing us to the food and its histories in Vietnam.Time for eating waa.more than enough and you could ask for more dishes if you want to. Amazing.day with my girlfriend with this tour.

Love the food. Youll find numerous assortments of bun cha on road corners. Individuals sit on asphalts on plastic seats eating. Its ordinarily around a dollar or 2 for bun cha and accompanies a serving of plate of mixed greens with mint and some lime to press over. Scrumptious.

Love the food. Youll find numerous assortments of bun cha on road corners. Individuals sit on asphalts on plastic seats eating. Its ordinarily around a dollar or 2 for bun cha and accompanies a serving of plate of mixed greens with mint and some lime to press over. Scrumptious.

Great food and fun night!. We did the night tour. A great night, 6 or 7 different food stops, all with delicious local cuisine. We took photos of the names so we could go back other times. We didn't get sick from any of the food and definitely wouldn't have been brave enough to go to some of the places on our own before the tour! No need to book ahead, just show up a bit before the leaving time.
Good guide!. Our guide was Phoenix, she was very good for us. Thank you! Food was also really really tasty. I recommend it.

Excellent tour. We did the 7pm tour and it was really great: 3 hours of amazing food in authentic local restaurants passing by streets one would not even notice if walking alone. At the end we had to give up as we could not eat any more. The tour also included desserts and a very nice Vietnamese coffee at the end. Our guide - Cherry - was not only truly sweet but also very interesting. Try to book with her! Highly recommended.

Brilliant. Definitely recommend this tour!A great introduction to Vietnamese food which helped us for our whole trip. Also a super way to get to know some really good food spots for the rest of your time in Hanoi - to go back to and enjoy more food from their menus.So much wonderful food - each stop was more delicious than the last!A highlight was our guide, Ms Moon. She was so knowledgeable and shared loads of information on Vietnamese food, culture and language and some wonderful personal stories, many of which had us all in stitches laughing.

So much good food. We decided to book a private tour as to be honest we don't like waiting or listening to other touristy people. We did the night food tour on motorbikes with Money and Sam. It was fun and we got to see parts of Hanoi we probably wouldn't have gone to. The food was very nice and of a good variety. By the end we were so full and couldn't eat another bite. Great way to taste and see the best of Hanoi. And by going on bikes it's not as hot. Highly recommended.

lod colnial French quaters hanoi. fantastic vibrant , street food after 5 pm so much to chose from fu of locsl people speaks for it self , frienfly , they enjoy there food and a beer young and old mix together no gender age discimination like the west , every body friendly you share tables with every body , local office workers , night life bars are available ,

Wonderful. After reading the reviews, we booked this tour upon arrival in Hanoi and spent our first evening wandering through the city with our delightful and charming guide, Kiwi. As others have noted, it was an excellent way to learn about Vietnamese cuisine and to sample a variety of tasty dishes. The food was plentiful, so much so that we could not eat the last 1 or 2 dishes because we were too full. I recommend that you pace yourselves and if you have a small appetite like me, do NOT eat everything at each stop. For the tour operator, it would be helpful if people could opt for smaller sizes, as we did not want to waste anything. The highlight of this tour was Kiwi, who shared personal stories, historical anecdotes, and information about each dish with excellent knowledge and genuine charm and sincerity. This is $20 well-spent!

Great experience. We did the walking food tour, which came out to be around $19/person I think. We were in a group of 4 with an amazing guide - Phoenix. We walked around the Old Quarter and ate at 6 or 7 places. This is a great experience for newcomers to Hanoi - we had no idea that most of these restaurants existed, as you have to walk through a small entrance or door which opens up to seating inside. The food was great, we were taken to some of the best places for each dish. There was a crab soup (bun rieu cua) place that we ended up eating at 3x during our stay, it was so good. Phoenix was very knowledgeable about the foods and how they are prepared, which was very informative. She also gave us a lot of general information about Hanoi and the culture, answered any questions we had, and was hilarious. Loved our tour.

Such a fun trip with Moon!. This tour is a must-do if you're a foodie! You spend the day tasting vietnamese food and drink, get to see the main sights and ask your tour guide questions you have about Vietnam. Moon was a really great guide, spoke perfect English and was so funny! We had a blast!

a great introduction to Vietnamese food. If your like me, then you are probably going to be overwhelmed with the Vietnamese cuisine and what to make sure not to miss out on. So i thought this would be a great crash course on Ha Noi's special and beloved dishes. You are to meet them at their office which is where the street food tour will begin. Ms. Vi, our guide allowed us to taste 6-8 different dishes around Ha Noi such as Bun Cha, che, bahn mi and egg coffee to name a few. She would give us information on the foods, the culture, history etc. crossing the streets with Ms.Vi was something else. She gave us this code: sticky rice, which meant we needed to stick close together when crossing the roads- she was funny in a weird way. All the foods tasted were yummy! a great way to spend a day in Ha Noi!

Vi is a wonderful guide!. We booked a private tour so we could go at our own pace and have some quiet after the bustle of a few days in Hanoi. Vi was non-intrusive, informative and we loved her gentle humour. Food was great and it was a really enjoyable evening.

Amazing . Walking food tour was amazing despite the stormy weather. Lots of fun with great bunch of people and a fantastic guide Kiwi. So much food! Variety of places, many which we wouldn't have otherwise tried!

A great way to begin your trip!!. The restaurant scene in Hanoi can be quite overwhelmed so we booked the 6pm tour on the first night of our trip. We had the most lovely young lady called Vi, who looked after us all evening and took us to the most interesting places to try the local street food. We would never have ventured into some of the places she took us had she not been with us. We spent about 3 hours with her and it was so interesting not only learning about the food but also her culture and way of life. She was great with our teenage boys too. We visited about 6/7 local places trying different sweet,savoury dishes and also drinks.....we loved every minute and would highly recommend this tour. Thank you for making it great Vi!!

Great tour, awesome guide Vi!!!. We loved our guide Vi, very sweet and kind. We got rained on and she bought us ponchos! We went to 7 different places and the food was delicious!! She did a great job of explaining all the food and how the Vietnamese eat it!!Great tour!!

Amazing tour. We had Cherry as our tour guide and she was brilliant. It is a great tour taking you to eateries you likely wouldn't normally go to. All the food was amazing and Cherry explained a lot about Vietnamese culture along the way. Well worth the money.

Fantastic Tour. One of our favourite things we did in Vietnam. We took this tour on our second day and it was fantastic thing to do at the beginning of the trip so as to know what to eat. All the food was fantastic. We had a private tour for 8 people and our tour guide Lily was just one of the nicest people we met on our entire trip. We had such great fun with her. She had superb eglish and she was well able for our sense of humour. I think the tour took around 4 and a half/5 hours in total and we visited 8 places. She brought us to some amazing restaurants and we forgot to mention when booking that one of the group was vegetarian and she quickly changed the route to accommodate this. One of our group was also quite sick due to room much fun the night before in some local pubs and Lily was so kind and even brought her to a pharmacy and ordered special food for her to help her stomach. If you book this tour you have to ask for Lily, she will just make it.

Amazing even with the rain!!. We had Sunny as our guide and she was fantastic. She provided lots of information and was very engaging and friendly. There was plenty of foods to try and there was nothing we had we didn't love. The weather turned about halfway through but our guide dealt with it amazingly ensuring we were comfortable and enjoying our trip. Thank you Sunny for a wonderful experience we can't wait to come back and do it again.

A Must when visiting Hanoi. We had booked the Walking Street Food Tour for our first night in the old quarter of Hanoi, as we thought that it would be an excellent way to start our visit to Hanoi, and get to know the old quarter. We were met at our hotel by our guide Nathan, and joined by two other couples. Within a few minutes walking we had no idea where we were, as the streets were so narrow, and there were so many turnings. However, Nathan obviously knew where he was, and led us to a succession of small “local restaurants” serving typical local dishes. The places were all quite small, and in some cases we finished up sitting on small plastic chairs.I cannot remember the names of all of the different dishes we ate, but by the time Nathan took us back to our hotel, we were both very tired, and very full! It was certainly an excellent way to start our stay in Hanoi, and we enjoyed it very much.

The Best Tour for Foodies in Hanoi. This tour was a great way for us to see Hanoi - such a busy and chaotic city.We arrived in Hanoi without a scheduled tour and planned on seeing the city ourselves. We realized quickly that it's hard to know where to go. We found Hanoi Street Food Tour on TripAdvisor and chose it based on its overwhelmingly good reviews. We were not disappointed.For people who love food and want to try authentic, non-touristy Hanoi street food safely, this is a great choice. Hanoi Street Food offers scheduled group tours and private tours. Because of our schedule we chose to do a private tour. We met our guide Kiwi at 9 am outside their office in the Old Quarter and started our visit to eight or nine food stops. We had a different dish at each restaurant and were able to learn from Kiwi about the dish, the restaurant and some interesting information about daily Vietnamese life.As we walked around the city, Kiwi explained different things that people were cooking and doing on the street. She also helped us learn how to cross Hanoi's motorbike packed streets.We loved the street food tour and especially our wonderful guide, Kiwi. We would recommend choosing Hanoi Street Food Tour (and we've already been doing so to other tourists we meet).

So cool !. Cherry was a very good guide !!! Very good experience in Hanoi. I discover delicious vietnam food and new streets. I really recommend this tour to eat well and discover Hanoi by night.
Happy !!!

An absolute recommendation.. We started our Vietnam trip in Hanoi and decided to immediately do a Street Food Tour with Kim's Tours. It was one of the most fun evenings that we had during our holiday. You'll be introduced to a wide variety of delicious Vietnamese specialties (make sure you're hungry!) while in company of other travellers and a great and knowledgable guide. The best 20 dollars we spent in Hanoi!
Street Food in the Afternoon . We had so much fun! Miss Moon was a great guide...super knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. I think I'm still full. - TBG

Delicious, informative and fun!. Miss Moon, a Hanoi local, was a friendly, super knowledgeable, and organized host to the best of Hanoi street food around the Old Quarter. We loved it so much that we're taking our friend on the nighttime tour when we stop back in Hanoi in a few weeks!

"A-Moon-zing" Vegetarian Street Food Tour with Ms Moon!. My wife and I did a private vegetarian walking tour with Ms Moon and it was so fun. We had been a little frustrated with navigating the street food scene in Hanoi as vegetarians and this tour opened up so many delicious options to us that we probably never would have even known about, let alone try. And Moon was a hilarious, educational, wonderful guide. She made it very fun. We barely ate breakfast before our midday tour and we were absolutely stuffed afterwards so leave room for the event! Highly recommended!

Great Way to Try New Food and See the City. This tour was one of our highlights in Hanoi. The tour guide, Kiwi, was awesome and very knowledgeable. We had an awesome time walking around, checking out old Hanoi and trying some truly awesome street food. The value for the money as exceptional, considering all we got to eat and drink. If you're on the fence about doing this, take my advice and do it, it's a ton of fun. One small bit of advice I would give to the tour operators is that they should provide a printed card featuring the names of the foods sampled during the tour. It would be a nice thing to keep and reference back to. Overall, it's an awesome tour and I'd certainly do it again!

Vegetarian street food tour. Great tour which introduced us to food we would not have tried. Being vegetarian we have not tried the street food till now as we were not sure what was in it. Our guide Vi took us to many places to try all sorts of food and she provided lots of detail on how things are made. A must do in Hanoi.

Food perspectives. We were a group of 6 with 4 adults and 2 teenagers and had a most insightful street food tour. We had the most terrific guide - Anh. Translated as Sunshine. And Anh was a real burst of sunshine shedding light on Hanoi and Vietnam through the perspective of food. We appreciated having our own private guide and starting at 5.30 pm meant we enjoyed the twilight hours into early evening. I'll leave what we had to eat a surprise but we were nicely sustained throughout the tour. We covered many of Hanoi's major sights and I particularly enjoyed tasting some of the more exotic fruits sold on the street. Mangosteens, green oranges and custard apples. Anh was the most friendly and inspiring guide. Felt like we had made a new friend. A real highlight of our trip.

Great day tour!. We booked a private city tour and street food tour. It's very well organized. Guide picked us at the hotel, visiting museum of ethnology, Uncle Ho's Mosoleum, Temple of literature. Then walking tour to visit the old quarter and have some street food. Our guide was very professional and informative. Foods were excellent. Best experience ever!

Back alleys and cooking with the locals - we loved it!. Sunny was such a brilliant guide, and took our two boys (aged 6 and 8) under her wing. Enthralled in her attention they happily tried everything for dinner from dried beef salad to rice pancakes to 3 different noodle soups to back rice pudding. This is a fantastic way to see an otherwise hidden part of Hanoi and enjoy some amazing food as well - we will be back for the lunch time tour!

Awesome!. We did this tour with Vi and she was great! She made sure we got he best food items at all the stops, taught us how to eat it like locals and took care of our dietary restrictions! A great way to experience street food in Hanoi!

Scooters and food...brilliant!. My 15 year old daughter and I did the 3 hour evening food tour by scooter and it was absolutely fantastic. It was so thrilling to be on the back of the scooters weaving through the Old Quarter of Hanoi and the food was delicious. Our food guide was called Money and she was great. She gave us lots of information about the various dishes and Vietnam. Big thanks to Sam and Num too. We felt totally safe and as ease as they drove us around. I would highly recommend this tour.

Hanoi street food walking tour. Took this tour today at 11 o'clock with Ms Moon and had a fantastic time. Ms Moon was easy to understand, was great company and very informative about the food around Hanoi. The food itself was delicious and there was much of it! The small walks (no more than 5-10 minutes) in between vendors helped a little bit in settling the 'food baby'. You definitely do not need to eat breakfast beforehand! Thank you so much Ms Moon, I had a wonderful time!

Amazing local insight. We did the lunch time tour with Miss Moon and it was really enjoyable. Some places we visited we would have never found on our own, particularly the Restaurant Banyan Tree that's been in the family for 4 generations. A great range of food to sample from and we had a nice group who enjoyed everything she selected for us. A highlight was street vendor who made coconut and caramelised sugar cane rolls.... and the egg coffee, together with the explanation of how it was made, but everything was delicious. We certainly didn't need an evening meal!
Mandy . We did this tour tonight with Phoenix and all l can say is thank you, what a great guide, so much information. The food was fantastic and so was the group. Strongly recommend this tour

Highly recommend tour with Mia”. We booked the 5 pm the Hanoi Street Food Tour And it was the best way to approach the Old Quarter, which can be chaotic and confusing at first.Mia, our tour guide, introduced us to things we had never tried before and places we wouldn't dare try on our own. We visited around 10 places all over the Old Quarter, some of the places were outside on those little plastic chairs and some were inside old places with little to no ambience but delicious food. We got to taste so many good things. Our tour guide was so sweet, warm, welcoming, knowledgeable. She goes above and beyond in hospitality.Mia spoke great English, explained how to eat the different dishes, gave the background of many of the foods, shared with us fun facts about the city, and wrote down all the places we visited with a few more options to try during our stay!I highly recommend making this tour on your first afternoon or night in Hanoi
Great Introduction to Street Food in Hanoi. We did this tour on the first day we arrived and had a great time. We went back to the same street food vendors over and over.

Amazing tour with Vi. We had a great time on this tour, especially thanks to our guide, Vi, who was extremely nice, fun, and informative. We booked the 6:30 pm tour on our first night in Hanoi for $20 each and were completely satisfied with everything. It is the best way to approach the Old Quarter, which can be caotic and confusing at first. In the following days we went back to eat in some of the places we tried. I highly recommend this to anyone in Hanoi!

Fun walking tour. Booked this at the last minute and even though we missed out initial tour we were able to reschedule another tour as we were an hour late. Lily took us out and the streets were super hectic but she managed to maneuver us safely through to all the different venues. Really enjoyed bun cha and also the desserts. Lily is hilarious and I especially enjoyed her marital advice and anecdotes of why beer is ok for kids Lolz. Hope to return one day ! Thank you from Samoa!

Amazing food, fantastic guide. Anh was our guide, she was unbelievably good and passionate about all of the food. It was a pleasure to share in her favourite dishes and learn so much about Vietnamese food culture. Every single dish was more delicious than the last. One of the highlights of my time in Vietnam! I'd almost do it again

Ok, but nothing special. Probably ok if you're new to eastern/Vietnamese food, otherwise I wouldn't recommend it. Rather stop at one or two of these restaurants on your own. The guide spoke very poor English, could hardly understand what she was saying. Seemed unecperienced.

Must do to see the real Hanoi. This was the best way to see Hanoi. You do a lot of walking but worth it. You get to see everyday life. The duck egg fetus was gross and confronting but the rest was good. Particularly enjoyed smashing some Bia Ha Noi with our tour guide. Awesome!

Excellent introduction to Hanoi Old Quarter and Vietnamese Food. My family & I (including 2 children aged 10 & 14) loved this tour. We thought we knew Vietnamese food but our wonderful guide Cherry introduced us to things we had never tried before and places we wouldn't dare try on our own - and it was all wonderful. Cherry was enthusiastic and knowledgeable (not just about the food but also about Hanoi). Even the pouring rain didn't detract from the experience - Cherry gave us plastic capes and it just added to the atmosphere. Highly recommend.

English couple travelling with 19 year old twins and 16 year old. When there's western food on offer trying to get teenagers to try the local cuisine is tricky especially as we had no idea what to order. On advise of fellow tourist couple we booked a food street tour at late notice and it was excellent. Our guide named Vi made the whole thing informative but more importantly great fun! She engaged with the teenagers in excellent English and kept them entertained for three hours as they happily tried all sorts of dishes. There's no pressure to eat everything it's just a fun way to learn more more about the food and culture ! Definitely recommend.

great time with great guide. we recommend this food tour in the old quarter of hanoi and the guide we had ,Duc, was great to talk to with heaps of interesting facts about the food we were eating and his culture and country. We had a great night!
Excellent.. This guided food tour was a great sampling of what the Hanoi food scene has to offer. Lily was our tour guide, and she did a wonderful job! Most importantly, we did not get sick.

Old Quarter Street Food Tour was the highlight of my trip!. I highly recommend making this one of the first things you do upon arriving in Hanoi or anywhere in Vietnam, for that matter! Vietnam has some of the most delicious, fresh and exquisite food to be explored and savored and this is the perfect way to dive in and find out so much more than you could if you just chose a restaurant with good reviews.Being a solo traveler, I was lucky because I was able to simply and easily join a group of others without a reservation or much planning at all. I'd read up a bit on TripAdvisor and Kim's Tours was conveniently near to my place. So about an hour after arriving into Hanoi and setting my bags down in my room, I phoned and they said to just come on over. I came, a few minutes past the time I was suppose to and was added to a lovely, well-balanced group of people. I am not personally overly-fond of group tours such as this, but I think we all lucked out with this particular group. There was a lovely family of 5 from Denmark, a fellow female solo traveler from Holland, and a brother and sister from the US who had reunited for a trip together in Vietnam after several years of absence, due to his deployment over seas for the US military. And, of course, worth honorable mention was our wonderful tour guide, Ms Moon, who adorably referred to herself in 3rd person throughout our 3 hour tour and absolutely charmed us with her endearing genuineness, sense of humor and a wealth of relevant information on both the food and Old Quarter! She was such a delight and we all loved her!We started our tour in what I consider the very best place: Bun Cha Ta. The place smelled intoxicatingly of lemongrass and the food was ridiculously divine! Bun cha is now my favorite Vietnamese dish: It's barbecued pork in a hot broth. They bring a plate of noodles out on the side which Ms.Moon instructed us to add into the soup. Then there was a large bowl of the freshest yummiest herbs which you add at your leisure and taste to the bowl as you eat it. You can also add rice vinegar and hot hot chilies. It had all the complexity and goodness people rave about when talking about Vietnamese food! From there, we visited about 11 more places all over the Old Quarter. Some of the places were outside on those lil plastic chairs that you always hear about, some were inside old divey places with little to no ambience but delicious food, none-the-less and some were in lil restaurants like Bun Cha Ta. We got to taste so many good things, I was absolutely on cloud 9! If you're in Hanoi, do yourself a favor and make this one of your first priorities!

Best way to experience Vietnamese street food. Our tour guide was nicknamed Mango and she was fantastic - friendly, knowledgable, entertaining, she brought us to the best places to sample Vietnamese street food and really made the tour one of the highlights of our visit to Hanoi

Great introduction to Vietnamese food. My wife and I had a great time. Our guide brought us to seven different places. Each meal that we had was delicious and we highly commend the three hour walking tour!

Brilliant . There were 8 of us doing this tour and Lily was our guide. She was absolutely brilliant and hilarious. We ate in 8 different places. We did this on our 2nd day to Vietnam so we would have an idea of what we liked and didn't like to eat. Was a great idea and we discovered some lovely dishes like Bun Cha and Papaya Salad. Highly recommend.

Amazing experience!. We were taken to 6 different street food stops by our guide, Kiwi - who was absolutely amazing. She explained every dish we ate at each of the stops, and was charming and helpful throughout (she kept us entertained with some of her stories about Vietnamese tradition!). The food was fantastic and portions sizes were not too large at each stop (you will be full at the end of the tour though!). We wish we had done a tour of Vietnamese food at the beginning of our trip, and not at the end, so take my advice and do a food tour first, as it will provide you with lots of hints and tips for eating out in Vietnam. This tour is highly recommended!

Great way to start your stay in Hanoi Old Quarters. We met at the Kims Tours building and were put into groups of 6-8 people. We were lucky to be grouped with Kiwi! Kiwi is charismatic, energetic, kind, and fun! Most importantly she got us around Old Quarter safely and filled our bellies with delicious foods! We highly recommend this tour. Our guide spoke great English, explained how to eat the different dishes, gave the background of many of the foods, shared with us fun facts about the city, and wrote down all the places we visited with a few more options to try during our stay!

Bun cha. Youll find many varieties of bun cha on street corners. People sit on pavements on plastic chairs eating. Its usually about a dollar or 2 for bun cha and comes with a serving of salad with mint and some lime to squeeze over. Delicious.

Amazing! . We had Cherry as our tour guide and she was fantastic. I am a vegetarian and was nervous that I wouldn't get to try a lot of street food but instead I was accommodated everywhere I went! The food, company I was with and Cherry led to a great experience! Please do this, you won't regret it!

Best value walking tour. I decided to add a street food walking tour to my itinerary because, in my experience, street food can be hard to experience properly on your own - you simply have no idea what to get or what to do with it. You get picked up from your hotel by cyclo, which is pretty awkward, but maybe you will find being conspicuously pedaled around fun:). During the course of the evening we tried about 6 or 7 different places, and our guide Sunny (who had an excellent command of English) took us a fruit vendor to try various tropical fruits - which I appreciated because I mentioned I have never tried a mangosteen. The food was delicious, accompanied by helpful commentary from Sunny. At the very end, we tried the famous egg coffee and rice wine that came from a coconut and tasted super yummy (unlike straight up rice wine which tastes like pure alcohol). I paid a fraction of what I paid for a food tour in Saigon, but it was just as good. Highly recommended, even if you think you know a lot about Vietnamese food.

So much fun!. We just finished a 3 hour scooter tour with Phoenix and the girls. This was so much fun! We tried an amazing array of local food; delicacies which we wouldn't otherwise know to try. The girls are great riders and I felt especially safe with Ruby. I would definitely recommend this food tour to anyone interested in experiencing Hanoi through the stomach of a local! Thumbs up!

Great way to experience Hanoi. My first day in Vietnam and my 4 hour sightseeing and food tour with host Money was brilliant. A great start to the holiday to experience the culture, food and learn about the history of Vietnam. Money was knowledgable, friendly and great company for the day. The food was great and the sights were really interesting. I felt safe on the back of the bike and much preferred to be riding the streets rather than walking! Definitely recommend. Egg coffee is delicious!

Great fun in Hanoi and a really nice way to see what you never could on your own. I went on an evening tour--though they are offered at lunch, too. Many different tour operators offer this tour; I booked mine through my hotel. I had a wonderful time--though I overate; go hungry.The tour lasted 3 hours and we stopped at 6 or 7 restaurants.The guide spoke wonderful English.

Well worth your time Food Tour!!!!. This food tour is absolutely worth your time in Hanoi. It'll give you an overall learning experience of Vietnamese cuisine, and it worked out great for my brother and I who only had two days to experience Hanoi. Our guide was Miss Moon, she was stupendous and I recommend her without reservation. During every stop she would explain the different foods, it's uses, how to eat it, any backdrop story it has, how it relates to Vietnamese culture, etc, she was on point with everything. It was a great experience to try all the savory and sweet foods, from fried spring rolls, Pho, fruit compote with coconut milk, beef noodles, and so forth. I feel it gave us a worthwhile experience of all the flavors we could possibly experience in Vietnamese cuisine. It'll be a worthwhile experience, learn about the amazing dishes of this culture while meeting great people from all over the world. The tour ends with a tasty Vietnamese sandwich, a beer and a delicious Egg Yolk Coffee. We couldn't wait to review the Food Tour and Miss Moon so highly!Forewarned, there is a lot of walking (and eating, of course), so be prepared for a great mini adventure around Hanoi city, this activity certainly isn't for the sedentary lifestyle folks. Also, this food tour has all sorts of meat, dairy, and peanuts....So, for those who are vegetarian or vegan, I recommend discussing this with the Food Tour representatives beforehand to see if something can be worked out as well. Overall, I loved the experience my brother and I had with the Food Tour! I would do it again and ask for Miss Moon, what a delightful experience!

A fun way to experience Hanoi. We did the 3 hour scooter tour.Our guide was Phoenix and she was very social, personable, knowledgable and I felt very safe driving with her as did my husband with his driver.We visited 5 different venues and sampled 8 different dishes. It was a nice variety of venues and dishes sampled.The drive over the bridge was a highlight.My only suggestion would be to offer a handout at the end with the recipes of the dishes we tried. Having something to take away at the end of the night would be nice to offset the price.

Walking Tour. We did this on our last day in Hanoi. Our guide was Drep also known as Sticky Rice.The tour was fun as the people on it were very easy to talk to. The main selling point of the tour was the location of the food stalls where we ate the different courses. We would never had ventured into them as they looked very questionable but the food was tasty.Sadly the variety was not great in terms of what alternatives were available. My girlfriend does not eat red meat so there was a lot she could not try and most dishes were just given without meat (no substitutes like pork available).Nonetheless, I would recommend it if you have not tried Vietnamese food but don't expect weird food, for example tarantulas like we had in Cambodia.

Nice experience. We had a wonderful evening with the nicest Vietnamese we met in two weeks. Young tour guide named Kiwi, introduced us through local food gems, local folks and culture. We spent 3.5 hours with Kiwi and enjoyed every minute. We tasted about 12 dishes from different places and at the end she recommended us a few more places to visit.
Well worth it. Our tour guide cherry was amazing, very enthusiastic, funny and spoke very good english. The tour is well worth the money but make sure you don't eat lunch before

A splash of Sunshine. If you have a choice, ask for Sunshine (Anh) as your guide. She is extremely knowledgeable, funny and generous with her time and attention.We had a blast tasting amazing food and going into places we didn't even realise were restaurants

Ngo Ha made us feel welcome!. Our tour guide Ngo Ha was very cute, outgoing and open. She spoke excellent English and seemed genuinely interested in us and our wellbeing. We felt like we made a new friend today, which is quite unique when travelling in a new and foreign country! She taught us a lot about vietnamese culture, she shared her own personal stories as well as some of her political views, she showed us where to find the best authentic vietnamese food and everything we had was delicious! I was happy we got to try the tea and sunflower seeds which seem popular among the vietnameese. We also learned a few vietnamese phrases such as "êm yêu anh", (I love you), xin chaô (Hello) and "tạm biệt" (Bye) and "Tên tôi là" (My name is"). She also suggested we keep contact on Facebook which we hope to do! All in all a wonderful day !

An enjoyable evening. We did the food tour on our second night in Hanoi. There was a good range of food and it was nice to try the local specialities of Hanoi. There was heaps of food and you left nice and full. The staff were very friendly and accommodating.Would highly recommend this on a trip to Hanoi as it is a great way to see some sights while tasting some delicious food!

Amazing food with great guide!!. I went on the street food tour yesterday with a group of friends and we all had a great time. The food was amazing and our guide Mango was lovely and and made sure we were all well looked after. I would happily do this tour again.

Must Do Hanoi. We went on the street food tour at 17h00, which takes around 3 hours and costs 460th vdn (20€).It's was a really great experience and our guide MIA was amazing. You will eat in places that you would not even think about entering without the street food tour, but the food in each of these places was really good. In the end we have been to 9 different places and really enjoyed the experience.Definitely recommend

Disappointing compared with other Food Tours in Vietnam. Sorry folks but our experience just didn't compare with other Food Tours we joined.Whilst we had a great guide (Sticky Rice) our expectations of the food quality & street food establishments didnt match reality.Its also a bit of a question mark when the guide doesn't actually join you for food in any of the eateries.So for us not the best of experiences & further didn't prevent us from other really enjoyable tours whilst in HCMC.

We'll worth it . I'm here with four adult boy's on vacation in Vietnam and had a day to kill so we booked a food tour from reading reviews on TripAdvisor. We all were not disappointed, our hostess was "Kiwi". She was the best and made it very enjoyable. The food was also delicious. We would have never got a chance to try all the variety of foods that she took us too. We also educated on some history of Hanoi which was a plus. We had a wonderful time, highly recommend. Thank you Miss Kiwi.

The perfect way to experience Hanoi. Ever wanted to try one of those little "hole-in-the-wall" restaurants, but were a little nervous about doing so? This is the perfect antidote. Our guide was "Cherry" and she was so enthusiastic about showing us around the Old Quarter, and introducing us to all kinds of foods, and places. The group size was 6 which allowed us all to become acquainted over the course of the evening. We stopped at 7 or 8 places and although the servings were small at each place, we were still stuffed by the time it ended. DO NOT eat first! There was lots of variety: soups, sandwiches, salads, rolls...We even got to try our hand at making those rice paper sheets that are then filled with meat or veggies. It's harder than it looks to pull a whole sheet, intact, off the griddle! It's great fun and I highly recommend Cherry as your guide.

Simply the best!! . My sister and I agree that this tour was the highlight of our time in Hanoi! Our amazing guide, Hannah, showed us so much more than the best eats and drinks around Hanoi.
