She taught us all about the culture and even taught us a little Vietnamese! Anyone looking for an all around stellar city tour should definitely consider this one!

Would go back and do it again. Definitely a must if you're in Hanoi and don't know how to spend your morning/evening. Miss Moon was our guide- super sweet, funny and knowledgable. I would probably never have visited some of the places had she not brought us there. Even though some of the places looked rather dodgy the food was superb and we ended up going back to some of the places the next few days.

Filling, delicious, and informative!. This was one of our favorite experiences in Hanoi, where the street food is crazy good but also intimidating for travelers. Lily took us around to a ton of hole-in-the-wall locations that we would have never found otherwise and ordered some of Hanoi’s most famous dishes, as well as lesser known delicious foods. We were completely stuffed after and actually took some food to go.

Lily is amazing!!!. What a great way to get your bearings in Hanoi! It was a great introduction to the layout of the city and the many wonderful foods available! Lily made the tour that much better! She was so friendly and knowledgeable! We enjoyed so many delicious foods and learned the right way to eat them! And they accommodated for vegetarians!!!!! Must do when in Hanoi!!

Great food, excellent tour guide. we went on this tour with our tour guide "Kiwi", she was funny, friendly and full of great tips for Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh. would highly reccomend this tour!we had 8 types of food and drink and loved it all.Thank you Kiwi!!
Hanoi street food tour . A great big thanks to bob. An amazing experience which was met with some trepidation nut results in a unbelievable experience.

Must do. Went on our first day in Hanoi. We did private tour for family of 4, $25 each. Or guide was Miss Moon who was excellent. Very good English and excellent at getting us around the old quarter walking and dodging the mopeds. She told us to 'sticky rice' ie stick close together which was then our holiday phase for the rest of the holiday. It was more than a street food tour but also a knowledgeable hanoi tour. It is a must do.

Hanoi streetfoodtour. THANK YOU MISS LILY! We booked a private tour and had the pleasure of meeting Lily. She was lovely, warm, friendly and knowledgable. We received a mini history lesson with our tour tour which was much appreciated. We walked the streets, that although seem very chaotic and dangerous with traffic, are quite safe and thrumming with family life. We are a family of 3, including an 11 year old. Not only was the food chosen for us delicious, the locations were varied from indoor to out door, and interspersed with little stories of the life and traditions of the people of Hanoi. Lily chose Hanoi specialties and foods from this area, while explaining to us the differences in the foods from region to region.Lily went out of her way to choose little tidbits that would appeal especially to my son, who although adventurous, is still an 11 year old kid. She ordered him special drinks and and was extremely thoughtful of his needs.I recommend Lily and this tour very highly. In fact, I would say that it is imperative to book this tour early in your visit to ensure your comfort and begin your love of this beautiful and delicious city.
Street food. Fascinating, loved the food.Very helpful guide. Perfectly safe for the whole family. Where taken to places we would never have ventured by ourselves

Amazing tour - highly recommended. I had one night in Hanoi on my own before joining a group tour so decided to do this tour, based mainly on other tripadvisor recommendations. My guide Cherry (Hien) was excellent. She took me to little out-of-the-way places that i would never have found on my own, but that served the most delicious, fresh food. I also ate all sorts of food that i wouldn't have dared to try and order on my own! Cherry explained how each dish is made and had lots of stories to tell about Hanoi, its food, people and history. She spoke perfect English and even managed to teach me some Vietnamese. I had a brilliant time - highly recommend this tour!

Be brave and don't ask. No the food off the street is safe and very tasty. I live in Vietnam and have never been sick in the four years I have been here. There is never any of the yucky thing if you don't looking for them and these are considered delicacies so they are more expensive anyway. Enjoy and be brave

Miss Moon is awesome :). Definitely come hungry for this delicious and informative tour. Miss Moon was so friendly, helpful, and funny! She was thoughtful about food restrictions and wanted to make sure each person on the tour was engaged and able to enjoy Hanoi street food. Variety of foods offered -- soup, banh mi, fried foods, fresh fruit, local beer and more. Definitely recommend!

These streets tours are awesome. Expect a helpful guide with lots of information about food and the city. Expect A LOT of food and don't plan too much for afterwards as you may be in a food coma. I will recommend this to anyone i know heading to Hanoi, its an awesome way to see the old qtr and get a grip on the local food.

Amazing introduction to Hanoi street food. You should really take this Tour on Your first day in Hanoi. We took a Tour with Sunny our fantastic guide! She took us to 7 different places where we tasted a variety of foods. Take a light lunch because You Will eat a lot! A nice introduction so You know What to get the rest of Your trip. About 20-25 dollar everything included.

Great Food and Company. Our Guide Mango did a great job of showing us the local foods of Hanoi. The tour took place predominantly around the Old Quarter, and varied from Sticky Rice, to Bahn Mi to Chatting Lemon Tea. Everything was explained in great detail, and Mango made it lots of fun, albeit the temperamental weather. Highly recommend joining in this fun evening.

Go hungry !!. So much food !! We could not fit anymore in our belly's !! We tried food from the street stalls , had ice cream , was some great tastes of Vietnam ! I recommend trying it all you will be surprised at what tastes good !!

Had the best time. We booked the tour on suggestion by a friend. It was great! The 3 of us were booked for the group tour but no one else booked (I can understand why as it was a very hot day) so it turned into a private tour.Miss Moon, our guide was very friendly and informative. She talked not only about the food but also about Vietnam, Hanoi and many other things (such as where to go for good bargains, activities around the area, etc.)We ate at places we would not have dared to had it not been for the tour. The selection of dishes were varied and each one selected to highlight the best food in Hanoi. The Vietnamese egg coffee was a pleasant surprise... it was sooo good! It was truly a great way to spend 3 hours and a bargain for $20. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hanoi.

The highlight of my trip!. As backpackers, this tour was a bit of a splurge for us, but at the recommendation of a friend we tried it, and it was the highlight of our whole trip! Our tour was done by the fantastic Mango, and we had very nice group of other travelers with us. The food was all fantastic (we went back for more the following night at our favorite places) and Mango balanced explaining what was in the food and how it was made, perfectly with a bit of background of Vietnamese history and culture. A must do for anyone visiting Hanoi!

Excellent night and great food. We did a night street food tour last week and it was great. Our guide Lily (Hue) was wonderful, her English was great and she explained everything very well. The food was excellent and a good way to try foods and see places that you otherwise wouldn't. Starve yourself beforehand though as there is a lot of food!

Highlight of Hanoi. Vietnam is known for great food but this tour finds it! So much fun and a great laughs. We had a guide called lily who was pure comedy ("same same, but different")! We got to try some cooking and adapted the tour to the group. Outstanding

Go with Mango!. Went on the 3 hour street food tour, my boyfriend is allergic to fish and I'm vegan - not exactly the ideal people to take on a food tour! Mango was super accommodating and helpful ensuring everything we ate was modified to suit. All the places we visited were places we would never stop at by ourselves - super authentic and top quality food. This is so much more than just a street food tour! We also got to see and hear a lot about Hanoi and the culture as well - Mango was an amazing guide - definitely ask for her if you can : )

Great Value! An amazing way to acquaint yourself with Hanoi. Lily, our tour guide was informative, spoke decent English and never hesitated to throw in a joke or two. As our group made our way through the old quarter, crossing the chaotic streets of Hanoi like "sticky rice", we stopped off at 8 locations sampling over 12 items. Lily introduced us to typical breakfast, lunch, dinner and snack foods, even having a few beers along the way. Highly suggest doing this tour at the start of your trip to Hanoi/Vietnam, worth every penny!

Great experience . This tour was excellent! The food was outstanding and allowed us to experience the famous Vietnamese street food without worrying about the risk of getting sick. Our guide Sunny was awesome - super friendly and happy to share her knowledge about other things to do in Hanoi. She even provided us with a list of all the places we went with addresses so we could go back (which we did). A great part of the Hanoi experience.

Amazing food tour. My friends and I went on this after a terrible start to our time in Hanoi and it totally redeemed the city! We had miss moon as our tour guide and she was wonderful. Full of useful knowledge not just about the food, but also about Hanoi and Vietnam. The food was delicious (some of the best we ate whilst out there) and we would never have gone to the places if we weren't on the tour. It was also amazing value for money. We were stuffed by the end of the tour. Definitely worth doing whilst in Hanoi.
Great!. This trip with the lovely guide Mango was so funny, interesting and the food was delicious. It was the best way to get to know the culture in the streets and corners of Hanoi!

Great experience . We booked this tour based on TripAdvisor and we enjoyed a great experience.Sunny our guide was a good laugh and great knowledge of the local foods.Some of the places they take you, you would never find on your own, some of the places are very questionable when it comes to hygiene. But we enjoyed the overall experience and would definitely recommend this tour to try the local cuisines.

Fabulous food tour with personality . Our guide Mango took us on the most fabulous 3.5 hours family of 5 persons street food tour across bustling Hanoi. We visited about 10 places with a large variety of taste and food types; she gave excellent insights to all what we saw and about Vietnam history and society in general - with high engagement, charm and personality in fluent English. Although a little pricy, worth every penny!

What a surprise!. We did not expect much but turned out it was full of surprise. Mia, our guide, was excellent and the food was really yummy. What a pity that we had a late afternoon tea and therefore could not finish all the dishes!

Delicious way to get to know local food :P. The tour is the best way to try local food in the crazy old quarter of Hanoi. I've always been afraid of eating on the street for sanitary reasons, but in this tour I felt "safe". I got to eat in small street restaurants (that otherwise I would never get inside) guided by Lily (Hue). If you like to taste local foods in your travels, this is the best way. A must do in Hanoi!
Great!!. This was my favourite thing we did in Hanoi, our guide Kiwi was lovely and very informative and the food was fantastic. A great way to walk the city and get a taste of a locals menu.

Very unique & inspiring tour with great guide named Mango. Perfectly organized & truly delicious local food and drinks in many lovely restaurants. Very caring and excellent guide (many thanks to Mango). Great evening & experience!

Same like all the other reviews - excellent. Like all the other reviews, don't eat breakfast before coming even if booking later in the day. Like others, miss moon was our guide and she was very friendly and knowledgeable on all the foods. Really good way to break in to Vietnamese food if you're afraid of diving right in to street food on your own. Save room for the banh my and egg coffee at the end. Only regret is that we didn't do the tour when we first arrived in Vietnam.

Excellent, Mango lovely! . Had a lovely evening strolling the streets of Hanoi savouring various foods and drinks and learning about the culture. Good variety, good pace and great foods. Mango was our guide and was lovely, so friendly and flexible and helpful. Would highly recommend - a must do in Hanoi. And early on in your trip so you have time to enjoy all the foods later. Possibly slightly expensive but I liked it as could trust where we eating was hygienic!

Perfect for the start in Vietnam . A very interesting tour with loads to eat and a very friendly tour guide (Sunny). You taste 7 different meals, all of them very nice. Some places you would never go as a tourist and there you get very tasty food. A must do thing especially for Vietnam beginners like we were!

So fun!. We had the pleasure of doing this tour with miss Moon (great and sweet tour guide) and a fun group of people. Miss Moon made our day so fun and showed us amazing places to eat street food. We discovered the best noodle soup in Vietnam because of her! Thank you Miss Moon!

A fantastic introduction to Hanoi. Our group of 12 people had a terrific time learning about Vietnamese culture and sampling a HUGE variety of food with Miss Moon---who could not have been a better hostess! She went out of her way to ensure that any food allergies (or hesitancies) were addressed at each stop, and was non-stop entertainment. I can be a bit picky with my food, but she ensured that each stop was not only delicious, but safe to eat as well. I tried numerous items that I would have never selected on my own, and all were excellent. Honestly, I would have never selected a food tour amongst my top five choices of 'what to do while in Hanoi', but don't make a mistake by missing this. It's the best deal you'll ever make for $20!

Moped food tour in the rain. Our family of five thoroughly enjoyed the food tour despite a torrential downpour half way through that lasted the best part of an hour, which threatened to cut short our tasting. However, our drivers (all women) were fantastic: they quickly found shelter then went off and bought us raincoats to help keep us dry. The rain somewhat spoiled the trip from our point of view, largely because the visibility in the rain was poor and there was a lot of water on the road, so this made for a more nervous ride from our point of view. However, the drivers coped admirably. As well as being expert riders, they were very friendly. Our guide was brilliant - very knowledgeable, great at explaining each dish and really personable. The food was delicious if a little 'safe': we didn't really feel that we tasted much that was different to what we had previously eaten in local restaurants. We would have liked at least one of the dishes to have been a bit more unusual. Overall, though, we would highly recommend the food tour.

Good - not overwhleming. Our guide Mia was amazing. She did a really good job in what must be a tough situation - crazy Hanoi, heat, humidity and trying to keep a group of wandering tourists together. Found it surprising that only one dish was actually eaten on the street though. All others were in dingy, HOT rooms upstairs or out the back. But maybe this is the norjm?We had about seven dishes but i thought it weird we had dessert then Banh Mi, when we were all stuffed full.It did seem also that most of them were toned down for the western tourists palette which made some undrwhelming. I was looking forward to lots of chilli, herbs and flavours.Also - no pho! I thought Hanoi was the birthplace of Pho.All in all though we enjoyed the tour and would recommend it. I'm sure it is more enjoyable when its not as hot / humid too.

Street Food Tour. I'm still stuffed! We made 15 stops with our guide, Mango for typical food, drinks, snacks, etc. She also pointed out notable sites and gave us historical facts throughout. It was like your favorite cousin showing you around town. Mango even wrote down each restaurant we visited, what we ate and the address! This was extremely helpful!Great value! The portions are not sample size! Great introduction to the culture. Now I feel prepared to fend for myself :)

Hanoi Street food tour. We liked it very much. We had a lovely guide, Mango, and she told us not only about the food but also about life in Vietnam. We had a wonderful evening with good vietnamese food.

Delicious Hanoi Street food tour! . I saw fantastic reviews online for Hanoi street food tour so thought I'd give it a go! It surpassed expectations! I have coeliac disease so I informed the guide and they said it would be fine. Every dish we tried was gluten free except for the banh mi at which point I was given a delicious alternative. Thank you so much to our guide Kiwi! Terrific tour. This was walking tour btw.

THIS TOUR WILL NOT DISAPPOINT . After doing some research on TA I decided to book this 3hr Scooter Street Food Tour. I was not disappointed. I was picked up from my hotel by Sam and given my first invigorating experience on the back of a scooter through the streets of Hanoi and the old quarter, to the main office for payment. From there it was straight into the tour. Money was a great host and tour guide. She takes an interest in all her guests. Thoughtful, considerate and organised. There was myself and a family of 3 for this tour. We all had a great time. All the food was explained at each venue, it's cultural significance within Vietnamese society and how it may differ from the food in southern Vietnam. I won't go into detail of each venue; it's nice to get a surprise, there is a variety of super fresh food, super tasty and the option for seconds was there as well, but I can guarantee that it most likely won't be necessary. Also the young man from the family had a nut allergy, that was also very carefully taken into consideration. Money, Sam and the rest of the girls will definitely look after you and keep you safe. As well asThis tour was a great way to see a part of Hanoi at night, and on the back of a scooter it's quite a bit cooler. Hanoi comes alive at night.....and with Money and her girls looking after you, you can not go wrong. I had a great time on this tour. Thanks again Money!!!!!

Great experience, amazing food, lovely guide!. We chose this tour after seeing positive feedback on trip advisor. Our guide was named Mango and she was so friendly and informative! She took us to so many amazing places to eat and gave comprehensive history and background information to Hanoi sights and traditions. We enjoyed it so much we booked a bike tour with Mango the next day. Do yourself a favour and do this tour!

Great tour!. We chose the street food tour by scooter and it was definitely worth it! Money and Annie were our guides. They were very knowledgeable about all of the food we tried and shared information about Vietnamese culture and history. By doing the tour by scooter you get to try places in many different areas of the city. We went to 6 different places and tried Bun Cha, Pho, fried food, ice cream, egg coffee and more!

Great walking tour . We did the walking evening tour and found it very good. Our guide Mango was excellent. Lots of different Street food so make sure your hungry. You also get to know a little bit of Hanoi history. Best to do this early on your arrival to Hanoi so you get to know the food. It is what it says Street food not fine dining.

A Great Intro to Hanoi. Our guide Mango (sticky rice) was very friendly and keen to answer all our questions.We are not great foodies but we love to try little bits of things and see how locals eat.It was a good walking tour around Hanoi and we got the chance to sample lots of different foods & drinks.It was professionally organised and good value for money. I would recommend this tour to others.
Very good experience. We had the pleasure to have Mrs. Sunny as our guide on the 3 hrs guided street food tour. We tried local food we wouldn't have tried alone. We loved it.

Honeymoon big bhudda development!. This tour was recommended by our hotel which we knew would be great as their service was. Indeed we were not disappointed in the slightest! Miss moon was exceptional and so informative about their culture not only around food but daily life in Hanoi. She had an excellent sense of humour and a brilliant grasp of the English language. Indeed she kept our group together across the busy streets just like sticky rice! We started with a total eclipse and ended our street food tour with two full moons! As is it the early days of our marriage miss moon helped us to develop a food baby in preparation for a real baby! Although we were older and on honeymoon our group was brilliant and definitely not the backpacking experience we had feared. We ate brilliant food from certified vendors and miss moon helped us to identify how to select street food from safe vendors. Even with my food intolerances miss moon ensured that I had foods that suited my tastes even if it diverted from the main stream meals. Exceptional experience which I would recommend highly! Thank you so much miss moon! Anne-Marie and Ross xx

Great Tour!!. Our guide Cherry was amazing! It rained heavily half an hour into the tour, and she got us raincoats, and braved the rain with us. Very passionate and personable. The food was also great!

Proper introduction to Hanoi's Streetfood. Our guide Pixie from Hanoi Streetfood Tour led us through the narrow and busy streets of the Old Quarter. On the way we tasted several authentic snacks/dishes and even participated in the cooking process:) We directly booked tickets with HST to the Water Puppet Theater after the end of the tour. Recommended tour on your first or second day in Hanoi.

Great introduction to Vietnamese food. I went on the tour with Kiwi as our guide. She was absolutely wonderful, so friendly and gave lots of information about the food we were eating and just some general tips about travelling in Vietnam. Be warned - there will be a lot of food. Don't eat all of the first few meals if you aren't a big eater, as you'll fill up too soon!

Fantastic tour ! . We had a private tour with Ms. Moon and it was absolutely wonderful ! I highly recommend this tour and make sure to ask for Ms. Moon. She is the best !Thank you for a fantastic tour and delicious food. We had a fantastic time.

Great your with Kiwi. Our guide Kiwi brought us to some awesome places that we never would have found. She was lovely and answered all of our questions. Everything was delicious too. Totally worth doing while in Hanoi.

THE way to experience Hanoi! . We were so glad that we chose to come on a street food tour with Lili (aka sticky rice!) on our first night in Hanoi. You'd better start this tour very hungry, or you won't be able to sample the long parade of amazing food which you find whilst wandering the streets of Hanoi old town. There were eight or nine stops on our tour, which included bun cha, tropical fruit salads, banh my, pork and shrimp rice pancakes, green bean ice lollies, egg coffee... the list goes on! All the time, Lili talked us through what we were eating, how the restaurant business has evolved in Hanoi, and a very interesting trick for spotting the oldest and best established restaurants... If you want to find out what it is, you'll have to go on the tour! Thanks to Lili for lifting the lid on Hanoi for us!

Excellent tour. My husband and I recently went on the 5 pm tour. Our guide Kiwi was incredible. She was funny, personable and taught us a lot about Vietnam food and culture. All of the food was delicious! It was well worth the 20 dollars. We were full all the way until breakfast the next day.

Brilliant tour!. I did a private tour with my partner yesterday and it was excellent! The places we visited for food were a great entry into the Vietnamese street food cuisine and will make ordering food in Vietnam much easier now! Our guide Duong spoke great English and happily answered all our questions. On the tour she stopped to show us points of interest around Hanoi and the history.If you have just arrived in Hanoi this is a great tour as not only do you get to eat delicious traditional food but you get to familiarize yourself with the area.

Explore real Hanoian (street) food in a fun way- Excellent!. A nice mixture between restaurants/ plastic table corner stalls and street stalls that even let you try doing pancakes on your own. Overall an excellent experience if you are looking for good quality yet safe and authentic food! Around 6-7 different dishes with nice walks in between (to digest!), better not to overeat in the beginning so you'll make it through to dessert ;)Our guide was Cherry, a lovely and super energetic mid 20's graduate who shared lots of personal stories and anekdotes about Hanoian culture and habits! Very recommended!!!

Great experience. Had a great time on this tour. Our guide was lilly, she was so informative and a lot of fun!The food in every place we visited was delicious, we had a different type of food in each restaurant and lilly Also brought us to restaurants that catered to a vegetarian. A must do in Hanoi really enjoyable!

Do this and find out hidden gems!. My husband and I did this tour and it was just the two of us. At first I felt a bit apprehensive about the scooter ride and pressure to eat food I may not have wanted to. I need not have worried. Our tour guides Sunny and Hue were extremely friendly and put me at ease. The food was actually all lovely (although if anything, too much food for me!) and we visited places that we would never had found for ourselves. THeir knowledge about the dishes, the regions they came from and how they were prepared were excellent and they also answered all my questions about life in Vietnam. I would highly recommend them, they even wrote out what we had eaten in english and Vietnamese so we could ask for it again afterwards.

Yummy!!!. There are certain things you absolutely have to get in Hanoi! 1. Coconut coffee! They mix coconut slushy with chocolatey coffee! Heaven!! 2. Banh mi - a street sandwich. I would suggest the barbecue pork one. It's fantastic!!! 3. Chicken skewers - if they have a chili sauce have them give it to you! 4. Coconut candies - they're like a creamy coding caramel. Don't be afraid to try the street food! My mantra was... I'll try anything once. Be careful not to eat things that are raw or undercooked, though. And watch out for fruits and veggies that are washed with water. The water is not drinkable and will make you sick! Use common sense. Always drink bottled water. Always.

If you do this tour ask for Miss Moon!!!. Where do I start!! Amazing food we would never have discovered on our own, personalised service and the best tour guide on the planet!! We arrived in a slightly drizzled day and found out we were the only two...our guide Miss Moon was a pocket rocket of information and good cheer. We ate so much amazing good from Bun Cha to Banh Mi to Hanoi spring rolls and egg coffee. Do this tour...it's so worth the money. But don't eat breakfast you'll eat 9-11 dishes you'll end up in a food coma...in the best way!! This is a must do tour in Hanoi...if you do nothing else, do this...you will NOT regret it.Thank you Miss Moon...,we love you!!!Rohan and Alex McElwee

Okay. We were a bit disappointed with this tour. It was our third food tour during our time in Vietnam and it wasn't as good as the other two. If we had been food tour virgins we probably would have thought it was quite good but because we had something to compare it to I'm afraid it fell short. Our guide was friendly and nice enough but she left us for periods of time whilst we were eating and we felt that she could have been more informative and talkative. Maybe she was just having an off day. The food was tasty enough but again nothing mind blowing. I've read in other reviews that people got beer but this was never offered to us. Do it if you're new to the country and the food but otherwise I would perhaps look for another tour.

So much fun!. I traveled to Hanoi with my husband and three teenage boys in June. The Hanoi Street Food tour was the first thing we did which is great because you get a feel for Hanoi and it is a great introduction to the food of the region. Cherry was our guide. She was so great. We went to a variety of different street food venues. They were all very authentic, but very clean and delicious! Our kids were introduced to food that they normally would not have ordered, so it made the trip even more fun because they recognized food on the menus. I highly recommend this tour.

Highly recommended!. I loved this tour! We were taken to loads of different places for food and Moon explained everything perfectly. Was lovely meeting others on the tour too. Definitely give it a try!

Amazing food!. It was a very, very hot day when I did the street food tour, however it was excellent! I got to sample many different dishes at local restaurants. The local knowledge was amazing too. I'd highly recommend this tour!

Excellent food tour. I really lovely afternoon spent wandering the streets of hanoi with sunni. Vegetarian options are proper vegetarian dishes rather than token efforts. Had some really tasty food - my favourite was either the bun cha or the crab soup which was absolutely delicious. ENjoyed all 8 dishes we had. Extremely full after. THis was our first ever food tour in acity and if you haven't done it before it's really worth doing it. OUr guide was excellent, had good english and was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Best trip you will do in hanoi. This is by far one of the best trips we did in our whole trip! We booked the trip through the hotel and I'm sure it cost 20 dollars per person for the 4 hour trip( although we were out for longer) we got picked up by our amazing tour guide called " sunny" who made the tour such a fun experience! There were 6 of us in the group and we walked about Hanoi tasting all the local cuisine and it is some of the best food I have ever eaten in my life! The food is so fresh and sometimes killed straight in front of you so you know it's fresh! Some of the places we went to eat didn't look the cleanest but they ended up having the tastiest food! Sunny never stopped taking us to places until we eventually told her we were full and then she said her job was complete lol! A must try is egg coffee when you are in Vietnam it is a local delicacy and you won't taste coffee as delicious anywhere else! Please go on this trip!!

Go for a private tour!. Based on a tip on a travel blog, we booked a private tour, instead ofgoing with a group. This costs 10USD more, but is definitely a great experience. Our guide, Miss Moon, was great. Her English could perhaps have been a little better, but what she lacked in language skills, she made up for in charm and good humour :)We were taken to places I'm quite sure I would never have tried, and the food was invariably extremely delicious! I seriously am unable to pick a favourite, as it was all so GOOD - an excellent introduction to Vietnamese food. In all, we tried some 11 different things (including 4 different kinds of spring rolls at one place and fresh beer at another), but never felt rushed during the tour. Miss Moon also wrote down all the dishes, in Vietnamese and English and with the nanes and addresses of the eateries.Not to be missed if you are a food lover in Hanoi!

Uncover the secrets of Hanoi!. After a rocky start to Hanoi (be aware of crooked taxi drivers at the airport!!!) the Hanoi Street Food Tour completely turned around our experience of Hanoi!!! The three hour walking tour uncovered all sorts of hidden gastronomic gems whilst providing an excellent introduction to this beautiful old town! Showcasing a wide range of food types, from breakfast to icecream to making our own rice paper rolls to Vietnamese coffee, each course was excellent. We highly recommend this tour and now feel inspired to start every new city with a food tour! Amazingness!!

Best food tour we tried in Vietnam. Our guide was Phoenix, a lovely and articulate young lady. She really made our experience pleasurable. Navigating the streets of Hanoi is no joke, but her "sticky rice!" technique worked perfectly. I felt like a complete glutton by the end of the tour but tried so many wonderful and exciting new dishes that I did not regret overeating! That said, I would definitely recommend NOT eating the day of the tour, until the tour.:)The historical anecdotes provided by Phoenix were also superb. The price of the tour was also much cheaper than other cities in Vietnam we visited. Would highly recommend this tour as a first night in Hanoi activity as it provides a wonderful introduction to the local cuisine.

Great introduction to local food. This tour is a great way to get to know what and where to eat in Hanoi. The friendly guides show you to some of the local street food restaurants and give you an insight into some tasty local dishes.Totally recommend

Awesome - a must do to start any Hanoi trip!. My wife & I did the night walking food tour last week and had a blast. There was only 1 other person in our group, so we basically had a 3-person private tour. Our guide Cherry was the BEST. She is hilarious, and took us to some amazing spots to try the best street foods that we certainly never would have found on our own. She even prepared a list of all of our stops at the end, and wrote the addresses down for us, so we could return later in our trip if we wanted to! We tried a number of the foods we sampled on the tour at later points in our stay, at very nice restaurants, and we must say, that while it was all good, none of it quite matched the food we tried on the food tour with Cherry! This is a must do early on in your trip to Hanoi! Highly recommended.

Take the private tour - Sunny was fantastic!!. Absolutely wonderful, small hidden restaurants. Sunny did a great job filling in the backstory of each dish and providing a well informed view of the city and the country.A must do in Hanoi

30,000 calories, approx 3 hours for 20 dollars I hear you say? DO IT!. I decided to go on this tour after reading the reviews on trip advisor and it did not disappoint! Our guide, Cherry, was brilliant and explaining the dishes we were eating, keeping us together, helping us navigate the roads and crazy traffic and taking us on a magical tour of Hanoi.You experience 6 Vietnamese street food dishes in the magical old quarter ranging from Bahn Mi to Bun Cha with some rice wine thrown in for good measure. Beware the rice wine....!The tour is reasonably well priced and a great way to see Hanoi. It's definitely worth a visit!

Fantastic bargain!. We chose the half day food tour, and it was well worth the price. There were eleven people in our group, so I guess you could say it was a private tour. Ms Moon, our guide was delightful. She was the perfect guide for this, being very knowledgable about local foods, and what Americans might want to know about it. She made sure we knew how to identify safe restaurants, and I think we all agreed she took us to many places we never would have tried on our own. You get a lot of food on this tour, and I thought all of it was good...Ms Moon checked for food allergies/preferences before we set out. Be aware this is a walking tour, but the pace is leisurely, and Ms Moon was very adept with the traffic.

Very good food tour. We did a private tour for 4 people. Our guide, Sunny, was very informative and friendly and spoke excellent English. We tried lots of different local dishes, and definitely ate "off the beaten track". We certainly didn't leave hungry! Would definitely recommend to anybody wanting a taste of local food (and drinks) in Hanoi.

Awesome tour of street food in Hanoi. We had a great time with our tour guide Sunny - she took us to some great places with some awesome food that we would never have found by ourselves! We learned a lot about street food culture in Hanoi. Definitely recommend!
Great time!. We thoroughly enjoyed Sunny's tour of a die range of foods in the Old Quarter. She was excellent, and we went places we would never even knew existed.Highly recommended!

Wished it was more. I didn't get what I was looking for. We ate some pretty good food we walked around a lot but it wasn't life changing and the tour guide didn't really keep us up to date one where we were going. So you couldn't go back if you liked something. I'm glad I did it. I would recommend you do it but maybe look around. It doesn't have to be this one.

Nice food tour!. We traveled with young child so booked a private tour with this company. Our guide - Cherry was amazing. She spook English very well and we tried some best/cheapest foods ever. We could not find or dare to try those foods without a guide. Recommend this tour for anyone!

Amazing Tour Guide and Great Food. We took the tour with a group of friends and I cannot say enough great things about it! The food was delicious, the tour guide, Miss Moon, was knowledgable and friendly. The tour included more than enough food across 7 stops and beer and coffee were included. The tour was a great way to learn about the area, foods, and culture. Well worth the money and three hours!

Hanoi Street Food Tour. We had a great time on a tour led by Miss Moon. She shared what was in each dish and how it was made. In addition she shared information on the Vietnamese culture. Very great start to our trip to Hanoi.

Amazing toor by Moon. Ms. Moon led our group of 10 through an amazing half day of fantastic food and wonderful insight into Viet Nam and its customs and traditions. This tour far exceeded our expectations as we learned a bit of Vietnamese, received background information on the food origins and how they differ from foods in other parts of the country. The food was phenomenal and Ms. Moon was a delight. I highly recommend this as it was one of the highlights of our trip. Ask for Moon whose knowledgeable insights and friendly personality really made this tour shine.

The best thing to do in Hanoi!. This was the most fun thing to do in Hanoi. I don't know about other walking food tours, but this one guided by Ms. Moon, covers a lot of places, and a lot of food all around the old quarter, including one establishment that has been in operation for 80 years. These are places I would not have found on my own. I could also go back to these places because I had photos from the tour to order food with. You're in good hands with Ms. Moon who is engaging, entertaining, and full of information about Vietnamese food and culture.

Lily Flower - Thank you!. Our amazing guide, Lily, bonded our tour group together from the get go. Within 10 minutes we were laughing our heads off while Lily successfully navigated the group through crazy Hanoi traffic. Lily has lived in Hanoi her entire life and her knowledge of the city, the food and the people is incredible. Our tour started at 5pm and lasted about 4 hours. In this time we went to 8 different stops and were given more food than we could eat! The tour consisted of us visiting restaurants that I never would have found otherwise! Some of the places we went did not even have a restaurant exterior. Not only did we learn about Vietnamese food customs and Hanoi specialties, Lily also answered all of our off topic questions about Vietnamese culture. We ended up talking about Vietnamese weddings (often 200 - 1000 guests!!). The tour had a relaxed vibe. We definitely did not feel rushed going from place to place.After the tour Lily showed us where the Beer drinking street of Hanoi was and our entire group stayed out for a few drinks together.Lily is clearly passionate about food and her city and she has a natural gift with people. If you want a fun evening out in Hanoi and you are open to trying new foods you shouldn't hesitate to go on this tour.

Amazing tour with Cherry. We just finished eating our way through the old quarter and Cherry was an amazing tour guide. Visited spots we never would have and ate some outrageous foods! Highly recommended - ask for Cherry!

Great Guide and Delicious Food. My husband and I really enjoyed the walking street food tour in the old quarter. Our guide, Cherry was very personable and funny. She made sure everyone was happy and satisfied with our meal at every stop. She told us interesting facts about the city and even gave us tips on places to go get beer after the tour. I definitely recommend this tour!

Brilliant experience . Awesome tour and a great way to get your head around the amazing street food of Hanoi.Our guide was brilliant ans we had way more food than we could eat included in the price.Groups aren't huge which helps with the experience

Great walking and food tour!. Dùong ("Pixie") was an amazing guide for our food trip. We went for a great walk around some of the neat landmarks in the city and she shared a bit about their history and meaning to Vietnamese people. Great local food spots with amazing dishes. We would have never found them. Thank you. A definite must do when in Hanoi. Would recommend doing it on the first couple of nights so you get your bearings and know which foods you like.

Stick with Miss Moon. Amazing tour with the lovely Miss Moon who got us all over town, effortlessly navigating the Hanoi traffic. Wear your walking shoes because this lady wastes no time :-)We had a wonderful evening sampling delicious food and learning many fun facts about the city. Having participated in food tours in many cities this tour and the guide herself were one of the best. Thank you!

Amazing; one of the best things to do in Hanoi. Great food, really friendly guide (Cherry!), fun for all ages.We were taken to various key street food spots in the city and had really amazing food we surely would have missed because of our lack of vietnamese (Cherry did all the food ordering, since all signs were in vietnamese and we were clueless about them).

Go eat at places you would normally just walk straight past. I booked a walking street food tour for my family (2 adults and 2 young teens). It was a simple process, just went to the office location in the morning and booked a 5pm tour. We all turned up got a 3 hour tour but were treated to 4 hours with a excellent guide Mango. We ended up having 13 different tastes of Hanoi, food and beverages. We were completely satisfied at the end, that is appetite and intellect. That is we are well and also were given an insight into some of the sights of Hanoi and also a little more knowledge on the way the people of Hanoi live. This was the best way to start the trip as it set my kids up to be more adventurous with food and the way people live in a different country. Thanks to Hanoi Street Food tours and Mango for a great experience.

Excellent insight into the street food culture of Hanoi. I really enjoyed this tour. I learnt so much about the food and culture and got to try so many different dishes. Our guide Lily was fabulous and couldn't do enough for us. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone.

"Highlight of time in Hanoi". First of all, it was our guide nicknamed "Mango" who made the evening so wonderful. My wife and I didn't have much time in the city so the night street food tour was perfect. It not only accomplished what we wanted to do while we were there but saved us time bartering with vendors and allowed us to relax and follow the guide without any worries accept listening to her information and taking in all of the sights and smells around us. I think it is a must do for those with limited time and want an authentic experience and a "taste of Hanoi".

Great food tasting. Our guideMango, and a couple from Luxembourg spent over 3 hours walking round the old quarter trying,tasting and even cooking foods we would never have tried on our own.It was a fabulous walk with a great guide with a bubbly and happy personality.

Great food for cheap!. This was our first tour in Hanoi. You won't go wrong with this tour. Costs only $20 per person and we had a great experience. Our guide, Dzuong, took us to different restaurants/street stalls to sample 7 courses of different Vietnamese food. The restaurants were for the most part clean and had sitting areas. It was worth it. Dzuong was very knowledgeable and gave other recommendations on what to do while in Hanoi.

Worth it!. Thought it was a tad pricey (USD20 per person) but it was highly recommended by a colleague. We wanted to try local food anyway, signed up for this, and really, really enjoyed it!Our food guide was Sunny. Really helpful and took good care of us (given the traffic in Hanoi). We had about 8-9 dishes including 3 drinks and 1 dessert. Really, really good and clean food.

A taste of all of Hanoi . Over three hours we got to taste a delicious fraction of what Hanoi street food has to offer. Our guide Sunny was friendly and helpful and made sure we all got across the crowded streets together (no mean feat). It was a great way to explore the old quarter and try a lot of food that we might not have otherwise.

The best day we had in Hanoi!. Sunny Hi! we miss you and your beautiful smile!Okay, we are from Texas! wanted something to do and like you we went to trip advisor and the #1 thing to do was the street food tour and we were not disappointed. It exceeded our expectations. Don't eat breakfast, book a 3 hour private tour with Sunny and tell her all about youself. She loves to talk about life...so contageous. We had no idea what to do in Hanoi but we heard we would like it. We booked our trip through Kims tours here 74 Hàng Bạc, Hoàn Kiếm, Hà Nội 08404, Vietnam. It was 40,000 kip ($2.00) for a tuktuk anywhere in the old city to get here. We went through back alleys, side streets, hidden stairways and back doors to experience Hanoi eating in only a way a local could. It was a wonderful insight to life here. Sunny spoke perfect English and took us to seven different restaurants and even wrote down the location addresses, and what we ate there. Thank you again Sunny. We will never forget you and our experience there!

Best tour guide! . My husband and I did this tour a few days ago. I wasn't that excited to do it but we were told it was great so decided to try. Mango made it an unforgettable experience! She was so friendly, knowledgeable and made it so interesting! She was the reason we loved it so much! (The food was great too!) We have friends coming to Hanoi in the next few days and have already told them they MUST do the tour and request her as their guide! Great time!

Foodies, this is a must for you to truly enjoy Vietnam! Best time ever!. This tour was one of our Hanoi highlights and really introduced us to the local cuisine. And there is really so much to know from what, where and how to eat so join Miss Moon on a culinary adventure that will leave you full, happy, and satisfied. One of the best food tours we've ever taken.

Definitely worth taking the time to do this tour!. I had been in Vietnam for almost a month and had eaten a lot of delicious food all around the country, but still I found this tour to be very worthwhile! Not only was it fun and led by the wonderful Kim, "sticky rice!!", but we had some DELICIOUS meals! As a vegetarian I found it intimidating to order street food because I wasn't sure how to ask for it without meat, so I figured this would be my chance to eat at really local places. I wasn't disappointed, we went to so many great shops and really got to see how the food is made and learned so much about the culture. It was a fun way to meet people too and we all went out for bia hoi afterwards. Great day!

A Must Do in Hanoi. This fantastic street food tour is the perfect way to get introduced to the food delights of Hanoi. Our guide Lily was delightful and made it such fun for all 7 in our group. Each food stop was a revelation and Lily was very knowledgeable not only in the cuisine but also the sights of Hanoi. Highly recommended.BTW Kim Tours where this is based were really helpful and we also did the scooter tour with them.

Great food tour. We booked a private tour for my family of four on the day we arrived into Hanoi. We had Sunny as our guide and she was fun and very informative. We tried an array of great food and went back to the wonderful Bun Cha place the next day. Sunny organised a taste of river snails for us which was fun (we didn't eat them all). The tour was a really great way to start off our time in Vietnam, highly recommend it.

"Sticky Rice". I have traveled to Vietnam with my two girlfriends and began our trip in Hanoi. Before arriving, I was so hesitant to try any of the street food but after doing this great tour, my whole mentality changed. We had an amazing tour guide, Mango! She was so informative and very friendly and as crossing the road is a bit tricky, we all had to stick together like "Sticky Rice". She walked us around the old quarter talking about the culture and history and showing us the fantastic street food places to eat. Would definetly recommend this tour to anyone who loves food!

"Truly excelent". More than good value for money. You will eat things and visit places you would NEVER eat / visit on your own. It's 3 hours of taking in vietnam culture in the old quarter and meet other travellers in groups of 8. Our tour guide was Cherry, and she was kind, happy and had plenty of information to share. English could be better but we haven't really met anyone who dominates the language!

Amazing Tour "Sticky Rice!". We did the street food tour last night after reading all the great reviews on TA. We loved it! Absolutely lived up to our expectations. Our guide, Cherry, was great. She was funny, witty and taught us a lot about vietnamese culture and food. She took us to places I would have never walked in alone or even thought of eating there. All the food was amazing, especially the bum cha at our first stop and the desserts (green sticky rice with coconut icecream). We also enjoyed getting to know the other people on our tour, had a blast sharing travel stories. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi it is a great way to explore the Old Quarter, enjoy great food and company!Thank you Cherry for making our experience so great!!

An absolute MUST !!! Ask for Kiwi !!!!!!. one of the best tours i've ever been on. A friends recommended this to us and have to thank her so much for this. Unbelievable USD20 eat for 5 hours at 7 locations all the best local street food you will not find by yourself. Tour guide Kiwi was absolutely lovely, she made it soo fun and enjoyable. "Sticky Rice" !!!!!! ok you have to find that out what that all means....... : )The group we were with were absolutely off the chart fun. Formed great bond after eating for 5 hours together and shared loads of photos on our whatsapp group. An absolute must for Hanoi visit !!!!!!

What a great introduction to Vietnamese Street Food!!!. We decided to take a street food tour with this group after reading trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed! We had the most lovely Miss Moon as our guide who made the tour with her lovely bubbly personality. You won't go hungry on this tour as you sample the most popular Vietnamese delights in the old quarter. All the places we visited were clean and the food absolutely delicious!!! We got a real taste of Hanoi on this tour and would thoroughly recommend it ! For $20US you will get your monies worth. And not need to eat for the rest of the day. Miss Moon explains the food your eating. Also offering to teach you a few Vietnamese words that can be of help on your travels! Thanks again Miss Moon. Loved our day with you.

Great Tour!. What a fantastic way to learn about Vietnamese street food! Myself and two girlfriends arrived in Hanoi (our first stop in Vietnam) this tour was a perfect way to take away our fears of eating street food. There was nothing "scary" so if you are a fussy eater you will be fine! Hoai Yumi (Mango) was fabulous, her English was great, she was very knowelegable and made the tour very interesting! Definitely a must do!

Awesome food, awesome guide, awesome experience!. My friend and I had such an amazing time on this food tour! Coming from Vancouver, we've tried a lot of good Vietnamese food but we still managed to try a number of new things on the tour. We went to places that you wouldn't even think were a restaurant looking at them from the street and wouldn't otherwise try. Our guide, Ms. Moon, was really informative about what was in the food, how it was made and also gave us great tips about what to look for and avoid in and around Hanoi. She was also adorable! The tour helped us get to know our way around the old quarter much better and we were stuffed at the end. Highly recommend this tour!

So good!. We have been traveling Southeast Asia for nearly 3 months and this walking tour will be one of our favourite memories! Our guide was Mango. She was funny, spoke perfect English and was so nice; a huge part of what made the tour so fun were her stories and jokes. I am a vegetarian and told her ahead of time not to worry too much about accommodating me as I don't have a huge appetite anyway, and was more doing the tour for my husband. At every stop, she ensured there was a vegetarian option for me. At one place she even insisted on me not tasting the soup until she went downstairs and made sure with the staff that there was no fish sauce in it. Not only that, at a stop near the end of the tour when she went in to get beers for everyone, I was craving a diet coke and snuck out to quickly get one. Mango literally chased after me and bought it for me, insisting that it was included in the cost of the tour. She totally went above and beyond to make the experience comfortable and fun. There was soooo much food, all delicious and interesting. We are very full and very happy with our decision to do this tour. Highly recommended!

Great tour with Mango!. We did this our first night in Hanoi, and we had a great time touring the Old City. Mango was a great guide- she kept us full, entertained, and safe when crossing Hanoi's streets! She also explained a lot about Vietnamese culture and each food we were eating. There were a variety of different foods and drinks, and we left with a list of the places we went so we could revisit them. We definitely recommend!

Must do this tour! Ask for Mango as your tour guide. Me and 2 friends did this tour the second night in Hanoi and it was incredible! They took us to amazing street style restaurants that we would not normally go to and the food was delicious! Our tour guide Mango was extremely knowledgable, spoke great English, very polite and entertaining - if you do this tour, I recommend asking for Mango as your tour guide. Thanks to this tour we now know what type of street restaurants to go to and will be eating likes locals for the rest of our trip.

Introduction to Vietnamese food. I'm from Melbourne in Australia and the high Vietnamese population here means there are some truly amazing restaurants at home. This tour was great because it suited beginners to Vietnamese cruise and also the more advanced. The big upside is being exposed to places that you would never find on your own. The guide was fantastic and I loved the "sticky rice" saying - very cute.

Good way to try some things you wouldn't othrrwise. We did this tour with our 2 daughters 13 & 15 and it was a great experience. Mango our guide was very informative and even though we were a bit unsure about some of the places we visited everything was very good. Don't count on the itinerary bring the same as the website, as a lot of the foods were different. As others have said do this tour as early as possible in your trip so you can put what you learn to use.

Great way to experience Hanoi!. My husband and I just did this tour last night with a group of 10 people (us included) and our adorable and perky, tour guide Mango.Mango was energetic, sweet, informative about both the food and Vietnamese culture, and she would call "sticky rice" every time we needed to cross one of the insane Hanoi streets. She wrote down all the foods and places we went together for all of her guests, as well as her email. She is just another shining example of the hospitable Vietnamese people.The tour is only 20USD, which included 6 food items, ice cream, and 3 beverages. Go hungry!!!! Besides the awful heat and humidity of Hanoi in the summer, everything about this tour was exciting and enjoyable. As an American, some places are questionable (no health code here), however that's life in Hanoi. Be adventurous! Our favorites were the Bun Cha, Banh Mi, and lemon/mint ice cream.

Great food experience. Mango provided a great insight into a large range of street foods, as well as explaining the way of life for locals. A fun way to do a quick evening tour of the Old Quarter as well. A must if in Hanoi. Suggest you do this as early as possible in your stay.

Great food with a great guide. Kudos to Hoai for taking us on a great tour of the old quarter and giving us a little history of Hanoi and the '36 streets'. Food was fantastic! Having a guide to help you approach the daunting food scene in this marvellous city is essential!Thanks a bunch to 'Mango' and 'Sticky Rice!'

One of the highlights of our trip. You can't miss this!!. After having gone through some waves of sickness during our stay in vietnam, my boyfriend and I were a bit sceptical to try out the famous street-food in Hanoi. Don't be. You won't have trouble finding amazing food in the many restaurants of Hanoi, but the street food is one of the most uniquely delicious experiences you can have. I won't go into much more detail, but trust me: you HAVE to try this. P.S. Shoutout to our guide Sunny, who were very helpful, radiant and well-informed. Thank you for making our tour a blast!
Sticky rice!. Good value for money and all the places we were taken to seemed quite authentic. The food was excellent all round. Special mention to Cherry our awesome guide!

Amazing from kiwi. My partner and I booked this tour from trip adviser reviews and we were not disappointed! We had a great crew and got along really well! kiwi our tour guide was AMAZING!! Her English was great and answered all our questions and was so informative we are so glad we booked this thanks so much kiwi!! And now when we cross the road we yell sticky rice!!Highly recommended!

brilliant tour, brilliant guide. We arrived slightly late for the 5 O'clock tour, but there were enough of us to form another group. we walked around Hanoi. as well as delisious food, our guide told us about the city and its history. ultamatly, i can't fault the tour, and our guide was passionate and engaging. 5/5 stars, brillaint experance. well worth the $20(USD)

Sticky Rice!. This street tour was the best time! We were in a group of six and stuck to Kiwi our amazing guide as we dashed across busy streets in and out of 8 different restaurants. So much fun and every dish we tried was delicious. We learned a lot about the food and Vietnamese culture. Definitely recommend this tour, great price, great food, great way to explore Hanoi, and a fantastic guide. Thank you Kiwi!

Make this your first stop in Hanoi!. We arrived in Hanoi last night. We decided to do the 11:00 lunch tour today. Our family (myself, my husband, and two children ages 9 and 11) ended up being the only ones on the tour. Miss Moon was our guide and she was wonderful. The food we tried was delicious and she gave us great information about each dish. She has scouted out hole in the wall eateries we never would have tried or found on our own. We tried 12 dishes over three hours, including bbq pork, papaya salad, lemon mint ice cream, pillow cakes, sour spring rolls, rice flour pancakes. Each dish was better than the next. Our kids loved the tour, and Miss Moon was so patient and generous with them. A great introduction to Vietnam and Hanoi

Make sure you start with an empty stomach!!. We toured the old quarter with Sunny from Hanoi street food tour, She was very professional and knew everything about what we asked. We had a great time with her as we took the lunch time tour with the 6 of us. Make sure to remember "sticky rice, sticky rice" as that's the call to stick together when you cross the street - traffic is never ending and one way streets are never really just one way for motorcycles! We had 7 courses over lunch and this was more than enough as there is just so much variety to choose from. All the dishes were great and suitable for adults and kids alike. You'll find yourself navigating winding alleyways and crossing crazy intersections as you eat meals on the curb side, up tight and twisting staircases and in air conditioned sweet dessert shops. It's a great way to taste and see the old quarter all in one go. The 3 hours flew by and we were ready to relax and take the afternoon easy after the tour. Take the tour early on in your visit to Hanoi, that way you can go back to your favourite places over the next few days.

Sunny Sunny!. Just completed the street food tour with Sunny and had such an enjoyable night! We ate beautiful food and the itinerary is perfectly paced so you can actually manage to eat and drink at 8 different venues during the three hours. I'm a vegetarian and was well looked after, with Sunny keeping a close eye on everything I was served. Good group atmosphere (10 of us) and was nice to see the change in the city as we walked around between 5pm when the tour started and 8:30pm when we finished and the streets were pumping. Sitting at home writing this with a full belly and happy heart! Thanks Sunny.
Great way to experience hanoi. Great way to experience hanoi definitely a must... amazing food and the guides are gun and very knowledgeable.

Great intro to Hanoi and the old quarter . This was a wonderful introduction to Hanoi and Vietnam. Our guide Cheri was wonderful and her English was excellent. We did this tour on our first day and I can't think of a better way to get a feel for the city and its culture. Every restaurant on the tour had great food. Cheri even got our youngest son, who can be a picky eater, jumped right. He loved the food, as did our who family. Since this is a walking tour, you are treated to an insiders guide to the old tour. Highly recommend!

BEST TOUR OF MY LIFE!!!. I just went on a tour today with my family and I was absolutely amazed I came in with low expectations and a negative mind frame but that quickly changed, everyone was happy and welcoming, I am vegan and the guides were more the accommodating, finding food I could eat. The guides were all amazing and safe drivers, whizzing around the streets of Hanoi was a 10/10 experience would recommended to everyone and anyone!!!!! Big thankyou to our wonderful guide Money and the other drivers Sam, ha and Ling!!!!

If you are spending a couple of days in Hanoi this is a best first stop. Sunny was an amazing guide for us on our tour, the restaurants we went to where amazing and the quality of the food was nearly 10/10 everywhere we went. Have and will continue to recommend it to everyone who goes to Hanoi.

Awsome tour with pixie. Awsome 3 hour walking tour around hanoi sampling some killer street food! Pixie was amazing very informative helpful and friendly! Definitly reccomend this tour to get into some street food of you havent tried it before and also a great way to get to know the hanoi area!

Street Food Tour with Ms. Moon. Had such an awesome time discovering 8 or more local dishes and the best Old Quarters establishments that serve them. Two thumbs up to our guide, Ms. Moon! It shows that she loves what she does! Was happily full by the time we had our last stop.Had been looking for a good banhmi place on our first 3 days and found most only so-so, but the one I tried on this tour hit the spot. Thanks Ms Moon!

So Good I Took Two Tours. This review is for two tours: 8 hour city tour and 3 hour street food tour - both on motorbike. These tours were amazing. I only had two days in Viet Nam, and I am so glad that I spent them on these tours. Even though it cost more, I would strongly suggest the motorbike tours. They were an amazing way to cover a lot of ground and experience the sights, sounds, and smells of the city...not to mention a great way to beat traffic and stay cool. Both motorbike drivers (Annie and Cherry) were safe and effective in getting me around.My first tour was the 8 hour city tour with Cherry. I had a list of many places that I wanted to see, and we covered almost all of them. Cherry did a great job of explaining the highlights of each attraction (in good English) as well as explaining the local culture. She did a particularly good job as allotting the right amount of time for each attraction. At some, we just looked at it from the motorbike, which was perfectly acceptable as I would not have wanted to do anything other than look at it any way. At others, we went inside and I was treated to an in depth "lesson" about what I was seeing. Lunch and snacks were delicious and informative. The tour was so good that I decided to dedicate part of my second day to another tour. The second tour I took was the evening street food tour by motorbike. My guide was Annie. Her English is perfect, and she did a safe and amazing job driving us around. In fact, she picked me up in the rain and dropped me off in a torrential down pour. This was perhaps one of the most exciting parts of the tour. Fortunately, it only rained at the beginning and end of the tour. The hours in-between were spend eating the most amazing assortment of foods and learning about Vietnamese food and culture from Annie. I had such a good time discussing table manners, how people eat and cook at home, and how the small businesses are managed. Truly an multifaceted and well designed tour. The food was delicious and plentiful...not just samples. Lot's of food ending with an amazing dessert. All in all, I cannot recommend these tours, and the tour guides, enough. I so glad that I chose to spend the bulk of my time in Vietnam on them.

Great vegetarian food tour. We had a great experience with Duong (Pixie). Due to an mixup on their end, she didn't realize we had a tour but came right away to the office and without missing a beat gave a great tour. We were there people and are all vegetarian. She showed us some great places ending with fresh beer, delicious banh mi, and egg roll coffee. She was a really delight to be with. We had a great time.

Best food tour with Cherry. Thanks to Cherry for such an excellent day. We booked a private group tour since there were so many of us and had the best time tasting all the local food. Cherry entertained us with lots of stories and shared her local knowledge. She was super friendly and interested in helping us explore the local food culture. Especially delicious was the Bun Cha from Bun Cha Ta - most of us went back several times during our stay. Thanks for such an awesome day!! It was a highlight of the trip.

Hanoi is incomplete without the food tour. Took a street food tour. Took 3 hours on foot to taste 10 dishes. Walked over 4 kms. Tried several dishes including shrimp, beef, pork, eel and chicken. Was even taught to make transparent dumplings! See all the photographs

Very nice tour with Cherry!(;. We arrived the first day in hanoi and decided to go for a streetfoodtour Group. Cherry showed us so many nice places and the best food we could get in Hanoi, as we are vegetarians she easily adapted the tour so that we could enjoy the evening. Thanks Cherry you were GREAT! :)The girls from Luxembourg!

Private walking tour. We had an amazing young guide, "Mango" who spoke excellent English and introduced us to a number of Vietnamese delicacies and special treats on our private walking tour. She was very knowledgable and added to the experience with local and cultural insights. We experienced cuisine and dined at places we wouldn't otherwise have gone to. A little adventurous, but perfectly OK. Great value and overall an enjoyable evening in Hanoi's old quarter. Mango was genuinely interested in our experience and welfare. "Sticky rice" will happily be remembered. Would recommend.
Food. The guide was the best!!! The idea is great, but i really would prefer a different choice, of place to eat, some was nice, some to dirty for tourist .

Great motorbike tour with food and sightseeing!. We had a great time with Money and Sam who were our drivers and guides for the night! They picked us up from our hotel and took us to their office before we set off! Both ladies were fantastic drivers and we loved every minute of it! The food was great as you got to try many portions from different shops. It's good to have you a guide to assure you that the food you are eating is safe. Come with an appetite as you'll be extremely full by the end! The motorbike was great fun as you got to whizz around with the locals. We also got to go over a bridge that was only for bikes that had a great view. Money would stop at many sights to give you a break from eating and to give you some info! Her English was great and she would answer any and all of our questions! Thanks for such a fantastic night ladies! We highly recommend this to all. I am 21 and my mum came on the tour too! So it's great for all ages!

Ms. Moon is great tour guide!. Ms. Moon is an amazing tour guide, funny and tells you a lot of interesting facts about the culture that you wouldn't have otherwise known. The variety of food is great, and considering she has to accommodate for many food preferences it was pretty authentic too!

good finds. I liked this tour because Hanoi is packed full of too many options and most of TripAdvisor's recommendations tend to be geared towards Western tastes. So this tour directs you through the maze of Hanoi to some places with great food that you might easily overlook. Kiwi was a great tour guide -- she showed us key local gems, walked us through some hoppin' Hanoi streets on a busy Saturday night, and established a warm and friendly group-dynamic right from the start. She made sure that we enjoyed the food we had, even asking for our feedback at the end, and didn't rush us from place to place (a 3 hour tour ended up being 3.5 hours because of how chatty our group was). Her English was clear and lucid.

Vegan. I looooooove the foooooood!!!!! omg. i love phó. phò. i don't know how you spell that. but really! i am in love with it. vegetables are fresh and kind and sweet and oh dear.. i always eat it. it is so easy to become vegetarian or vegan in this place. i love hanoi! a lot! thank you. : ) food is cheap but the quality is outstanding.

Best way to explore food culture in a short time!. We joined the group tour on the first night we have arrived Hanoi. With our passionate Vietnamese food enthusiast tour guide - Donut, we were introduced 7 different type of food! including:grilled pork noodle (Obama's fav), dried beef salad, steamed cake stuffed with mushroom and pork, assorted deep fried savory donuts, sticky rice ice-cream, Vietnamese sandwich, egg coffee/chocolate.Of course each of the portion is reduced so we can try everything. But after that we were all very full, so prepare an empty stomach!The tour's meeting point is easy to find. The guide is very friendly introducing us food while teaching us basic Vietnamese. She also helped and led us when crossing the road. The Vietnamese name of the food was given at the end of the tour, so we could go and find our favourite after the tour. As we joined the grouped tour, we were able to meet new friends as well!In general, it is well worth the money and highly recommended to everyone especially for those who want to try the best Vietnamese food in 3 hours!

Excellent tour. Went on this tour tonight. Was really enjoyable. Cherry our tour guide was so helpful and was an excellent guide. Brought us to 6 stops with all different food types. Definitely would recommend.

Hanoi must-do!. This was our favourite part of our 4 day stay in Hanoi! Our lovely guide Sunny took us to 7 of the best spots in town for a mixture of totally delicious street food - into doorways and alleyways that we would never have thought to go into. Don't be afraid because the food really was good! Sunny also gave us confidence crossing the crazy Hanoi roads! We loved every moment! 'Sticky rice!!'

Such a fun way to see the city on the back of a Scooter. Prior to arriving in Hanoi we had pre-booked a private tour of Hanoi which we did on day one. It was excellent but did not cover food which is such an integral part of life in Vietnam. So, using trip advisor we decided to book a street food tour on the back of a scooter. I'm sure a walking tour would have been good but I have to say we covered so much more ground on the back of the scooters and in this heat it made a welcome change from walking. Our guide 'Money' and her friend we not only wonderful guides but also great scooter drivers, it was great to be out there whizzing along side all the others. We went to about 5 different places where we had one course at each place. You do need to do this trip on a very empty stomach, there is just soo much food. In addition to covering many of the streets in the old quarter they also took us out across the old bridge which only the trains and scooters are able to use (no cars) this was a real bonus for us. All in all a fabulous trip and highly recommended. We did the 11.30 one.
Weekend at Hanoi . Enjoyed the food and the site seeing during the day. Hanoi is a place to visit over the weekend only. Halong bay tomorrow and looking forward to it

First thing to do in Hanoi. Just came back from this fantastic tour. I enjoyed every minute of this 3.5h tour that guides you thru the best of Hanoi street food. Mia our guide was fantastic took us to places you'd never go in nor find alone and explained alot about the food and history of Vietnam. Without a shadow of a doubt each time I'll be in Hanoi I'll book this tour for the first night. With only 20usd we had plenty of food, water and even a beer! Really loved it

Do the street food tour!!!. The street food tour is not something to miss. Go with an appetite and an open mind and you won't be disappointed. There was nothing that I didn't like. All the food was delicious. Our guide mentioned that the afternoon tour could be different from the evening tour because the establishments visited are different. Had I had more time in the city, I would have tried both. It's a great thing to do at the beginning of your stay because you get a tour of the Old Quarter with your guide and it helps you to orient for when you brave the streets on your own.

Fun food tour. After enjoying the excellent Back of the Bike food tour in Saigon last year we decided to try this night time scooter tour. It was easy to book by email. We were picked up on time at our hotel by Cherry and her sidekick Leechee and taken to the nearby offices to pay and then it was off into the crazy Hanoi traffic for a top class tasting and sightseeing tour. We travelled the length and breadth of the city sampling some really fine street food all beautifully explained by the charming and informative Cherry. She also took pains to show us the sights and explained the significance of various landmarks. Both were great drivers and took us down some very narrow lanes. All the choices of food and strange little venues were innovative. We loved every minute of the four hours. And a special thanks to Cherry - a really lovely, well spoken and informed guide.

A first night must do. Food was great, and the tour guide was really informative. He and the rest of the group gave us lots of tips on what to do and do in Hanoi, what to eat, and most importantly how to cross roads!! The final stop on the trip is the best, lots of stairs, but a great view at the end of it

Amazing!!. Our family just came home from a food tour in the Old Quarter tonight with Cherry. It was an incredible introduction to the city and its cuisine!!Cherry is a great guide, taking our family to local gems that we would not have found or tried by ourselves. She was great with our kids and they LOVED her!! She choose the perfect variety of restaurants to showcase different dishes. She even went out of her way to get a cake for my husband's birthday. SO sweet!!Overall it was a wonderful experience for our family and I would highly recommend it!!

This should be the first thing you do in Hanoi. Seriously, this should be the very first thing you do in Hanoi. We went on an amazing 3.5 hour stroll through the Old City tasting amazing foods that I would never have ordered on my own, in restaurants I would have never stopped in. For US $20, you will have an amazing tour and be stuffed to the gills with some of the tastiest street food. And Mango was such a charming host! Highly recommended!

Mango is a lovely and the tour is well worth it. Lovely tour with plenty of dishes and insight into the local culture. The food was diverse and tasty. The tour is well worth your time and money. Mango was our tour guide, she was friendly and attentive. 10 out of 10, Many thanks, Mel and Eric!!

Great way to try street food safely. We went on this tour through recommendation. There was only one other couple so 4 people in the group. We had a lovely host called Cherry. Her English was excellent and very friendly. We went to 8 venues. 5 savoury and 3 sweet dishes. Some places we went to you wouldn't even think of buying from and the restaurant section were hidden from street view. I would highly recommend this to do when you first arrive in Hanoi so that you can be confident with buying food during your stay. My favourite thing was the egg coffee. We had it cold and one of the group had it hot but said the cold was better.

Fun Night. We did the 3 hour street food tour by scooter. There was only 3 of us in the group. We visited several stops in the old quarter and received a good explanation of the foods and drinks. My favorite of the foods was the grilled pork from a street stand. Yummy!! The highlight was the end of the night when we drove onto the old bridge for a nice view.

Wish we could give 10 stars for Mango's tour. My partner and I had a wonderful evening learning about Vietnamese food and Hanoi with our lovely guide Mango. Mango was great company and shared many interesting facts and funny stories about life in Vietnam. The food was wonderful and all places we never would have found ourselves. I think this tour is unmissable and a great way to get to know Hanoi. We highly recommend it.
Mrs Moon ❤️. Today we did the three hour walking tour with Mrs Moon. She was the absolute best. We tried about 10 different foods/drinks and each one was amazing. Thanks for the good times. 😊

Street Yum. Just finished a street food tour with Phoenix, she was a great guide really upbeat and passionate about the traditional Vietnamese food.
