She took us to lots of hidden gems that we would of undoubtedly missed alone. We had great spring rolls, chicken noodle with tons of coriander, coconut ice cream and my favourite egg coffee....! Phoenix was great at assisting the various chefs along our trip with our groups special requests for veggie options too so everyone could eat well. I would recommend this tour to everyone and I'm really fussy over food so it was a nice safe way to try authentic Vietnamese food and the local fresh beer :)

Best experience in Vietnam. We had an amazing private tour with Cherry tonight! We spent almost 3 hours walking the streets of old Hanoi and enjoying delicious street food. Our favorite were the crab noodles. Everything was delicious and the beer was cold. Cherry is an amazing hostess who took the time to get to know us and modified the tour to give us the very best experience possible. She made the night our best experience in our 1+ week in Vietnam!

Would recommend this to anyone coming to Hanoi. I really enjoyed this 3hour street food walking tour in the old quarter. We joined the 11am group, which was a nice small size of 4 other people. The guide, Cherry, was delightful. She was friendly, experienced and very relaxed. The tour took in 6 eating or drinking place in just over 3 hrs. It was timed perfectly, with enough time in each location to sit, relax, chat with Cherry and the others in the group, and enjoy the food. Cherry was a pleasure to talk to, and it felt like chatting a friend. The tour started off in a very western-friendly Bun Cha Ta and then moved on to the standard street eateries on the side of the road.I would recommend it to anyone and would do it again the next time I visit Hanoi.

Great fun with Sunny. We did a private tour in the evening with our tour guide Sunny.We got to try many different dishes in places that we would have never tried by ourselves.Sunny was an excellent guide and spoke very good english, she took us to a variety of places on our 4 hour tour where we tried fresh and tasty dishes. Sunny also gave us the confidence to go out by ourselves and try different street foods.Highly recommended to do early in your stay in Hanoi.

A Must do. A group of 8 of us did this on our first night in Hanoi in late march. As there were 8 of us we were able to do it as a private tour and choose the time of our start.This was a brilliant tour that took us to places that we would never have tried on our own. The types of food we sampled were delicious and we were told about the origins and ingredients of each. On our next few nights we went back to a couple of these shops ourselves as we were so impressed. This is a definite must do if you want a taste of the real Hanoi.

So different. Just ask for the house special and see what arrives. I have enjoyed every meal so far. Eat with the locals and the tiny restaurants with the tiny plastic chairs and the metal picnic tables are terrific. Use the tissues (just like the locals) and really enjoy the food. The coffee is great and the local tea is also good . Dont be surprised if the small places dont have change for large notes. Just order more food

Fun, tasty and informative. The street food tour was a fun way to learn your way around Hanoi and traditional Vietnamese food. We were taken to eateries that I would have never otherwise considered going to but the food was delicious, and I would definitely go back to them if I had the chance. We had a great variety of foods to try, including desserts and drinks too and even got to try out hand at making some rice pancakes. I would recommend this to anyone that has an interest in food!

Amazing experience!!. Lucky to be the only couple on the tour, we were taken on a private tour around the Old Quarter by our lovely tour guide Sunny. As well as providing delicious food, Sunny was a great guide and gave us much information about Hanoi which was useful as it was our first day! She even wrote out a list of all the places we visited so we could return, and gave some other recommendations. Thank you!

Fantastic . The walking was a consern for me. ( Old Injury ) but it wasn't a big concern. Not a huge amount of walking. The food was fantastic and the young lady spoke better english than a aussie. Took us to some incredible places abd managed to tick off a heap of things we wanted to try. Highly recommended

Great way to discover Vietnamese street food. Fantastic tour. Our guide, Miss Moon, was wonderful, and took us to 10 different places to eat and have a range of different foods, all of which were excellent. She even gave us further recommendations for where to eat in the future. A great way to get a taste of the city!

Fantastic Viet Food Experience. Miss Lilly took 4 of us on this tour which was very informative. She was a great happy cheerful guide. This is a great tour and I would suggest you do it at the start of your Hanoi Old Quarter stay as you will learn what to order in Vietnamese and what is great food available everywhere. It is great to know what to order locally instead of being "safe" and ordering boring Western style food. We highly recommend this tour.
Great food and excellent guide. Miss Moon was a great, knowledgeable guide who organized a good tour. She was funny and approachable - we enjoyed it very much!

A Great Taste of Hanoi. Absolutely loved this walking street food tour. It took us to places we would never have found ourselves. Our food included: papaya salad with beef jerky, bun cha, silk crepe dumplings, a variety of deep fried treats, kumquat juice? (iced tea?), bahn mi, lotus seed/lychee dessert and egg coffee. Best activity we had in Hanoi.

Unlock Hanoi hidden food gems.. Our guide Mango introduced us to restaurants we wouldn't have found ourselves. She explained the differences in food in north, central and south Vietnam during the tour, and explained more about Hanoi and Vietnamese culture. During the tour we tried a big variety of food, drink and even ice cream (welcome on a hot and humid evening). We got to know others on the tour around the old quarter and enjoyed the experience as a group.Highly recommended.

Tasty dishes with Hanoi street food. I describe myself as a big fan of food, so I booked a street food tour on the second day I came to Hanoi, I was rest on my first day tho. My friend and I had a great dinning with the guide, Mr. Lucky who took us through Hanoi's buzzing streets and chaotic traffic.

very enjoyable program. We got a very nice young girl as a tour guide.She has a very fun and enjoyable caracter with lot of knowledge.She told us lot of stories about the local habits.There were 8 people in the group.And we visited about 5 places to eat the local dishes.Excellent program.We enjoyed it very much.

Awesome & fun experience. We, a group of 12, spent a lovely evening strolling around Old Quarter with our guide Sunny, sampling a wide variety of dishes. Sunny was friendly, passionate and fun. We enjoyed the food tour tremendously. Highly recommended!!
Authentic Viet Food. Friendly guide who took us to good eats which we wouldn't have discovered ourselves! Would request for them again if I go to Hanoi again!

The best food we had in Hanoi. While in Hanoi, my boyfriend and I decided to start off our stay with this food tour. Miss Moon was our guide, and she has amazing taste. I am a major food enthusiast, and the food did not disappoint. During our stay in Hanoi, we got other recommendations from people for their favorite Bun Cha, Bahn Mi, etc, and none compared to Miss Moon's selections. She doesn't choose the most popular spot, but she does choose the best. Even though I didn't think we would, we ended up going back to a lot of the places Miss Moon took us on the tour. We even ran into her at one of the places a few days later, and she remembered us and sat down with us and chatted for a bit and gave us some pineapple she had. So sweet! I highly recommend this food tour! I miss that Bun Cha!

Terrific street food tour!. Signed up for the food tour at the tour agency about an hour before it started. We were taken to numerous stops and had the opportunity to try a variety of foods ranging from noodle dishes, fried dumplings, fresh and preserved fruits, banh mi, local beer and Vietnamese desserts and egg coffee in a 3 hour tour. Definitely got our money's worth. We were stuffed at the end.A perfect beginner's introduction to Vietnamese street food. Nothing too exotic, but everything was tasty!

Food tour of Old Quarter . Joined the tour as a solo traveller. Booked the tour that morning for the same day with no problems. Started off with a friendly welcome and the chance to try snails (if you wanted to!) then tried out 10 different little places around the old quarter. All the food was great and even tried some local fresh beer and egg coffee. Our guide was Mia (Phuong) she was brilliant, sweet and knowledgeable and her English was brilliant, she really made the tour for me! I would highly recommend this tour with Mia!

Awsome experience with mango. Our guide mango was so kind when i visited there was huge rain and i did not have rain coat or umbrella Mango offered free raincoat to members who do not have one We tried almost 10 food during 3hoursBesides food,mango gave us aome tour guide as wellthis is must try when you visit hanoi

Enjoyable and interesting food tour . Love this idea of walking the streets in old quarter to search for awesome Street food. Out guide Sunny is simply fantastic. Knowledgeable and accommodating! We truly enjoyed ourselves.

Great street food tour experience with tour guide Mango!. I did a walking street tour in the late afternoon with tour guide Mango and she was very enthusiastic and helpful in describing local food and Vietnamese culture to us. She was funny and told jokes along the way, and made the 3 hours fly by with many yummy foods. Definitely come hungry.Also very easy to walk into the tour agency office 10-15 min before the tour times, and sign up directly. The tour agency office is in a very central part of the old quarter near the lake. I also did a Cyclo tour which takes you around the streets of the Old Quarter and see everything at a leisurely pace and allow you to take photos without worrying about street traffic.
Great food tour with sunny . Really fun day with Sunny! Got to try some new and different foods we wouldn't have tried otherwise! Highly recommended!

Essential if new to Hanoi!. Did the tour on the night of 29th. Our guide Cherry was great and provided lots of information on all of the dishes we tried on the tour as well as Hanoi in general. She also very kindly bought us all waterproofs when it started to rain! Essential tour to orientate yourself, gain a bit of local knowledge and of course let you try all of the amazing dishes Hanoi has to offer. Thanks Cherry!

Great experience. The tour is really nice as it provides a good insight into Hanoi's street food variety. You discover a lot of dishes and places which you would never find on your own! However, there is too much food stops in total so that you can't really enjoy the last dishes as you are quite full in the end. Our guide Sunny was really helpful and did a great job.

So much fun with Miss Moon. My favorite experience in Hanoi. My party of 3 and 2 others walked around with Miss Moon. We went to many places but were told it was a secret. If i had it to do again I wouldn't eat as much at the first 2 or 3. All the food was wonderful. We learned a lot about walking around Hanoi and many customs of Vietnamese life. Every time we crossed the street she had us stay together like "sticky rice". Still makes me smile to think about Miss Moon.

Best way to eat food in Hanoi. We went on a fantastic walking street food tour with Cherry. We tried so many different dishes and went into places we usually would feel a bit unsure about or wouldn't even be able to find! Cherry was fun and created a lovely atmosphere for our group. A must-do for any visit to Hanoi.

Brilliant tour and introduction to Hanoi food!. Cherry was our guide and she was just lovely! She took us to 8 different locations and was very accomodating, purchasing water and ponchos for us! The food choices were also delicious. I highly recommend this tour!

excellent food tour!. Our tour was excellent and lead by Ms. Moon who was very funny and very informative. Although very authentic, very much catered to tourists, but no complaints, food was excellent!

You must do a food tour while in Hanoi!. We are not foodies and we loved every moment!!! Best thing we've done on our trip. We got to taste the best of the local and authentic cuisine and learn about the dishes. We now know what local dishes we like and have been able to order them as we go along our trip. We got to enjoy an exciting walk around the old quarter with all the hustle and bustle of the city. Our guide Ms Pheonix made us feel as though a close friend was proudly showing us around her home town. We loved the experience.

Wonderful food and awesome guide. The decision to book this food trip was the best decision that I made in Hanoi. The tour lasted for three hours, tried all together 10 different type of street foods. I would say the only limitation is your stomach. The food are so fresh and vibrant, without the guided tour there is no way that I will be able to find such many hidden gems in Hanoi Old quarter. What make the whole experience so special is Miss Moon, a very professional and extremely friendly and nice. She has great passion for food and will only show you to the place that is the best. U will not only eat the food but will have a good understanding on how it is made and also the origin. I highly recommend the tour and miss moon.

Fantastic tour with Mango. We took the tour with Mango and she was absolutely delightful to spend time with.We learnt a lot about Vietnamese food and also about the people. She was very knowledgeable and took great care of use while navigating from place to place.Thanks Mango - Sticky rice :)

Getting to know the Street Food. Anna pucked us up at the hostel and in the whole we were a funny gruop of 5 people. The choosen food and restaurants were great and Annas informations interesting. Her English and French is amazing fluent and she is taking care of the tastes and wishes of the whole group. Great experience! Thanks Anna

Fantastic!!!. Highly recommend the moped tour, we had a great time with our guides Money and Annie who were friendly, knowledgeable and spoke great English. Felt really save on the moped despite heavy traffic as they both drove us around so well. Tried many different dishes you would not normally have tried. The guides even wrote us a note with all the dishes we had and made more restaurant recommendations!

If you are a foodie, jump on board this tour. I did the walking street tour on the 9th May with Miss Moon and the phrase "sticky rice Miss Moon" remained etched in my mind as I attempted to cross streets throughout Vietnam.Miss Moon was enthusiastic and passionate and clearly loves good food! We had about 10 different foods and a local beer and I wasn't disappointed. The flavours of Hanoi are unique and you will be craving them from that day on.My ultimate favourite was the bo bia from the street cart with the fresh shredded coconut. Miss Moon wrote down all the foods we had and the addresses so we could go back if we wanted. The next evening I did exactly that and revisited some of these places.If you want an introduction to Vietnamese food and a flavour party in your mouth that you will forever dream of, I highly recommend this tour.And to Miss Moon, your beautiful smile and effervescent personality will be one I will always remember.

Delicious Food, Amazing Time. Our guide Sunny was great and did a wonderful job of introducing us to the various foods we enjoyed during our nearly 3 hour tour. All of the food was delicious, just be sure you come hungry because there is alot of it. I would definately recommend that anyone coming to Hanoi for the first time should take this tour, both for the food and the walk through the Old Quarter.

Hien was great!. Highly recommend Hien. At first I refused to travel by motorbike and I'm really glad I changed my mind. While the vehicle traffic looks like chaos to a pedestrian, when you are on the back of a motorbike, you realize that there is an orderly and safe flow to the traffic. All drivers know the "rules" and it definitely works. But I'd hate to see an American driver try to learn the "rules" on the fly.Back to the food tour, lots of very delicious food - banh cuon thit, bun rieu, bahn xao, nem lui, nem chua, nem cua, pho cuon, bun cha, and more. Loved it all. Spent xis hours on the tour! Hien is sweet and patient and (whew!) an excellent driver!

So much fun (and so much food)!. My husband and I booked a private tour for the two of us and got the fabulous Miss Moon as our tour guide. Her passion for Hanoi street food was completely infectious and she took us to a wonderful selection of places, all with delicious, fresh food to taste. My favourites included Bun Cha (BBQ pork noodle soup), papaya salad, spring rolls (fresh and fried), rice pancakes stuffed with pork and mushrooms, and the fresh fruit and coconut milk. The evening of gastronomy was topped off by a delicious Glass of Bia Hoi (fresh beer) and a cup of the famous Hanoi 'egg coffee' - absolutely divine. We were VERY full by the end of the evening. This tour is the perfect way to try some of the best food Hanoi has to offer - we tried (and loved) a lot of dishes that we possibly wouldn't have otherwise tried. Great value for money.

Must do Hanoi street food experience. Spent an awesome few hours with the delightful Miss Moon. Very knowledgeable and passionate about the different regional foods of Vietnam and Hanoi. Delicious food at each of the 7 stops we had. Lots of different foods we wouldn't have known to try and cafes we probably wouldn't have stopped at. Highlights were the BBQ pork noodle soup (Bun Cha), Pappaya salad, fruit salad and the Egg Coffee to end the eve.

Great introduction to Hanoi. This is one of the few trips we booked before our holiday - the first morning of our arrival into the country. As we're covering a lot of ground in just 2 weeks around Vietnam and Cambodia, we wanted to gain a quick understanding of the food and get some tips on Vietnamese culture and also how to navigate the streets. This tour did not disappoint! Because of its good reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked through Mr Anh of Awesome Travel. We were met by Ha at our hotel exactly at allotted time - we've learnt in the few days we've been in Vietnam that the Vietnamese are professional and great at time-keeping. Ha was great company, easy to chat with and enthusiastic. She was very knowledgeable and happy to answer any of our questions about the food and Vietnamese way of life. We tried a whole range of dishes at different stops, including egg coffee which is unique to Hanoi. It tasted great - definitely worth a try! Ha even stopped at a street vendor so we could try out some of the unusual fruits that we hadn't come across before such as mangolese and dragonfruit. Thank you, Ha. We would definitely recommend this tour.

Interesting way to explore Hanoi. I would recommend the street food tour on the first day of your visit. It's an interesting way to explore the streets of Hanoi, while trying the various street foods with a local guide. Some of the best foods we tasted in Hanoi was from the street food tour. Without the tour, I would probably not have tried the street food on my own and what a pity that would be!

Sunny rocks. Great learning and eating adventure. In and out of alleys, upstairs, downstairs, on the street corner and in the back room... What a great time we had with our host Sunny. Totally recommend this introduction to not only the food, but the in and outs of navigating Hanoi. Ask for Sunny..... Sticky Rice!!!!!

You need to do this if you visit Hanoi!. Booked for a group tour but as we were the only ones it ended up being just us and the lovely Miss. Moon who was very enthusiastic and knowledgable about the local street food and Hanoi in general. We had lots of fun along the way and it was definitely the best thing we did in Hanoi. Make sure you are hungry because you get a lot of food- we thought we would just get small tasters! Would recommend doing this at the start of your Vietnam trip so that you have an idea of what to eat and how to eat it ! To top off an excellent day Miss. moon suprised my dad with a birthday cake after finding out it was his birthday!!!

Motorbike Food Tour. Annie was our guide and we had so much fun trying all the local foods and riding around on the motorbikes. Felt very safe during the motorbike portion even though the driving is crazy there.

"Let's stick together like sticky rice!" . This was so much fun! Miss Moon is such nice tour guide! She made our "foodbaby" very happy not only with the delicious food she introduced us to but also with the passion she puts into her work. Very authentic and good experience!

Great way to explore the food!. Eating street food can be scary, especially since you have no idea what you're eating and whether it's safe. Besides the fact that I was on sensory overload and was afraid to cross the streets! Enter Kiwi, our adorable guide, who made us do "sticky rice" to get to the other side and to experience the best street food in Hanoi. By far, the most fun time we had on a tour!

Amazing tour. Highly recommend!. We had the pleasure of having our wonderful tour guide, Sunny, show us around the streets of Hanoi. We enjoyed wonderful street food that we never would have found without the tour. Thanks so much Sunny for a wonderful tour!!

Amazing night, great food tour. We were greeted by a smiling Sunny who's smile cut through the rainy wet evening we were having in Hanoi. Sunny awesome attitude completely made us forget about the gloomy weather. All the stops were delicious and we got a good taste of Vietnamese cuisine. My personal highlight was the crab soup. Awesome tour must in Hanoi.

So much delicious food!. Our amazing guide, Mango, took us to tons of different street food places dotted around the old quarter in Hanoi. She said the tour would take 3 hours but it ended up taking 4 hours because we were all having such a great time (and needed time to let the food go down so that we could fit the next dish in!!)We tasted 10 different dishes and Mango gave us lots of other tips of places to try whilst staying in Hanoi. I was in Hanoi on my own and it was very easy to chat to the rest of the group for the evening. Definitely do this if you'd like to learn about (and taste) Vietnamese food. It's delicious!

Fantastic taste of Hanoi Street food. Loved the street food guided tour. Happy to have opted for it and it was made excellent by a enthusiastic and dedicated tour guide, Li Ly. Totally worth it, especially if your are apprehensive about quality of a thousand Street food places and don't know what is the speciality of each restaurant. Wonderful 3 hours.

Fantastic introduction to Hanoi. We couldn't have asked for a better start to our trip in Hanoi. We did a private evening walking tour with Hien (Cherry - also known as cheerful Cherry). She sure lived up to her nickname! She was also down to earth, very knowledgeable and happy to answer all questions. This was a great way to sample the wonderful food of Hanoi. We left very satisfied with full stomachs!

Evening street food tour. My husband and I did the tour with Cherry on Friday night. Cherry was excellent guiding our group of six through the busy streets. The food was all delicious and we were very full by the end! Cherry was very good at answering all of our questions and very accomodating when we all wanted another beer! Would highly recommend the tour-it made it easy to enjoy the food rather than concentrating on where to go and not getting lost!

Great way to experience Vietnamese cuisine. Fantastic tour guide. We went to 6 different restaurants in the Old Quarter accompanied by Cherry who did a great job at explaining the different meals we were having and went out of her way to make us all comfortable (catering to people with allergies). A must do if in Hanoi.

Excellent tour with Mango!. This is more than just a food tour. Our guide, Mango, stopped us along the way to provide insight into the Vietnamese culture as well as specific facts on Hanoi. The food was delicious and we would never have experienced it without doing this tour. I would highly recommend it!

Great way to experience old quarters . Recommended way for first time tour of old quarters. The guide brings you to his favorite local stalls, share stories behind the stall keepers, the food and also gave us a glimpse into the private and quiet alleys of residence behind the busy and chaos row of shops

Great Food, Fantastic Tour Guide. Our tour guide, Lua, was great! She was friendly, knowledgable and clearly loved showing us around Hanoi and telling us about the culture. We ate 10 mini meals and so come hungry! From the Bun Cha to the Vietnamese Coffee, everything we ate was delicious. Overall a great introduction into Vietnamese food. And Lua's phrase for crossing the busy Hanoi street's together - sticky rice - became our slogan for the remainder of our trip. Worth $20.00 you'll pay!
You have to try!. You really have to try as the food is often of excellent quality and so cheap it would be sad to miss the atmosphere and the experience.

Excellent tour with Phoenix! . We had a private tour with Phoenix and it was just awesome. I would never have been introduced to such amazing food had we not done this whilst in Hanoi. Phoenix was an excellent guide with loads of knowledge and fantastic English. Oh.. did I mention that the food was amazing?!?!?

Phoenix is an amazing guide! !. Omg the food. The egg coffee! ! Phoenix was so lovely and explained all about the local food and even wrote us a little list at the end of everything we tried so we could go back and try more of what we liked! ! ♡♡Thank you Phoenix!!

Great night with Cherry!. My partner and I decided to do a food tour fairly last minute and were pleased to find that it was just us that booked that night so we had our lovely guide Cherry all to ourselves! Cherry made the tour great by taking us to all the great local eateries that make the most delicious Vietnamese food! Make sure you don't eat lunch before you go!Keep up the great work!

Hanoi food street tour. This tour is worth it with only 20usd for 3hrs with all the local food in Hanoi! Miss moon was great in introducing us the food and explain well for us to understand! Will recommend it to my friends!!

Not Worth The Money. We paid $40 each. Yes we were full at the end but the meals were very small, costing maybe $2/meal x 6 meals that's $12. That means that we paid $40-$12 worth of food =$28 value of...??? Also, our guide did not eat the food with us. Which made us feel like the food is not to her standards, why are we eating it then? Food itself was okay, we only liked 2 stops. Following day we both felt a bit ill. The cleanliness of the street food places we feel may be attributed to this.

STREET FOOD IN OLD QUARTER, HANOI. The one of the amazing things that can relish in Hanoi is the Street Food stalls along most of the streets if Old Quarters.Every turn you take it will take you back to about 30-40 years Asian way of life. If you are a must savour local food person, then this is the right place to go. You can find on the streets most local dishes, while the tiny restaurants do offer western and other Asian food.Street food are very reasonably priced, while those at the restaurants are quite pricey.However, a word of caution, street food may not be 100% clean, but if you have the stomach for it, there is no harm trying.Have the experience of sitting around with the locals in street drink shops and munch away with melon seeds. It is an experience which you will never find in a developed country.Try the local fruit cocktails with various condiments at these sidewalk shops. They are pretty good.

Very nice tour with guide "Mango" :-). I can really recommend this tour. We had 10 different dishes and drinks! On top of it Mango gave us additional information about the city and the vietnamese culture! Great :-)
Great insight to street food culture. Very interesting and informative. Lily was excellent guide and explained the different foods as well as the cultural aspects.

Great way to spend an evening!. We really enjoyed our evening with Hanoi street food tours. Our guide Lua was very welcoming, kind and informative. Her English was very good too and she was very fast to find dishes catering to the vegetarian in our group. Lua took us to 8 different places and we tried at least 8-10 different dishes and drinks. We were so full by the end of the tour, no room for another bite! It was really a great introduction to Hanoi and lovely to walk around the Old Quarter in the evening. We highly recommend taking a private tour, we were 2 people paying 30 USD each and it made it really easy to ask questions and engage with the guide. Thank you Lua for a great evening!

A great way to experience the food of Hanoi & Phoenix was excellent!. We had heard good things about this tour so decided to do it as our first experience in Hanoi. We did the evening walk on Wednesday 18th May 2016 and our guide was Phoenix. We had a great group of people on the tour and Phoenix was fantastic. We experienced many different types of food and Phoenix ensured that we had just the right amount at each stop. I highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting Hanoi. Big thanks to Phoenix for making it a great experience.PS don't eat too much before the tour. There is heaps of food.

Exciting & delicious. We visited 7 different places that we would have never went to if we were on our own, because those places were quite hidden. We enjoyed the 3 hours tour a lot as our guide, sunny, was very funny and lovely when showing us around. The food was soo amazing and filling. Thanks sunny, definitely would recommend to do this tour!
Good. I will back this city and used food street in Hanoi. The people here were nice and friendly. Funny city

Worth. This was first experience with both the old quarter and Vietnamese neighborhood dishes. Tour guide was educated, eager and amicable. We attempted nourishment and ate at spots that we'd not thought about and would presumably have missed or never investigated. Would absolutely prescribe the nourishment visit in ha noi.

Well worth doing. Our Tour guide miss Moon was fantastic , great fun, full of energy and really knowledgeable about all the food we ate. You will not go hungry on this trip so be prepared to eat a lot. Great price as well for a $20 group tour i assumed that just included having a guide to show you around but it covers the cost for all food and drink eaten during the tour as well.

You Must Do This. But make sure you have a Tour Guide with you who can make sure that you get to the best places. We went back to a place without him and they took the mickey out of us. You have to do this though, what an experience

Street food was an amazing experience. Our street tour guide took us to the best places with the best food! We even got to try the local beer. Loved every minute of our tour :) thank you sunny for a great evening we would definitely recommend this to otheres

Couldn't fault it. Anh our guide was diminutive in stature but full of knowledge and interesting information. Started in market and saw the fresh produce then went to various places starting with vietnamese bagette, then steamed rice pancakes with pork, BBQ meat including frog and then delicious fruit dessert. Finally an egg coffee at the place it was invented (Giang).Left you with a feel for what street food is all about but also served as a good intro to the old quarter. Anh was great and we loved the sticky rice approach to crossing roads.
Great experience!. Our guide Mango was great and led us to 10 tastings around Hanoi's Old Quarter. It was a great way to sample the delicious street food - you should definitely come hungry!
Great!. We really liked this tour, one of the best things we did in Hanoi and Vietnam. Our tour guide Mango was really nice, funny and knowledgeable. Can recommend!

Great afternoon with Ms Moon:) . We did this tour on our third and last day in Hanoi but think it's a great way to discover the city on your first day. We stopped at 10 places in total, trying all types of Vietnamese dishes from bun cha, pho, pillow cake, papaya salad, pancakes, fruit salad and even local beer! And we ended up with a egg coffee which was yummy even though we were a bit reluctant first. It's a great way to spend $20 in Hanoi, and our guide miss Moon was super fun!

Fun!. Cherry was a great tour guide. She was very pleasant, fun and knowledgeable. You get to eat a huge amount of food and drink on this tour, all quite tasty. Come hungry! Definitely worth the time and money.

Unmissable. This was the highlight of my trip to Ha Noi. The smells and site had been wonderful to see during the day if wondering around the town, but one is always wary of buying something that is literally served on the side of a dirty street. Taking a tour means that the guide has (or should have!) been there before and made sure that clients do not get sick. The Asian stomach and the western one are not the same and you mush make sure that they allow for western sensitivities while still giving you the full experience. If you can, get the guide to finish off the tour in beer corner. Never iN my life have I seen such a hectic place not had a couple of beers literally sitting in the street drinking beer. An experience I will never forget. Highly recommended.

Great way to find food highlights. Our guide, Moon was friendly and gave us lots of interesting asides about Hanoian food culture. We went back several times to one of the restaurants she took us to, and she showed us a dessert sold from a street cart that I never would have tried otherwise, and it blew my mind. There was a family with a ten year old boy in our group, and there was plenty for him to try even though he was a picky eater.

Very interesting, but. This was really interesting, unique experience. It is marketed as an example of that habit by locals to eat in street "restaurants". Well, I walked twice the streets, it was amazing, some of the sea foods presented were what I dreamed of: fresh razor-blade shells, crabs, oysters, sea urchins. And all fantastic fresh fish. Moreover, there is also the typical and popular "pho" (a soup with rice-noodles to which chicken, pork, vegetables may be added). But the apparent sanitary conditions may repel many of trying all this (literally cooking and washing dishes in the street).

Excellent experience. Was recommended this tour, by another traveller we met on route and we weren't disappointed. Our guide Miss Moon was knowledgable and very entertaining. We tried many foods in places we wouldn't have previously chosen a real eye opener. Excellent value for money and great food.

Great experience, worth it!. Street Food Walking tour is a great way to experience the varieties of Vietnamese foods in 3 hours. This tour company did an excellent job to show us the local food scenes in the old quarter of Hanoi. Our guide, Mango is great, entertaining and has wealth of information. We have a small walking group, Mango, myself and 3 other couples. We stopped at 9 locations and had 14 different types of foods & drinks. Great foods, fun and recommended to join while in Hanoi.

Excellent walking tour. This walking tour of Hanoi was an excellent way to know some of the local foods that Vietnam has to offer. Our guide, Pheonix was delighful, she took us to places I would have never even thought of going into, or found by myself. She even provided suggestions afterwards for the rest of my time in Hanoi. I'd highly recommend doing this on your first day as it helps to get to see a different side of Hanoi and know where to go after!
Mango Mango!!!. Excellent tour. Well worth the money. Tried lots of food and a few drinks. Our guide Mango was brilliant and very informative! Sticky rice!!

Best food so far in Hanoi. An interesting walk around the old city at night with 8 tasty food stops along the way. Our guide , Lily, was a sweetie who really new her dishes. A good mixed group of 8.from 4 nations helped make the evening a success.

Walking food tour. Booked on regular walking tour for 20usd. Only 2 of us so cherry our guide was able to answer all our questions and show us our of the way interesting and varied food.would recommend this tour

Brilliant food and fabulous your guide. Like many people, we found these guys through Trip Advisor ('well, you can't go wrong with the #1 Hanoi food tour,' we'd guessed), and fortunately this trip didn't disappoint. The guide Duong (nicknamed Pixie) was really excellent - very knowledgable and enthusiastic for food and her culture.Really nice mix of restaurants, small local kitchens and street food. Highlights included the Bun Cha, Banh Cuon Thit and Che. (Actually, throw in the fresh beer - brewed that day - and egg coffee too). More than the food, it opened our eyes to a new part of Hanoi we'd yet to see. Highly recommended for the start of your trip to Hanoi, so you'll be able to get the most of your subsequent food stops in the city.Thanks again Pixie

Awesome private tour with Lilly. So glad we did this. Lilly took us to tasty places we would not have otherwise discovered on our own. She also explained some of the meaning and culture behind the food and the neighborhood. Would highly recommend! We did the private tour which was only $10 more than the other option. Do not miss the egg coffee!

A Highlight of Hanoi. The food tour of the old quarter was recommended to us by our concierge from the La Siesta Hotel and was one of the highlights of our time in Hanoi. Long our guide was knowledgable and great company and a great advocate for Hanoi and the La Siesta. Would highly recommend.

Don't eat breakfast . My husband and I only had two days in Hanoi so chose to do this tour on our second day here. Unfortunately we made the rookie error of eating breakfast before the 11am tour which went for three hours. Our guide was the fantastic Miss Moon who throughly explained each dish and took us on a tour of Hanoi's best street food. Highlights including miss moon telling us her large dog was called Susan and the coconut and sugar cane wraps-delicious. This is a great tour and lucky you if you get Miss Moon to guide you around. Worth every cent. Good luck Miss Moon on one day getting your own tour guide company!

A great experience. Met our tour guide Miss Moon who didn't stop talking for the whole time we were out very informative and off we went. There is street food available on every street a lot I personally would not want to eat. This is the beauty of this type of tour all the places we visited have been vetted by the tour company, an enjoyable experience not to be missed many thanks Miss Moon from (the funny man)

Amazing food, fun trip. Great food - 8 different dishes, make sure you're hungry! There was a fantastic variety for all tastes and palates and it was fun exploring Hanoi with our informative and super-friendly guide Lua. Definitely recommend this to get underneath the sometimes-bewildering choices of street food Hanoi has to go offer.

Amazing and super delicious! . We couldn't have had a better guide! Hien ( nickname Cherry) took us to places we would never have found or considered trying, unless we'd taken this tour. Lots of places looked like family restaurants; the Vietnamese home cooking was delicious. Good variety of restaurants and different street foods. Cherry was the perfect host. Really knowledgeable, passionate about food and her culture, and made the tour great fun! Until this tour, I never thought much of Asian desserts, but this opened my eyes and I can't recommended them more. Super fresh, sweet and delicious. Thanks again Cherry for a memorable evening!

Fun, informative and tasty. I was very fortunate, my guide, Cherry, and the three other members (two Aussies and one Kiwi) of our tour were simply fun to be with. Cherry was fun, funny, informative, helpful and a pleasure to be with for our 3+ hour tour.I highly recommend this tour.
So yummy!. We loved the tour and Sunny was fantastic! We tried lots of new foods, went to places we would have never known even existed and loved them all! Highly recommend this tour.

Great way to sample everything!. The tour was great! Did the walking dinner tour 5pm slot. Our guide Ms Moon was knowledgeable and spoke good English. Food was great. The Bun Cha, Bo Pia and egg coffee were the highlights for me. We were wondering around hanoi and found it so difficult to order food. The locals didn't really understand English and we were left guessing most of the time. This tour takes groups mostly to the small lanes and hidden gems of the city.At the end of the tour, Ms Moon also kindly listed the places that we visited provided the names of the dishes that we ate should we choose to visit the places ourselves. She also recommended another breakfast and dinner option :)The tour was the highlight of my trip - really enjoyed it
Great & cheap tour. I had outstanding experience in this tour, knowledgeable guide. Brightly nice food with local approach. Will back next holiday!

Great range and value. Excellent introduction to a dozen of Hanoi's favourite dishes. Great value. Very easy. Everything was delicious. Our guide Phoenix spoke English very well and was generous while also keeping us moving.

Best Activity in Hanoi. Fantastic introduction to all the amazing and delicious street food in Hanoi. Our guide Cherry was great and taught us so much about the local food while taking us to tons of little places we'd never find on our own. We even had an opportunity to try out hand at making some rice pancakes.This is a must-do in Hanoi and something you won't soon forget!
Marie Martin. Very interesting tour with variety of food.Tour guide was very imformative in explaining the different food provided.

Not to be missed!. What a fantastic way to spend 3 hours wandering the streets of the old quarter tasting traditional Vietnamese food. Our guide was Miss Moon and she was fabulous. Best tour guide ever 11/10, I would give her 6 stars if I could. A wealth of information about Vietnam and not just about the food. If you want to take the tour and don't have any allergies, be adventurous and try everything as it would be a shame to miss out. AND don't eat beforehand as you want to be able to enjoy the experience. Thank you Miss Moon; we had so much fun.

Great way to try traditional food!. Went on this tour on our first stop in Vietnam and so glad we did, otherwise would have missed out on knowing and trying the traditional food which we later on saw through the rest of our travels and we were not afraid to try. Our guide sunny was great, giving us information and showing us some sights enroute. There was also a couple of vegetarians in the group which she was able to accomodate at each stop. You get so full by the end of the 3 hours but it's a great experience and recommend you do as soon as you get to Hanoi.

Great introduction and experience in Hanoi. A must! . We went on the 5pm tour with Pixie. There were 9 of us in total and I think we had 8 stop offs. Definitely arrive hungry as you'll roll home! The trip intersperses info about Hanoi (although with big group and busy bustling Hanoi can be difficult to hear what the guide is saying) and obviously info about the food evolution and culture which was great. It is a perfect introduction to Vietnamese street food and being taken into some places and back streets you would never find if you were not a seasoned visitor. It's nice to be taken to places you feel can be trusted if you're slightly apprehensive about street food (which annoyingly I am!). The courses alternate between savoury and sweet. My favourite was the first place we went for Bun Cha and my husbands was the grilled pork. I also loved the ice cream we were introduced to and ate lots more before we left. Pixie was lovely and informative and really amazing at answering questions and dealing with allergies and dislikes (you are asked at the beginning of the tour). Some people wanted to learn more about the actual cooking process so a little token guidebook/recipe book to cover some of the things we try, or a list of where we go and what we eat (the names etc) would be really useful. Pixie wrote it down on paper after it was requested which was above and beyond, and so really great. But I suspect many more would like this so it's something that they could offer...even email it to everyone if printing is too expensive. In summary, we were absolutely thrilled we went on this tour and would highly recommend it. 3 hours of eating delicious food (I was personally really pleased it was mainly pork dishes and prawn and nothing such as dog) exploring Hanoi, learning the culture and navigating the crazy roads is a wonderful intro into a very busy and culturally rich city.

Amazing. This visit was exceptional. We experienced Hanoi and had us test a few sorts of astounding road nourishment. On top of an incredible visit, Ms. Moon was likewise comical and an impact to stroll around the city for 3-hours with. It's unquestionably an "absolute necessity do" for foodies in Vietnam.
Hanoi Food street tour. So great. Excellent and very exceptional. Important choice and mandatory for anyone visiting Hanoi. Egg coffee was the best.

Excellent way to be introduced to Vietnam and Hanoi. We had a wonderful night food tour with Phoenix on 25th April. This is our first visit to Vietnam. Her knowledge of the food, sense of fun and excellent english made for the best introduction to Hanoi. We highly recommend this tour to see a different type of Hanoi. We're a couple in our 50's and we can't wait to come back!

Wonderful tour with Duong!. My sister and I loved the tour, not only was our guide, Duong, lovely and informative, but it was a great chance to wander some back alleys and end up at some restaurants and food carts we wouldn't have otherwise. The tour is 3 hours with lots of food stops, so come hungry!We took the 5pm tour and hit up Bia Corner afterward -- was a great night!

Great way to try something new. It's a must do if you are in Hanoi - the city has amazing food, but typically the menu's are in vietnamese, and frankly it's hard to know what and where to try. Our tour guide was great and we loved being able to join a few other travelers. Just make sure to come hungry and save room for the end! Also the walking is pretty minimal for anyone worried about that.

Five star food tour with Phoenix . Phoenix was a wonderfully knowledgeable, funny, kind and adept tour guide. We had a great time sampling delicious dishes of Hanoi. We were a group of seven people --- mixture of family and friends of different ages (27 to 62) and dietary restrictions (vegetarian, spice sensitive and spice lover). Our vegetarian member had just as much fun and as many food options as the rest of us. The Bun cha was the first and best dish of the day! The egg coffees and cocoas were different and quite tasty. Phoenix navigated the traffic and roadways quite well with our large group. We did the tour on our first day and her guidance and suggestions were all very helpful even beyond the food tour. She followed up the tour with emAiled suggestions about wedding dress tailors and even offered to help us with communicating more complex conversations. I highly recommend Phoenix and this tour for those that are interested in a friendly and knowledgeable introduction to Hanoi's food and culture.

Great tour and great guide. We took a tour our first day in Hanoi with Cherry, who was absolutely wonderful! Not only did she take us to places we could eat delicious food, but she also told us a lot about Hanoi and Vietnam that proved helpful for the rest of the trip. A must do early in your trip to Hanoi.

Great way to find excellent street food. My husband and I had a great night with the Hanoi Street Food Tour. Our guide Cherry was brilliant, answering any questions that we had beyond the food. We were taken to places that we would never had found by ourselves and enjoyed amazing Vietnamese street food. We have been able to find the places again by ourselves, enjoying the food with locals. This tour is a must :)

Loved this tour. We loved this tour during a recent trip to Hanoi. We took it on our first evening in the city and it was a great introduction to Hanoi. We visited seven street food locations in the old quarter with our guide, Mango. She took us to simple but great places to try different foods and drinks and knows everything about local food. We finished with "egg coffee" a treat not to be missed. At 20 dollars, this tour is a great bargain

Delicious food adventure. Went out tonight led by Lua. She was a good guide through the bustling streets. It was the 6:30pm tour so the streets were very busy. We visited at least eight places and tried a variety of things. It was a lot of food and beer so definitely go hungry. She handled the three people with dietary restrictions well. Even though it was late we didn't need to wait long for food and usually had a place to sit.

Couldn't eat another thing. Ms. Moon showed a group of 4 of us to a great night of food and information. Excellent guide who not only gave us good food but a very interesting insite into Hanoi itself.

A Highlight in Hanoi!. I booked this tour having read the Trip Advisor reviews. It was brilliant! I was traveling on my own and it was the perfect way to explore the Old Quarter and try the street food that the locals enjoy. Miss Moon was our guide and she was lively, informative and full of funny anecdotes. We stopped at 8 food stalls finishing with egg coffee. Not to be missed!

Fun way to enjoy dinner in Hanoi. Sunny was a great guide - very informative about Hanoi and the food we were sampling, but also a lovely fun person to lead the group. The tour was enjoyable and the food was all good, although I would have preferred a slightly more adventurous selection of dishes (skip the bahn mi for some grilled eel?). We had a nice group of 8 so it was a fun social evening, the downside was it was a little hard for everyone to follow the explanations of the dishes at times. Overall well worth your time and money!

Go for the tour during lunch and skip breakfast. We went on the 11am tour and were glad that we did as most of the food places did not have a queue.Make sure not to eat breakfast as you would be so full at the end. I think this tour is best done as one of the first things on your trip as it gives you a good understanding of how to avoid tourist traps, and the significance of certain streets.Food wise, nothing really blew my mind but that may be just my tastebuds. However, our guide Miss Moon wrote down more food places to try after the tour and that was a nice touch.

Brilliant first night in Vietnam. Totally recommend this food street tour to try food that you would probably just walk past. Doung (Pixie) is a brilliant guide and we learned how to negotiate the streets and culture through the food. My friend has allergies and there wa always something different for her. Also she gve us tips of other things to se and do in Hanoi. A great first night!!!

Street food walking tour - great fun and value! . We showed up at Kim's tours a bit before 11 and easily got a place on street food walking tour at 11 - no fuss. It ended up being a group of 8 of us (plus a small child), it wasn't too many - it was a really friendly group and the guide, Phoenix, was great at making sure we were all crossing the road together and able to hear the information she was sharing throughout the walk. I had been a bit worried about it being a bit expensive at 20 dollars but after 6 dishes at some of the most famous places among local we would never have known to go otherwise and drinks (beer and fresh beer) included along the way, it really was great value for money. Phoenix was also one of the best guides we've had in Vietnam with great English. This tour is a great thing to do just as you arrive in Hanoi as then you can go back to some of the fantastic places!

Great Family Evening. Our family can recommend this tour. Our guide Phoenix provided a really good tour showing us some of the street foods of Hanoi. In fact, the places were so good that we returned to a few of them a couple days later!We recommend taking the tour early in your visit so you have a chance to revisit your favourites.

Do it on your first day. We did a group tour for street food walking (US$20 per person) at 6:30 pm on Wednesday, and we were the only people in the group, so in the end, it became our private tour. Our guide, Phoenix (English nick name, translation of her Vietnamese name) was excellent guide, very friendly, and her English was excellent. I recommend that you do this tour on the first day, so that you know what to order throughout the trip.투어를 여행 첫날 하는걸 강추합니다!

Great introduction to the streets and food of Hanoi. We had a private tour for the two of us 4 hours after arriving in Vietnam. What a perfect introduction to the Old Quarter as it can seem a little overwhelming at first but having a guided tour helps you embrace the charm of this city. My partner is gluten intolerant but our wonderful guide (Pixie) was able to advise on what could and could not be eaten. We ate amazing food in places that we would never have thought of going to ( or could have found ) . Pixie not only described the food but gave us a potted history of Hanoi. She was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. We ate in 8 different places and had our first taste of egg coffee which was lovely. We had a great time and would highly recommend you do this tour at the start of your holiday.

A wonderful time eating our way through Hanoi!. Duong (Pixie) was a fantastic guide who showed us not only the food but also some of the sights along the way! She shared her knowledge of the culture and characteristics that make Hanoi special. We really enjoyed our time with her and she was able to answer any questions in a caring manner. It was a great way to see the city and try all sorts of local food. We would highly recommend her!
Great Introduction. Ms. Moon was an exceptionally knowledgeable guide. She introduced us to ten different foods in a most interesting walk through the Old Quarter.

Very interesting and fun.. This was our introduction to both the old quater and Vietnamese local dishes. Hiem (aka Cherry) was our guide. She was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and very friendly. We tried food and ate at places that we'd not known about and would probably have missed or never explored.Would totally recommend the food tour in hanoi.

An awesome, delicious way to start your vacation in Hanoi!. We did the 5pm 3-hour tour on our first day in Hanoi. It was a great way to visit local food joints and discover a variety of Vietnamese foods. And our guide Sunny was really sweet and wonderful. :) Make sure to come hungry! (seriously, it's a lot of food...)

Ask for miss Moon!!. Miss Moon was the best food tour guide and so hilarious and witty. She will give you all the fascinating details of local Hanoi cuisine and social customs, ask her about weasel coffee and wedding photo shoots. She was wonderful and her "sticky rice" method for crossing the street was very effective. Thanks miss moon! Ciao! -Liza and John

Great food. The food was very nice, tour throughout the old quarter with our guide Sunny. Would like to recommend this tour. Good informative tour, different flavors, some inside (can be a bit hot on warm nights) and some outside. Bun cha & black rice caramel were my personal favorites!

Lua was the best. Lua made our tour very enjoyable. She was extremely knowledgable, charismatic and thoroughly enjoyable to be around. The food was great, the amount of people in the group tour was perfect and overall it was a great experience. I reccomend this tour to anyone traveling to Hanoi. Theres a reason why its one of the best tours in Vietnam.Thank you Lua,Skyler and Jill

Thank you, Ms. Moon!. So glad we did an afternoon food tour with Ms. Moon on our first day in Hanoi. We ate delicious food that we would otherwise have had no idea about and Ms. Moon also gave us plenty of tips (safety, where else to eat for the rest of our stay, things to do) for our stay in Hanoi. She was friendly, sweet, funny, and very accommodating. Her English was great and she took great care of us. Loved the entire experience. And we were stuffed by the end! Thank you Ms. Moon!!

Thanks Lua. Lua was a great guide, who gave us a glimpse at the old city, and all the cuisine it offers. Very recommended experience for your first day in Hanoi. The tour is very intimate - one guide for every 4 persons. Lua was very kind and friendly, and spoke English very well. Ask for Lua and come HUNGRY!

Fantastic tour. We had such a brilliant time on the street food tour, I would recommend this to anyone! So much food but it was all great! If you're unsure what foods to order in Vietnam I would recommend this at the start of your trip as you get to try so much. Rocky the tour guide was brilliant and we had a great time! One of my favourite parts of our trip to Vietnam. Thank you!

Get to experience the real Hanoi. Get a real feel of the street food of Vietnam, You will try many things that you would not if you did not join this tour. Try it as soon as you can and you wont have any problems getting a snack anywhere in VietnamGreat value for money
Delicious foodtour! . The foodtour was great. Great and clean food at places we would never try out just by ourself. We tried a lot different good food.

A taste of Hanoi . If you are in Hanoi, you must do a street food tour! It's in the Old Quarter and you are able to try a lot of items that you might skip if you weren't with someone who speaks the language and can explain what it is you are eating! You will eat where the locals eat and learn about the area so that you can return the next night on your own and know exactly what to order and where to go! Delicious! The food is fine to eat...don't be afraid to try!

Come hungry. Myself and my partner went on this street food tour. I would advise that you come starving as there is so much food. We both really enjoyed this as it gives you a chance to try some places that otherwise you would not try. It is well worth doing.

Do it first thing when you get there!. We booked a group tour with Sunny and had a wonderful time. We did the afternoon walking tour and tried about 7 different dishes. Sunny lived up to her name in her personality and was happy to answer all questions. She even wrote down everything we tried so we could try the different foods again. A highlight was the rice paper rolls which we helped make ourselves. Another plus is that there are western style toilets available throughout the tour. This was a great way to sample the wonderful food of Hanoi.

Excellent food and tour. Highly recommend this tour particularly a the start of your hol as it gives you a taster of the great food to come. We went to a fantastic range of places and Mia our guide was so friendly and knowledgeable. Thanks for a great tour. Do make sure you are hungry as you do eat alot on this tour.

A brilliant way to dive into Hanoi at night that takes all the stress out of exploring an unfamiliar city. Our guide, Sunny, was a cheerful, friendly navigator of a whole variety of spots we'd never have noticed or found too intimidating to try, especially in the middle of the craziness of Saturday night in the city and the melee of scooters and people it involves. We opted to pay the extra $10 per head for a private tour, and for us it made sense - trying to navigate the back streets in a big group would have been daunting. We found the tour perfectly paced - over three hours we sampled pho, bun cha, spring rolls, dumplings, banh mi and several other dishes, with a short walk between each. As a sit-down dinner it would probably have been too much, but the ability to burn a few calories between courses made the difference.As a way to jump into the middle of Hanoi at night without the stress of navigating and paying at each stall/restaurant (never mind finding them in the first place) I think this tour is ideal. Thanks again to Sunny for introducing us to some wonderful food and nightlife!(アプリの不具合で日本語のコメントを書き込まない限り文字数がカウントされず投稿できないので日本語でも短めのコメントを添えます。)ハノイのストリートフード入門・街そのものを体験するのに最適なツアー。行き交うスクーターと人ごみの中で絶対に気付かない、あるいは気付いたとしても入っていけないようなローカルなお店を数多く紹介してもらえる。値段は前払いで30ドルとリーズナブル(プライベートツアーの場合)。この値段に全ての料理と飲み物が含まれるので頻繁に財布を出して支払いをするストレスもない。しかも食べ物のクォリティは抜群に良く、代表的なベトナム料理はだいたいカバーされている(フォーなどの麺類、春巻、エッグコーヒー、バインミーなどなど)。ガイドのサニーちゃんは経済学部卒業したての大学生でとっても明るく人懐っこい性格だったので自分たちも全くストレスなくハノイの夜を満喫できました。絶対にお勧めのツアーです。

Excellent food tour . My husband and I did the group walking street food tour on a busy Saturday night and loved it! Our guide Lua was great, spoke English well and made sure to keep us safe in the very busy traffic and also very informed about what we were eating and how to eat it. We also loved the little bits of Vietnam history and culture she added which made it very informative as well.The tour is a great introduction to Vietnamese street food and I would definitely recommend doing it early in your visit to learn what and where to eat. We went to about 9 or 10 places in the old quarter and the price was very affordable at $20 USD and definitely worth it.

Very well done. This tour was great. We went to some really small shops that we would not have tried on our own. Solid food throughout, but Cafe Duy Tri and the small near Cầu Đông were the highlights.

Delicious food & Mango was a FANTASTIC guide!. This street food tour was the highlight of our trip to Hanoi. We were so impressed with the taste and amount/variety of stops on the trip. We highly recommend doing this on your first night (as we did) because it is a great intro to Vietnamese food culture. I would consider this a must do in Hanoi. On top of that, our guide Mango was fantastic! She spent hours talking about her culture and we learned so much about Vietnam beyond the food. Her sense of humor and warm demeanor made for a fun night out with the group. Highly recommend this tour & requesting her if at all possible.

Tour with Mrs Moon was faboulos. We (family with one 8 year old) booked the bicycle and food tour at 4pm. The bicycle tour was fun, however please note that the pollution in Hanoi is very high. But you will see lots of the Old Town.Afterwards we did the Food tour with lovely Mrs Moon. She is a great tour guide and speaks very good English. We visited about 7 or 8 different restaurants and sampled beautiful food. I almost gave up after the third one as it is plenty of food, but its clever organised as you will get fruit salad in between and feel refreshed, so you can start with more hearty food again! Mrs Moon even helped us organise a taxi after the tour as we were to tired to walk afterwards (especially our son). Would book this tour again!!

Fun with food!. Had an amazing time trying some very delicious food. Phoenix our guide was exceptional. She ensured that everyone was catered for and even provided a list of what we had afterwards...which was great because their was so much! We did this our first night in Hanoi (and Vietnam) and was a fantastic way to get an introduction to the food. Phoenix even provided some history and cultural knowledge that made the whole experience even more enjoyable!

Great authentic experience. Great experience doing the street food tour with miss Moon. She was very friendly, motivated and well-knowing about all the food and places. It was a truly authentic tour at local places we never ever would have visited! I will definitely recommend it!

Awesome guide and awesome food! . - our guide Cherry is super nice and knowledgable , good English and fun to talk to - went to 10 places at least to try different food and they have special small portion for us so we r not too full after the first few courses - the places are really hidden in small lanes that u will never find or dare to eat if without their guide - so full after eating, we were offered nice local beer and egg coffee, so special!

By far our Favorite activity in Hanoi. We had a great tour leader Cherry! She was so upbeat and loved sharing her knowledge of Hanoi and it delicious food. Egg coffee was our favorite. Loved being having to get the opportunity to go into some of the owners homes for a meal - such a great experience to see what real life looks like in Hanoi. Would definitely recommend!

A delicious adventure on motorbike!. Hanoi is a vibrant city and this is the way to experience it - weaving in and out of traffic on the back of a scooter. My wife and I love to seek out off-the-beaten-track experiences and the Hanoi Food Tour fit the bill perfectly. The food was delicious, the tour exhilarating and informative. Mostly, it was just FUN. Our tour guide, the charming Miss "Money", truly seemed to enjoy sharing the food and customs of Hanoi. We had some special food requests (I'm not a huge fan of some seafood) and they accommodated us easily. Recommended.

Delicious street food & a lovely guide. I went on a walking street food tour and enjoyed it a lot. Our guide Pixie led us to corners of Hanois old quarter we wouldn't have found ourselves and invited us to street kitchens and dishes I wouldn't have tried if I was exploring on my own. Moreover she shared interesting stories and information about the areas we passed and the dishes and drinks we tasted. This is definitely a must-do when in Hanoi!
Great trip . We had a great trip with miss moon and thoroughly enjoyed the experience . This is amuse for for first time travellers to Hanoi

Aussie Adventurers Abroad. We did a walking tour we found on Trip Adviser. We went to many areas we wouldn't have known of or tried. The food was cheap and reasonable. The tour lasted a good three hours. Our guild was Vietnamese with good English. We had about 5 courses including soft drinks and beer.

Great start to our Hanoi visit. After some initial confusion...pre-booked our tour online, confirmed same day. Told to arrive at 6-15, but got there at 6-20 to be told no spaces left now on 6-30 tour as we are late. Had to join the 7-00pm tour? Also, the 7-00pm tour is more expensive than 6-30... This was soon forgotten as we started our tour with Cherry, very enthusiastic girl who made the evening a fantastic experience.The tour took us to places that we would never have tried if we weren't on this tour but that only made it much more of a special treat for us. We only had 6 on our tour which was a lovely amount to get to know the others throughout the evening.We started with Bun Cha, then moved on to try beef and papaya salad. On again and pork skewers from a street cart, then some savoury pancakes which we all had a go at making ourselves, great fun.The after stopping at the cathedral on for a beer and 'beer food' and then to dessert (probably the best I've ever tasted) coconut ice cream and black coffee flavoured sticky rice with yoghurt. Finally on to get an egg coffee to finish the evening off. A strange concept to us but really delicious. Along the way we learned some history of Hanoi and a couple of Vietnamese words, as well as how to conquer crossing the roads..Everything we ate and drank was included in the price, we thought excellent value.I would highly recommend this tour....be brave and go for it.!

Excellent experience, most memorable. Took the 3-hour motorcycle tour at 6:00pm on our first day, and turns out to be a perfect decision. Annie was our guide together with her band of riders who took our small group of 4 as pillions. While the places we visited could technically be within reach of walking, but weaving through the "organised chaos" of the Hanoi traffic (safely, of course) is not to be missed.The street food experience felt just right in the evening, with throngs of locals all around as well on the Friday evening. And the food choices? Diverse yet each so very palatable.Tummies were filled by the end of 2 hours, but the additional hour brought further delights from the street vendors of Hanoi. Annie was patient, knowledgeable and sincere with an excellent command of English. She also very kindly wrote down all the names, description and addresses of the food that we tried, with additional recommendations that we could not cover. We covered the rest on our later days in the trip and also went back for more for those that we particularly loved. Could not be happier!Zero qualms in recommending this tour. If you're short on time or are a small eater, try the 2 hour version. If you're terrified of riding on a motorcycle, take the walking tour. At the end of the day, you will get to know the streets and the food like you would very unlikely to be able to on your own, and certainly not in that short span of time.

Perfect Tour with Ms. Moon. At only $20 USD, this tour was outstanding. Ms. Moon took us through Hanoi and had us sample several types of amazing street food. On top of a great tour, Ms. Moon was also hilarious and a blast to walk around the city for 3-hours with. It's definitely a "must-do" for foodies in Vietnam.

Fun and delicious tour with Hien!. We loved the food tour with Hien (Cherry) who was an absolutely fantastic guide! She did a great job of introducing us to many delicious Vietnamese foods, and included lots of interesting information about how to eat like a local, the history of the various cuisines, and other tidbits. She enabled a fun group camaraderie by making the tour interactive and helping everyone get to know each other. Lots of food variety and everything was delicious! We definitely recommend this tour!

A brilliant introduction to Vietnamese street food- Sticky Rice!. We did this tour on our first night in Vietnam, jetlagged and overwhelmed by the craziness that is Hanoi! Our guide was Phenix, a young lady who was bubbly and spoke amazing English. We tried 8 or so dishes and had a really good walk around the old quarter which helped us explore with confidence over the next few days. Phenix gave us local history as well as practical tips- especially how to cross the road (sticky rice!) This is a really good tour, excellent value for money and a great introduction to Vietnamese cuisine.

Cheery Cherry = Great Tour Guide. After doing a Halong Bay tour we only had one day to explore Hanoi, and we wisely chose to make this food tour a priority. We did a private tour (still very affordable--highly recommend doing the same to fit your schedule) which they were more than accommodating with starting early in the day (7AM) per our request. Ended up having Cherry as our guide (Cheery Cherry as she called herself--shoes with smiley faces on them exemplified this), and overall we couldn't have been happier with the experience. Was great fun going through the market early in the day, and the experience of eating delicious dishes at local places that we may have otherwise passed by was an invaluable part of our time in Vietnam. Afterwards, we still had plenty of time to explore the other major sites in the city, shop, and have a nice dinner, so don't hesitate to do the tour even if you have limited time in Hanoi. Highly recommended!

Great introduction to the food and city. Our family of five did the tour with Mango and three others. Mango safely "herded" us through the old quarter and over the roads. We kept up the "sticky rice" mantra from then on in to cross roads safely. Loved the different foods and the chance to try out places we would never have found ourselves. We headed back to a few. Favourites were the bun cha and bahn mie. But also the egg coffee, we had no idea what to expect and the delicious iceblocks by the lake.

Over the moon with Miss Moon! Amazing food tour!. My husband and I only had one full day in Hanoi, and wanted to see the Old quarter plus explore the local food. We booked the 11am tour and met the rest of the group, plus our lovely guide Miss Moon, a very colorful and funny character who made our day. She took us to eight different eateries (actually one was a brewery!), places we would probably never have experienced ourselves. Most restaurants don't look like much, in fact some look a bit dingy, but the food is ALWAYS super fresh and very tasty. Miss Moon, who always refers to herself in third person, told us stories about each dish, explained some local eating habits and was a wonderful guide. This tour was basically a three-hour lunch with a LOT of food. Don't make any big plans for dinner on the same day you take this tour!We would go back to Hanoi's Old Quarter in a heartbeat, and I would recommend this food tour to anyone spending more than a few hours in Hanoi.

"Simply a must do". We did this 3 hour walking tour and had the best experience. Miss Moon was a laugh a minute explaining everything with knowledge and fun. The group was great, everyone appreciating the entertainment from Miss Moon. A great way to try traditional Vietnamese food and learn how it is made, thanks to trip advisor that we found this tour!

Great food tour. We booked this food tour last minute after arriving in Hanoi in the afternoon. Phoenix was our guide, with her trainee assistant "Susan". We had a four hour food tour through the streets on Hoi an. There were only 4 of us on the tour, so at the end of the night it really felt like we had been on a night out with some friends rather than a tour. Phoenix was very friendly and informative and made the tour a lot of fun. The food was a good selection, and all was delicious. I would definitely recommend it to get a good idea of Hanoi food and where to go to get the best.

Worth it. Street food is one of my fav things about travelling. I like getting off the main tourist track and heading down the back streets and this tour delivered on that. So many places I would have never found. The egg coffee was like liquid tiramisu, delicious!Annie was a lovely guide who answered any questions we had. Would recommend this for anyone who wants to eat like a local.

Must do!. We did the 3 hour private food tour with our 7 and 9 year olds. Our guide Kiwi was excellent. She was friendly and happy. She made it fun with the kids yelling 'Sticky rice' to get us across the street together. We went to 8 places and everything was great.Kiwi taught us about each dish and helped us with the pronunciation. The kids even had a go at making pancakes. Highly recommend this tour and go with an empty belly!!!!

Fabulous. A really great experience. Our guide was Cherry, you will see she gets great reviews all the way down.We went into street food vendors that we'd normally walk past deliberately. It just shows how many great eating experiences we miss on preconceptions - or they looked a bit scruffy !!Go empty, you will fill up with some of the best food you will ever taste, do this tour.

Average. Book on your first night.. Firstly, our guide Phoenix was awesome! Cheerful and accommodating of dietary restrictions, we enjoyed her service very much. We went on the tour our second day in Hanoi, and were disappointed to find that we had already tasted almost everything in the previous day simply walking around. There wasn't anything about the food that was unique or special or that you couldn't easily find on your own. In fact the first stop's bim cha was miserable compared to what we'd eaten for lunch. We're young professionals, and wanted an experience a little more "street" - but it turns out maybe we didn't need a tour to do that.

Best day out in Hanoi. Cherry was our guide for this tour and was full of enthusiasm and energy from the word go. She was very knowledgeable about all the restaurants she brought us to and had exceptional English to answer all our questions. Cherry explained all about each area we went to and showed us the sights in between the culinary delights!It was a definite highlight of our Vietnam experience and we couldn't recommend it more!

Great food experience. My entire family enjoy the walking, history of Hanoi and excellent Vietnamese food. We went back to some of the place visited with more time to enjoy and experince other dishes...

Vacation. Pixie our tour guide was great! Very knowledgeable and took us to a great selection of food stops. I was starving at the beginning of the tour but by the end I was pleading for her to stop. All the food was really delicious and I would definitely recommend Pixie as a guide!

Great day out. I did the 11am tour with our guide "Cherry". She was amazing and offered a lot of insight and answered any questions which was asked. Cherry also wrote all the items down we tried so we could take a photo to reference later. I would do this tour again but make sure you're really hungry because it is three hours of non stop eating

Cherry Cherry ...We love you!. Our first night in Vietnam could not have been better! I can't recommend Cherry or this tour enough! Great orientation to the city and unique fantastic food we wouldn't have found on our own. Thank you Cherry!

Cheerful time. We went on this tour by six other tourist.This small group went into 5 restorants.These were in the streets mainly.These were very simple,but the deshes were the best in Vietnam.Much better were that in other "normal restorante".And the tourguide,the young girl was so brilliant ,we all enjoyed this tour very much.Thank you.

Great way to experience the old quarter. . Our guide 'Donut' was great. We visited great spots that we would have otherwise not found ourselves. The tour also helps a foreigner learn how to spot locations that otherwise we would have walked by and not realized the potential. It was a great mix of food, culture, and friendly interactions. Absolutely recommend for anyone visiting Hanoi.

Hanoi Street food tour . We've just come back from an evening with Pixie. I was sceptical about what it would be like as it had so many rave reviews but they are right it's a great introduction to Vietnamese food and enabled us to try a really wide range of local specialities. Pixie took great care to make sure dietary requirements were met and made a really good evening.

Food heaven. Just finished a tour with our guide Money who filled our bellies with amazing food and gave us added history and facts about the country while we walked from one side of the Old Quarter to the other. The dishes were fantastic and Money's humour and guidance made our first night in Vietnam a special one. Excellent way to get rid of any fears about street food. Would recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi.

Hanoi Street Food Tour. Great way to start our trip in Vietnam. Showed up to the old quarter 15 minutes before the tour and jumped in with a group. Very easy to book and great way to get to know the old quarter from a local. Annie was an awesome guide and made sure our group had a great experience. Highly recommend.

Great tour for foodies. This is a great food tour as you are brought to some of the best street food in Hanoi. Our walk was around 3.5 hours and we had eight food stops, which were mainly mainly around the Old Quarter.
