The portion was just right and there was a wide variety.During the walk, you will also have a chance to see and be introduced to some of the famous attractions of Hanoi.I would recommend to take this tour during the start of your trip as you will be given some basic introduction to Hanoi. If there are some food stop that you liked during the Tour, you will have time to visit them again.

Great Tour of the City... On the Money!. We decided to book a last minute your with Kim's travel agent for a 4.5hr tour of the city on a scooter with our lovely guide Money.. We had a lovely tour of the city visiting the main sites of the Hoi Chi Minh museum, Turtle Lake etc. Lunch was provided at a local restaurant along with coffee thereafter.Its a great way of seeing the real Hanoi in a heartbeat... Too make it even better, Money was a great guide, fluent in English and very friendly... 4 star due to the tour starting 30 mins later than scheduled else it was fantastic.

The best food tour we've taken, anywhere.. The tour was really perfectly constructed. It hit all the main Vietnamese dishes, with each a phenomenal rendition. The pace was such that we were full at the end, but not sick. And our tour guide Hien (Cherry) made the whole thing a lot of fun. She was very knowledgable, responsive, funny, and did a great job of bringing the group of five couples (and my partner's parents) together, which made the experience that more fun. We've been on a handful of food tours in different countries, and both the food and overall experience of this one was hands-down the best.

Loved it !! . Miss Moon was the nicest and funniest guide I've ever met !! :) You can do the tour if your vegeterian !! That's what we did and it was delicious :) It's a must do if you really want to taste the local food in Hanoi.

Priceless intro to Hanoi & nut allergy taken care of !. We did a night time private walking tour of the old quarter the minute we arrived in Hanoi - it was invaluable! Our lovely guide was called Phoenix - we booked a private tour due to concerns we had over a nut allergy. Phoenix took this seriously and took great care of us ; the food was amazing and we were more than full at the end! The street food tour was a great way to see the old quarter and learn about the food at the same time, not to mention learning how to use chopsticks, cross the crazy roads, sample the local beer at "beer corner" and see a few sights along the way! Phoenix wrote a list of everything we had eaten at the end of the tour so that we could always find a nut free safe meal during the rest of our holiday. 100% recommended. Egg coffee v good too! Thank you Phoenix!

Not vegetarian friendly, despite what they advertise. Didn't live up to our expectations. If you are going to do a street food tour only do it at the very beginning of your trip, otherwise you are going to discover most of this food yourself during your travels. Almost everything we had we had commonly seem in restaurants all over the country already, nothing unique on the tour. We booked with Hanoi Street Food Tour because their website stated they can accommodate vegetarians. We also emailed them to double check and clarify the definition of vegetarian. Turns out their idea of accommodating means some places I couldn't eat at all and when I could nothing was supplemented, I just got whatever bits were left after all the animal was removed. Didn't always leave much or very tasty versions. I had much better adapted veggie versions of most of the food elsewhere during our trip. Also veggies beware- the 'veggie' soups they serve are made from meat stock and fish sauce. I paid the same rate as everyone else to still be hungry at the end of the tour. Totally not worth it.

Great experience, great guide, Annie, great food too!. Go hungry as the experience of walking round old Hanoi eating in lots of little cafes you would never have found yourself was truly a foodies heaven. Highlights included crab and mushroom spring rolls, phur which are noodles and fermented black rice for pudding. The coffee at the end packs a punch (in a good way if you want to party for the rest of the night!) and the lemon and mint ice lolly by the lake was a refreshing way to cleanse the palate. Be prepared to walk on busy roads rather than the pavement, not have access to toilets and expect the cafes where they don't always appear obvious. Our guide Annie was really lovely, so friendly and so knowledgeable we couldn't have asked for anyone better!

Good intro to the Hanoi street food scene. Did the Hanoi Street Food tour (walking) this evening. Cost was $25 USD. This was a great way to experience some of the wonderful street foods offered in this great street food city that you might not otherwise stumble upon.  Our guide, Mango, was informative, not just about the food but about Vietnamese life in general,and very entertaining and funny. The group was ten people and all were convivial and easy to get along with. Mango ushered us safely through the crowded streets of Hanoi.  Well worth doing this tour early in your Hanoi visit as there will likely be places you want to go back to for another taste. Highly recommended way to spend a little over three hours. Make sure you skimp on lunch as there will be more than enough to eat and drink!
Enjoyable tour. We took a tour with Cherry and it was very enjoyable. Great food and great guide. Cherry also provides information on the city.

Excellent experience . My partner and I have just finished this tour and we loved it. We took the 6.30pm option as it's cooler and the food was our dinner tonight. Our guide Cherry was lovely. Spoke excellent English and was really attentive and funny. We went to about 6/7 street food restaurants/cafes and we tried some dishes we had had already and some new ones. We were given water, beer, dessert, rice wine and coffee as well. We didn't spend any additional money. Really good fun. DONT eat before you go, we ate like kings!

A must do in Hanoi. Fantastic!. The Hanoi street food tour organised through Kim's Tours was a fantastic experience. Probably the highlight of my time in Hanoi - I really enjoyed meeting new people, trying new foods and the hustle and bustle that is Hanoi. I was a bit apprehensive about attending a tour as a lone traveller however our tour guide Phoenix, did a really great job to welcome a group of complete strangers. Her energy, food knowledge and great organisation really made the tour.The tour took us to multiple locations (all on foot) to sample all the different foods that I read about (bun cha, Viet egg coffee, banh mi among others). The best part was having a local tour guide in Phoenix took all the guess work out of where and what to eat. Without local knowledge it can be easy to miss places or foods because you're apprehensive or don't have the local knowledge. This tour gives you a taste of everything and I went back to a couple of the places later in my trip!The tour itself is non-stop walking and eating. It's well organised and I couldn't recommend it highly enough. A must do if you are staying in Hanoi!

Do this when you first arrive. What a fantastic way to get to know your bearings and learn about the food available in the central area. We walked around sampling marvellous food from many places (10 in all). Ms Moon was our guide and has a lovely sense of humour along with a good knowledge of safe food sites.

Great way to eat local food and see Hanoi safely at night. Our guide Lua was fantastic. She did a great tour, explaining what we were seeing and eating. We had great fun and felt very safe in her group!We even did some impromptu souvenir shopping and she helped us with that too.We paid a little more to go in a smaller group. If you are going with friends, do this as it makes it easier to get served / hear your guide / keep together in the busy streets.Top tip. Some eateries will provide takeaway boxes if you get too full!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. We LOVED our tour, it was fun and yummy! Our guide (Moon) was super nice and helped make the whole experience fantastic by being funny and engaging. There are lots of different foods to try and we feel like we got a really varied taste of Vietnam. All in all, highly recommended!

Unmissable experience in Hanoi!. Many thanks to Ms. Moon, our tour guide, for introducing our group to fantastic street food of Hanoi! With eloquence and wittiness, she toured us around Hanoi delicacies: Bun cha, dry beef salad, bia hoi, egg coffee and more... The food is to die for and makes you coming back for more!

Well Organized Tour, Great Guide. We decided to make a private tour since it was 4 of us. We picked the time and date and worked out perfectly. Sunny took us walking through the old quarter of Hanoi to 9 different places over 2.5 hours. It was well organized because we walked through main parts of Hanoi without doing more than 2 blocks at the time. The food is exotic and at times hard to eat but it is all authentic Vietnamese meals that we would have never tried otherwise. Sunny was very patient, friendly and knowledgeable.

A must do if you want to try real Vietnamese food. We just did the three hour food tour. Our guide Cherry was knowledgeable and fun too. We tried stalls that we wouldn't have even known were there. Everything was delicious. Well worth the money. 5/5. Thanks Cherry!

A Must-do, Informative, Delicious and Lots of Fun. Ok, so you're a little hesitant to try street food. And, you don't understand what is what. Go on the food tour and you'll discover a number of delicious Vietnamese dishes, overcome your fear of street food, and get a great tour of the old historic district of Hanoi. Four of us were led by an engaging 23-year-old Vietnamese man who spoke excellent English. I've sort of lost track of all the dishes but they included papaya salad, a noodle dish, a rice dish, a mix of grilled pork with outstanding spring rolls. We learned not only about the food but about the life of a young Vietnamese man. He has a degree in hospitality management but is continuing to train to improve his professional opportunities. He told us he has to do three things: get married, get a job and buy a motorized vehicle (most likely he'll live in a rental). Be prepared, you have to be able to sit down on the low, child-sized plastic stools at each food stall and climb some serious stairs to get to the final stop on the tour which is down a narrow hidden hallway. You will end up on a rooftop over-looking the lake and drinking the delicious egg coffee. We all loved it. Delicious. Fun. Informative. Go.

Highlight of Trip. I took the 4 hr motorbike tour with "Money" and her crew and had a great time. Money handled the streets like a pro and I was able to take in the sights and sounds of Hanoi worry free hanging out to the back of her bike. We stopped at numerous places and had lunch at a local spot tasting a dish of fish and sticky rice, followed up by a stop at a cafe for some Vietnamese coffee. She was very informative and fun and wish we had more time, I highly recommend it.I was so pleased with the morning tour I ended up taking the night food walking tour and it was a blast. We must have went to about 8 different places and I could barely move at the end I was so stuffed. There were a few dishes I had never tried before and I learned so much from our guide. At the end she even wrote out each dish we tried for our own reference. Many of the places look to be vetted pretty well and most of the patrons were not entirely locals. However I ate at many other "local" restaurants during my stay and the food on this tour was totally legit and really good. Highly recommend this tour and was one of the highlights of my time in Hanoi.

Amazing food in old quarter of Hanoi. As it was my husband and my first time in Vietnam and we had just arrived in Hanoi yesterday afternoon we thought it best to try the Hanoi Street Food Tour as an intro to Vietnamese food . Sunny our lovely host and guide was sweet and gracious and led us around the old quarter of Hanoi and ordered the best of Vietnamese delights . We had 9 courses overall . Every course was amazing . The best bun Cha ever and yummy rice pancakes filled with mushrooms . The crab and fish soup was to die for and the spring rolls were simply the best !We finished with coconut ice cream and sticky rice with coconut cream and a Hanoi speciality... The egg coffee which was suprisingly delicious . Sunny spent afew hours with us explaining the food and showing us the variety of life in this tiny pocket of town . It's a great way of experiencing the best of Vietnamese food .

The Best Tour!. We did this tour our first day in Hanoi. We were in a group with 11 other people and visited 7 different restaurants/vendors. By far, this was one of my favorite things we did on our trip. It was fun trying all the different authentic foods that we probably never would have on our own. The tour guide (Duong/Pixie) was super informative and made sure our whole group had a great time. The food was delicious and we made sure to go back to a couple of our favorites later in our trip. Put this on your 'must-do' list!

Yum!!. Such a great experience. For $20 a person we feasted on all kinds of local dishes, had a lovely guide (thanks Pixie - you are great!), walked around old town and met some fun travelers. We went into local places I would never even think to try on our own and had dishes that I wouldn't necessarily know to order. All amazing.
An absolute must do!. We did two street food tours with two different companies (we like food) and this was the best by far! Delicious food! I highly recommend going with this company.

Excellent experience guided by Moon. We did this street food and it was amazing. The price is very good and they will show you the best places for trying street food. Our guide 'Moon' was very friendly. She explained everything in an interesting and funny way. Excellent quality-price ratio. Do it since your first day in Hanoi, because for sure you will repeat more than one place of the route.

Exceptional!. My husband and I enjoyed every minute of this 3 hour tour with a group of like minded people as we were taken by tour guide Cherry to sample street food in establishments we otherwise would not have found.The food surpassed any we have eaten in Hanoi so far and we'll certainly be eating more of those dishes during the remainder of our stay.Cherry is very knowledgeable and so much fun. 'Sticky rice' was the code for stay close as our group crossed the busy roads together. Cherry's assistant was also great company. We left with a comprehensive list of the food we'd eaten and the places visited along with suggestions of other places we might like to try. Excellent value for money. We cannot recommend this tour highly enough.

Authentic and delicious tour. You'll eat at restaurants you wouldn't know/dare to go to on your own. We did the group tour and our guide (Cherry) was adorable and showed us her favourite dishes. So much food! Well worth it.

Cheery Cherry does an AMAZING tour!. We absolutely loved this walking street food tour! There were multiple stops--pho, banh mi, bun cha, "beer food," papaya salad, etc etc and Cherry was so informative, friendly, and a pleasure to pass the time with. She was funny and very sweet, deftly leading us up and down major streets and alleys, uncovering amazing neighborhood finds. The food was great, the company great, the sights great. It was a good way to gain familiarity with this busy city and get a feel for traditional north Vietnamese street foods without hassle or worry. Cheery Cherry and her street food tour for the win!

So much delicious food and super sweet guide!. This was a wonderful experience and a great way to get to know the Old Town and Hanoi's food in a short amount of time. Our guide, who told us to call her Mango, was super sweet, energetic, and spoke very good english. All of the food was very good—the bun cha, bahn my, dumplings, and desserts stood out in particular. We also tried egg coffee, beer, and the a sweet lemon tea. We were so full that we skipped one place but Mango gave us a list at the end with everything we tried so we could go back the next day (and we did!). It was an amazing experience and I would highly recommend it to anyone else who is (like me) a little overwhelmed with all the choices in Hanoi and wants help navigating! The only thing I might recommend for the tour company is to have pre-printed maps with all of the places marked on them just to make it a bit easier for the guides (our guide Mango hand-wrote ours and we each photographed it).
A must do!. Street food tour with Cherry was amazing! Food was superb and she's a fabulous guide with great English and very entertaining!A must do!

A must in Hanoi. Had an amazing time with the guide Annie who is really friendly and fluent English speaking. Tasted great food in places you wouldn't think even to come in! Wonderful experience. Highly recommend!

A must do in Hanoi. We did a four hour street food tour with our two children who are 9 and 7 and they loved it as much as we did. Our guide Hoang, who is also a chef, spoke English very well and was very knowledgeable and willing to share information about ingredients, cooking methods, cultural traditions etc. He was super attentive with our girls making sure we were safe in the traffic and entertaining the kids. Our tastings were continuous so deffinately don't eat before going on this tour. They ranged from pho, to roast pork, fresh fruits, rice noodle pancakes, a lot of variety. The tour was fuss free, casual and easy no racing around from one point to another. If you don't mind eating from street vendors and have an open palate then I would deffinately recommend that you do this tour.

Delicious and informative. This is a fabulous tour lasting 3 hours and featuring 8 street food experiences in 8 different parts of Hanoi's old quarter. Our guide, Lily, was lovely and very knowledgable about both the food and the old quarter of Hanoi. She gave us all sorts of insights into local custom, was funny and made sure we all crossed the road safely - no mean feat in Hanoi! The food was delicious and helped us to overcome earlier reservations we had about eating from the street vendors. I would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone interested in learning more about the food and customs of Hanoians.

Highlight of Hanoi . This tour was fantastic, our tour guide Phoenix was brilliant, she was very knowledgeable about the food and made it really fun. We had a great group and had such a laugh! We went to 8 different places and tried soooo much food.

Must do if you're a foodie!. My husband and I did the 5 pm tour and it was excellent! Our guide was Sunny and she was very sweet. We tried 7 dishes, a dessert, and our tour included a beer and a shot of rice liquor. All of the food was incredible and the restaurants were usually ones I wouldn't have even thought to step foot into, but after you get through the entrance, they turned into cute Vietnamese local eateries. The egg coffee weirded me out at first, but it was actually quite nice! For the price, this tour can't be beat. The only thing that I thought was strange was that pho wasn't included in the tour, but I figure that the reasoning is because people just know to try pho when they come to Vietnam, but don't know about all of the other amazing soups and dishes.

An excellent way to get a taste of the real Hanoi!. We had a lovely guide called Silk. The food ranged from Bun Cha, Egg coffee to Bánh cuốn and many more. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that loves food with time to explore the old quarter. A must try!
Excellent tour. Excellent tour well worth doing our guide sunny did a great job showing us some great food. Would recommend to anyone visiting hanoi

Best food tour with Mango!. We took the food tour with Mango one evening last week and had a great time! She helped keep our daughter entertained and showed us some great places to have even better food! She listened to what we liked and really worked hard to show us the best time. I'd recommend a tour with her!
Nice Tour. Our guide was Mango, tour was excellent with 6 different types of food, the best restaurant being Bun Cha Ta

Fun filled evening. Cherry our guide for the evening was very informative and fun also. The amount of food we tried was great - from memory about 10 dishes, she also gave us a list of other places and dishes to try whilst we were in Hanoi. The meeting place was easy to find and the tour seemed very well organised!
Food every corner. Great street food n coffee at every corner u passVery tasty, cleanliness is a little lacking but piping hot food The bun car n pho were best.Coffee at this shop was simply yummy .
Authentic food and experience. Perfect way to initiate into Vietnamese street food. You feel like a local. Set aside your usual standards of decor and presentation and enjoy the lovely food.

Fab & yummy!. Fab way to spend an evening! Got to try really great food and our lovely guide Mango was fantastic. Have us loads of information about things and really seemed to care that we enjoyed ourselves!

Great tour. The food was good and we got to visit many places where locals gathered which we probably wouldn't have found ourselves.
Also our guide Sunny was super friendly :)

Bike tour was just OK, their high rating is probably for the walking tour. We did their bike tour and compared to previous experiences in other locations it was OK, but not great.We had done a bike tour a few days earlier in Saigon (Back of the Bike Tours) and really enjoyed it. They set a really high standard for us that the Hanoi Street Food Tour didn't meet. There's nothing wrong with their tour, but it's not as well done as we had experienced in Saigon.Comparing the two, I'd have to say these are my 3 biggest items of feedback for Hanoi Street Food Tour:1. Little driver interaction. On the other tour we got to know our drivers, learned about them and their background. The drivers on the Hanoi Street Food Tour sat at another table and chatted amongst themselves while we ate. My driver seemed quite shy at best and never ate with us.2. No menu. A the end of the night, I had no idea what I'd eaten or where I could go to get more of it. The other tour gave us a menu at the start of the night and an information booklet at the end telling us some stuff we could do next.3. One beer. For the entire night I received one beer to drink at one location. Whilst I don't expect a beer at every stop, one beer at one stop wasn't enough. It's not because I didn't ask either, I requested it at several locations, but my wish was only granted at once.The food was pretty good. There was plenty of it and some good diversity. But the non-food part of the tour was lacking.

Best city tour!. Amazing private walking tour, we thoroughly enjoyed this!! Was great to get a bearing on the shopping district on our first night and the food was to die for! We kept going back to the same restaurants. A must do in Hanoi!

A great way to explore the streets and foods of Hanoi!. We had a brilliant time with Phoenix who was so friendly and hospitable. The tour lasted over 3 hours and we visited lots of vendors around the old quarter and sampled a wide variety of delights, with Phoenix attempting to teach us how to say each of them in Vietnamese! She told us stories of Hanoi as well and made it a really fun evening - cannot recommend it highly enough!

Thank you, Mango!!. I took the night time walking tour with Mango and she was an absolutely pleasure. She was energetic and really wanted all of us to enjoy our time with her. We started out with Bun Cha and from there went to about 10 other stops. We got to try sticky rice, egg coffee, desserts, beer, even got to try our hand at making steamed pancakes!We decided to do this on our first day in Hanoi based on recommendations from others on trip advisor and they were right! It's a great way to get familiar with Old Quarter and try several local dishes.Thank you, Mango!

Great experience with Mango!. The tour was a great way to explore Hanoi. Mango was an amazing tour guide - we had so much fun with her, I would definitely recommend to request her if possible! Also a great way to meet other travelers.

A must for Hanoi Newbies! Thank you Lua!. This was a fantastic (and very filling!) introduction to the delights that Hanoi's street food culture has to offer. Our guide, Lua (Silk), was fantastic and we learnt a lot about her upbringing, Hanoi, and the array of dishes we were treated to.Highlights of the night included bun cha (grilled pork with vermicelli), bun rieu cua (crab noodle soup) and green papaya salad with beef jerky (goi du du bo kho). Stopping by a street cart for a snack of bo bia (a sweet wrap filled with crunchy sugar cane, shredded coconut and sesame seeds) also made for a welcome surprise.I strongly recommend that all Hanoi newbies experience this street food tour - we even revisited some of the stops before heading back home to Hong Kong. Thank you Lua for a very enjoyable evening.

Great fun. The food was great and Moon was excellent fun. I think all around good idea. I would recommend doing this as soon as you get to Hanoi so you know where to go and get recommendations for the rest of your trip.

Amazing tour with the incredible Pixie. We had so much fun with Pixie on our first day out in Hanoi that we arranged a second night time tour with her to extend our foray into the incredible food this city has to offer.Easy to find and great communicators - the Hanoi Street Food Tour team will have you quickly out on the streets - dodging motorbikes and up alleyways eating amazing local dishes.As pretty daring food tragics, Pixie took us to places that we wouldn't normally find or go to on our own - savoring the most amazing dishes until we could eat no more...A "must do" activity in Hanoi if you love food, particularly early on in your visit - so you can double back and find that little guy near the "big church" rolling fresh Bo Bia one last time before you leave Hanoi....

A must do when in hanoi. We went on the tour yesterday evening with Lily. We were 2 of a group of 10 and visited 8 different street food locations throughout the old quarter. We went into some little restaurants that we would never have found, or probably thought about going into.Lily was an excellent guide. Very sweet and taught us about Vietnamese culture, language and lifestyle as well as the food itself. Sticky rice!!!I would say a tour like this is a must do and we would have never managed to do as much if we had tried it on our own.

Pixie is the best. Loved this tour, one if the best things I did in Hanoi, I would Suggest this is a must do for anyone visiting Hanoi, especially those who would not ordinarily eat street food. 10/10!!!

The best way to see Hanoi!. On a recent business trip to Hanoi, my colleagues and I had limited time and wanted to experience as much of the city as possible. We started with a Wednesday evening walking food tour of the Old Quarter. Our guide Hien (who also goes by Cherry) was an absolute delight! From the smiley faces on her shoes to her stellar attitude to her extensive knowledge of the city and its cuisine, we couldn't have asked for a better introduction to Hanoi. We started off with the best Bun Cha (pork and meatbal noodle soup) I've ever had, and wound our way through Vietnamese cuisine from the tame (a yogurt, black rice and fruit dessert) to the more adventurous (I don't remember what it was called, but there was definitely an eel involved). Hien was careful to check with everyone in the group for food intolerances and preferences to make sure she chose restaurants we could all enjoy. She tirelessly guided us through rainy, crowded streets from place to place, making sure we were getting everything we needed (and more!). She even stopped to get us all ponchos so that we could continue to enjoy our evening despite the weather. We had such a great time on Wednesday night that we emailed the company to see if she was available for a tour of the city on Friday. Much to our delight, she was! They were so accommodating and even arranged a van so our group could comfortably see as many sights as possible. We saw temples, museums, beautiful gardens, and (of course) more food! Hien had us figured out as foodies and made a point of finding us delicious snacks, and an incredible "modern pho" lunch. I absolutely wouldn't have traded our experience for anything else. Hien was a delight, and I would recommend her with no reservations whatsoever. I hope to return again next year to attend the same conference again, and plan to email ahead of time for more tours with her. I highly recommend you do the same. And when she yells "STICKY RICE!" as a cue to stick together and cross the street quickly, you'd better listen. Hien will make sure you're full, and that you don't get plastered by a moped!

Awesome tour!!!. We loved it!Cherry is adorable and she took us to the bests places we would not have be able to find. The following day we went back to a few places because it was soooo goood! Thank you !Highly recommanded!

Loved our tour. Thanks, Phoenix!. We loved our night time street food walking tour led by Phoenix. This was a perfect introduction to Hanoi on our first night and my only regret is that we didn't sign up to do the tour again on our second night. We adored Phoenix and had a blast with our group. The food was amazing - definitely a highlight of a 2-week trip. Phoenix encouraged us to reach out to her or the company if we had any questions for the rest of our trip and they came through. We tried to revisit our favorite place from the tour the next night but they had closed early. We went back to the company's office and got some other great trips instead.

Very interesting and worthwhile. If this is your first visit this is the best way to explore the street food. You run the risk of being ill or not tasting anything if you are alone. Also maybe give yourself a few days to get used to the food first.

Best thing we've done in Hanoi - thank you Sunny!. Sunny walked us through the old quarter, stopping at several different locations to try a variety of dishes unfamiliar to us and all were delicious!! We made our own rice pancakes, drank fresh beer on the street, and ate more than enough food! Great value, great company, amazing guide. Our group size was 10. Travel tip: be prepared to pay for the tour in US dollars.

Kiwi is the best. Much is to say about this terrific food tour. As a group we were brought to spectacular street food venues by their guide Kiwi and she deserves the best for her honesty, hospitality and friendliness. The other guides seems to have the same attributes as well. This is really admirable and an experience worth the ticket alone. Based on our tour in March 2016:Fantastic: You'll get to taste an authentic variety of great vietnamese cuisine, enjoy your stroll following your knowledgable and nice guide, tasting food in groups works splendidly and most importantly the food is fresh and delicious.Horrible: Nothing!

Great insight into Vietnamese Cuisine. Our fantastic guide Cherry showed us the food delights of Hanoi but also gave us information relating to the city, helped us cross the road and made the tour one to remember.We tried numerous dishes and were really full by the end (skip lunch), everything was tasty and authentic. Great value for money.

Highly recommended. My partner and I love street food tours and this one didn't disappoint. Our guide Cherry was full of energy and provided and interesting insight not only into the local food, but also helped us make sense of the craziness of Hanoi. I cannot speak highly enough of the sticky rice dessert I ate on 'dessert street'.

Ask for Dzung (Pixie)!. We're experienced scooter drivers in the US but, wow, Hanoi redefines road rules. "What rules?!"We were fascinated with street food and wanted to be a part of the traffic mayhem. Perfect excuse to try Hanoi Street Food Tour by scooter. We were cheerily greeted by Dzung ("you can call me Pixie!") who spoke perfect and colloquial English. The other driver guide was Linh, an equally young and confident woman who pointed out places while navigating traffic within centimeters of contact.My husband eats seafood but no other meats. They easily understood and when meats were the specialty, provided him with an alternate, equally delicious, dish.We went to 7 unique locations, each offering a specialty dish. By the last two (dessert and egg coffee) we had no room for anything else. As a souvenir Dzung even wrote down every dish in Vietnamese and English on....what else? A napkin!! Thanks to Dzung and Linh, Hanoi will forever be remembered as a foodie paradise!

Thank you Sunny! . A very well organised tour and an excellent introduction to a large range of wonderful Vietnamese food! Sunny picked us up from our hotel (family of 6) and asked us about the kind of food we like - she is so kind & friendly and was wonderful with the kids. She looked after us so well and all of the food was delicious! Sunny also explained to us how to recognise similar eateries to the ones we liked best and gave us recommendations for places we might like to try near to where we were going to be sightseeing the next day. She is a absolute gem and we all thoroughly enjoyed the tour and would definitely recommend it.

Do it!. Did the street food tour as part of the intrepid trip. Initially I wasn't sure as it sounded like a lot of eating and we were due to be getting on the train down to Hue soon afterwards, however I thought it sounded good.Very glad I went. Yes it's about trying street food specialities but the tour means that you get to walk around some of the crazy parts of Old Quarter and allows you to gain insight into where the food that you are eating is coming from. Fascinating guide; amazing food...it's worth doing.

Amazing tour with Sunny. My friends and I had a private tour with Sunny on March 28, 2016. She was great!! She accommodated our food preferences (some of our group didn't eat certain meats) while making sure all of us had a great experience. One of us also mentioned a certain Vietnamese dish we had wanted to try and she took us to a place that served it. She was informative and very patiently and sweetly answered all our many questions - not limited to just food. The tour itself was great- you go to 7 locations (sometimes tasting several dishes at one stop) and you are fully stuffed by the end of it. I can't even choose a favorite of what I liked most. I feel I got a great taste of the best of Hanoi foodstuffs without having to do any research. Five stars for the tour and Sunny!

Food and food for thought. It couldn't have been better....We (>60 couple) booked a private tour a couple of jet-lagged days after our arrival. Nga was our guide. We did a walking tour. Nga was able to put together a perfect evening of eating and thinking, even though our working radius was reduced to footwork (she is apparently a biker girl….). She knew about food, she knew about Hanoi (and dragons and turtles), and she quickly knew about us as we talked together. She is one of these remarkable guides that you meet once in a great while, who know how to design a tour and how to improvise at the same time. AND – she managed, a bit, to get my wife into the “how to cross the street” flow.

For a true cultural experience. Our guide, a young lady in her early 20s, brought us around the old quarters for a nice food tour. Her english was really good! We were able to try around 6 dishes in total, and each local dish was delicious (: This is a good tour to join at the start of your visit to hanoi perhaps, as it opens your eyes to the different tastes that we would otherwise not have ventured to try. However, if you're looking for a tour more to see the sights of old quarters, I would suggest looking for another sightseeing company. The only place we stopped at briefly was at the cathedral.At the end of the tour, my mom and I booked the water puppet show, and as we were running a little late, our guide went out of her way to take us there on her little scooter. It was very nice of her to do so as we would definitely have gotten lost if it weren't for her.

Our favorite moment in our trip. This is an absolute must do! Our guide Kiwi was very enthusiastic to share her favorite street food spots in Hanoi, and she made the tour quite fun, if you can you should try to ask for her to be your guide!We discovered many amazing dishes, all were absolutely delicious!

Fantastic experience with Pixie. Highly recommend this tour with Pixie our guide. We would never have been game enough to visit the places she took us on our own but the food was brilliant and very plentiful. At USD 20 each for a 3 hour walking tour it was amazing value for money.

Great way to explore Hanoi. We took an evening tour with the delightful Doughnut (Thao), and I'm so glad we did. We tried so many places that we never would have gone into or even found. Our favorites were bun cha and "Vietnamese doughnuts." If you want to sample Vietnamese food but don't trust yourself to navigate the confusing maze of Hanoi streets to find the best spots, Hanoi Street Food Tours is a must.

Fantastic evening!. We just finished our street food tour and we had a fantastic evening and we are totally stuffed! Our guide Donut was really lovely and extremely helpful and knowledgeable. She taught us how to say commons Vietnamese phrases and was extremely easy to chat to during the evening- we must have tried at least 10 dishes and we had 2 or 3 rounds of drinks. The tour took us to places that we would never have been into on our own- and the food was excellent all evening. Our guide was also extremely helpful and was able to order food without pork for myself. The tour ended with some excellent sticky rice wine! Genuinely a brilliant evening- worth every penny- would thoroughly recommend!

First thing first!. I couldn't agree more with all the reviews that classify this as first thing to do once in the city. The tour inmediately give you all the right introductions of one of your best coulinar experience of your life!

Time well spent. I enjoyed the street food tour I had the last February with 3 other couples. We ate a lot of different dishes, 15 maybe, drinks included. Nice tasty food : Bun cha, che and coffee with egg Mango, our guide, was very nice and smiling, she explained different stuffs about the city which were interesting. I recommend it.

Miss Moon is the best! . On our first full day in Hanoi we embarked on a street food tour with Miss Moon..she was the best guide! And this was the highlight of our stay in Hanoi! We did the mid-day tour and ate ourselves into a food coma! All of the food at every location was incredible. Having arrived in Vietnam the day before, we strolled around Hanoi without any idea where to stop, what to eat etc..Miss Moon clarified what every dish was in English and in Vietnamese. Our favorite dishes were the green papaya salad, and the fruit salad with coconut cream...mmmmm so tasty! Definitely set aside some time during your stay in Hanoi to do this tour it is well worth the money and so much fun! Thanks again Miss Moon!!

Over the moon with Miss Moon!. We have just returned from a 3hr private street food tour with the amazing Miss Moon. I can't speak highly enough of this tour; we ate amazing food that we would never have dreamed of stopping for. All up I think we had about 12 'courses' each one as good as the last. I was surprised to enjoy some of them, the egg coffee for example is something I would never have tried on my own but it was delicious. I'd highly recommend a private tour as you are not waiting for 12 other people, have the full attention of your guide and don't have to worry about different food allergies etc. Miss Moon, we will remember to stick together like 'sticky rice' to keep ourselves safe when crossing the road!! Thank you again for an amazing time.

Too cool!. This is a must-try! A local guy took us from "restaurant" to "restaurant" (it's basically a kitchen on the corner with small plastic chairs) and we got to taste all kinds of local food. Amazing experience, the guide was super cool, and all food and drinks are included in the price! Also, none of us got sick from the food, so don't worry, it's safe.

A "must-do" , fun experience. Such a fun experience and great introduction to the food of Vietnam. Great to do on arrival, as we did.Pixie picked us up at our hotel and took us by car to the Old Quarter. There we started our walk through the Quarter - so we also had a lesson in how to navigate the streets and crazy traffic. Pixie had selected a variety of different foods for us to try and I must admit there were many places we would never had entered on our own, where we experienced the most interesting and delicious new tastes.Definitely led to us trying many new dishes on the rest of our journey.Recommend a private tour or very small group as easier to keep together on busy streets, and to hear guides stories.Thanks Pixie, loved your tour, you were great!

Excellent!!. Really fun walking tour! Tour guide was great. Food selection was delicious. Great to meet other travelers from all over the world. Be prepared to get really full! We tried food and locations we would not have tried without this tour. Excellent!!

Kiwi was an excellent tour guide!. We really enjoyed the Hanoi Street Food Walking Tour with our guide Kiwi. She made the evening really fun and was so sweet. Kiwi did a great job of explaining each of the dishes we tried and their ingredients. We were definitely stuffed by the end of the tour and each of the dishes were delicious. It's a great introduction to Hanoi as well as Vietnamese food and even though we'd been traveling the country for about a month already and didn't need an intro per se, we still had a great night and would do it again in a heartbeat!One thing to note is that if you're looking to eat 'weird' foods, you won't really find them on this tour, which seemed to be absolutely fine for the majority of our group!

Great night with Annie. I was a little hesitant to do the food tour because I tend to be a little shy when I am out of my comfort zone but did this with my partner. We had a wonderful time being led around by Annie to taste some amazing food and drinks throughout the old quarter. Annie was very well spoken and had an extensive knowledge of the area and food. It was nice meeting people in our group as we had all very diverse backgrounds. I highly suggest that you take the time to do this tour as early in the trip as possible. Thank you Annie for making this night so much fun.

Great fun - and delicious!. This is a really fun way of exploring Hanoi. Miss Moon was informative, warm, helpful, enthusiastic and funny. Also expert at navigating us across the road - no mean feat in Hanoi! We tried about 10 different things. Great variety and all delicious. I was very full by the end... I particularly loved the mixed fruit, green papaya salad, spring rolls and steamed pancakes. I revisited a couple of the places when I was back in Hanoi ten days later and it was nice to know how tasty and safe the food would be.

Awesome tour! Fun and filling!. Phoenix was an awesome guide, informed and friendly with excellent English. We walked all over the old quarter eating very tasty food. I wouldn't have known how to tackle the rest of our meals in Hanoi without it, or how to tackle crossing the road! I'm now hollering Sticky Rice! every time I cross a road. Thank you for a great start to our trip!

Lead the way, Annie.. For my trip, this was by far the coolest experience we had and felt the most authentic. Annie and team picked us up at our hotel and showed us a wonderful time in Hanoi. Seeing the city on the back of a motorbike, combined with some delicious eats was exactly what I was looking for. Food was great and we tried a lot of different things that I wouldn't have been able to find on our own.

Amazing evening - Must do in Hanoi!!!!!. Definitely worth the money !!!! It was an amazing evening. Our guide Donut (she loves that food that's why you can call her like that) was sooo friendly and caring. She took us to wonderful places where I would probably have never went without her and we tried very delicious food ! I now know that I love papaya salad. <3 she was also very helpful and answered all our questions about Vietnam/Hanoi/ food/religion- everything ! If you asked her about a special food she tried to arrange it. I asked her if there is a special wine in Vietnam and we had rice wine during the tour. The only mistake we did was doing the tour at the end of our Hanoi stay. I would love to go back to some places and have the food again. So go there on your first evening- it's the best way to explore the old quarter and start with Vietnamese food.

A great way to see and taste Hanoi. We did a lunchtime tour with Miss Moon as our guide and it was great! We tried at least 10 different dishes - it was very helpful having a guide to show us the best local places and navigate the busy streets. The food was delicious too- you will definitely finish with a full belly :)

Not to be missed. Thanks to Sunny and her intern Silk for making this so much fun!!!Hanoi was our last stop on our three week trip so we had eaten A LOT of Vietnamese food. However, there is always room to try something new. This is a very professional tour and we tried some amazing dishes. Leave your inhibitions at the hotel and get hungry for an experience. As we had been to many cities before Hanoi this experience really made out visit to Hanoi special.

Eat like a local. This tour introduced us to quality food that we wouldn't have tried on our own because we were never sure how to eat it. We tried local dishes at 5 different locations and finished with a beautiful lunch at the Orchid Restaurant. Well done to the two guides who introduced us to this experience. Highly recommended. Would definitely do it again.

Exceptional. Must do this tour.. This street food tour is a must for anyone wanting to experience the real Hanoi, and taste the incredible flavors that are available. It is professional run with local guides who just happen to be trained chefs, so they definitely know what is good, and how to prepare it. If you are a foodie, or just interested in seeing a different side of Hanoi, do this tour. You will have a ball, and also eat some wonderful food along the way.

Wow. We got so much information about the food in Vietnam and especially in Hanoi, our guide really paid attention to what we like and what we didn't and did the best so we enjoyed every minute, it was fresh and delicious! A must do !

Hanoi must do. This was definitely a highlight for me in Hanoi. Our guide Sunny was very friendly and helpful. The foods we ate was absolutely divine. I definitely recommend to add this to your must do's while in Hanoi

Great experience. Value for money 100%.. Street tour we did was 6.30pm till 9pm. We did not finish till almost 1030pm which was okay for our group of 6 people but unsure how it would have gone if you were expecting a set time to finish. We did it with Mango. She was great and very knowledgable with the standard cute vietnamese loveliness. I did however often feel bad at times for not 100% eating the dish given as I am not a huge eater and she was always worried I did not like it. The food we had was all a great experience and I love how versatile and flexible the tour is. It changed as we walked. No dog or cat served apparently.

Our guide "Money" was awesome and the food - simply delicious!. We had such a fun afternoon with our sweet guide Money who was super patient and great with our kids and she took us to so many places I lost count! Great food, super informative and lots of fun, would highly recommend that you ask for Money as your guide. We came hungry and left full and happy and definitely felt like we were ready to step out and try street food on our own after Money's informative tour. Thank you!!
Amazing food. Its all cheap people are friendly and taste better than some reasturants. I would recommend this to everyone. At least try it you have to experience it while travelling in vietnam

Excellent food street. Amazing tour with miss Moon. She was friendly all the time and tought us a lot in only 3 hours and we didn't even realise when we were finished. I 100% recommend everyone take this tour as soon as you get Hanoi.

Great variety. Annie was fantastic - full of information about the food, local customs, and some of the history of Hanoi. She also told us about her own food experiences in Hanoi, which broadened our view of street food. Annie also has a very solid command of English, which made our understanding of the information that much better. We'd highly recommend this tour.

Street food tour. This was a fantastic evening spent getting acquainted with local food. Vi, our guide, was a wealth of information and if you can you should ask for herThe whole tour was three plus hours well spent learning about and tasting some interesting food. A big hie with all four of us
Amazing food tour!. Miss Moon was fantastic! This was a highlight of our trip. Excellent value and the food was amazing. Highly recommend it.

A great way to see and taste Hanoi!. My husband and I had a private tour with Phuong and loved it. She readily accommodated my husband not eating pork, and we had delicious food in an entertaining atmosphere with welcoming kitchens at every stop. We learned a lot about Vietnamese food, Hanoi, and eating and living there as we walked all around the city from place to place, more than we ever could have through a guidebook or on our own. Really great food and entertainment,

Must do. Guarantee it will change your trip. I highly recommend you book this tour as the first thing you do when you arrive in Hanoi. It will change the way you eat for the rest of your trip. As you travel around Hanoi on the back of a moped (so much fun) you will stop to see the sights while traveling to each place. My guide Hien was happy and funny but very passionate about explaining the history of the food and the sights you get to see. Thank you Hien for such a memorable and fun time. 5 stars for the tour and 6 stars for Hien

Amazing Street Food Day Tour. Our lovely guide, Cherry, gave an excellent informative tour that catered to individual dietary requests while also offering a diverse sampling of treats. In total, the group visited about 8 different locations. The food imbibed included classic vietnamese staples, unique food carts and more obscure hole-in-the wall snacks. Egg coffee, soups, salad, bar food, sweets and dessert were all covered rapidly in the 3 hour period - though the tour never felt rushed. Cherry's ebullient presence ensured that the group meshed well and a wonderful time was had by all.. Definitely a worth the time while in Hanoi, especially given that several of the establishments would be difficult for an English speaking visitor to find on their own...

Perfect start to Hanoi!! . Do this before eating anywhere in Hanoi!! This tour guided our food choices for our three days in Hanoi - going back to many of the stops for breakfast, lunch or dinner! We had Ms Moon as our guide and she was funny, knowledgable and so friendly. A tour is a good opportunity to meet other people and here their recommendations also. We were lucky in that we were only on a tour with 2 others, Ms Moon told us group sizes can be as large as 12!

Amazing vibrant tour with sensory overload.. A must do tour. The perfect way to experience Hanoi at its best. We were able to safely sample various (8) different classic street foods. Lilly our guide was delightful and made the tour extra special. I would highly recommend this tour as a real bargain and a great introduction to the foods and culture of Vietnam.

Pleasant evening activity. We were prepared to pay USD20 for the chance to try street food costing a fraction of the price of the tour just so we could get to eat in places tourists would normally not go to. In this respect the tour partially delivered. Our first stop was a midpriced restaurant for one particular dish, and we also had another stop at a modern ice-cream outlet at the lake, but we did have chances to sit down at the roadside for dessert and enter hole-in the wall restaurants we would never have visited on our own. Our guide Pixie spoke good English and was cheerful and accommodating. She halted traffic for us when crossing the ridiculously busy streets. It would have been nice to have more narrative of the areas we were walking through, as well as more information on the ingredients and and history of what we were eating. We did get a commentary on the lake and the recently demised revered turtle that lived there.Felt I could have eaten a bit more afterwords. Overall, a worthwhile activity, especially for first-timers to Hanoi.

Day street food tour. Did this today with Cherry as our tour guide, she was just delightful and very informative. We loved roaming the streets with her and being able to ask questions about the food and Vietnam in general. We were in a group of 8 which we enjoyed very much. As I am allergic to shell fish Cherry arranged to be able to cater for me. We are very full and not sure we will be having dinner tonight. Very affordable and well worth doing.

Delicious introduction to Hanoi!. Put together a wonderful guide named Nga, great food, a lesson in Vietnamese history and culture and an orientation to this amazing city of Hanoi...... and you have the perfect tour! Nga was delightful......so interesting and informative, AND she got us safely through seemingly impossible traffic! Thank you Nga for your friendly and engaging manner and the sharing of your knowledge and experiences. A memorable 3 hours and a fantastic way to begin our Vietnam holiday . Excellent value for money (almost more food than we could eat!). Hanoi Street Food Tour highly recommended!

Enterprising . You have to appreciate the sheer spirit of these people who set up a stall on any space they c's find and yet serve you amazingly fresh and tasty food for such a low price.Top marks. Eat hot food - safer.
Excellent tour with Kiwi. This is a must do tour of Hanoi. Our tour guide Kiwi was great. She was great company and very knowledgable of the food and history of Hanoi.

Unexpected Highlight of Hanoi Visit!!. On a free evening during a group tour, 3 couples ventured off on the Night Street Food Tour of Hanoi. OMG! Over the top! We expected a fun evening but were thrilled by the scope of the food shops and stalls we visited. Unlike that we would have ever given one a second look. Each one had a specialty, from pho to egg coffee. The sanitation was horrifying... no one even had indigestion! We were the only apparent foreigners at each stop but no one gave us a second look. Our local English-speaking guide a upbeat, cheerful, and thoroughly explained everything and answered all our dumb questions!One of the most memorable experiences of a month-long SE Asia tour. Highly recommended...

Amazing Night. What an experience! A must do tour when in Hanoi. We booked a private night walking tour and Phoenix was our guide. Phoenix was fantastic, great English, full of knowledge on Hanoi and food and made the trip a lot of fun. Great value for money, so much food, beer and happy water! Highly recommend Hanoi Street food walking tour and Phoenix.

Great evening tour recommended. Enjoyed a great private tour for my wife and I. The guide who we believe was called 'money' provided a a lovely tour visiting small places we would have never found ourselves. Food was okay, it was really the experience, so highly recommended

Highlight in Hanoi!. I tend to be weary of organized tours while travelling, but decided to take the chance with this one, and I wasn't disappointed!Admittedly, I am a pretty big foodie and a really adventurous eater, but I think this tour truly applies for all people of all ages. We made about 7 or 8 stops, and by the end of it, we all felt we needed to be rolled home. The food was all wonderful, and it can be a really good opportunity to discover Vietnamese cuisine if you are unfamiliar with it, as street food can be rather intimidating when first arriving in Hanoi! We visited some back alleys and more hidden places that would be hard to find on your own. We even got the chance to try and make some of the food at one of the stops!Our group was so varied, with ages ranging from 21 years old up to 65! We all got along and really enjoyed the experience together. This tour was the highlight of my time in Hanoi and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone visiting!

Great tour: Fantastic food and lovely guide!. We had a great time with "Mango" our guide. She was very sweet and kind, and not only introduced us into Hanois street food, but also the city and Vietnamese culture and traditions. I would definitely recomend the tour to anyone visiting Hanoi!!!

Would do this every night of a Hanoi visit. My street food tour was one of the highlights of my time in Hanoi! I would definitely consider doing it for dinner multiple nights -- the price ($20) is reasonable for the 7-10 dishes and 1-2 beers that you get, plus you get to eat at places you would never otherwise find!

Fantastic Tour!. We met Ms. Moon at 11 for a serious foodie experience - all three hours of it! We tried 7 different local dishes and finished the tour off with egg coffee and rice wine. Moon was hilarious and kept us all together as a group - and the group was diverse and great too. Totally worth it! I would do it again tomorrow!

Not yummy, not a lot of fun. Weve been taken to eat 10 different local foods (including beer and coffee), non of them was espcially tasty ot unique- Plain rice, too oily dumplings etc. Our guide Mango was cute.The tour was not worth our 20$! We ended up hungry and went out for more food.

Happy happy people. Having no idea what Vietnamese food to try other than Pho, and speaking not a lick of the language, this tour was absolutely amazing value and the best way to try some delicious food you would otherwise not experience. Our guide Annie was super lovely and answered all our questions about the things we were eating, as well as just being a friendly person to get to know over the course of the night. At the end of the tour the guide gives you a list of all the food you tried and where you can get them just in case you want to go back for seconds (which we certainly did!) For $20 USD and the amount of food we ate, I couldn't be happier with my decision to do this tour. Absolutely recommend.

Miss moon. Wow this was one of the major highlights of our trip, great food - you get taking to some really good spots not just places that are offering kickbacks. And our tour guide was amazing! Request miss moon!
Excellent. Excellent tour to discover Hanoi and its restaurants. Local food very tasty. The guide was very friendly and fluent in English

So full, so happy. . Great way to spend my last night in Hanoi. A chronic introvert/solo traveller, I surprised myself by making friends with the other members of my group. Favorite dish was the egg coffee, but I was also feeling very full by then. We had time for eight stops! Thank you Hien/Cherry!

A MUST DO for anybody visiting Hanoi. If you find yourself in Hanoi at any time of year, and you don't end up doing this tour, you are seriously missing out on the actual best thing this city can offer for anybody touring through it. You get a real taste of all things Vietnamese here and everything you eat is absolutely delicious! We returned the day before from Halong Bay in a rather disappointed state with what we experienced there, so doing this surely made up for any downfalls on the trip that we had.The guides all speak English fairly well and the cost of the whole thing is pittance compared to the value you receive for it. The most exciting part of all of this is the food of course, but the fact that you get to see the old quarter of Hanoi in all its glory. The smells of pork cooking over charcoal that waft through the busy streets takes you on a sensory journey like no other. It's a smell that I will never forget and makes me long to go back there and do it all again. You visit markets, dodge busy traffic while being told that "sticky rice" is the call you make when you huddle together to cross the roads or walk through an intersection. Don't worry about getting hit by a moving vehicle, they actually dodge you! It's pretty awesome to do that. Just remember, whatever you do, don't stop walking when you cross the road, or you may just wind up getting struck by a motorbike or worse still, a car.The end of the tour finishes with some desserts and a stop at a pub for a nice cold beer. I found that over the three hours of this, I felt so full that I didn't really need to eat for the rest of the day. I arrived hungry, left extremely full. Just how it should be. If you really want to experience the true culture of a city and the nature of its people, try the local food. It gives you a story that you just can't get with words.I place this tour here as hands down, the BEST thing one can do whilst in Vietnam.

Amazing way to start your trip. After just arriving in Hannoi this Street food tour helped us to have a look round and introduce us to some amazing food. Really recommend this as allowed me to try alot of food I might not have tied other wise

Good tour, excellent guide!. Sunny, our guide, was great! We did a private tour with my friend since she is a vegeterian and we wanted some extra care for her dietary needs. Sunny totally took care of our every wish and need. Great insight in Hanoi's street food. A great start to overcome your fear of trying new things and and a good way to find out your favourites since we tried around ten different dishes.Thumbs up!

What a surprise . If you are wanting a real tour of Hanoi and a food and history experience then this will surprise. Ms "Money" is an outstanding guide and takes you to places yup would never have stopped to try. Recommend it and all the girls are great.

So much more than a food tour. You should definitely do this tour. We organised a private walking tour on our first day during a short trip to Hanoi. The tour provided a perfect introduction to the Old Quarter of Hanoi as well as some great and varied local food. Our guide Nga, was fantastic. She was hugely knowledgeable about the cuisine, local environment and history and heritage of Hanoi. She was great fun, entertaining and really enthusiastic. We visited vendors and tried food that we would easily have by-passed had we not been on this tour. A real experience and excellent value. This tour totally lived up to its billing and fully deserves to be so highly rated.

Fantastic - thank you so much Anh. Absolutely fab night with Anh our guide she made our the trip wonderful & couples from Latvia & Chicago (Steph & hubby). We tried a local sandwich with pate, rice rolls, bbq, fresh fruit & egg coffee but i don't drink coffee so had egg hot chocolate everything was delicious and all at different street food vendors and a secret cafe to finish. Highly recommended we had a brilliant time. Helen & Martyn Fox, Preston, UK

Great experience with nica guide. ガイドの"Nga"さんが非常によくしてくれました。ローカルフードを食べるだけでなく、バイクの後ろに乗る体験は最高でした。As a main activity of my 1-day trip to Hanoi, I participated in this street food tour by motorbike today. It was 3-hour course and my guide "Nga" took me to 5 different types of local food restaurant. It was amazing experience not only to taste local food, but also to ride on a motorbike! She gave me interesting guide about history, culture and economy of Vietnam. I had really fun time chatting with her, and would like to appreciate her hospitality as she took me the place where I wanted to take photo and send me off at the place where I requested. Thank you so much, "Nga".

Brilliant tour, Awesome guide. Our guide Duong (Pixie), was superb. At the beginning of the tour she asked us if we had anything we really wanted to eat and if there was anything we didn't like or were allergic to.We started with Bun Cha (grilled pork balls with noodles), pork balls had a wonderful smoky flavour imparted by being grilled over charcoal. 2) Kem Chanh (Rice ice cream) at Hoan Kiem Lake3) Banh cuon thit ( steamed rice rolls) delicious and we had the opportunity to take the rice wrappers off the steamer which was a fun addition.4) Banh goi (pillow cake), Nem cua be (spring rolls), Nem Chau ran (sour pork rolls), Banh ran ngot (sticky rice fried bun). A wonderful selection of tastes and textures.5) Sua chua hoa qua nep cam (che dessert) a wonderful combination of fruit, black rice porridge, sweetened condensed milk and yoghurt6) Egg coffee and Bahn Mi(pork in a baguette). A wonderful way to round out the tour.Duong was extremely informative, not just about the street food, but also the history of the Old Quarter, origins of food and culture of Vietnam. Her English was excellent and she assisted us with our Vietnamese pronunciation. Duong is a friendly cheerful woman.At the end of the tour Duong wrote out a list of what we had eastern and where we had eaten it, along with a list of recommendations for us for the rest of our stay in Hanoi.You will visit places that unless you are local you Will Not Find. Beware that there are imitators of Hanoi Street Food Tour, make sure you go to the right address (look for Kim tours)
great experience!. A bit nervous about doing a tour including street food but our entire family loved it! We had the opportunity to try a bit of everything and enjoy the culture

Outstanding and so much food. My wife and I enjoyed this tour in March. Whilst the weather was not great we did not send to mind as we hustled between the streets and food destinations. Miss Moon was our tour guide and she was very informative. We tried a variety of local dishes all from very local small street cafes. And there was a lot too eat. Unless you are a very big eater, make a point of coming with and empty stomach. We took the tour during the day on our first day in Hanoi and this was useful as it helped us to orientate ourselves and gave us the confidence to try some more of the street food throughout our travels.
Wonderful introduction to Hanoi. Had a great night with our guide Sunny. She took us to some great places we definitely would not have tried on our own. So much food to try-make sure you go hungry!

Truly A Festival for Your Food Baby..... I have done food tours and cooking classes which have been very good - this street food tour raised the bar, it exceeded my expectations and that was after reading the TA reviews! Miss Moon is a true foodie, has excellent communication skills, a wonderful sense of humour, is knowledgeable (she has travelled extensively thru Vietnam) and cares about your enjoyment of the food. Miss Moon will give advice on scams, crossing roads and show you the food certificates to look for.Cost for 2.5 to 3 hour street food tour is $20 USD but you can pay in Dong if you wish. We turned up 10:40 and jumped on 11am tour no problems. There were only 3 of us and no food restrictions which opened up all the food choices. I highly recommend prepping your food baby (which means stomach) by not having breakfast. The food you are about to experience will be plentiful and so tasty from long term locals who specialise in their dish.In all we tried 11 items as we had no dietary restrictions. Our food babies were so satisfied! It is hard to pick but if pushed my top 3 would be BBQ Pork with Noodles, Pancake with Pork and the Egg Coffee. Special note for the egg coffee which is just superb, velvety, rich and tiramisu like in flavour and texture. It is not just a whole egg yolk in hot instant coffee as I thought beforehand. It is a chicken egg yolk with honey and sugar blended until frothy poured into extremely hot coffee. If you don't drink coffee they can make a Egg Hot Chocolate for you which tastes like rich creamy chocolate custard. I highly recommend it for anyone in Hanoi. It will make your food baby very happy.

Lunch Tour with Mrs Moon = Awesome!. You can't recreate this experience on your own. You can know the places they go, you can know the food they try, but you can't recreate the experience, the knowledge and the extras that come along with the tour. This is truly an insiders experience of Vietnam street food. I did the lunch tour, I would recommend going on a tour as soon as you arrive as you are told about the hustles and scams along with being shown secret seating areas and accompanying condiments that you would not know to ask for and are not offered. This was a great tour and well worth the $20 for the hour plus, stomach filling, walking tour of the old quarter. My only wish was that they did a "Adventurous" street food tour... something more Andrew Zimmern style.

Searching out Hanoi's best street food.. We spent our first night in Hanoi walking the streets of the Old Quarter eating our way through some great food. Our small group of 4 enjoyed a variety of local dishes unique to the north of Vietnam. We were guided by Lilly who kept us well entertained and fed. Hanoi Street Food Tours know where the best eateries are and there are some a tourist would never find or possibly want to walk into. A must do, thank you Lilly for a great night.
Delicious. This tour is just great. Great food, great vibes, great price, great guides, and great tastes! Mango is a great guide and really passionate about food and Hanoi!

Best food tour in Hanoi. We were lucky enough to do a private tour with Pixie(Duong), she customized our tour and helped us have all of the best food in Hanoi we hadn't had yet. She took us to some great places and was very knowledgeable about the city and food we ate. This was an amazing tour, we ate 6 amazing dishes and really helped make our trip in Hanoi the best.

Best tour!. We had the best time driving on the back of scooters visiting different street food places! All of the food was delicious and our tour guide Pixie was so friendly and full of knowledge! It was nice to get an overview of the city and we even stopped at a few of the sights, where Pixie shared the history and stories.Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to eat street food!

Hanoi street food tour with Miss Moon. I am always a little reluctant to jump straight on to an organised tour (I did this in Morocco so am now wary of guides taking you to places to get kickbacks instead of good places), but after my sister convinced us that this tour was rated number 1 on tripadvisor, we all agreed to go. This tour does not disappoint! It was 465,000 dong (about USD$20-25), and we ate and drank soooo much! The food was incredible! Our guide Miss Moon was funny enthusiastic, and genuine. She warned us that locals don't eat from street cart vendors (like the banana ladies) because they don't know where the food has come from, and promised to take us to trusted, tasty and great local places. She didn't disappoint! The most incredible thing I had that night was the corn paper filled with fresh coconut, fried sugar cane and black sesame; I'm still having day dreams about it! This was one was by fluke though; Miss Moon took us to the usual places, but happened to see this little man with the delicious corn papers peddling his little bike cart down the street (it has bobia written on the side), so ran him down for us. So glad we did this tour on the first night in Hanoi, not only did we learn so much about the food and drink, but we also learnt how to cross the road (sticky rice!) and got tips of tourist scams to be wary of. Thank you so much Miss Moon for such a wonderful experience! Great foodie thing to do in Hanoi.

Exceeded expectations. Loved the tour! Tons of fresh local food.... I took the 11 am walking tour around Old Quarter. Booking was quite easy over email, then showed up 15 minutes before tour to pay the 20 USD. We were 4 in the tour (great size!) Our guide was Cherry and she was young and cheerful but she managed to make the tour very engaging, fun and interesting, explaining many cultural aspects of the life in Hanoi. I thought that food portions would be small, but believe me, by the end of the tour you cannot possibly eat more, and I have a big appetite. We tried 7 to 9 different dishes and drinks, including soup, spring rolls, donuts, beer, beer food, dessert, salads, rice cakes, etc. All the places we visited were 100% local and authentic. Food was super yummy and fresh and stomachs were perfectly fine. I had taken food tours in other countries but his has been by far the best... Highly recommended for all foreigners visiting Hanoi.

A feast for your taste buds!. This tour is a must while visiting Hanoi! A great introduction to Vietnamese street food. Sunny was a brilliant guide and she took us to places I would never find myself. The food was delicious and egg coffee was absolutely mind blowing! I highly recommend it!!!

Great tour. We decided to go last minute and so glad we did, great tour great value tried so many different local dishes in some great spots around the old quarter. Also our tour guide (sunny) was so helpful and knowledgeable on the area couldn't recommend the tour enough well worthy of five stars.

Fun tour. This is a fun tour to check out local cuisine. Spread over about 2.5 hours with about 8-9 stops, one gets a great feel of the local street food. There is no way that you would find these spots by yourself. We set with locals in tiny shacks, by the road side and in narrow alleys and it was great fun. Our guide Cherry was sweet but I had some difficulty understanding her English, however, she makes up with her bubbling spirit and great attitude. I wish they could have told us more about local customs and culture.Highly recommended.

Must try "The morning hanoi tour by scooter". A quickest way to see Hanoi is half a day! We got picked up by scooters from our hotel promptly. At first, we were intimidated by the traffic but soon felt comfortable and safe with the young under/grad college female drivers. They were very friendly and cheerful. We visited Ho Chi Minh mausoleum, Ho Hoan Kiem, Ho Tay, Old Quarter... We stop for a nice lunch and later ended with "Com" ice scream at the lake (Hoan Kiem).Thanks to Yen, Nga, Nhung, Thuy (Annie), and Thuy Anh (Rachel) for a wonderful tour!

Excellent and stomach safe. Extensive tour of old quarter led by friendly guide with 7 or 8 stops for local street food. Plenty to eat as you go along and a great coverage of different local specialties. Our guide Miss Moon was really enthusiastic and funny, and made a real effort to include everyone. Also, no-one was ill afterwards!

Worth a try! . If you love (vietnamese) food, but you don't know where to begin this is a great introduction to all the wonderful street food Hanoi has to offer. Our guide Mango did a great job showing us all the food and at the same time telling us about an showing Vietnamese culture. If she saw something she thought was worth tasting - even though it wasn't in the program she bought it for us anyway, and it is safe to say we got some new favorites afterwards. She was a perfect guide and she spoke English very well and we had a wonderful time. Definitely something to do one of your first days in Hanoi, so you have time to eat and enjoy all your new favorites. Enjoy!

Amazing if you love Vietnamese food!. We loved the concept! Our guide "mango" was a sweet young student who spoke very well english. We tasted 12 different dishes during the 3 hour tour - both famous vietnamese dishes but also delicious street food we wouldn't have tasted if we were by ourself.Very recomendable!

Ms Moon = amazing. We had Ms Moon and she was terrific! You haven't met anyone as wonderfully delightful as Ms Moon. Because there were no dietary restrictions in our group, she took us to her favorite spots, some of which she's frequented as a child. She also told us stories about Hanoi culture and gave a great deal of insight into the people there - especially how to spot scammers (actually saw quite a few people after falling for "free trials" of food and "shoe shines"). All of it was SUPER useful for our first day in Hanoi. She also told us how to make a few of the dishes back home! (PS: places seem pretty dingy but she pointed out the health certificates when we visited, and we're all doing well GI-wise three days later)

Don't just smell the coffee, eat it!. We went on the tour as a party of 10 ($20 each) on a heaving Sunday night, but Hanoi seems to be like that every night. Phoenix our guide was fantastic taking to to some iconic places we would never have found ourselves and keeping us together with her calls of 'sticky rice' (now a catchphrase in Hoi An!) . Lasted about 4 hours with plenty to eat and drink - the egg coffee being a bit of both but you must try it! Tours are more expensive for two or four people so team up with others and don't miss a great night - it finished near 'Beer Street' so perfect for a nightcap or two.

Fantastic insider's tour of Hanoi's awesome street food. I did this street food tour as a pleasant way to spend an afternoon and get some lunch in. Be prepared to eat a lot! Our guide, Cherry, was incredibly cheerful and took us to all her favorite spots -- she told us that each guide takes you on a different tour of their favorite eats so it will be different with each person.This is a local's tour so you will be eating in some tucked away places, in alleys and on streets on plastic stools. The food was excellent, each dish delicious in its own way. If you're an adventurous eater, give it a try!

Om Nom Nom!. Taking this tour was such a great experience as it took us to 10 different places (most of which we would have been apprehensive to go by ourselves) and encouraged us to try heaps of food (most of which we would have known what/how to order. On this tour I found so many new favourite foods and even got to have a go cooking rice paper. Our only regret was that we didn't do a similar one when we were in Thailand!! Would definitely recommend!

Great tour, tasty food in places we would never have discovered... We spend a few hours with the ' Vietnamese God' Tu, he was extremely knowledgable and we went to 5 places to experience different types of street food. Sitting on the low plastic stools, we ate fried spring rolls, dipping them into noodle soup..... Bananas in tapioca.... Fried sqid...then, a well hidden coffee shop - packed with youngsters using their smart phones and we sampled the taste of the special egg coffee, which is just like liquid tiramisu. Delicious. Then we ended up with a delicious fruit salad with coconut milk....A great way to spend a few hours and learn a lot about how to chose and eat local food....we would highly recommend Tu ......a great experience and one of the highlights of our visit to Hanoi.

Wow! . From start to finish, the whole experience was amazing!Annie (our tour guide) was so adorable that I wish we could take her home with us! As wary westerners, my perception of street food was met with caution but Annie blew all of that out of the water. We let our inhibitions go and I can tell you, it was worth it! The food was sensational!! For any other wary tourists, I strongly suggest a tour to educate yourself about Vietnamese food and how the locals eat..
