Don't waste your precious taste bud moments on western food when you can enjoy the delights of Hanoi. Annie was so knowledgable, well cultured, took time to answer our questions and knows how to have a good laugh.Our highlight of Hanoi by far!Lastly, just to demonstrate how great this tour is, my partner is one of the fussiest eaters and only eats western food abroad.. He is now converted! Enough said :)Cam on Annie!

Best thing we have done so far!. We booked the street food tour and were a bit apprehensive due to being fussy eaters back home. We met Annie at our hotel and had a chat about the foods we like and don't like and she catered for our needs. We never expected the tour to be so amazing and it has opened up our pallets to some amazing new foods. Annie was amazing and a joy to chat to. She imparted her knowledge of the history of Hanoi to us in a way that was fun and engaging while showing us the amazing foods that Vietnam has to offer. I will never be afraid of street food again and can recommend this to anyone of any age and culture. If you are lucky enough to be paired up with Annie that's an even bigger bonus!

10 stops, 3 hours food trip. This tour had 4 couples who started as strangers and ended up as tour buddies after 3 hours. Mango, our tour guide was excellent in telling stories about the food and Vietnam life in general. The food stops ranged from bbq, spring rolls, egg coffee, ice cream, newly brewed beer, lemon tea, and the banh mi. The portions were small for the $20USD/ person that was paid. It was a great way to get introduced to the street food culture of Hanoi. We also got some interesting insights regarding the old quarter. The beer was good and brought more harmony to the group.This tour would have been 5 stars if not for the portions. Maybe the guides should ask if 2nd servings were required. Some of the food was good and we wanted more.

Go on an empty stomach! . Our guide 'Mango' was full of energy and has definitely set the bar high when it comes to tour guides. At first I thought $20 was quite expensive but it was definitely worth the money. We got some history of different things around the town and mango answered any questions we had. The portions are not huge but you eat a lot so it's more than enough. By the end I was so full I could hardly move. This tour is definitely worth doing if you are in Hanoi!

A 'Must do' in Hanoi. i do not think that i would have stopped at any of the cafes we were taken to ..... I would have been to wary. But the food in each one was just superb. This tour is an absolute must for visitors to get an introduction to the wonderful quisine

Fantastic tour with Magno!. We could taste about 12 different snacks, meals and drinks - all of it very tasty! Mango, our tour leader, told us a lot of interesting things about the food, culture and people in Vietnam and very funny stories - she was fantastic - thank you a lot, Mango!

Not good. 3 hours is way too long for a street food tour and we love street food. The places we've been were filthy and the food was low/average. My wife got food poisoning and we lost 2 days of our trip. We couldn't understand a SINGLE word of what the guide said (honestly, not a single word).Overall, overpriced and not worth it.

Highly recommend. This was an excellent tour. During the tour, we tasted about 10 different things, each of them delicious and different. Our guide, Ms. Moon, was excellent. This would be a great tour to do on your very first day because you will get an intro to Hanoi food and you will learn how to navigate the traffic. Arrive hungry, you will be doing some serious eating!

Not to be missed tour when in Hanoi!. We did a private street food tour with our guide, Annie who is such a delightful company and a wonderful ambassador for Vietnam. Annie took us to places that we would not have contemplated going to and as such , have enlightened us to all the joys of Hanoi Street Food. We are now planning to come back to Hanoi next year and hopefully Annie will be available to continue to amaze us with more Hanoi food secrets and delights

Ms Moon was brilliant!. My girlfriend and i did the afternoon tour with Ms Moon and had the best time! It was great value, informative and lots of fun. We left completely full, happy and with a few new friends. completely worth the time!

Had fun exploring the streets of Old Quarter Hanoi and trying out local food. Decided on short notice to join the evening street food tour. No need to pre book as you can just show up about 15 minutes before one of the times that the tours go. We were put together with others to make a group of 8 and introduced to our guide Sunny. She was very informative and safely navigated our way as we walked through the crazy streets of old quarter. I lost count but we went to at least 6 different street food vendors, often tucked away up narrow staircases or in the back of a shop. We had a variety of different Vietnamese foods including salad, buns, soup, dessert, egg coffee, beer (or alternate for those who don't drink alcohol). The food was very filling and this was a fun way to spend a few hours with others trying out different foods.

Excellent street food tour!. Cherry is a delightful guide who took us to SO MANY PLACES. This tour was well worth the $20 cost, and Cherry gave us a handwritten list of where we went, what we ate, and some recommendations of other places to try. My main purpose in Vietnam has been to EAT, so I have done far too much research in order to eat every possible thing on my list. This tour covered nine or ten of those options in one evening and also helped me feel more confident braving the street food scene by myself. This tour and Cherry set me up for an incredible trip to Vietnam, so do yourself a favor and book it!!!
Awesome . We had an awesome Food Tour with "Moon" as tour guide. The private tour tour took us 3h and we visited 8 different spots! Moon deserves a special appreciation! "Come an"

Definitely worth doing. At first you may think it's expensive ($20 per person) for what is essentially street food, but it is so worth it. All the dishes were great (total of 7) and our guide, Kiwi, was lovely and really informative and definitely knew where the best places were. You should definitely go on an empty stomach as you will be stuffed after the tour as the portion sizes they give you is really generous. It was also nice being guided through the chaotic streets with someone who knows their way around and was always concerned for our safety whilst crossing the roads. A really great introduction to the amazing food here and to some great restaurants that we will be visiting again during our stay in Hanoi.

Highlight of Hanoi!. We booked a vegetarian tour and it was incredible! Don't eat before you go, we had at least 7 stops and were absolutely stuffed. Cherry was an amazing guide, good English and adorably cheerful. Such an amazing variety of food, and a great way to experience true Vietnamese style eating! We tried things that I likely wouldn't have ordered on a menu myself. Will recommend to any friends traveling to Hanoi. Excellent!

Great tour!. Our guide Kiwi she is so cute and easy to talk to. We went eight places and i loved it! My favorite was Bun cha at the first place. I've seen reviews that "go with empty stomach" so,, i thought i was prepared,,, but it wasnt enough ready. Hehe. Dont finish all the dishes u have on the tour cause u will have more coming on!

Great experience of Hanoi. We met our guide Hien (or Cherry as she also proclaimed) in the hustle & bustle of the Old Quarter. We started our 6 course eating experience straight away for our walking tour. Trying new foods that we would never be brave enough to order is the reason we take these foodie tours, and this one didn't disappoint. Local dishes like Bun Cha from the best restaurant were our faves. Hien was friendly, a great source of entertainment and very knowledgable, so was a great guide who made sure our allergies and needs were met.

Foodie way to discover the old quarter. Great food tour and very authentic . Did about 7 stops and covered almost all parts of the old quarter by walk. Right from the bun cha, Vietnamese spring noodles , raw papaya salad to the egg coffee every street food outlet was picked with care and quality of food was really authentic and good. Please be informed that it is a typical street food tour and in some of the places you are seated almost on the street on small stools. That's the whole fun of it. Also many of them are not super clean if you are finicky about cleanliness. Our guide was Ms.Cherry who was very enthusiastic and made the tour really enjoyable. Loved the yogurt and fruit mix dessert.

Amazing and a must do!!. Our tour guide was 'money' and she was fantastic! She spoke very good English and was very insightful into the local history of Hanoi which was incorporated into the local foodie experience! We were in a group of 4 and had 4 wonderful ladies who took us around on their scooters. There is also a walking option for those less keen on the scooter experience but we felt very safe at all times! The team was very accommodating when we alerted them upon picking us up that we didn't eat seafood (obviously there is seafood options) and money made sure that this was not an issue. I recommend doing this at the beginning of your stay in Hanoi to find the best eateries at the start so you can enjoy them throughout your stay!

Great guide and loads of delicious food!. Our tour guide Hien (Cherry) was awesome. Lots of fun and had loads of history on Hanoi and more specifically the food in Hanoi. We visited 7 places and by the 7th place we were absolutely stuffed full - all for ~$25AUD each. Great to visit places and eat food that you wouldn't have tried otherwise. Lots of fun walking the small packed streets of Hanoi during the evening. Would highly recommend.

Great tour from Miss Moon. I was just recommending this tour to a friend and realized I hadn't written a review about it. I went back in October when I was only in Hanoi for 24 hours and had a great time. Miss Moon is a hilarious and great tour leader who only refers to herself in the 3rd person. Trust me, it works for her. The food is phenomenal, and you will leave completely stuffed. Highly recommended!

Great Food Tour. This was a great street food tour in Hanoi. I did the 11:00am group tour, we had 7 stops and it took around 2 hours; all of it right in the Old Quarter of the city. My guide, Pixie, was excellent; she was easy to talk to, and very willing and ready to share information about both the food and Hanoi/Vietnam. This tour was easily one of the highlights of my time in Hanoi, and I'd highly recommend to anyone who wants to get a feel for both the kind of street food available and the Old Quarter.

Great tour, Great Food.. We enjoyed a fantastic walking tour through the Old Quarter of Hanoi, stopping at seven or eight street food vendors. The food was fantastic, impossible to chose a favorite. We finished a Vietnamese sandwich, egg coffee, and a shot of rice wine. Try the egg coffee, a nice surprise. Our guide "Annie" was very personable and very informative. A great introduction to Hanoi cuisine.

Great night. Very good value at US$20. The office was centrally located in the old quarter within easy walking distance to all the restaurants.Went to approximately 7 restaurants and finished with beer, coffee and icecream. Food was of good quality and a great introduction to Vietnamese cuisine.Our guide Sunny was informative, knowledgable and extremely helpful.

One of my highlights in Vietnam!. It's already a year ago (Jan 2015) but I think it's never to late for a review of one of my highlights and most memorable experiences during my past travels. I came back from Halong Bay and had only 4,5 hours till my night train to Sapa. More spontaneous than anything else I ended up joining a recently made friend for the 3,5 hours street food tour in the old part of Hanoi. Every minute of the tour and every bite of the different traditional local snacks we tried in more than a handful little street restaurants/stalls were sooo worthwhile! Our passionate and lovely guide "Money" provided us with excellent and valuable explanations about the local food culture and the snacks we had and chose thoroughly from the many places to give us the most authentic and varied experience possible. I can't recommend the tour more, it was by far my highlight in Hanoi and almsot from my entire 14 day trip to Vietnam. I am already looking forward to my next trip to Hanoi and this authentic and delicious food experience!

Authentic Delicious Taste of Hanoi. Our guide, "Pixie" was delightful in her enthusiasm and courageous in her street crossings! We were introduced to street food at its finest with a multi course progressive dinner as we moved from stop to stop. At the beginning we had a Vietnamese soup called Bun Cha and the tasty treats continued through eight yummy courses. Pixie explained in well-spoken English each of the items we ate. The group was congenial and fun - a great tour not to be missed. We had done a similar food tour in Saigon that did not begin to compare to this.

Street Food Tour at its best. The guide, Duong, is to be congratulated on making this tour definitely the highlight of our trip to Hanoi. Yes the food was / is excellent AND the experiene was / is most rewarding. Duong knows her way around the best street stalls, she knows all there is to know about the delicious food AND she also proved to be an excellent ambassador for Vietnamese culture and Hanoi's lifestyle. Thanks for a great night out -- Vivien and Terry from Melbourne.

Totally charming and worthy every penny. I got lucky because I ended up being the only one in the group tour.My tour guide name was Sunny and she totally stuffed me with al kind of delicious Vietnamese food and at the end egg coffee.I made a mistake to eat a little before the trip (because I was very hungry and because of the review 'Started hungry, finished hungry' by Carl J) but had to take my last meal home in a doggy bag and finished it this morning.Sunny was very nice company and at the end she wrote down all places and addresses by hand for me and even gave me two new places to explore the next day on my own.Very nice to do if you like street food and I think not expensive at all.

Great way to get an insight. This was a terrific tour and we highly recommend it. There were just the two of us and Mango was our excellent tour guide. She guided us through all the hectic streets and providing a really useful interesting insights into the city and its culture. She was very happy to answer all our questions and was very flexible about us over staying in some places and cutting short in others - no pressure to follow a strict schedule. Oh and the food was great !

This tour will pay for itself!. Been in Hanoi a day and had no idea where to find good authentic cheap food,without hitting the bland expensive tourist restaurants. Booked on this tour and had a great time walking the streets to find the best that Hanoi had to offer, at a fraction of the price. From noodles to pho to papaya salad, Kim, our guide, talked us through the different dishes at different restaurants. I was stuffed after the 3.5 hour tour, having visited 8 different places across the city. We had our 3 year old with us, and everyone in the group was very accommodating and sweet to him. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone, and Kim was particularly informative and so friendly.

Great Overview of Hanoi Steetfood. Great overview of the streetfood of Hanoi. Our tourguide Pixie was great and took us to a range of very nice places that I would never have found on my own. Great food and good value for money

Started hungry, finished hungry!. After being on a food tour in Bangkok which was amazing I think we'd set the bar a bit too high for Hanoi Street Food. Before I write anything else I have to mention our guide Mango who was amazing. She was so bubbly and bright and really loved showing off Hanoi to us. She on her own would be a 5* rating.The 'food' provided on the the tour was a bit of a joke portion wise. My wife doesn't eat much generally and even she came away dissatisfied. Out of the 10 foods you try one is an ice lolly, one is a beer, and one is a lemon tea. When you do get food they are simply just small snacks and we found it tough to work out where our 40$ had been spent. Some places we want to it felt like we were more killing time than on a tour. Such as visiting a closed temple, a photoshoot outside the cathedral and eating sunflower seeds in the lemon tea shop, which most people were eating to get some food in themselves!In general it's a good tour if you want to get your bearings, meet new people and have a very small taste of Northern Vietnamese food. To be honest though I would just do a walking tour less the food, and then save the extra to jump in to places yourself, after all it's rare that you can go wrong with street food in Vietnam. Just get a list of the local delicacies and go seek them out.It wasn't what we expected and we felt the price was a little too strong for what it was, 10 - 15$ would have been more like it.

Best way to try Vietnamese food!. We had a fantastic time on our street food tour with our guide Nha! Not only do you get to eat delicious food all evening, you also get a nice walking tour of the city and learn a bit about the culture. The tour lasted 3 hours and we got to try so many different tasty things, from typical breakfast soups, to unusual and yummy desserts, to egg coffee. My stomach was very full but felt totally fine after the tour. Highly recommend!

Great experience . This food tour is a great way to discover the local food. Our guide; Ms Moon was very enthusiastic and took us to 10 different places to eat a dish. All dishes were totally different from each other and very good. Nice that our guide took us to some places we had probably skipped (based on the looks of the restaurant ;))

Best tour ever! Thank you Pixie. 베트남 음식이 워낙 다양하고, 길거리 음식같은 경우에는 영어로 번역이 되어있지 않아 외국인들이 시도해보기 어려운데, 이 투어를 통해서 베트남 현지인들이 즐기는 다양한 음식을 맛볼 수 있어 정말 좋았습니다! 또 다양한 국적의 사람들과 얘기하며 그들의 문화와 생각을 알아갈 수 있어 정말 좋았습니다! 진짜 추천해용!I really enjoyed the tour. The first thing I like about the tour is I got to try different kinds of food in short amount of time. I also enjoyed talking to people from different country!! I really loved the tour guide Pixie!! She is smart and friendly and super awesome! Had a blast!

Highlight of our trip to Vietnam. We LOVED the walking evening street food tour. Our guide was great, and customized the tour to what we liked. We had SO much fun on the tour. The food was all AMAZING, and it was great to be able to walk around at night with someone who knew where to go. She also gave us great recommendations for where to eat the next day. And for only $20, this was an absolute bargain.

Ms. Moon made the day. As other reviewers have mentioned, we would never have known which establishments to try, nor would we have had the courage, had we not taken this tour. It seems that all the reviews here have complimented their tour guides, but it is hard to imagine a more engaging and charming guide than Ms. Moon. I don't know how she does it: how do you lead two trips a day, every day, to the same small list of food stalls and still keep your delivery fresh, exciting and fun? Our group of three couples who met her and each other for the first time felt we entirely lucked out to have Ms. Moon as our guide. One note: If you do the arithmetic, at $20 per head for three hours which has to cover food and the margin to the company, the guides can't be earning a lot in exchange for giving us a delightful introduction to Hanoi's food culture. If you enjoy the experience, don't forget to tip your guide!

Awesome.. If you want to experience authentic Vietnamese Street food , you have to do this tour. Our guide was super sweet and very passionate about her city, and food of course. We had a blast tasting all the incredible diversity of food Hanoi had to offer. A must do for the adventurous food lover.

A delicious evening!. The street food tour of Hanoi is a great way of learning what's good to eat and where to get it. Until we did the tour we had know idea what we were doing and wandering into a street food vendor's place seemed a little too intimidating when there are no English menus and you don't know the standard of cooking.Thanks to our fantastic guide, Pixie, we had the most delicious food during the evening and we feel we can confidently choose what to eat in restaurants now. It was a great experience, we met nice people and tried so much incredible food.I would suggest arriving very hungry and do this as your dinner or lunch. It's $20 very well spent!

Best way to eat your way around Hanoi. This was fantastic from beginning to end, we joined a group of ten and met our fantastic Guide berry who is brilliant at her job, we weaved our way through the manic streets of the old quater and were brought to where all the locals eat, we went through laneways,alleys and kitchens to reach each destination and through the 3 hour tour each meal was fantastic, you must try the egg coffee so tasty

Crazy Cherry and her sticky rice. Don't miss this Street Food Tour! Excellent guide Cherry walked us, 3 couples, through allees and very lively streets. We visited all kind of places and had us taste food we would have never tried ourselves! For 550k dong each we tasted at 8 locations, and btw no stomack issues afterwards!

Very wonderfull tour. We made this tour with Cherry (Hien). She was a wonderfull enthosiastic guide, who gave us a very pleasant evening in Hanoi. The food was very good and the trip through the old part of the town was very nice to do.
Thanks you Cherry.

Terrific Experience - Can't Recommend More Highly. This tour is amazing for the food, the quality of the guide (Ms. Moon in my case) and the value for money. For 3 great hours we were brought to a mix of restaurants and street vendors for dishes that were well prepared and very tasty.

Worth every dollar. This was a great tour and I highly recommend it. Mango was a great tour guide and kept us all safe when crossing the road (very important in Hanoi). We went back to the same restaurants the next day they were that good.
Great way to spend 20 USD

We love Ms Moon!. We were stoked with our street food tour. Worth every penny and Ms Moon is just the best guide. She is caring, funny and knowledgable. Would never have found the egg coffee place without going on the street food tour. Would totally do it all over again!

Amazing guide, amazing food.. This was an excellent experience and I could not recommend more highly. We went to 8 or 9 different places over 3 hrs. Great range of food - All were amazing. Our guide Phoenix/Phung was great!

Great night with a great guide. The street food tour was an excellent way to spend an evening--all the food is delicious, with nothing too out there for picky eaters. We didn't want it to end! Our host, Annie, was informative, fun, and friendly. We couldn't have asked for better. The food was so good that I went back for more the following day!

Awesome tour!. What a great way to experience the food in Hanoi. Cherry was our guide and she took us to places we would definately not have gone to on our own. Lost track of how many places we visited. Tour included a cold beer, many entrees, dessert and 'egg' coffee. Good thing to do your first day in Hanoi... then you'll know of 'safe' street food to enjoy while you are here. Paid 20. U.S. dollars for 3 hours tour. Cherry was very knowledgeable and spoke very good English.)

Food Baby . What an excellent food tour. Our tour guide Miss Moon was energetic and lively and took genuine pleasure in showing us some amazing vietnamese street food. It really helped me break the resistance to eating street food and really opened my eyes to just how good the food really is. Loved sitting on the tiny stools in restaurants i wouldn't normally try.Well worth the time and money. The spring rolls are amazing.

Terrific. Ms. Moon was a great tour guide. Definitely a must do in Hanoi and a great experience. Highly recommended. Professional and highly informative. Great way to try all the delicious foods in Hanoi. Request Ms Moon for a great and thorough explanation of all the history in Hanoi!

Keeps on getting more delicious. We read about Hanoi Street Food Tour in the internet and of course Trip advisor. searched the address and hailed a cab going there. For a first timer, the streets are confusing, of course, but when we got there, they are more than willing to be of service to us. We choose the street food tour. To our luck, we got the very energetic, lovely, knowledgeable and lively Miss Pixie together with Ms. Jao (a trainee), also as lovely as Pixie, as our tour guide. Aren't we lucky, we got two! :) They took us to different restaurants and gave us the information of what we are eating, how to eat, when is it eaten, ingredients, and sometime on how it is cooked. We ate like the locals, sitting in small chair, holding that chopsticks and enjoying their cuisine. We walked and ate and walk and ate. Not only to food, both of them gave us a peak on their history and their culture. Pixie was very attentive. She's the one serving us the food while explaining, and answered all of our questions. At the end of the tour, all of us are very happy with a big smiling tummy! :) And Pixie wrote on a piece of paper, which I still have, the food that we ate and the address of each place and it came really handy and useful since we came back in the Old Quarter to shop and eat! Then they walked with us to our taxi and gave instructions to them on where to go. Hugs of goodbyes!It was our first Food tour ever and I was really impressed. It is such a great tour since this will be a window to the Vietnam culture. It would be really great if you take this tour. I love the Vietnam dish! and will prolly come back for more! Thank you so much for the two girls who assisted us! :) We love you already!

Wonderful tour!. We couldn't have been happier with our tour led by the wonderful Annie! There are a lot of options to choose from when picking a Hanoi food tour, but I'm convinced this is by far the best. Annie took us to some fantastic places that we never would have been brave or knowledgeable enough on our own to venture into. The tour fee is more than covered by the amount and variety of food you get to try as well as the inside knowledge by the guides. Just book it!

Cherry bomb!. Cherry was our guide for the Hanoi street food tour and she was fantastic! She definitely has a good sense of taste and was very informative not only on the food but the culture of the city. She took us to areas in Hanoi we would have never thought of even peeking in to. She was very flexible in accommodating a couple food items we wanted to check out that were not on her list. Thanks Cherry!

Food Tour Dining Adventure. We took the motor scooter street food tour and we were very glad we chose this tour. Riding on the back of the motor scooter through Hanoi traffic was exciting - seeing & experiencing the congested Hanoi traffic close up and personal was fun. The food on the tour also was very good and the number of restaurants & food types we sampled was great. Our individual drivers/tour guides were a delight. I would recommend this tour for those who want a food tour but with a little more excitement.

Excellent. Our guide, Cherry, showed us Hanoi's from most tourists hidden street food stalls and we were not disappointed. We enjoyed listening to her stories and of course having lots of tasty food. The tour is certainly not the cheapest but we found it to be worth every Dollar and can only recommend doing it.

Taste of Paradise. Our tour guide Cherry was amazing - and as it was our first night in Hanoi and the first activity we did - it was the perfect way to start off our holiday. Cherry not only took us to some amazing places to eat - but she taught us how to deal with the traffic in Hanoi - which if you're not used to can be a little scary at times. The tour itself also shows you a bit of the city - and there are some places that you visit that you would've simply walked past had you not known how good the food was! The Bun Cha and the Papya salad were highlights for me - but everything was good - and you have the option of trying some of the more unusual foods if you want. This tour was brilliant - and a really good introduction to Hanoi. If you get the chance do it!

Amazing! . My husband and I did a food tour with Hanoi Street Food Tours and absolutely loved it! Our guide, Pixie, was the best. We lucked out because it was actually the last tour of the lunar year and they would be closed for the remainder of our time in Hanoi. Despite this, Pixie was able to locate some fantastic restaurants that were still open. We felt like it was a real authentic experience, as we were going to back alley restaurants and eating alongside locals on small chairs on the sidewalk. All of the food was incredible. We sampled 12 different food items and loved every one of them! We would absolutely recommend this tour to all our friends and family.

Brilliant . Took the street food tour with miss moon.....she was absolutely brilliant. Took us to some great local spots and shared great information about how to eat and mix the flavours. If you take he tour the biggest hint I can give is don't eat before hand. Afterwards she gave us a list of what we ate and the address of each restaurant so we could find our own way back

Fantastic!. I'd never eaten Vietnamese food before so this was a fantastic introduction to the types of food here. Our tour guide Cherry was incredible, cheerful and really funny! And all the foods we tried were super tasty. They even adjust foods according to your dietary requirements which was great for me considering I don't eat seafood. Awesome experience, even for a solo backpacker like me! Not to be missed whilst in Hanoi!

Perfect start to Vietnam vacation. If you're not familiar with Vietnamese foods, or even if you are, this is a great way to introduce yourself to the the cuisine of Vietnam. You'll get to experience enough different foods to prepare yourself for the rest of your time in Vietnam. Plus you get an informative Hanoi tour from a wonderful guide (Cherry in our case)! This is a DO NOT MISS in Hanoi.

Guide Annie was awesome and great street food. We had the pleasure of going on the Hanoi Street Food Tour with Annie as our guide. She took great pride in her job and she had lots of good stories to share, to our and the british couple enjoyment. She told us about the food we had along the way and I lost track during the 3 hour tour around Hanoi. We tried some of the many different street food and my favorit was the rice pancakes with pork, but the fried spring rolls and small pillows came pretty close.Please treat yourself and hope that Annie is your tour guide.

Amazing food, company and tour guide! . Booked this tour as it was recommended to me by a friend and I am so glad I did it! My first tour as a solo traveller and it was great. The food was incredible, we got to try everything you could think of. So many different dishes (tip: don't eat anything before hand) and a lovely tour guide who taught us so much about the food and culture, and included a great walk around the city. Definitely worth your money!

Great tour. An amazing tour guide - Sunshine such a knowledgeable young lady beautiful person, awesome food good fun walking around eating and enjoying The culture experience and meeting beautiful people, the egg coffee great tour and food

Awesome food and guide! . I had a favelous time during food tour. We can experience the most famous and tasty foods in Hanoi with great explanation. Our lovely guide "Kiwi" was really nice and friendly, also her English was good. We can had a fantastic food and got a lot of helpful information about the places to go while we stay here. I recommend you to book this tour on the first day. This tour would guide what to eat during your travel also. Again thanks for Kiwi with made wonderful time!

Food Tour With Hien (Cherry). Fantastic tour! Cherry was a very attentive and knowledgeable guide taking me to places to sample a wide variety of food in places that as I tourist I would either never have found or tried. This tour has given me lots of ideas for places to try for the rest of my stay in Hanoi....thanks Cherry!I would recommend Cherry and this tour to anyone who is interested in the local food of Hanoi.....a great evening!

Motorbike Food Tour great fun. Our family of four did the three hour evening motorbike food tour. We were promptly picked up by Money and her team of Alice, Tina and Maya from our hotel. We went to the office to pay then headed out on the tour. We had a great time feeling perfectly safe in the mayhem of Hanoi traffic. All the food stops were good, places we would never have gone to by ourselves. At the end Money wrote out a list of what we had eaten where. She also gave some suggestions of other places to try, which were also good. The girls were charming, friendly and good fun making it a thoroughly enjoyable night.

Highlight of Our Hanoi Experience. We really enjoyed this tour and it was a great introduction to Vietnamese food, including things that we wouldn't have known to try on our own. The tour guide was great and we learned a lot about Hanoi and its food. We have recommended this tour to multiple friends visiting the city.

완전 좋아요!! It's really good!!. 저녁에 혼자서 투어를 했습니다. 가이드가 'cherry'라는 여성분이었는데 완전 친절하고 좋았습니다. 가격은 베트남 물가에 비해서 저렴한 것은 아니지만 직접 하노이 골목 구석구석을 다니면서 로컬들의 맛집을 찾아다니는 것이 아주 재미있었습니다. 한번에 여러가지 베트남 음식을 설명과 함께 쭉 맛볼 수 있다는 것이 좋은 것 같습니다. 한번쯤 해보시는걸 추천드려요!! 하기전에는꼭 배를 비우세요..많은 것을 먹어야하니까요. I took this tour alone. My guide was 'Cherry'. She was really kind, lovely and funny. It's more interesting than I'd expected. The food was local street things and the taste was great. I think it's suitable for foreign visitors. Because it's not easy to find delicious local restaurants by himself. I'm sure that if you join this program, it will be your best experience in Hanoi. Thank you Cherry!!♥︎

Wonderful Tour Guide. I decided to do this tour because I wanted to experience Vietnamese Street Food and this tour had the best reviews. It did not disappoint. I did the night tour and paid on arrival. I was the only person doing the tour so instead of a group tour it turned out to be a private tour. My guide was Hien (Cherry) and she was probably the nicest person I met during my time in Vietnam. She was sweet, funny, friendly, informative and always smiling and laughing. It was easy to tell that she really enjoys her job. We went to 10 different places and I was able to try a wide range of local food and drink. I would highly recommend doing this tour.

Great introduction to street food. We booked this tour on the day at their site in the 'Kim's Tours' building in the Old Quarter and were pleased to be shown around some really interesting places by a good guide in a small group of 3 couples. We visited at least half a dozen street food outlets/small restaurants and enjoyed a great variety of dishes. Sure the food is good, but for us the tour was more about being guided around places you might not have the confidence to go to on your own, particularly if (like us) you just arrived in the country that day. For this reason we'd particularly recommend the tour for new arrivals, but it'd be fun for more experienced hands too.

First night in Vietnam . My husband and I joined a tour with Phoenix on our first night in Vietnam and this was a great introduction to Hanoi and it's food. Phoenix took us to a great choice of restaurants which we probably would never have tried. Great start to our holiday, thank you

Steretfood in old town. We booked the tour in advance over Internet. 20$/p or 460.000VND
Our tour guide Cherry was very engaged and we got an insight of Vietnamese food culture. Spicy, sweet, hot, cold... We liked and would recommend to to this at your first evening.
Very good. Do not hesitate to try the street food,we had it douzenf times and enjoyed it,there is also the street food tour that helped us to discover a lor of local foods,

Great day. We have lived in Hanoi for a year and before leaving we decided to go on a street food tour. We were not disappointed. Ms. Moon took us to some of our favourite places, some places we had been recommended and some we'd never heard of. Each one was delicious. Ms Moon was a great guide and took care of us and the others on the tour :)

Very good night . Did this tour last night with my girlfriend! No better way to try the local food! Packed with information that I will use again for sure! Had a nice small group, and we left about 6:30. Our tour guide was a young student (berry) with good English and gave us the inside on every place!! From Vietnamese breakfast,, snacks, dinner and coffee! If your doing it, make sure u go with an empty stomach, cos u get proper fed!
Amazing Tour with Mango!. My husband and I really enjoyed our tour with Mango. This is an excellent way to explore Vietnamese food if you are not confident with ordering street food.

Great tour and the best price. Last night with my wife and four fiends we were taken on a fantastic street food tour by Sunny, a delightful and knowledgable young lady. Our evening tour commenced with a short lesson on how to survive the frantic Hanoi traffic. Sunny taught us the Sticky Rice theory, stick together, don't stop or slow down. It worked we arrived back at the start all 6 of us! Sunny took us to 6 street food stalls, fantastic food, even had a go at making rice paper rolls on the pavement. We all agree, a great experience, that you Hanoi Street Food Tour and the lovely Sunny

Wonderful experiences - the food, the guides, and the motor scooter view of Hanoi. This is a wonderful way to experience many facets of Hanoi. Riding on the back of a motor scooter, rather than fearfully dodging between them on foot, was great fun. We sampled several very different meals, saw a lot of the city, and our guides Nga (a.k.a. "Money") and Alice were terrific - very friendly, talkative, and informative about Hanoi and Vietnam history and contemporary culture. The ride across the Long Bien bridge to the east side of the Red River got us out of the Old Quarter, and was well worth it for the outstanding clams and a taste of rice whiskey. Money left us with a list of all the dishes we had (we never would have remembered the names) with addresses of where we ate, and even gave us recommendations on other dishes to try (and where to get them) during the rest of our stay.

A highlight of our trip to Vietnam!. My boyfriend and I knew nothing about Vietnamese cuisine, so this tour was a perfect way to experience the food and explore Hanoi. Cherry, our guide, was amazing - she was sweet, energetic, informative, and made it a truly memorable experience. She spoke great English and was able to answer all of our questions and share a lot of knowledge with us about the local food and culture. We stopped at about eight eateries, which provided a great variety of food. Each stop was spaced out well so we weren't rushed or overly-stuffed, but still got an ample amount of food. Definitely worth the $20!

I still dream of the food!. Wow! This was the first food tour I had ever been on and it will not be the last!As a solo traveller with no local friends to show me around this street food tour seemed like a good activity for expanding my knowledge of Vietnamese food and culture apart from the quintessential pho. I absolutely love pho but I really wanted to try some new things.This tour opened up my eyes to so many delicious dishes that I never would have tried if I hadn't done this tour. There were ten food/drink items from egg coffee, to beef knuckle salad, to dumplings, to bun cha, to beer, to dessert....oh my goodness! Make sure that you go on an empty stomach because you will be so full at the end of it all. At the beginning, the servings seemed so tiny but it's actually to save space.One tip I have for you is to take a picture of the dish with the name written on a napkin beside it. That way you can always go and have more another time! If you can, also mark down the locations of each place on a map. The egg coffee place was particularly obscure so if you want to go back, make sure to take notes!Our tour was a group of six plus our guide. Our guide, I can't remember her name, but she was really sweet and made the whole experience so much fun. I think her name begins with an "m", she had glasses and bangs.This is only the beginning of food tours! I could not recommend this tour more. Such a wonderful experience and well worth the money!

Fantastic tour. We found this trip on TripAdvisor. We did the night walking food tour. Thoroughly enjoyed it and highly recommend it. Our guide (Kiwi) was so friendly and knowledgable. She took us to about 8 places - all hidden away, local haunts. We tried a huge variety of foods - make sure you come hungry! Not a cheap tour but definitely worth it.

Fun food adventure . This is a great way to get an orientation to Vietnamese food beyond the typical foods that you may be familiar with (i.e. Pho, bahn mi). We tasted a variety of foods and if you have a dietary restriction, they will certainly accommodate that as well. We enjoyed each of our food stops and felt like locals eating in places the Hanoi people would!

Unforgettable Christmas Eve Tour. Our tour guide 'Money' is the most genuine, thoughtful and well spoken tour guide I have ever met. She has a genuine passion for her city and the incredible array of food it offers. Every stop was organised, on point, with almost no waiting time at each stop - just straight to the eating.If the Birj Kalifa in Dubai is the world's only six star hotel, then Hanoi Street Food Tour is Hanoi's six star tour experience.Thank you Money for your kindness and memories on Christmas Eve 2015.

Friendly and informative tour. Our guide Mango was very sweet and took her time to tell informative stories abort the places and the country. Very friendly atmosphere and a very nice tour in general. I think the price is very fair, you wont leave hungry !

A Highlight of our Visit to Vietnman. Make this your very first stop in Hanoi - then you can go back to your favorite spots for meals for the rest of your visit. Ms. Moon is a gem - she brings a passion for food and the culture of Hanoi, plus a great sense of humor and fun to the tour. We were lucky to have a small group four our Street Food tour (8), leaving at 11:00 am. She happily accommodated my partner's vegetarianism and my own preferences (no red meat). Stopping at 10 different locations, we were so full, we never even considered eating dinner that night. Everything we tried was great, and we would not have experienced any of them without the tour. Even if we had found the locations on our own, we would not have known what/how to order. She had interesting tidbits to share about everything we ate, from where the dish originated to nutritional properties.After two weeks in Vietnam and Cambodia, this tour definitely stands out as a highlight and I absolutely recommend, especially if you can get Ms. Moon. Ms. Moon Rocks!

TAKE. THIS. TOUR!. My husband and I heard about this tour while traveling in Thailand actually. It was one of the first tours we took once we got into town. It was amazing! Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and helpful. You will get your moneys worth on the tour--they are not stingy at all with the amount of food or drinks. Many of the places we would not have found (or thought to visit) on our own--and we ended up going back to many of the places from the tour during the rest of the stay. We met some great people on the tour that we still keep in touch with. We had a fantastic time and would recommend it to others!

Real Street food by an amazing guide. Three of us went on a private street food tour with Nga (Money). We got to sample a lot of dishes from different places around the Old Quarter, as we expected. However, the experience could not be as good without Money. We were very impressed by her English communication skill. Out of the 5 days in Hanoi, we had at least 5 tour guides for different activities. We can easily say she was the best one. ps. we paid 90 dollars for three of us, the food was hardly 20 dollars, so you should really bargain or at least make a request for Money to be your guide

Discover great food, have a great time!. We were fortunate enough to have Kat guide us through the wonderful food secrets of Hanoi. While we had eaten well on our own while visiting Hanor, Kat led us to some great places we would have never discovered, and explained a great deal about food preparation. The tour stopped at about 8 places, and we sampled noodle dishes, desserts, fresh beer (bia hoy), rice dishes of every kind, and finished with a delicious, locally famous coffee. We had a truly great evening, and learned so much about the food in Hanoi. In the days afterwards, we returned to many of the places we discovered that night.

Fantastic tour. Really great way to try the places you wouldn't know about and wouldn't know how or what to order.Cherry was our guide and was super passionate about her job! She was very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. There was enough flexibility in what we could eat so she accommodated vegetarian/no pork without any fuss.Really reasonably priced for the length of the tour, quality and quantity of food. Would highly recommend!

Best Tour in Vietnam. The street food tour was a highlight of my trip to Vietnam. I’ve recommended it countless times to friends going to Vietnam. It was a wonderful tour of the city and Ms. Moon, our guide, was passionate and informative about the food and city. We were lucky because he had a small group and could go into tiny restaurants with limited seating. The tours are customized based on the size and preferences of the group. Went to 8 food places and 3 drink places, including a place where we sat on low stools and had a couple glasses of beer (perfect). I don’t like seafood but all the seafood dishes were my favorites! Some of the food I tried included, crab soup, BBQ pork, fried fish, prawn soup, spring rolls, pillow cake, moon cake, rice pancakes, water chestnuts, egg coffee, sugar cane, beer… The street food tour was a highlight of my trip to Vietnam. I’ve recommended it countless times to friends going to Vietnam. It was a wonderful tour of the city and Ms. Moon our guide was passionate and informative about the food and city. We were lucky because he had a small group and could go to tiny places with limited seating. The tours are customized based on the size and preferences of the group. Went to 8 food places and 3 drink places, including a place where we sat on low stools and had a couple glasses of beer (perfect). I don’t like seafood but all the seafood dishes were my favorites! Some of the food I tried included, crab soup, BBQ pork, fried fish, prawn soup, spring rolls, pillow cake, moon cake, rice pancakes, water chestnuts, egg coffee, sugar cane, beer… Really awesome tour – I highly recommend it! Really awesome tour – I highly recommend it!

Amazing food tour. My guide was Donut and she was helpful and made the tour fun and enjoyable! Make sure you have a light lunch, you will be taken to eat so many delicious food around Old Quarter! Highly recommended!

the best night we had in hanoi. This street food tour was definitely a highlight of our time in hanoi. We would recommend doing this earlier on in your stay so that you can revisit some of the amazing places you will eat in again. Our friendly guide picked us up from our hotel lobby and throughout the evening accommodated the groups various requests along the way ranging from rice wine to street side chicken wings culminating in the hardest to find cafe, serving the best egg coffee in all of hanoi. Definitely don't eat lunch before this tour otherwise you will have to bow out half way!

Behind the Scenes of Hanoi's Night Food. Had one of our best nights in Hanoi doing the food tour with Cherry, our guide. She did an amazing job of easing us in by starting at a sit down restaurant, then going to more and more local styled places. We made it to 6 spots in all. She was very fun, and incredibly knowledgeable. I would recommend the tour to anyone!

Great street food tour. We had a private 3 hour tour with Cherry, who was a delight and very knowledgable about the ingredients in the dishes we tried, as well as many other things we asked about.We had been a little anxious before the trip about whether our stomach's would accept everything we ate, however we had no problems afterwards, so you can feel confident about trying all this street food.Arranging the trip was a bit torturous, we corresponded with a Mr Nguyen who obviously struggled to comprehend what we wanted, however once we were there, the guide was wonderful and the experience was well worth having persisted for.We had a very limited time in Hanoi and so we chose this as a way of seeing the old city - rather than being bussed from one attraction to the other. We had such a great time and we are so glad we chose this. If you like Vietnamese food, this is a great way to experience Hanoi.

Fantastic tour- a must do in Hanoi. We did a tour with Mango in the old quarter and it was absolutely great. Mango was very knowledgeable and gave a good introduction to Vietnamese culture in addition to the street food. The food was delicious, there was tonnes of variety and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! Mango- 10 stars! You were great!

Fantastic tour. Wonderful private evening tour with Peach. She was friendly, informative and fun - and it goes without saying that the food was wonderful. Gave us the confidence we needed to eat street food ourselves for the rest of our holiday. Do it!

Must do in hanoi!. My 9 yr old son and i did a private tour with Nga and it was awesome!We did the motorcycle tour the next day with her in the rain and ahe made it a total delight! Of all the things we did on our 4 day stay we both enjoyed these 2 tours more than anything. It was truly worth the money! We felt much ovliged to tip heavy too. Nga and Hung were so incredibly wonderful. Highly recommend. Made our trip perfect. The owner is very quick to reapond to emails too. And extremely polite and patient. 10 stars!

No trip to Hanoi is complete without it.... My partner and I chose to do the Hanoi Street Food tour in January 2016 after it came highly recommended on Tripadvisor. Definitely worth the money.Our tour guide Sunny was extremely friendly and took us to about 7 local eats where we stopped to try a traditional Vietnamese dish at each place.It was no problem that we do not eat seafood - there were plenty of other options available for us to eat without feeling like we were missing out on the experience. If we hadn't have gone on this tour, many of these dishes we probably would never have tried.Make sure you arrive with an empty stomach, because Sunny made sure that we didn't leave hungry at the end!A must do for any trip to Hanoi.

Must do in Hanoi . My husband and I did this in a group tour and were very impressed. I am not adventurous with food and wasn't brave enough to wander around trying street food so this tour was a great way for us to try lots of local foods (and not get sick!). We got to eat so much food and try so many different things. The guide was friendly and knowledgable and we think it's excellent value for money.

Brilliant intro to Vietnamese food! . We booked an evening food tour with Hanoi food tours as soon as we got into the city. They were very easy to book with and very friendly. We chose to do a private tour rather than a group tour so we could ask more questions but also because we had specific dietary requirements. Our guide Pixie was great, she took us to some great local eateries and explained everything to us. It would have been great to have visited other places which served chicken rather than pork/beef however it was still good. It was a great way to be inducted into Vietnamese street food! You should book with these guys!

Sunny was an excellent guide.. Over 3 hours we went to about 10 different street food places, all were excellent. Our guide Sunny was excellent, very friendly and happy to share her knowledge. She was happy to deviate from the tour route to show us anything we were curious about. I very much recommend this tour, we paid $22US per person and it was one of the highlights of our 4 week trip to Vietnam.

Great intro to Hanoi. Shu was a great guide and gave us the I side scoop on the best and most authentic Hanoi street food. Worth the money not only for all the food (don't eat before!) And also a guide through the Old quarter. Her additional recommendations were spot on and we enjoyed dinner at a place she told us about. Highly recommend!

Brilliant. . Great way to enjoy plenty of different foods that you might not otherwise find and definitely value for money. Do not eat lunch if going in the afternoon/evening - you won't need to. Mango was my guide and she was absolutely lovely, answering general questions and telling us a bit about the history of the area and Vietnamese culture as we ate.

Thanks Phoenix!. Great experience. We definitely wouldn't have tried some of the restaurants without a guide. It was like a crash course of flavours in 1 night. Great for first night there. Thanks Phoenix for your fashion advice and the great egg coffee.

Great value and experience. Such a brilliant tour, it didn't feel rushed and we got to try a lot of dishes. Our guide was great and it was nice to chat to a big group (of about 10) as we had been travelling the two of us for a few weeks. Our only regret is that we did this on our last night not our first so we couldnt revisit any of our favourites!

I love it. Last week . I had been in Hanoi and enjoyed street food in here. So great . I loved Bun Cha ,Pho and eggs coffee .My guide and i had walked around Hoa Kiem Lake and explored some famous places. We had a great dinner.Thanks.

Very fun night and lots of food!. We had a great evening joining the 6:30 walking tour with a 6 person group and our guide Phoenix. We tried lots of delicious things, quite a few we hadn't had yet, kumquat juice, papaya salad with crispy beef jerky, bun cha, egg coffee, sweet desserts with lychees and sticky rice...among others. Well worth the money and a nice way to meet new people.

Delicious! Great way to experience Hanoi. We did this food tour with Ms. Moon who did a great job of explaining the food and creating an entertaining and delicious experience. This is the perfect way to try street food in a low risk manner as all the food is vetted for cleanliness and quality. You'll be able to try food that you wouldn't otherwise know how to order. I highly recommend this!

Fun & Filling. My boyfriend and I booked this tour for our first day in Hanoi and we are so happy to have had the experience.We were able to pay the registration fee on our CC and the prices were clearly quoted for us in USD, which was helpful since it was our first night in the country.We chose the 6:30pm tour and had Pheonix as our guide. She was a sweetheart and spoke great English so we were able to joke and carry conversation all night. Our group of six got instant access to some remote restaurants around the Old Quarter and tried a huge list of foods we otherwise would not have known to eat. My boyfriend and I were so full (rare occurrence!) by the last couple of stops, we were slowly entering a food-coma and were practically passed out by the time we got dessert. Would recommend taking the tour with this company to anyone! And we will definitely book again with them when we return.

Highlight of Hanoi. Wow! This is not to be missed during a visit to Hanoi! Im a super fussy eater and my husband was terrified by the thought of trying street food so we went in to this tour on our first day in Hanoi (and first day of our Vietnam honeymoon trip) feeling VERY anxious. But we were blown away by this tour and the delicious food along the way. We chose the evening walking tour and had no idea there was going to be so many stops (we lost count but it was somewhere around 10) and we tried everything and it was delicious, we were so full! Our guide was awesome and really helped us to relax and enjoy ourselves. We would never have stopped and ordered on our own at the places we went to on the tour so it was a pleasant surprise and a great start to our trip as we felt very brave from then on to step outside our comfort zone and eat at different places.Overall this was really fun, and an absolute must while in Hanoi, it was the highlight of our stay!

Great way to experience Hanoi street food - Cherry was the best!. My 4 friends and I booked a private street food tour ($25/person) and had the great fortune of getting Cherry (Hien) as our guide. Cherry was friendly, knowledgeable, and showed our group many incredible places to eat street food. We had 7 stops in our 3 hours, ate more than should be humanly possible, learned a lot about the flavors and ingredients in Vietnamese cuisine, and had an absolutely amazing afternoon. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who enjoys eating - and make a special request to have Cherry as your guide! Also, Cherry was able to accommodate dietary restrictions from one of the members of our group!

Outstanding. What a great way to explore the old quarter, get fed and learn about Vietnamese cuisine. Worth every cent and the guide was lovely and made everyone feel at home.
Highly recommended
Amaaaazing! . Amazing food, great guide. The food was amazing and we seen a lot of Hanoi that we would have not seen otherwise. Best thing we did in Vietnam. Thank you! Christine and Cormac

Fantastic food tour! . We absolutely enjoyed our 3 hour walking tour of the old quarter and delighted in trying out new food! We did this tour on our very first day in Vietnam as a way to jump right in, and we are glad we did. Our guide, Miss Moon, spoke very good English, was very informative, and super friendly. We went all over the old quarter and tried some of the smallest little places with some very delicious eats. Highlights definitely include the egg coffee, deep fried rolls, mixed fruit with coconut cream, Bo Bia, and the green papaya salad. The day was topped off walking through tiny alley ways with a cold beer in hand (Bia Hoi). I would highly recommend this food tour!

If you want to see the Old Quarter do this tour. We arrived from Ho Chi Minh City and only had a couple of days to explore Hanoi, so we booked this tour to collect us from our hotel as soon as we arrived. We just loved it! Pixie was our guide and she was just fabulous. She took into account our likes and dislikes and made it a great adventure from start to finish. WE found so many delicacies that we had not tasted in the south and it set us up for our 10 day tour of north of Vietnam.Happy to recommend it to anyone because as exciting as the Old Quarter is its a bit confusing at first and you need to walk around it with someone who can explain things clearly.

Highly recommended!. Our guide (Hien / Cherry) was friendly, cheerful and knowledgeable with excellent English. As she brought us from stop to stop she made us feel like her friends visiting from out of town, rather than a guided tour.One of the best tours I've been on anywhere in Asia. We paid an extra few dollars to make it a private tour of four people and I honestly could not recommend it any more highly.
Duong's amazing tour. Duong led an amazing food experience for myself and my partner. We had a great night as Duong exposed gems of the city it's culinary delights.

Great tour. We had 7 diffrent dishes, beer and lots of fun. Our guide was funny and knowledgeable. She gave us an intro about Vietnamese food, culture and she even gave us some recommendations for other street foods. It was a great experience that we would never find it on our own.P/s: Going hungry as there is a lot of food! A definite must do in Ha Noi

Best guide and fantastic street food!. This was the highlight of my trip. I booked the 3 hour walking tour and Phenix was the tour guide. She was super friendly and knowledgeable and added a personal touch to the tour. We could not have asked for a better person to show the culinary delights of Hanoi.Come hungry though - I was so full at the end of the tour, I could barely stand up!Best was the egg coffee (I had two!) and a sour crab/noodle soup with tofu.Do not miss this!

Fantastic tour, great food and great guide!. My boyfriend and I joined this tour after seeing some of the excellent TA reviews and we were not disappointed. Our guide - Mango - was excellent, really knowledgeable and friendly and took us to some wonderful places. We still say 'sticky rice' every time we cross the road now!The tour was very well organized and we got to see a lot of the Old Quarter and little places we wouldn't have known about. The food was delicious and again, we wouldn't have tried it if not for Mango and the tour. Bun Cha is just delicious! Good value as the cost includes all your food and some water. Don't hesitate to join one of these tours.

So much delicious food. One of the highlights of our time in Hanoi. This food tour was great for getting some local knowlegde into vietnamese street food and where the best places were. We went to about 10 places and this took 2-3hrs.

Very nice tour - a very good start into any Vietnam trip. We enjoyed our street food tour with Mrs. Moon very much! She showed us nice placed where we wouldn't have stopped on our own. It's a perfect way to start any Vietnam experience when you have just arrived! She also took care that my girlfriend is vegan!

Wow, the best of Hanoi street food. A great experience with the irrepressible Miss Moon leading us to the best examples of about 10 different street foods. She even showed us how to cross the road in Hanoi and survive. The food was brilliant but it would have been better if we had less! Smaller portions would mean more space for the later treats - it still would be worth the money.
Private Street Food Tour with Nga ( Money). We had a really nice time with our guide Nga (Money). She told us a lot about the food, answered all our questions and we had many delicious dishes.

Great tour, great food and great guide. We had 10 different dishes, a few drinks and what felt like a short walk for three hours. Miss Moon was funny, took good care of us and showed us some good spots to eat that we never would have found ourselves. Great tour!

Amazing tour and great food. For foodies and not...this is a great way to explore our old quarter, get some more insights about Hanoi and Veitnam, while getting to know most popular dishes of the local cuisine. Most of the places we ate were authentic and really great. No way to find them alone. One of the best parts of the tour was our guide... She called her self 'Mango'. Her English was great, very knowledgeable, funny and shared much more than just the 'dry' info of a tour guide. Recommendation - do it on your first day so you'll know where to go back.

The best way to try the hidden street foods. It was a great experience as we wouldn't dare to gi to thise places on our own.Don't look at the small damp place you'd go, or your plate, just try it and you won't regret it. Our guide Kiwi was an amazing guide. She gave us an intro about the Vietnamese food, and culture and she even gave us some recommendations for other street foods to try on our own. Her english was really giod and sufficient and she made sure that all of us are enjoying, and asked us each time if we want to try something else. She explained all the ingridents in each food we tried and made sure that we are not alergic to some ingridients

Great way to experience street food with a local. We made a private street food tour with Duong (aka Pixie) and were glad we did! Hanoi can be quite intimidating with so many sights and smells and so many places offering the local fare. Duong navigated us expertly through the streets for 3 hours making regular stops so we could sample all the traditional dishes. I would recommend going hungry as there is a lot of food! A definite must do in Hanoi.

Great Way To Discover Hanoi. It was only through passing a sign in a small alleyway that I saw yesterday saying street food tour $20 & following up on Trip Advisor that I discovered this amazing experience. Tour began at 11.00 with 9 of us & Miss Moon our wonderful tour guide. She started with a street place that made sticky rice cakes & told us to stay together like sticky rice when following her down small streets & alleys. Each place we stopped for a new plate, she explained the ingredients & how long the vendor had been there. We were totally stuffed with delicious food, beer & egg coffee by the time we finished 3.5hrs later. We sampled 10 dishes (yum) & all were sumptuous.Thank you Miss Moon you were a breath of fresh air with a delightful sense of humour.

A great way to see and taste the street food in Hanoi . A fantastic tour tasting/drinking about 8 of the favourite street foods of Hanoi. Cherry had great English and explained about Vietnamese culture on the trip as well. Do not turn up without an appetite, you will be so full by the end of it! Great value at US$20

Best part of our Hanoi visit. Our friends who had just traveled in Hanoi recommended Hanoi Street Food Tour on a private tour (2 people versus a group of 8) with Ms. Moon. We followed their advice and requested Ms. Moon but when we arrived were matched with Mango. We loved Mango and she did a great job leading our tour. Mango took us around to 8 establishments to try 11 foods, snacks and drinks. I was worried we would be way too stuffed to try all the food, but each stop doesn't involve an entire meal. 9 out of the 11 things we tried were brand new to us and most likely we wouldn't have ever tried them without the tour. Every single one was good, and some were great! Our favorite was the dingy hole-in-the-wall where we got to make our own rice pancakes that were wrapped around fried pork and mushrooms and dipped in a light sauce (called Banh cuon). In addition to trying great food, we got a different look of the city as we walked through back alleys and around hidden corners in Old Quarter Hanoi. Mango did a great job stopping throughout the tour and explaining the historical and cultural significance of different aspects of the city. At the end of the tour, Mango wrote down the names and addresses of all the places we went and gave us tips for the rest of our time in Hanoi. When I look back on our trip to Hanoi, this stands out as my favorite part (partially for the food, partially for the view of the city, and partially for our great tour guide). It was pricier than we were anticipating ($30 USD per person for the private tour), but it was worth it. The private tour seemed like the way to go because many places we went were tiny spaces, and in a large group you could be crowded out or pushed to the back. If you go, request Mango!

Mango the tour guide showed uw great places with nice food and drinks. We went with Mango our tourguide. She brought us to al great places for lovely food and drinks, between she told us a lot about the city and the country.
We had a wonderfull evening with lovely new food and drinks.
I would reccomend the tour! I also recommend the tourguide

A+ would do again.. We have just completed the tour via scooter. Easily the best thing we have done in Hanoi. They take you to some amazing food places and share some interesting stories about the people who make the food and the city. Scooters are the way to go, excellent safe drivers. We had a great time with our tour guides Money and Anni, awesome people!

Best way to experience Hanoi food and culture. We had just finished a tour throughout Vietnam and had a few days left to explore Hanoi. We were tossing up between the walking tour and the scooter tour, and ended up with the latter. We were not disappointed, as the locations we travelled were actually some distance away!We went with a group of 5 friends and as soon as we were introduced to Nga, we knew we were in for a good night.We then hopped onto a scooter driven by a friendly local, most of them students or doing this on top of studying/working other jobs and were taken to several locations to experience street food all around Hanoi. We also stopped off at several locations and learnt about the history and culture of each part.Getting to each destination was half the fun and not even the rain could quell our excitement, in fact it just added to the whole experience. In addition, they do offer pickup and drop off to your hotel, so travel isn't an issue. All in all, one of the best experiences we've had during our time in Vietnam!

Great way to see the city. We booked the morning city tour as pillions on scooters. Our guides, Nga and Annie were excellent riders, we never felt unsafe in the traffic, even when it began to rain. We went the HCM mausoleum & some lesser known city sights as I had been to a few of the regulars. The girls really knew their stuff regarding Vietnamese history. We also had some stops for street food along the way. In all a top day & highly recommended. Andrew

Great way to see the city of Hanoi. We had a great morning out with Nga and Annie doing the city morning tour. We saw HCM's mausoleum and house where he lived and a number of other historical sites in Hanoi. We also got to try some authentic street food including a great egg coffee. Nga and Annie were very friendly as happy to answer our questions, Nga provided us with lots of interesting historical facts about Hanoi and Vietnam's history throughout the trip. A great way to get an understanding of the city on my first visit. Thanks!

Great tour...and filling too!. Just got back from the Street Food Waling Tour with Annie as our guide. Even though we had sampled a lot of Vietnamese food over the years, this tour opened up some new vistas for us. A good variety (and a good bit of it) for a decent price. Annie was the perfect guide, moving us right along without rushing us and giving us insight into a lot of the foods we sampled.

Great look at the old quarter, fantastic food and Ms Moon, a great guide.. The food was fabulous and Ms Moon was very informative not only about the food but the city itself. I would do this again the next time I visit. A must if you are a meat and three veg diner.

Ho hum just another five star review. During busy season you need a reservation. According to Phoenix our tour guide high season is December and January. We were fortunate that it was not busy when we went. We were able to walk up and secure a place in line. We paid $20 US. This is a three hour tour. You will have a place or two or three to go to the bathroom if you need to. It might be wise to take some toilet paper if you think you might even remotely needed it. If you are a little finicky you might bring along your own chopsticks or a sanitizing cloth to wipe the ones provided by the restaurants. However we used the provided chopsticks at every restaurant and had no side effects. You will have to cross the street multiple times. You will be provided beer at several locations. The price is all inclusive. Pheonix did such a great job we wanted to tip her. We had 8 stops. They will adjust the restaurant locations if you have food allergies or concerns. It was the highlight of day and not only provided the where of good food but the cultural experience of the old quarter. We would have paid $20 just to learn about everyday life in the old quarter. We recommend the 1830 tour because you get to watch the after work environment evolve. Parents taking kids home, people stopping for dinner,then all the young natives and expats heading out for the nightlife. We managed to pass the beer corner twice and the crowd was amazing. Do this!

great way to see the city. This is a great tour with really friendly staff.They take you round 6-7 different places and let you try all different types of food - starters, soup, fried, fruits, spring rolls, egg coffee, and desserts.It is very well organised, def do it as soon as you arrive in the city it is a great way to see the streets. Also don't eat before going I can eat a lot but was stuffed by the end and a lot of people couldn't finish all the food.

The best way to learn about Vietnamese cuisine. Our guide Cherry was wonderful. Food was amazing! For $25 we ate at 8 different places. Don't eat lunch if you're going at night! We were totally stuffed

Great Value. We had Mango as a guide who's favorite phrase for our 8 person group crossing busy streets was "be like sticky rice". We didn't have too much sticky rice but we had several interesting dishes ranging from noodle and barbecue to lemon ice cream to rolled rice pancakes to lemon tea to beer to a Vietnamese sandwich to wrapping up with egg coffee and rice wine. Very reasonably priced ~$20 USD lasting about 3+hours in a max group of 10 people which is perfect. You walk a bit which helps deal with the amount of food offered. It's all so good so you're definitely tempted. A few places look a little sketchy but turned out fine. Met interesting people from all over comparing experiences which added nicely to the evening. Great value.

Do This in Hanoi!!. This was a fantastic tour! Cherry was awesome and had such a great, fun attitude while taking us to different spots. She was knowledgeable about each dish and the culture of Hanoi. We had a great time and I would recommend doing this tour to anyone!

A must do !. We arrived in Hanoi and on our second day there did a private tour starting at 6pm with Pixie. ( 3 of us ). We are SO glad we chose to do this, as we would never have had the opportunity to go the the amazing street food places we visited with her. Pixie explained in great detail how the food was prepared, why certain ingredients were used to balance flavours , and also the history of the dishes we tasted. We had so much fun. Venturing into tiny street food stall that we would never have had the courage to try alone. In all we went to 8 places - and loved every minute of it. Pixie is excellent at her job and I highly recommend that you ask for her to lead your group ! Thanks Pixie for a great night.Lou, Bronwyn and Gail.

Great Eating Experience. We had an enjoyable food experience in Hanoi. We devoured the beautiful, fresh, tasty and interesting food. We loved it, all the food places were local so it was fantastic to interact and experience the local atmosphere. Our guide was lovely, great english, knoweledgeable and friendly. Well worth it.

Best, most delicious way to see Hanoi!. The guide was so much fun and showed us some great places that we would never have found without her. The tour was tailored to the groups preferences and we ate so much; great value for money.

Lovely tour guides. We did a morning tour with Money and Anna. What delightful tour guides. They were so friendly and personable.They took us to Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum and it was really informative having them with us. Tasted some great street food including the famous egg coffee. Highly recommended this tour.

Brilliant. Brilliant tour, thoroughly worth the money. Tours are personalised to each guide, who basically takes you to their favourite hole-in-the-wall local restaurants. Serving mouth-watering food at considerably cheaper prices than Westerner-friendly establishments, these are Hanoi's hidden gems but ordinarily you'd be put off by the absence of menus, prices, dish translations or any other concession to tourist sensibilities. After the tour you feel a lot more confident wandering in and ordering. Food was amazing, extremely good value for money (I nearly burst) and our tour guide Cherry was brilliant - incredibly enthusiastic and always willing to order something extra if you expressed curiosity. Been recommending this tour to everybody we encounter who's heading to Hanoi.

Great introduction to Hanoi with fun and knowledgeable guide. Great way to sample Hanoi's many delights with lots of information (including a few sites around the city), explanation of life and history behind food. Our tour guide Mango was brilliant.

Authentic food & experience. Went to this tour after recommendation with 3 colleagues. Cherry was fantastic, tried 11 dishes in places I would've never thought to go in. Everything was delicious, Cherry was a bunch of joy & very informative. She also catered to everyones needs. Highly recommended!

Great Way to Start. I chose this tour from competing tours due to very high TripAdvisor rating. It was my first night in Hanoi and the tour was meant to be a Vietnamese Foods 101 course ("Intro to ...").It was just that. Group was very congenial. Guide full of good will and great intentions. But most important, the food was excellent.Recommended for your first night in Vietnam, and if it isn't then your first night in Hanoi. And if it isn't that either, then go anyhow.

A fun and tasty introduction to Vietnamese food.. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon street food tour around the old city of Hanoi. Our guide Duong, aka Pixie met us at our hotel and for nearly 3 hours we had the opportunity to try Vietnamese dishes that otherwise we would not have had the chance (or the know how) to try. Duong's English was very good and we had some interesting conversations about life in Hanoi and Vietnam in general and food, of course. The time just flew by! We had a super fun time, the food was great and at the end we even received some recommendations for more things to try. We highly recommend!

Good tour. A lot of fun as a solo person with tour guide. A bit disappointing that there wasn't a plan b after I informed the tour guide I didn't drink alcohol. Would've been nice to have been taken for a famous Hanoi coffee or something instead but the guide was very knowledgable and competent.

Mango is the Tops! (Sticky Rice!!). Yes, Mango is her name and she led a private tour for my boyfriend and me as Hanoi Street Food didn’t have any spots left in their regular tour. For an extra $5 ($30 per person), this was money well spent. As we traversed the congested streets of the Old Quarter, Mango would yell “sticky rice” to remind us to stick closer together, and we continued to use this throughout our time in Hanoi!We tasted 13 foods from 8 places on this 2.5 hour walking tour with Mango, and between all the history, information and trivia she shared, we had a blast. Here are some of the tasty treats we had:--Bun Cha: rice noodles with BBQ pork in fish sauce with sugar--Kem Chanh: refreshing lemon mint ice cream popsicles--Bang Cuon: we tried our hand rolling these rice pancakes on what looked like a crepe maker, using a wooden mallet to slide under the pancake.
