We then sampled the rice pancakes, which were stuffed with pork and mushrooms, and sprinkled on top with fried onions, then dipped in the fish sauce with herbs.--Bo Bia: a light, sweet crepe snack filled with dried coconut, black sesame and honeycomb (a student's snack as she called it, because you can take it with you on the go very easily)--Nem and Banh (dumplings and spring rolls): we had four types here, the fermented pork roll, pillow cake (which had pork, mushrooms and glass noodles), the crab spring roll (deep fried imperial roll) and the sweet donut (which had green bean inside it)--Bia Ho: fresh Vietnamese beer--Ruou Gao: banana rice wine (30% alcohol content)--Banh My: Vietnamese sandwich--Ca Phe Teung (egg coffee): the egg on top was like dessert, but it all finished off like a proper coffee once it was all mixed up. Don’t hesitate to book this tour early on in your stay in Hanoi, as you’ll want to visit and re-visit some of these hole-in-the-wall joints again! And if you get a chance, do request Mango—you will find her to be a simply delightful guide and companion.

Best way to experience more traditional Vietnemese dishes. Our tour guide was great, spoke perfect English and catered to everyone's needs. The whole tour itself was only around $30 which I think was more than fair for the informative guide and plethora of food. I am sure if you looked you could find something cheaper but who knows if you would have as good of an experience. Perfect way to spend the early evening in Hanoi, it was definitely one of my highlights while I was there.

Great way to start your Hanoi holiday. We landed in Hanoi early afternoon and set up camp in the Old Quarter. Trying get our bearings we were fortunate the Street Food tour office was around the corner from our hotel. We confirmed our tour for a 5pm start and met back with a group of about 9 ready to set off. Our walking food tour consisted of a range of locations around the Old Quarter, where generous serves of local dishes were on offer. Our guide was a funny girl, doing her best to keep the group entertained with knowledge of the local places and food. It was a good effort as most of the group were just off the plane and jet lagged.We're really glad we did the tour, as it was a great way to learn parts of the area, handy first up tips, and some good food thrown in

Great introduction to Vietnamese street food!. This really was a fantastic experience and gave us a great intro to Vietnamese street food at the start of our travels. Our wonderful guide Duong took us to several different food stops in the old quarter of Hanoi. Our preference is always to try local foods, but the street food tour gives you confidence to go to the quiet little back street restaurants and stalls that you may overlook! We were introduced to a variety of local dishes and sweets, each one as tasty as the next! Not only is this a food sensation but also an insight into the local culture. Many thanks for a great evening out!
good food, fun walk. Walked around Hanoi to a bunch of different restaurants and street food stalls, guide was very informative and fun. I think her name was Mango!

Great food. Enjoyable day out with a great group of interesting people of different nations. Moon our guide was fantastic & took use to many different places to eat. Had the best custard dough nuts ever. I suggest taking photos of street signs if you wish to return to where you ate as it all becomes confusing on where you are.

Hanoi Street Food tour. This was one of the highlights of our recent trip to Vietnam. It was a private (2 couples) tour of local street food, for not much more money than the group tour. We visited 8 locations (all within walking distance) over 3+ hours, and had about 13 different kinds of food. Cherry was our amazing guide - she was bubbly, informative, and solicitous.

Fantastic! . Our guide took us to about 7 different places to try different dishes. We tried all sorts of food and drinks. The coffee with egg was really good!She provided us good explanation on the different dishes and took us to places all over the old quarter in Hanoi.Good food, good drinks, good guide! Great insight into street food in Hanoi!

Excellent Experience with the Hanoi Street Food Tour. I was lucky enough to have a private tour, just because of turn out. Cherry was fantastic; very informative and would adjust what we ate or the pace we went based on my feedback, questions, etc. At the end of the trip, she also asked for feedback and took the time to handwrite all the places we went so that I could visit them on my own. She just went above and beyond.

Great fun and the best way to discover Hanoi. Mango showed us a fantastic night around 8 locations in the old quarter. She was so charming and made the tour so much fun, providing also great insights into the Vietnamese culture and showing us around the city in the process. My only comment would be on the food as we seemed to have experienced better eats for similar dishes in other spots during our stay in Hanoi. But I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to learn about the street food and culture of this great town.

A must do experience.. We booked 2 different food tours thru the old quarter area in Hanoi, one during the night and one during the day. The tours are very different and offer you a great way to experience all the local cuisine. They take you to places you would not be able to find on your own. The tour guides we had Sam and Ellie really made the trips the best expereinces we had in Hanoi. We booked both thru Viator which is part of trip advisor and highly recommend anyone going to do the same.

Gute Tour. We booked a private tour with Cherry. She was well prepared and tried to adapt to our wishes or any special needs. We had a lot of awsome food and ended up speeking a lot about tradition and behaviour in vietnam. Definitely worth the price! Would come again.

Awesome way to start a visit to Hanoi. We had Sunny as our tour leader and she was great. There were lots of us so they split us in 2 and we had a nice small group of 6. Loved allllll the food and met some cool people who we went out for drinks with after. Sunny was really friendly and she got us all beers throughout the tour!!! Fully reccomend this tour!!!
Highly recommended. great tour guides.Mango and Dao. extremely friendly, easy to talk to and had a good sense of humour. Great food. pace yourself.

Such a highlight. This tour has five stars for a reason- it's amazing! We went to six or seven different places but didn't feel rushed. It was so much fun, so interesting and the food was superb. I'll do it again next time!

Wonderful experience! Great value! A real culinary adventure. . Ms Moon was a pleasure to have as a guide! As promised we finished the tour with a "food baby". Exotic flavors experienced in interesting places. Very enjoyable.
Go with Cherry!. The food on this tour is AMAZING! Especially the bun cha. My mom loved the Bahn Mi. Cherry is an excellent guide. STICKY RICE!!!Take this tour, you won't regret it!

Best money spent in hanoi. Traditional street food.. This was a great tour. It ended up being just my partner and I, which we loved. We stopped at about 6 or 7 places and all totally only locals there. We even stopped at a few sights in the area too. Super fun tour. We had Cherry and "Orange" as our guides. We highly rate this place. Almost all of the restaurants seemed so dodgy and we would have never gone to them, but now we know how to order and where to order. Awesome!!

Tasty and enjoyable Old Quarter tour!. We do a food walking tour in most cities we visit and chose this group based on reviews. We were not disappointed! After a little searching (we walked to the old quarter) we found the meeting place and met our guide for the evening, "Pixie". For the next 3+ hours she showed us around the area and introduced us to many delectable treats,including Bun cha, Banh cuon thit and Egg chocolate. She was a delightful guide and we enjoyed not only the food but some wonderful conversation and explanation of the area and other things about Hanoi and Vietnam. Would highly recommend doing the tour in the evening with all the lights and hustle and bustle of evening life here. It's a great way to see some sights and get introduced to some of the local fare. 5 stars for Pixie and Hanoi Street Food Tour!

Ms Moon is great. Sticky rice all night!. Wonderful tour guide with plenty of fantastic traditional food and local knowledge to go with it. Would have walked past each of the places without a tour guide. Highly recommend!

Yummy and fun street food tour with Mango, our guide!. Mango was a great guide who would yell sticky rice when we crossed the streets so no one would hit us. We ate 10 different things at 8 different locations. It was all delicious and was a great way to get introduced to the city of Hanoi. Our group of 8 ranged in age from 5 to 72 and we all loved it. I completely recommend doing this on your next trip to Hanoi!

Highly recommended. Husband and I arrived in Hanoi and this was the first thing we did to help us get acquainted with the area and local cuisine. Our guide was Sunny who introduced us to 7 different foods/drinks including Bun Cha, Banh My, beef jerky salad, egg coffee, bia Hoi etc over 3 hours. All the food were delish and we were so full by the end of it.
Ms Moon is fantastic.. You will understand more about their street food in doing the tour vs just wandering around, and you'll certainly get to places you might have walked past.

One of the highlights of my entire trip. You really can't find these hole-in-the wall gems yourself. The food was absolutely delicious, I left stuffed with a food coma and happy, and our guide was so sweet. I highly recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi!

A must do in Hanoi. Meeting place easy to find. Everything we could ask for. Did the 1 hour Cyclo, food and even included a great water puppet show. Our guide, Gna (Money) was fantastic. Spoke great english and made sure we did not leave hungry. If we saw a place we wanted to try, she would take us there. Best $35 per person that we spent in Hanoi. We all loved it. A must do.

First tour on Vietnam. Got in Hanoi and my first tour was this one. I recommend to all, it is very cheap (around 25 USD) and you eat a lot of food. All dishes are very tasteful, and at least for me was a very exotic experience because the food is very different from Brazil's. We ate from Pho (Noodles soup) to egg coffee, drank local beer (Fresh bia) and ate the Balute.Our guide Kiwi was amazing, she explained all dishes, show us how it was done and a little bit of Vietnam history behind it.Recommend you to go with a open mind to experiment new things. Don't be scared about cleanness because, to be honest, you are in Vietnam hahaha.

Delicious . Great intro to Hanoi street food. Every dish was delicious and our guide Sunny was really nice. After the tour we felt comfortable to go try more street food! This is a must do when you visit Hanoi.

Street food at its best...with Nga. Nga (a.k.a. Money) was amazing. We got off the plane, dropped the bags at the hotel and went to our private food tour. We were off and running from one unique tasting experience to another. Nga/Money spoke English beautifully and explained the food, cooking technique, culture and history in a very clear and engaging manner. We spent more than 3 hours with her and the time flew by. She brought Hanoi to life to us. I wholeheartedly recommend the company and especially Nga if you want a unique way to be introduced to Hanoi. And yes, the food was delicious!!

Walking food tour. Great tour, food was awesome and tried places and food we never would have on our own.
Our guide Dzong? (Pixie) was v nice and chatty and told us lots bout the local area.
Well worth a 3 hour trip but don't eat beforehand as you will be stuffed!

A must if you want to know about Vietnamese food. Great tour. We did this on our last day in Vietnam to kill the time. Group of 12 was too large to my opinion. Food was great as we tried several dishes and learned some words of Vietnamese. Tour guide Moon keeps the group together like a teacher, which was strange at first, but funny after a while. You are crammed in small places, which makes for good conversions with your group!

Great tour, especially if you love street food. I have to say that the “Hanoi Street Food Tour” was extremely good, and I am so glad I booked it. My wife and I booked the tour in October 2015 and I would rate the experience we had as 5 stars out of 5. The cost was only $20 per person (£14), and this was great value for money. As not only did we eat a lot of lovely food on the tour (8 different courses, if you include the drinks too) but our guide on the evening, “Kiwi”, was fantastic too. She was so friendly, smiled all of the time, took time out to help everyone on the tour, and was very informative too (“Kiwi” was very knowledgeable). If you had any questions “Kiwi” the guide was more than happy to help. Thank you “Kiwi” for being such a great guide. Another good thing was that “Kiwi” never “clock watched” and the tour did not last the expected 3 hours, but actually over-ran to nearly 3 ¾ hours. Meaning the guide “Kiwi” did not rush, and was very customer focused.I would say that it would be better to do this tour at the beginning of your stay in Hanoi, as it will allow you to get to know your way around the Old Quarter early on, in the first few days of your stay. As you do cover off a lot of ground on foot, meaning it will help you find your way around the OId Quarter for the rest of your stay.What can I say about the food. Wow fantastic. It all tasted lovely, and at the end of the tour I was stuffed. There was such a diverse range of different food types also.We ate “Bun Cha” (Noodle with grilled Pork), “Nam Bo” (Green Papaya salad), “Banh Cuon Thit” (Fresh Rice noodle rolls), “Nem” (We tried 3 different versions of Fried Spring roll), “Bun Rieu” (Noodles with Crab), “Hoa Qua Dam” (mixed fruit salad), “Bia Hoi” (locally produced beer), “Banh My (Vietnamese sandwich), lastly “Café Tray” (Egg Coffee).All the food was fantastic.So overall I would suggest booking this tour, as it was one of the highlights of our holiday. Thumbs up to the great guide “Kiwi” also.

Best $ you'll ever spend . I joined the tour with very little expectations, esp when I've just arrived a day ago and all I can think of are all the glorious food Hanoi has to offer. I read so many reviews and Hanoi street food tour was the most recommended and I can see why. Our guide, Moon, was bubbly and animated. She's very smiley and adorable! Her guide was informative and relaxed. We tried about 10 dishes and my favorite was this street dessert (made out of corn pancake, fried sugar cane, shredded coconut and black sesame) made by a deaf phantom seller. Why phantom? According to Moon, it's hard to spot him on the streets, we were lucky that day to bump into him! I'd recommend the tour to anybody! It will be the best 20 USD you'll ever spend at Hanoi. It might seem pricey at first but when you know what you're getting in return, you know you got a really great deal. It was a lovely late morning with Moon and a bunch of other travelers. Through this experience I made new friends, ate my fill and brought home a little knowledge about Hanoi.

Amazing experience. We did a tour of the street food with 'Hanoi Motorbike street foods' and it was amazing. Nga (or better known as 'Money') was our guide and her knowledge of the area was incredible. Our guides weaved us through the traffic without any issues at all!We took our 3 kids (ages 10, 10 and 12). We each had a seperate bike. This was definitely one of the highlights of our stay in Hanoi.

A must. . This was the first thing we did the morning we arrived in Hanoi. A great introduction to Hanoi and its culture. Our tour guide Mango was the best. Cheerful, youthful energy and took care of us + my 80 year old Grandmother. Sticky rice !!

Don't miss this one. Since my wife and I are true fans of street food wherever we travel I was a bit reluctant to do this tour fearing simple repetition. Boy am I glad we did it! It turned out to be one of the highlights of our visit to Hanoi. Our delightful guide, Kat, a university student whose English was perfect, took us to eight or nine places for a real variety of food - everything from soup to bia Hoi to dessert. Our group of ten people all had a wonderful evening. I cannot recommend this tour highly enough.

Must do when in Hanoi. My boyfriend and I just spent a couple of days in Hanoi and had already visited the Old Quarter and sampled the street food, however after just doing the walking tour we realised we hadn't even scratched the surface!!!! Our guide took a small group of us on a 3 hour magical and insightful tour of places we either wouldn't have felt comfortable entering or that we could not have found even if we tried. The food was out of this world!!! I am a vegetarian and our guide went out of her way to find me tasty alternatives to the meat eaters. We got to try all the local and traditional delicacies and learnt about the history of the foods and the culture too. What really made the tour was our guide Cheery. She was bright, bubbly, very funny and so informative about the food and way of life in Hanoi. Thanks for a great day!

Best street food tour going round. This is the second time I've done this street food tour, and I wasn't disappointed either time. For US$20, you'll be taken around and sample approx 10 different dishes to the point where you can't eat any more. Our guide, Kiwi, was excellent. At the end she wrote out every place we visited, along with a bunch of other recommendations in Hanoi. I can't rate this tour highly enough!
Great Hanoi Street Food experience!. Our guide Cherry did an amazing job introducing us into the local food culture and fed us very very well! You won't be hungry after this - promised!
Go with Moon!. Moon was an awesome guide; this was absolutely worth the time while in Hanoi. The tour lasted around three hours and we probably had right around 10 dishes.

A must tour. You got to do this to break the ice if you are hesitant to try street food. We had six stops; 4 for different meals, 1 for dessert and the last one for egg coffee. Each dish was delicious and the dietary requirements were very well taken into consideration. Some of the places were a bit dodgy where I wouldn't have put my foot on my own. But the food was great which is the main thing. Our group was only six people so we learnt to know each other a bit. We had fun and some good laughs together.Our tour guide was knowledgeable and she guided us well.The staff in the office could have been more friendly but you didn't need to deal with them a lot.

Great intro to Hanoi and Vietnamese food. We booked a private food tour for the evening on our second night in Hanoi and it was a superb way to begin the trip and get to know Vietnamese food. The Old Quarter can be a bit daunting and the tour gave us the knowledge of what's available and how street food here works. Our guide was a young woman named Mango. She was very open and easy-going. She wasn't pushy. By the end of the tour, we felt like we were with a friend rather than a tour guide. We recommended her to some friends later that night who did the tour the next day with her and loved the experience too!

Highlight of Hanoi. This was one of my favorite things we did in Hanoi, if not the favorite. Part of that was because of the awesome guide, Cherry, who made the adventure so much fun and informative. All of the food we tried was amazing. We had a group of 13 and everyone enjoyed it. The cost was reasonable and it was well worth it! I highly highly recommend it...and ask for Cherry!!

Incredible experience in Hanoi!. Although we've only spent a short time in Hanoi, this has definitely been the highlight. This tour provides a fun and interactive way to experience not only the delicious food the city has to offer, but the wonderful night life too. The food will speak for itself, and you'll find yourself enjoying every minute, as we did. Phoenix was our tour guide and she was honestly one of the main reasons we had such a good time - she is friendly, informative and full of insightful information about Vietnam and Hanoi's unique quirks and flavours. This is a must! Enjoy!

Good experience to try food from small restaurants. Our tour guide was Nga and she was really good. I liked her knowledge on food but also history. It is great to have someone local as she took us to places we wouldn't have tried by ourselves. It is also useful if there is type of food you don't want to eat. Personally I'm not very adventurous as I dont want to eat food without knowing what it is first. Overall, very happy and I would recommend. We did eat a lot however the only negative comment I have is that it was relatively expensive.
Cool tour!. We enjoyed our tour very much. Had 6 stops with different local food. The complete tour took about 3 hours, wakling through the old quarter. We liked it very much!

Excellent Street Food Walking Tour with Pixie. I tried a few food tours throughout Vietnam and Thailand and would have to say that this was the best bang for my buck at $20 USD per head (the other street food tours were good too - just 40-50% more expensive). We stopped by 7 establishments and tried out 11 different dishes if I'm not mistaken. Pixie was an enthusiastic and knowledgeable guide that also provided some historical context at a couple of places in-between the food tour stops. At the end of the tour (and to our delight), she provided a hand-written list of the places we went to and also wrote down a few more recommendations for places that we didn't try on the tour. All-in-all, I thought $20 USD was well spent to try places that I wouldn't have known to go to myself. An added bonus is that the walking tour is also a decent way to meet other solo travelers, depending on the composition of your group. I grabbed beers with two other people (now friends) from the group after the tour concluded as we were close to the sprawling beer corner.My favorites from the tour were Bun Cha (grilled pork meatballs with noodles), Ban Cuon Thit (steamed rice rolls), and the egg coffee at the end. Some additional tips:- You do cross a few busy streets in the Old Quarter so be prepared if this is your first stop in Hanoi!- This probably goes without saying, but try not to eat beforehand. - Be careful of other operators posing as this street food tour, but just follow the instructions on the website and you'll be fine.

Exceeded high expectations . Booked a private street food tour after reading good online reviews and recommendations from friends. Had quite high expectations which were completely exceeded! Had the lovely Mango as our guide. After being in Hanoi two days we thought we'd pretty much figured out the street food scene but we were proven wrong! Tried food we otherwise wouldn't have. I can definitely recommend doing this!

Amazing!. Was told this was a must-do from friends and then read the Trip Advisor reviews. Booked immediately and did not regret it. We booked a private tour so we could go over lunchtime. Was $30 to go on our own, we requested Nga (Ms. Money) and she was as good as advertised. Just fantastic -- smart, knows her stuff, speaks great English and gives a great tour. A home run and a great idea, particularly for folks new to Hanoi. A great exploration of a ton of types of Hanoi street food. Loved it.

Excellent food, friendly guide and great for kids (6 year old boy). We had this tour recommended to us by travelers we met and would happily recommend it on to others! Lots of delicious foods to try, the guide took the time to explain what everything was (AND how to eat it!), and we never felt rushed. Yummy!

Great Food - Great Guide - Thanks Cherry!. We booked the 11AM Street Food Walking Tour and it could not have been better. We had so much fun walking around the Old Quarter with Cherry. She was a great guide with lots of energy, we had a lot of laughs! The food was great and I couldn't believe how much we ate (and I can eat). I tried so many different dishes that I never would have ordered due to lack of knowing about them. I'd highly recommend this tour and I'd do it again. Absolute great value. Cherry went over and above making my husband's birthday a special day.

A fantastic tour, even in the rain!. Nga aka Money was our wonderful tour guide on Christmas Day. We wanted a unique experience to celebrate the day and had a great time visiting all of the locations with Money, even in the cold and the rain! Her English was great and her knowledge of the city and food was even better. Loved it, thanks Money!

Street food tour with Pixie . We were in Hanoi in December in 2015, and decided to do the Street Food Walking Tour with Pixie. Pixie was great and showed us everything and really showed us what it was like to eat like a true Vietnamise person. She was able to tend to our dietary restrictions and was great with our 5 kids. I would definitely reccomed this tour if you go to Hanoi, and if its possible try and ask for Pixie. She also brought us into places that we would not have ever entered if we did not decide to sign up for the tour.... And it tasted REALLY good!

Street Food Tour with Cherry. Joined the street food tour few days ago and would do it again. Learned a lot about the vietnamese food culture by visiting 7-8 restaurants, trying different delicious dishes. A really good introduction to the best restaurants the locals normally visit. Many thanks to our knowledgeable and very funny tour guide Cherry.

One of the best experiences in Vietnam . Went out for Christmas eve to enjoy a bit of authentic Vietnamese food and was not dissapointed. The tour had a delicious variety of local food and our guide Cherry did a fantastic job at guiding us all through an extremely busy Hanoi for Christmas eve. She was very friendly and informative about the city and the food and made the whole experience extremely enjoyable. Would definately recommend.
Food tour. Brilliant guide and brilliant tour. Tasted food we would not experienced without tour. Definitely worth 1hr cyclo tour.

Nice tour with Mango. We had the 5pm walking tour with Mango and a group of 9 in total. We really liked the enthusiasm of Mango and also that she explained some things about the city itself. The food we ate was delicious and she wrote down the addresses if you want to go back to some place you liked. Do this tour at the beginning of your stay so you know the good places. The amount of food we had was right for us, not too much or too less. Recommend if you are a foodie!

This street food tour is truly amazing!. Highly recommend this tour for any food out there. If you've ever seen Anthony Bourdain episode on Vietnam - this is the kind of experience that you can expect to here. Our guide - Mrs Moonwas funny, caring and amazingly knowledgeable. The $20 fee was a super bargain for 8different dishes and a wonderful walking tour of old town!

Delicious Food on a Fun and Educational Tour. Our family of five went our a private tour with Ms. Moon. She was fun and extremely knowledgable. We learned not only about all the delicious foods we ate and their health benefits, but also about the people and culture of Vietnam. We booked in the morning and enjoyed the tour in the afternoon. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Best way to start your visit. Firstly we are well aware of Vietnamese food coming from Australia but I have to see that we've never had it so simple, fresh and cheap ever before!! Our guide sunny was delightful and before the night was out we had eaten more than we could have hoped for as well as squeezed a few beers, rice whisky and coffees in. Our group of 6 had 2 swedes, 2 Brits and us two Aussies ch made it even more fun. Couldn't recommend highly enough.

Absolutely delicious!. My girlfriend and I booked this street food tour and we did not regret it! Our guide took us to 7 different places and they were all very good. It was the highlight of Hanoi. Not to be missed! Don't have a substantial breakfast before going on this tour as you'll be having a lot. Also the cost of the tour is US$20, go straight to Kim Tour to book it otherwise you may pay much more (our hotel offered us another one for $40!!)

Much more than the title suggests.. Can't vouch for other companies reviewed (obviously some dodgy characters out there), but our tour booked through the tour operator and run by an American called Daniel Hoyer was absolutely fantastic. Daniel runs a restaurant business in Hanoi, and starts the tour taking you to the local markets where he would buy food - and you definitely get to see a Vietnam that the ordinary tourist would never see - fascinating. A leisurely drive and walk around parts of Hanoi that are a must-see if you want to really experience the place, the walk ended at a deightful locals bar for a drink, with street food brought in from the vendor next door! Only in Vietnam! Eating the food, and a talk through the herbs and spices included, was fascinating. A truly worthwhile experience to get to feel the real Hanoi.

Best food of what Hanoi has to offer. We went on the food tour the first night we arrived in Vietnam. It was a great introduction to Vietnamese cuisine. We sampled food we never would have tried on our own and were so glad we did. Come with a big appetite and good walking shoes. well worth the visit.
Street food. Great way to experience what Hanoi streets have to offer in terms of food. Our guide Sunny was excellent at her job and so informative. Highly recommend!

Fun night out!. We booked a group tour at 6:30. I thought it might be difficult with 12 people but it was really fun to make new friends, exchange travel stories and enjoy the wonderful food together. Our guide, Chun, was great. She took very good care of us, checking for food restrictions, leading us around the very busy old quarter and answering our many questions. The food was delicious. The tour was 3 hours and we visited 6 places. At the end of the night, Chun gave us a list of where and what we ate with some extra recommendations. I agree with the other reviewers that it's a great introduction to Vietnamese food and to take the tour at the start of your travels.

A Wonderful Tour - You must do this. We did this tour the first night we arrived in Hanoi and we are so glad we did. The guide was extremely friendly & flexible. Her English was the best we found in all our tours of Vietnam. The range of food was extensive and my brother (who is a huge eater) simply couldn't fit anymore in. We had to beg to stop the tour earlier or to just stop feeding us. We did not get sick from any of the street food. The places we visited we would never have gone into on our own - but for days afterwards we continually went back their whilst in Hanoi.

Atrocious Service. We booked a private tour... And arrives to find utter anarchy. Insufficient guides, overbooked tours, no one who speaks English, lots of angry guests. We walked away and happily toured on our own. This tour guide is a trainwreck. Photo attached of many angry tourists waiting for a semblance of satisfactory service but not finding much

Worst experience we had in Vietnam. We booked a six person private tour, only to arrive and not have a guide. They overbooked completely and did not have a guide for either us or another group. The agent there barely spoke english and it took 20 minutes for her to tell us that we wouldn't get the tour we booked. The manager was out and there was no number to call. We were planning for a 6:30pm tour so we were unable to find another option at that late at night.There are lots of options for food tours in Hanoi, I'd pick an operator that's more organized and delivers on its promises. A completely wasted night out when we wanted to try a food tour. Big disappointment.

Great Intro to Hanoi Street Food. Our family of four (kids aged 12 and 15) did a private street food last night, led by the very friendly and knowledgeable Mango. This was an awesome introduction to both the food and the chaos that is Hanoi and we loved every minute of the 3 hour tour. We tried a big range of food at 8 different locations, with Mango guiding us on local customs and practices. Mango was really delightful and particularly good with our kids - ask for her if you're planning on doing this tour!

You must do this. We did this tour on the first afternoon we arrived and it exceeded expectations. Food was delicious, guide Mango was friendly and had vg English, the extra information about Hanoi old quarter was soaked up. The only minor critique would be that some of the food shops hygiene looked bad by our standards but hey when in Rome.....and not been sick yet. Bun cha, Pho 10 and dumplings at 52 ly quoc st were stand outs. Ban minh and bia Hoi close behind.

Ate food I would never have otherwise. This food tour really changed the way I experienced food in Hanoi. Vietnam has an eclectic cuisine and this tour is a great way to try it. Our tour guide , Phuong ( Phoenix) was bubbly, enthusiastic and made this tour more than worthwhile. This tour manages to strike an excellent balance of variety and quantity while including all courses of a meal. I would nevertheless recommend that one prepares themselves for a big meal if you want to try all dishes. We counted 8 different restaurants/ eateries that we visited and one of them also allowed us to try making one their rice - crepe dumplings.The price of the tour is a bit on the higher side if you just add up the cost of the dishes we tried, but I don't believe I would have tried all these dishes without the guide. No one fell sick despite the general appearance of the establishments we visited. The tour definitely has chosen establishments with clean cooking practices. Vegetarians and special diets are also accommodated in this tour. This was not only a great way to taste different Vietnamese food but also a good way to spend an evening walking around the old quarter. STICKY RICE!!!

Informative and delicious. We booked our tour the same afternoon that we were going no problems. They did push the tour back half an hour or so after we arrived and also tried to tell us that it was more than the advertised price ($25usd instead of $20usd) but without much trouble we stuck with the less expensive price.The food was delicious and all freshly made which meant at times there was a little waiting around but cheap local beer helped with that issue!Also touring with like minded people is always interesting and we had a friendly bunch with us. My favourite dish was the paw paw and pork salad - yum! You will eat a lot of food on this tour so I would suggest not eating lunch that day or you won't fit it in, luckily we had done just that.We took our 9 and 13 year olds with us and while it was a late night and they were tired by the end they handled it well and were entertained listening to all the different accents and conversations in our group.My only tip is that if you are a clean freak or germ-a-phobe this may not be the tour for you. It is very much street food but having said that most of the places we visited could have done with a good clean, dirty tissues and scraps strewn everywhere and tables not wiped down. If you are going to go, try to not look and just enjoy the food. Also if you have bad knees or back, sitting on the tiny chairs may be a problem.

Must Do!. Such a fun tour. We had a fabulous group and our guide was amazing. Cherry, you're the best! Lots of dishes to try, we made 6-7 stops in total and all the food was extremely delicious and very authentic. It didn't feel like I was in a tour, felt more like a group of friends going out for a night of laughs and eating. Highly recommended and make sure you ask for Cherry, she was so lovely!

Great way to explore Hanoi. We just finished our street food tour and it definitely exceeded my expectations. Not only did we get to eat like other Hanoians, away from touristy spots, we also got a lesson on the culture and history of the area. Our guide spoke English very well and was warm and engaging - three hours definitely flew by! We probably sampled 8-10 different dishes, so definitely take this tour with a healthy appetite! My only regret is that I wished we took this tour on the front-end of our trip because it really helped us get acclimated on our surroundings.

Great tour, Fantastic guides. We went on a night tour of the food markets. What a fantastic experience zooming through the crazy streets of Hanoi. Our guides Lilly and Mia were fantastic. On our 3 hour tour they took us to at least 8 different restaurants introducing us to the wonderful local food and places we would never have tried on our own. They were also very confident drivers - an important factor when you see the roads here! Lilly and Mia were fun, professional and informative. Highly recommended!

Fun and interrdting. What a great way to learn about the different Vietnamese dishes from pho with eel, morning glory salad, catfish, ban bo man no, half hatched egg to Vietnamese egg coffee. The guide Chang was fun and entertaining and she told us a lot about the local culture. All in all a great experience!
Must do. Pixie from Hanoi street food tours was amazing. Everywhere we went was true, authentic Vietnamese cuisine. Would recommend this to everyone, our 17 & 13 year olds loved it.

A Wonderful Way to Experience the REAL Hanoi!. I'm not very adventurous when it comes to trying new foods, and was skeptical when arriving in Vietnam — mostly because I didn't want to ruin the trip of a lifetime by eating the wrong thing, and getting sick. Enter Hanoi Street Food Tour! What a great way to walk around the city and find amazing places to eat that you would NEVER EVER find on your own. Each place we stopped at along the tour was clean, authentic, delicious and friendly. The tour was very inexpensive, and at the end of it everyone was STUFFED and happy! A special shout-out to our tour guide Hien (Cherry), her upbeat personality and infectious smile made the tour even more enjoyable. Request her by name! And ask her about crossing the roads and "Sticky Rice"! And be sure to try some delicious egg coffee. :)

So good we went back again!. We went on the walking food tour first and met Nga (Money). The tour was so good and she was so informative that we went back again last night for her motorbike evening tour for three hours for my husband's birthday. Money was so great, told so many stories of Ho Chi Minh and the local sights. We learned more from her than anywhere else in our week here. The food was amazing, we never could have found this ourselves. When you come to Hanoi, do this tour and request Money for the best guide in Hanoi....you will love it!

Wonderful experience. This was my first time doing a food tour and had a wonderful time with our guide Ms. Moon. She is a wonderful and friendly person who impressed us with her in depth knowledge of food and the local area. We did a private tour, slightly more expensive but we able to go at our own pace and learnt so much more. The food we ate was amazing with a wide range of tastes and styles, all local. This was the highlight of our trip in Hanoi.

A pefect tour for the hungry tourist. We just returned from a 3 hour Hanoi street food tour with Nga from Kim travel. We walked around the Old Quarter and we stopped at 6 places where we sampled maybe 9 different foods, including desserts and egg coffee. Nga is very nice and she adds a lot of information into the experience. We highly recommend her.

Superb. We booked this trip for our first night in Hanoi and wasn't sure what to expect; we wasn't disappointed!!Amy was superb, giving us an unforgettable experience. She ensured our safety on the busy roads, took us to places we would never have stepped inside and provided us with amazing food. Thank you Amy we will not forget Hanoi.

Amazing!!. The tour is just awesome!! It takes you to hidden places that you can't reach by your own. Make sure you ask for Cherry as a guide, because she is the best!! Really makes you enjoy the food as a cultural thing to understand Vietnam as a whole!! Certainly a must do!

Private tour is great and worth it. . My travel partner and I took a private tour with Pixie today. She was an excellent tour guide! We are from the states and have a lot of great Vietnamese food there so we wanted to try street food outside of the usual banh mi, bun, pho and cafe sua da. Pixie took us to try foods we have never had the chance to try before. It's a fair amount of food so be ready. The extra $10 usd per person for a personalized your is well worth it if you've already had an introduction to the most popularized foods and want to try something different. Thank you Pixie!

Fantastic! . This tour was definitely one of the highlights of our time in Hanoi. Our guide Kiwi was fantastic guiding us around the streets of Hanoi while sharing interesting facts about food and the life in Vietnam in general.
If you came to Hanoi and just did this, it would be worth it!. The tour was fun, our guide Kat, delightful and the food delicious. We talked a lot, laughed a lot and definitely ate a lot!

Perfect Tour with cherry our Tour guide!. Had the best street food in Vietnam. Would advice to do it! The food was amazing! And with the Tour guide Cherry, if you want to discover Hanoi at night with great food! Then this will be the place!
Highlight of Hanoi!. This food tour was amazing! Our guides we super knowledgeable and the food exceptional. You CANNOT MISS going on a food tour in Hanoi. All I can say is: prepare to eat!

Authentic street food experience. Our group of 8 booked a private tour at 7pm. Our assigned guide was nicknamed 'Money'. From the start she was highly engaging and we all got along with her really well. We made around 7 stops and a few dietary requirements within our group were dealt with easily. We visited places we would have probably never ventured to on our own (and even if we did the language barrier would have been significant!). This tour gave us the authentic experience we were looking for and out of several tours/activities booked during our trip around Vietnam, this was the favourite for many people in our group. Money was an excellent guide, and she really made a difference to our experience!

Mango the guide is GREAT. This is a fabulous food tour! Mango, our guide (who I highly recommend!) was very eager, cheerful and knowledgeable about the food and culture of Vietnam. She would occasionally stop at different landmarks to explain the history throughout our walk.
Mango obviously loved her job and loved sharing everything about the street food!
Definitely take this tour!

Well worth it!. This tour is a little expensive for a three hour experience with quite inexpensive food (US$20) however our guide 'Mango' was so much fun, and the food was completely different to what we would have ever ordered or found on our own. A must-do in Hanoi, thanks Mango :)

Good way to know the local food. This is a good way to know the local food, to eat with the locals.
I recommend to do this tour when you arrive to the city, it will halp you after it when you look for local food.

Great way to sample Hanoi. We really had a great time on our walking tour. We'd been in Vietnam for almost 2 weeks and thought we'd tried all the best food already, but we were wrong. Our excellent guide Mango introduced us to some great tastes and her stories and sense of humor were great! A definite must if you enjoy food.

What a fantastic way to experience street food in Hanoi.. Had a wonderful tour with Mango who was a very enthusiastic and cheerful guide. I loved her "sticky rice" method for crossing the very busy Hanoi streets safely. Suggest you bring an appetite as you'll get to try a great variety of culinary delights...

Amazing food with a great guide and am accommodating company. We walked up to the office without a reservation, requested a private walking tour for 4 people and they said they could accommodate us in 30 minutes, which was perfect. Annie, our guide, was spectacular, sweet, friendly, and her English was superb. We liked her so much, we wanted to bring her with us to Ho Chi Minh city later in the week so she could guide us there, too! Thank you for a great tour, Annie! The food was delicious and the locations were places we never would have thought to visit ourselves without a guide. Not a single location disappointed. We each had our favorites, but in general this tour has been the highlight of our visit that we keep telling other people about. We would recommend this tour and our guide to anyone in a heartbeat. Annie was also very conscious about asking if we had any food allergies or aversions or restrictions before we started the tour. Very considerate and at 25 US dollars per person (with a group of 4) it was a great value. (Walking the beautiful and intriguing Old quarter was also a great way to get to know that part of the city.)Highly recommended to anyone as a great intro to the city and its cuisine!(At the end of the tour, Annie also wrote out a list of everything we had eaten, as well as a few other recommendations as to where to go for food items we did not yet have in this particular tour. We went to the Pho place she recommended that night and loved that, too! Thanks again, Annie!)

Highlight of my week in Vietnam. This was recommended by so many people we spoke to that we had to do it even though we were wary of street food. Pixie was our tour guide and she was excellent! Great first night activity so that you get to see the city and go back to your favourite spots - you will have many. You go to about 10 places and the tour lasts 3 hours.

Fantastic way to enjoy food in Hanoi. On our first day in Hanoi we booked into the walking Street food tour to discover food and the street life. Our guide Money was amazing, charming, informative and went out her way to make sure we had the best experience possible.

The Best experience of our journey. We booked in advance asking them if Amy could be our guide tour. They confirmed her to us and I must Tell you that the three hours tour Was so incredible that We would like to start it again. But it is not the food which is very nice, not Hanoi that is a beautiful place, but Amy. She is superb!. She makes us lough all the time and help us to understand how they are! Really go with her and you Will never forget the Tour.

You'd never in a million years..... Our tour guide Kiwi took us to 8 locations on our tour which you would never have dared try without help. She was kind and made an effort to explain everything we were eatting and kept the group together. Come hungry, as you'll be getting a lot of food. Be sure to try the Egg Coffee at the end, and take note of what you liked, as it can be ordered elsewhere in the Old Quarter.

Great we to start your stay in Hanoi. We were fresh off the plane and wanted some tasty street food so joined Phoenix on a tour on our first night in town. Great tour, great food. We went back to most places over the next days and the food we found was the best we ate in Hanoi. Phoenix gave us a written list of all the things we tried that helped loads in ordering food after the tour. We tried our favourite dishes elsewhere too but it wasn't as good. There is so much on offer but to find the best isn't so easy without local help!

Amazing!. The food was amazing, great way to learn about what to eat, especially if you are in Hanoi for a couple of days. And also good if you are just there for a night and want to try good street food. Our guide Nga, was absolutely brilliant and informative. I would definitely recommend her if you have an option to request a guide.

Tour set the bar high. Kim Tours' street food tour was a great start to our stay in Vietnam. We'd requested MIss Moon as our tour guide and felt very lucky to have her. She took care of our group of four, choosing the best places to eat. She ran interference, managing to get us a spot to sit and eat at each stop. Miss Moon gave us some background on the foods we ate, explained the seasonings, and showed us how to use them. (She also gave us some insights into the Vietnamese culture.) Miss Moon gave us an invaluable lesson in how to get across the crazy-busy streets, many with no traffic light. We used this for the rest of our stay. Be sure to ask her to explain her what "sticky rice' means for crossing streets in a group. We are some of the best food and had a really fun time on this tour. So glad we got to do this!

Food is good, not for other tours. The tour agency is easily found near the Hoan Kiem lake. My tour guide was really good with English and she brought us around to some popular areas.I had 1) beef and papaya salad 2) Bún chả3) Vietnamese rice roll 4) deep fried spring rolls, prawn with dough 5) dessert that had sesame paste or coconut ice cream 6) egg coffee. The food was decent in terms of taste and the variety was good, but the egg coffee wasn't good in my opinion. If you've already had a few meals in Hanoi, you should let the guide know in advance so they won't bring you to try food that you've already eaten.Overall, excellent location and good variety of food, but the taste of the food was not fantastic.Lastly, one point to note is to NOT take other tours from the office as they are outsourced. If you do, it'd be best to find out exactly what the tour is about. My friends and I signed up for the tour to ha long bay and we didn't get what we expected.

Delicious food, fantastic hoast Amy (Hoai). We went to Hanoi in June, it was the first stop on our 3 week trip around Vietnam. This tour was a must do to experience safe to eat street food and great value for money. We were so stuffed by the end! Other than the delicious food we experienced, our guide, Amy, was just the sweetest thing! SO bubbly and full of knowledge. She answered all our questions with very good English and told us a lot of info on Hanoi, (including where to go to get the best massages) as well which was interesting and helpful. We have recommended Hanoi Street Food Tour to friends and would definitely go with them and Amy again when revisiting Hanoi. Thank you Amy!

Fun atmosphere and great way to go to non touristy stalls. Guide: Our guide was name Kiwi who was very bubbly, kind, and enthusiastic.Walking: There wasn't too much walking involved with 20 or so mins of sitting on small stools to eat, so don't fret - it's not 3 hours of walking.Food: food was great. around 8 courses at various stalls. some of which were quite dirty which is expected but We are glad we went as they are places we wouldn't have gone in otherwise. had papaya salad with beef, steamed pancake, banh mi baguette, crab meat vermicelli soup, spring roll to name a few. Drinks: It was not really clear what drinks were included in the price. everyone seemed to order only one drink each over the whole night excluding the bia hoi stall (which was clearly included) as we didn't know if they were included but didn't pick up any remaining tab in the end.all in all - great value and good fun!

Great food, guide and group. This is a great introduction to the different street food of Hanoi.Booking was easy. I just sent them an email and we were immediately booked for a tour. We were concerned at first that food wouldn't be delicious or plenty and we would be left looking for more after the tour. But we were wrong! There was so much food! I even didn't get to eat my Banh Mi as I was too full at that point! Definitely liked (hope I get these correct) Bum Bo Nam Bo, Bo Bia, Bun Cha, Egg Coffee and my personal favorite, the different kind of spring rolls!Nguyen Thu Hien (or Cherry) was excellent. She took care of the group well and she gave us usable information (how to cross the streets, the food we were eating, some sights in the Old Quarter). Sticky rice! :)Also, we were in a good group. Everyone was willing to try the different kinds of food and game to walk around the area. We definitely had a blast with our group.As a suggestion for improvement - maybe provide water at the 1st stop and the halfway point. Some of us were asking for water from the 1st stop, but we were told to wait for the water on the next stop. Also by the halfway point, we didn't have water anymore.Overall, great experience. I will definitely recommend this to friends! Best to try this on the 1st day!

Must do food tour. The best way to sample and see Hanoi's traditional and authentic food places. For $20 you are taken to 8 or 9 back street food stall/restaurants which you may of walk past normally, but inside have the freshest and best tasting dashes we've had in Hanoi. Our guide "Hiem Cherry" was really informative and passionate about the food, you learn and try a lot about local culture, in that short space of time.

The best thing we did in Hanoi. If you want to walk around the Old Quarter of Hanoi and pop into a random restaurant, you'll probably find something good. But if you want to insure that you'll have the absolute best food and best time, then you need to take the Hanoi Street Food tour. My wife and I were set up with our own private guide, Amy. She was adorable, knowledgable and very pleasant to spend the 5 hours of the tour with. She knew all the great restaurants and street food stalls so we had a variety of tastes to sample. We got some interesting facts and history lessons about the people and culture of Vietnam and an amazing array of local fare from about 9 different stops on the tour. Our favorite was the Bun bo nam bo. We liked it so much, we went back the next day. We would have never gone there had it not been for the tour. I highly recommend this tour, and I suggest you ask for Amy. You and your tastebuds will not regret it!

Eat delicious food as you walk through the Old Quarter. We had Cherry as our guide. She was enthusiastic, kind, knowledgeable, and well-organised. The food was delicious. i loved the Old Quarter, and this was a great way to experience it. We had six courses, spaced out over three hours. Pace yourself -- it's worth it.

Fun!!!Must DO!. We did this on our first night in Hanoi and we had Sunny as our leader!
She was very friendly and sweet :)
I recommend doing this at the beginning of your visit in Hanoi as we ended up going back to our fav spots multiple times during our trip.
Really fun activity!do not miss out

Couldn't have asked for better. There was an initial confusio in dates but this was quickly resolved and in a very professional manner. We had miss Money as a guide and we couldn't have asked for a better guide. Incredibly knowledgeable not just on food but also on vietnamese customs and history. We got so much out of our tour. And we ate SO WELL!! Discovered some unique spots as well. Our tip: do this tour at the beginning of your stay so you can go back to some of the spots. We highly recommend this tour.

Awesome tour with a excellent guide Mango. This tour was excellent!!! Our tour guide Mango was brilliant, very knowledgeable and lovely. We went to some cool places and ate brilliant food....and its the first thing we did when we landed in Hanoi. Recommend this highly, and ask for Mango as your guide if you can. I'd give six stars but five will do.

Pretty good tour. Pretty good tour sampling quite a bit of food. Our guide was very friendly and informative. The quality of the food was not the best we have had. I also was worried about cleanliness in a few locations but know it was a street food tour but somewhat expected.

Great good, great tour guide!. We had Phoenix as our guide, and she was wonderful! The tour went to several different places in the Old Quarter, and each was better than the last. Nothing disappointed. I think we went to 6 places in total, and ended with egg drop coffee and Banh Mi's to go. Do not eat lunch before this tour! You will have more food than you can possibly eat, so you should definitely skip lunch in anticipation of this walking food tour. Drinks were included, and a few of the stops had restrooms. Our only glitch (which did not end up mattering) was that we had booked a private tour but ended up on a group tour. However, the others in our group were a pleasure to be around, so it worked out fine. I would highly recommend this tour as a way to get an introduction to delicious food and drinks in Hanoi. We went back the Old Quarter on other nights for dinner and it helped to already be (somewhat) familiar with the area.

A Must Do in Hanoi. We had a group of 10 of us on this tour and everyone had an absolute blast. We stopped at at least 8 different food places around the Old Quarter, and each was better than the previous, really well planned. Cherry (Hien), our guide, was fantastic, and so enthusiastic about her city and cuisine that her excitement was infectious. If you take this tour, you must request Cherry as your guide, she was incredible and everyone just fell in love with her.

Great evening in Hanoi. Our family enjoyed a privat tour around Hanoi's old quarter to taste the local strretfood. Our tourguide Nga made us all feel welcome and made the trip a fun and educational experience for the whole family. Even our picky 2 and 4 year old had a great time. The tour is not cheap, but for a family with kids the option of doing a private tour turned out to be a good choice as we could walk along at our own pace. Got to eat at places we would not have found on our own and taste dishes we haven't tried before. All dishes were absolutely delicious and Nga wrote down a list of all dishes and adresses for us so we can return for more of our new Viatnemeese favourites next time we visit Hanoi. She even wrote down her contact information so we could ask for recipies. What a great service! We recommend Hanoi Streat food tour for anyone that wants to learn more about Hanoi and local food.

Must do!. A food tour is a must, have a empty stomach and a healthy appetite because you won't be left hungry! Cherry looked after us and she was great. I actually thought it would be tasters or sharing bowls but at each place we got full bowls each!! Yum. It's a great introduction to Vietnamese food and encourages you to try places you wouldn't normally try and food you wouldn't get otherwise! I'm still salivating about the bun cha...

Great tour. Our guide Phoenix took us to several places to enjoy street food. At every cafe she explained what we were eating and how the locals would enjoy it. The food was delicious and we tried a variety of foods. Great way to share experiences with other travellers as well as you all chat as a group on the tour.
Very good!. The best part of our Hanoi-visit were the street food tour! Cherry took us to tasty places and were so helpful and friendly. Perfect guide.
Great tour! . Had a great tour! The food is delicious and the tour operator (Mango) was so nice. She told us a lot about the food and about Hanoi. Definitely worth the money!
Must do in Hanoi. It was a great tour, we tried places just around the block from hotel and Mango was an excellent tour guide. She was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Great good and good company. Went on this walking food tour with 6 friends. Phuong aka Phoenix was our guide and she was such a delight! Very friendly and her english was great. We became team "stickyrice" and had an absolute blast. She took us around showing us some landmarks of the city as well as taking us to places for food that we would definitely pass by if we were on our own. Hidden gems in the city for sure. We ate amazing food (and tons of it!) and we even went back to the dessert place the following night by ourselves. At the end of the walk, she wrote out a list of what we ate so we would know for the future. We went on a saturday night and had the added bonus of watching tweens dj-ing up a storm with kids dancing on the streets while we were having beer for only 5K!

Fantastic way to experience Hanoi's cuisine. The Hanoi street food tour is definitely one of my trip highlights in Vietnam. Not only is it a great way to get a real taste of Hanoi's delicious food, it is also great for exploring parts of the city and getting to know the best places to find your favourit Vietnamese dish. Our guide, Phoenix, was friendly and speaks English very well. She also knew some interesting facts about Vietnamese culture, such as the story behind Hoam Kiem Lake. I would recommend this tour to all foodies and anyone who loves trying new things.

Hanoi Street Food Tour. Sooo good!! Local culture delivered in a delicious experience! Duong was a fantastic guide, perfect English. She selected English as a major in high school. Smart girl, kudos to the company for hiring a smart and savvy woman!

Great tour! . We were unable to join an organised tour, but they were able to take our group of 3 on a private basis We were taken to try 8 different dishes, all of which I had never tried before, and all were excellent! Our guide dhuong (pixie) was very nice, friendly and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this tour if you are a fan of food and have a couple of spare hours to hand

Go. And go hungry.. My friend and I picked this as it was top rated on TripAdvisor. Hanoi Street Food Tour did not disappoint. We booked the dinner scooter tour and Lily and Mia took us around on what was essentially a private tour. First - all of the food they selected was incredible. The only item we were a bit disappointed by was the banh mi - but it was accompanied by egg coffee that was incredible, so I think they just picked the place for the coffee. Not to mention by that point we were so full that everything was going to taste a bit different. Everything else? Amazing. Very local, you'll eat in places you might have never walked into on your own, and as I said - everything will be top notch quality. Also - if you are trying to choose between the scooter and walking - go with the scooter! It was SO much fun. It's definitely the way to see Hanoi and make it feel like a truly local experience. Lily and Mia were great drivers (I was glad that I wasn't driving!) and it was a really, really nice change of pace from challenge of navigating the streets on foot. They picked us up at our hotel and then dropped us off where we requested at the end of the night (for us it was at the Night Market.) Excellent service, excellent knowledge and great food. Don't skip this.

Loved it!. My husband and I loved the waking food tour of Hanoi! All the food was incredible, it was great hear about the local food and drink. Mango was a brilliant tour guide, she showed genuine passion for her culture and shared many funny stories and facts about the Old Quarter. She went the extra mile for us - writing down the restaurants we visited, foods we had and added in some extra places for us to try during our stay. Great value for money, we came home with full bellies and a deeper understanding of Vietnamese food and culture!

Sooo much good food!!. We had Sunny take us on our food tour and we absolutely loved the experience!! She was so great and very informative. We went to 7 places, all of which were delicious. We had some vegetarians with us and Sunny went out of her way to get them different street food when the stops had no veggo options. So many places that we would have just walked right passed. I feel like this tour is a must for anyone that visits Hanoi!!!

Excellent view in Hanoi's food. A good overview in Hanoi's food. Several stops with typical dishes, nice talks and a lot of information. Three yummy hours! The next day we received a list of "must eat" dishes and their best eateries!

Great introduction to local street food!. We always love to eat at street shops where the locals eat and this is a wonderful way to explore the dishes of Hanoi! Our guide Phượng was super enthusiastic and took us to several different places where we tried Hanoi cuisine. The Bun Cha was so good that we went to visit that place the next day as well.. really loved it.. of course it also depends on who your group members are.. we had a really nice group and enjoyed our evening to the fulliest.. drinking local beer and finishing the night with the famous egg coffee and even banh my to go :)

Must do tour!!. Thoroughly enjoyed this tour with our great guide Hiem (Cherry). We got to try many of the hidden food stalls in Hanoi and learnt a lot about the city along the way. This was one of the highlights of my visit to Hanoi, I would highly recommend it.

BEST Food Tour We've Been On!!!! (and we do a lot). Awesome tour through and through with our guide Money (that was her nickname.) We weren't able to be picked up at our original location but it was no problem as Money got us on her motorbike and took us to the original starting location. It was such an authentic experience as we went into restaurants that you would never know was a eatery from the outside. You knew you were truly eating where and what the locals do. Just when we thought the food could not be more delicious, every stop got better and better.Money was great because she not only answered questions about the food but also was happy to explain culture, nuances of the city, history, ect. There was no language barrier, and she was super personal and genuinely happy to be giving a tour!She even wrote down everything we had, what addresses we had them at, and where she would suggest we should go if we wanted to continue our culinary explorations. We could not be more happy with our decision to go!!

Must do in Hanoi. If you want to discover the Vietnamese food and the old city of Hanoi, you must go along «Hanoi Street food Tour». They will make you go true the old city tasting all there local specialties... Food is excellent! The groups are limited in mumbers, and the guide is perfect... I had a blast...!!

A must do. We thoroughly enjoyed this whirlwind introduction to Vietnamese food in the Old Quarter of Hanoi with the lovely Mango and fellow travellers. She took us into places we would never have ventured into and kindly wrote down everything we sampled for us. As well as tasting and drinking we were shown Temples and told snippets of history over the 3 hours. I really recommend this tour near the beginning of your holiday and at $20 it is good value too.

"Stickyyyy riiicceee!! ". My girlfriend convinced me to join her on this tour, after being told that the tour was 3 hours my initial thought was it was too long. However at no point on the tour I was looking at the time. There was a group of 8, our tour guide was Kiwi, she was fantastic, great English, very attentive to everyone's needs, there was a pregnant woman who was avoiding shellfish Kiwi was quick to inform the local places we visits to get an alternative dish.When crossing the busy streets in Hanoi Kiwi would shout STICKY RICE, for everyone to group together an cross safely, not only I found this hilarious but also brilliant she was continuously looking after everyone.Surprisingly not a lot of the dishes we had were fishy, although most of them contained fish sauce only 1 or 2 things actually contained seafood. I don't eat much seafood at home and was full of fish from the week before so it was a welcomed break from seafood.Highly recommend this tour and ask for Kiwi to take you, she was great.

Excellent. Excellent tour with Annie - she took us to about 10 of her favorite restaurants and all of the dishes we tried were delicious. She took us to places we would never have thought to go to on our own, and she explained the cultural significance of each dish.

A delicious intro to Hanoi!. Our guide, Phuong (Phoenix) was great, and the food we tried was all delicious. I went my first night in Hanoi, and ended up returning to my favorite spots from the tour a couple of times during my stay because I liked the food so much. Highly recommend, especially early on in your visit.

Thanksgiving away from home. We decided to try Hanoi Street food tours based on the reviews from trip advisor, and we were not disappointed at all. Our guide Cherry was so friendly and spoke English really well. She was so nice and was very knowledgable. All of the food was excellent and it was great getting to know the other people in our tour group. We even got to watch a lady at one of the restaurants make fresh rice paper. I would not eat before the tour because you'll be stuffed. I would definitely recommend this tour and would go again myself if I visit Hanoi again. Absolutely great tour.

Excellent . Well worth checking out. Excellent introduction to Hanoi Street food and our guide (Duong) was super nice. Decided to give this a go off the back of the reviews on here and was not disappointed. Go with an empty stomach!

A night to Remember. We had an Amazing Night with Cherry meeting new friends and trying things we would never have tried otherwise, we met promptly at the designated meeting spot and instantly you could tell she was someone who enjoyed her job immensely, we went to a half dozen places over the course of the evening and tried a different dish at each place, such as chicken feet..for the brave and the egg coffee was amazing!! All in all $25USD well spent, Cherry gave us a running commentary on the history of the food that we were eating and I don't think I will ever cross the road again without saying "sticky rice" .Thank you Hanoistreet food tour for making our very first trip to Vietnam so special....oh and as a tip to those wanting to do this tour, go Hungry because otherwise you just won't fit it all in

Yummy! Yummy!. Just enjoyed a delicious food tour with the delightful and entertaining tour guide, Money. She brought us to some of her favourite street-side restaurants where we sampled a variety of local cuisine: BBQ pork noodle soup, young rice ice-cream, sugar cane roll, banh mi and egg coffee (just to name a few). The tour also included some interesting historical facts about Hanoi and how street food evolved. This tour is a must-do for any foodie. My only advice - come with an empty stomach because you will eat a lot! And be sure to ask for Money when booking a tour. She is an exceptional tour guide and clearly enjoys sharing her love of local cuisine with tourists. Bon appetit!

An absolute must. If you are new to Hanoi and just arrived, be sure to book this tour as early as possible. It will give you the heights of the street food scene in Hanoi and give you a taste of some foods and places you may not have noticed on your own. The host spoke terrific English and always made sure everyone was looked after no matter what our tastes were. Can't recommend this highly enough. We booked through our hotel and it was very affordable.

Sticky Rice!!. If you want to delve into the heart of Old Quarter Hanoi, this is the way to do it!! The food tour is exceptionally casual yet very well managed. You essentially walk around the old quarter with a guide visiting different little street food places sampling Vietnamese food. Our guide, "Cherry" was knowledgeable, fun and interesting. She knew all about the food of her nation and where to get the best. There are no five star restaurants on this tour, prepare to get down and dirty with the locals. But it is worth every penny (which at $25 per head really amounts to nothing). We were so full by the end, there wasn't room to stop at Beer Junction for a refreshing cold one. A brilliant way to spend 3 hours in Hanoi. Can't recommend it enough. Thank you Hien Cherry for making the tour so fun and memorable!!!

The taste of Hanoi at its best. Due to the very limited time we stayed at Hanoi, we wanted to make the most out of it and chose to do the Hanoi Street Food Tour, which was rated #1 on Tripadvisor, to get a good impression of the Hanoi street food scene. We chose the 3 hrs night tour and my personal opinion is: it totally deserves its status as the best street food tour in Hanoi!Our guide, Phoenix, was a very warm and friendly person, who was really enthusiastic about the places and food she showed us and did not only take well care of our group ("sticky rice") the whole time, but also made this a quite inside experience, as she showed as how to eat and enjoy the dishes and explained about their ingredients and preparation.She brought us to a lot of places, we would have probably not tried or even not found as they are very small and hidden but nonetheless very tasty and authentic! In one place we could even try to make the thin rice paper layers by ourselves. We also were with a very nice and funny group with a good group size of 6 persons, so we had interesting discussions the entire evening. The evening ended with some Bia Hoi and Egg Coffee and our guide even stayed with us a little longer until 10.30pm so we had the feeling she really enjoyed the tour as well and was not pushy at all about the time we would need to get back.We definitely recommend the tour to everyone who is really into experiencing local and delicious Vietnamese food and wants to a add a great experience with a local guide who can tell you a lot of interesting and funny stories as well. Perfect evening!! Thank you Phoenix!

I know why it's #1 on tripadvisor now. My husband, friend, and I signed up for this tour after reading the amazing reviews on tripadvisor. Yes, it really is as awesome as we all make it out to be. Why it's amazing: 1) Customer service. It's everything. Our guides Mia, Lily, and Moon were on-time, fluent in English, friendly, and very attentive to our needs. In fact, when one of us accidentally left our bag (with TWO of our passports) at the last stop after we had gotten dropped off for the day, we called in a panic back to the company and within minutes, our tour guides had brought our bag back to us, and with a big smile as usual. This was just beyond what we expected and asked for in a company and put the cherry on top of an already great day.2) Fun! Riding on the scooter is definitely the best way to explore Hanoi. You could not pay me enough money to drive it myself, but I trusted those guides 100%. They were ridiculously good scooter drivers all while checking in every few minutes to make sure that we felt safe. During the trip, we went down narrow back alleys, past historical landmarks like the oldest bridge in Hanoi, and through other neighborhoods that showed us a slice of Vietnamese life.3) Delicious. We had 8-10 different types of food during the tour, most of which we had not heard of before. So delicious. I'm still thinking of the food right now salivating. In fact the food was so good that we continued to order it for every meal for the rest of the trip rather than getting Western food.Overall, this company was wonderful and the experience made me want to stay in Vietnam longer. The things I learned, not only about food, but about history and culture, made me appreciate Vietnam on a deeper level. Thank you Mia, Lily, and Moon for the spectacular day, we are still talking about it! Hint: Do not eat before your tour if it's an afternoon tour. You will be so full from all the food!

Scooter tour was well worth it. Money and Annie are two recent college grads who took us on a 3+ hour scooter food tour. They're friendly pleasant and spoke good English. Also very diligent and thorough with their introduction to food and sites in Hanoi. Definitely worth it and glad we chose the scooter tour to see more of Hanoi. The pho place (pho 10) they took us to was the best

Best local food in Hanoi!. Cherry was a lovely guide who showed us the hidden culinary gems in Hanoi's old quarter. Many of them were holes in the wall that I never would have thought to stop at, but they served the best food I've had in Hanoi! All the dishes were ones I had never tried before and will now order again and again, rather than just the standard pho bo. The bun cha was a huge hit with our group and it's definitely worth doing the tour just to find out where this amazing bun cha place is located. The tour was also a great way to meet people! We hung out after and checked out the water puppet show.

Great introduction to Hanoi and Vietnam. Highly recommended. Spend your first day(s) in Hanoi doing this terrific tour. Duong/Pixie was a great guide on this 3-hour tour. In addition to being introduced to wonderful food that you might otherwise miss or not know about, Duong's commentary on Hanoi and Vietnamese culture and history give you a better sense of "place." It also provides an opportunity to meet others traveling through Hanoi and orients you to the Old Quarter. Time well spent - and the food amazing. Our entire group was game to eat anything and everything, but Duong asks at the outset what people are willing to/can eat, and it seems likely that accommodation for eating requirements will be made.
A must do in Hanoi . Excellent food in locations you wouldn't ordinarily find/go into. We had Cherry as our guide and she spoke really good English and was very informative - loved the egg coffee!

Great orientation to the street food in Hanoi. We booked the street food tour our second night in Hanoi and enjoyed every single bite of it. Our guide was Miss Moon, I highly recommend her if you can get her. She listened to what our tastes and preferences were and did a great job lining up a tour that was geared towards what we were looking for. Hanoi has some amazing street food, this tour will help you figure out how to find it.

Great introduction to Hanoi. We had been to Hanoi a few times but we had friends that hadn't. We done the cyclo street food tour option which is great and good value. We were picked up at our hotel to do a 1 hour cyclo tour though the Old Quarter which is a great introduction to Hanoi if you are a first time visitor followed by the street food tour. We had a private tour for 6 of us and Nga (Money) was our guide. She was an excellent guide full of local knowledge.We sampled a variety of different types of food some just available in Hanoi. It gave us the opportunity to understand what the food was and we went back to sample some of the restaurants that were recommended. Definitely go on this tour early in your stay in Hanoi it was great.

Lovely tour. Me and my boyfriend decided to take this tour after reading all the nice reviews and we haven't regret it for a second! Our tour guide, Mango, was really friendly, good at english and so helpful. The tour lasted for about 3 hours and in that time we had the chance to taste so many different traditional dishes (around 10). It was really interesting to see what they eat and have everything explained for us in a very good way. We really got to taste things we NEVER would have tried otherwise and we are really glad that we payed to go to this tour.We were prepared for a group with perhaps 10 people but we were pleasantly surprised to see that our group included only 4 people. A big plus was that Mango showed us different places in the city as well. So the food tour was also like a mini city tour, really nice!

A must do in Hanoi. We were cautious about this because we didn't want to get sick, but we heard such great things and really wanted to try true Vietnamese food. Well, we were not disappointed! Pixie was a great guide - she was very enthusiastic, knowledgeable, friendly and efficient.She took us to places we would never consider eating at on our own, and even ended up in the house of a street stall owner because they had no seats available at the stall.
