The food was great - we had the best meal in Vietnam on this tour and it was so good, we went back the following night to have it again.Pixie explained each dish for us and at the end of the night wrote down for us the address and names of each stall we visited. She also wrote down the name of foods we weren't willing to try - ie. dog, so that we knew to avoid it.We ate at least 10 meals on the tour - and by the end of it we were all very full but so keen to eat the delicious meals served. It was definitely worth the money and one of our best experiences in Vietnam!

Fantastic food and wonderful host. Our group of 7 was led around to about 7 different little stalls/ restaurants. Most of these we would not have looked twice at and avoided had it not been for this tour. Our host, Kiwi, was knowledgable, super friendly and did a great job at ensuring we got to experience some great food. We learnt how to add the right condiments, mix and eventually eat our food. We also learnt some basics for shopping and looking after yourself in Hanoi. We had heaps of food and actually didn't go to the last place because we were so full of delicious food! I wish we'd done this on our first night so we could have been better prepared for the other nights we had in Hanoi!"Sticky rice!" :)

Absolutely deserves it's #1 ranking. This was a great tour from start to finish. Our guide was lovely (don't remember her name but she was studying law). She took the time to explain every dish and to talk about the culture in Hanoi as well as the food in general. She was interesting, funny and by the end we felt like she was a friend, not just a guide. She took us to places we would never have ventured into on our own and everything we ate was delicious. Our guide was also very considerate of one member of our party being vegetarian and another not liking seafood - no small feat in a country where shrimp and pork get mixed together in most dishes! But she did it. And we all enjoyed every minute of the tour.Book this one - early in your stay, you won't be disappointed.

Horrible. Got food poisioning after doing this tour and been ill consistantly for 3 days now. The food is terrible, wouldnt recommend this to my worst enemy unless you want to kill her/him. Nothing tasted good. The guides were so friendly though but do you self a favor and avoid. Sorry :(

Wonderful introduction to yummy Hanoi street food. We were lucky to be able to have Ms Moon as our tour guide, as she was wonderful! We took a private tour and had 2 kids with us, so our progress to the various food destinations were slower than average and could not be completed within the 3 hour timing. However, Ms Moon was cheerful and obliging throughout the tour and made sure we completed all the food stops (and we exceeded the timing too!). She even did some running around to get us mineral water, beer etc when we requested. Thumbs up, and she left us with a very memorable evening around Old Quarters

Best thing we did in Hanoi. We are so glad that we booked this tour when we were in Hanoi. We did the night scooter street food tour. Our guides, Mia and Lily, picked us up from our hotel and took us on a 4 hour journey round Hanoi.We saw lots of sights and visited loads of street food venues. I would advise you not to each lunch the day of the tour as there is more food than you can imagine included in the tour - i think we visited around 10 places and places that we would never have found by ourselves.The guides were lovely. Spoke really good English, really friendly and helpful. They pointed out all the sights on our way round and showed us how to enjoy the food. They were good fun and provided us with a list of all the places we visited and what we ate in case we wanted to go back. They were excellent drivers and we felt completely comfortable in their hands on the chaotic Hanoi roads.The music bar they took us to at the end wasn't quite our scene but we had a beer and left and the girls were happy to take us to another bar in the Old Quarter.I would highly recommend this tour as a fun way to see the city and sample the amazing food on offer in Hanoi.

Great way to eat your way through Hanoi. First off, Ms Nga (Money) was an amazing guide! She customized the tour based on our culinary interests. She showed us parts of the old city we would have never found on our own. The food was very tasty. We had a wide assortment, ranging from traditional pho and banh mi to a surprisingly delicious young rice ice cream. Beyond the food, the highlight for us was the conversation. Nga is very knowledgeable and a great story-teller. Would definitely recommend this tour, and be sure to ask for Nga aka Money!

Ms. Moon with take care of your belly. I can't say enough good things about this tour, or my host, Ms. Moon! For $20 (which I found very reasonable) I ate my way around Hanoi for 3 hours. You will def have a food baby afterwards, so plan to sleep off all the tasty food you shoveled into your stomach. I eat street food and in holes in the wall, but I am not confident I would have found these places, let alone tried them. We had so much authentic food and even got a beer and some famous egg coffee! Ms. Moon kept filling my plates. She also was so informative about Vietnam, Hanoi, food, and culture. I learned a lot and would definitely do it again. Be on the lookout for Ms. Moon, she's a rockstar!!

Fantastic! . Was a bit overwhelmed by Hanoi when we first got here, but this settled us in and taught us how to eat like the locals. Phoenix was our tour guide and she was absolutely brilliant. So much knowledge, very friendly and happy to chat, can't recommend her enough. All the food was delicious and gave us the confidence to sit down and order our own street food the day after. Fantastic experience.

I'm really satisfied with this tours.. I'm really satisfied with this tours. At the end of my trip I joined the night scooter tours for 2 hours and met a good local guide Ms.Duong (Pixie). She is very kind and smart with good English speaking. So I really enjoyed the food and history who she explains in details. I think it would be better joining this tour when you arrived in Hanoi !!From Korean Yuri

A must do!. One of the HIGHLIGHTS of our visit to Hanoi!! Annie was THE BEST GUIDE!!! She took us to many places that we never have found on our own, and they were the best spots for each particular dish. We have had a lot of Vietnamese food before, both in the states, and in Vietnam, but these places were the best! THE FOOD WAS INCREDIBLE!! Do your self a favor and do this tour first thing in your visit as you will be able to revisit these places, and trust me you will want to! PLEASE REQUEST ANNIE we found her to be sweet and charming, and her English is great. We loved this tour, and our guide!

Great Time. We booked a private 2 person tour with Kim Tours for Saturday Morning Old Quarters food tour 9:30am as (it was only an extra 10 USD per person on top of the base price). We arrived promptly at the office and we set off for the morning with our tour guide Ms Moon. Ms Moon showed us round the old quarter explaining the different areas and street vendors on Hanoi. We had 10 different items of food ranging from local rice/noodle variations to coffee and sweets. Our favourite was the Bo Bia which I can best describe as a coconut and sugarcane pancake which hit the spot and we visited the vendor a couple more times during our trip to get our sugar hit. Each restaurant/vendor had a different charm and story to be told. Ms Moon had great English and an amazing sense of humour. If you have a spare 3 hours and want to get a good grounding of Hanoi 100% recommend.

Great way to experience local Hanoi food. We took a private tour with "Money" - who was smart, interesting, thoughtful and fun. The food she introduced us to was tasty and the tour was informative. She also was very sweet to help us situate at each location with our 1 year old son, and helped to keep him smiling and entertained while we enjoyed the food. She even called us a taxi for our next destination (Van Phuc Village, which I also recommend checking out). Definitely one of the highlights of our trip - I would highly recommend this food tour to anyone visiting Hanoi who wants to get a true taste of the traditional food.

Must Do. Everyone knows Vietnamese food is incredible - so why wouldn't you have a knowledgeable and fun person take you around and show you the most amazing flavors the city has to offer that you most likely would not have tried on your own. - nor found. We had an awesome tour with our guide Nga also known as "Money". She knew her facts and yummy food. It was very enjoyable and delicious 3 hours. A definite must when in Hanoi.

One of the highlights of our trip!. The Hanoi Street Food Tour was easily one of the highlights of our Vietnam trip. Our guide Sunny was awesome - she escorted our group of 14 with ease through the congested streets of Old Hanoi and took us to some amazing places along the way! We stopped at about 7-8 places and tried a variety of different foods (and beer); the bun cha and banh cuon in particular were highlights. She also provided a lot of interesting information about Hanoi itself, Vietnamese food and culture, and the specific restaurants that we visited. She also provided a list of places and foods that we had along the way, as well as other places in Hanoi to check out on our own. If there's any negative about the tour, it's that there's so much food that it's impossible to finish it all - I would avoid a heavy lunch, and maybe breakfast for that matter.

Must Do in Hanoi. This tour is a must do if you are in Hanoi. It's a 3 hr tour and they charge 20 usd per person and it's worth it.Our tour guide Mango was very good. She gave a lot of information about Vietnam Hanoi Vietnamese food and their culture.We had around 8 stops and tasted more than 10 varieties of food items. Everything we ate was amazingly good. I would definitely recommend this tour.

So glad i did this - 8 different type visits food over 3hrs in a friendly small group environment. Very well organised. I felt so much more confident and informed about trying different types of local food after doing this tour. It was fun, educational and social with a 10/10 tour guide. One suggestion would be if they had another tour with more exotic/adventurous food types to try. On;y negative is they don't use the real mid exchange rate when converting 20usd to dong. Instead they use the banks rate which incorporated ~ 3% bank commission. Just silly and spivvy to do that as most people won't pick up on it, but i did, and they waived it for me as i kicked up a stink.

Excelent Sample and explanation of the local food, I wish I had done it earlier. I stumbled across this by chance, but am so glad I went. Kiwi was our guide and really helped make the night fun and informative. The food was amazing and without a local guide you would not find many of these places. Put this on the list for one of the first activities to do.

Brilliant food and city tour. Its always great to find out about the food of a city. Duong (Pixie) guided us through the streets and back alleys of Hanoi to expertly showing us the food and the culture of the city. A great tour for the first night in the city as it helps you work our where to explore for your days ahead. Turn up hungry because you will eat plenty of delicious food. I highly recommend this tour.

Excellent way to experience Hanoi. We did the streetfood night tour on mopeds and had a great time. The 4 of us were on the back of a motorobike each, which was a scary but incredible experience due to the way they drive in Hanoi! We stopped at I think 8-10 spots and had loads of different local dishes, which really helped when ordering later on in the holiday. The guides were also great so I would recommend this tour to anyone looking to experience the real Hanoi

Delicious food and a great guide!. We did the evening street food walking tour with our bubbly guide Hien (Cherry) today. She took us to many secret spots which served our favourite foods, and it was delicious. Boy are our stomachs full! - hint: do not eat lunch on the day of the tour. Highly recommended.

Hanoi Motorbike Street Foods - Day Tours. Money and Annie took us on a fabulous three hour excursion of Hanoi. We not only ate some delicious food, but they also showed us the sights and were most informative and also very funny. Thank you ladies.

I ❤️ Annie Best Guide Ever. We had an amazing tour! Annie was our tour guide she was such a great guide. Knew everything about the food we were eating and so many neat things about the city. The places we went had amazing food. It was a good way to get to know your way around the city also to get to taste the cuisine of Northern Vietnam. We have had a lot of great tour guide since we have been in Vietnam but Annie was by far the best. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Absolutely the best way to see Hanoi!. I went on a tour with Cherry today, and it was the best thing I've done in Hanoi! Cherry was a great guide, we went to so many great places. I was happy that we had so many meat-free options. By the end of the tour I couldn't eat another bite if I tried!

Scooter fun + delicious food= WIN!. My husband and I did the "Nightlife Food Tour by Scooter" and had so much fun! Money & Alice took us around the streets of Hanoi by scooter to many delicious food stops. The food was plentiful and so good- come hungry because you will leave full! I highly recommend doing the scooter version of this tour; we had so much fun riding on the scooters and felt safe the whole time thanks to our excellent drivers. 5 stars all the way around! :-)

Loved this!. We did the street food walking tour, our tour guide was Pixie and she was great! She took us to several different places and we tried so many wonderful Vietnamese dishes, she also gave us some historical info here and there which I really enjoyed. I HIGHLY recommend this tour!

What a great way to sample a lot if different food!!!. Pixie was our guide, and she showed us around the crazy old town with a dignified calmness which was refreshing. We got to try 9 different places and the food was fantastic I can really recommend the tour.

Great night, delicious food. We were very fortunate to have had Mango as our tour guide for the evening. She was a bubbly character and led the tour exceptionally. We were brought to a variety of places and tried amazing local food, the kind you won't find on the Internet or Google. In addition to the delicious food recommendations, Mango also gave us insights and history of the old quarter along the way. Wonderful way to spend the evening in Hanoi

ANNIE!!! You were AMAZING! Funniest thing to do in Hanoi!!. WOW WOW WOOOOOWW!!!!! This was the best decision we've made on this trip!!!!! You get to walk and see the city and sample all kinds of DELICIOUS foods LEARNING what and where the best spots are!!! it was an absolute delight! Annie our tour guide was HILARIOUS and so wonderful making the tour that much BETTER! Do not hesitate! BOOK THIS TOUR! We did evening at 6pm with a group of 8!! Ask for ANNIE!!!

Great Evening!. This tour was recommended by a friend. Our tour guide Mango was really friendly and gave us a lot of information. We visited places that we would never have gone to otherwise or known existed. The food was delicious and there was a great variety. By the end we all felt we had experienced a good range of Vietnamese cuisine.

Thank you Sunny for a wonderful evening in Hanoi!. We booked a private tour instead of with a group because we both have rather complicated dietary requirements - I don't eat meat and my wife can't eat dairy or gluten. We wanted to be sure we'd be able to enjoy the food rather than watching the rest of the group eat! When we met our guide, Sunny, she was initially a bit taken aback by the challenge, but then she did us proud. We went on a truly delicious round of different street food locations and were able to eat everything she put in front of us. Not only that, but she was lively and engaging and we genuinely got on. The tour was meant to last 3 hours but we didn't finish until 10:30 pm - which was an extra hour - after drinking Larue beer at "beer corner" with a rice wine chaser, followed by (at another location) an egg coffee which I wasn't sure about but which turned out to be truly yum! Like a coffee-flavoured zabaglione. It was a memorable evening which made us feel part of Hanoi. Highly recommended.

Definitely a must. Do early in your trip. We did the 11am tour on the 18th November with Cherry. What a sweet and well informed guide she is!! This tour is a must if you come to Hanoi. I would definitely recommend it, more so at the beginning of your trip. For anyone experiencing Hanoi, you know (or will soon learn) the streets are chaotic and its a little bit daunting walking around. By doing this tour, you get to learn your bearing, learn how to cross the road (I'm not joking!) and become familiar with the restaurants and see how the real street food is cooked. The food is beautiful. Why bother coming somewhere like Vietnam and not sampling the amazing street food. You stop at approximately 7-8 places and try all kinds of different dishes. I would suggest only having a very small breakfast or no breakfast at all as you are eating for approximately 3 hours. Cherry, our guide was amazing. She was very funny and you could just see she loves her job. Her English is great and her local knowledge is even better. Big thumbs up to her. Great way to spend a half day walking around the city and pretending to be a local :)

A nice way to sample street food, in the old quarter of Hanoi. 4 of us joined the street food tour which lasts about 3 hours, there were a total of 10 people from different parts of the world. We walked about 1.5 - 2km and sampled about 10 different dishes at different local restaurants. Some of these were table and low seat on the sidewalk. the evening ended up at one of the roads that that are closed off for the evening for the locals (and tourists) to enjoy beer hoi. at about 30c a glass. We sat there and said our goodbyes. An interesting evening which will take you to part of Hanoi that you would otherwise overlook. Cost about USD$20 per person

A MUST Do while in Hanoi. This was the best way to experience Hanoi and get your feet wet with trying some unique foods of Northern Vietnam. Money was our guide for the walking tour and we can't not say enough good things about her. We just love Money! She was so fun and very knowledgeable about the food and Hanoi in general. We went to so many stops and tried such a variety of food. We were so full by the end of it. From doing the food tour, we fell in love with certain foods we had never heard of before and were able to order with confidence these items after the tour. It was such a fun experience and is a must do!! Thank you Money!

A must while in Hanoi. . My girlfriend and I just got home from the Hanoi Street Food Tour and we had such an amazing time. Our guide, Pixie, was extremely knowledgable, funny, and accommodating to the entire group of 5. We have been in Vietnam for a couple of weeks so were a little worried that we would have tried the foods already, but the majority we hadn't. And the vendors were in such obscure and hidden places sometimes, that there is no way we would have found them ourselves. Some tips;Go hungry! We made the mistake of having a late lunch and, even with my "healthy" appetite, couldn't finish all the food. Ask questions! Every food we tried had a story, and it was just as interesting as the food itself. On a side note, Pixie took the time to give a few dollars to a homeless woman during our walking. It was such a nice thing to see, on a human level, that it really made my night. Thank you Pixie!

Awesome Tour with our guide Cherry. The tour with our guide Cherry/Hien was awesome! We got to know a lot of different dishes (both sweet and salty) in Hanoi and additionally, Cherry told us a lot about Vietnamese culture and habits - always in a very lovely, refreshing and entertaining way! We enjoyed the tour pretty much and can recommend it to everyone visiting Hanoi!Thanks a lot, Cherry - this is definitely one of our highlights on our way through Vietnam.

Street food tour with Nga (money). We did the street food tour on our first night. We started with a cyclo tour for an hour with Phong. Poor guy had to peddle both my husband and i around in 30 degree heat! But he had no complaints and was friendly. Then we switched to the 4 hour walking tour with Money, our tour guide. She was so nice and friendly! She spoke great english and talked us through the history of the country, the city, and each dish. And there were MANY MANY dishes! Go with an empty stomach! A great mix of sweet, savoury, and exotic and she took us to real local spots that we'd never had tried if not for her. Everything was fresh and delicious. At the end she wrote us a list of all the dishes and gave us some other suggestions. She was fantastic! Go with her if you can!

Amazing Experience. I did the Hanoi Street Food Tour with a group of friends a few weeks ago and it was the best experience of our trip to Vietnam. Phoenix - our guide - was fantastic. She was so enthusiastic and seemed genuinely to enjoy taking us to all the different cafes, restaurants and bars that make up the tour. We went to 8 different locations in total, sampling a different dish at each one, with plenty of commentary from Phoenix all the way along. We also had a friend with quite a few dietary requirements, but nothing was too much trouble and Phoenix made sure there was something she could try at each place. Hanoi is such a vibrant city, and this was such a great way of seeing what is has to offer... I would never have been brave enough to try any of the restaurants we went into if I hadn't been on the tour, but I'm so glad that I did!

If you make it to Hanoi, you really should do this tour!. Having read so many great reviews about this street tour, I finally got round to doing on the tour on my last night in Hanoi!I and 2 other lovely ladies from the hostel I was staying in made our way to Hang Bac Street where the lovely Cherry was waiting for us. We were quite lucky in that there was only 2 others on the tour with us, a lovely english couple from London!We got to sample so many different foods around some nice places in Hanoi. Our guide Cherry couldn't have been more helpful. She explained in great detail about every dish we ate.. The highlight for me was the snail.. Chewy.. but still lovely!If you do happen to be in Hanoi and would like to take a food tour, this is the best one!

Great Street Food. Jun our guide took our group of 8 around the Old Quarter to experience the night street food. Every stop was a different experience and by the end after 6 stops we were bursting! Jun's English was very good and she answered a wealth of questions for us. It was our first night in Vietnam and a great way to the understand food and city life. The egg coffee at the end was delicious and more like a dessert with a strong coffee kick and highly recommended, I was a little bit dubious as I'm not a condensed milk fan and the thought of raw egg yolk was scary but I was so pleased to have tried it. The trip gave us a very good orientation of the town so made travelling around on our own so much easier.

Must do this tour! . We had a street food tour with Nga aka Money. Rightfully so, because she is on the money! We had such a variety of dishes, snacks and desserts. This is better than any sit down meal you will have. She is knowledgeable and funny as heck. She gave us some city pointers. We felt like we were dining with a friend rather than a guide. Do this tour. Or do any tour with this company. Be sure to request Money! Trust me on this. Do not leave Hanoi without this experience.

Great food tour with Moon! . We had a great day exploring Vietnam and trying new foods with our guide Moon. We joined the afternoon tour which lasted a little over 2.5 hours and learned a bit about Vietnamese culture too. Definitely a must when in Hanoi

Great food tour With Annie. Annie was our guide, and she made sure we had a great experience tasting all the different foods we would have not tried on our own. We highly recommend this activity if you want to get a taste of the local food and lifestyle.

Morning tour with Pixie. Went on the 11am walking tour with Pixie. It was fantastic! We had such a variety of food we wouldn't have otherwise tried, all of it was delicious! Pixie as a guide was so informative about the food and also about the city. We felt it was a great introduction to the city and to the food! Highly recommend this tour!

The best night, with the best guide Sunny.. What an amazing night, so much tasty gorgeous food, in places of never of dreamed of going to. It's a total must this tour to appreciate the food, the people and the general feel of Hanoi. This was totally down to our lovely, wonderful guide Sunny. She became a new family member that evening, such a delight.

Great evening with Pixie!. Brilliant value for money.Pixie was very informative and charming.She chose a good range of restaurants with differing specialities and once we were full she recommended those we may have missed to find ourselves.Much recommended

Excellent fun. I was desperate to do a street food tour early on in my visit to Hanoi and I found the Hanoi Street Food Tour online and decided to go with them because of the great reviews. I have to say I agree with all the reviews, this tour is fantastic.The office is very easy to find, our guide Cherry was very knowledgeable about Hanoi and the food. She was very sweet and really made us get a feel for the city, its history and the truly delicious food. We went on the tour in the morning and ate so much mouthwatering food, we could barely move at the end. We loved every single morsel we tasted. There was not one thing we didn't enjoy. Doing the tour early in our visit really helped us get our bearings around the Old Quarter. We also tried food that we would never have ordered ourselves. Despite our reservations we even tried the famous egg coffee, which was an experience in itself! I can't even say what food I enjoyed the most, it was all so good! My only negative point, is that we would have liked a little time to take photos along the way but we fully appreciate that alot is packed into the tour.If you like food do this tour, its the best way to eat real Vietnamese food. And, its incredible value for money.

Fabulous tour!. We were a little wary of the street food even though a lot of it looked tantalising. So this was a great way to try some safely. Our guide, Pixie, was truly marvellous. She not only introduced us to lots of different foods but also gave us information on customs and landmarks. So it was a bit of a general street tour of old Hanoi. We laughed a lot as well. Highly recommended!

Absolutely the BEST tour in Hanoi !!!. My 85 year old mother, my sister and I thouroghly enjoyed ourselves on this adventure of a lifetime. Lilly and Mia raced us through the streets of Hanoi from food stop to exquisite food stop. The girls were amazing drivers and made us feel safe in the chaos of Hanoi traffic in no time. The food was terrific but the fun company of our drivers made this trip Amazing. Don't go to Hanoi without doing this ! It was the highlight of our 2 week trip to Vietnam.

Not for the faint hearted. A brilliant evening. At times we had little or no clue what we were eating but it tasted good! The lack of flies amazed me and as the food was cooked fresh we took the risk and it was worth it.

Amazing food in places we wouldn't have visited by ourselves. We did the street food tour on our second evening in Hanoi. Our group was very small (total 4 people) so that we did not need to wait long for the food and the atmosphere was very nice. Our guide Pixie took us to amazing places that did not look very welcoming from the outside but that had great food. She provided us with many background information on Vietnamese culture and gave us a list in Vietnamese and English in the end with all the places we visited and some other recommendations so that we could go back to those we liked best. The tour lasted 2,5h and we had more than enough to eat.

Best way to start in Hanoi. Probably the best tour I've done, anywhere, for any topic. We rode on the back of scooters, with the sweetest little girls. We ate like kings. We saw a few sites. We asked a million questions.At the end, Lilly wrote down where we'd eaten, and what, plus told us where else we needed to eat.

Fun way to experience a new culture. We live in Hanoi for seven months now and already did the tour when we moved here. But, this time we did the tour with some friends visiting us and experiencing Vietnam for the first time. We loved the tour as much as our first time!! Our guide's name was Money, she was very lovely, speak very well English, was fun and informative. We ate so much that we couldn't eat the last course of our tour which was desert ... Money, was super nice and made sure to change the last bit of the tour to suit our need. I highly recommend this company...it is a very nice way to start a vacation to experience local food!!

Perfect introduction to Vietnamese food. We really wanted to try the local food, but didn't know anything about it, or where is best to eat, so the food tour was perfect. We were in a group of 10 and we set off with our guide Cherry leading us to places i would have walked past, and introducing us to dishes I would have not even tried !!! I can honestly say that there was anything that I didn't like. From the first dish of Papaya and beef salad, to the last dish of coconut ice cream and sticky rice, the food was outstanding. Cherry was very attentive and you could see that she was eager that we enjoyed ourselves. The poor woman had to deal with some vegetarians as well as people who 'can't eat this or that' ... But she organised variants of each dish to suit all the particular requirements.The price includes all the food, its great value for money and surely is a 'must do' for visitors to Hanoi. Thoroughly recommended !!

Food tour with Hien (Cherry). Hien was an excellent guide for the tour. We sampled a wide variety of street foods in the old quarter and she was great at explaining how it was prepared, the ingredients and the origins of the dish. Of the eight or so places we went all of the food was great, especially green papaya salad and the egg coffee. As I was getting full and we were winding down the tour, I asked her suggestions for BBQ and Grilled pork Banh Mi, she named a few places which I tried the next day, they too, were excellent.Highly suggest the tour, especially with Hien (Cherry).

Really worth every penny. We booked this tour the same day to start at 5 pm. We did the tour with a group of only five, the other group was twice as big, which was great. Our guide was the lovely Mango (not her real name BTW). The tour was really great and offered a lot of food (I'm a big guy and I was stuffed). During the entire tour (3 hours) Mango explained what we were eating, how we had to eat it and everything else about the Vietnamese culture. We really enjoyed it and we recommend this tour to everyone.

Best of Hanoi, great value for money, everyone should try this. It was my last night at Hanoi and my German friend Tim, for whom I met at Halong bay suggested that I should do this food tour. And I should thank him because that turned out to be a great advice.The tour start in the middle of old quarter at Kim tours', you can either go with a group or pay slight extra to do a private tour. Tip:If you want to go on the group tour, it starts at 6:30, so you can turn up slightly beforehand and join on the spot. I didn't mind the group tour but it turned out that there were too many people so we had to split the groups and our "group" only had 4 people, therefore it was like a private tour anyway.Our tour guide mango was great, she took us through the old quarter and we tried around 10 different places which we would never know to try ourselves. Some of those places had very small entrances or looks very run down from the outside and you'd just walk right past and miss it. Mango also assured us that they've checked the hygiene of all the places so they are all safe to eat from. Some of the food we had include chicken noodles, green papaya with beef jerky, rice paper roll(which we were involved in making ourselves), fried fermented pork, shrimp cake, fruit yogurt, local beer, ice cream, egg coffee and other dishes which I find hard to describe. All the food was delicious, make sure you don't eat lunch because you'll be too stuffed to eat everything. In between all the eating, our guide Mango also gave us mini tours of some local attractions, such as the lake, temples and the local area in general. We had lots of random questions and she was very good in answering them. She apparently studies French, so if you need a French guide, you know who to ask for.Unfortunately I didn't take any photos, because I was too busy eating and having fun. I think there are plenty of photos in the guide to get one's mouth watering.

Our guide, Annie, was terrific! So was the food.. Hanoi's old town is a bedlam of traffic, noise, extremely interesting shops of all types, and surprisingly, many of the somewhat dingy restaurants that Americans would fear to enter, but where the 'locals' dine, serve excellent and very inexpensive food.Have Annie take you to half a dozen of her favorites.A recent university graduate in business, with excellent English skills, she's a very friendly and accommodating guide who will be certain to make a couple of worthwhile hours both interesting and delicious.Taxied are cheap and easy to use. Walking in the heavy traffic is very interesting but nerve-wracking.

A Perfect First Day in Vietnam Experience!. After reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor, I found that the Hanoi Street Food Tour did not disappoint. Annie was our guide and she went out of her way to help us appreciate the wonderful tastes and textures of Vietnamese food. After three hours together on a private tour, Annie seemed more like a friend and not just a guide. She was careful to custom design our tour to fit our unique tastes and requirements and she was very successful. We enjoyed every dish - none of which we had ever tried in Vietnamese restaurants at home. The extra cost for the private tour was definitely worth it. We discovered we liked Bun Cha more than Pho that we had standardized on at home. The surprise to us was how much we loved the "egg coffee"- truly a heavenly "dessert" for coffee lovers. We now feel confident about our exposure to a variety of Vietnamese treats as we begin our three weeks in Vietnam and are eager to taste a lot more of what this country has to offer in the Central and Southern areas as well as the North. Great job, Annie!

as real as street food gets. I did a similar tour in Bangkok and loved is so I decided to go for Haoni as well. I loved it. Tour guide Cherry was friendly and informative and food was versatile and tasty. We went to places I would never find on my own. Would reccommend it to any street food enthusiast in a heartbeat.

The highlight of our trip.. Hien Cherry was our tour guide and what a sweetheart. She was terrific. There were 5 of us and I think it lasted about 3 and a half hours but the time just flew by. It was hot but Cherry managed to find several cool and even AC places to sit. Most of the time it was on those little stools. Truly this was the highlight of our time in Hanoi. You get a big variety and tasting from making steamed rice pancakes to having egg coffee. This tour is not to be missed especially with Cherry whose enthusiasm for her city and its cuisine overflowed throughout the day. At some point early on I mentioned it was my wife's birthday so at the last stop she surprised her with cake with her name written on it! Something we both will remember for the rest of our lives. Thank you Cherry. By the way you get more than enough to eat.

A great way to see the Old Quarter and try some great local food.. Le was our guide and is the man. He was very informative and spoke excellent English. Wear comfortable shoes and come hungry. You will walk all over the markets and old quarter. We stopped at 6 or 7 vendors for food so you will be well fed by the end. Definitely worth it.

Amazing evenings . My boyfriend and I wanted to experience the Vietnamese authentic food. But where do you start. JUN our tour guide was great she took us for a 4.5hrs around the old quarter to her favourite places, places we wouldn't have known to stop. Every thing was really tasty and delicious. Don't eat too much for lunch you will stop at about 7 places, including beer corner. Well worth the 20 USD. Great night thanks Jun.

Fantastic- Pixie was awsome. Was our last night in Hanoi. Decided to do a food tour last minute and were blessed to get Pixie as our guide. She was fantastic. Had great knowledge and was so kind and friendly. Which made the tour that much better.The food was just amazing. Before doing this tour we didnt realise how much fantastic food is our there. I had some amazing food that I wouldnt have tried otherwise. Im so much more open to trying new food and places. Me and my partner really enjoyed it and had a great time. Would totally recommend.

Amazing way to get your bearings. This tour was a so much fun! Our tour guide Nguyet (Kiwi) was friendly, knowledgeable and very accommodating. I don't eat meat, and she made sure to bring me and my husband to places where we could both enjoy the food. She taught us some useful Vietnamese phrases and at the end of the tour, she took the time to write down all of the places that we went to so that we could return to our favourite spots later on. I highly recommend this tour. Ask for Kiwi!

Amazing Tour and Tour Guide. Delicious Food and a Very Fun Time!. I had amazing 5 hour sightseeing and street food tour on a motorbike with Duong (Pixie). It was so much fun. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who visits Hanoi. It was a great way to see the major sights, get to know the city a bit better, and eat a TON of amazing food. I also want to thank Pixie, she was an amazing guide and wrote down all the places we visited after the tour so I could explore more on my own.

Food and guide were great. I totally enjoyed this tour. Well worth $20US. Cherry was our delightful tour guide. We went down back alleys to little kitchens that I didn't even know existed from the streets. A good variety of meals were sampled. It got me ready to fearlessly venture out on my own. A must do.

Hanoi Street Food - Amy Amy Amy!. Last nights Hanoi Street Food tour capped off an eleven day Asian tour for my party of four. Worn down and overfed for the entire trip, we needed a spark or inspiration for the tour. We got that and more in our 22 year old tour guide Amy. We booked a private tour ($25US per person for a group of four) just a few hours before the typical start time and were someone blessed with the assignment of Amy.Having taken fantastic food tours/cooking classes over the past week, we have a pretty good idea of what constitutes a good experience and tour. This, my fellow travelers, exceeds on all measures.The tour itself was very well coordinated and creative. We were picked up at our hotel and shuttled to the tour office in the Old Quarter. We paid (I believe they accept either cash or cc), were introduced to Amy and were off immediately on our walking tour. As an aside, there are group tours but for just a few dollars more we chose the private tour which we preferred. Rather than walk through each stop, let me just say that each guide has flexibility on where he/she stops to accommodate their personal favorite. As a result, it seemed as if Amy were more personally connected to each. We stopped and were seated in five different places (two for drinks only) and one street vendor where we took the food and walked. With the exception of the take away street vendor (fried bananas) each stop was an actual restaurant, some with seating outside. The tour lasted three hours and included a significant amount of history, culture and sightseeing in addition to the food. Because of the density and size of the Old Quarter, it was very helpful having a guide walk us through, even though we'd visited earlier on the day on our own.Regarding the quality of the food, each restaurant was unique and interesting and specialized in one primary dish - the sure sign of a great place. Our one slight complaint was in the third restaurant which specialized in fried foods. Besides the place being a bit dirty (food and napkins all over the floor) and being later in the tour, we were all too stuffed to really eat such a heavy assortment. We did our best to sample what was served but may have done better with a lighter dish (at a cleaner restaurant) at that point in the tour. But let me add that this in no way diminishes my very strong endorsement of the tour or of our guide. I know that Hanoi Street Food Tours is very interested in feedback of its guests - so there you go.I'm sure all the guides are wonderful, knowledgeable and speak good English. But its hard to imagine there are any who could provide a better experience, more information or more laughs than Amy. Having been a college tour guide myself, I know that it is difficult to be sincere and fully engaged tour after tour after tour. Amy, a self-described "foodie", apparently isn't effected by having done the job for two years. It was as if we had a very close friend provide us every bit of knowledge and love of Hanoi and Hanoi food she possibly could. We encouraged her to join us in a nibble of the mounds of food served to which she declined saying "I have to stay tiny to trap a man" with a glint in her eye and a warm smile. Funny, charming, self-effacing, bubbly, energetic and candid, Amy is a very rare find in a world of professionals "going-through-the-motions". This young woman is a superstar!I could not endorse the Hanoi Street Food tour any more strongly. And if there is anyway to book Amy as your guide, I'd suggest re-arranging your time in Hanoi to do so. Bravo HSF and Amy! You were the highlight of our trip!!

Eating our way through old town. We had a great time with Nga aka Money. She was a very nice and generous guide who seemed to like her job a lot. We've never eaten so much good food in such a short amount of time. We ate everything from rice noodle pancakes, young rice ice cream bars, popular student snacks and local drinks like lemon tea and draft beer. It was eye opening and worth the money, thanks to Money! :)

Thank you Cherry!! . This was one of the best tours we have been on. Cherry was funny, very knowledgable and friendly, and we learnt so much about the food of Hanoi and even some history about St. Joseph's cathedral. I would recommend anyone to take this tour, it is brilliant value for money and we are still full 4 hours later so go on an empty stomach! The whole booking process was so easy and we had an absolute blast. Thank you again Cherry for a fantastic day!! (11am -2pm, 8 stops with coffee and dessert, some share meals and full meals to yourself, some drinks provided)

Great way to experience local food and life. We had a great day with 'Money' our tour guide today who took us to 7 different local food/drink establishments. The tour lasted 3 hours and started with Money picking us up promptly at our hotel at the agreed time. She was sure to check any allergies or foods we wanted to avoid and made up an itinerary accordingly. Our group (2 couples) tried barbecue pork noodles, rolled rice pancakes, mixed eel noodles, mixed rice paper box, banh my sandwiches, pillow cake, ice cream, sweetened dessert, craft beer and egg coffee. I can definitely say that we would not have tried 90% of what we ate and drunk had it not been for this tour. All of the stops were at local places which we would not have tried but with Money, we felt completely confident and at ease. Overall a great experience, very informative with plenty of insight.

Yummy seafood tour to kick off our trip!. We had a private seafood food tour with Hanoi Food Tours and was assigned to Hien, who was a sweet and knowledgeable guide. Our first stop was not too far down the road to try some crab noodle soup – yummy. I must admit I would never have tried this hole in the wall, which made it all the more special. Next we had steamed whole crab, cracking and peeling the shell to find the meat before dipping into the delicious ginger and chilli dipping sauce! Then it was off for a walk to the next venue, where we tried some rice flour pancakes with shrimp filling, also yummy. We even had a chance to bake our own pancakes, they are super thin and quite tricky to lift from the pan.Another walk and shrimpcakes next, basically whole shrimp deep fried in a crispy batter, with more dipping sauce of course. It was then time for something sweet, a pancake with a coconut and dried sugar cane filling. Next we had Jellyfish and green papaya salad. It was not to my taste but interesting to try if you had not had it before. Also had a stop to try rice milk, its creamy peanut flavour made it my favourite drink of the tour.It was then time for another sweet stop to try some fresh fruit and ice cream. At this point I was trying desperately to keep up as my tummy was full. After it was time for the main event: Seafood Hotpot! Tasty broth with noodles, veg, and a plate of raw seafood to cook to your taste – shrimp, fish, snails, tofu, and mushrooms! Halfway through and I could not eat another snail, thank goodness we made it to the end!One last walk to try a traditional northern Vietnamese coffee topped with egg yolk and condensed milk! Beautifully presented and yummy, the perfect ending to an awesome evening! A special thank you to Hien for being a fantastic guide!
Wonderful Food. Hanoi is the perfect city to take a food tour. The food was wonderful and the tour was a great introduction to a very hectic city.

Exceptional Food Tour with Annie! (Gluten free options) . This is a super fun and delicious way to get to know Hanoi! Annie was our guide and she was exceptional - taking us to the best places and explaining what each and every dish is. My daughter eats gluten free food and Annie accommodated our tour so that my daughter could enjoy almost all the dishes!

Perfect way to get to know local restaurants. Hanoi Street Food Tours offers day and night tours. We chose the night tour and had the chance to do it with Sunny, who made sure all the questions about food, culture and history were answered. The tour consists all in all in 8 stops to taste 8 local dishes in different places. I would recommend doing this tour to anybody interested in getting to know where locals eat. My favourite: Bun Cha :-)

A must while in Hanoi. We did this tour on our first night in Hanoi, and I'm so glad we did. I would recommend doing the tour at the beginning of your trip. We were introduced to the city and to all the delicious foods and drinks so we knew what to order and where to go back to!Mango was our guide and she was brilliant. She knew so much about the city and gave us great locals' tips. She was pleasant and kind and showed us lots of extra city sights too - like St Joseph's Cathedral and a few temples.I would highly recommend a street food tour, and we highly recommend Mango as a guide!

Great way to try something new. This tour is an awesome way to find out more about Vietnamese food and taste some of its specialties. You will try some food that would most likely miss out on, if on your own.Jun was a great guide, really friendly and knowledgeable.Tip: do not eat lunch! There is so much tasty food to be had during the tour that you really don't want to miss!

Great Experience Thanks to Amazing Tour Guide!. My husband and I had a blast on this food tour, and it was all thanks to our amazing tour guide, Nga (Money)! At first I was hesitant to spend more money on a private tour, but based on what I saw, it was money well spent. Not only did we receive ample portions, but we got to taste more variety than if were in a group tour. I know this b/c we went back to one of the restaurants, and saw a tour group the next day, and noticed less portions and variety. Nga was great at giving us the history/backstory of attractions in Hanoi. She also gave us insight into a local person living in Hanoi. We had a great time chatting about food and culture! I'm not sure if our experience would be as great if we didn't have Nga as our guide.

Fantastic afternoon tour. My afternoon tour with Cherry was a delight. She took me to attractions I would never have considered on my own, guided me through a museum, and went out of the way on the ride back to downtown to check off a couple sites on my list. Exceptional

Excellent tour - great way to explore Hanoi!. Phoenix (our tour guide) was great!! Bringing us around to 8 different local eateries in the Old Quarter of Hanoi. Varied menu with delicious food - even got both of us to try coffee with condensed milk (my husband and I are not coffee drinkers). If you want a real Vietnam food experience, this is a must do and would highly recommend Hanoi Street Food Tours. Booking process was very simple, and staff is extremely friendly.

A Foodies Delight. Last night we were treated to a food experience like we have never had before. The wonderful Cherry took us to out of the way places where we ate things that were both delicious and unusual. She had a great love for and knowledge of the Old Quarter. We would never have found these places ourselves or known what to order. The highlight was the black sticky rice dessert. Thank you Cherry for a fantastic evening.

Best tour of our trip... don't miss it!. I have literally just walked through the door of my hotel after the best evening if my two week tour of vietnam and Cambodia. I have seem some incredible places and met some amazing places but this tour has been an absolute highlight.Our tour guide, Phuong Tran, was incredible and really made the tour personal and pleasant throughout. The food was outstanding and I tried things I would never have chosen otherwise but will most definitely be trying again! Phuong was informative and approachable and very funny too. A real pleasure to be around It helped that we had a really lovely group too and I would definitely suggest taking the group tour... it's cheaper but you get to meet and socialise with lots of different people and swap stories about your travels. Was really nice to meet them all and spend the evening with them.To sum up, I would have to say that if you are in hanoi, it would be criminal to miss out on this tour. Lots of food, amazing quality, great guide, lots to learn and lovely people to meet. Not bad for twenty dollars! By the way, if the bosses are reading this, Phuong deserves a raise... she's awesome!

Do this tour!. My family was in Hanoi for one night and got a tip to go on this tour. Was the best decision we could have made. Our guide, Pheonix, was sweet as can be and very informative. We went to about 8 food stands / restaurants and enjoyed all different kinds of local foods in places we'd never know to go to. Only recommendation is to go hungry and pace yourself!

Best thing we did in Hanoi! Get Phoenix as your guide!. This was by far the best thing we did in Hanoi! It's much more than just a 'food tour' as you get taken around the whole of the old town, exploring streets and restaurants you would never have discovered otherwise. We were very lucky to get a private tour- with Phoenix as our guide. She spoke excellent English and changed certain dishes for me (as I'm a vegetarian). I'd recommend skipping lunch before taking on this 10 dish 'challenge'...as there's a LOT of food to get through (and because it's SO good, you just can't don't want to say no!) The tour was also spread out over 3 hours, so was well worth the money as Phoenix provided us with a lot of information about the city (and was very funny too!) This is no exaggeration when I say I have never eaten such good food. So much flavour and such a diversity of dishes! After the tour we decided to do a cooking class (in Hoi An) so that we could attempt to replicate some of these delicious dishes at home!A must do in Hanoi!!!

Great tour!. Money was a great tour guide and Angel was great to ride along with, riding around the city at night on scooters was awesome. This is a great way to see different parts of the city from a new perspective and try many different foods in cool little places you likely wouldnt find on your own. Money provided a mix of humor and knowledge to make the tour enjoyable. Just do it.

Amazing!!!!!. If you want to get the feel of eating on the street and authentic food this is A MUST! Our guide Pixie was amazing. We went to six different stops trying a variety of food. We were a small group of four and we all enjoyed every stop, every meal. Would have never thought to even try this if it wasn't for the trip advisors ratings. This truly was a highlight of Hanoi for us.

Great food, even for us veggies. With only a limited amount of time in Hanoi we did a 3 hour walking food tour with this company around the old quarter. Our guide Hien (Cherry) was great, she was really informative and from a personal point of view brilliantly looked after my vegetarian needs in a predominantly meat orientated environment. We all ate very well but were beaten by the volume of tasty food and drink available. Good value and a great way to see interesting parts of this fab city. Would highly recommend.

If you only have time to do one thing, it's this! Get Annie as your guide!!!. I'm a self-proclaim food nut and I plan my trips around restaurant reservations. The places Annie took us, you can't find anywhere else! Not even in NYC where I grew up. If you can't stand the sight of a little bit dirtiness or just eating on a plastic chair in the middle of the street. Then you shouldn't even bother going to Vietnam. But if you're here for the food. This is the thing to do!MUST: Do the night version of this tour, preferably on the weekend. They close a certain part of the city up and turn it in to walking streets. We elected not to do the Scooter tour, though i heard you get much better food.

interesting and informative. A good evening with 4 of us let by the delightful Nga. Definitely took us to a few off the beaten spots and tried things we never would have on our own.Was fantastic and she was knowledgeable and fun. Too much food, but great evening!

Highlight of our time in Hanoi - Phoenix (Phượng) is the best!. My 4 friends and I were led by Phoenix (Phượng) for our food tour and it was definitely the highlight of our time in Hanoi. Although we had spent the day walking around the city, all of the places we were taken to were ones we hadn't seen before and all of the food we tasted was delicious and unlike anything we had tried before. Phoenix was a great guide, she spoke great English and made the evening really fun for us all. She even emailed us all afterwards with a list of the restaurants we went to and the dishes we tried. The tour is amazing value and was really fantastic - definitely recommended!

Money and Angel were AWESOME!. My cousin and I booked the tour for around dinner time and Money and Angel picked us up at our hotel on time. They were the sweetest and knew all about the food and places we traveled through. Their English was great too! We definitely tried some things that we normally wouldn't have, which is what I was looking for. Money also wrote out everything we ate and gave us some recommendations on things to try - very helpful. It was fun on the motor bikes since we could travel farther and see more of Hanoi. Good times!
Introduction to the local kitchen. top, they guided us into places, were we would never have gone to by ourself. Small kitchens with even smaler tables. Great food, top tour

Just Brilliant - A must Do. This tour was a highlight for us in Hanoi. We Had only arrived in the country about 2 hours previously before we went on this tour, so it was a great introduction into the food & culture in Vietnam, although the food does vary according to which region you are in. There were 10 people on the walking tour and we all got along just great. We were given a list of foods we were eating for the evening. you did not have to eat all of them if you did not want too or if you could not fit them all in, which is usually the story by the end of the evening. The tour went for about 4 hours. Do not eat lunch before you go. It was good value for money and a great laugh. Loved the Po, Egg coffee & of course the fresh beer. About 50 cents a glass. Beware the stools that you sit on. They are hard to get out of at the best of times, less alone after having a few beers. No further explanation required. You need to find out for yourselves. LOL. As a suggestion do this tour as soon as you arrive in Hanoi. You get to know the food, the location of various shops and eateries that you can go back to at a later time, which we did.

Good Variety and Overall Experience. "Money" was our tour guide and she was very nice and informative. There were just four of us on the tour, so we easily got into all the places and Money took care of paying and made sure we got our food quickly and that we knew exactly what we were eating. I enjoyed all the food itself as well as the variety of foods we tried and the way the tour was organized. Would recommend to others.

A Must Do Tour When in Hanoi. So happy that I decided to do this tour. Our tour guide was Pixie and she was the greatest. She was the nicest person and a great tour guide. She was very informative and took her time and was very accomadating. She took us to great restaraunts that I would have never gone to on my own. The food was excellent and I got try a myriad of different local dishes that were delicious. If you're in Hanoi I would absolutely recommend this tour and request Pixie. Awesome experience that I won't soon forget!

Amazing Day In Hanoi!!!!!. This tour was fantastic! We were shown some amazing 'hole in the wall' places that we would have never visited otherwise and each restaurant specialised in its own delicacy. The guides Annie and Money were absolutely wonderful, fantastic english and stopped to explain history and legends of Hanoi. This could easily be the best day of our holiday and request those girls if you can as they were brilliant!!!

Great way to see Hanoi and experience the food. This tour was great, in part due to our exceptionally enthusiastic tour guide - Miss Moon. We spent a blissful time wandering the old streets of Hanoi with her regaling us with stories and taking us to some real hidden gems. It's definitely worth towards the beginning of your stay in Vietnam if possible because then you really know what to look out for on the menu as all the foods we tried were delicious. A must do when you're in Hanoi.

Amazing Day w/ Nga (a.k.a. Money). My fiancé and I had the lovely pleasure of going on a private walking food tour with Nga (who also goes by the nickname, Money). I would confidently say that the highlight of my trip in Hanoi was definitely spending the afternoon hanging out with Nga and chowing down on some really spectacular food! Be sure to come hungry, because they really don't skimp on anything.Being the adventurous types, we told Nga that we were willing to try everything, from tasty comfort food to the crazy unfamiliar items. I thought it was really great that she asked us right away what foods we had already tried so that she could customize tour to create the most unique experience possible for us. So basically everything we had on the tour was a new and exciting experience, which was exactly what we were hoping for having already tried many of the popular local spots. As an added bonus, on our way to our different destinations, Nga would point out special landmarks, locals doing interesting things, etc. and explain a bit of the culture and history behind it. She was also incredibly knowledgeable about all of the topics we asked about, from cooking to culture to local customs, and I really enjoyed having the opportunity to chat with and learn so much from Nga. Talk about an amazing experience, one that engaged both my stomach with food and my mind with knowledge.My review really doesn't do our experience with Nga justice - she is such a sweet, knowledgeable, and overall fun person to hang out with. If you're looking for an awesome time with great food and good company, I definitely recommend booking a private food tour with Hanoi Street Food Tours, especially if you request Nga (Money) as your guide!

Hanoi Street Food Tour. Today we had a wonderful experience doing a Hanoi Street Food Tour. Miss Nga was a delight and spoke very good English given none of our group had any Vietnamese! Not only did she introduce us to local Hanoi food she was also able to point out places of interest and explain the local customs and culture. I felt we had really visited the old town area of Hanoi. Our group were all in our late 60's or early 70's so the tour is great for all ages. Thank you for a wonderful few hours.

Fantastic experience!. We had a fantastic time on this private food tour and would recommend it highly to anyone who loves food and cares about getting the authentic Vietnamese eating experience!Our tour guide, Nga (aka "Money"), took us to try a wide array of authentic foods, chatting with us the entire time about life in Hanoi and answering our endless questions about food, culture, and random things we noticed around the area. At each stop, she explained what was in the dish and how to eat it the proper Vietnamese way. She was clearly very knowledgable about the local food and culture, and she knew Hanoi's streets like the back of her hand. Not to mention that her English was impeccable; we didn't have any communication problems at all during the tour.What we really liked was that Nga tailored the foods on the trip to our interests. For example, we had already tried bun cha on our own the day before, so she took us to get a different kind of dish so that we could try something new. We also told her that we wanted to try anything that the local people like to eat (even more adventurous things), so she took us to try fertilized duck egg, which was definitely one of the craziest things we'd ever eaten and totally not something we would have found otherwise!While this tour is structurally all about the food, we also learned about Vietnamese life by chatting with Nga. She took the time to answer every one of our many questions with a thoughtful and detailed response. From the second we met, she was extremely friendly and very sweet, and her warm personality made her easy to talk to. Nga was also kind enough to point out a few landmarks and tell us some traditional stories along the way. At the end of the tour, Nga wrote down (in impeccable handwriting) all the places we had gone and the foods we had tried so that we could find them again if we wanted to return. She also wrote us some recommendations for what else to eat (and where to get it) so that we could visit on our own after the tour, which was really helpful since we were very full at the time but would surely want more food later during our trip!Getting to spend a few hours with Nga was easily the highlight of our trip to Hanoi. It's not every day that you get to hang out with (and learn from) a local. We really enjoyed spending time with her and it was sad to say goodbye at the end of the tour. We're so glad that we booked this tour because it gave us the opportunity to try the local foods in a fun way and make a new friend in Vietnam!

So much fun!!!!!. We also had the pleasure of Lily and Mia showing us around Hanoi on scooters. We went with our 2 daughters aged 5 & 6 and they LOVED it! We had a driver, child and parent on each bike which worked well, so well that our daughters wanted to go back the next day for more. We did the dinner tour which was lovely as you get to see the lights between stops and the food was amazing with not a single poorly tummy the next day. I would highly recommend this tour. The traffic and general driving 'rules' may put you off but whatever system they use locally ensures the bikes and people work in complete harmony like a well rehearsed waltz.

Authentic. Ms Moon, our guide was terrific. She picked 10 stops, including a couple spontaneous meet-ups with street vendors. The food choices were all authentic, genuinely local and healthy. Overall, a great experience.

A must do in Hanoi. This was a great experience but do not eat breakfast before because there is plenty of food to eat and we left with full bellies! The food is absolutely delicious and a great way to get to know great Vietnamese/Hanoi food. Our guide Miss Moon was excellent: knowledgable, energetic and funny which made the tour truly excellent for all 11 of us. (We chose the 11am tour which generally has smaller groups and means you only need to arrive and sign up ten minutes before.)

Excellent way to taste the real Hanoi!. I booked this tour very spontaneously and ended up being more than happy with my decision! Phuong was a very professional yet sweet and fun guide and all the eight dishes we got to try during the tour were absolutely delicious. There is no way I would have discovered all these authentic places and tastes by wandering in the city on my own, so although I initially felt like the price of the tour was quite high, now I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Hanoi.

Delicious. Easily my favorite thing we did in Hanoi. My friend and I opted for the scooter version of the tour which was a little more expensive than the walking tour, but in my opinion well worth the extra expense. The benefits of the scooter tour are that you get a personal guide, you get to do some sight seeing in between stops, and riding on a scooter is just plain fun. Our guides, Mia and Lily, were both entertaining and informative, and most importantly they knew where to find the most delicious food. At the end of the tour they handed us a list of all of the places we ate at as well as the food we had at each stop. I highly recommend taking this tour early on during your time in Hanoi so you have the opportunity to go back and re try all of your favorites!

Excellent....ask for Mia and Lily. Our street food tour took us to all of the most famous street food places in Hanoi as well as the best tourist sights. They are very talented scooter drivers, always felt safe. Awesome value for money. Also, they're really funny!Would highly recommend this tour and get Mia and Lily if you can.

Fun street food tour. I did this tour with Phuong, she was an excellent and fun guide. We tried lots of great food that I wouldn't have tried otherwise. I was travelling alone and there were 5 others on the tour - it was a fun way to eat out and make new friends! Highly recommend.

Food and culture. Could not recommend this more highly. Our tour guide was mango and from the outset she was bubbly, talkative and a great tour guide. The tour was fantastic, taking us through various parts of the old town and into the surrounding areas. Mango even got us into a temple even though we were not dressed as required. If your interested in trying some of the street food, but not sure where to start, this is the place!! Enjoy!

Delicious. My boyfriend and I were slightly late to the 5pm tour so by luck missed the bigger group and took the tour with another couple. Our guide Annie was lovely and spoke impeccable English. She took us to around 7 different places- all delicious and we were glad we skipped lunch! At the end we were given all the places we visited and recommendations for other local delicacies which we later went to ourselves. Would highly recommend!

Tasty perfection. We had an incredible evening of food courses that we simply could not have done on our own. Our guide, Nga, was the best tour guide we had during our time in Hanoi and couldn't thank her enough for the perfect food tour. So awesome!!!

A great way to see the city and navigate the food options.. We took the 11 o'clock walking tour with Miss Moon. The tour took more than 3 hours and we had at least 9 stops. It was a great way to see what was around and how to eat it. Amazing food from the most unlikely looking places. Miss Moon showed us a lot of things we would not have done by ourselves, like the egg yolk coffee. She also shared with us a lot of information about the city and its customs. we ate a lot of fabulous food. Don't eat before you start.

Great tour with Mango!. My husband and I did the street food tour our first night in Hanoi. Our guide Mango was great! She was very friendly and energetic and spoke good English. In addition to teaching us about local Vietnamese foods, she gave us lots of info about different areas of the city. We tried many different types of food we otherwise would not have tried including dry pho, egg coffee, rice wine and Vietnamese desserts. The tour was super easy to book.... we showed up at the office a few minutes before the tour and were able to easily get tickets. There were only six people in our group which was very nice. Doing the tour on the first night was helpful in navigating the city the following days of our trip. Would definitely recommend!
Amazing!!!!!!!!!! Ha vu'. One of the best food tours I have ever been on. The tour guide ha vu' was awesome. I wish I could of attended the tour nightly!

A Hanoi Must-do!. The other reviews were right, do this on YOUR FIRST DAY in Hanoi. It helps you get acquainted with the old quarter and its food. My husband and I joined 4 other people for the 5pm street food tour. Jun was our guide and she made sure we were well fed and happy. From the very beginning she asked if anyone of us had dietary limitations or allergies. She made sure that the person with the allergy was not served seafood or shellfish. She also asked our food preferences. Jun was friendly and knowledgeable. She did her best to answer our questions and also did her best to keep the small group safe while walking everywhere. There are around 6-7 stops for the food, so make sure you didn't eat a full lunch. We skipped lunch and I think that was a really good idea. Come hungry! The food introduced to us had a good variety. We even returned for bun cha a few days after in the place we had it with the tour. We really enjoyed the food. It's a great way to make new friends as well. We enjoyed the company of the 4 other people we went on the food tour with that we extended our "food trip" with them until midnight (until the police came).

Highlight of our trip. We did this motorbike tour with Lily and Mia and it was without doubt the highlight of our trip to Hanoi. The food was excellent and our two guides were full of funny and insightful stories about the city, its people, its culture and of course its cuisine. Plus they were excellent drivers! Its a great way to both explore the city and enjoy the wonderful food. Be warned though: You'll need an awfully big appetite to fit it all in!

Great experience! Tasty food and lovely guide!. My girlfriend and I went on the tour on our second night in Hanoi. It was a great introduction to street food in Hanoi. All the food we tasted was delicious and our tour guide Annie was great company chatting to us about Vietnamese culture and food. Highly recommend this tour not only for recommendations of where to eat but also to get your bearings in the bustling old quarter. Five stars!

Fantastic and Fun experience . A group of 8 of us enjoyed this tour. Our guide Money was so friendly and really catered the tour to our groups requests (many requests!). We even had a vegan in our group- Moneys communication skills were superb- nothing was a problem! A lot of the food was fried so she also helped us get lots of cold beers! We had such a fun night- a great way to see Hanoi! My best night in Hanoi! Thanks Money!

Absolute must. Take the tour as soon as you can. Because once you have had it you will know where to go for amazing tasking food at incredible prices. We went in the evening with a small group and our tour guide was Phoenix. She was very good and spoke very clear English. She was knowledgeable about where to go, where not to go and followed up after words with the details and other recommendations by email. Don't be worried about what you get. There was nothing wild, a good mix for all tastes. Absolutely loads of food. Highly recommended and if we go back to hanoi will go on it again.

Amazing and comprehensive food tour of Hanoi!. My wife and I had a fantastic food tour with Nga! Nga took the time to ask us about our food likes/dislikes upon meeting us and tailored the evening to fit our preferences. I lost count on the number of stops, but it was at least 10. Her knowledge of Vietnamese food in general and of the best foods stops in the Old Quarter is staggering. Along the way, she was amazingly helpful and could articulate everything in her fantastic English. Want a drink with your food at this stop? Not a problem. Want a beer to accompany you to the next location? Sure, I'll bring back the cups to the restaurant after the tour. At the tour's end, Nga wrote out each of the stops we made, the names of the food, and addresses. She also gave us some tips for other favorite restaurants. Five stars!

An amazing food tour!. We had a private food tour with 6 people, with a girl called Kat. Kat was absolutely fantastic, she was friendly, chatty and spoke great English. She took us to so delicious places to eat and told us about the history of the dishes, she also answered lots of questions about the tour. The food was amazing, would definitely recommend this to anybody visiting Hanoi!

An amazing food experience!. A group of 8 from countries around the world followed Miss Moon to some of the best food available in Hanoi. All the stops (6) were excellent and most we would not have tried on our own. Ever tried egg coffee? You would be surprised! As a bonus we also learned how to cross the busy Hanoi streets ("sticky rice")!

Delicious evening street food tour with Mia & Lily. Absolute must when visiting Hanoi. Lots of delicious food and lovely and very professional guides. We've been lucky to have Lily and Mia - two excellent scooter riders who know absolutely everything about Hanoi street food. Thanks girls!

Fantastic experience!. We thoroughly enjoyed the morning street food tour, thanks to our brilliant guide, Lotus! Wonderful food, egg coffee, informative and interesting cultural experience also. Loved your sense of humour Lotus and your genuine love of your work! Highly recommended, thank you .

Fantastic experience. I booked this tour last minute and what a great decision it turned out to be. The guide 'Pixie' was so knowledgable about all the food and her English was spot on! The real star of the show was the northern Vietnamese cuisine however, we had countless different courses in the most authentic restaurants/living rooms and finished it of with an egg coffee! Fantastic evening in the old quarter!

very interesting tour. high recommend. guide was great.. money was guide, she was great. she was flexible with what we liked to eat. great intro to Hanoi. she talked about non-food as well. the owner was hard to deal with but it didn't bring us down. I would suggest showing up, (we planned ahead but owner did not do anything until we arrived). we had private tour

Amazing introduction to Hanoi's eclectic street food experience. This was the highlight of my time spent in Hanoi. The tour was so interesting and our guide was excellent and so well informed. It's a definite must to do this tour when you're in Hanoi. Do it while you still have some time left in the city to return to some of these delicious places you'll learn about!

Yummy Yummy To My Tummy. We went on a night walking tour. If you are looking for off the beaten track local Vietnamese food this is the tour for you. Our guide,Pixie, was friendly and knowledgeable. We had foods ranging from Pillow cake to delicious Bun Cha. It was a great way to see the city by foot and gave us a good excuse to walk off the delicious food. If you are only in Hanoi for a short time this should be on the top of your list for things to do. !

First night in Vietnam MUST DO!. Straight off the plane basically couple hours rest and we were collected at our hotel - the 6 of us for a private street food tour with Amy (thumbs up!). She was great a wealth of information and tips on eating our way around Vietnam.We loved this tour - we made sure we were hungry at the start and we were so full by the end we told her to miss one stop! Loved the Bo Biah man on the bike near the lake - the elusive man as we could not find him any night after that!We revisited several of the places she took us to during our next couple of days in Hanoi. It was fabulous to know where we could eat and what we could eat safely - and literally eat on the street on the tiny plastic stools just like the locals - do this tour you will not regret it!

Amazing!!!. Efficient service by the bookings team, quick responses. We paid $60 for a private tour for two people. Our guide was Annie, so knowledgable, friendly and funny, my wife was vegetarian and she was so accommodating. The tour itself covered 8-9 stops and each one was an absolute experience. Highly recommend this tour. Do it on your first night in Vietnam so you know the lay of the land!

Perfect for the whole family!. What a great tour! Ms. Moon was a wonderful guide and we now use her "sticky rice" method to safely cross the streets throughout all of Vietnam!The tour itself left us full for the rest of the day so is totally worth it. Secondly, we got to eat delicious Vietnamese food beyond Pho and can now go to different restaurants better understanding the menu options. I totally recommend this walking tour--- we had children, young adults, and elderly from all over the world join the tour.

Do the tour as soon as you arrive!. My husband and I did this on our second night but wished we'd done it sooner. You get to sample all kinds of different dishes and eat in restaurants you would never try. Our tour guide Mango was fantastic!! So helpful & friendly. Would recommend to anyone who wants to get a true taste of Hanoi

Do this tour on your first day in Hanoi: amazing. A bit scared of all the dirty-looking street food I saw on my first day in Hanoi, I decided to book this tour. That was the best decision ever! We were a small group of 8, our tour guide was so funny and laughing a lot (sorry, I forgot her name!) and the food was just awesome. I've learnt a lot about Vietnamese food and after this tour I knew how, where and what to order. I'd recommend just to have breakfast because we were all totally full after all the delicious food. Must do!

A highlight in Hanoi. This was a last minute decision to sign up for this tour after someone on my Halong Bay trip recommended it. It was great and I'm glad I didn't miss out! I did the 5pm tour with our awesome guide Mango. She really made the experience in my opinion. She is super friendly and sweet and knows a lot of good spots to go.
