We must have stopped at 10 different street vendors, stands or carts. Make sure to go pretty hungry as we were all stuffed by the end. I think this is a really good value for the experience.

This was the highlight of my Hanoi visit. I took a private 3 hour motorbike tour with tour guide Amy. It was $45 U.S. and worth every penny. I was very nervous right about riding on a motorbike but Amy made me feel safe and it was an amazing experience. Every place we visited had delicious food. We started in the Old Quarter with fried snacks, crab spring rolls, pork skins and sweet sesame balls. Very delicious. Then we went for the best lunch in Hanoi! It was a local spot not many tourist go to. Noodles with pork meatballs and pork belly in an amazing broth. After that we toured around Hanoi. In addition to the street food Amy showed me many important sites in Hanoi and we did site seeing. We also had a traditional dessert, egg coffee and finally the best papaya beef salad I have ever had. This was my 2nd day in Hanoi. My first day I was a bit overwhelmed and not sure I even liked it here. But after this day I have changed my mind about Hanoi. Amy was a great guide. She spoke good English and was very knowledgeable about her city's history and made sure to share with me interesting facts about the culture and traditions of Vietnam. I can't say enough nice things about her. The private tour is more expensive obviously, but I think it's worth it. At the end of the tour into her she changed my view of Hanoi and that she is a great ambassador for her city. She said it made her day to hear this. I'm glad because she made my trip extra special so like the golden turtle, I was glad to return the favor.

Very good tour. We had a great time on the tour - our guide Mango was excellent - energetic, interesting and fun! It was great trying all the different foods, my one complaint would only be that I could have eaten more (perhaps I'm just greedy!)

HAPPY FULL!. Thanks to all who've written reviews on this tour company. Your reviews have made me chose the right food tour. My guide Pixie has given me a wonderful experience. Very friendly (of course), helpful and kept me well fed! Or in her words : HAPPY FULL! Pixie has her own secret off menu item. Lucky me to have had the chance to try it. Who would have thought something that seems quite creamy could taste so refreshing as well? The taste just lingers. Go on and experience it yourself, and if you're luckiy....maybe you'll get Pixie as your guide.

Great tour, well worth it. We took a private Street Food Tour for two on the afternoon Monday 12th October. Our guide introduced herself as Ms Nguyen. She was a great host and encouraged us to try things in places we would never have stopped at on our own. Watching her walk calmly into the middle of the terrifying Hanoi traffic gave us the confidence to cross the street too! We stopped off at eight different places for nine different snacks/dishes over the course of about three hours, ranging from breakfast noodles to ice cream, student snacks to egg coffee . Even the private tour cost only US$30 per head which seems good value to me and included all the food plus the guide. She made the trip for us and was interesting, friendly and informative, with excellent English. I understand she also does other tours, including a scooter tour which frankly sounds quite terrifying but I think I might try if I ever go back to Hanoi.

An Epic Food Experience in the Old Quarter. Miss Moon was a fantastic guide who was equally focused on getting us all safely across the streets as she was explaining the foods and their respective features and the health benefits of their ingredients! She threw in some information about the area and the streets we were walking along, and was very energetic and entertaining. She was constantly encouraging us to eat more, but as mentioned in other posts, there is a lot of food provided so many times we had to say 'enough'. We did the tour from 11am to 2pm and were still full enough that we didn't have dinner. Miss Moon was attentive and accommodating with respect to our 9 year old daughter, and ordered her an "egg chocolate" at the last stop, instead of the "egg coffee" that the adults had (and both were delicious!).

Best local experience ever!. If you are in Hanoi, then do yourself a favor and go on this street food tour on one of your first days :) this tour is so amazing and the guide will take you to places, that you would never think about going yourself! also the guide Annie is very good at english and will explain you a lot about the food and what it is made out of..loved it! :D

Some real hidden gems!. My husband and I went on this tour with guide Hien (Cherry), we were taken to lots of fabulous family run restaurants hidden round corners/down alley ways, there's no way we would have found them ourselves! Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable about food and the area. Agree with previous posts- make sure you start on an empty stomach, great value for money. One small point would be that it would have been great to have a beer with some of the food as well as afterwards, but all in all an excellent tour, highly recommended!

Great tour, Pixie was a fantastic guide!. My girlfriend and I went on a 3 hour food tour with Hanoi Street Food Tour. We got extremely lucky when we landed Pixie as our guide. She was wonderful. She took us to a series of delicious places. Early on I thought I was going to be too full to continue eating, but Pixie made sure to vary the experience so that following a main course, we’d go somewhere else and have a palate cleanser. And throughout the tour, I really enjoyed learning about the foods we were eating, and the local history.Pixie ordered some off-menu items for us that combined flavors she personally liked. If she ever opens her own restaurant, I’ll be first in line to eat there.When I come back to Hanoi, I’m going to ask Pixie to take me on another food tour. I’d recommend anyone else do the same.

A must do experience!. There are so many reviews that are positive I'd only be repeating the same message! This is a must do tour!Over 3 hours we walked the old quarter with a wonderful guide called Annie. She did everything possible to make us enjoy the tour and make sure we enjoyed the food as well as giving us some background to Hanoi and its peopleWe sampled 11 dishes in 7 shops or street stalls. All of them were amazing and we'd never find them again if we tried! Do yourself a favour... Starve yourself for the day and enjoy the scrumptious street food offerings on offer, they are truly amazing! Thanks Annie!

A fabulous food tour. A wonderful tour led by the knowledgable, friendly, efficient Miss Moon. We learnt so much about the food, culture and language of the area as well as munching on the most delicious dishes and drinks from various authentic, well established eating houses. Highly recommended but ditto previous comments - go with an empty tummy as you will need plenty of room. Excellent value for money.

Annie is the best! (And so was the food). We had a great street food tour. Our guide Annie explained a lot on a very funny way. She took us to places we would never have gone to by ourselves. We really recommend this Tour!
Yum yum yum. Loved this. So much food and drink to eat in 3 hours! Guide Moon was fantastic! Recommend not eating before and don't plan to eat after! Brilliant

Amazing food!! . Booked the tour last minute and we were lucky enough to have the tour guide, mango all to ourselves. She was amazing! Super friendly and knowledgeable. We had a great chat and not only learnt about food but the city and the history. She's was so lovely and passionate. The food of course was amazing, there was not one single dish that we weren't impressed with. Overall fantastic Street food experience. Highly recommended. Ask for mango!! Oh yea and go with an empty stomach cuz there will be a lot of food!

Phượng (Phoenix) was the best. Hi Phượng (Phoenix)...we didn't forget!I promised a review of our evening walking the streets of Hanoi and tasting the street food with Phượng (Phoenix) but was stumped after our hotel was without internet for 5 days..can you believe it this day and age!I guess there will be many other reviews with greater details on the food on offer and with pictures too but for us the highlight of the evening was the fun with had with Phượng (Phoenix). She was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and very tolerant of her mature group of revellers - there was only one of us younger than 60!. She had patience in abundance even though we tried our hardest we could not get the pronunciation of ngon correct, however she was fine with us all standing and shouting "delicious", so she kept us happy. As a mark of respect we continued throughout our week in Hanoi to use her phrase "Sticky Rice" whenever we crossed the road. If the advice and information on food supplied in other reviews is still not enough to persuade you then take a gamble and ask for Phượng (Phoenix) she will not let you down. And if you look anything like Benedict Cumberbatch she will be especially glad to take you on a merry tour of the town.

MUST DO for an authentic taste of Hanoi!. We signed up for this easily online and paid in person. Our guide Kat was fluent in English and brought us to 6 different places around the old quarter, introducing various cheap and tasty local cuisines. It would have been hard for a tourist to identify these spots and to know what to order, so we were really grateful to have her with us. EVERYTHING was so delicious and authentically local. We even re-visited some of the places by ourselves. As a local, Kat was also able to share about her culture and it was a terrific opportunity to engage and understand more about Vietnam. I highly recommend everybody to do this during dinner time. Go with an EMPTY stomach because it'll be so stuffed!

Must do . Went on the street food tour yesterday. Mango was our tour guide, she was very helpful and even wrote out a list of all the places we stopped at and the names & translations of the foods we ate. Everyone should do this tour once they arrive in Hanoi so they know where and what to eat for their stay there.

Fabulous Foodie Tour. We were a group of 10 (ages 6 - 50) who embarked on this culinary adventure with Lotus. She was very informative, although it was hard at times to hear her over the bustle and noise of the Hanoi streets. We went to 7 different small restaurants, without notice, and it was fun to see them rush to fit us in. The food was amazing, focusing on Hanoi specialities and we were assured that each was the best of its type in the Old Quarter ;-) A word of warning - we were told we would have a sample of each dish; however, full size serves appeared and we were struggling at the end to fit them all in!! (I know, what a dilemma)A great, value for money tour that I would recommend to all ages and palates.And a special thanks to Lotus for taking my 6yo and I back to our hotel on her scooter :-))

Brilliant street food tour!. Along with many others, we booked this Street Food Tour for the Saturday night of our short stay in Hanoi. It was just terrific - our guide was pleasant and knowledgeable, and the food was varied and delicious. We would never have gone to some of these places just on our own - one or two were even up an alley-way! Highly recommended.

Excellent Tour!. My partner and I did this tour on our last night in Hanoi but wished we had done it on our first night! Our guide Hoai (Mango) was excellent, very informative and funny and her English was very good. she took us to some hidden gems that we never would have tried on our own, the food was delicious and cheap if we wanted to head back there on our own. I would highly recommend! places but also info us of other

Add to your to do list in Hanoi!. We had an amazing time with Money (this is the nickname of the funny and gentle girl who accompanied around for the whole night), trying several kinds of food varieties, and introducing stories about Hanoi and vietnamese people. Thanks Money!

Eating Hanoi. We did a walking tour at 5pm with our guide, Money, and 6 other people. Money guided the group through the old quarter traffic with absolute confidence. From one eating spot to the next we sampled modern to traditional (balut anyone....), sweet to savoury that the Hanoian street food community had to share. Money was so sweet and genuinely very enthusiastic in showing off her food culture. This is a must do on any food travelers hit list.

Best tour of the trip with Sunny!. My mum was terrified of the short ride on motorbike from our hotel to the tour office but instead of leaving it all to my responsibility, Sunny was very gentle and kept consoling my mum to calm her down. We tried a handful of dishes and walk quite a bit throughout the tour while Sunny in her early 20s, never forget to slow down her pace for my 66 year old mum. She patiently explain each of the dishes to us, how to eat and even noted down the name of the dishes against the address, plus a number of recommendations for us to go to after the trip ends. There isn't a dull moment as we also chatted a lot of our similarities against the differences in our families throughout the tour. Remember to wear comfortable shoes to trek the uneven pavement & bring your camera, a good idea to start the tour for breakfast when your stomach is empty! Ask for Sunny, a very bubbly girl with lots of energy.

The street food tour to take. Fantastic evening with some lovely people (8 of us in total) as we walked around the old quarter of Hanoi eating the most delicious food in the most hidden places. Jun our guide was brilliant - interesting, informative and thoroughly lovely! Can't recommend this tour highly enough.

Best night out Hanoi has to offer. We went on the food tour by motorbike and it was the best thing we did in Hanoi. Our guides Amy and Lily were amazing and showed us not only the best food Hanoi has to offer, but the major sites and attractions as well. I highly recommend doing this tour by bike as there is no other experience quite like it! For an authentic, fun and fast paced adventure this is a must in Hanoi!

Great start to our trip - thanks to the ever smiling Amy!. On our first night in Vietnam (after a few hours sleep following an overnight flight) we decided that a local street food tour would be a great way to get our bearings in Hanoi and to discover local tips for eating out. Our guide Amy was a delight - full of funny little stories and eager to explain to us the right way to eat each dish, what toppings to put where. She never stopped smiling and also taught us how to deal with crossing Hanoi's crazy streets. We made 4 x local restaurant stops to eat their specialities (two we enjoyed so much we went back during our stay), we tried Bo Bia from a man that made it all on a platform on the back of his bike - a yummy sweet mix of milky crunchy, coconutty flavours. We have been trying to track the Bo Bia man down again but have not managed to find him yet! Much to Amy's disappointment we had to turn down two eating stops on the tour as we were all so full of delicious food and instead opted to finish up with an egg-coffee .... mmmm that one I am not going to revisit but that's what street food is all about - discovering things you love and others not so much ...

A great evening . Just finished my tour. What a great way to try a range of the local cuisine. A perfect sized group of 6. The tour started on time and before I knew it we were into our first dish. We moved around at a nice pace yet plenty of time to finish each dish. Everywhere was able to accommodate dietary requirements. Our delightful guide Phuong (Phoenix) was excellent.

Great food, great guide!. The food we tried was very good. And our guide Hoai amazing! She is so nice and helpful. We would give them 5 stars but it was a bit overpriced compare to the street food cost in Hanoi.

Do this, you won't be sorry. Kiwi was our guide, and she was wonderful. We've all been on a lot of guided tours. What makes a tour worthwhile is when the guide shares their passion for the topic and infects you with the same interest and love. Kiwi did this - she was so generous with her knowledge about the different dishes, so accommodating to the different people on the tour, so genuinely interested in the topic herself. We really felt like we learned something, and enjoyed the time immensely.Oh yeah, and Vietnamese food is the best in the world, so you can't go wrong there. What's helpful is that she shows you the best places, and how to eat things in the right way (which isn't always obvious, but always more delicious.)There were a couple dishes we were interested in that we didn't get to try on the tour, so we asked her for her recommendations. She even drew us a map. We found them the next day and were not disappointed. All in all, hard to find a better way to spend 20 bucks in Hanoi.

Something different ! . My partner and I arrived late into Hanoi after a long delay so felt we needed to make up for lost time and pack in as much as possible. I found this tour via TA at we booked at 3pm for 6pm pick up at our central hotel. Great fun on the bikes and staff totally professional. Enjoy the ride and tasty food!! enjoyed

Must do!. We booked this tour for the first day we were in Hanoi to get a feel for the food and the city. That was the best decision we could have made. Our guide Mango was awesome and gave us a lot of information about the food and history of the area. Do not eat lunch if you are doing a afternoon tour. We were so full. There is a fair amount of walking but it was good to walk between eating.

Excellent way to experience the Hanoi food scene. My husband and I showed up an hour before we wanted to take a tour and arranged everything with no problem. We booked a private tour which is not much more expensive than the group tour, but you get the benefit of tailoring the menu to your own preferences. We had about 4 specific dishes not listed in the itinerary that we had wanted to try, and our lovely guide Phuong (Phoenix) made sure that we got to sample all that we requested. I highly recommend Phuong as a guide; she's super friendly, patient, and explains each dish in detail before you eat. Also, at the end of the tour, she wrote down everything we ate and even gave us a mini lesson on the Vietnamese language. If you have a free night in Hanoi, be sure to take this tour!

So many dishes, so much tasty!. We had the delight of KiWi as our guide, which made for a hilarious time when we attempted to explain we were Kiwi's also! KiWi our guide was a great deal of fun, we weren't sure what to expect but the first meal out of the gate, Bun Cha and we were sold! A great tour, worth going hungry and liking fish sauce. Thoroughly cemented a deep seated love affair with Vietnamese food, which we are already missing! Can definitely recommend KiWi as a fantastic, fun and enthusiastic guide. And as the person who first helped us cross the insanely busy streets with the 'sticky rice' technique she will hold a special place in our hearts :)

I can't recommend this enough!. Took the evening tour with Phuong (Phoenix), the most wonderful guide you can have. She took us to 9 places where we had different kinds of foods, places we never would have gone to on our own. The food was so good, Phuong was super nice, ready to answer every question that we had and watched out for us in the crazy Hanoi traffic. I'm stuffed and probably wont have to eat for another week. Go hungry.

Nice but expensive . We booked a private walking tour. It was nice. Our guide named Sunny (I think they all called that way, it's their 'tourists name'). At the beginning we felt that she was a bit in a rush, and we just spent a few minutes in each place, but on the last places it become better and we sat comfortably. I felt like the tour wasn't that informative as I would want it to be. And the guide's English wasn't that good (only understand half of what she said). We did it on our first day in Vietnam so for me it was a very good introduction to the Vietnamese cuisine, which helped me a lot during the trip (I already knew what I like and should order at restaurants).Although I really enjoyed it, don't think it was a good money value, because it was quite pricey.

Scooting around Hanoi - a great way to see the city!. My friend and I went on a 4 hour motorbike tour with our fantastic guides, Lily and Mia. We didn't have much experience at all with riding motorbikes, but it's definitely not a problem as the tour comes with helmets as well as experienced drivers :)Lily and Mia really made a difference to the tour. They were funny, knowledgeable and very sweet. Definitely DO NOT eat before taking this tour. You will burst at the seams!! A nice bit of sightseeing inbetween the snacks helps to break up the eating.At the end, Lily and Mia dropped us off back at our hotel.

Come Hungry. I was lucky to take this tour when the Night street market was open. The food was very filling. Make sure you come hungry. There were a lot of stops and a lot of food. Some of the food I has was spring rolls, thin pancake, soup, cold ginger tea and the last stop was some kind of yogurt with fruit( very refreshing). I had Cherry as a tour guide and she was very good. Cherry took us to places that I would never of gone to. It was like I had a private tour because there was only 2 people on the tour. My only complaint is that if I had not phoned to confirm I would of missed the tour. The tour date was changed and I was not notified. Be prepared that some of these places are dirty. You will be sitting on very small stools. A tip - wear comfortable shoes.

Awesome tour! A must in hanoi. . We arrived in hanoi yesterday and organised this tour straight away for lunch the next day. It was awesome. We walked around stopping at various shops and the food we tried we would never have known to try on our own. Our tour guide was lovely and very chatty. Her English was great and we enjoyed her knowledge of the area and the food. Highly recommended these guys.

The best food tour I've ever taken.. I've taken many, many food tours across Europe and Asia. This one is hand's down the best. Our guide, Ms. Moon, was absolutely fantastic - funny, knowledgable about Vietnamese history and food culture and endearing. The tour wasn't just about stuffing ourselves with delicious food either, it was interesting and well paced. Hat's off to Ms. Moon for a wonderful day. In my book, a must when visiting Hanoi.

An amazing experience of cultural immersion. I read about this tour on TA before we left home. We booked a private tour for the 6 of us. We loved our guide, Nga, a recent college graduate. She was knowledgeable, helpful and so friendly and enthusiastic! We walked for over 3 hrs. and sampled food at 9 restaurants. This included delicious rice ice cream and egg coffee. We liked it all, but we were stuffed! We did this on a Sat. night, so the streets were filled with locals, mostly young people sitting on little stools eating and drinking and visiting with each other and just enjoying the weekend. One street was for pedestrians only and was set up like a mini-playground for children with various types of play equipment arranged down the middle of the street. It was so rewarding to be there among the locals and witness their Hanoi on a Sat. night. This was my favorite experience of our entire 19 day trip. I would definitely recommend Kim's Hanoi Street Food Tour and Nga as a guide.

Mean feed on the street food tour. We had a fantastic guide, Money, take us on our Hanoi Street Food Tour, providing not only amazing hide aways with the best Vietnamese food, but also some great insights into the culture and history of the city. We were left extremely full and well worth the money. Go hungry!!!

Brilliant Tour with Lotus. We booked a private day tour last minute as we really wanted to kick start our holiday with lots of food. Our guide was Lotus. She was brilliant! Very very knowledgeable about the area and the food. She entertained us and took us to 8-10 places where we tried all different styles of Vietnamese street food. It was amazing. I also ate an egg with a baby duck in it which was interesting but tasted great. I highly, highly recommend this tour and hope you're lucky enough to get lotus as your guide. Go with an empty stomach! She also gave us some great recommendations which we tried in the next couple of nights. The tips she gave made our stay extra special, thank you Lotus!

Great Street Food Tour. We took the Hanoi Street Food Tour on our trip to Hanoi last week and absolutely loved it. We did it on our first night there and it really helped us navigate the Old Quarter the rest of the days. Our guide, Nga, was excellent! She loves to cook herself and knew a LOT about the food we were eating. She also knew her history well so in addition to the food, we also got a history lesson, which was awesome. Her English was also very good. Would highly recommend this tour company and Nga!

A treat to eat on the street. A good thing to do as both a way to experience traditional Vietnamese food street style and to find your way around the old quarter of Hanoi. The local guide is very keen to please and ensure you enjoy your time as well as leave there with a full tummy. I suggest this tour is taken on your first day in Hanoi as it sure provided me with a good basis to get my bearings and find my own way from there on.

Best experience in Hanoi . You must do it! We took the tour in a group of 6 people and it was just perfect. The guide will take you to some hidden places in Hanoi that you can't find by your self. The food was amazing! Prepare to eat a lot, at the end we couldn't eat any more. I recommend to the the tour in your first day on Vietnam, it will help you to know what are the best dishes in the country for the future.

It's always 'Sunny' in Hanoi. Had a fantastic night with our guide Sunny. She was so friendly, very knowledgeable and she took us to the real Vietnamese food places, not the fake places.
Thanks for making our first night in Hanoi a great one! We will tell all our friends to request you!

Eat like an Hanoian !. We have been on the tour with Kiwi, she is super friendly and loves to talk about anything ! She is a very curious girl and she dreams to travel as well ! Anyway, on the tour we have been visiting many local restaurant with "weird looking" food (which I really thought I wouldn't be able to eat). To my amazement, it was just paradise..! I had also some food restriction (no seafood, ..) and she adjusted my menu on that without even asking !That was really thoughtful and I was impressed.Eventually she will start a conversation and even give us some tips on how to survive in the Old Quarter. I can tell that our trip wouldn't have been the same if we didn't do the Food Tour. You can either do the tour with a group for 20$ per person, or private tour for 30$ per person.Thank you Kiwi to be the highlight of the day !

Best thing that happened to us in Hanoi !! Love you "KIWI". We did the food tour on our first night in Hanoi with our lovely guide "Kiwi". She isn't just an ordinary guide but also an amazing friend we made in Hanoi. The 3 hours tour doesn't seem enough to learn the amazing culture of Hanoi with Kiwi. The tour is very flexible and suitable for all. Kiwi is very attention to details, she made sure about our allergy and preference, and ensure that all meal are sterilised and safe for us. She is full of knowledge about the food and informed us about the ingredients, the history behind each meal and piece of advice of how to find the delicious food like Hanoian. Moreover, she also gave us a wonderful tour of the city, packed with fun facts, that isn't only informative but also fun as well. Before we departed, she also gave us a few tips of how to survive in Hanoi, in which very helpful to us until the very end. We must say that our Hanoi trip wouldn't be completed if we didn't meet Kiwi. She is the best thing that happen to us in Hanoi !!

Awesome!! Don't miss!!. With so much opportunities for dinner in Hanoi, where ever I was sitting I felt like I was missing so much, and since I had only 3 nights in Hanoi, the street food tour was perfect for me and my wife. Our guide was phoenix, and she was friendly, funny, knowledgable and sweet. We went to 5-6 different places and had a great time!!cogrou

Amazing food and tour. We did the food tour on our first full night in Hanoi and we are so glad we did. Our guide was Diep (Sunny) who was really friendly and really made the tour special for us. It was especially nice as it was only me and my husband on the tour so we felt we got to know her well. We ended up in lots of hidden restaurants trying things we never would have if it hadn't been for the tour. By the end of the night we were full and had a list of recommendations for other dishes to try as well as a list of what we already tried. Thank you Diep! Would thoroughly recommend.

Great food and company. "Pixie" took us on a stroll around the old quarter sampling various traditional Vietnamese dishes including bun cha, banh cuon and banh goi. She was a great host who explained how to enjoy each dish as well as some of the history of the old quarter. She also gave us a list of other dishes/restaurants that she didn't have time to cover, one of which we enjoyed later that day. Highly recommend spending 3 hours of your day with Pixie!

Fantastic Food Tour with Annie!. We just got back to our hotel after a 3 hour food tour with Annie. We are stuffed and so happy we decided to book this tour! We ate at places we've been walking past all day and would never think to stop at and also places we would have never noticed on our own. Annie was great at explaining the dishes we were eating and telling us how we were supposed to eat them too. We had someone in our group who couldn't eat certain meat and my boyfriend is celiac causing food restrictions but there wasn't an issue at all, she let us know what he could eat and ordered alternatives for both of them when possible. This is a must do activity in Hanoi!

Amazing food with an amazing guide!. This food tour was awesome!! Every dish we had was incredible and we were able to see how most dishes were made, we also got to make our own at one of the locations. Our guide, Pixie, was so sweet and so informative. It was obvious she knew a lot about Hanoi food! She also stopped by a couple historical sites on the tour to tell us about which was unexpected and very awesome. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wants to experience a variety of Hanoi dishes!

Great fun with Kiwi!. We first did the night cyclo street walking tour on our second day in Hanoi. We had the lovely Kiwi as our guide. She is very knowledgeable, friendly and speaks English well. She introduced to a lot of food that the average tourist would never have found.We were so impressed with her that we requested to have another tour with her (food street and water puppet show) . The menu she prepared for us the second time was just as good as our first experience.Unfortunately the heat got to my Dad and and had to miss the water puppet show. Kiwi made our experience in Hanoi very enjoyable and we would definitely recommend her to friends in Australia. Thank you Kiwi for introducing us to the delights of Hanoian food!

Enjoyable night with "Mango". Had a good time stuffing myself throughout the old quarter. There are lots of street vendors so it's helpful to have a local guide to help you pick out the good ones or ones with lots of history. Hoai, aka Mango, was friendly and knowledgeable, not only about local food, but about life in the capital, how people live, study, etc. highly recommend!

Great exprience. Had a really funny and great evening with our guide Cherry. She is extremely enthusiastic, and took us to places we had never have went to ourselves. They were also been great picking us up from our hotel since we told them we are coming on the last minute.
This is a great VFM tour, I highly recommend it.

The best food tour in Hanoi with Sunny. I strongly recommand to do it.
Hanoi is very famous in street food but If you try your self, Its very hard to find good place.
Also my guide was very kind and too great

Great way to eat like a local . Had a great night with my knowledgeable and friendly guide Nga, we tried so many foods drinks and snacks. There's no way you could seek out all these fantastic little local eateries on your own so definitely worth doing. I was the only person on the 7pm tour so got a private tour for the usual group price of 25usd ^^

Excellent Street Food Tour. Went on a 2 hour breakfast (8am) street food tour on scooters with friendly and knowledgeable guides Lily & Mia. They took us to places you probably wouldn't go on your own and gave us time to eat and enjoy the food while explaining about the dishes, what they were made of and how to eat them properly to enjoy the flavours.They also showed us a few sites in Hanoi.If I could change 1 thing, I would have done the longer tour. Thoroughly recommend.

Great experience to eat like a Hanoian !!. Due to the flight schedule, me and my friend couldn't make it to join the city tour, but it's not a regret too as we've join the 3 hours (11am - 2pm) street food tour to open our taste buds and fill up our hungry stomach, Pretty and friendly Money (Ha Vu), not only brought us to eat like a hanoian but tells us the local history, and the lifestyle of local vietnamese too. At the end, 2 of us back to guesthouse with a full full stomach !! Highly recommended and is worth of money !!!

Loved this tour. We did the tour at 5pm with Amy at the end of August. Had a great time & she was a wonderful guide with a great sense of humour. The food was great & plenty of it. By the end, we had trouble moving very fast. Amy even helped us find a taxi on a very busy night after the tour. Much appreciated Amy.

WHAT A GREAT EXPERIENCE!!. A couple of days ago, my husband and I did a street food tour with a fantastic guide, Kiwi (Nguyet), who spoke extremely good English. She took us to 7 or 8 stops and we tried some really good local food and also drinks. We elected to do the private tour just the two of us, but for $10 less you can do a group tour. Our tour started at 6.30pm and as it was a Friday night, we got to see the Old Quarter in all it's manic glory as the night market was on and there was a lot of street entertainment also. If you are wanting a little more calm, then I suggest doing the 11.30am tour, or picking an evening other than Friday, Saturday or Sunday when the night markets are on. Our guide told us some interesting things about local life in Hanoi and Vietnam, which was great. Being able to spend time with this lovely young lady was probably the highlight. Can highly recommend this tour, and the egg coffee at the end was a massive delicious surprise!! Thank you Kiwi for a great experience.

Absolute must, do it now!. My fiancee and I are staying in Hanoi for three weeks. We did this food tour on day one and it was the best decision we could have made. 8 amazing street food stops, Miss Moon was an absolute pleasure; funny, charming, and super knowledgable. Ended the tour with fresh beer!Highly recommended, a no brainer at $20 US, best thing we did in Hanoi!

Awesome!! Must do!. We just got back from this awesome street food tour. We took the 11am group tour and one word of advice - DONT EAT BREAKFAST!!! So much food, and so much amazing food - we couldn't eat it all! Wonderful stuff and our guide was called Money - seriously her name is Money :)) and she was great! Highly recommended.

Highlight of Hanoi - this is a must do. We spent a fantastic and delicious evening sampling the gastronomic delights of Hanoi with our lovely guide Sunny (Diep). The whole family enjoyed the experience immensely and only wish we had done it earlier in our stay so we could go back and enjoy some of the meals again. The variety and quality of the food was exceptional and this tour gave us a real insight into Hanoi and some of the local food places we could never have found on our own. We highly recommend this tour and thank you Sunny for a wonderful experience.

Hanoi Street Food Tour is a must do!. This was a great and inexpensive tour that I would highly recommend. Our guide Duong (Pixie) was fantastic and had put a lot of time and thought into taking the group to a variety of places for eats and drinks that certainly I never would have found or considered trying without her guidance. Pixie managed a diverse group (dietary requirements) very well and flexibly and took the time to explain cultural significance of the dishes and sights we walked passed on the tour. Also a great way to see and understand Hanoi culture at night. Suitable for anyone of any age, including children.

Great use of a morning in Hanoi. We did a three hour morning scooter food tour with Hien (aka Cherry) and Nhung (aka Jane) and it was brilliant. Both the girls were awesome. Friendly, chirpy and excellent English speakers, not to mention safe and confident scooter riders. The tour itself was everything we hoped for. We did a similar tour in Saigon which was a much slower pace and only took in three different eateries over a similar time. This tour was action packed and included seven stops. We'd already said we didn't need to be back to our hotel after three hours and would be happy if it over-ran, and we ended up being out and about for nearly four hours because we were having so much fun. I've not doubt we could have kept to time if we'd needed to. The girls asked what food we'd eaten during our time in Vietnam and adjusted the tour to ensure everything we tried was new. Highlights included the new style pho rolls, fried sour pork rolls, crab soup and Vietnamese coffee with egg. We ate so much food, and won't be needing lunch today. We also popped over the Red River using the old rail bridge to go one way and the newer road bridge to come back which gave us some good photo opportunities. The girls kept a handwritten note of all the foods we ate and included some restaurant and bar recommendations for the rest of our time in Hanoi which was a really nice touch. All in all an excellent use of a morning in Hanoi. Vietnam has given us some brilliant moments and this was one of them. Highly recommended.

Great introduction to Vietnamese food!. We landed in Hanoi and 2 hours later, and quite jet lagged, were wandering the streets tasting everything in sight. For $20USD we got an energetic young guide who spoke near perfect english and took us to 8 amazing places around the old historic quarter of Hanoi. You get a diverse selection of foods, a couple of different dessert options, and chance to try some of your own cooking, and end the night with amazing egg coffee! Overall about 2 hours and I recommend making it your first adventure in Vietnam so you know what to order on the rest of your trip.
Amazing!. Money was amazing for our private tour! Jam packed few hours, local history and delicious food! So full at the end, full range of food and drinks included! Highly recommend, must do!

Hanoi night street food tour. What an amazing way to sample the best of Hanoi street food! Our three hour tour was guided by Sunny (Diep). Her English was fantastic and her name certainly suits her fantastic personality. She was very knowledgable and told us all about the various parts of town we were walking through.She took us to sample some of the best dishes Hanoi has to offer, from traditional Bun Cha to crispy pillow cakes and the freshest salad I've ever eaten.Was well worth the $25 it cost and I would highly recommend this to others.

Great tour, fantastic guides!. Working out where to eat in Hanoi was a challenging and somewhat daunting experience with so many street food vendors, cafes and restaurants lining the streets, so my husband and I decided to give this awesome tour a shot. What an experience it was! We were taken by motorbikes around the foodie hot spots of the old quarter and were then driven further a field across the bridge to the hang outs where only the locals venture. Whilst the food was pretty awesome (I especially loved the coconut ice cream and egg coffee!) the highlight of our tour was the beautiful company and insights provided by our two wonderful guides, Pixie and Viv. Not only did they share their extensive food knowledge but they also provided us with incredible local insights about their city and heritage. I'd highly recommend this tour but would recommend the guides even more highly. Thank you Pixie and Viv for a truly memorable evening! :)

Excellent, must do in Hanoi. Our guide Lotus asked what the group had eaten before, and then tried to challenge us to new dishes. Not only did we have so so much food - listen to the advice and don't eat before this, you have about 10 dinners worth.... we also got our bearings in the old quarter and had lessons in culture and history. An excellent eve, would recommend to everyone.

Hanoi Street Food Tour a must for all tourists. Me and my wife were visiting Hanoi for 4 nights and wanted to experience the local food the way the locals enjoy it. We had a private street food tour and it was well worth it. We tried food we never would have thought to and also restaurants we would never have entertained going to. It was great and we even went back to a few of the restaurants the next night ourselves to try more food on their menu.What made the tour so enjoyable was also our tour guide, Sunny (Diep). She was great and explained each restaurant in depth from they way they cook the food, their sepcialties, how to eat each dish, etc. She also wrote down a recommended menu for us to use for the rest of our trip in Hanoi and gave us some helpful information and tips on other tours and things we should do in Hanoi, not to mention some good stories about the old town and some of the sights we walked past during our street food tour. She made the tour very enjoyable and we would recommend others using Sunny in the future.

Great tour! . This was a fantastic tour. Very glad we chose the group option as it was a nice atmosphere doing the tour w other travellers. Our tour guide, Mango, was very cheerful, funny and happy to answer all our questions. The tour introduced us to new foods we wouldn't normally try while travelling so that was great.

Very interesting street food tour. Four of us went on this tour recently and really enjoyed it. Our tour guide was Money and her English was perfect. We all agreed we ate in places we would never have entered let alone eaten in them which was great. The different food type were good didn't know you could do so much with rice.My only complain is that when the men asked for cold beer it came served with ice in the beer, so I suggest that they have some beers in the fridge for people that like it cold not of the shelf.

Dive into Foodstreet . We made the 3 hour tour with our guide Kiwi who was super sweet and very friendly! She showed us 9 different typical vietnamese dishes and drinks! Excellent tour if you have no clue about vietnamese food so do it in the first days after arrival. Forget about your hygine standards (it is REAL street food) and come with an empty belly!!!! Big fun!
great memories, great tastes. Miss Moon was a wonderful guide to the streets and tastes of old Hanoi - thank you again!! We went there a year ago and would recommend this tour in a heartbeat.

Street food tour. Having arrived in Hanoi the night before and felt overwhelmed by the choice of where to eat, but not knowing anything about Vietnamese food, I took a friend's advice and tried one of these hanoi street food tours.I would thoroughly recommend it.. all the food was delicious and our guide Diep was very diligent in telling us what each dish was and how you eat it. She also gave us plenty of extra information about the areas we were walking through, with some local history and a bit of cultural background info.Due to the time of year it starting raining heavily during the tour and Diep insisted on buying us plastic ponchos which was very sweet of her (not sure this would be a guaranteed part of every tour!).This was an excellent introduction to food in Hanoi, and our guide left us with a great list of each dish and where we ate it, along with further recommendations if we were staying on in Hanoi. Well worth doing.

Best way of exploring street food of Hanoi. We enjoyed 3 wonderful hours with Miss Moon! She showed us the most amazing small spots with amazing food and local specialties. We would recommend this trip to all visitors of Hanoi - a definitive must do!
Great, guide, great food!. Perfect tour to get to know the many foods of Vietnam. our guide was exceptional and we enjoyed it very much.

Very nice and funny food tour. We visited Hanoi for 2 days, and we were suggested to have a food tour there. We did not regret this choice, even because we did an evening one with Money, the funny girl working in Hanoi street food tour, and I must say this was really worth it! We passed by several places where we ate lots of typical food, all this dressed by the tips and jokes of Money. A special thank to her!

Brilliant for all. Absolutely fantastic walking banquet You will come away completely full to the brim and love every moment. Thanks to our guide Lotus. You were wonderful.moevevemoment. Thanks to our guide Lotus who was just wonderful. Highly recommended!

Miss Moon made the trip. Very informative and clear explanation offered a varied of different food to try from places that you would otherwise walked past with no knowledge that it was there. Miss Moon offered a great sense of humor & personality which made the tour most enjoyable Most highly recommended to do at the beginning of your stay in Hanoi Sony u know where & what to eats

Kids point of view. I loved this tour it was amazing. I tried foods that I had never even heard of before. Miss Moon has a great personality and alway remember her rule "you have to sticky rice together." Think of this rule when ever you cross the road in Hanoi.

Don't think; just go. As soon as possible!. This was one of the first things that we did on our month-long trip through Asia, and remains one of the highlights. Hanoi is a very intimidating city to jump into, and we found that starting our trip with a street food tour with Miss Moon was a perfect introduction to town. She was an incredibly charismatic and fun leader of our group. We went to hole-in-the-wall places that we would have been very nervous to try on our own, and had a great introduction to the local food. One warning - be sure to pace yourself in the beginning as you will get more food than you can possibly eat along the way.

Fascinating and yummy !. My husband and I took the walking street food tours 2 days ago and it was both amazing and delicious. Our guide, Nga, was very nice and shared a lot of stories and explanations with us. We tried 12 dishes and drinks without exploding (well we almost did !). Some of them were quite astonishing like the green sticky rice ice-cream or the egg coffee (with a sabayon on top), but everything was basically succulent ! And it's a nice walk into the Old Quarter as well.
Hanoi Street Food Tour. Miss Moon you are wonderful, what a fantastic experience. Group of people were lovely. Food exceptional and experience one to never forget.

Knowing A People's Culture Through Food. My friends and I took the Hanoi Walking Food Tour and it was an unforgettable and insightful evening. We were guided by a smart, witty and very lovely young lady, Jun. She's an English Major in university. She did not only let us taste all these delicious food, but gave us anecdotes on how the food is prepared and eaten, how it differed from Hanoi and the rural areas (where she's from), she pointed us landmarks and places to see as we walked along. She asked the proper questions and made the group comfortable in sharing each other's food preferences (we were with 2 lovely couples from Argentina and Germany). I appreciate it that these eating places are where the locals eat and grab meals everyday, the range of food choices was just right---from soups, fried food, wraps, pickled fruits, iced desserts, ending with their local beer, Banh Mi and egg coffee. I recommend that you take this food tour on your first evening in Hanoi.

Absolutely awesome. The tour was so good! We were taken to really local places with delicious food and our guide JUNE was the best! Super friendly, very informed and happy to share her culture with us. It's a must!

Insightful and delightful experience!. My tour guide was Annie, a university student (I think they all are?). I signed up for the 17:00 group tour but since the weather was sub-par that day and a few guests had to cancel at the last minute, I ended up getting a one-on-one tour. Annie was a great guide as she was not only knowledgable about the food, but engaging in general conversation as well. It felt more like she was a friend than a tour guide. Of course, this was influenced by the size of our party but nonetheless, I would absolutely recommend this as an experience to be had in Hanoi.

Culinary delights. Our guide was Cherry.Not only did she give us insight to the food culture but also an insight into viet culture.We tried food we would not normally have tried and for me it was all delicious even the chicken embryo ha ha ha.Cherry's English was excellent.She introduced me to Bo Biah which became my favourite little sweet for the remainder of our journey.We really enjoyed this tour and recommend it for the first day of your stay in Hanoi as it opens up Hanoi for you as you will recognise many of the dishes and try them again.
Amazing!. This was maybe my favorite tour in Hanoi as our awesome guide, Annie, was so accommodating to the vegetarians that we had! Street food is possibly my favorite thing about Vietnam :)
Great!. Good fun, great explanations of food, wide variety of local tastes. Highly recommended. Come hungry and ready to dodge scooters.

AWESOME!!!!! A must-do!!. We had an awesome time on our private tour with Miss Moon. She took us to so many amazing restaurants that we never would have ventured into on our own and everything we ate (there was A LOT of food) was INCREDIBLE!!! I think we ate about 12 different things (make sure you go very hungry). We almost skipped this tour because we were exhausted after a long day of travel and afterward we were so glad that we didn't because on our 3 week trip to SE Asia this was one of our favorite things that we did. If you really want to try "real" Vietnamese food and truly eat what the locals eat, do this tour for sure. Also, if you can specially request Miss Moon as your guide, you should!

Really fantastic and worthwhile tour. The Hanoi Street Food Tour with the gorgeous Amy as our guide was really wonderful from start to finish and we can't recommend it or her enough. There were two of us and we chose to do a private tour. Personally I feel this is the way to go as many of the restaurants are really small and crowded so I'm not sure large groups would be able to go to all of the same places as we did. Also, the streets in the Old Quarter are really narrow and crowded so with only the three of us we were able to walk together and talk.Amy was enthusiastic, interesting and knowledgable, her English was excellent and she went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed ourselves and learnt as much as possible about Hanoi and the food we were served, (she even arranged to have my earring fixed free of charge as we were eating our dessert!) We have had quite a bit of experience with Vietnamese cuisine but even still there were some foods we'd never tried before. Without exception all of the food we had was absolutely fresh and delicious. Most of the places we visited, had we not been with a guide, we either wouldn't have had a clue what or how to order or we wouldn't have known the restaurants were even there as some were accessed down dark laneways or up stairs without English signage. Having Amy there though enabled us to try places and foods we as tourists wouldn't have otherwise. Thank you so much Amy, we will certainly recommend you and the tour to friends.

Amazing food tour, eating like locals with locals. Did this tour earlier in the week. We had Phonix Chan as our tour leader. She adapted the tour to our dietary requirements and also to what we liked while we were on the tour. Think we went 8 places to eat - all very good and not what we would have picked out. Nothing is pre booked like on other tours where you end up eating with tourists rather than locals. Had 6 savoury stops (including Bia Hoi!) and the one dessert and one coffee place. Can highly recommend it. Great value for money at $20 per person.

Fantastic tour, a highlight of Hanoi. Took a tour with guide "Kiwi" last week. She was adorable and super cheerful and gave us some great insight into how the food is made, ingredients, who typically eats which dish when, and best of all, how to eat it. Great service with the restaurants and plenty of great food.

Must Do First stop in Hanoi. Took a Private Street Food Walking Tour with Lotus. Was a fabulous introduction to the tastes and flavours of Hanoi Style Vietnamese food. As we walked the streets of the Old Quarter, Lotus chatted to us about Vietnamese History as well as local customs. She had a good grasp of English and the most important thing of all - how to eat each delicacy - what to mix with what. It was no trouble at each stop on the tour for her to arrange, where possible, for GF (gluten free) options. The food was fantastic and had us wishing we had done it on our first day in Hanoi rather than our last. Thankyou Lotus!

Excellent tour with Lotus. Did a private tour tonight with our guide Lotus. Her English was really good and not only did we learn about the food but also the culture, history and personal family life.The food was amazing and I wish that I had done it sooner on our visit to Hanoi. After spending the time with Lotus it was a little sad to say goodbye to our new friend. I would highly recommend this tour and especially Lotus

The best guide - Annie!!. We loved this tour!! Our tour guide was amazing - explained everything we wanted to know - about the food and general questions.. Finally we found food that we actually like here! Thank you Annie!

Fantastic Tour , tailored to us.. We opted for the private tour which was still cheap in comparison to others, as we had a 4 year old with us. We were lucky to get the amazing Nga or "money". She spoke amazing english, took her time with us, tailored it to our reqests and made the tour perfect. We had already eaten a few types of food already, so she took them off the tour and she added a trip to the fruit market to help us buy and try new fruit, which was great for my son. I wanted to know what everything was everywhere and as a result Nga obliged and over delivered, with obscure items, we saw on the street, explaining each item and where to find them. Her passion and knowledge of food was exeptional, and even though she had run numerous tours, she was still so enthusiastic. If you can request Nga or "Money" then you wont be dissapointed. She took us to see 12 things rather than the 8 or so on the tourDefinately recommend to anyone.
Fun and VERY FILLING Food Tour. Wonderful food tour in Hanoi. Tried many different foods and flavors with a knowledgeable guide. Words of advice....skip lunch. A definite must if you are in Hanoi..

Fantastic Food -- Expectations met and Surpassed. We signed up for the public food tour the night before we did the food tour. Everything was settled quickly and efficiently. Our guide's name was Jun, and she was endearing and very knowledgeable about Hanoi street food. She took us to taste several different dishes in several restaurants that we never would have found on our own. Jun was sweet and spoke English very well. She wrote down the list of restaurants we went to and even the names of the dishes we ate. She also gave us her email address if we were ever to return to Hanoi. My friends and I all loved the tour and thought the high rating on trip advisor was warranted. I definitely recommend this food tour. www.hanoistreetfoodtour.com

Food & Scooters = Happy Day. Amazing tour and I would recommend this to anyone for sure !!! Lily and Mia took us on the Hanoi street food tour by scooter. Apart from taking us to some amazing places to eat, the girls were so much fun and made sure we had a fantastic time - they even tried to kidnap me :-)Nothing was too much trouble. If you are visiting Hanoi you must do this !!

did the scooter foodie tour. Since our hotel is 30 minutes from the old quarter, we decided to use their motorcycle foodie tour, not the walking foodie tour. It costs more than double to the walking tour, but the difference is we get to try to ride at the back of the motorcycle in rush hour traffic. There is no way to reach old quarter that fast during rush hour using a taxi. 2nd, we get like a private tour since we got 3 motorcycles as we were 3 people. What i heard is that the walking tour is a group of people sharing 1 or 2 guides and according to my guide/driver, these walking tours can exceed what the website's stated maximum number per group, which concurs with what some reviews here complained about.We were brought to so many food outlets that by around the halfway point, our tummies were already very full. I seem to have misread the description of the tour because it stated "our foodie tour focuses on street food that most people outside vietnam have never had a chance to experience, so NO banh cuon, banh mi, bun cha, ba hoi, egg coffee. Well, we got to eat these. I was thrown off by the word "NO". I was hoping for some grilled food just like the foodie tour I have done in ho chi minh, but we were not brought to one. We did ask for some seafood and was brought to another food that was still noodle soup based. If we wanted more seafood selection, we were told that is using another tour called seafood tour, also in the website. No grilled food option was given. But I saw in one of the cheaper foodie tour that grilled food was part of it. We were full, but we were given too much noodle soup based food.Because we were on motorbike, we were able to see places like the ho chi minh mausoleum although only at the outside as it was already closed, the catholic church, and even did a stopover at the lake.What i was surprised unhappily was that at the end of the tour, they flagged us a taxi to return to our hotel. I was expecting that the package included hotel pick up AND return. Overall, I think the walking foodie tour will suffice than the scooter option.

Another level of street food. We had always tried to eat out on the street throughout our journey in Vietnam. However, we experienced a complete new level of street food during the tour. Hidden spots where you could barely see the seats in the room behind the "kitchen", incredibly good food - plus a nice mixed group, people that you can share your holiday experiences with! Thank you Annie for a great tour!

Miss Moon a winner. We had a tasty 3 hours following the lovely Miss Moon through the busy streets of the Old Quarter of Hanoi (calling us to stick together like 'stickyrice' ). There was no need to book - just turn up 15 minutes beforehand. There were 8 of us of varying ages, and apart from the 36 degree heat which was oppressive we tried various foods at very primitive places where we probably would not have eaten on our own. Miss Moon was very informative and entertaining during the walking tour and we had plenty to eat.

Under the shining Moon. Three hours of eating delicious Vietnamese food - our definition of heaven. The wonderful tour guide, Moon, had us weaving through the streets of the Old Quarter. Directing us into nooks and crannies (cupboard sized restaurants)that were as old as Independence (and sometimes older). Offering us traditional vietnamese cuisine of the highest order. It was the perfect way to spend our last day in Hanoi. Moon's sense of humour, knowledge of the food and command of English make her the perfect guide. thoroughly recommend this!

A trip full of nothing but yummy dishes of Hanoi. We spent a good 3hours+ walking about in the streets of Old Quarter eating all the famous dishes of hanoi with the help of our food tour guide; Nga, as known as Money. From all kinds of rice pancakes; steam/fried/dried, to fingers licking good grilled pork with rice noodles to various types of hanoi desserts and not forgetting the famous egg coffee.. you name it, they have it! On top of all these delicious food, our tour guide was awesome. She answers to all the questions(history of hanoi/buildings/city) we have for her, even when it wasn't food related. Highly recommended for all freshies who are coming to hanoi to join this food tour and special mention to have "Money" as your guide! The only bad thing was, it requires LOTS of walking but.. it's worth it!Warning: BE HUNGRY because you're gonna end the night with exploding tummies. ;)

Unmissable. Our guide Hien/Cherry was delightful and this tour was one of the highlights of our holiday. All the food was delicious and Hien made sure we didn't try anything we had already eaten in Vietnnam.

Amazing street food with surprises. We are from Hong Kong and had some expectation of the food quality. We were very satisfied with our foodie trip. It was a walking tour and our guide Moon is a very nice lady. We tried 8 different food which are local to old quarter. All very tasty. Suggest to go for day tour as some well known stalls only open during daytime. Most dishes are with meat so may be difficult if you are vegetarian. We love the bun cha which is rice noodles served with pork patty in honey and kam quat soup and egg coffee. Highly recommended tour.

Don't miss this tour! . I took the street food tour yesterday, and my only regret is that I didn't go sooner! Our guide, Diep (Sunny), was absolutely lovely and did an amazing job of taking us to places that I never would have discovered on my own. She even managed to reroute our tour to include the National Day fireworks, and then brought us delicious juice while we were stuck in the crowd. Highly recommend adding this tour to your Hanoi itinerary if you're looking for a first rate culinary adventure with first rate guides.

Amazing! Nga is the best tour guide ever.. Nga (English name, money) did an absolutely amazing job of showing us around Hanoi, showed us incredible food and tailored the trip to our needs and took us off the beaten track! Thank you every so much!

Fun & Delicious!!. My boyfriend and I had a lovely evening in Hanoi walking around with our fantastic guide named Cake sampling many delicious traditional Vietnamese dishes. Cake was super knowledgeable about street food in Hanoi and the city in general - we really enjoyed getting to know her! The food was wonderful and unlike anything we've ever tasted - I am a vegetarian and Cake made sure to accommodate me while letting my boyfriend try all of the delicious meat dishes at the same time. Some of the highlights were the "naked" pho, the steamed pancakes, and the whipped egg coffee and hot chocolate. Highly recommend this tour!!

Delicious Tour; one of the best tours in Vietnam. If you didn't study anything about local food, you should experience this great tour.Vietnam has lots of food menues and categories so you need to be very careful to order.This tour will guide you what to order and where to go by experiencing more than 8 different best local restaurants.Our family including 2 kids had a great experience with a young and beautiful guide named "KIWI" She was enthusiastic and very helpful. of course she speaks english very wellAlso, she wrote down all the names of the food we ate and restaurant we visited for us due to the difficult name to be remembered as foreigners at the end of the tour.

Great way to discover Hanoi food culture. Highly recommended to everyone who plans to visit Hanoi. It was fun to know how and where the locals eat. We had Diep as or tour guide and she was awesome. Tip: Eat small portions in the beginning. :)

Great tour and bring your appetite. Wonderful tour and wonderful tour guy by the name of Cherry. She was awesome as she took us to about 5 or 6 places and they were all delicious. My only complaint is that I wish I could eat more but was so full by the end of the tour I couldn’t have another bite. Recommend if you take the lunch time tour to skip breakfast so you have a large appetite, because there is plenty of food. Great experience on local Vietnamese food and culture.

A must do!. I was a little reluctant to do a street food tour as I am a vegetarian so wasn't sure if it would be suitable but I am so glad I did! We went to about 8 different places and tried all sorts of foods I wouldn't have normally and being a vegetarian was not a problem (although I do eat shrimp which made it easier). It was great value for money. Our tour guide, Annie, was so sweet and easy going. My boyfriend and I did an evening tour which I would recommend because it was much cooler than in the day!

Thanks to Diet for a fabulous experience. This tour took us to places we would never have considered visiting and the food was delicious. Our guide Diet made the night particularly enjoyable despite the thunder storm!

Highlight of our Hanoi Trip. We booked a scooter street food tour with best friends Lily and Mia. I have dietary restrictions and they made every effort to ensure that I was never left out and always had something delicious to eat. Their stories were interesting and amusing, the food was plenty and extremely tasty. These young ladies are intelligent, charming and very hard working. Meeting them was the highlight of our Hanoi trip and I wouldn't hesitate to book a tour again with them the next time we visit.

Excellent , fun, adventurous. There's nothing to dislike. The tour was fun, fulfilling and the tour guide was fantastic. Our guide was Amy and she was friendly and spoke good English. Variety is the spice of life! At the end of the walking tour, desserts & Vietnamese egg coffee was last of course, she would show us the way back to our hotel.

Do this your first day in Hanoi. This tour will take you to several, local spots to eat. As a western tourist, it'll help you overcome any apprehension you feel eating street food in Hanoi. You'll learn where to go and what to order. The food we had was so good! Do not waste your time and money at restaurants that cater to tourists. The food isn't tasty but it is expensive. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable.Do bring comfy walking shoes and sun protection as warranted.This is a half-day tour.

A great flavour of Hanoi's streets. We did this awesome tour in family with our 2 daughters (7 & 9 years old). We would have never tried these delicious snacks, rolls and desserts if we hadn't been there in the small shops. We were into their local life. It was interesting to understand how Vietnamese eat from breakfast to dinner and it was delicious. My favourite was the bun Cha! A big thank to Hien (cherry) who was very kind with our children.

Great way to experience hanoi food. Great tour. Annie was our guide and she was great. Lots of food (don't eat in the 6 hours before!) In 7 different places. I suggest doing this tour upon arrival in hanoi as you'll learn about hanoi food helping you to better experience food during your trip.

So much great food and a wonderful guide. Jun was brilliant! She explained all the different foods and bought us everything she could think of so we experienced everything. She was our favourite guide in Vietnam and was so smiley and told us all about her family and traditions and the delicious food we tried. A must for Hanoi visitors!

Excellent tour and great value. While Lonely Planet recommends a tour that costs $75, this one was excellent and only cost $20….we tried 8 different dishes including all of the Hanoi specialties, so it was well worth it! Must-do even if you only have one day in Hanoi.

Amazing tour-Jun (guide) was awesome. Just returned from the Hanoi street food tour and couldn't be happier about my experience. Come hungry as there is no shortage of delicious food to try. Jun, the tour guide, was extremely knowledgeable and personable and made the experience of sampling a different culture very fun. Definitely the highlight of my trip to Hanoi so far. Please don't miss out on this awesome experience as I highly recommend it.

Best food in Vietnam. Great experience! Our tour guide was Cherry who was excellent, she told us about all the different dishes we were eating and found the places that specialised in each dish to make sure we tried the best example of each. I would never have tried all of the dishes without doing this tour and would have really missed out (particularly enjoyed the black sticky rice and the egg coffee!) Also, really enjoyed meeting other tourists from all over the world (America, Korea, Australia, Holland, South Africa) and Cherry soon had us all chatting together. A very memorable experience and great value, I would definitely recommend going on the tour but best skip lunch first (and maybe breakfast too)!

Well Deserved #1 Rating. This food tour deserves its #1 spot. i didn't do the other ones, but I can say that this was an amazing good time. The food was amazing and we want to at least 8 places. I am a vegetarian and our guide, moon, made sure that I got only food I would eat. She was fun and our group bonded. Also, they keep the groups to a certain size to guarantee the experience and it worked. Do it if you are lucky enough to get a spot.

Food, beer, adventure and rain. Two of us popped in and booked this the day before. It was a very easy process. On the day we were greeted by our tour guide Diep. She was very knowledgable and took us to what seemed to be some of her favourite places to eat. We made sure to try everything that was put in front of us and it was all amazing. Diep was easy to understand and managed to tell us a fair bit about some of the processes and history behind the food that we were enjoying. The Bun Cha was incredible and the egg coffee was fantastic!We would highly recommend Diep and Hanoi Street Food Tours. Over to you whether you do it first day or once you been here a while. It won't matter.

Delicious!. My friend and I joined a Friday night tour. Our guide, Annie, was great. She took us to several locations all across the Old Quarter and we were able to try many types of food and drink including bun cha, banh cuon, papaya salad, different types of spring rolls, banh mi, local beer, and egg coffee. Everything was amazing! I think the menu varies a bit by time of day and what's available, but I'm sure you'd get a delicious sampling at any time of day. I'd recommend doing this early on your trip if it's your first visit to Vietnam- it helped me find some favorites early on and I was much more comfortable popping in to order at any places we came across after the tour. Definitely recommend!

Moon!. We did our tour with Moon! It was fun, delicious and very good value! Moon was excellent, very informative and lovely! Lots of great little places and food that we never would have tried! Particularly loved egg coffee!

So fun and so much food! . This was a great way for my friend and I to end our trip in vietnam! We tried a bunch of different foods throughout the country but there were plenty of dishes during this tour that we had not tried yet. All of the food was so good and there was way too much food! Definitely worth it to go on this tour and get to know a few of the local cuisines! We had Moon as our guide and she was really sweet as well!

Great way to sample local food.. We joined a tour with 6 other people, the tour guide (Smile), was very informative and pleasant. We visited 6 places to sample local food and each place was an experience. The tour lasted 3 hours and covered a good area of the old town of Hanoi. A very pleasant evening.

Best experience in Hanoi. This was by far our best experience in Hanoi. Great to try so many different dishes in a small group. As a plus you also get to see the city. Our guide Amy was amazing. Very funny and helpful!

Gratown. We just came back from the tour with Duong (Pixie) the tour was conducted professionally full of accurate information where she happily answered all our questions an also gave us an excellent understanding of the Vietnamese street food tradition. She is an excellent guide. As this is our 5th trip to Vietnam but our first street food tour we would happily recommend this tour to anyone else. We should have done it on the 1st trip.

Wow and Wow Again!. We have been on a lot of food tours in a lot of cities. But this one is at the top, for both quality and quantity of food (we were totally stuffed, then ate MORE!). Our guide, Kat, a law student working as a guide during her summer break, was knowledgeable, warm and funny. She--and the food--even impressed the chef who was one of our party. This was a great way to spend our first night in Hanoi, including the lessons on how to cross the streets in the old quarter. This is a must do. Be sure to arrive with an empty stomach; you certainly won't leave with one.

Great intro to Hanoi. We hit the ground running by doing this tour on our first night in Hanoi and it was great. Our guide Jun was lovely, her English was good and she taught us a few basic phrases and foods to look out for. We did the small group tour, six of us walked the streets and found little food stalls and restaurants. All the food and drinks we had were super tasty - highly recommended

Food Coma. With a Smile.. My brother and I had one day in Hanoi and thought that a food tour would be a great way to not only experience the local cuisine, but also see a lot of the old quarter.Let me tell you. For 20 bucks, you get an amazing guide (we had Ms. Moon) who was excellent in providing us the history of the city and how each dish contributes to the local culture. She was very sure to show us how to correctly eat each dish and was just in general a very warm and great guide. Beyond that, you literally don't stop eating for 3 hours. We thought we were going to be sampling, but you essentially eat 8 meals. We rolled our selves happily to the airport that evening, ecstatic for having gone on this tour. It is definitely a "must" when in Hanoi!

Great food, great tour guide and cheap beer!. We thoroughly enjoyed the street food tour! Every food we tried was excellent and it was a great opportunity to try some popular Vietnamese dishes and eat at places that we'd not normally be brave enough to try. Our tour guide was fantastic (Jun) - she had excellent English and took the time to explain all the dishes and ingredients to us. We also went to beer corner for a few cheap beers which was a welcome stop on a very hot and humid evening!

A Gastronomical Trek That's Astronomical... Hanoi Street Food Tour. Vietnamese food... it's delectable... but more than that, it's a science, an art, a philosphy and a way of life. You can never truly digest Vietnam without having fed your stomach, quenched your soul and tantalize your taste buds. For those with a large appetite for culinary adventure, embarking on a Hanoi Street Food Tour is an absolute must. Sweet, savory, salty, mild, spicy-- the sounds, smells and textures cannot be separated from the musical symphony experience by the pallet. Our guide too, Ms. Moon, is definitely someone to request-- she'll make sure not a single moment is a dull one.

Great tour!!. My husband and I did the walking food tour with Ms. Moon as our guide. The food was great and it was awesome to get to try dishes and street vendors we never would have been brave enough to wander in on our own. The egg coffee was one of our favorites! :-)

Best Food Tour in Hanoi. Phoenix was our favorite tour guide in Vietnam, and really make our food tour amazing! Definitely one of the best value for money tours we went on, and I would recommend it as a highlight of Hanoi, definitely a great way to get acclimated to the city after a lot of travelling. Food was excellent, and unlike other tours I really had the opportunity to eat as much as I possibly could and drink like a fish for a couple of hours. Definitely did not feel like I was cheated in any way, I could never have reproduced the tour for the price we paid in my wildest dreams. We even got to cook some of the snacks! Great time.

Amazing food only a local could find.. Absolutely amazing. A must-do for any foodie visiting Hanoi. Our guide Money was the best, make sure to ask for her! We had amazing food that we would simply have never been able to find without a guide. Bring your appetite and a sense of adventure.

My favourite tour in Vietnam. Best $20 I've ever spent. A great way to try foods/Vendors you wouldn't feel confident enough trying on your own. We tried 8 different options and was not disappointed. The guide was friendly and helpful and pointed out alternative vendors we could try the next day. Come with an empty stomach and good walking shoes. I would recommend doing it on your first night in Hanoi so you can go back to your favourites again.

Delicious Vietnamese cuisine . This tour is a must! I expected to be sampling small bites of things but it turned out to be a sit down meal where 10 strangers got to taste food I wouldn't have been able to order myself. Even though there were more than five restaurants sometimes with two courses, the food wasn't overly filling and you got to walk some of it off going place to place. Two locations were to try egg coffee which was like a desert and a chocolate bun which was a personal favourite. The guide spoke great English and gave us an in depth history about Vietnamese food and reasoning for the certain tastes you can find dotted around the street.

Go to places you may not try otherwise. This is a great way to navigate your way around the Old Quarter and eat at places that you may never even consider. We had a small group of just four which made for a very intimate tour. The food was excellent - lots of stops for different dishes - and our tour guide (can't remember her name, sorry) took the time to modify some of the standard dishes when she heard of our group's preferences. It's not an exciting as the motorbike food tour in Saigon, but well worth doing.

Great for the over 60's too !!!. Our guide was Amy and we were accompanied by another much younger couple who did not seem to mind us oldies tagging along. We were taken to about 8 street food outlets in the Old District where we experienced typical breakfast, lunch, diner and even dessert which were all superb. We were even bought a local made icecream on a stick and tried the egg coffee which I would recommend. Amy described each of the dishes in detail and how they played a part in the locals lives. As we walked from each outlet she gave us information on the district and the daily life of the locals. Our tour took over 3 hours and at the conclusion we had absolutely full stomachs. Great value for money. Thank you Amy, you were marvellous !!!

Delicious food and great tour guide. This was an amazing tour. Our tour guide took her time and explained everything very nicely. We ate food i would usually not order in Vietnam.
