We tryed food at local places that is not recommended by the travel guides. The good thing is that we learned how thw food is called, how to pronounce its name and how to eat it correctly. It was a very nice experience.

A must do in Hanoi!. If you call yourself a food lover- this tour must be the first thing in your to-do list in Vietnam! 8 different courses in 3 hours all over the old quarter, in places which normally, as a western, I would have never step into by myself. Ms moon was a brilliant tour-guide, providing us a great experience with her unique sense of humour. They were really flexible with the food, making it possible to vegetarians to enjoy the whole thing to. This is by far best activity we've done in Vietnam.

Good tour to enjoy both foods and sightseeing!. My son and I joined the tour on the first night we arrived in Hanoi, and enjoyed it very well!! Lili and Mia, the tour guides took us by motor-cycle to eight locally popular restaurants, and at all of them, foods were very unique and delicious. Not only local foods, they showed us several sightseeing spots. One of them we enjoyed the best was motorcycle run through narrow back alleys. We could feel some thrill, while we could see local people's life style spreaded out along the alleys. The whole tour took just three to four hours, and you can get brief idea on what Hanoi is through food and sightseeing, which is worth while to spend your time and money! Lastly, Lili and Mia, thank you very much for your excellent guide and smile!

Awesome tour - would highly recommend. We wanted to learn a little more about Hanoi and its food. A little nervous about a scooter tour after seeing the traffic, but our nerves were quickly settled.Mia, Lily and Kelly picked us up from our hotel and we were off on an awesome adventure. The ladies were fantastic, accomodating and very informative, would highly recommend this company.The scooter riding was exhilarating and we flew like birds.The food was amazing, but make sure you have a very light lunch, there is heaps, the flavours were amazing and they are able to accomodate dietary requirements and tastes... But we gave everything a go and surprised ourselves... Food we would not have tried on our own.Thank you again to our fantastic guided, you all were amazing!

Must do in Hanoi. A friend told me that I had to do it. I was backpacking around the world and it was a bit expensive to the average activity in Vietnam but I decided to take his advice and do it (45 USD).I am really glad that I did it because it was (by far) the best thing that I have done in the city. The experience is AMAZING, my guide Cherry was super nice and I was able to taste amazing food (and weird dishes that I always like to try as I am not a very picky eater).I would recommend everyone to do this, it is a good way to visit the city and try the Vietnamese cuisine, which is incredible.Make the effort. It is worth every penny.

Do it. I was dubious at first as thought this would be touristy and a bit lame but was totally wrong. Really recommend. The food was great and it took me to places I'd never have gone in without knowing about them and introduced me to great food. Our guide, Phoenix, was l only and chatted with us about loads of stuff and was generally great fun. It was a small group, only 5 of us, and was definitely worth the money.

Better be packing an appetite! . If you have 20 bucks and are willing to eat/walk for three hours straight, then this is the tour for you! It was a uniquely wonderful experience to eat several traditional Hanoian dishes, as well as take in the rustic charm of the old quarter. Our guide, Ms Moon, was incredibly informative and packed a great sense of humor. Would definitely return for one of the night tours just to see more of the city, and try its exquisite flavours.

Not to be missed!. This was a definite highlight in Hanoi. All of the food was so fresh and delicious, you could never pick these places on your own but you're really missing out if you don't try the incredible array of street food that Hanoi has to offer. Ms Moon was also great fun and an excellent guide, providing lots of info on the old quarter as we strolled from one restaurant to another. Be sure to bring your appetite!

Hanoi Street Food Tour. Such a great experience in Hanoi! If you are a big foodie and don't mind being a little adventurous, then I fully recommend this tour. You get the best of both worlds...traditional Hanoi food and sight seeing of the Old Quarter. We couldn't have asked for a better tour guide than CHERRY!

Great tour and great guide. We booked two places on this tour, 8 people in total. Our guide's name was Smiles. From the very start it was a great tour. She explained everything that she ordered for us, and showed us the correct way to eat that particular food. Mixing the chilli and vinegar with fish sauce first for dipping etc. really cool to be told how to do all this properly. She brought us to little places that we definitely would not have tried ourselves as they were places with all local people eating. Some places didn't physically look the best but the food was AMAZING. I would recommend the walking tour as it gives you a chance to weave around old town without the hassle of trying to figure things out for yourself. We did the tour towards the end of travelling in Vietnam for two and a half weeks. If you start your trip in Hanoi do it straight away as it will leave you ready to try and enjoy street food thoughout your trip as you'll have an idea of what things are.

Our guide was the Cherry on top!. Really enjoyed this tour. You get to try sooooo much food. Cherry, our guide, was so friendly and explained the different dishes and how to understand the menus. As well as getting to eat delicious food, it was a great introduction to Vietnamese street food and gave us the confidence to try lots of places by ourselves. Would definitely recommend doing when you first arrive in Hanoi.

Great way to see Hanoi and try food you never would have planned!. We organized a private tour for our group of 8, which included a pick up from our hotel. Our guide Pixie was wonderful, so friendly, so enthusiastic and clearly very passionate about food. This is simply the best way to see the city in a few hours and sample the best food it has on offer.

A must if you're in Hanoi. Kat was the best guide as we weaved our way through Hanoi by night, tasting a range of street food dishes. So glad I booked this on my first night in Hanoi - it's made everything less daunting and much more accessible. Food was amazing and so was the company (about 6 others - mix of solo travelers and couples). Highly recommend. Would love it if the could have provided a map with all the places on it for me to go back to on my own.

so glad we did this tour.. Our guide was Zwee (hope it spelt correctly) and he was wonderful. Not only did he tell us about the food but also his culture and his life and family. The food was great, all out on the street except for one restaurant and that was only to show us how to make spring rolls. We had see a rick stein programme with him sitting on little stools in Hanoi eating these pancakes and we got to do the same thing. He was very mindful of our safety especially as I have a tendancy to wander and not a good thing on Hanoi streets with traffic coming at you in all directions! I think if you don't do this tour especially when you have just arrived you will be missing out

Kat is the best guide, must go with very empty stomach!. We just came back from an excellent tour with Hanoi Street Food Tour. Even with group tour they kept their number at 7-8 which allowed interaction with the guide as well as other travellers in the group. We were led by Kat who was an excellent guide, very knowledgeable, friendly and responsible and obviously loves Hanoi and Hanoi cuisine. Every single item was delicious, we feel like we have come back from a street version of degustation! We highly recommend this tour and Kat the guide :)

Must go food tour with lily and mia. My gf and i just came from this tour and we had such a blast. The food was of the highest quality and the tour guides lily and mia were very friendly and had great English skills. It was like going around hanoi with new local friends. Would highly recommend it! And don't bother to eat before this tour, make a lot of space for the awesome food!

Hanoi street food tour.. Our guide "Pixie" was great very attentive and really went out of her way to make sure everyone would be accommodated food wise. At the end of the tour Pixie even made a list of all the foods eaten which was great. Well done Pixie.

MUST DO!. Cherry was our private tour guide. She was fantastic! She took us to places we would not have gone on our own. We loved all the dishes but our favorites were crab soup and egg coffee/egg chocolate. It was a lot of food to consume so go hungry! Cherry taught us about the Vietnamese customs of eating and how and where locals eat. We even had the opportunity to help in the rice noodle making :)Definitely the highlight of our stay in Hanoi!

One of the best experiences we had in Viet. Even though food tours, or any tours at all, aren't my favorite thing to do when traveling- this one was especially great. The tour was fun, the food was delicious. The credit for this awesome experience surely goes to the great tour guide we got, called Pixie. If you're considering taking a tour here, make sure she's your guide!

Pixie was Terrific!. As we had our Halong Bay tour cancelled because of the typhoon, we found ourselves with unplanned for free time in Hanoi. We booked the evening street food tour, and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip! PIXIE, our guide, led us to different culinary landmarks in the Old Quarter, some of which we would never could have known about. With very good English, she explained the origins of the dishes, demonstrated how they should be eaten, and gave us much insight to the lives local Vietnamese. We kept revisiting these places on the following days in the city. In Hanoi, this is a MUST tour.
Scooter food tour. Great tour. Lily & Mia were great guides. Lots of different food choices and goes outside of the main tourist areas. Highly recommend.

Great Day in Hanoi . We had a day to spend in Hanoi and this was the perfect way to both see the city and experience its cuisine! Great variety of tasty street food. Lili and Mia were great guides and our family (2 adults plus 3 kids aged 14,12 and 10) truly loved the experience! Highly recommend this 3 hour street food tour on scooter/ motorbike!

Best food we had on our trip. We went on the 29th of July 2015It was by far the best places we had eaten in Hanoi. We were actually thinking about taking it twice. We kept comparing everything else we ate to it. We had Moon and Butterfly as guides. They were very engaging and flexible. If you had any food in particular you couldn't eat they would substitute it for something else. But as we were warned by another person be careful not to fill up at the first place. I recommend not eating breakfast as you stop at many places and you get a lot of food. One of the best meals was the grilled pork patty seasoned with honey. No where else was it as good. Hope this helps.

Amazing food tour. This was a fantastic experience. It gave us the opportunity to sample many different dishes from Crab Soup to dry Pho with chicken. It was made better thanks to the tour guide Hien aka Cherry who had strong knowledge and was very pleasant company. So much food though, don't eat much breakfast before you go ! I think I had some of the best food of my trip today in places I would have walked by that are not in guide books or on TripAdvisor.

Choose Mia and Lily! Highlight to the entire Hanoi Trip!. Me and my travelling buddy had a night to spare on our last day in Hanoi. In the morning we contacted the agency through email and everything was set up by our pickup time of 6pm. We chose the scooter food tour because we were feeling a little adventurous. Lily and Mia, our tour guides, picked us up and gave us a thorough safety overview of how to ride on the scooters. It was definitely scary at first, but the guides definitely made us feel comfortable and safe. We proceeded to the agency where everything was paid and sorted. We then proceeded to about 6-7 locations sampling the different foods from different neighborhoods and vendors. We also got a quick tour of Hanoi. If you are up for a little challenge, definitely choose the scooter tour. Walking or scooter, definitely choose Mia and Lily as they were great guides and gave us a great insight as to the daily life of Hanoi.

Even in the rain this is a great evening . Kat was our guide. Can't fault her, really good food and local/ national knowledge. Also her English was excellent and she got us all chatting straight away. We just turned up and got the last space but we were just lucky so I'd suggest booking. We went to nine different places altogether. The last two were beer and coffee/dessert two! So there was plenty to eat. I'm a veggie and this wasn't a problem at all. It was really good to learn about all the dishes and how they were made. The tour is set up for the majority of tourists so if you want bespoke (snakes, spiders,etc) you'll need to book.We had a really good time with great company. Six others we hadn't met. If you want to go privately you can its $10 more and you can choose the time. $20 each was very well spent.

Excellent experience!. This was an excellent introduction to Hanoi city and to Vietnamese cuisine. Our guide (Ms. Moon) was very friendly and she explained many interesting things to us in a really enjoyable way. We can definitely recommend this tour to any person visiting Hanoi.

Delicious food. I saw all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor and booked a lunch time tour and I'm so glad I did! The food was delicious and we went to places that I would never have known existed. "Cherry" was our tour guide who gave us some great local knowledge and was a lot of fun! The coffee was probably the best part at the end

Great Food and a Great Guide...She Was Money!. A great way to explore and eat your way through the streets of the Old Quarter in Hanoi at night. The only problem we had, which was not our guide's fault, was that we had booked this tour online and when we arrived at the location it appeared as if they had forgot about us. We were told to arrive at 5:30 pm and instead of starting the tour right away we sat for 15 minutes while we waited for our guide to show up. Once the tour got underway we had a great time and ate so much food. We told our guide that we would be up for eating almost everything and she made sure we tried a lot of different foods including some green ice cream that was made of young rice!

The perfect start to our trip around Vietnam. Our guide was the lovely Nga.I was initially worried that paying the full $25 for my 9 year old son would not be worth it, but the food was wonderful and he enjoyed it just as much as we did and ate everything. Having just arrived, we would never have tried most of these things and would have missed out. Nga was really informative about the food as well as giving us an insight into Hanoi and Vietnamese life. We all had a perfect evening.

Good tour. If you don't have much time to try a variety of local food in Hanoi, this tour is just for you. I did food tour in HCMC before and decided to do it again in Hanoi. I do love the dessert here especially the sweet black rice porridge with coconut milk and natural yogurt and the egg coffee is very interesting. The staff were very friendly and took good care of everyone.

Street food galore. Amazin!!One of the best food tours around, "smile" was the name of our host and she certainly lived up to her name!!! Great places off the bested track with bizzare and wonderful food

Fun, delicious, informative and all round awesome!. For a great way to explore the streets of the Old Quarter whilst learning about Hanoi local life, and eating amazing food along the way look no where else but here! Hanoi Street Food Tours caters to the full spectrum of tourists. In our group of 8 people we had a family with two young girls, a married couple, a back packer ... And me... The solo business traveller with limited exploration time. Our guide, Nga (her nickname is Money), was informative and intuitive. She took us places that of course were part of the plan... But also sensed we wouldn't mind a beer stop at Beer Alley. She catered to the small children and although had the trip planned was flexible and accommodating. We tried a whole range of street food - and visited places you wouldn't even think of stopping into - but every single time we were pleased to have ventured into a back room, or even someone's personal kitchen!!! The food was safe and everywhere was clean.Nga was a real breath of fresh air... And did such a great job that I booked a private tour for 12 of my colleagues tonight with the tour company.Would recommend to all. Thanks for a great experience!!
Great value for money . Had an amazing food tour with our guide 'Moon'. She was very knowledgeable and stuffed us with so much food and drink. Best way to explore street food in Hanoi

Great fun, lovely guide.. We did the lunchtime tour starting at 1100h and very quickly regretted having breakfast!We dived into funny looking places we would never have normally dreamed of going into and eat and drank many different but delicious snacks and dishes.Our guide was Money who was very knowledgeable and good fun, it was a really good tour and we were all very glad we did it. Its a great introduction to local Vietnamese food, and fun to walk around the Old Quarter with someone who knows the history and knows the area.

Great experience even better guide.. we were a loose end after out ha Long trip was cancelled so we booked in a lunch time for and evening tour. Our tour Guide as Aimie. What a lovely, bright, knowledgeable young lady. Nothing was to much to ask. We had a great time and eat too much. Thanks Amie.

Money Shot. This is not a review. This is a Love letter and it is addressed to Ha Vu (aka Money).Thank you Money for such a lovely day.My mother and I had 1 day in Hanoi and after a morning strolling on our own through the beautiful streets of Hanoi's Old Quarter we met Money and that changed our day. The tour is on my top 10 of travelExperiences but better than the tour itself was getting to meet Money and through her have a real taste of Hanoi's food and culture.Just do it you'll see what I mean!We loved it so much that despite the full stomachs we signed straight to do the Motorcycle Food tour with Money. Again... Beautiful and well worth it!Thank you money for sharing Life&Food with my mother and I :)

Fantastic Tour - A must do in Hanoi!. Our tour guide Lotus was fantastic - she showed us many great foods and shared what life was like for a local in Hanoi. If you are going to do anything whilst in Hanoi, this is it.

Excellent introduction to Hanoi and Vietnamese food. The wife and I turned up fresh off the plane with no prior booking. Thankfully someone else had cancelled earlier in the evening and Pixie become our street food guide for the night.Having never visited the country before, we had little prior knowledge or expectation, but have been overly impressed with the wonderful food on offer, which we simply would never have discovered without Pixie's help. The restaurants are often very narrow buildings, would simply blend into the bustling crowded streets.I can't recommend enough the benefit this tour would bring to anyone staying here for the first time. It has provided us with a great introduction to the old quarter and a good understanding of the cuisine (same same, but different!).Thanks for all your help Pixie. You made the tour truely special.

Great food tour and guide. We did three different food tours in 3 different cities and this was the best. "Mango" was an awesome guide - it was fun to practice French with her too! I also liked how she did cultural interludes as there was so much delicious food. I felt like throwing up the white flag at the end - so full.

Fun, local, easy - do it at the start. Our guide Phoenix was cheeky, funny and very knowledgable. We did the night tour which was a great way to get to know the otherwise overwhelming old quarter. The food could perhaps have been a little more adventurous but it was great to get to know Vietnamese classics.

Great Fun and Delicious Street Food. I booked the tour one week in advance by email and I wasn't sure if my booking was confirmed, but on the day, just as Mr Nguyen had promised, they picked me up from my hotel on the confirmed date and time. My guide was Thutrangdang and she was very experienced in delivering the tour. She knew all the streets and best places to eat and drink. We ate so much food and it was all street food and delicious. The food was great and all clean and interesting. I was expecting to see more local traditional delicacies like snake, scorpions etc but it was more street food maybe like a proper meal that you would eat at home in Vietnam. We had about 8 different types of dishes from 8 different places including some beers and also rice wine. They also took us off the tourist trail which was even more interesting away from tourist which made the tour feel all the more authentic. I think what would be better would be to take you more off the beaten path as most of the street food places were in the tourist areas so it still didn't feel like it had the fully authenticity of the the real street food. But overall it was excellent and if you don't have much time in Hanoi then this would be the best choice. I would highly recommend this tour.

Amazing tour!. What an amazing tour! Our guide Pixie took us around Old Quarter's best street food spots and we got to try so many different kind of traditional foods. We tried several dishes and I loved all of them so these guys really seem to know all the best spots. I did my tour on the first day in Hanoi and would recommend other people do it in the beginning of their stay in Vietnam as you will get so many tips and advices where to go and what to eat. We were so well looked after through the entire tour, it was a hot day so Pixie even stopped and bought us traditional ice creams to "cool down" while walking to the next stop. We could suggest her if there was specific dishes that we wanted to try and she made sure that we got them. In the end of the tour she wrote down where we had been, the names of the dishes we had tried and also recommendations for other places that are worth trying, she was such a lovely girl!P.S Don't eat before the tour as you will get to eat soooo much during the tour and definitely won't leave to your hotel hungry!

Excellent way to scratch the surface. We had a great time on our food tour with our guide Amy. We visited 7 or 8 different places - some sat inside and some outside on the street. The guides spoke good English and were also really good when it came to allergies - some in the group having nut and fish allergies and there were no problems catering to those people. Food ranged from pork noodles, to fried pastries, to dried beef and squid and ice cream too! Great value and a great way to get inside places you may otherwise walk past.

Great Intro to the Street Food Scene. We arrived in Hanoi and this was the first thing we did. We were picked up on Motor bikes at our hotel and began the tour at their office with a 1 hour cyclo tour of the Old Quarter . It was really great seeing an overview of the area. When we finished the cyclo tour we were introduced to our guide Mango. She was amazing. The first thing she taught us was how to cross the crazy streets of Hanoi. At first it was a bit scary but as the night went on we got a hang of it. We had such a great time with Mango, getting to know her and learning about all the different kinds of street foods. Things that we may not have tried and didn't know about them. In fact Mango was so awesome she wrote down a list of everything we ate and the address for us to go back during our stay in Hanoi. All of the food we tried was delicious and very safe. I would highly recommend this tour and if you can get Mango as your guide you're very lucky. She's a lovely person and a great tour guide. As we left we gave Mango a Thank you gift from our home town Raleigh NC. She really loved it.

Must-Do in Hanoi. We were picked up at the hotel and started our tour from their office. The Food we got served was really delicious and all of us enjoyed it. Our Tour Guide Phoenix was extremely helpful, Kind and friendly. She explained us a lot about the different dishes and Vietnam in general. All in all we had an awesome experience and would highly reccomend this Tour!

More than just food, an unforgettable taste of the Vietnamese life. Thahn gave us a true taste of life in Hanoi. We went to a number of locally famous restaurants that we would have never been able to find by ourselves. In addition to tasting a number of excellent dishes, Thahn also answered all of our questions on Vietnam culture and lifestyle.I would highly recommend this tour to everyone visiting Hanoi that wants to learn more about Vietnamese cuisine and lifestyle.Five stars!

Amazing and beautiful variety of street food. My husband and I had Miss Moon to ourselves as we spent 3 hours walking and eating our way around the most superb, delicious and interesting bowls of Hanoi street food. Miss Moon is such a happy, funny, informative lovely lady. The best guide we could have hoped for. We enjoyed the whole time, lots of laughs, 'sticky-rice' crossing the roads (hilarious way to keep us together). Highly recommend adding this to your Vietnam visit as you will taste beautiful clear flavours of many dishes that you might otherwise miss without Miss Moon. Excellent!!

Our angels from Hanoi. My husband were on a short weekend break & chose this tour as we both enjoy trying local food wherever we go. We had some reservations about riding pillion on motorbikes as suggested by the manager who took our call, as opposed to the walking tour. The traffic in Hanoi is not for the faint-hearted!!When Lily & Mia picked us up from our hotel the next morning, we were more nervous. They're both so young & petite....how would they be able to handle the motorbikes?? But we found that our fears were totally unfounded - from the minute they helped us with our helmets, & showed us how to climb onto the bikes, and the way they confidently rode the bikes safely through the traffic, we had the confidence that we were in for a great time!! Both Lily & Mia are very knowledgeable, constantly providing background information on the places we passed by, and then bringing us to the many little food stalls or cafes for really yummy food - deepfried rolls, ban xeo, bun cha, egg coffee and many others, and explaining the types of food to us. I forget the number of places we were brought to for great food!!And then at the end, they brought us to a local healthcare centre for a 2-hour herbal bath & massage too!!We enjoyed ourselves so much with Lily & Mia that before the end of our 4-hour tour, we had booked them for another half-day tour the next day, where we were brought to the military museum and a drive past the Ho Chi Minh mausoleum which we skipped as there was a really long queue waiting. We were also brought to a huge local market, and got to ride across the old bridge. Lunch was a delicious bowl of beef pho at Pho 10, followed by delicious coconut coffee at Cong Café.We had a lovely time with Lily & Mia - both are very warm, friendly & also reliable. They were also curious to find out about our culture, without being rude, and we were happy to share with them. We will be back with family next year, and will definitely ask for Lily & Mia, our 2 Hanoi angels again!
Amazing tour. . Miss moon was the greatest person ever! She is so funny and sweet. The food was so good and this is one of the best ways to see Hanoi. Couldn't recommend more!

So so so so much food. Me and my girlfriend were shown around Hanoi by Tran (Phoenix) and we had such an amazing time. Tran new all the hot spots and listened to the types of food we wanted and hunted them down. Her English was superb and talked to us as if we were her friends rather then people who were paying her to been shown around. Would highly recommend getting Tran as your tour guide if this is possible, she seriously deserves a pay rise...Back home now and am missing Vietnamese food so badly, get me back to Hanoi and their amazing street food culture...
Great experience. Our tour guide Annie was very informative and friendly. One of my favourite activities so far in Hanoi . Best way to find quality local places to eat.

Fun food experience. The Hanoi Street food tour is a must do for anyone who is interested in trying the local cuisine but like us is a bit hesitant to try some of the street food. We tried a total of six different dishes and street food restaurants and everything was very tasty. Nothing was too out there but we would not have gone to any of the places had they not been part of the tour. Our guide 'Smile' was very friendly and knowledge about Hanoi and the dishes we tried. There is a fair bit of food to eat over three hours but it is nice to break it up by walking between the stops and getting to know the other like minded people on the tour.
Food tour. Awesome time, brilliantly lead by Miss Moon who was hilarious and very knowledgable. Fantastic food, highly recommend doing

An awesome introduction to Vietnamese Street Food!!!. My husband and I did the food tour two nights ago with Cherry. She was AMAZING.She started the tour by asking for everyone's names and food preferences. She then checked in throughout the tour to make sure things were ok. My husband and another guest said they wanted to try the Vietnamese version of Balut someday. So, Cherry found the duck eggs, had them prepared and showed my husband and the other person how to eat them. As I typed, she is amazing.We tried so much food for green papaya salad to beers and beer snacks to coffee to desserts to banh mi. By the end we all were waddling with overstuffed bellies and big smiles.This is totally worth your money and time. I highly recommend checking out Hanoi Street Food Tours. Ask for Cherry!!! You will not be disappointed!

Street food dinner tour. My tour started at 630pm, our group had 9 people from all over the globe. We checked out local delicacies and each place was unique and tasty. Our guide Annie was very helpful and explained everything very clearly. Thoroughly enjoyed it and recommed highly.

Good Experience Even for a Vegetarian!. My tour guide was named "Money". She arrived on time at my hotel and took me all around the city on her motorbike (wasn't scary at all). She gave me a lot of history, which I appreciated. She took me to her favorite small "pop and pop" spots and the food was really good. It was nice because she made sure to order all vegetarian food for me in a city where they its difficult to find... and the food was very tasty!I would recommend Money and this tour to anyone traveling to Hanoi and wants a taste of yummy Hanoian food!

Favorite part of Hanoi!!. We lucked out for our lunch tour and essentially had a private tour (since no one else signed up). Our guide, Moon, was so fun and excited about the food and places she was sharing with us. We popped from one joint to the next, and the food was made right there and ready for us within just a couple minutes. We had so much food (and drink ;) ) for a GREAT price! The only payment we made was at the tour site, so the tour itself was seamless. Moon showed us the best way to eat each dish, how they were made, and more than doubled our Vietnamese vocabulary. :) LOVED this tour and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to dive into the food scene in Hanoi!

Best decision we made in Hanoi!. My boyfriend found this company through the New York Times. It was by far the best decision we made while we were in Hanoi. We went on a private tour from 830am-230pm on our first full day in Hanoi. We made our way to the coffee shop that we were told to meet at and from there we went on a tour of the city. We started with some fish soup and ended with a coffee that had egg white in it. It was all DELICIOUS! We ate and ate and ate. Our guide was very informative and became like a tour guide of the city and the food scene. Since we had never been to Hanoi and didn't know a ton about it, he was great at educating on us about the local culture, food, etc. We each paid $135 and then our guide paid for all the food, drinks, taxis, etc. There is no way we would have had a food experience like that while we were in Hanoi without him. It is 200% worth it! We were even considering doing a 2nd tour for dinner but ended up going to Pots and Pans. Pots and Pans had high ratings and it was good but we wished we would have gone back to just do another tour with our guide. I haven't had a chance to go through all my pictures but I got some amazing shots! This should be #1 on your list to do in Hanoi.

Very scary but do it!. Did this tour at night as it was cooler. The food we ate was very traditional and we would not have tried it if we had not been on this tour. Our guide was young, very enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. Some of the eating places and food a little scary but a must do in Hanoi!

Essential Introduction to Street Food. We went on this tour after only being in Hanoi for one day and found it to be the best way to give us confidence to know where and what to eat around Hanoi. Our tour guide 'smile' was really helpful and took us to some places we would never have chosen without a guide. At first the food (and the locations) look intimidating but you just have to go for it and embrace the experience. Also a great way to talk to other travellers and get tips on places to go around Hanoi and wider Vietnam. Would highly recommend. My wife can't have dairy but there was still loads she could eat.

Perfect introduction to Hanoi Street Food. We took the 5pm Hanoi Street food tour on first day in Vietnam, as an introduction to what we would potentially want to eat over the next 2 weeks in Vietnam.We did the tour with our 8 year old daughter and 12 year old son and about 6 other people. We ended up having about 8 stops over a 3 hour period and the food was SO GOOD.....honestly some of the best things we ate on our trip. In fact, we went back to a couple of the spots we visited on the tour, which was really great because these were places that we probably would have never ventured in to on our own."Money" was our guide and she was great too! All in all it was money well spent for great food, and introduction to Hanoi street food AND an introduction Hanoi's "Old Quarter" and "French Quarter".

The best way to be introduced to Hanoi. This is a must do when in Hanoi. Amy our guide was brilliant. She took her time and explained where we were going and what we would be eating and why. She took us around and discussed the areas as well so it became not just a food tour but an introduction to Hanoi itself. We went to local places to try authentic food and to be honest I wouldn't have went there or tried these dishes on my own. Now I definitely will. The desert was a highlight. It was relaxed and the group that I arranged to go all had a great time. We did it in the evening which I would recommend as it was cooler. Go hungry as there is a lot of food to try. Overall thanks to our great guide Amy this has been the highlight of Hanoi so go try it. Great value for money

Amazing private food tour of hanoi . This was definitely a highlight of our trip to Hanoi, our guide Moon brought us to the most amazing local places that we would never have found by ourselves. I would recommend the Private tour if possible as you learn much more about the food and history of the old quarter this way. Make sure you go hungry as there is ALOT of food to eat.

Great introduction to Hanoi. We did this tour on our first day in Hanoi (also our first in Vietnam), and it was a great introduction to the street foods of Hanoi. Phoenix was an amazing guide, constantly smiling, very knowledgeable and helpful. She also sent us a list of all the dishes we had during the evening afterwards which was very helpful. If you're going to Hanoi you HAVE to take this tour!
Great tour . Our guide Smile was so friendly and helpful and we were really full after the tour :) it was good value! I'd recommend doing it in the evening when the weather is cooler!

Delicious glimpse at local cuisine . Our guide Annie did a wonderful job taking us around the Old Quarter while filling us to the brim with food. We were glad we went on this tour, as we tried foods and ate at places we normally would not have considered, but Annie knew to be reputable and tasty. Highly recommend as an Intro to Vietnamese Cuisine.

Something for the adventurous and for the picky. Lived up to the hype. Our guide Pixie was incredibly helpful and accommodating. The street food in Hanoi can be very intimidating and this was perfect to help break the ice. We booked ahead, but they mean it when they say just show up and pay beforehand (3% charge for paying with Credit Card). We went to many places I would not have gone on my own and Pixie's explanations were always helpful. Its more than a food tour its a cultural tour. As many have said go hungry, really hungry, and pace yourself (it is truly a 3 hour tour). A few in our tour were stuffed with in one hour and had to pass on some very lovely dishes. Also there isn't a bathroom until the last stop (good to know in advance). Pixie was able to accommodate a no pork request at some, but not all restaurants (don't worry you won't go hungry). I can't recommend it enough.

Great idea to begin a trip in Hanoi . Getting a food tour with Hanoi Food Tour isn't only the best way to discover the culture of food tour in Hanoi but it is also a great way to discover the city.We booked a private 3 hours tour with the lovely and very nice guide : Nga (surname : Money (?)) and she took us to places where we would never go if she wasn't there with us.We discovered all kind of food like Bun Cha (noodle with pork), Banh Cuon (rice pancake), Banh Trang (mixed rice paper), Banh My etc...While we walked, she explained the history of each streets and gave plenty of explanation for each meal that we tasted like how they are made, when do people eat it etc...Beware not to eat before doing the tour! 10 meals are waiting for you!We booked this tour at the first day of our roadtrip in Vietnam and we know many specialities of the street food which are sold at each corner of the streets of Hanoi.

Absolute MUST DO in Hanoi!. This was 3 of the best hours spent in Hanoi and maybe even Vietnam. The food tour, which we recommend doing on night 1 in Hanoi, introduced us to the food culture of the city, the old quarter and some friendly and hospitable Vietnamese people. Our guide, Phoung (Phoenix), was a delight to be around and should be requested if possible. She was adaptable to our preferences, without being too conservative, and took us to some of the city's best and most popular (among locals) spots. Phoenix even followed up with an email after the tour recommending further places which we had not visited during the tour, detailing the name of each place, the location and the type of food. At $30 per person (private 2 person tour), this is an activity not to be missed!

The Best!. Our guide Smile was so sweet and helpful!It's a ton of food, so don't eat lunch before hand.And everything they fed us was more out of the way so we wouldn't find it on our own. But even though it was out of the way, things were clean and we knew that we were not going to get sick. Definitely a must do, especially towards the beginning of your time in Hanoi, so then you can know the food to have while here.

Fun, fascinating and tasty. We took a private tour with the lovely pixie. The tour is very informative, and you go to places you would never find on your own. Pixie gave us lots of advice, and showed us all sorts of local street food, including some only the local buy regularly. You eat SO much food, I wasn't hungry for breakfast the next day. Some days later we even went back to some of the places. Make sure you do this tour as early as you can in Hanoi, as it will make you feel much more comfortable in the following nights.

A great way to start your Hanoi visit. A great way to get the feel of Hanoi, through its street food that is literally on a street level (everybody sits on tiny stools on the sidewalk, the best view to watch the world pass by).Not only will you taste the best foods in this city, you will also experience the hustle and bustle of the old quarters. It is a walking tour and as with any walking done in Hanoi, it is an adventure just to cross the street.Despite the 30 minute delay even when we booked a private tour in advance (hence the 4 point rating), it was an excellent experience. Our tour guide Pixie was the best. Knowledgeable and attentive to our every need.The tour is a 3 hour affair stopping at about 8 food stalls, enough to sample all the typical Hanoi dishes. Wear comfy shoes and stretchy pants to make room for all the eating. The highlight was traditional egg coffee to finish the evening.Do book straight to the address in this posting to avoid disappointments.

Great way to learn more about Hanoi. We had 'Money' take us on our tour. She was fabulous and really explained so many of the food details and city details you would not pick up without a tour. She took her time at each place and was really helpful with my vegan daughter. Cannot rate this night highly enough

Pleasant way to spend an evening. I have taken many food tours and this one was great value and very entertaining. It was just myself and two mates and we had a good laugh along with some great food with our young guide.

Fantastic!. This is an splendid way of trying the local cuisine and experience the street food culture in Hanoi. As Norwegians (two adults and two youngsters) we were a bit anxious about the hygiene, but it was nothing to worry about. Our guide Money (real name Nga) guided us to safe places with an amazing food. In combination with very small chairs, chop sticks and street activity this was a memory for life. For those who have never tried a full sett of street food, contact Hanoi Street Food and you will get a new view of food colture (and if you get Money as a guide I can guarantee that you will have a great evening).If you are short of time in Hanoi, book the combined Cyclo and food tour. Cyclo is a good way to see the Old Quarter.

Lovely guide. We arrived and spent two nights wandering the streets of Hanoi with nervous interpretation. After the street food tour we feel like we understand the place so much better.Amy, our guide, was wonderful throughout. She was telling us what things were as we walked past vendors, what we should and should note eat and in total taking us to around 8 different places.To book we just turned up 15 minutes before the tour was due to start and we had a group of 6 in total which was ideal.We tried various noodle dishes, desserts, drinks and a few surprises I won't mention in the review so as to not spoil it for you when you visit. Overall our guide was very helpful, friendly and spoke great English. She explained Vietnamese culture, cuisine and gave lots of useful information.

Thank you phoenix:). Very good food, very surprising places and a great way to have a first walk through the city and chat with other travellers. Phoenix was the sweetest and most friendly guide. Thank you for leading us through the motorcyclejungle and explaining all the dishes! Given the low street food prices the tour is slightly overpriced but you couldn't find all the places without a good guide so it may be worth it.

Amazing. amazing experience, great to get insight into culture and try lots of great foods at places we would normally not have went into. Our tour guide pixie was fantastic, very nice, happy and honest which made it so enjoyable. Highly recommend

The best and delicious introduction to Hanoi. I highly recommend this tour if you aren’t familiar with all the great food Hanoi has to offer.If you are lucky, you’ll get Nga (aka Money) as your tour guide. She is an absolute gem and we wouldn’t have had such a great experience in Hanoi unless we met her. We took the food tour as soon as we landed in Hanoi so that we would know what to eat for the rest of our trip. Thank goodness Nga showed us the ropes and kept us (and our tummies) very happy.

Hanoi street food tour. We loved the street food tour done through Kim's tours. Our tour guide Annie was a delight, fun, knowledgeable with the best English. We turned up a few minutes to tour times and was allocated a group only 6 per group makes for a good group size. We had a fabulous group which added to the expereince. Best way to learn about the food and to get a real sense of the food culture in the old quarter. Highly recommend the tour and Annie our guide.

Delicious street food (loooads of it) at local spots!!. The whole tour was amazing, from very start being welcomed by Smile. We went to about 10 different spots and everywhere you get pretty much a full meal, she fully explains all the ingredients, how local ppl eat, names, translations and while walking around town also a bit of history about certain spots and whatever you ask about Vietnam she can tell you a lot. All the spots were very local street food places and everything was sooo tasty and big! It alo includes water, local beer at one of the last spots and a special local coffee and rice wine tasting. All for $20, tour lasts about 3 hours which gives yous plenty of time in each place. Absolutely recommend, you will not taste amazing food but learn soo much about this fantastic culture!

The soul of Hanoi. We have just returned from a private tour with Lotus, who was professional, interesting, funny and charming. She took us to places we would never have found without her, and places we would never have been confident enough to eat at. Down little alleyways, to street carts, up stairs in tiny little restaurants full of locals, we ate the most beautiful food we've had anywhere in Vietnam. We highly recommend this tour, it is great value for money and allows you to explore the true soul of Hanoi - the street food!

Brilliant food adventure. Phoenix was our tour guide and she took us on a delightful tour of the old quarter to experience the tastes of Vietnam. We had such a great night with our group of eight and ate so much that we could not fit another thing in. It was the perfect way to start out time in Hanoi because it gave us the courage to venture to gems that we would not have otherwise eaten at. From bim cha to bahn mi we tried a large selection of dishes and finished with Vietnamese coffee, rice wine and beer! Highly recommend this tour.

A great tour to show some of the local foods.. We did this tour on our first night in Hanoi. I have a interest in Vietnamese food and know a little about it. However I learnt so much on the night, Some foods I had never heard of which tasted yummy. We had a group of 8 people which was perfect. Our tour guide Phoenix was fantastic! (She even remembered all 8 of our names!) she was very informative about the foods, the ingredients. Phoenix also looked after us very well when walking the streets. STICKY RICE!!!! We were recommended this tour from friends and I would recommend it also

Miss Moon was fantastic. We booked this tour as we had limited time on Hanoi and wanted to experience the old quarter and street food. Miss Moon took us on a private tour with lots of sensational food and information about Hanoi. It was a chance to see some out of the way places and experience Vietnamese cooking at its best. Thank you so much it was excellent. A tip though, don't eat much before going as there is plenty of food and drink

Fantastic introduction to Hanoi food with private night tour. We had Nga for a private night tour on 1 July. We arranged this because we arrived the very same evening and thought we need to know the local food from Day 1. We were not disappointed as Nga was an excellent guide with very good English. I lost count of how many dishes she let us try but they are all very good, especially Bun Cha (which we revisited twice!). And we are extremely lucky to have Nga as our guide and she is very sweet and thoughtful. She wrote down all the restaurants' addresses for us and also recommend some other places for different dishes. She also answers all the questions. If you are a foodie or interested in knowing more about Vietnamese cuisine, this is a very good start.

Excellent Introduction to Hanoi's Street Food.. An excellent introduction to Hanoi's street food for the uninitiated and the guide, Miss Nga, was friendly, knowledgeable, and spoke extremely good English. During the tour we ate a wide variety of savoury and sweet dishes, plus coffee and lemon tea. It was very filling and great value for money. Highly recommended.

The Best Thing We Did in Hanoi. We loved our street food tour. Because I wanted vegetarian food (though everyone else in our group ate everything) we booked a private tour. At $25/person for four people it seemed worth it. Our guide was Cherry and she was wonderful. She showed us great places to eat, answered our questions, and generally provided us with a great experience. We spent about four hours on our tour and tried more dishes than we could count from Bun Cha, to green papaya salad, savory pancakes, kumquat green tea, a selection of fried foods, Bia Hoi, Vietnamese Coffee (with the choice of egg coffee), a fruit and condense milk dessert, Banh Mi...and I am sure others I am forgetting. This allowed us to both find great places to get old favorites and learn about some foods which we were previously unfamiliar with. In addition, Cherry was extremely helpful in facilitating vegetarian options for me while allowing everyone else to eat the meat options. If you like food and want to explore the Old Quarter go on this tour--but make sure to show up hungry!

Best Vietnamese food we've ever tasted!. We had an amazing time with Phoenix! It's incredibly daunting to choose from the sheer variety of food stalls that scatter the streets. She showed us the real hidden gems of... food that burst with flavor and delighted our taste buds.We also got to learn about the ingredients in the dishes, and the really cool concept of "hot" and "cold" foods.

An excellent introduction to street food in Hanoi. We did this tour on our first night in Hanoi. Nguyet (or "Cake") as she is affectionately known, was a delightful and knowledgable tour guide for our family group of 5. We enjoyed a great range of savoury and sweet dishes as well as a beer stop and finished with delicious egg coffee. We informed Cake at the beginning of the tour that my daughter is unable to eat a number of ingredients. Cake ensured that she was able to eat something at every stop, whether the same as ours or adapted to her requirements.Doing this tour early gave us great confidence to explore and find our own food during the rest of our stay.We highly recommend this comprehensive tour. Just make sure you don't eat beforehand - there is an enormous amount of food!
Yum. Great food tour, lots of amazing tastes and a couple of bits of history at the same time. DON'T eat before doing this tour or you'll be too full to enjoy everything.

Great food and great guide. We enjoyed the tour with Johnny. Enjoyable and the food was fresh, delicious and authentic. Very hot weather so chose the evening, still hot but the many cooler places were appreciated. Great company of a young American couple. All good. Highly recommend.

Worth the money. Did the street food tour on our first night in Hanoi. Really helped orientate our selfs and find cheap, safe and delicious meals. We went back to a few of the restaurants during our four nights in Hanoi. The tour guide was lovely and spoke very good English and gave us an insight into the culture and food of Hanoi.

Hanoi street food tour- a must- tour for gourmets. Great experience! I and my friends had an unforgettable moment to explore an interesting the Old Quarter. We walked through the bustling and hustling street that make up Hanoi's Old Quarter, then we had a chance to enjoy the most tasty dishes there: from famous Pho (Rice noodle soup), Banh ran (sticky rice pancake), Banh Cuon (rolled sticky rice cake),... to Bun cha (Hanoi Style Vermicelli with Grilled Pork ). Especially, you should not miss try to Bia Tuoi (Draugh Beer) in Ta Hien. So, Do it, you won't regret it!

Fantastic. I highly recommend this food tour at the beginning of your time in Hanoi to expose you to different dishes and to find out what you like for your time in Vietnam.We had Nga, aka Money. She was excellent - friendly, accommodating & very informative. We tried 9 different dishes, so go on an empty stomach. They were diverse and delicious. The walking tour is a nice way of seeing the streets, soaking in the atmosphere & having a little break between courses. It was a bargain for the amount of food and information you get.

Must do!. Thank you to our guide Money/Nga who was so much fun as well as being informative and of course helped us to start our Vietnamese food journey with 8 delicious courses! Was also good to spend time with 2 other great couples. Will def recommend! Not sure we would have managed to be brave enough to go into places she took us, now we will seek them out with her recommendations, thank you Money xx
Seven course walking tour. Seven stops, solid food, and extremely nice guide. My friend and I did the group tour (not the private one) and met a bunch of great people.

Street food tour. We had the delightful Miss Moon for our tour. She was very knowledgable and also funny with an obvious genuine love for her job. The food was fantastic and heaps of it so go with an empty stomach! Would highly recommend this tour

Hanoi Street Food Tour - highly recommended!. Hanoi Street Food Tour - highly recommended!Vietnam is known for its variety of street kitchen and can sometimes be quite a jungle - which is the reason why the street food tour offers a great overview of the wonderful food and locations where you would never visit by yourself. More over there is a big difference between North and South Vietnamese food and our guide was good in telling us the difference while guiding us through the narrow and bustling streets.Guide:Our guide was great in telling us about the Vietnamese culture, the diversity of the Vietnamese food and showing us the best of the Old Quarter.Food:Alltogether we visited 8 different food stands and were so delicious, authentic and local. The dishes banh xeo, bun cha, pho to egg coffee were all so tasty and just a great treat. We can highly recommend this tour and had a really eye opener to Vietnamese food.

Awesome tour to introduce you to the Old Quarter. Annie guided us on an culinary experience and we had an amazing time!! It was a great way to introduce ourselves to "what to eat" and "where to eat" as it can be a little overwhelming when you arrive. Thanks Annie!

Mango is my Pho. Mango guided us on an awesome tour from start to finish. There is nothing I can add to other reviews besides consider the weather. While I am not one of those idiots that gives bad rating because of weather, the monsoon rain definitely put a damper on an otherwise tremendous tour.

Delicious and fun!. My friends and I booked the moterbike street food tour for the first night we arrived in Hanoi. Our primary guide was Money and she and her three friends drove us through the city visiting various hole-in-the-wall restaurants. The food throughout the tour was really tasty and was different than the Vietnamese food available in the U.S.! The amount of good on the tour waslentoful and we were all stuffed by the end. The best part of the tour was riding on the motorbike and I felt completely safe the entire time. This really is the best way to experience Hanoi and get the local experience!

Very tasty tour!. This was such a great way to try all the tasty street foods that Hanoi has to offer, all the while knowing you aren't going to regret it later. Our guide Nga aka Money, was very upbeat and very knowledgeable. We were not only taught a bit about the history of the food, but we were also taught a bit about the city as well while we were walking throughout town! We ate a lot of food with a good amount of variety between both savory and sweet too, so make sure to come with an appetite!

Excellent way to sample street food and see the old district of Hanoi. I thoroughly enjoyed this tour; the guide was excellent ,a lot of walking so you need to be able bodied.A good selection of food including noodles,spring rolls, beer, desert,egg coffee to name a few.I would recommend this tour to first timers in Hanoi.

Incredible!. A group of five went on this tour with Cherry (Hiem) and it was fantastic. She took us to places that she knew well that specialised in certain dishes. If we mentioned that we wanted to try something she would find somewhere that had what we wanted and we would get that as well as all of the other things that she had planned for us. Vietnamese food is incredible and we ate so much without feeling bloated or ill and none of us got sick. Cherry was so enthusiastic and said that she really enjoyed that we got so involved and were very exited. This was a really great price as well for all of the food that we ate. I would recommend this to anyone as Cherry ensured that anyone with allergies were catered to.

Fantastic overview of Hanoi's wonderful cuisine. I had a personal tour with Ms Moon on a recent visit to Hanoi and it was an immensely worthwhile experience. I'd already spent a few days in the city and thought I'd made a reasonable fist and trying out the much-ballyhooed local street food, however in reality I'd barely even scratched the surface. Ms Moon ensured i got a real flavour (no pun intended) of what Hanoi really has to offer in the culinary department.First piece of advice, go on an empty stomach, you will be fed exceptionally well and will not be left wanting! I tried a wide variety of 12 separate dishes and bites, clearly covering a good spectrum of Hanoi street food. I won't go into detail about the various dishes but I genuinely enjoyed all of them. (Disclaimer: I'm not a remotely fussy eater) The tour was also a great way to wonder around the Old Quarter and see various nooks and crannies you'd never venture into otherwise. Ms Moon was an absolute delight and very pleasurable company indeed. A highly recommended experience all round!

Skip breakfast, and dinner!. I had a great experience with Moon as my guide, as it was low season it was just me on the group tour. It is so helpful to have a language and cultural interpreter to tell you what makes the food special, the proper way to eat it and to interact and say thanks to the chefs!! You can sign up last minute. The egg coffee in particular is a treat and the banh my had curry butter which was an intriguing interpretation. Delish.

Great way to the awesome food of Hanoi. Cherry was our guide for the Hanoi nightlife and street food tour, she was fantastic! Very helpful and informative and you can tell she genuinely enjoys her job and showing people the best of Hanoi's glorious food. We had everything from Bun cha soup to draught beer, hanoi coffee and more! I would highly recommend this tour if you are short on time in Hanoi. Be prepared to do a fair bit of walking however it is all part of the experience :)

Scooter city plus Street food tour . Hien or Cherry as she is known was my guide for the day. The weather was beyond hot but I still had lots of fun. The pick.up at the hotel was on time and we visited the usual as well as off the grid places. Had many food stops along the way and so much so that I had to skip dinner that night. Good value and informative.. Would do it again

Awesome fun eating our way through Hanoi. We went on this tour as a last minute booking, and it was one of the best decisions we made. The office was easy to find on the corner of a largish intersection. Our guide Lotus was great, yelling out 'sticky rice' when we all had to cross the streets of Hanoi (which os an adventure itself!). We had around 10 dishes ranging from hot, cold, sweet and savoury. She even made us her favourite fruit dessert with rice, fruit, condensed milk and more! All the dishes were delicious! And she even wrote them out for us so we could revisit as well as recommending her favourite pho shop - where i bumped into her the next evening! This tour is alot of fun and good value of money! Highly recommended!

Informative and fun food tour. Walking through the streets of Hanoi tasting local food was one of the highlights of our visit to this city. The starting location was very easy to find and our guide was friendly, fun and informative. But be warned .... you get ALOT of food!

Great Food!. I had Phoenix as our guide and she was awesome. She did a great job of explaining all of the food and was very knowledgable. The only thing I would change was to give more of a narrative about the area. She was great in explaining the food and restaurants but didn't mention any do the sights we were walking by. I included the water puppet show at the end, it was great! Not like any show I've seen before. Would highly recommend both components!!

Great food, fun tour. My husband and I did a private tour with Ms. Moon and it was fantastic (despite 100 degree weather with 100% humidity!). We ate some of the best food we had throughout our 10 days in Vietnam, all of which was more interesting and diverse than the standard dishes you find in big restaurants. I highly recommend this as a way to discover the tastes and sights of the Old Quarter. Come hungry, you will have plenty to eat!

Awesome food tour. Fantastic way to explore food in Hanoi and try things you mightn't otherwise know how to order. Our guide was Nga (also known as "Money") - she was so great and explained a lot about Hanoi and culture in general as well as food. Don't let any rain scare you away either. Must do if you want to learn to eat here.

Delicious and fun. We wanted to try the Hanoi street food which we heard was very good but didn't have the courage. We had the lovely Hien (Cherry) as our tour guide. She showed us eight places, where we ate with locals and all had delicious food.Cherry didn't lose her spirit and energy even when a thunderstorm broke out. She provided us with ponchos and the tour continued with all its fun. We had better food with this tour than everywhere else actually, including the expensive restaurants and a cruise. And it was the only evening in Vietnam which neither of us had a stomach problem :)Highly recommended. Thanks Cherry!

Wonderful tour guide. Such a friendly tour guide, we were in a group of 4 and turned up 10 mins before having not booked and they happily took us along. Would definitely recommend as the food was great (easy on the stomach ) and although very full after was a great way to see the old town! Thank you Ms moon!!

An excellent way to get to know the local food. We got to try a lot of food we would never have dared to try without a guide. Our group of 4 friends booked a private tour to try the street food in hanoi. Our guide Hien (cherry) was lovely and provided a lot of information about the food we ate. She created a nice atmosphere and made it feel like walking around with a friend. 10/10, would do again

Excellent introduction to Vietnam. We were recommended to start our trip with a street food tour in Hanoi as an introduction to the great foods. We were not disappointed, our guide Tu was fabulous, he showed us around the back streets, old quarter and new quarter in Hanoi, stopping off along the way to try different dishes and drinks. He was so informative and helpful and sent us an email after with recommendations of restaurants and places of interest to visit through the country during our trip. It was a great few hours and good fun along the way.

A must do!. travelling solo I would probably not been adventurous enough to go into these small unassuming but top quality places! They are located down alleyways and small hidden upstairs locations. If you are in Hanoi and if you love fine food, take this street food tour.Thank you Miss Money for an enjoyable evening. This is w must do in Hanoi.

Great tour!. Great way to experience some of the best street food Hanoi has to offer. Our energetic tour guide Cherry took us to 8 different stops and explained everything really well. We just came back from a really nice night and met some really nice people. Great value for money as well. Absolute must do when in Hanoi.

Good introduction to Street food in Hanoi. We did this tour on our second day in Hanoi. Meeting place to pay for tour was easy to find and staff very friendly. We had a small group 7 people which was good size and our guide was Money and she was training Mango (who moved to Hanoi to study French at University).Money was very informative and gave us inside into life in Hanoi and made us laugh along the way. At one stage it started to sprinkle with rain and offered us a poncho and we all declined and next minute it poured .... Yes we had a poncho on which was purchased by Money. Actually the rain made it even more enjoyable.We visited a total of 8 places eating BBQ pork noodle, rolled rice pancake, fried spring rolls, prawn cakes, lemon tea (like the locals have as they gather to chat on side of streets), pillow cake, traditional baguette, sweetened dessert x 2, egg coffee (that was amazing so creamy), rice wine (that was like hot on the back of the throat as it went down).They also gave you the names of the places you visit so you can go back which we did go back for a baguette which was so cheap $1.25 Australian and was fresh. Also went to the restaurant that served the BBQ pork noodle dish but tried something different which was also so cheap.Gave you confidence to eat like the locals.It was fun and definitely a great experience.

Beware if you are a vegetarian. OK, it is difficult to get decent vegetarian in Hanoi if you can't speak the language. But if you have an English speaking guide you would expect they would act as an interpreter and advocate for you with vendors. And most dishes were modified for my diet. However once I was told, "It contains Vietnamese sausage, just don't eat that."Hmmm. My partner was able to taste all dishes and he commented it was modest at best. So many opportunities were missed on this tour: no market, no funky Cafe Pho Co, very little local information and history. Customers on the tour were promised a menu of all the food we ate. We got it too: it was hand written on one sheet of paper and we were told to take a photo. Maybe a full menu and a map of our tour would have been better. Lovely, lovely guide but this mob could learn so much from the people who run "The Great Taste of Hoi An." That was a five star experience where the food was the star. This was a walk around the streets of Hanoi with food thrown in. Not impressed at all.

Good food interesting commentary and great value. Booked on the 6.30pm tour and had the very friendly Hiem (cherry) as our guide. The food was great and never stopped coming and the detail from Hiem made the tour. Great group from all over the globe to share it with.Thanks guys love your work

Great food and drink experience. Walked into the shop at 1645 and booked the 1700 tour, nice and easy. Annie the tour guide was great, and made sure I had any of my dietary requirements at each stop. Good to do at the start of your time in Hanoi so you have some food ideas for the rest of your stay. Good selection of local foods and drinks.

Great Way to Experience the Culture!. We've been in Hanoi for a few days and while we want to try street food, it's tough to know what to order/how to order. That's why this is so great. For 20 bucks you get stuffed on the best food I've had in SE Asia. Your guide brings you to small hole in the wall spots you would never walk in as a tourist. We had a lovely guide named Lotus who is a 21 year old Hanoi native. Not only did she explain the food and how to eat it, but she dived deep into the Vietnamese culture and what it's like to grow up and live in Hanoi.

Simply awesome. You have to do this!!. Firstly make sure you book with , http://www.hanoistreetfoodtour.com. There are a few places around who try and fake they are them. There address is on the website, simply turn up and book your tickets. They have tours at 11am, 5pm and 6:30pm. Money (the English nickname for our guide) was amazing. She spoke great English. Explained all the dishes extremely well. When it started raining she went and bought us all waterproof tops to throw over so we stayed dry between stops. Answered any questions that were asked. There was 8 of us in total. A great group size. At the end of the tour she gave us all the names and descriptions of the dishes so we can easily order them again. She even gave us a bunch of other recommendations for resteraunts and dishes so those staying in Hanoi for awhile can go check them out.There was so much food. We went on the 5pm tour and finished at 8pm. I would suggest not eating anything much at all before, we had a brunch at 11am and still struggled there is just so much good food. Well worth the money (20usd per person) paid in Dong.Do it, you won't regret it!!!

Great idea!. My brother and I did this street food tour recently, and loved it. Our host was Ms. Moon, who was a great guide, with a lot of knowledge about the food and the area. It lasted about three hours, and by the end we were stuffed but happy. If you're interested in venturing beyond the tourist-oriented restaurants but don't know where to go, this will give you plenty of ideas.

Want to do it again!. An incredible way to start off a trip in Hanoi. It was stinking hot and Miss Moon was so friendly and helpful and knowledgable that it was still great. Food was incredible and safe. Would recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi!

OK but could be better. This was one of the top tours according to TripAdvisor. We went to the office and it was a bit chaotic with lots of people trying to sign up for various tours. Didn't feel very welcomed at all. We were a group of 12 people from all over the world and we set off to visit 7 different places for food. We started with Bun Cha at a small local restaurant that also served other dishes. We only had Bun Cha there and although it seems that the restaurant was famous for other dishes, no other dishes were explained or mentioned. We then left and went to a street stall with green papaya salad followed with rice crepes, lemon tea, fried spring rolls, jackfruit and yoghurt and finally egg coffee. The food at each place was nice but lacked detailed explanation. There were also lots of other street food along the way that would have been great if it had been explained to us...drinks with all sorts, fried dough balls, potato spirals...it felt as it the tour as getting us from one place to another, feed us and that was it. There was not interest in explaining in detail. All in all, found it lacking and saw some other tours where the guides were more forthcoming with information. In fact one other tour had the opportunity to try their hand at making the rice flour crepes when we were just ushered into the restaurant without even the opportunity to observe the crepes being made. We had to walk through the night market and the tour guide didn't even make sure that the group was complete as part of the group fell behind and was left wondering. All in all, didn't think it was worth the money...maybe it was the guide but thought that it could have been much better. Does it deserve the top spot...I didn't think so.

Excellent way to start your time in Hanoi. We did the 5pm tour just hours after landing in Vietnam and it was a fabulous wAy to get accustomed with the foods on offer and learn how to navigate the busy streets. Everything we tried was delicious and our tour guide, Money, was kind, helpful and good fun. We can't wait to head back to some of the visited cafes. Value for money.
A real food adventure. Thank you Miss Moon! A fantastic tour full of fun and humour. Highly recommended. A great way to access hanoi's tiny one-dish restaurants.

Top of the "to do" list. What a fun and delicious way to see Hanoi. My wife, two kids, and I had the great fortune to be paired up with Hien on our private food tour. She was extremely fun and knowledgeable and went out of her way to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. We ate so much delicious food and had such fun that I recommend everyone adds it to the top of their list of things to do while in Vietnam. One piece of advice: Arrive hungry. :)

A must! . A great way to see Hanoi! This was one of the highlights of our visit to Hanoi. Our guide, Cherry, was great. She took us around the city showing us some of the best spots. The food was amazing. A great way to dive into Hanoi street food. Arrive hungry!

A must do. Tu was excellent! Possibly costly compared to some other tour options available, but he was informative, entertaining, knowledgable, and very easy going character to get along with. We had 4 young kids with us and he did a great job getting them involved & trying out the snacks on offer. I gather they tailor the food experience to whatever Akers your fancy.Excellent guide, highly recommended.

Absolutely amazing!. My friend and I recently did the street food tour and we wouldn't have changed a thing! There were three of us in total on the tour which was lovely and our guide was wonderful. Found lots of little places to eat at that we wouldn't have otherwise tried. Very authentic and the locals were extremely welcoming. Walked away from the tour extremely full and satisfied! Highly recommended!

Best food tour in Vietnam . We had one of the best experiences during our recent holiday with Hanoi Street Food Tour. Nga or Miss Money as she likes to be called took myself, my wife and my two teenagers on a private food tour par excellence. The 10 stops for food were amazing. The food was fantastic and learning about the cultural and the history of Vietnam was a real eye opener. Starting with beef and noodles and ending with banh mi and egg coffee was a great way to spend an evening. I would highly recommend taking this tour, you will be amazed by the food and friendly people.

Adventure for the non adventurous. We have traveled widely over many years with fine food as one of our top priorities. This morning we had one of our most memorable food adventures anywhere. Our guide , Nga, had superb English matched by the quality and variety of the places we went into. On our own we would probably not been adventurous enough to go into these small unassuming but top quality places. If you are in Hanoi and if you love fine food, take this street food tour.

Amazing food tour!!!. Have heard a lot of good things about Vietnamese food, I decided to do the tour on my first day in Hanoi. The food was so delicious that I wish I could bring them home. The guide, Lotus, was friendly and good at English, she explained well what we had. I love " sticky rice" when we crossed the road. It was really the best way to learn about a country.Highly recommend. Don't eat too much before the tour !!!

Tu was a great guide!. Food tour with local food blogger, Tu, one of the two authors of Stickyrice.com (http://www.stickyrice.typepad.com). Food tour was so good! Well curated and adaptable for allergies, food preferences, and level of adventure of eaters involved. Great activity!

Not great vegetarian. The guide was wonderful and very helpful, however the vegetarian food was very average. Most of the dishes were just meat dishes with tofu chucked in, not dedicated vegetarian dishes (no banana flower salad or morning glory etc.). For example the vegetarian Banh Cuon had nothing inside except some tiny slices of onion, and it came with fish sauce (not exactly vegetarian). Some of the other dishes were ok, but it was not really a great vegetarian experience. Was pretty good for the meat eaters through.

Off the beaten path. Loved this tour. We were walking through back alleys and small restaurants that you would never find as a tourist. Our guide was very sweet and spoke great English. We ate street food and sometimes felt like we were right in people's homes. It was a really fun night and definitely an experience.

Amazing day out. Our lovely host hien, aka Cherry picked us up at our hotel. Then took us on a walking tour around ten different places to eat, every single dish was great, including dessert and egg coffee was amazing too. Cherry was informative, had excellent english and was so friendly. We would reccomend doing what we did and paying a little bit extra to go on a private tour rather than a big group because it was so informative and personal. Thanks a lot cherry! Leith and alice.

Ideal introduction to Hanoi. Fantastic value 3 hour tour to 5 eating places and then coffee/beer. We decided to follow advice and do this on our first night in Hanoi. Best idea ever as we learnt to navigate traffic crossing and learnt some of the best ways around town. Our guide Linh was really sweet and answered all our questions and was really interested in meeting our group. There were 6 people on our tour which was an excellent size to get to know each other and share stories whilst learning how to eat and interpret Vietnamese food places. We walked all around the old quarter, eating on the street, in back room areas and upstairs in a hidden little cafe for coffee. All the food was really fresh and Linh wrote some of the names and information down for us. We also had a go at removing rice paper from the cooking tray. I highly recommend this tour. Great value for money.

Best food, locations and guide . We went to the 5pm tour with guide Kiwi, it was well worth the money. She was knowledgeable but friendly and very easy to talk to. All the places were very authentic and delicious. I would never had tried some of the dishes without the tour, which would've meant I'd miss out on some of the best food I've eaten. A must in Hanoi.

Nicest Tour Guide in Vietnam, delicious Vietnamese cuisines. Decided to go on this food tour as it was the highest rated in that category and me and my friend hadn't really had a taste of the Vietnamese street food as we've always been a bit weary with where we eat. We arrived about 15 minutes before the tour started at 5pm thinking they may have been all booked out but luckily there was still room for us and they gladly let us join the tour. Our tour guides name was Lan Anh (nick named Kiwi). She speaks English well and is legitimately the nicest person I've met in Vietnam so far! The rest of the group consisted of 3 Korean women who couldn't speak a word of English or Vietnamese but still Kiwi would try to talk to them and include them in the conversation. The 3 women weren't eating much and ended up leaving the tour due to some light rain... Kiwi continued the tour with me and my friend. She's a very likeable person and very easy to talk to.
