She lead us through the streets of Hanoi taking us to several restaurants which I never would have seen. Go with an empty stomach as there are quiet a few places you visit. Kiwi walked us back to the tour guide station and let me use the work laptop so I could check my emails. We were heading to the Water puppet theatre after the tour so she gave us directions and after still being confused about where to go she then kindly offered to walk us there and spoke to the cashier for us. I tried to tip her but she kindly refused and just asked that we reviewed the tour on TripAdvisor. Highly recommend if you would like to taste some Vietnamese cuisines you've probably never tasted or heard of or even if you just want a pleasant tour around the streets of Hanoi.

Recommend - go hungry. Fast moving and really a great way to get a good feel and confidence in the city. Food choices were diverse and all yummy. Our guide Moon was really energetic and accommodating. We learned some great useful words along with a fast walk about.3 hours for $20 U.S. seemed reasonable for what we got
Hanoi street walking street food tour. Great experience, bit expensive, but worth it for the range of tastes, plenty of food. Our guide Lotus was lovely and interesting.

You'd never manage it on your own. Well worth doing if you are the interested in food. A great night out well explained and fun. There were just 4 of us and Sharie our guide who was charming informative and spoke well. Got to taste amazing fresh food prepared as we arrived and eat with the locals never would have got to any of these places on our own. We were fortunate to have another lovely Aussie couple to make up the foursome.

Fantastic food tour! . What a great way to spend an afternoon in Hanoi - eating and drinking your way around the best street food the city has to offer. We visited some fantastic places in the Old Quarter and got the perfect mix of different foods and drinks that Hanoi and Vietnam are renowned for. Miss Moon, our guide, was a gem - so knowledgeable and insightful, sharing lots of interesting facts and answering all of our questions along the way.  We learnt so much and really enjoyed our time with her. Thank you Miss Moon and Hanoi Street Food Tours. A must-do if you are visiting Hanoi!

Lovely guide-fabulous tour. We were five minutes late for the 6 pm tour so we opted to pay $30 pp and go just the two of us with a guide. Great call. Phuong or Phoenix, was our guide. She was knowledgeable, friendly and a lot of fun to spend time with. We spent about four hours all together walking around. We ate at eight or nine places. Beer was included in the price. We tried many different delicious dishes and got a real taste for the flavor of Hanoi street food life. Money well spent, do this tour!

OK food. I might be a bit pussy as being a Vietnamese and going on this tour with my Western partner. Food was kinda experience but we were not really fancy it at all. Most of the food we found okay, but we enjoyed the egg coffee the most. It is a bit over price though but it would be good if you dont have any idea of where to it and what to taste as they cover pretty much all the highlights of Vietnamese cuisine. Moon, the tour guide was friendly and have a very out going personality despite her limited English level, we still communicate well

A great introduction to Hanoi. We did this tour our first full day in Hanoi and it was a great introduction to the food and streets of Hanoi. Knowing we were in town for 2 weeks we wanted to get a good feel for the city, how to order food (not knowing any Vietnamese!), what to order, etc.Miss Moon was our tour guide. We had a blast with her. Lots of stories, history, etc. GREAT FOOD. The tour was scheduled for 3 hours and I think we spent over 4 hours with her. I highly recommend the egg coffee which is famous in Hanoi.It was one of the most memorable things we did in Hanoi and Miss Moon was a great part of why it was so enjoyable.

Great street food tour with a lovely guide. I went on the street food tour in Hanoi which was a lot of fun. We were a nice group and got along very well. Our guide "Money" was fantastic, she took us to many hidden places where I would have never went by myself. I'm vegetarian, so it was great to have her to always order something veggie which is normally hard for me when the street food sellers don't understand English. We ate A LOT of good food. It's absolutely worth the price. It was also nice to see that they actually block some streets in the old quarter for pedestrians on the weekend which are normally crazy busy with traffic. Thank you "Money" for the great tour! I can recommend it to everyone.

Top taste bud titillation . Excellent night. Seven locations with seven different small plates and a much needed beer stop. Great guide (Annie) who gave us insight into the food and the area. Easy going group as well. Highly recommended - do it at the start of your trip so you can learn which you like the best for the rest of your time!

Fantastic food! fantastic guide!. We went on the 6.30pm tour with Phoenix. It was such an amazing experience, we went to so many places we wouldn't have ventured to by ourselves. Phoenix was lovely, friendly and spoke such perfect English, she was a fantastic guide!We had 6 savoury dishes - bun cha, papaya salad, spring rolls, rice crepes, pillow cakes and then went for fruit and ice cream or sticky rice ( do not underestimate how good fruit and ice cream can be!) then we had Hanoi beer, egg coffee and lime tea! Absolutely amazing, we just wish we had skipped lunch that day so we could eat more! We would recommend to all our friends if they visit Hanoi.Thank you Phoenix, we love Hanoi!

3 hours of food adventures w/ great company and guide. Miss Moon demystified Hanoi street food for us! Highly recommended for the tasty food, the fellow travelers and the energetic and knowledgeable guide. We came at 10:45 for an 11 tour and had no issues getting in. Also they dealt well with allergies and food preferences

Excellent food and a great experience. I met at the tour office and the tours have a maximum of 10 people. There are three tours a day 11am, 5pm and 6.30pm.
We went to many stalls/ local restaurants and the food was great.
Very informative and the 3 hours passed quickly. There is the facility of a western toilet during the tour.
The tour cost USD20

Fantastic Tour guide of Hanoi. We had a great time on the Hanoi food tour. We were with really friendly two tour guides who took us to about 7 different local food places to street vendors to a family home and the food at each (10 dishes in total) was fantastic. would fully recommend them!

Awesome Night of Fun Food!. This tour was fantastic - from the various types of street food to tidbits of information to bia hoi. Everything was well planned and thought out. The places we visited were off the beaten path and we probably would not have visited them without the tour. The best part...how fun and interactive the tour was. It was definitely worth the price - awesome value!

Awesome scooter tour!. my husband James and I went on this fantastic tour last August. We had our guide meet us with two drivers dressed in beautiful, traditional silk clothes. They were very accommodating when we indicated we wished to try more foods. We had delicious pho, rice paper rolls, and saw much of the city. Ended with wonderful coffees topped with egg cream. Over the top. Highly recommend. Lots of pictures too.

Do it! It is a culinary blast and a great way to see the City.. I booked a private tour via email last minute and I was really glad I did it. It was raining really hard in the morning and I was hesitant to jump on the back of a scooter with wet roads. I arrived fashionable early and the ladies at the desk said we would take off at 9 instead of the scheduled 8:30 starting time and I told them I wanted beer for breakfast and they directed me to a local watering hole, more on that later. Hien aka Cherry gave me a quick run down on scooter safety and offered to buy me a raincoat, I pulled out a parka and we were off. Our first stop was for Pho, but the place was packed so took off for another spot. Long story short I saw and ate more in the three plus hours than I ever could have done on my own.Cherry was an outstanding driver, guide. Very knowledgable offering to take photos of famous landmarks. We ended our tour with "fresh beer" unbeknownst to Cherry right around the corner from the beginning of our tour. She offered to drop me off anywhere after our beer, but I was perfectly happy with walking around the Old Quarter soaking up the sun.Overall I highly recommend this tour group and Cherry as a very knowledgable, friendly guide for making my stay in Hanoi a very memorable one.

Do it on one of the first days you arrive in the city. The tour will give you a little insight into some of the street food offered around Hanoi. If you are not familiar with the Vietnamese language this tour can be very helpful with figuring out what certain words mean. Then you can start to understand what places are serving when walking around the city. The tour guide was super nice and informative. It was a nice experience to walk around the old quarter with other travelers and share new experiences with new people in a new city. Fun. Highly recommend it.

A first and must do in Hanoi. My wife and I decided to do this tour on a Sunday evening during our first full day in Hanoi. I'd recommend other travelers add this to the beginning of their itineraries as well. You will gain confidence in sitting, ordering and eating at local food stalls for your following meals. Also our tour started at 5PM and ended at BIA HOI a local spot for people watching and drinking inexpensive fresh local beer. A perfect way to end the night getting to know our guide Cherry who was very sweet and passionate about her job. Also, a great opportunity to connect with other travelers on our tour.

Do as soon as you can. As many others have said a great introduction to the street food Hanoi is famous for. We visited about 7 places. The next day I went back to one of them for lunch as it was close to my hotel. I did it on arrival day.

Best thing we did on our trip!. We did the three hour street food tour via motorbike and I could not say enough good things about it. First off, riding on the back of a motorbike was so much fun! I know I personally was a little scared at first but all of the drivers were very safe and I became very comfortable on it by the end. Doing this tour also allowed us to see so much of Hanoi that we wouldn't have otherwise seen (we went over past West Lake and saw that neighborhood including "the most beautiful street in Hanoi" which definitely held up its name). Secondly, the food was all amazing! We went to so many tiny hole in wall places that look like nothing from the outside but serve the most incredible meals. Last (but definitely not least) Amy was our tour guide and she was amazing! Our group absolutely loved her - I was lucky enough to be on the back of her bike and she told me so much about the areas we were driving past and just really made the experience so fun! Plus her English is phenomenal - we never had a difficult time understanding her. This 3 hour tour was definitely a highlight of our entire two and a half week trip in Southeast Asia and I would HIGHLY recommend it. If the price is deterring you (the motor bike tour was around $40/person) I can assure you that it is worth every penny!

Hanoi Food Tour. We went on the 5pm tour with Lotus. We had a great evening and are very glad we decided to do the tour. The food was delicious and lotus was a brilliant guide- enthusiastic, informative, great english. Definitely a worth while trip, highly recommend it.

Fabulous Miss Moon!. A must do in Hanoi, but don't be overwhelmed by the busy streets, just take a stroll with Miss Moon. We were guided through three delicious hours of noodles, soups, sweets, local beer, sandwiches, egg coffee with a few lucky surprises thrown in. Miss Moon was a professional, knowledgeable and fun guide - we'll definitely come again. Excellent value for money and a great introduction to all that Hanoi has to offer. Thanks for a really fantastic day Miss Moon :)

Fantastic time in Hanoi!!. My wife and I signed up for the street food tour right after we landed in Hanoi and it was SO GOOD! Our guide was amazing (ask for Sunny, friends) and the food was incredible! 3 hours plus of non-stop eating and walking around the Old Quarters... Thank you Sunny for an incredible tour... We loved it!!

Food tour. Great way to sample a taste of authentic Vietnamese food whilst soaking up the buzzing atmosphere of the old quarter without the worry of getting lost or having to chose where to go. Lots of variety in some really interesting places. Would recommend for sure.

world's best food. i can highly recommend the street food tour in hanoi, vietnam. in my opinion this is one of the must-do's in this city! the food is excellent, varied and plenty enough. if you can choose the tourguide, ask for phoung (phoenix), she's great.enjoy :)
Amazing !!!. Went on this tour on our first nite in Hanoi & had the lovelly Amy as our guide :D She was very happy & informative ! Great way to start our trip & food was yummo :)
Delicious. This was great fun and the food tasted fabulous. We have eaten at some highly rated restaurants but the local food on this tour shocks with great flavours and variety. Highly recommended.

Best day in Vietnam!. This was the best food tour I've done in any city. Ever. My husband and i absolutely loved and adored our tour guides "Money" and "Cherry". We loved them so much we hired them the following day for more sightseeing and food. I wanted to hire them for a third day but my husband thought i was being a bit excessive. He regreted that decision big time cause we spent the day getting lost and eating crappy food. Don't hesitate in booking this tour. Book a street food tour and a motor bike tour. Go private!! You won't regret it!We love you Cherry and Money!!! Come visit us in Hawaii!!! Love your friends, Dave and Rina. Xoxoxo

Great start to holiday. It was our 1st night in Vietnam. This street food tour was a great introduction to Vietnamese food and to see Hanoi old quarter. We did the 18 30hrs tour it lasted over 3hrs so was also. a great way to get use to old quarter at night. We were in a group of 6. It was a fun evening. Do not eat beforehand

Cracking Experience - Young girl, Bich personality, great food!. We organized the street food tour a couple of days ago and the only regret we had is that we didn't do it sooner. When we saw our guide rock up we were somewhat concerned as she looked a little young to possibly know where the best spots were, we were more than pleasantly surprised! Bich (Sunny) was unreal. She ensured we were entirely safe the entire time as we negotiated traffic on only our second day. She took us to places we wouldn't have dared going ordinarily, many within meters of our accommodation! She even got us in and places packed with locals which seemed impossible. Learned heaps. Ate even more! Awesome young lady. Great experience. Do this before you do anything else in Hanoi to ensure you get your compass calibrated before you eat street.

Amazing street food tour. I decide to go on a street food tour as I like eating a lot. I paid 20$ and so I expected to be in a group of people. Upon arrival I was greeted by Kiwi, only to find that I was the only one doing the tour. This made the experience so much better and Kiwi made sure to not only tell me about the food but also about the history of Vietnam and talk with me about the cultural aspects of different places in Vietnam. As a consequence I think she is the reason the experience was so amazing. The food I tasted was really good and I expected nothing less from the Vietnamese cuisine. The tour also went to some hidden places were only Vietnamese people went and I loved it.All in all great food, great company , great experience.

Amazing Evening!. Just finished a private street food tour with tourguide Nguyet. What a fantastic night we had. Nguyet speaks very good english, is enthusiastic and explains the different food very well. It is one of the best tours we have ever done and would recommend it to everybody that has an interest in food. We loved spending the evening with Nguyet. Thank you Hanoi Street Food Tour and Nguyet.

Great way to visit the old quarter and sample some great food! . We had a great experience on this food walking tour! Great food lots of variety Ms Cherry brought us to places we might not even thought of trying out on our own. Nice way to visit the old quarter too!

Great food tour. . Because there was 12People, we were divided int two groups. In our group were two other couples. We hit it off pretty well from the start and our tour guide Kat was a star. We stopped at about 7 places to eat and gave all the common local dishes a try. All were very good and gave us a good idea of Vietnamese flavours. Do book one of these tours early on in your holiday. It will be worth it.

amazing. We had the best time with our tour guide Kat she was so nice and funny, we learnt alot from her and she tailored the tour to suit our needs. Its one of the best things to do in Vietnam. I dont eat much unusual food but it was all really beautiful be thanks to kat

Wonderful introduction to Hanoi food. Wonderful tour to become acquainted with Ha Noi food. IT IS NOT SCARY! It is a delicious cuisine well worth exploring. The tour guide was fund and friendly and took us to 6-7 places over a couple of hours. Actually got rather full. It was a good time.

Delicious experience! . We did a private tour for two with Nguyet, a true foodie whose nickname is "Cake!" It's a marginally higher price ($10 extra per person) but well worth the personalized tour to learn about the food, culture, and language. For the more adventurous diner, you can request to try extra specialties and Nguyet knows the best places for everything! Fun time. Be prepared to eat a lot. Would definitely recommend!

Hanoi Food Tour - Kim's Tours. I looked at reviews for this tour prior to visiting Vietnam and it was no. 1 on my list of things to do as the reviews couldn't be better and I couldn't love trying new foods more - I was NOT disappointed! It was absolutely superb! My friend Charlotte and I went on the tour and met an absolutely great bunch of very mixed people which was excellent! We shared travel stories while being shown different venues to eat in and different REAL Vietnamese food to eat by our tour guide, Ling. Ling was a brilliant tour guide and really couldn't have been friendlier, kinder and really made us feel like we were out with friends, nevermind a tour group consisting of random people! Ling took us to some great places which the average tourist would never think, or have the confidence, to visit. Highlights included getting involved with some of the food preparation and visiting a Vietnamese coffee house and drinking egg coffee surrounded by sunflower seeds! On our walk to different venues Ling was full of stories about history and culture whenever we passed something of note. It was like two tours in one! It really was a highlight of my Vietnam trip and I would recommend this tour to all! At $20 USD this tour is an absolute steal - get involved!

Food glorious food. A few hours of excellent food,culture and general experience of the real Hanoi in the company of a delightful guide. Thanks Sunny your company, knowledge and attentiveness was greatly appreciated

Best way to visit Hanoi. We had just arrived in Hanoi when we decided to take this tour. So glad we did, Nga - Money was our guide and she was fantastic! $20 US and we had 9 courses of amazing food from places we would normally walk past. Definitely a must do!

Must Must Do!!. We went on a private walking tour (4 persons) with Hanoi street food last night. Sunny, our very happy and knowledgable tour guide walked us around the old quarter and we got to eat seven dishes none of us would have ever known about if not for this tour. My husband and I have been in Vietnam for 7 days and had been feeling the food was below our expectations. Now, thanks to Sunny, we know we have been eating in the wrong places and the wrong food because the food she fed us I will be dreaming about for years. I would thoroughly recommend this tour on your first day. You not only learn about the food but also how to cross the road!!!. If you are really lucky you might get the delightful Sunny to take you round. She is so enthusiastic and lovely I wanted to take her home to Oz with me!!!! Thankyou hanoi street food tours and thankyou Sunny!!!!Lynne and Winston Webster ( aka Mum and Dad) big hugxx

The highlight of our trip. This tour was the best way to start our trip in Hanoi. After coming from Singapore and Bangkok (food capitals of the world) my Mom and I had low expectations about the food in Hanoi. We were most definitely wrong. Our scooter tour guides, Trang and Le Thi, were fantastic -- they took us to the most interesting and authentic Vietnamese corners to try some of the best dishes we've ever tried throughout our travels around the world.We also visited some of the major historical sites in Hanoi, which were all outstanding. Our guides were very knowledgable about the social, political, and economic history of the region. They also let me drive the scooter for a good part of the tour, which was a lot of fun. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Hanoi, either for a few days or a few weeks. Do it in the start of your trip so you can get a nice overview about all of the best foods to try and sites to come back to. Without a doubt I give it the highest recommendation.

Fabulous food and company. We had been on the Street Food Tour last May, so wanted to do it again. Our friends were a little sceptical - how good could it be? It was hot, we were tired, it was our last night in Hanoi and we were on a 7am flight out.... we had such a good night! Sunny was delightful, very organised and wonderfully cheerful. The food was not exactly the same as last time, so we all had new experiences. It was all delicious, we visited places you would walk past not realising they could turn out such wonderful dishes. Sunny contacted us all with the list of dishes we had so we now know what to order. An experience not to be missed, and well worth repeating - the best $20 you will spend in Hanoi.

The best way to experience Hanoi. We had done the walking tour when in Hanoi last year so really wanted to try the scooter tour this time. What an experience! The tour operator was very accommodating and granted our request that our guide from last year, Amy, lead our group tour this time. The selection of food vendors was different and, not that I would have thought it possible, but the food was even better than last time. There is a difference between the two tour options. On the walking tour you are better able to ask questions about the historical/cultural things you see when travelling from site to site. The guides that work for this tour operator are very enthusiastic and knowledgable about the history, customs, etc of their home town and that really adds to the value of the walking tour. I felt that this aspect was slightly diminished on the scooter tour. However, for anyone who has stood on the roadside and marvelled at the chaotic Vietnamese traffic, I can only say that it is even better experienced from the back of a scooter. Overall, it was a fantastic tour. All of our 5 scooter guides were friendly, helpful, courteous, and enthusiastic. Amy was brilliant as usual. The food was excellent. And the scooters made it a very special experience.

A really enjoyable tour!. This tour gave my partner and I a true taste of real Vietnamese food. Our tour guide, Bich Nguyen, was very friendly and informative. I would highly recommend going on this tour, it is great value for $20 US per person, you get a lot of food for your money, and it is a great way to find out about the best local places to eat in Hanoi on a budget.

DELICIOUS street food with a FABULOUS tour guide. This tour was one of the highlights of our trip in Vietnam. Not only did we get to sample local delicious foods we also got the pleasure of meeting a lovely, kind local girl who made the tour so worthwhile. You should definitely consider doing this tour even if you are only in Hanoi for a short time as its great value for money. You should also ask for Bich Nguyen as your tour guide. You won't regret it!

Food Tour with Ms. Moon. I was with a friend of mine and we went on a Street Food Tour in Hanoi with Ms. Moon…maybe the best experience I have had in Asia in the past 19 years. Ms. Moon takes complete care of you the whole tour and makes you feel like she is a long lost friend. All of the little street-side family food shops that serve the best food is what you will visit. She takes care of you from start to finish and makes you feel super comfortable plus gives you detailed descriptions of the food you are tasting. I was completely full from the food and so happy with Ms. Moon's companionship. It was so much fun I will do it again upon my return to Hanoi. See you soon Ms. Moon from the American living in the Philippines =)

Just loved it .... What a welcome to Hanoi ... just loved it, the people , the food, the sights. Definately a must do in Hanoi.A big thanks to Phuong, lovely girl, lovely tour guide, a job well done, many thanks

Yum!!. Everyone should do a food tour on their first day in Hanoi! It was a great introduction to both the food and the Old Quarter area. Especially since we were jet lagged and we didn't want to have to think too much as we wandered around. We never would have gone to some of these street food stalls and restaurants on our own as it can be a bit intimidating when you first arrive in Vietnam. We certainly wouldn't have know to buy Bo Bia Ngot (delicious, unusual sweet treat) from a some random guy selling it from a wooden box attached to the back of his bike!My kids (12, 12 and 9) had great time and loved all the food as did my husband and I.Hien/Cherry was our guide. She was great--very friendly, informative and professional. If we had more time, we would have done another tour. Excellent value. Note that kids under 12 get a $5 discount. The person at the tour office charged my 9 year old full price but then gave me the discount when I showed her my confirmation email with the child price.
Good mixture of places. A gentle walk around several well known place to Mark made this a highlight. There were several locations we would have not seen or realized how good they were

Bring your appetites for a first-day must. Joined the 11 AM tour led by the excellent Miss Moon and ate our way through the Old Quarter. Great introduction to Vietnamese specialties - and through the help of Miss Moon they could be customized for the vegetarians and non-seafooders in the tour. Usually we do no revisit restaurants more than one time when on vacation but made an exception at several places introduced to us. Easily the highlight of the few days spent in Hanoi!

Fantastic introduction to hanoi . We arrived at 4 pm and decided to leap straight into things. After getting lost on the way to the office and navigating the very crazy streets. It was a relief to have Lotus a friendly tour guide ready to help us learn about hanoi and the life here. The food was amazing and we tried some really unique foods outside of your standard pho and rice paper rolls. Even down to stopping a local on a bike selling Bo Bia Ngot yummy!!! A lovely night with a friendly friendly tour guide - ask for Lotus a great sense of humour - thank you Lotus
So much food. We were pleasantly surprised by the amount of food. Great chance to try local food that you wouldn't try on your own. Small group of people, and our guide very helpfull.

Eat like a local in the Streets of Hanoi. Very simple and efficient operation. For 20USD, we spent over 4 hours with our delightful and very knowledgeable guide Bich (Sunny) eating in various food places in the center of the Old Quarter of Hanoi. The food was tasty and diverse, the drinks were refreshing and the whole experience was amazing. A special highlight was the final "egg coffee cà phê trứng" :-) Highly recommended. Hanoi has great street food, and you see the city thru local eyes. Bich was REALLY GREAT.

Great. Did this food tour first night in Hanoi! Private tour for just the 2 of us worth paying the extra, amazing value for money, Amy our tour guide was good fun, very knowledgable, and made it a really good evening, food was super yummy! My advice don't be scared of the street food just go for it!

A great introduction into Hanoi street food.. Our group of four loved this walking food tour with Miss Moon. The food was excellent and information was presented in a fun and historical way. Of course getting across the street as "sticky rice" stuck with us for the entire vacation and when ever crossing someone in our group would announce "sticky rice" and we would all go together. We went back several times to the places Moon took us and loved the food equally even without the smile of our guide. Don't miss this fun tour.
BEST THING EVER.. This was by far probably my favourite thing to do in Asia. Do it and don't hesitate. For 20usd you get like 10 dishes from 8 different places. TOTALLY WORTH IT.

Highlight of the trip in Hanoi. This was one of the highlights of the trip. Going to Vietnam hearing all the amazing food that the country offers really intrigued me and therefore a street food tour is a must! Ngo was our tour guide of the day. She was so energetic and really passionate about the food. She has a wide knowledge of the local food and even bought us to one of the egg coffee place where she designed her own egg coffee recipe! One of the best I have had in Hanoi! Big thumb up to Ngo and thank you for such a great experience!

Great intro to street food. Did this on our second night in Hanoi. Great intro to sampling some of the amazing street good Hanoi has to offer. Phoenix was our guide, who was attentive and cheerful. We didn't totally follow the itinerary, would have liked to have visited the secret cafe near the lake, but we had egg coffee at a different venue. The egg coffee was absolutely delicious and not at all what you imagin it to be like. We really enjoyed the experience.

Fantastic!. We had a fantastic tour with Nga, she was brilliant! It was so much more than a food tour, we learnt a lot about Hanoi and the way of life in Vietnam. The food was amazing and lots of it. Definitely recommend doing it on an empty stomach and at the start of your trip so you get to know which foods you enjoy. Also recommend asking for Nga - she was so lovely! For $20, don't pass up the opportunity.

Great Tour. I found the website before heading so when I went I was really looking forward to it. We met Pheonix who was so sweet. She loved what she did and she was a great guide. For over three hours we went to so many places, little hidden gems too (egg coffee - the BEST!). We were so full, ate new and wonderful food. Great value for money and a great night out.

wonderful last night in Vietnam. although we were 5 minutes late and the group left, they were great to provide us with a private tour after seeing how disappointed we were. we tried so many different things and got lots of interesting information. well worth the money!

Wish I'd done this before now!!!. One of the best activities I've done in Hanoi. Lived here for 6 months a few years ago & drove past these places so many times.
The food was delicious & Money (the Tourguide) was amazing. Well worth it!

Great experience. A great day with superb guide. We started the trip in the morning after breakfast at hotel. We traveled around the old quarter and stop at local retaurants which was not popular for tourists. It was the first time we had tried to seat on small and low chair at sidewalk to enjoy a special food Banh cuon. It was so funny when driking Beer at the street conner and chating. Linh was a informative tourguide. She taught us the way to make the food, what to prepare, the typical of each one before tasting.Highly recommend! - Alicia.

Loads of fun. Really enjoyed this tour, there was a group of about 10 or 12 of us shown around by Cherry. We got to try a load of different foods like Bun Cha, Bo Bia, Green Papaya Salad, Egg Coffee, Banh Mi, Dried Eel, and load of other bits and pieces. It was a good way to check out a bunch of different of different places and foods, and to meet some new people to share some Bia Hoi with.

Fabulous taste of Hanoi food and traffic lesson!. On our second night in Vietnam, our party of 5 arrived for the evening food tour and were teamed with a party of 5 Aussies. We knew it was going to be fun. 10 people is the max for any group, and there were several groups who left at the same time, but all seemed to end up at different places at different times. Our guide was Lotus, who was very sweet and very petite and whose English was a little difficult to understand. But she managed to communicate the critical issues: first of all - how to cross the street. Hanoi traffic is like nothing I've ever seen (including Beijing, Bangkok, and my home town of Los Angeles). It flows like a river. No one stops. No one honks. No one screeches. But from a pedestrian standpoint, it appears impossible to breach. Not so. Lotus taught us the concept of "sticky rice", moving as a unit, and simply striding across the street. Very powerful. This is truly a walking tour, so be prepared for blocks and blocks of exploring. We went to eight different places. Please come hungry, or you will miss the delight of tasting all the dishes. Portions did not seem that small, and we tasted every possible combination of traditional and untraditional foods, including foods prepared on the street, as well as indoors. Be prepared to sit on very low blue plastic stools (I think the blue plastic stool business is the business to be in...). Crowded together. Maybe a little warm. Water provided. They accommodated my husband, who does not eat red meat, without any problem. We ended up with "egg coffee" at our second to last stop and finished with a bowl of distinctly different fresh fruit in large pieces, topped with a yogurt/cream. (We had covered many different neighborhoods by then.) This place was packed.The fruits were fresh and even included avocado, along with rambutan, pineapple, banana, and lots of other goodies. Lotus showed us how to take the spoon and mash it all together. That was the tradition. My husband, who is a great admirer of the beauty of freshly cut fruit, couldn't bring himself to "smoosh" all those beautiful chunks. So Lotus simply took his bowl away and gave him a lesson in "remedial mashing". Became a running joke throughout the rest of our trip. Very much enjoyed the food and the expedition. Wear comfortable shoes, loose clothing (because you will eat and squat a lot), and a sense of humor. Expect to spend at least 3 hours on the tour.

great food great tour guide. For $20US we did a 3hr walking street food tour with a great local guide Nga but we could call her (Money) her nick name, she had great local info about Hanoi and what to do and eat, she took us to 8 place to eat and drink we had a great time, the food was great and the places were pretty cool, we tried different foods like duck egg, egg coffee, and some local meals. I wished we had done this straight away as it gives you a good walk around the city will tell people when I get back home to do this tour.

Take the tour from Tu and Mark - Our best time in Hanoi. There are numerous street food tours in Hanoi but the only one to take is found at http://streetfoodtourshanoi.blogspot.com/.Every place we stopped was excellent and later in the day we got sent links to all the places we have visited and all the food we tried.Tu our guide was not your usually boring guide who just walked you round you really go the feel he cared.

Absolute must do - as soon as you arrive. This tour is an absolute must if you are a first time visitor to Vietnam, or even just wanting to pass on the expensive Western style restaurants and eat with the locals.We booked our tour to start early on our first morning and it was the best decision we made.We got to try a huge variety of foods from starters to desserts. You can work out what you like (we found nothing we even remotely didn't enjoy) and memorise what everything is called so you can confidently order alone and not get any nasty surprises.We had Kiwi as a guide who is a young uni student and was our 15&16 year old's best friend for the 3 hours that we had her. She was like having your best friend show you around their city - invaluable! Her English was perfect, she was genuinely interested in our lives and answered all questions we had relating to food or otherwise. I strongly recommend you do this tour as soon as possible on arrival.

Food adventure awaits!. Just finished a 3 hour street food walking tour with Phoenix as our lovely guide. For the duration of the trip she made sure we were all well looked after (hydrated in the muggy heat with lots of water) that any allergies were accounted for (my sister doesn't eat any shrimp or chicken) and that we all navigated the busy streets of the old quarter safely despite the crazy traffic.The tour itself consisted of us visiting 5 different street food vendors a bar for some local beer and then a coffee shop for some famous Vietnamese egg coffee. By the end our whole team was stuffed full of food but Phoenix organised takeaway Banh Mi for our group as she insisted on us all trying some regardless.I could not have asked for a more knowledgeable and considerate guide and it was fantastic rubbing shoulders with locals as you went to street side stalls, sat on tiny stools and tucked into a bowl/plate of deliciousness which you would otherwise not have the opportunity to do if you were travelling independently. Thanks Phoenix for a perfect tour and for answering all our questions, I look forward to using some of that food knowledge you taught us today!

Great, great, great all around!. We had such a solid experience on this tour! We started our travels in Vietnam in Hanoi and signed up for this tour the first night. We were SO GLAD we did because it taught us so much about the variety of food options and how to put them together. Not only did we have such great food (tried 8 different local restaurants and varieties), but it also enabled us to order with knowledge for the remainder of our time in Vietnam. No longer were we intimidated by all the ingredients and now to put them together! Because of this tour, we had a great evening/night and maximized our eating experience while in Vietnam. It is also a steal at the price point for all the food you get! You must come hungry, or you might leave miserable!This tour is organized pretty well and takes you to the best of spots in Old Quarter. Our guide, Smile, was the a gem. She was so easy to talk to and so helpful. It felt more like we had a friend showing us her favorite spots than a tour guide!

Great Guide, great time. We did this tour the first night we were in Hanoi. We had a lovely guide named Linh who knew a lot about Hanoi and was very good at explaining what we were eating and the history of the city. Food was good - though in some instances not great. Made up for it with good company - from Korea, Belgium, France. Would recommend this tour to anyone going to Hanoi - or the equivalent in other cities. Street food is the way to go

Highly recommend the street food tour. We had a great night on the street food Tour, the food was amazing and our host Annie did a great job, and took us to some places on the street we never would have discovered on our own. I highly recommend it.

Great tour. This was a great walking tour guided by two young ladies. Both had good English and took us to local places that we would definitely have not tried on our own. We stopped at 7 different places and tried 7 different local dishes. It was not a great distance so walking was easy. Great opportunity to try food we would not have otherwise.

Wide variety of food. My amazing husband booked this tour for our family of 4 (kids ages 8 and 11). He loved everything and I enjoyed most of it. I'm a vegetarian, but the guide (Smiles) was nice enough to order the veg alternative.

Great introduction to Hanoi. This is a brilliant way to start off any trip in Vietnam. We were very lucky to have Lotus as our guide as she was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. We tried 7 different dishes which were all delicious and also had fresh beer (bia hoi) and egg coffee. The pacing of the tour is also good as it gives you a bit of time to digest between dishes. Would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Hanoi, particularly if it's your first time in Vietnam.

Great and Tasty experience!!. This fantastic food tour introduced us to some of the finest street food available in Hanoi's busy Old Quarter. At only 20 dollars for what ended up to be quite a feast for the even the hungriest of appetites, with savoury and later sweet courses over a wide range of friendly places, an absolute bargain for a memorable experience. Phoenix our guide was fantastic, very warm, friendly and engaging and got the group we were with talking all evening and even made sure we got back ok to our hotel ok. A memorable experience and a great way to get to grips with Hanoi's bustling street scene. A must for any Hanoi visitor.

Hanoi street food tour a must do!. After reading all the great reviews on tripadvisor this tour was on our must do list and we were not disappointed, it was one of the highlights of our trip. Hiem (Cherry) was our guide for the night, she was very knowledgable on Hanoi and all the local street stalls. We were able to try 8 dishes in places that you would normally glance at but not sit down for a feed as you are never sure if it's okay.The food was fresh, tasty and unusual. We experienced tasty dishes such as 'Nom Bo Kho' (Papaya, peanuts and dried beef salad) one of my favourites and 'Bun Cha' (pork meat balls with rice noodles in a fish sauce, vinegar and mint broth) delicious. We highly recommend this tour as it was fun and a great way to gain knowledge on Vietnamese culture plus we can now recognise some great dishes on the menus!

Wonderful tour guide and great food. Sunshine was a wonderful tour guide, a complete natural with excellent English. She was completely herself and unscripted and was flexible about picking places which we very tasty and not too busy for the group to get served quickly. We learned a lot about different dishes, how to order them and also a lot about Vietnamese culture from Sunshine's stories. Highly recommended as a fun evening activity which builds your confidence to try and order Vietnamese food.

Worth it for a short trip in Hanoi. Coming to Hanoi, I had a list of items I wanted to try: bun cha, bia hoi (fresh beer), egg coffee, etc. But with only 2-3 days in Hanoi, it would be difficult to try everything in time or know where to go! This tour is perfect for condensing 2 days worth of eating into about three hours, with 8 different stops involving various breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert foods. We enjoyed learning about the food, how to eat it, when to eat it, and additional Vietnamese culture through our conversations with our guide, Lotus. At some of the stops, she even personalized the food a little bit by showing us how she likes to have it or tweak it. Go on an empty stomach!

Amazing Evening tour. We took the Urban Adventure Street food tour it was wonderful. We were meet at our hotel by Trois ( not how it's spelt!) who was so knowledgable he took us on a tour of the old town and we had a different course at each stop. We watched rice pancakes being made and went for a street. BBQ where we sat on the opposite side of the road to the main restaurant and watched in amazement as the girls darted through the traffic to bring our food! The guide took us to a market and along the railway tracks to see the people who live there places we would never have found on our own! We finished in a roof top cafe drinking egg coffee overlooking the lake a magical end to the tour.

Exceptional guided street food experience. Highly recommendedLotus was our wonderful guide on Hanoi Street Food Tour tonight. We arrived a little early for the 6:30 - 9:30 PM tour, and were happy to find that we there were only three people (two Americans and one Brazilian) in our group, which made it feel a bit more intimate. We paid in cash (USD also accepted) at their office, and after asking us if we had any personal preferences or dietary restrictions (e.g. "would you try spider? snake? dog?"), Lotus took us on an expedition to try 8 different restaurants throughout the Old Quarter. Her English conversation skills are impressive, despite only having studied it independently for about a year. She was also very friendly, patient, and hospitable when it came to explaining the dishes, making conversation about life in Vietnam, or answering any of our questions.I won't spoil the tour destinations for you (the food is included), but be assured you will try a medley of authentic dishes that you may not have experienced before. Far from your typical pho, you will likely encounter other combinations of Vietnamese ingredients, sauces, and recipes that are sure to challenge and delight your taste buds. We also heartily enjoyed a Vietnamese dessert, beer, rice wine, and egg coffee along the way.Walking among traffic was not an issue due to Lotus calling out "sticky rice!", the effective rallying cry to band together behind her, every time we faced an intersection we needed to cross. We ended up running a bit over time, which was fine since we had nothing planned for the rest of the night, but that was more due to our enthusiasm than lack of punctuality from Lotus. Overall, definitely a memorable experience. Hope you read this Lotus--we had a lot of fun, and hope you can raise a Samoyed one day :)

Interesting way to taste street food while sightseeing and learning about traditions in Vietnam. Our guide was a very polite young lady you talked us about food and traditions in Vietnam while leading us from place to place, giving us different treats. Her English was not perfect, but it was understandable, and on the whole the experience was very good. This tour is an interesting and affordable way to taste street food you wouldn t otherwise try, while sightseeing a little bit, led by someone that won t allow you to get lost.All in all, recommended, provided that you don t have an easily upset stomach.

Excellent experience!. We booked the 11am food tour, and we were guided by a sweet woman named Moon. She spoke English well, and she shared many facts about Vietnamese culture. We went to about 8 different places in the 3 hour tour, and it was a very interesting combination of foods. Moon was attentive to our needs (potty breaks, water refills, etc) and she made the tour more fun and inviting. She was professional and courteous, and we would definitely recommend this tour group to anyone looking for a taste of Hanoi street foods!Moon, if you see this - thank you for a great time!

Fantastic!. Our only regret was that this was the final thing we did at the end of a 2 week trip around Vietnam so may have to wait some time to try some of these dishes again!My girlfriend and I were part of a group of 9 very friendly Canadians and Americans hosted by Linh who was a charming and knowledgeable guide as she showed us round 8 different spots in Hanoi's old quarter. The food picks were all fantastic and at each stop we were able to sit comfortably and received very prompt service.We were on the 5pm tour which was due to last 3 hours but the whole group was having so much fun we were still enjoying fresh be after 9! A really great experience and must-do in Hanoi!

Was expecting a bit more. First attempt at booking a private tour through their website didn't get a response. Tried again and this time it worked (although the excuse about their online booking form going to a spam folder seemed unlikely). We showed up at the office a few minutes before our appointed start time, only to have to wait around while they dealt with getting a large group underway. Somehow, in the confusion they managed to send a different couple (who had paid for the group tour) off with our private guide, so we then got to wait some more while a replacement was hurriedly organized.Things improved after that. Our guide was lovely, spoke good English and we certainly got to try way too many dishes. But the whole thing felt a little generic - most places we ate were full of other groups on similar street food tours and it didn't feel like we were taken anywhere we couldn't have found ourselves. If you're a serious foodie it may be worth considering one of the tours run by proper chefs (eg Daniel Hoyer) instead.

Do this on your first day. We arrived in the morning from the UK and booked the 5pm tour which I had arranged via email before we left. We were in a group of 8 people who were all really nice people. Smile was our guide who was great. It was one of the highlights of our trip and certainly got you settled in quickly with the way of life here and got ou over the culture shock. One word of warning - you will be expected to use chopsticks so get learning! We also asked for the water puppet show after the tour for an extra 5 dollars which was a great end to the evening. PS Having dollars was a real bind - just exchange your pounds to dongs at the hotel when you get there. All places accept dongs and it is much cheaper to pay in dongs.

Restored our faith in North Vietnam food. The food tour provided us with the best food we have had in North Vietnam in 6 days. We had spent 25 days traveling from the far south of Vietnam to Hoi An and Hue and sampled truly excellent dishes. So, we were surprised that the Hanoi restaurants on Trip Advisor didn’t measure up. The guide, Sea, was a delightful young man. His knowledge of the old quarter and the best local food was very good. He not only took us to 8 eclectic food places but also showed us through two “tube” houses and down the raucous and fun bar and club streets. We were lucky to be with a mix of 9 very congenial foreigners – Korean, Chinese, Hong Kong, New Zealand, Manchester, Utah, Colorado and Idaho. We ended the tour with “fresh beer” visiting with our new “friends”. We look forwarded to returning to some of these food spots in the coming days and evenings in Hanoi.

food tour with LOTUS!!!. we decided to have a private tour food tour and it was the right choice. we were assigned Lotus and she provided us with not only a great tour and great information about the food we were eating but she shared with us great information about the city and the culture. we had reservation for dinner that night and had to cancel it. we were so full!!! great way to eat your way around the city and a great way to get a good sense of the city. THANK YOU LOTUS.

Great tour. Probably my absolute favorite thing we did on our 3 week trip to Vietnam. Our guide (Cherry) was so nice, full of energy and lovely to talk to. She answered all of our (numerous) questions about the food and Vietnamese culture and was a pleasure to be around. The food.. Oh my god. If you're nervous about trying Hanoi's amazing street food then just do this tour. We were taken to loads of great little places, some of which we never would have dared entering on our own because as foreigners it's a bit intimidating and it's also hard to know what it is exactly that they're selling which makes it hard to order. But this just makes it easy and all the food we ate was so good. SO good. All in all a great night out.

Very good introduction to Hanoi street food, worth doing...don't miss it!. I joined this tour on my first morning in Hanoi, and our guide was a young student called Lotus. I thought the tour itself was terrific! It really gave me a sense of how to enjoy street food--both the food itself and the culture. Our guide, Lotus, was knowledgeable, really has a passion for food and the sharing of it, and looked after all of us like a big sister. By the end of the tour the group has also developed a camaraderie. You really should give this a try!

Food tour in old quarters . We did the tour of the street food. We showed up at noon and asked to go on tour right away. We had to wait 30min for a guide to be here. Not a problem at all. We just stayed there at the agency and asked questions to the girl behind the desk about different things we wanted to know.The COST of the tour was $30/person for the private tour. It was 3 of us. It would have been $20 with a group, and in that case the tours started later for an evening tour. I'm sure the evening tours are fun but seriously the old quarters is already a mess during the day and at night it becomes a jungle, so I preferred to do this at lunch.The tour was fun, we tasted food from 8 different places. Small enough portion each time that we could keep going for a while but it's a lot of food. All the places we went were the small little street food that you hesitate to go to because of all the warnings your get from the book guides or from your medical institutions especially in the USA... Which seriously the problem comes from the "hygiene beyond extreme" American mentality, not from Vietnam style of making food. If you don't live in the USA and you're not one of those clean freak then indulge.Our guide was Lotus. She was super nice like Vietnamese people seem to be in general. Beyond the food experience it was also a cultural one. It was nice to have her attention for 3 hours and listen to her way of life as a student.After this tour is like to do another tour related to food but maybe less traditional and more about what's young people today's favorite places in Hanoi to go eat. Also I would have liked to understand how she would select a place if she didn't know about it before. We failed to ask these questions.At this point, after 3 days in Hanoi though I'm a little sick of the old quarters and want to explore more of the city where the tourists don't venture much.

Ngon (delicious). Had a great time with Kat and several others on our first night in Hanoi. The tour involves visiting several food stalls throughout the old quarter so apart from the food you also get a wonderful overview of the nightlife there. Kat speaks perfect English and is very knowledgeable about the food and the culture. Lots of ngon food to eat and good company. What better way to spend a night in Hanoi.

Our best experience in Hanoi. The Hanoi Street food tour was a positive experience. We had tried some street food on our own before taking the tour, but this tour made dining at the street a whole lot easier and understandable.Our guide Link, a lovely girl studying in Hanoi and working for Kim Tours as a part time job. Her english was good and she made us all feel like a group of friends hanging out.We can definetively recommend this to others, it is something you should do during you're first days in Hanoi/Vietnam

The only option to try best street food in Hanoi!. We recently booked a private street food tour for 2 and we highly recommend it! Our guide, called Smile, was wonderful and spoke fluent english. All the street foods in Hanoi can be intimidating. This street food tour is the only way to get comfortable with various types of street food so that you have confidence and understanding for the rest of the trip. This food tour is a 'must-do' if youre visiting Hanoi!

Brilliant. We had a fantastic street food tour by Kat Moon during out stay in Hanoi - its so difficult to navigate through the endless food joints but Kat takes you to the number one places for around 10 different traditional dishes. Kat was funny, informative, interesting and just a fab guide! If you go to this company try and get Kat as your guide if possible!

'Must do' tour!. A friend recommended this tour to us - it was brilliant. Our tour guide 'Sea' spoke fluent English and answered our many questions about food and the Vietnamese way of life. The dishes were all amazing - we were informed how the dish was made, where the ingredients were from and how to eat them. This was also great as I have gluten sensitivity, so we were able to wander back on the following nights for further meals. We tried a range of desserts, mains, snacks and even egg coffee. We were very full by the end.

Find the best spots for street food in Hanoi.... You'll completely enjoy yourself as you trek back and forth in the Old Quarter of Hanoi trying 8 different types of street food. "Cherry" our tour guide spoke excellent English and was diligent in catering to the needs of everyone in our tour group. This is a fun tour for families with children as well, as most of the food is kid friendly or can be modified. My daughters even had a chance to cook their own pancakes. Make sure to bring USD to pay, or be prepared to pay in USD on your credit card.

wonderful evening out!5. We booked a private tour for 3 of us and had a great time!We also paid $5 extra each to get a ticket for the water puppet theatre amust do.Our guide sunny was the most delightful and lovely young woman.We had a great deal of fun and sunny was great.We would thoroughly recommend this tour but do go in a smaller private group if you can!

Excellent Introduction to street food. We went on this tour with "kiwi" who was a lovely guide. She was great company and made everyone feel like we were a group of friends on a night out rather that a tour group. Its a great thing to do when you first arrive as it can be a bit confusing how to go about ordering, how to eat etc. We learned about how the dishes were made, how to eat each dish etc. It was also great to get inside anecdotes about life in Hanoi. We had a lovely group of easy going friendly people and I gladly recommend this tour. (We went on the 5Pm tour which ws good as it was a bit cooler).

BEST tour in Hanoi. We had very little time in Hanoi so we wanted to eat everything without having to get sick. We were recommended to get Miss Moon to guide us. It was just me, my husband and Miss Moon! So private we loved it! She made it so specific to what we wanted to try and things we haven't even heard of! She was quite informative as well. Told us where to shop and how to bargain. She was very knowledgeable and quirky! She made sure we were so full! We had to actually take one of the dishes home at the end because we just couldn't eat anymore! Loved all the dishes! Can't wait to come back to Hanoi!

Fantastic local food in the old quarter. The nice and friendly guide Lotus brought us on a journey through Hanoian street food. She showed us the places that are most popular among the locals, and we got to try 8 different dishes, all of which were new to us. We had a no seafood preference, and that was easily taken care of. We are a bit uneasy of going to street food restaurants that we do not know, so it was very nice to have a guide show us the best of these places. We enjoyed every dish very much. Since more 8 people had signed up for our tour, they divided us into two smaller groups. This was very nice, as it allowed us to get to know all the other travellers in our group. Lotus was very good at telling us about all the dishes, but also very good at letting the conversation flow whenever it started. She always used the breaks in the conversation to take us to the next stop or tell anecdotes about the food we were eating.

Great introduction to the local street food. I did this tour four hours after stepping off the plane in Hanoi.It's a great introduction to the local street food and a fun way to get your bearings in the Old Quarter if you've just arrived.We had a terrific guide by the name of Sea who took us to many different places to eat so pace yourself you will feel very full by the end of the evening !

Must do when in Hanoi. This tour is a must do when staying in Hanoi. Our guide took us to so many vendors and explained not only the food but also the customs and general life of the people. Awesome tour

Best night in Hanoi. We took the 6:30pm tour with Sunshine along with a group of 8 people including ourselves. Sunshine was an excellent guide - she speaks English fluently, answered all of our questions, and told us interesting stories about her life as a college student in Vietnam. My wife is mostly vegetarian (but eats seafood) and we were able to work around her dietary restrictions at every stop. We had absolutely delicious food at many hole in the wall type places that I would have overlooked had I been on my own. I lost count of how many stops we made, but we finished up around 10pm and everyone was completely stuffed and fully satisfied. For the squeamish - all of the food that we ate was perfectly "normal" by American standards - no organ meats, blood, exotic animals, bugs, or balut or anything like that. I wish the tour company would offer an "extreme" food tour with all sorts of weird stuff, but still this tour was super fun, and super tasty, and my stomach felt perfectly fine the next day. This tour was easily the highlight of our stay in Hanoi and I strongly recommend it!
Linh was a great guide. A great way to experience some of the food of Vietnam in places you would never (at least I wouldn't have) even think to eat at. Linh was a great guide.
Nice food tour. I liked the tour with Linh a lot. It provides a lot of different dishes, actually maybe one too much for my taste. Though the guide was nice and the food selection very good! Thanks!
Enjoyable. Linh gave us a very enjoyable and friendly tour. The food was remarkable, I liked most of the dishes.

Sticky rice!. Thanks to another review, we took this tour on our first day in Hanoi and it was a great idea! Miss Moon was a superb tour guide and gave us a great introduction to the Old Quarter and street food. She was funny, friendly, enthusiastic and informative. What to expect: Wear your walking shoes and expect to eat a lot and sit low. Most of the portions at each restaurant are just the right size and nothing we ate would be considered too unusual for a picky palate. Tell your guide if you have dietary restrictions (they worked around mine). Some of the plates are communal. Budget between 3 to 4 hours for this tour. We were able to get our tickets at the office in the same hour. Our group was eleven people total, just big enough to still feel intimate. I think any more people would have detracted from the experience.Our guide wrote up a list of all the restaurants and dishes that we ate at, so bring your camera to take a photo of it. The ONLY thing I did not like about this trip was the unique banh mi. There was too much sauce and I've honestly had better banh mi in my own country. Everything else was great, definitely do it on your first day. It's a great way to orient yourself in the Old Quarter.If you need a bathroom, there's a bathroom stop at the office. Beware that it's a steep stairway up. (You could also try at one of the restaurants.) At the end, I was full but not overstuffed.

highlight of our time in Hanoi. Others had recommended doing a food tour in Hanoi before we visited and based of Tripadvisor recommendations we choose Hanoi Street Food Tours. On our 1st night in Hanoi a dinner sitting at the table next to us suggested we should have done the tour that night, our 1st night in town. He explained that it opened his eyes to places and food he otherwise would not likely have tasted. Unfortunately we took the tour on our last night, 3rd night in Hanoi, and wished we had done it on the 1st. The food we had he 1st 2 nights wasn't bad but it paled in comparison to the dishes Smile introduced us to. As their were 3 tours going out at 5pm the night we did our tour and we never ran into the other 2 tours I would presume that each tour goes to different locations. With this logic I would have gone on the food tour each night if we had gone our 1st night in Hanoi ...that's how much we enjoyed it and how good it was.

Great Experience. We spent a very rainy night with Kiwi exploring some of the traditional foods of northern Vietnam. Kiwi was cheerful and enthusiastic and never let the weather ruin our experience. The food experience was interesting and unique. We would happily suggest that this is a "must" fiirst day/night experience in Hanoi

Great for picky to adventurous eaters, easily the best thing I did in Hanoi. Our guides Lily and Mia met us after we were picked up from our hotel. They were very nice and were able to organize the tour around what Vietnamese foods we had already tried and any specific diet requests that we had. We did the streetfood on motorbikes tour which I highly recommend as they explained about different sights and parts of the city we passed on the way, and we were able to see parts of the city that we had not seen before.Lily and Mia were great. Anytime we wanted to try something they got it for us and they actually bought us several additional items along the way, so we tried more like 11 or 12 dishes than eight. Also, along the way they changed one of our stops as we told them we had already tried bun cha hanoi style.Overall we had 8 different stops, each one having food and two of them having drinks also.The first stop we had pho bo (beef pho). Having already had pho several times, this was not incredibly interesting to me, but the pho was pretty good.The next stop we had nem bo (green papaya salad with beef). I thought this might be similar to som tam (Thai green papaya salad), but it was actually much different and tasted great. They also brought me some beef liver and fat to put on mine, although I didn't really like the fat. This was my favorite dish of the night overall.The next stop we had banh cuon (thin rice pancake with black mushrooms and pork), a traditional food for Vietnamese breakfast. They also brought us an additional dish which was egg with mugwort (I forget the name in Vietnamese), that was also very interesting.The next stop was the fried stop. We had a "pillow" dumpling with pork, a spring roll with crab, a fried sour nem with beef, and a donut with green bean curd. They also bought us lemon tea to drink. These were all pretty good, especially the sour nem which was delicious.Next we cruised over to the West Lake and had a small snack of bo bia. This was basically a very thin rice wrapper wrapped around shredded coconut and sugarcane. It was a light, slightly sweet snack/dessert. The next stop we tried modern takes on pho. The first was a beef and herb roll wrapped in giant pho rice noodles. These were dipped in fish sauce and were delicious. We also had a fried pho noodles with beef and morning glory, served dry (without broth), although I was not a huge fan.The next stop we had a banh mi and egg coffee with cacao. I had already eaten plenty of banh mis and this one was fairly unremarkable, although not bad. We also had a shot of rice wine which was strong, one was definitely enough. The egg coffee was alright also, but nowhere near as good as the egg coffee we had at Cafe Giang (where I would recommend going to try it).The next stop we had bun reuc (spelling?) or bun noodles with crab, fish, and pork in a beef broth. This was pretty good, although not overly remarkable.Finally dessert! We had two options - yogurt with sticky rice and caramel or fresh fruit, so we picked the yogurt option. After getting our bowls, we mixed everything together and tried it. I was surprised by how much I liked this dessert, it basically tasted like sweet yogurt with sticky rice, and a slight caramel taste. It was a fantastic ending to the night! By this time I was also super full but I still managed to finish the whole thing.I highly recommend this tour, we tried so many interesting food items and were very full by the end of the night. We also learned a lot about the city of Hanoi, got to see the city from the back of a motorbike, and got to meet two interesting locals. Definitely do this if you have any interest in learning more about Vietnamese cuisine!

Can't think of a better way to explore Hanoi. Just got back from amazing 3 hours of delicious food and amazing time with our guide Phuong. We explored every possible (I think) street food around Hanoi, with lively explanations about Vietnam and everyday life in Hanoi. DO NOT MISS!

Hanoi street food tour 31/3/15 with Amy was amazing. We had been recommended Amy's tour by friends & it was fabulous. 4 of us (including 2 teenage boys) ate & toured around the City. The food is delicious & Amy is friendly, fun, plus passionate about the food & the Vietnamese people. Her English is great & with her colleague Than we had a great time. Make sure you are hungry as lots of beautiful, fresh, clean food - from ban chao to fruit salad & coffee/hot chocolate with much much more in between. We were full, but enjoyed every mouthful. Cooking class here I come!

Fantastic experience . Took the walking street food tour of Hanoi with husband and three kids ranging from 8-14: approx 3 and a half hours at a gentle pace. Hien (Cherry) was our guide and she was fantastic is every respect. We visited 8 different cafés/food stalls and tried a selection of fresh local street food ranging from savoury to sweet and finishing with a delicious egg coffee. At every stall Hien would check our food preferences and order accordingly while explaining how the food is made and making sure we didn't get run over in between! Even the fussiest of children will find something authentic that they love to eat/drink. Take this tour at the start of your holiday so you can revisit your favourite eateries on subsequent days and get more ideas of places to eat/things to do from your guide. Would heartily recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi - but come hungry because there's a lot to eat !

Great way to enjoy Hanoi's food scene. Our guide, Lotus, organized a great sequence of restaurants (7 over 3 hours) for our tour. We thought the quality of the food and the tour was outstanding. Vietnamese food is amazing and this was a great way to experience a variety of flavors. She even gave us recommendations for other restaurants to try later in our trip. This tour is excellent value, and even better than the reviews indicate.

Great hanoi street food tour. We were picked up at ours Orel with scooters for the walking tour. Our guide Nhawasver friendly, chatty and tookustosomanygreatplaces places I would never find by myself! I was so full at the end. I didn't like the las place we stopped as they only served boring sandwiches but great coffee. It was a delicious mix of food overall!

Fully satisfied!. I joined Friday evening's tour with my boyfriend. We visited 8 fabulous street food places. Guide lady explained well how to enjoy the food like a local. She was also fluent in English. Everything was good!+Recommend to go this tour with empty stomach! ;) +According to the tour representative, this tour's limit is maximum of 10 people/tour, so it will not get so crowded.

Hanoi Street Food at its best. Great experience eating local cuisine, one of which being egg coffee. Try it and you will be pleasantly amazed like myself. Be guided around the streets of Hanoi by an experienced English speaking guide who knew a great deal about the food, city and much more. If there was something you wanted to try, the guide will take you to the best place for it. They also take into account any dietary needs or allergies.To top it off, our guide very kindly gave us a note with all of the foods we tried and where. Another must do! My only regret was not doing this when I first got to Hanoi and was just trying food blind (which was a fun experience, but didn't have a clue what some of things were). Don't let the price put you off. They put on numerous tours throughout the day and worth getting there 15 minutes before. Worth putting your name down that day, but isn't necessary as they have more than one tour at one time. Lasts about three hours and a great way to spend your time - turn up hungry because you get fed like a king/queen.

Fun and fabulous!. You can either join a group tour or hire a private guide. We booked a private guide and there was a bit of a mixup about it despite our confirmation, but it was quickly sorted. Our guide was absolutely lovely! We enjoyed so much all the many many stops and the food was fantastic! She really knew where to go and explained so well about their customs and country. We loved it! The last stop is coffee and it was near a flower vendor. I asked about the cost and our guide quickly took me over and bought me a bouquet! So kind!!

Wow, what an eye opener, loved it.. We went on a morning street food tour and we were with our own guide. The guide was fluent in English and easy to understand. We had no problems asking questions or making suggestions if we wanted to try some of the food, all included in our cost. We met out the front of the Water puppet theatre in the Old Quarter. We went past lots of street food stalls, where the vendors explained the ingredients in their dishes as we tasted them. The spaces in which some of these vendors set up shop was extraordinary. Spent 3 hours on this tour and was thoroughly engrossed all of the time.Strongly recommend.

Great intro to Hanoi's street food, arrive hungry!. Our guide was Lotus who was great and explained what everything was. 7 stops, so arrive very hungry and pace yourself! Everything was delicious, only criticism was the last stop where we had banh mi and egg coffee - I had to use the toilet which was through the kitchen and there were cockroaches everywhere. Bit of a sour note to end on as everywhere else had looked really clean, so would suggest that they reconsider the venue for the final stop.

Perfect way to explore Hanoi food. We had our tour with our guide Sea who spoke great English and made the tour friendly and fun. He showed us some of the best street food and we were so full by the time it was over. We loved ending the tour with egg coffee in a small restaurant that we never could have found ourselves. Sea also taught us a lot about the Vietnamese lifestyle and showed us more than just great street food. This was definitely our favorite thing we did in Hanoi. A must if you love food.

Good food. We booked a private tour with the hotel, cost us 35 dollars each, which included the food. The guide was great, he took us to one small place for noodles, then o e for stir fry etc, we ended up at one foe sweets but we where stuffed. We ended up at a coffee shop foe egg coffee, coffee with condensed milk and an egg yolk. I didn't like this but one of the party did. All in all a very good night.

Street Food Tour. We woke up on our first morning to rain and we were thinking a walking street food tour would not be a fun idea! Especially when we found out our 'British' waterproof jackets must only be waterproof in England!How wrong we were - Hiem (Cherry) was our private guide for the morning and we had the best morning ever! We tried local dishes from the local families in places that you would normally walk passed and places that would almost certainly not exist in the western food hygiene obsessed world.The food was fresh, tasty and unusual. We experienced tasty dishes from 'Nom Bo Kho' (Papaya, peanuts and dried beef salad) and 'Bun Cha' (pork meat balls and rice noodles in a fish sauce, vinegar and mint broth) to a local delicacy 'Balut' (Boiled duck egg embryo). Don't panic - we only tried things we were willing to and weren't forced into anything at all. Another must try is Bo Bia (Fresh grated coconut, fresh sugar cane and sesame sweets in a rice pancake) with a lemon tea - AMAZING. Hiem was fantastic - very good English and incredibly knowledgable about Hanoi and not just the food. I couldn't recommend this tour enough and was a great start to our Vietnamese adventure as we now can recognise some great dishes on the menus!

Fantastic. Our guide "money" was very fun and took us to some great places to eat. Met some great people on the tour and went to places I never would have gone to myself. Food was delicious and there was lots of it!

You must do this.. This was such an awesome experience. We went to 7 or 8 different spots to get food, and our awesome guide talked with us the whole way about the food, Hanoi, and Vietnam in general. Our guide, Sea, said that there are nine guides, but try to get him if you can. He is the best! Don't eat a big lunch, you'll need a lot of room in your stomach for this night out.

A wonderful way to try the local cuisine. My husband and I joined a small group the other night for the night tasting tour. Linh was our guide and she was an absolutely delightful host. She knew so much about the local food and the places we visited. We would never had gone to these places without doing her tour and the food was delicious. Ate about 7 courses and finished with egg coffee which is a must to try. Linh, the company and of course the food is a great way to experience authentic Vietnamese food. Elana and Jimmy

Awesome way to experience Hanoi food . My husband and I loved this tour! During the three hour tour, we tried seven different dishes and had beer and coffee along the way. Our guide was fun and would scream "sticky rice!" to signal us to cross the street. We went into restaurants I would have never gone in by myself and we also got to help make some rice noodles at one place. It was exactly what we were looking for and the cost was quite affordable as well.Ah, also my husband doesn't eat pork or drink alcohol and was always presented with alternative options.

Come hungry, no lie.. I made the mistake of eating a snack two hours before the street food tour. Let's just say I was glad to have some tonic water on hand afterwards, because you basically end up eating about 6 separate meals. If you tell your tour guide ahead of time of any dietary restrictions, they will acommodate the tour and the menu for your request. Vegetarian requests are easy- they just make the dishes without meat in them! (Wish I had known that before eating my snack).The tour lasts anywhere from 2-4 hours (depending on how chatty your group and tour guide are). You will wander the streets of the Old Quater, going from restaurants to hole-in-the-wall eateries. Your tour guide is in charge of ordering for you, and if you have one as great as ours, they will tell you the ingredients, origins, and history of the dish you are eating. They will even give you background on the people who run the eateries.If you are particularly tall or long-legged, do some yoga beforehand. Most of the places you visit have child-sized benches. It is entertaining but come prepared to fit into small, tight places.The food is fantastic, the company is usually very interesting (open minded foodies usually are), and the $25 we paid are well worth it.You end up eating 11 different dishes (some are desserts) so come prepared!

Come hungry. Sunshine was our guide and did a phenomenal job. She is very enthusiastic about being a tour guide and had so many great stories throughout the night. Not to mention she fed us well. We couldn't even finish the last meal. And she accommodated my vegetarian dishes among the meat dishes no problem.
