Great Tour, Very Worth It! Go Hungry!!. We just took the street food tour today with our guide, Miss Moon. It was so much fun and very worth the money!! My husband and I, along with 2 other couples took the 11AM group tour. Our guide was so nice and knowledgable and made the whole experience very fun. She gave us tons of information about all the food we are and even the city. She even showed us the "right" way to eat everything! Miss Moon made sure to ask all food preferences right from the beginning (vegetarian, no pork, no seafood, only seafood, etc.) and remembered everyone's choice at every stop. We ended up getting much more food than initially expected and everything was SO good! Definitely make sure you go hungry!! Our group can usually eat a lot of food and we were all very full by the end! My only regret is that we didn't to this sooner in our trip to Hanoi because I want to go back to several of the places we visited!

Excellent tour!!. We did the 3hr scooter food tour and it was excellent - our guides shin and lily were great they explained lots of things to us about the food we were eating and the places we went, would defiantly recommend this tour.

Incredible food & amazing guide. Our amazing guide Sea made us feel so welcomed in Hanoi and introduced us to such a variety of wonderful food. He was very knowledgable about both Vietnamese food and culture and shared a lot of great insight on both. I would highly recommend this tour, but come hungry because it's a lot of food!

Perfect way to be introduced to Vietnamese kitchen!. We did the Hanoi Street Food Tour on our second night in Hanoi, just to get to know the local specialties and good places to eat. Worked out perfectly! We had this nice and very friendly guide Sea who took us to about 7 locations - from egg coffee and Bahn Mi to everything I forgot the name of but was lovely food. $20 is not cheap compared to just having dinner in Hanoi, however I think it's worth it because of the amount of food you get and the things you get to learn about the Vietnamese kitchen.

Excellent way of enjoying Hanoi. we had a great half day tour with our guide and enjoyed a lot of amazing food in Hanoi. Our guide was very enthusiastic and spoke very good English. She not only let us enjoyed the food but also help us know a lot about Vietnamese history and culture. Loved this! highly recommended!

A must for food lovers. I went on the street food tour with my girlfriend and would highly recommend it. It might seem a bit pricey (25 USD for a group tour and 30 if you want to be only two) - but you get great value for your money and will discover food you would never find without a guide. The tour lasts for three full hours and you will get to experience everything from starters to desserts - as well as a draft beer that is supplied daily from the brewery in Hanoi. Our guide (Kat) spoke good English which is definitely not a guarantee in Hanoi. If you are a food lover this tour is really a great experience.

Wonderful food and tour guide!. Our group of 7 family & friends had a wonderful time on this half-day tour. Our good was "Miss Moon" who was absolutely delightful. Here English was excellent. She was kind, figured out how to adapt for the vegetarian in the group, and kept us together despite our being distracted by vendors ("keep together like sticky rice"!). Each of the 6 or 7 stops had wonderful foods from pho to desserts, coffee and beer. Loved this!

A delicious way of seeing Hanoi. We had Moon as our tour guide and she was informative and enthusiastic! The food was excellent. Only locals eating at these restaurants/food stands! I highly recommend a tour, especially if its with Moon!

A must do tour!. We cannot recommend this tour highly enough! Our guide was Kat - a delightful, charming, well informed english speaking local who made the trip around 8 different venue's an immense pleasure and thoroughly enjoyable experience. She pushed our boundaries out of our normal comfort zone, took us to places we wouldn't have entertained going into and suggesting foods that we were certainly unaccustomed to. Big guys beware, the stools in some restaurants are small but Kat always seem to manage to find a larger one for me! Post tour she was kind enough to email details of all the foods we had eaten, many thanks.

Great way to explore Hanoi. Did the half day walking street food tour which was a great way to try local food one might not ordinarily try. Our tour guide "Money" had a great sense of humour and definitely added to an already great experience.

Moped street food tour. literally just got back. What a fantastic experience and the two girls , Shin and Lily, where great drivers,very informative and entertaining. great food and lots of it. Definitely to be recommended, will go down as a high light of our stay in Hanoi😜😉😀

Brilliant activity to do!!. This is a great activity to do in Hanoi especially if you have just arrived in Vietnam. Our guide 'sea' was absolutely fantastic, really good English, gave us a good insight into vietnam life and was loads of fun too. He brought us around to 8 different places sampling various dishes. The food was gorgeous, we were so full after! Also a great introduction to street food in Vietnam and myself and my boyfriend returned to 2 of the places after our tour. Great fun and would really recommend it!!

AmazIng tour and guide. we booked a private tour via email about a month before we were due to arrive in Vietnam. We had a quick response and decided to book a private tour. Our guide was Kat and she spoke great English and was so knowledgable. We had such a great time with her and the time just flew by and we were so full. Can't recommend this highly enough as you will get to try food and restaurants you would never even know existed.

Great food and a great guide!. We had a blast on this tour and got to eat some really good and really authentic Vietnamese street food. Our guide, Nga, was unbelievably charming and knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. Aside from knowing quite a bit about the local area and foods, she also filled us in on Vietnamese history, culture, and tradition along the way. All in all it was a blast! I'd highly recommend it to anyone looking to try some authentic food and have a fun night out on the town.
Wonderful experience. Nice guie and great food. Sea made lots of comments about vietnamese food and lifestyle, it was like having a friend showing you where to eat.

Great experience!. Our guide kiwi was really knowledgable a out the food and also gave us a quick insight into Vietnamese culture. It was really great trying so many different dishes that we wouldn't have otherwise tried and can't wait to go back to try them again whilst we are here. We loved all of the dishes and drinks, the egg coffee was particularly nice! Kiwi was great answering our questions and would highly recommend these guys to do a tour with, the group were lovely, only four of us but getting to know them was part of the fun and would do it again!

Street Food Tour on a Motorbike. You can book the street food tour also on a motorbike. You try all kind of food at different places. Driving around is lot fun. "Money" tells a lot more stories about Vietnam and Vietnamese culture than about food only. And she is a careful driver! Great tour!

The best introduction to Hanoi's street food culture. Normally I am wary of organised tours but we were so glad we took the Hanoi Street Food Tour. Our delightful and passionate guide, Lotus, gave us a great introduction to Hanoi's famous street food culture and took us to places we perhaps wouldn't have dared to try otherwise. Great value and very interesting.

Great street tour. Definitely changed the rest of my trip in Hanoi.. I was full by the time I arrived for the street food tour but I didn't want to miss it. There was four of us in my group (USA and Australia). I'm glad I had Sea as my tour guide because he was extremely knowledgable and passionate. He didn't only take us around to eat good street food but he explained to us what we were eating and what it was made out of. When we got to certain food stands, he would have us participate in the cooking process which was great. He made sure that he interacted and learned how things were cooked. Sea also brought us around to the old quarter and showed us how a typical apartment in Hanoi looks like. It was definitely more than a street food tour which is why this tour was extremely great. At the end of the tour, Sea invited all of us to his village the next day and I took his offer. Sea brought me to his village and I was able to hang out with him and his friends for the next few days. I wasn't sure what to expect when I arrived in Hanoi. Luckily, I stumbled across the street food tour and managed to not only eat tons of great street food but also make some new friends. Thank you Sea for a wonderful and unforgettable experience in Hanoi.

Great way to sample local street eats. Our tour guide Sea was a phenomenal host for this tour. His passion for Vietnamese cuisine and culture shines through. Sea loves his work and is genuinely interested in getting to know the group. It was a perfect group size of 8 people, and we really enjoyed getting to know each other. We happened to come from Commonwealth countries (Canada, Australia, Singapore and India) and had a great vibe going.... which enhanced the dining experience. Loved the bun cha... and had the best fruit bowl ever: lots of local variety fruit topped with a magical combination of coconut milk and condensed milk...yum. There are daily tours at 5pm and 6:30pm; 3 hour duration and $20 USD. I am a big foodie and highly recommend this tour company.

Our tour guide Kiwi was great.Young, spunky, interesting and nolegeble about the as real.. A great way of getting a taste and a tour of the Old Quarter at the same time.Something I couldn't have done on my own.

A must do food tour. We did the 11am tour and there were only four of us in the group which was nice. Our guide miss moon was very knowledgeable and had very good English. We tried foods we never would of if we hadn't gone on this tour. The tour was great for sampling new flavours and picking up some bits of Vietnamese. You should definitely do tho early on in your stay in Hanoi!

A must do - best part of holiday so far. I dragged my husband along to this, as I love street food but he is a very picky eater. Of the 8 or so stops he ate every dish until he was full, beautiful fresh and delicious food.Our guide Phuong (Phoenix) was so cute and funny, with excellent English and expert local knowledge.This was the best tour so far, wonderful value for money and a great way to spend 3 hours in Hanoi Group size was 4 people which was perfect.

Hanoi Best dessert in the street. Mix fruits cocktail with ice cream or mix fruits cocktailThe best dessert in the street .The store will open in the evening,when you pass the street, you will see a lot people sit on a small chair at the roadsideevery person with one bowl mix fruits cockail or w/icecreamYou must try it.at To Tich Land Hanoi

Must-do tour as soon as you arrive in Hanoi. We did this tour a few days after arriving in Hanoi, and I wish we'd done it on our first day as it really gave us a better understanding of the food and the city of Hanoi. Our guide was Lotus and I can't speak highly enough of the attention and help she gave us. Cat is vegetarian, and Lotus had a word with the staff in every restaurant we visited to ensure she got something vegetarian prepared. The food was all excellent, and Lotus took us to the best restaurants, sometimes off the beaten track. Lotus was very friendly and even stayed out for a beer with us afterwards. Our evening tour was supposed to take 3 hours, but Lotus stayed with us for 4 and a half hours to ensure we all had a great time. Don't miss out on the chance to try the Egg Coffee, a real pleasant surprise.

Yum!. As many have mentioned, this is a great way to get your bearings about Hanoi's street food which you definitely want to partake in during your visit. Cherry was a great guide and customized things to the group...giving us some different options when she found many had tasted some of the standard dishes. She even found Bun Cha for us when most places had been out during Tet due to pork's popularity (and a # of places closed)...you could feel her enthusiasm and desire to ensure we had a good time and tasted the best dishes.The pho stop was wonderful (where we also tasted chicken and sticky rice and another noodle soup made with chicken and pork) as well as the marvelous banh mi and the egg coffee. We ended on the beer corner, tasting the fresh beer and some beer snacks and socializing with our fun group. You will definitely get plenty of food and have fun! Cherry was very open and it was a great chance to ask questions about food, good spots, etc. We couldn't do it until our last night due to the Tet holiday closures, but definitely try to do it early on so you can go back to get your favorites!

Delicious. Sea was such a fun guide, he was so sweet I wish he could be my friend back home! the group was nice and small, and dang! was the food good. This was our very first night in Hanoi and in Asia, in fact, and I would definitely recommend doing this as early in your trip as you can. It gave us the courage to eat mostly street food our whole trip, and to find new dishes that we loved. They were also super accommodating with my mom's gluten-free diet. We went back to the same stalls our next few days in Hanoi because we couldn't stop talking about how we wanted more of the food!

Excellent Tour. Went as a group of 7 tonight with our tour guide Sea. We made about 9 stops and I think we got lucky and had a great group of people. Definitely suggest doing this tour as soon as you land in Hanoi as it's very informative. All of the food was delicious and the restaurant owners were all very welcoming. We booked the 6:30 tour so we got Sea as our guide. He was brilliant. Spoke great English, was very honest and open and taught us all about the food and Hanoi answering all sorts of questions from us. Go hungry as there's plenty of food. Egg coffee was a highlight! I would recommend Sea as he was so funny and smart thanks again! Couple from England.

eat like a Hanoian. stayed in Hanoi and the first thing we did was book a street food tour. This was brilliant we got down with the locals and ate what they did with our tour guide Kiwi telling us all about it. From that day we only ate street food.Thank you Kiwi it was amazing Hanoistreetfoodtour.com 74 Hang Bac Street at Kim's Tours building

Best thing we did in Hanoi!. Vietnamese food is so delicious but, overwhelmed by the variety of dishes and inability to speak the language, we found ourselves sticking to the same tried-and-true favorites when dining around town. In an attempt to spread our culinary wings we booked the Hanoi Street Food walking tour. The tour was the best thing we did in Hanoi and in our top five favorite experiences in SE Asia! Smile, our super friendly and knowledgeable guide, introduced us to new dishes and patiently answered questions related to ingredients and preparation. We also had a barrage of questions related to the buzz on the street for the upcoming Lunar New Year and really appreciated Smile's explanations of the traditions and practices around the holiday. It would be a shame to be in Hanoi and not go on this tour. Highly recommended and ask for Smile!

A great tour to get your food bearings in Hanoi. I would highly recommend this tour when you first arrive in Hanoi to allow you to get your bearings on the best street food vendors in the Old Quarter. This will then allow you to revisit the ones that you enjoy the most. We had some great food, including visiting "Dessert St" and egg coffee (delicious!!). We went back to several of the places / restaurants over the next few days. Unfortunately we can't remember the guides name but she was very good and gave us a big hug at the end of the night. Highly recommend it!

A must do - we loved Miss Moon!. We took the 11am tour with the fabulous Miss Moon. There was only one other couple which I think was the perfect size group.Miss Moon was the perfect guide - we had 12 things to try in total, some larger dishes at tables, some snacks standing on the street. Favourites were the crab soup, bun cha and the sugar cane and coconut snack from the man on the bike! I understand that quite a few of the vendors we saw don't actually open in the evening, just for lunch until they sell out, so we were glad we opted for this tour rather than one of the later ones.I think $20 is a bargain for this tour - we looked at food tours in HCMC and Hoi An and couldn't find any under $40 for what sounded like less stops! A highlight of our trip.

Amazing tour!. We absolutely loved this tour. Our amazing guide, Miss Moon, took us to 10 spots in total. You will leave with a "food baby", as she calls it, so don't eat breakfast (if you do the afternoon tour) and you also probably won't need much dinner. Highly recommended and try to get Miss Moon if you can!

Must-do in Hanoi. Our guide Sea led us on an amazing tour. Not only did we get to try a lot of delicious food (7 stops total with several helpings of the dishes at each!) but we also learned a TON from Sea about the food we were eating, other foods that are typical, Hanoi life and Vietnamese people. He was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. He even invited any of us who would be around Hanoi longer to visit his family in their home if we'd like to see how a typical Vietnamese family lives! Such a warm and welcoming person. Which really made the tour special and gave us a true glimpse into Vietnamese life and culture. Not to mention that the food, which was the original purpose of the tour, was delicious and authentic. We ate alongside locals on the sidewalk but always felt safe that we were eating food that would not make us sick. I highly recommend this as an introduction to Vietnamese culture and food (not to mention as a way to have the most interesting dinner you'll have in Hanoi!).

Good. If you are a western 'I-need-a-clean-restaurant' type of person this is a perfect introduction to the Vietnamese kitchen. We already ate everything that moved for 2 weeks so we didn't get a lot of new things, but the quality of the food was good. Food wise the egg coffee is a must have in Hanoi. Also we liked the bicycle guy with his coconut wrap. Linh is an excellent guide. I especially liked that she took us into one of the alleys and showed us how the less fortunate families have to live the Hanoi hustle.

Best way to explore local Hanoian dishes. This is the way to go if you want to explore the streets of Hanoi and try local foods. They take the guess work out of which places are authentic, clean and legit. They've done the research so you don't have to or get lost searching for a place. Our local guide, Sea was passionate about showing us the best fare in Hanoi, and taught us about local life and answered any questions we had. He was very funny and accommodating, making sure all the guests were happy. He was a super star, tour guide. After the tour, a few of us on the tour grabbed drinks in one of those busy alleys, squatting on those tiny stools with $25 cent beers. This tour was an experience we enjoyed on many levels!

Our favourite thing we did in Hanoi!. If you are a foodie, you have have have have to do this tour. The food was incredible and you eat just like the locals! We actually went back to some of the restaurants because it was good! Our tour guide was fun and informative and we had a blast. It is also reasonably priced, considering other food tours can cost up to $100. It's worth it! Do it now!

Great Food tour. This tour should be taken as soon as you land in Vietnam, is the perfect way to get in touch with a delicious cuisine. You stroll around the Old Quarter from eatery to eatery with a maximum of 10/12 people, and you taste several very good dishes. The guide we had, Cherry, was simply wonderful, you can tell she loves her job and she is very good in sharing her knowledge with her guests. I don't eat meat and she could arrange very good alternatives for me. She was also very good in creating a good and relaxed atmosphere. The price was really reasonable and it was worth every dollar.

Enjoyable tour that just needs a little more attention to detail. I live in Hanoi and in January, my parents and brother came to visit me from Australia. We decided to do the Hanoi Street Food Tour partly because it had been recommended to me and also due to the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. As there were four of us, the company recommended and arranged a private tour for us. Our guide was personable and friendly, however, we do not feel she really went out her way to cater to our tastes considering it was a private tour. My mother is not fond of pork or egg and although, we appreciate these are very common ingredients in Vietnamese cooking rather than trying to limit the number of dishes with these ingredients most things we ate had pork and/or egg in it. This wouldn't have been a big issue except our guide took the time at the beginning of the tour to find out if we had any food preferences or allergies but never really catered to them despite taking the time to find out what they are. Also we felt the tour was a little overpriced for what we got. There were a lot of dishes that were very similar and for $25 per person for a private tour you expect a little bit more diversity and for your preferences or interests to be catered to. This tour did have its redeeming features though, our guide was very informative and we learnt a lot about Hanoi and Vietnamese cuisine. We enjoyed the tour but I think it just needs a little more attention to detail to make it a great tour.

Hanoi Street Food Tour with Sea!. Sea was a great guide. He was really kind and was helpful. We ate so much. It was all tasty. We started of with Bun Cha, Banh Cuon Thit, Banh My, Cumquat Tea, Nem, Pillow Cake, Crab Noodle Soup. Dessert was fresh fruit with coconut and condensed milk finished with Vietnamese coffee (with egg). This was velvety and delicious. Highly recommend this tour, and ask for Sea. Courtney & Danny

Try it, it's brilliant. We went to 8 different places and tried 6 delicious savoury snacks / meals, 1 sweet and finished with the delicious egg coffee. Drinks / beer is provided at one of the savoury stops. It's a brilliant way to find some of the best street food providers and to have a very sociable and informative evening (we went from 5-8pm). Sea, our guide, was great at bringing our small group together and his descriptions of his and his family's life really made it for us.

Sea rules! Fun evening. We had a great time with Sea on our tour--he was super informative and so much fun to hang out with. We ate a lot of great food at small family-run restaurants, which is the way to do it in Hanoi. All the food was delicious and we were stuffed by the time we stopped for the equally yummy egg coffee. My only suggestion would be to maybe throw in a curveball of something a bit adventurous for the folks that have eaten some of the typical local food and are looking for something a bit weird or different :)Overall, great way to spend an evening in Hanoi and enjoy the amazing food the city has to offer!
Hanoi street food tour. This will be a great experience for those who visit Hanoi at the first time. Food is very delicious and cheap....

Amazing Tour. Was really keen to experience the famous Hanoi street food but was nervous to try places I was unsure of with my more conservative wife. This was a great option with lots to try, make sure you come hungry because really was a lot to eat! Our guide Nga (nickname Money) was also amazing and great guide for the food and Hanoi/Vietnam in general

Great food in a great city!. This was actually a great experience. Hanoi was the last city we visited during our stay in Vietnam so we thought already tried everything. So when we got on this tour, we were surprised that we still haven't tried everyy Vietnamese food. My favorite stop on the tour was the coffee with egg. Overall experince, excellent!

Hands down the best thing I did in Hanoi. Our guide was Linh and she was fantastic. She went above and beyond my expectations and I am very grateful for her showing us around Hanoi. The tour is fantastic and the food delicious. A great way to start your stay in Hanoi as you will know where to go to eat from there onwards.

Best tour ever. My partner and I did the 5pm tour today and we are so glad we did. There was four of us in the tour lead by our wonderful and amazing guide Linh. She was outstanding at discribing the food we were eating. You will dine at six local street vendors, five savory and one dessert finishing of the tour in a cafe.Once again thank you Linh you are the best tour guide we have met so far on our travels.

Superb food tour round a great city. We met Ling at the start point early one evening for a 4 hour private food tour.Food was fantastic, Hanoi is a superb city at night and Ling was a very helpful, friendly guide.As Vietnam's food is some of the best anywhere, a food tour is a must during any visit.The tour included Ban Mi, soups, salads, pho bo, fresh spring rolls, chili fruit, some fried rolls, deserts etc. Was absolutely stuffed when we finished!The egg coffee in Giang Cafe is incredible...! Worth the tour just for this.Very recommended!Steve

Great introduction to the flavours of Hanoi. Our guide was Sea and he was fantastic. We went (my daughter & I) to 8 different locations and tasted an amazing variety of foods - places we may have not ventured to ourselves but what a great experience. Sea also gave us insight into the lives of the street food vendors and also the country people coming to Hanoi to sell their products. We tasted Pho, spring rolls, rice paper rolls, Vietnamese sandwiches, fruit salad, egg coffee (a real surprise) and everything was delicious and so much food. It was our first day in Vietnam and a great introduction as to what we might enjoy food wise. It was a great experience and I would recommend it to anyone who wanted to try the delights of street food and unsure where to begin. Thank you also to Sea who was a very knowledgeable and helpful guide.

A must do in Hanoi!. This tour I found to be one of the best things I have done in my travels of South East Asia. It was great to have a local tour guide walk you around the main areas of the city and take you into small local restaurants that I would not have known or went to. The food was clean and delicious, I was so full by the end and met a great bunch of people. I would strongly recommend this tour!

Get ready for a taste adventure. I cannot say enough. I have already recommended 3 different people to hit this tour up! Go early, stay late and as TU told us. SKIP BREAKFAST! We did this tour 1 1/2 years ago and I still have such fin memories! My wife and I are chefs and our first morning in Hanoi was spent with Mark, one word, ok two, Bun Cha. Life changing. We spent the afternoon with Tu, running from food stall to tiny chair, eating, laughing and loving it! Thanks guys! Good luck with that Brazilian group I sent you! Take care of Sonia, she is a blast.We will return!

Best way to start a visit in Hanoi. I had booked a private tour for the two of us by email and asked to be picked up at our hotel. 15 minutes before the tour was due to start a man was waiting for us in the lobby of our hotel, the beautiful Sofitel Legend Metropole, put us in a taxi and told the driver where to go. Then the man disappeared, telling us he'd meet us at our destination! What a very odd way to start what was going to be three fantastic hours!But after a five minutes drive through a bustling city we had never set foot in, we did reach our destination and our man was there to open the taxi door for us (did he use teleportation or one of the millions of scooter in town, we will never know!).Hien/Cherry was our guide for the evening. Wonderful young woman who seemed to really love her city and the food she made us try on the evening. We had eight different stops all around the Old Quarter. From Bun cha via Banh mi,spring rolls, crab soup, coconut and sesame sweet, we tasted some truly wonderful food.We ended up our walk drinking an egg chocolate drink ( we are not coffee drinkers) and a delicious ginger tea. Absolutely great way to spend our very first few hours discovering a City and a country we had never visited before.Loved it!

So much food!. Miss Moon was our guide and she was great! We must have stopped at nearly 10 locations for all sorts of foods and drinks. We were able to try all of the specialties that are available in Hanoi. Miss Moon's English was great and she was very knowledgeable about the food and the culture. This is the best way to experience authentic Vietnamese/Hanoi culture. Our favorite spot was her off-the-beaten path location for Ban Cha - highly recommended!

we finish on time, full and happy :). We did take our street food tour last December 2014. The food was great and our tour guide (her name is Kiwi) is awesome. They (tour agency) seem to make sure there is no repeated type of food in every station. Don't be mislead by the tour name "Street Food". For me it implies something extraordinary like insects, chicken intestines or other local delicacies. The foods are all within the bracket of usual edible foods. On the other hand our guide, Kiwi, is superb. She socially intelligent at her age (just graduated university). She knows when to talk and when to let us talk. She knows when to impose (in a lovely way) and when to adjust the itinerary for the group's demand. In the end, we finish on time, full and happy :)

Best $20 you'll spend!. We went for the Hanoi Street Food Tour on our first night in Hanoi and it was a great decision. Sure, $20 sounds "expensive" for dinner in Hanoi, but what you're really paying for is the luxury of not needing to know where you're going and of not having to worry and of knowing that the food you'll be eating will be DELICIOUS!!! The other thing you pay $20 for is learning how to cross the street. Our lovely guide Hien instructed us that she would say "sticky rice!!!" and then we would all cross as a pack. After doing that a few times, crossing the street seemed much less scary. One interesting experience from our tour was when we came to one of the stops and found that there wasn't enough space for us in the normal area - so we went up some stairs and ended up having that food (spring rolls, salty donuts, and something else fried) in the family kitchen. You truly feel like they are taking care of you. Also the egg coffee was yummy! Highly recommended!A tip: I took pictures of the food from each stop and something indicating what it was called (menu, sign, etc.) on my phone with the geo tag so that we could find our way back later.

Smile. We booked a private tour and had a wonderful young guide named Miss Smile who was so refreshing, professional and lovely to be with. She led to us to many different interesting food places always with great facts and conversation in between. We know Miss Smile will be a great tour guide and wish her the best of luck.You absolutely cannot go wrong with Vietnamese street food. Always an absolutely joy.

Fantastic Adventure. We went with two of our friends on January 18th. We had a wonderful time with our Tour GuideLan Anh (Kiwi) She was just 21 and had recently graduated from College, her English was terrific.She was very knowledgeable about the city and took us to 7 wonderful places to try the different street foods and drinks offered in Hanoi. It was a pleasure to sit and eat with local people, they were all very friendly to us. If your looking for a fun time, take this tour.

Great Way to Explore Hanoi. We had a great experience on a private tour with Hanoi Street Food. Our guide was Lotus. She was charming, knowledgeable and fun. Perhaps our favorite thing about this tour is that each guide is allowed to pick their favorite vendors (each is checked for cleanliness according to their site). This meant we got to try Lotus' favorite spots and hear why she enjoys them. We tried nine different spots. Each was great for different reasons, but the best part was the stories Lotus told us. We tried Bun Cha, Green Papaya Salad, Bahn Mi, Fried Spring Rolls, Beef Pho, Lemon Tea, Egg Coffee, Fried Bananas, and several more. Lotus even got us to try dried eel (she told us this is the one food she does not like, so I felt I had to accept the challenge...it wasn't bad). My favorite dish was the beef pho (well done and half cooked) from the stand Lotus goes to with her mom and dad each Sunday. The pho was so good we went back the next night. My wife's favorite was the egg coffee at the end. We also made a return trip to that shop. I agree with some others who posted that it would be great to learn a bit more about the history of the dishes, but in the end that really isn't that important on this type of tour, especially when you are getting the personal history from the guide.

Delicious, entertaining and enlightening!. We signed up for the street food tour at the last minute after hearing great reviews from other tourists we had met and we were not disappointed! Was even better than expected, our guide Linh was lovely! So informative not only on hanoi street food but also hanoi history and culture. She had an excellent sense of humour , and impressive English. We had a great time and excellent food! If it hadn't been our last night in hanoi we would have considered signing up with Linh again as she says she mixes up the itinerary tour to tour. Looking back the food tour was a top highlight for hanoi, thanks Linh :)

Nighttime culinary adventure to remember. My husband and I went on our second day in Hanoi (a good idea since you can return to your favorite places later), and asked for the private tour option. We had a fantastic time! Lotus, our guide, was truly amazing. First, she asked us what foods we've already had on our travels, and customized the tour based on our responses. Her dedication to offering us something we haven't yet had and to showing us where/how the locals eat really made the night memorable. Sitting on tiny stools, my husband's 6'2 physique looked particularly amusing - always a bonus! Other than Lotus, it was, of course, the food that really made an impression. From the legendary Pho place we visited, to trying my hand at rolling a Ban Cuon (total fail on my part), to sipping some tea and crunching some sunflower seeds with the youth of Hanoi, to stopping into a desert place and having Lotus' special mix made for us (delicious!), I cannot recommend the entire experience enough. It's not a small amount of food, so eat light that day. Also, although I think it would be fun to do this as part of a group, I really thought that the individual attention and customization of a private tour made it even more memorable.

So much great food!. The second night we stayed in Hanoi, we did the food tour. We read lots of great reviews, so we were really excited. We were a small group of just 2 couples, but that made the experience even better. We had some amazing catfish fresh springrolls at a small restaurant we allready passed a few times during the day. How little did we know what great food they serve! Our tourguide Ha was a very lovely girl, a real foodie.She was very ingaged and we talked not only about food, but also about architecture, history and culture. It was great to hear how a young girl lives here in Hanoi area.She wrote down all the dishes we ate, and showed us on the map where we had been. The hidden coffee shop was actually in somebodies house. This tour should really be on your list if you still have a few days to spend in Hanoi, so you can return to your favorite spots in the days after. Our tour was scheduled for 3 hours, but she walked us home to the hotel after 4,5 hours! Ha is a really special guide that opens up to you and shows you so much more than only the best food places.

Fantastic food. Great guide.. We had Cherry as our guide, and she was brilliant, good English, friendly, informative, and had great enthusiasm.We went to about 8 different places, most of which we will be returning to over the next couple of days!This is definitely a must do, and I'd recommend doing it as soon as you arrive, so you can use all these hidden little gems for your stay here.

Fantastic Tour. Great way to sample food of the old quarter. Very informative tour with stops at authentic local places.. Got to sample a variety of delicious food, including bun cha and crab soup. . Our guide Miss Moon was great. Highly recommended

Bring chopsticks. Our guide 'Sea' was fun, informative. But I'd recommend if you are have any issues with hygiene that you bring your own chop sticks. Also, best to do this on your first or second night in Hanoi versus your last.

Amazing tour - Hien was ace!. My husband & I did this street food tour after recommendation from friends, on the first leg of our Vietnam honeymoon! Our guide was Hien was was absolutely wonderful - a sweet, attentive, funny girl who was so keen to answer all of our questions & show us her city! All of the food was delicious & perfectly explained by Hien - we certainly did not go hungry!!! Our group was 6 people including us which was a perfect number! Very highly recommended - a great way to see the city!

A highlight tour of of Hanoi. Fantastic tour with Urban Adventures. 3 hours walking tour around Hanoi Old Quarter & market areas. We stopped at 5-6 places to sample street food. I was a bit worried about hygiene etc, but we were told these place have been thoroughly checked out. The food was delicious! From pork mince baguette, rice pancake with fish sauce & lime juice, BBQ pork, chicken, tofu, tomato, mushroom, bok choi, fruit salad with condensed milk, egg coffee. Some was stand up, some was sit down on the little plastic stools inside the street stalls. Special mention to our tour guide San Toa, very informative and friendly man. I really think Urban Adventures hand pick their tour guides very well. (we also had a great guide to Halong Bay with the same company). Overall great experience, definitely a highlight of our stay in Hanoi.

Authentic Experience and Amazing Food. Authentic Experience and Amazing FoodMy friend and I booked the Meals on Wheels Street Food Tour on our first day of arriving in Hanoi . Our tour drivers were incredibly friendly and knowledgable about their city and we saw some places we wouldn't have known about without them. I was initially a bit scared of riding on the back of the bike but the driving was quite slow and felt safe as we cruised across the motorcycle choked streets of Hanoi. The food was of course the highlight and the places we visited were authentic and most importantly very local, giving you a taste of both the delicacies and local way of life. Worthwhile tour for anyone wanting to taste and see Hanoi like a local.

Amazing! . By far one of the best things we did in Hanoi, came away feeling as if we were going to pop but totally worth it! Would 100% recommend! Sea (our tour guide) was the sweetest guy I have ever met, he knew his stuff and had a great sense of humour!! Fab night!

Your guide to Hanoi Street Food. Following the advice of TA reviews, our group of four took this tour on our first day in Hanoi. Best advice ever! On arrival at the office, the tour was overbooked so we were fortunate to have our own private tour with guide, Linh, a final year student and experienced guide. Linh made the tour fun and interesting. She was very knowledgeable of the various food we sampled and places around the Old Quarter. Our favourite was the Bun rieu cua and the banh mi (washed down with fresh lime juice). We were really pleased that we went on the tour as we would have missed so many of the delights had we tried to do it ourselves. By the end of the tour, we were so full that we had to forgo our beloved Vietnamese coffee. Great value and highly recommended. Thank you, Ms Linh.

Good food overdose :). The food tour was great. There was really a lot of food, so make sure you come really hungry. I think we went to around 10 places and food was tasty in all of them. I especially liked the egg hot chocolate, it was soooo delicious! Our guide Lotus was amazing. She was really a lot of fun and also gave us a lot of interesting details about Vietnam and Hanoi. This tour is a must-do in Hanoi!

Fooooood!!!. I am normally a bit cautious of tours and always prefer to make my own discoveries when I travel but I can't recommend Hanoi Street Food tour enough! Our guide, Sea, took us to places with some incredibly tasty food which we would've never otherwise discovered (either easily missed on the street or rather difficult to convince yourself to eat there as a Western visitor). Everything was perfect, great value - 5/5, I still have dreams about that food and egg coffee! :)

Don't think, Just do it!. There are enough 5 star reviews so I am sure there is good reason for everyone reading this to do this tour. I can help with a few tips though. (1) Prefer the day tour because you shouldn't take heavy dinner. (2) Either skip the previous meal or have it well in advance or you would not be able to appreciate everything to the extent it deserves. (3) Your guide would take you to 6-7 different stalls so keep that in mind and eat little amounts of everything. (4) Ask your guide for longer walks between the meals, you would be able to explore more of old quarter and easily digest whatever you eat. (5) And lastly, don't think about the bike tours, walking tours are cheap and best.

Great for first night in hanoi. Hanoi can be overwhelming at first and the tour is a great way to ease in to the culture of the city by sampling all of the different dishes it has to offer. My guide "Sea" was an absolute gent and kept us all at ease throughout the tour. I'd highly recommend it.

Delicious secrets revealed!!. I am so glad I decided to jump on board and follow a food tour rather than try and discover things by myself as not only were the dishes that we sampled absolutely delicious and in places I would have no idea about, our tour guide was very entertaining and enhanced the culinary experience ten fold. My buddy and I decided on a lunch time session and we were lucky to get the ever so cheerful Miss Moon!! Miss Moon was a joy to follow around as she radiated an enthusiasm that would make you think you were the first and only group she had ever led around. We made sure to skip breakfast that morning as I wanted to enjoy every dish on offer and I am so glad I did. There was quite a bit of food to sample. Miss Moon also made sure those with any special dietary requirements were fully catered for. In fact, I was jealous of my vegetarian friends alternative dishes on many occasions! As a result of this great experience, we managed to re-visit quite a few eateries to enjoy our favourite dishes a few more times. I mean, who would know about where to get such great egg coffee and fresh draught beer for NZD$0.30!!

Foodie Heaven. If it's possible, I would recommend doing this the first day or two of your trip to Hanoi. I wish we would have done this towards the beginning of our stay versus the end, because we stopped at so many places and tried so many things that I would have loved to have again. We enjoyed the Bum Bo Nam Bo so much, we went back to get it again late that night for dinner.Our guide was Lotus and she was so helpful and informative along the way. Be prepared, you will not go home hungry on this tour. Honestly, there is probably too much food but without so many dishes, we wouldn't have tried so many things. I would suggest sharing some of the dishes with someone else if you can so you have room by the end. Can you tell I'm trying to emphasize how much food you eat?!A food tour like this would cost double the price in the states. It's really a great bargain and introduces you to dishes you probably wouldn't have tried without know what they were first. And now I'll feel more comfortable ordering Vietnamese dishes when I go to restaurants here in the US.

There is a reason it's No.1 food tour. Stumbled across this place after walking around the old quarter looking for something to eat. Decided to jump on the next leaving tour which was the 5pm with Nga. Great tasting food with a good range of different things to eat. The guide was amazing! Nha gave us a mini tour of the city between food places. She really knew her stuff. Would highly recommend. Good value for money. I wish I did this earlier in my stay because I really want to go back to the places but unfortunately I fly out in the morning

Could have been better. Hien was our guide for a mid-morning street food adventure. I've been to Hanoi many times and was hoping to try something new, something only locals would know. We had banh my, bun cha, banh cuon, bo bia, assorted fried dumplings/spring rolls, egg coffee, papaya salad and a fruity dessert. One thing is for certain - we were stuffed! What was really lacking on this tour was more in-depth information on the origins of each dish, how they vary from region, and general historical context of the neighborhood / Old Quarter / Hanoi. Hien knew answers to pointed questions, but did not really give information unless prompted. If you want someone to lead you by the hand and order food for you, then this tour is for you. If you'd like a side a history/background with your pho, then perhaps a different tour would be better.

Love, love, love!!. Just got back from the Hanoi Street Food tour and am feeling very full and happy. I wanted to check this out for some family members coming to the city next month. The food was amazing and our tour guide "Moon" was fantastic. We had 10 stops, so I'd advise you go with an empty belly. We tried a crab noodle dish, bun chau (bbq pork, noodles/broth), fish/beef rolls, crab spring rolls and crab/rice flour pillows, rice pancakes w/mushrooms,local beer, a pastry donut-ish item with cream filling, fruit bowl with coconut milk, and famous Hanoi egg coffee. So delicious and worth every penny of the $20US fee. It takes 3 hours and I went at lunch, but there are evening times as well. I wish I had done this long ago!

Truly 5 star experience!. We were so impressed with this tour and with our guide Miss Moon. We took the mid day tour and visited 10 local food spots in 3 hours. Our group had no food restrictions so the streets were open to us - but the tour company can tailor stops to your dietary needs. We learned so much on this tour including basic greetings in Vietnamese, customs related to the new year holiday, and found ourselves engrossed in the wonder of Vietnamese food and the history of various food sites we visited. A food and culture extravaganza!The food? Simply delicious! I wish we had done this tour our first day in Vietnam. By far the best food we ate during our entire week long visit here.The guide? Superb. Miss Moon answered all of our food and non food questions - patiently listening and responding to our many questions. She also took great delight in our wonderment with each new delicious experience!Highly recommend! Book now!

An Absolute Must Do. Took the Hanoi street food tour with Kim Tours for the lunch time excursion. If you think you know Vietnamese food by merely self sampling around town, your senses and mind will be opened when you get up close and personal with a guided tour of this cities best street food eateries. The tour is well run, perfectly organized and great effort has been expended to find the top vendors. Our tour guide Moon was efficient, knowledgeable, genuinely interested in our safety and satisfaction. She taught us all the ingredients, showed us how to eat the various dishes and answered every single question our group had. To fully engage with this countries cuisine having a guide take you on the culinary journey through the old town makes it worth every penny of the affordable 20 dollar tour. You will not walk away hungry and you will have tried some of the best offerings and a variety of sweet and savory dishes. Hands down one of the best tours I've taken! Thanks Moon! You certainly took us over the moon.

So much delicious food. We set off on this tour soon after our arrival in Hanoi, and were so glad we did. It gave us a wonderful opportunity to try many different dishes (at different food stalls) and to get a feel for where to go, and how and what to eat. Our guide, Thuy, was a wonderful "hostess" and took us to 8 different street stalls or restaurants. Highly enjoyable, good value and unreservedly recommended. Hint: don't eat for a few hours before you go.

Hanoi street food tour Magic. Our family of 5 went last night on a fabulous and fun tour around Hanoi with our guide Lotus. She was full of energy and had great knowledge of the area. The food was amazing and plentiful. What topped off a great night of food was a hot chocolate in one of the busy cafés with all the locals.

Amazing Amy! Don't miss this one.. We took the private option with our two teenage children. Started with the cyclo tour which was a calm oasis from which to get a close up view of the bustling streets. Amy, our guide, was engaging and enthusiastic. She took us to her favourite food stalls and we tasted so many delicious local specialties. Each one was delicious and there was nothing weird or off putting. Amy took us to her favourite dessert cafe and helped the chef create what we called the "Amy Special". We intend to go back and get another Amy Special. Amy taught us so much about the lifestyle and culture of Hanoi as we walked the streets. Thank you for a fantastic evening Amy!

Do this as soon as you arrive in Hanoi!. Loved everything we tried on this magical mystery tour of Hanoi's eclectic street food menu. Sunshine was an awesome guide with great knowledge of the foods and history as well as being generally bubbly and fun. My only regret was not doing this sooner as you get a great understanding of the kinds of foods on offer, the streets around the old quarter and where to get a nice drink also.Do it!

A Little of This, A Lot of Thant. Mark Lowerson guided Dearest and I through the streets of Hanoi, having us try a little of this and that until we were so full it was hard to imagine ever eating again---but, of course we did. Mark is a very enthusiastic New Zealand ex-pat who has embraced the entire street food scene of Vietnam and writes an amazing blog title Sticky Rice. He is educated, funny, engaging, and knowledgeable about the food, culture, history and life of Vietnam, starting with lessons on how to cross the street without getting run over. Our day with Mark was delicious delight.

Sunshine made the tour. My wife and I joined 4 others and Sunshine who led our tour through a rainy Hanoi night. The food was good ,we went to to places we"tourist" never would have gone to. But it was Sunshine who made it great. We had been in country for 48 hours and hadn't really slept for 72(bad jet lag) but Sunshine was funny , entertaining and delightful as she explained the different foods we ate and about Vietnam and had a real self deprecating sense of humor.Take this tour and ask for Sunshine.

Add to your "Must Do" list now!. This tour was incredibly fun and the food was fantastic. Not to mention, Miss Moon is one of the best tour guides we've had. This is THE way to experience culinary adventures in Hanoi. Miss Moon takes you to the best food stalls and restaurants in Hanoi and educates you in Vietnamese food and culture along the way. Our faves were the bun cha, fresh and fried spring rolls, fresh beer and, from this little bicycle cart (which apparently you only get to taste if the man is in your path) a snack of freshly grated coconut, black sesame seeds and sugar cane rolled in rice paper. Everything was really delicious and Miss Moon was delightful. "Sticky rice!"If you are looking to experience the real Hanoi (crossing the street like a local, eating from carts, using your hands, sitting on the sidewalk stoops for a meal with good people) then this is it!

Great experience. Very interesting experience. We did a private tour for 2 on our 2nd day in Hanoi so it helped us get our bearings. Or guide was Nga - nickname "money". Was very helpful and answered all our questions not only about the food but also Vietnam in general. Excellent english. Recommended to everyone.

Amazing Food Tour!. I went in the late evening food tour on my first night in Hanoi. It was amazing! Great food dishes in off-the-beaten track places that for sure I will not have visit on my own! We had 8 stops with yummy things like Soup dishes, rolls, desserts... So much! (Do not eat before the tour!) the price is far too good for what you get! My guide, Sea, was really nice and a proper Hanoian! Thank you Sea!
Great tour and nice food.. The tour was well organised, our group consited of 5 people plus our lovely guide. The food was diverse and very nice, I think in total we had 6 stops.

Must do!. We did went on the tour and I would highly recommend it. The food was amazing and probably food I would have not otherwise tried. The guide, Miss Moon was so knowledgable, funny and friendly!

A street food adventure. An amazing tour around Hanoi old quarter, trying lots of different local street food. Our guide Linh took us to a variety of very different and very tasty places that we would never have found on our own. As well as taking us on a gastronomic tour she was also full of interesting information about the people and area from a local perspective. They can cater for dietary requirements but you should let them know in advance as a lot of the food has meat/nuts in it (fortunately we can eat everything). Linh was very friendly and like any good host encouraged the group (6 people) over the initial awkwardness of meeting new people so soon we all talking and enjoying ourselves. If you are feeling adventurous and like trying new and tasty food it was a $20 well spent.

Great guide, amazing experience. We had a street food tour last night on our first night in Hanoi. It was easy to book by visiting Kim Tours' booking office. Our guide was Sunshine, who I couldn't speak more highly of. She not only provided us with a lot of information about the food we were eating but also about Vietnamese culture and her life growing up in the mountains. We visited approximately nine different street food vendors and sampled a huge amount of traditional vietnamese food and drink. We had to pace ourselves after the third place otherwise we wouldn't have been able to move! As we didn't have long in Hanoi it was a great way of safely experiencing traditional street food. I loved the Egg Coffee and Pho Ga. Well worth $20

Great fun and value. The trip was a great way to experience the old quarter and learn about the local food of Hanoi. We had a great time with our guide Nga. She was both very informative and fun. Our group had a great dynamic and everybody seemed to be having a good time. Would definitely do again - and for the 20USD, it's very good value since they take you to many different places and provide you with valuable information. Remember to come on an empty stomach since you will eat a lot.

Fantastic!. Fantastic tour with Hien! We visited street food stalls and shops with hidden narrow entrances that you wouldn't ever think to walk into. The food was fantastic and Hien catered for any dietary requirements we had. She was also very friendly and informative about general Vietnamese cuisine and life! Thanks a lot Hien!

Fantastic!. We did an evening food tour and it was fabulous. Make sure you have a huge appetite though! All of the foods we ate were none that I had ever eaten before and it was all very, very good. We did a private tour (just the two of us) and our guide, Ling was extremely friendly and knowledgable. Would highly recommend.

Must do in Hanoi!. This was by far my favorite part of our time in Hanoi. Our tour guide, Sea, was so fun and welcoming and really made the experience so enjoyable. The food was delicious and there was plenty of it! It's a great way to learn more about the culture and also meet new people while you're on vacation. Must do!!

Sunshine was an amazing guide!. My husband and I had so much fun on the tour! The food was great, and the things we learned were priceless! Some of the many stops were the definition of 'off the beaten path'. I loved the bun cha stop, the fresh fruit bowl stop, and the delicious egg coffee stop (and the beer stop too, of course). Most of all, our guide- Sunshine- was one of a kind. She was sweet, funny, smart, polite, and so engaging. Her stories were hilarious and she really was a ray of sunshine. Everyone on the tour adored her positive outlook on life and she made it such a blast! Nikki & Dave (Jan 11th tour)
Sea is Great!. This tour was a highlight of our trip. We had a blast meeting new people and eating delicious food. Sea was a great guide. I highly recommend this tour!

Great tour. This tour is a great one to do on day 1 of your visit to Hanoi. It is a great opportunity to orientate yourself with the old quarter as well as get to sample some fantastic street food that you may not necessarily stop to buy if you were not with a local. The crab soup, Bo Bia and the egg coffee were all amazing. Our guide 'Happy,' while only relatively new to her job as a tour guide was enthusiastic and great to do the tour with. I would highly recommend doing this tour.
Can't recommend it enough!. This tour was a great way to try local dishes and Sunshine, our guide, made the experience all the more memorable.

Fun foods, great guide. Worth doing Day 1 of your trip, to get familiar with local street food, cuisine in general. Provides a real sense of best street food, and screened for safe eating as well. Opportunity to visit places off beaten tourist path. Sea, our tour guide, provided both excellent food descriptions, and as importantly, gave us a sense of changing lives of young Vietnamese, including brief courtyard visit. He's enthusiastic, patient and knowledge. Ask for him.

Good intro with lovely guide. We found the food our well done but safe. By safe I mean the foods are nothing weird or out of he ordinary, maybe that's another your to try! If I could make any recommendations/feedback it would be to advise the tourists of when there is a suitable bathroom stop and one other Thor that bothered us was the constant touching of the chopsticks as they were passed out to each person. I understand the meaning behind the youngest giving out the chopsticks but our guide had her hands all over the eating ends and was constantly touching her hair etc. Would recommend this tour as a nice easy option for entry level foodies

Must do tour!. Highly recommend doing this tour asap when you arrive in Hanoi. The tour guide was great fun, Sea, and the food was amazing. It was a great introduction to street food, we revisited most of the stalls during the rest of our visit.

Best of Hanoi. We had a wonderful time on our street food tour and with our guide, Sea. The food was fantastic and plentiful. Sea helped take a city that at first seemed overwhelming and made it inviting and fun. I would recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi. Can't miss it!

Do This First. Try to do this tour as soon as you arrive in Hanoi. Not only will it give you an introduction to Hanoi street food, it also provides a great walking orientation to the Old Quarter. Carry a map with you and mark down places of interest so you can circle back and visit them on later days of your stay. The guide is interesting. You may also meet some fascinating world travelers.

So Much Food!!!!. We had a wonderful time on our Street Food Tour. We took the tour on our first night in Hanoi and it was a great orientation. Our tour guide, Sea was enthusiastic, interesting and clearly passionate about the food in Hanoi. We sampled food from many different vendors with Sea knowing the "best" places to experience the cuisine. We ended at a fresh beer pub, as we had already tried an egg coffee that morning, and had no more room. We were stuffed!!! Great way to kick off a trip to Hanoi. Fun, delicious and a great cultural experience.

Great introduction to Vietnamese food - one of holiday highlights. Did this tour on our first day in Vietnam. Great introduction both to Hanoi, the old quarter, and, of course, the food which was fantastic! Really recommended - our of the highlights of our trip. Our guide Hien ('Cherry') was great, very knowledgeable about the little food shops and cafes and the food itself. Loved all of the foods we tried including banh cuon, bun cha, the sea water crab rolls, the crispy friend pancakes with tiny shrimp, the lovely dessert, the egg coffee, the little rice paper rolls filled with coconut from the vendor near the cathedral - have I missed anything?! Couldn't make the times of the group tours so my husband and I went on the street food tour for the two of us and then the water puppet show which Hanoi Street Food Tour also organised for us.

A great way to sample Hanoi's vast array of street food. My partner was keen to sample Hanoi's legendary street food while I was a little more cautious and concerned about potentially falling ill. The solution was the Hanoi Street food tour where the lovely 'Money' escorted us around and ordered an array of tasty and delicious local street food. She was a little incredulous when I explained that I didn't eat pork but went out of her way to make sure that I was able to sample a wide range of seafood, tofu and sweet dishes. This is highly recommended for foodies who are keen to explore the local cuisine with a knowledgable and friendly guide to show you the way.

Passionate Hanoi. Wether you're an independent traveller or not, this tour is an excellent way to discover Hanoi and it's food.Our guide, Hiem, was as passionate about the food as the city itself. Enjoy!!!

Got the party started in Hanoi. I attended a night-time street food tour led by Sea and his trainee in Hanoi in early January. What I had thought was a crazy and daunting maze of a city came alive with Sea's energetic tour guiding. We had a fantastic group of English speaking young people on the tour from all over the world. We were drinking at bier corner and drinking egg coffee at 10:00pm and didn't want to leave. This tour is a 'must do' for anyone in Hanoi.
Trip highlight. Wow! I absolutely loved every moment of this trip. The food was spectacular and my tour guide was great. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Awesome experience to immerse yourself in Hanoi. We took our 2 small children on a private tour with Dieu and it was amazing, We did nearly 10 stops through the middle of the Old Quarter and it gave us the confidence to eat street food the rest of our holiday. The guide spoke great english, spoilt our kids and took us through the crazy streets of Hanoi to discover the amazing food that Vietnam is famous for.

Sunshine is the best!. We did the tour yesterday and was great!! Our guide, sunshine was very kind and friendly, explaining us all about the food around here. We tried like 8-10 plates and the food was delicious!! We only had breakfast and wait until 5pm to the tour, so we were really starving and was perfect! Because you're really having a big dinner! I can't recommend this enough if you really are into food!

Great way to sample food while familiarizing yourself with the city. Had a short 2-night stop in Hanoi. Got into town around 6PM and immediately headed over to sign up for the food tour. Glad I did. It's a great way to orient yourself with the city, try the local dishes, and meet people. Pi was our guide and she did a great job taking us to the spots in the Old quarter totally taking care of the group. She described the ingredients in the dishes, how they're prepared, and how to eat them (sauces). I often eat Vietnamese food when I'm back home, but the tour managed to introduce me to new dishes that I didn't know about. Even if I found these places on my own, I probably wouldn't know to order some of the dishes because there aren't any pictures on any of the menus. A nice introduction to Hanoi. Highly recommended.

100+ Stars to give. There are not enough words to describe!!!! Great sightseeing, great ride, GREATEST FOODS!!! Most importantly, great thanks to our guides (Lilli and Jane). GREAT GREAT GREAT...THANKS THANKS THANKS...;-)

A fun experience in the Old Quarter. We love food tours, we always look forward to eating local food in every city that we visit. We were not disappointed with our experience in Hanoi! Sea was our guide and he was fun, talkative, informative and genuinely cared about giving us a great experience not just a tour. Besides the planned food tour stops we were able to try our hand at making rice paper wraps, we bought food from street vendors and we got to experience the bustling street life in Hanoi's Old Quarter.From noodle dishes to desserts, fruit and spring rolls - we tried so much. No problem accommodating a vegetarian either, the substitutions were fabulous. I can't stop thinking about the Bo Bia - if I could travel back to Hanoi just to eat more from the street vendors I would.Thanks for the great Hanoi experience!

FOOD TOUR WITH SEA. The tour was an amazing and unforgettable experience. Our tour guide, Sea, was a very excited energetic and informative guide. We went to about 8-9 different locally run street vendors. Included in that nine was a locally run pub.. And an awesome coffee shop! You are provided with enough food to feel like you experienced the full city of Hanoi. After the tour, we returned to a few of the places for lunch and dinner. A MUST DO IF YOU VISIT HANOI!!

Do this first. We did this tour our first day in Hanoi and are so glad we did. We got an orientation to the old town and the food. Not a lot of ground covered on the walk, which is good, more time for food. Our guide, Ms Moon, was very enthusiastic. Make sure you are hungry.

Great way to start a visit in Hanoi. We started our trip in Vietnam with this food tour. It gave us a good introduction to local cuisine. The group had 6 people. Our guide, Miss Moon, was absolutely amazing! She would tell us what we were eating and go through a list of the ingredients as well as their healing properties when applicable. She also demonstrated how to mix various sauces and herbs into the meal to enhance the flavour. The tour was about 3 hrs long. The food was delicious and plentiful. In addition learning about food we walked through the jumble of streets in the Old Quarter and the French Quarter and became more comfortable with crossing the streets. Food and drink are all included in the price. The tour ended with beers at 'beer corner'. After Miss Moon said goodbye, the group remained seated on the tiny stools in front of the bar soaking in the sights and swapping travel stories over more beers. We definitely got a very authentic and fun experience.

Good introduction to Hanoi street food. Although we had already enjoyed some street food before joining this tour Sea, our guide, provided us with great information about local living and Vietnamese culture. We sampled several several local dishes as well as egg coffee (delicious!) and bia hoi (fresh beer). Bottled water is provided.This is a great way to learn more about the culture through food and with a local guide.

Delicious food and great experience!. The Hanoi Street food tour is the perfect way to be introduced to the food of Vietnam. Our tour guide, Miss Amy was amazing - very lovely, open and fun. She was very informative about the food we ate, and also answered all of our questions about Vietnamese food and the Vietnamese way of life. The food was also delicious and fresh. I will definitely be recommending this to everyone who visits this beautiful country.

Great way to explore the Hanoi city streets and eat local food. We arrived late for our street food tour in Hang Bac street,so only had 2 hrs instead of 3hrs. as we had to get back to catch our plane.However, we were delighted with our lovely guide 'Money' a student and worker who managed to take us around and sample some of the many delights.My friend was vegetarian but she managed with sea food, and veggies. There is no way that you could do this on your own without a guide as you would never know which alley way to go into, and speak the language to know what you are eating! well worth the money. Hanoi is very interesting and its is a skill to cross the road and avoid all the numerous scooters and bikes! Great food, delicious.

Great food with great guide. One of the best things I did in Vietnam. It was so fun to try different foods and experience street culture. Our guide, Sea, was friendly and informative. I would highly recommend this tour.

Fantastic food tour!. Please do this your on your first day in Hanoi and you will not be disappointed! You will be set up with the best food tips for the rest of your stay in the city. Ask for Miss Moon! She is fantastic! She is so open and genuine. She showed us some amazing places to eat and explained how to eat the food correctly. We had so much fun tasting everything and we went back to most of the places within the next few days. The pho and the fresh beer were so good, not to mention the most divine egg coffee ever! Miss Moon thank you for an amazing tour!

Great Food!!. This was a wonderful way to get to know the food in Hanoi. Our tour guide, Lotus, was fabulous. She was very excited about showing us all of the different treats and foods that were on our tour. We were a little burned out and jetlagged but managed to make it through the tour. Awesome group and I recommend this company highly.

So happy we did this!. We only had 36 hours in Hanoi and love Vietnamese food, so we thought this would be a great opportunity to try lots of different treats in a short time period. This tour was perfect! We went to places we never would have gone to otherwise. Everything so so tasty and interesting. Seeing the street life (lots of scooters everywhere!) and hundreds of restaurants with patrons spilling onto the sidewalks made for an exciting evening. Our guide, Kiwi, was so sweet and fun. We were really happy to have gotten to hang out with her for a few hours. I'd recommend this tour in a second. We even went back to a few places the next day for lunch.

fantastic food tour. the food tour was fantastic and it got me to try things that I otherwise wouldn't have tried. The guide (Sea) was very friendly, funny and knowledgeable.I loved it and it really made our first night in hanoi a memorable one.

hanoi street food tour. This is a must when visiting Hanoi. The guide Tu was an absolute delight, very knowledgeable, a real foodie and a funny guy into the bargain. We went down back alleys and through markets and saw some wonderful sights. The food was great, lots of which we would never have tried on our own. Just trust the guide and you wont regret it. A great way to learn lots about the city and the people.

Highly recommend. I have a chance to learn about other types of Hanoi's food and enjoyed them. they're delicious at all. We walk and talk to each other as close friend even that is the firsr time we met. I really like this tour. Highly recommend.

Was great, a definite must. The tour was great with roughly 8-10 different foods (subtract 2 for fruit) for us to taste and enjoy. However a "taste" is an understatement because most places we had a full serving if not a plate to ourselves. The guide Ms. Moon was a great guide, "sticky rice" will be stuck in your head. Please do this tour at the beginning of your trip, you'll know what to eat and where to go from there on in.

A night of food and fun. Booked a private tour for the group for the food and sightseeing tour by scooter as we were not able to make it for the group booking timing. Had a fantastic night with Cheryl and Li Li who are best friends. Thus, with such buddies to bring you around means more fun. We tried many food and drinks but my friend was not feeling well. Cheryl and Li Li, in my opinion, got a shocked when my friend vomited. They thought she was not used to the food they had introduced so far during the trip. But rest assure, my friend was not well due to indigestion from the previous meals. I guessed they were really young and perhaps, first time encountering such situation that we had to reassure them that it was not their 'fault'. So they decided to bring us around to Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, west lake, red river by their scooter. It was always fun to be on a bike in Vietnam. Like they say, while in Rome, do as Romans do. so while in Vietnam, ride as Vietnamese ride. It was totally different being a pedestrian and a passenger on the bike. Though it was 'scary' at first, you will slowly be enjoying the breeze and view as Cheryl and Li Li are great riders. Along the way, they will introduce the country and provided information of the architectures. It was really informative. Will we try this again, yes, of course. But well, I guess, perhaps it will be better if the price for private tour can be lower!

Ms Moon is the BEST. We cannot recommend this tour enough. Honestly one of the best yours we have been on. Our tour guide Ms Moon is such a genuine, beautiful and well educated women who brought so much laughter, knowledge and fun that had us all talking about this tour days later.I would recommend doing this tour as soon as you arrive and you will want to go back to some of the most amazing food places in Hanoi before you leave. We cannot thank Ms Moon enough and we still have cravings for 'egg coffee'.Thank you so much again.

A great intro to Hanoi and it's culture. A must to experience the true buzz of Hanoi's old quarter...we were ushered around by Sea who made our street food experience the highlight of our stay in Hanoi. a good idea to do the trip at night and as early as possible during your stay so as to get some insight into what to eat, where to get it and become part of the culture. absolutely fantastic. thank you Sea and we hope to see you in SA some day.

Highlight of our trip to Hanoi. We chose a private food tour on our first full day in Hanoi. We booked it for lunch time; it was simply wonderful. We tried so many different dishes and had the rest of the day to walk it off!Our guide, Lotus, was extremely kind and really made the tour special. We highly recommend booking with her.The tour made us comfortable ordering and eating from the street. If you only do one thing in Hanoi, this should be it!

trip highlight. The Old Quarter in Hanoi is a maze of back alleys, busy intersections and hole-in-the-wall establishments. It's not an easy area to navigate and it's even harder to find the 'best of' foods when many places seem to serve the same types of dishes. For these reasons, the street food tour is a must-do if you're a foodie and want to explore the area without consulting a map every five minutes. Our guide, Sea, a bubbly 21 year old, was eager to show off his beautiful country and it's wonderful cuisine. He took us to seven or eight places, serving such things as Bun Cha (roasted pork with noodles), banh mi sandwiches, egg coffee, and my personal favorite, bo bia, a shaved coconut and sugar cane concoction. At each stop, Sea explained the significance of each dish, how it is prepared, and the best method of eating it. You will definitely have a better appreciation for the street food culture and the unique dishes the area has to offer when you have someone with you who speaks the language and knows what they're doing. My wife and I had a wonderful night and we'd highly recommend taking the tour.

Worth it!. Have to say I really enjoy this tour as I have the opportunity to learn about other types of Hanoi's food and learning how to order them. Part of the fun is walking around in a big group and meeting people from all over the world ^^. In our group we met friends from Brazil, Canada and USA! The guide can speak very good english and she was ready to answer all of our questions. Price includes all food and drinks during the tour.
Amazing!!!. Went last night. Our tour guide was Sea. An amazing 4 hours of delicious food, great company and informative Hanoi information.A MUST DO!!!!

Best street food tour in Hanoi. We had Moon as our tour guide and she was warm and friendly and highly knowledgable. Originally from California but live in Singapore, we traveled with our 2.5 year old and 10 month old and Moon was extremely mindful of our family's needs (even babysat and carried our baby while we stuffed our faces with noodles). We had a wonderful time exploring the "back roads" of Old Quarter Hanoi and eating and sampling an array of amazing food which we would have never had tried if it weren't for our tour! Do yourself and your friends/family a favor and recommend and try this tour company. It will be one of the best, if not, THE best thing you do while visiting Hanoi. And ask for Moon! She is lovely!

One of the best tours I've been on . 3.5 hours of amazing street food and drinks, with a great English speaking tour guide (Sea) who knew his stuff. Considering the amount of places you go to (must've been at least 10) it's great value for money. Highly recommend!

street food fun!!. We had a great tour with Amy this morning. She's knowledgable, fun and so easy to work with.
Delicious food and interesting conversation.She picked out some tastyand adventurous thigs to eat. Our teenage kids had a great time with her too. I highly recommend Hanoi Street Food Tour. Reasonably priced as well. - Karen Feder

A great evening with Sunny. Last night we had a great food tour wth our guide Sunny who led us through the maze of the Old Quarter to fantastic local eating places that we would no doubt have simply walked past if not for her local knowledge. We were a group of 8 people, including our 14 and 12 year old children and she was very patient as members of our party invariably drifted off to look at something that caught their attention. Along the way we tried a variety of foods, deserts, and local beer finishing with a special coffee at one of Hanoi's oldest cafe. She is a charming and fun guide who gave us a lot of information about Hanoi's food and life in the city generally. We met her at about 5pm and she even walked us back to our hotel where we returned about 10pm. We all agreed it was a highlight of our visit to Vietnam. Don't miss doing the food tour. Be warned - you'll need a huge appetite to cope with all the foods that come your way during the tour!

Fantastic food and guides. Recommended.. We tried 7 excellent dishes over 3 hours at 5 spots around the old city and by the lake. Highly recommended. Excellent value for money and certainly didn't walk away hungry.

An experience in Hanoi to be remembered!. You will venture through the alleys and streets of the old quarter in Hanoi tasting a wide range of classic Hanoian and Vietnamese food on this tour. Our family of five took this tour at the recommendation of a friend and we couldn't have been more pleased with the experience. We brought along our three kids (ages 14, 12 and 8), the two younger ones are very picky eaters and really didn't try much but the remaining three of us could have done this tour several times a week and not tire of the experience.
