Advice:1) Ask for Miss Moon as your guide, she was simply incredible with her stories and guiding2) Eat little if anything in the hours before this tour, you will make up for it with all the tasting along the way3) Bring good walking shoes, you will cover sever kilometers easy on the walking tour4) Bring a good camera and if you have a good zoom lens then keep it nearby, there are so many great chances to photograph all the zaniness that makes Hanoi so endearing5) Remember that you are taking a street food tour, you will be sitting in some places that you would probably never venture into on your own, that's the whole point of taking a guided tour that pushes you beyond your comfort zone!Bathroom facilities are available along the way, but they are tucked into nondescript and random points. This is not a good tour if you have difficulty navigating sidewalks and uneven terrain, it is the old town after all. If you have a baby in tow, wear a baby-backpak; old town Hanoi is just not a good place to navigate with a stroller.

Great experience . After reading the reviews we decided to give the tour a try. Loved it. Our host, Nga, was great. She is a great guide who loves to tell you more about food, Hanoi and Vietnam in general. The food we tried was delicious (this might be important to :) ). Some of the places we went I would honestly just passed by without considering eating there. But it turned out to be really, really good and we were delighted to be able to try such a variety of food. Highly recommended

Wonderful street food tour from guide Amy. Highlight of our Vietnam visit thus far. We took the private tour as we have a 6 and 12 year old and wanted to move at our own pace. For a few dollars more this was worth it not to be rushed and to have the more close contact with our tour guide Amy. Her English was great and she was. Dry knowledgeable about the area and cuisine. We had pho, spring rolls, grilled quail, grilled pork on a stick and lots of stuff I can't even recall the names of. This tour is well worth the money paid and highly recommended.

Sunshine illuminates the best of Hanoi Street Food. We just returned from a wonderful street food tour with Hanoi Street foods. It was led by a tour guide by the name of sunshine who was magnificent.we are a family of four foodies who wanted to experience real Vietnamese street food. If you want to experience true Vietnamese culture, the way the locals do, you should not hesitate to take this tour and specifically, ask for sunshine.we started out our tour at the Hanoi Street food kiosk and proceeded to go to about eight different places.these were not stops that we could've found on our own. In fact, some of the stalls or shops were holes in the wall that had terrific of food.at each stop, At each stop sunshine introduced us to the owner and described what the food was that we were going to be eating. Portions at each stop were full size portions. We are four Americans with hearty appetites and could not in any way shape or form eat all of the food that was provided.we had different types of pho, Bahn mi, different types of spring rolls and dumplings.we had local beer and concluded our stop with delicious egg coffee. We never had anything like it and are so thankful that we got the opportunity to try it with sunshine.At the end of the tour we had difficulty locating a cab. The streets of the old quarter are confusing and there is no way that the four of us could have figured out how to return to our hotel. Sunshine offer to walk us back to our hotel so that we would not get lost. She truly was a lifesaver and went above and beyond the call of any tour guide. we found Hanoi Street food tours through TA . A number of Vietnamese will try and dissuade you from booking saying that they "have a friend" who can do a better tour. That is not possible in my opinion. As four foodies who have traveled the world, this was one of the best experiences we've had. Thank you sunshine and Hanoi Street food tours

You will eat in places you would not normally venture into!. I have to admit that our experience of this company has totally surpassed anything I would have expected anywhere else in the world. We had a nice tour of totally different food types in street food outlets and discovered places that we would never have dared to even enter with a lovely young lady who took us around to all these different venues over a three hour period. I was only disappointed that the level of English was a below expectation however the owner of the company has since been in touch and we have even met since the tour and he has more than adequately compensated for this. Very professional approach. Lovely individuals and the good will is second to none. A great introduction to Hanoi and Vietnamese food! Do it as early on as you can - just email them as soon as you know your arrival dates so you can book via email.Thanks Mr Nguyen for your quick and timely responses to my emails to book and your very professional folllow-up to my comments/feedback.... most appreciated!

Group tour too big. Went on the tour on Christmas day as a fun treat instead of the dinner at home.The tour said on its website and in emails that the tour would be 6-10 people max but 15 showed up and all were taken on it.This meant that our tour guide (the excellent cherry) found it difficult to describe the dishes to everyone and the food stalls couldn't get everyone served at the same time. Many would have finished before some were served. Also, it was difficult to get talking to everyone over the night.There wasn't that much food included but the fantastic cherry brought us to an extra restaurant after and we chatted for over an hour.The tour should not have gone with so many people and should have split the group up - it seems money took over. The tour itself follows the recommended eating spots in the lonely planet guide.I rate the tour 1 star but cherry 5 stars.

Fantastic. This tour totally deserves it high reviews. The super enthusiastic and friendly Miss Moon was our guide and she couldn't have been better. The food stops were wonderful and I loved the contrast in the different foods, one minute we were eating warming soups, then cool crunchy & fresh foods and then sweet and sticky...so fabulous. A couple of times we made random stops and Miss Moon bought extra foods we were interested in, or from a mobile vendor that she happened to see. I never would have known how to find or order these foods by myself. This is the food I came here to experience, it really was an outstanding tour and so moderately priced compared to other food tours I have done.

Come hungry!. Wow! So good! We went to 7 or 8 hooked in the wall food vendors and it was amazing! Such a variety and such an amazing way to have authentic cuisine. Make sure you don't eat for a while before you go though...there's a lot of food!! Also, I would recommend doing this on the first day you're here. Typically we had just one item at each location and doing it early in your trip means you have the ability to test other things on the menu or go back for seconds.

Must do in Hanoi. This street food tour was definitely worth the money. Great way to taste different Vietnamese dishes in places we would not have gone otherwise. The food is really good and there was plenty of it (even for a big eater) so go there hungry. Our tour guide Hien (Cherry) was very sweet and she did a great job keeping the group safely together. We had a nice group of couples from all over the world and we ended up going for drinks with them afterwards.

Great experience. I highly recommend the street food tour it was a way of seeing a side Hanoi life we would not have otherwise experienced. Our tour guide Hien even took us into someone's kitchen to sample some home cooking; she was a really great enthusiastic guide.

Great food. Taste of everything. Our guides, Sea and Happy, were absolute angels in this city of food and motorbikes. They navigated through the alleys and streets with such a cheery and helpful attitude. I hope i get this right: Bun cha, bun rien cua, banh cuon nong, bo bia were the items we ate. Really good food. Great insightful tour.

Amazing food tour. The food tour is amazing. Delicious food, you learn lots about the local food, history and traditions, our guide was great and we met lots of nice people! Overall, definitely worth it!

Out of our comfort zone!. We are going on food tours in 4 different destinations . Such a great way to familiarise yourself with a city and the regional specialties.Hanoi Street food is so amazing and varied.Again a must do activity suitable for families.

Wow a ray of Sunshine. What a great way to spend a evening in Hanoi costs $20 lots of great local food and drink in places we would not normally go to or find, we have already been back to three of the places and intend to go to others. We had a great group of people from all corners of the world. We were fortunate to have a guide called Sunshine who is obviously a very very nice person and a great guide. Thank you for a great night and wish all the good luck and happy travels.

hope you're hungry!. What a great way to get to know some of the local specialities and history. Our guide sea was very nice and friendly. He was a pleasure to spend a few hours with. There was lots to eat and drink! Would definitely recommend this tour, and ask for sea as your guide, you wont be disappointed.

Fantastic way to explore the local cuisine. I went on the lunch tour with my family and it was a great way to try the local cuisine and to explore the old quarter at the same time. Nga was our warm and friendly tour guide and she was a wealth of information – she knew everything about the food right down to where the ingredients came from and also enlightened us with historical facts about the city and Vietnam in general. We had 8 different food stops and the food was tasty with interesting flavour combinations and ingredients – so eat a tiny breakfast and you probably won't even need to eat dinner afterwards! Overall a great experience and by far the best activity we participated in during our time in Hanoi.

Excellent Tour. We did the tour on our first night in Hanoi. Enjoyed all of the food (and it really was a lot of food), the group was great and our guide Sunshine was the best. Explained a lot and answered all of our questions. Definitely recommend the tour, we loved it!

Wonderful time, delicious food & excellent hospitality. It was only me & my wife...on our 2nd day in Hanoi , when we found Kim's Tour .. Which we knew it was highly recommended online. It was our tour guide Ms Moon... Who was being so friendly , patient & helpful, in that 3 hrs of street tour.. We were shown around trying out all the local street cooking favorites which me & my wife wouldn't have known how & where to look for. .. without Ms Moon. Despite the agony beating the very busy & almost beyond control traffic situation...we enjoyed every single bite in every stall we visited... Ms Moon guided us through the very busy traffic..from 1 stall to another, explaining patiently to us on the preparation & ingredients of every dish... Some came with traditional backgrounds & history, some were just simple dishes but tasted extra-ordinarily . We hereby wish to thank Ms Moon for that wonderful 3 hours spent together..introducing the Hanoi specialities , the best place for the best food & Vietnam culture that we were initially unfamiliar with, we would like to recommend Ms Moon to all potential Hanoi visitors .. & we are confident your trip would be a fruitful one.. being in the good hands of Ms Moon. Thank you. Alan & Paulyn

Fantastic culinary experience. This was probably the best touristy activity that I did in Hanoi. We went to about 8 different venues to try local foods and Vietnamese coffee. There is plenty of food so this is a good thing to do for lunch or dinner. The tour guide was very accommodating for people on the tour with dietary requirements. Given that so much of the food in Hanoi is 'street food' this is a great way to try the cuisine for Westerners without the risk of eating something dodgy.

Do yourself a favour.... Do yourself a favour and book this tour at the start of your visit to Hanoi. We gained an insight into the food and so much more.. Our delightful guide, Miss Moon and her sidekick Miss Happy were warm, friendly and chatty..comfortable answering every question about life in Hanoi that we threw at them. We had been a little wary of the street stalls but after this experience we felt a lot more confident and knowledgeable. The other advantage is the opportunity to meet fellow travellers and exchange notes. There was ample food provided..and the 3 hour walking tour ended with a cold fresh beer at 'beer corner' and the egg coffee which really is delicious. Good value for $US20 pp
Great. We loved to see the locals cooking their food. Brian, our Hotel Manager recommended a couple of local restaurants and the food was great,

Amazing - perfect first day activity. We went on the 5pm tour after only being in Hanoi for a few hours and it was the perfect way to ease into the city! The roads are so intimidating, so even following a local for three hours crossing busy roads was very welcome. The food was amazing throughout the tour. There was just so much - it was a good idea to only have a small breakfast that day! The walks are not too long between stops, and the quality of the food is so high and it differs between each shop. The highlight for us was the egg coffee at the end - worth hanging around for! 'Sunshine' was a sweet and well spoken tour guide. She was able to give us information about not only the food and the city of Hanoi, but also about other Vietnamese traditions which was very interesting! I cannot recommend this trip more strongly. It is an excellent thing to do in Hanoi to get a feel for the city!

Fun, Local Insight - and Sensational Tastes. Anyone visiting Vietnam will quickly find that the food is a highlight - and Hanoi provides a bewildering array of options. Amongst these, the street food is undoubtedly the highlight - it's in tune with the rhythm of the city, as diverse as the metropolitan melting-pot itself - and the quality is outstanding. This tour provides visitors with a great introduction to the variety of local options - three hours flew past in a whirlwind of delicious treats, brief walks, and lots of enthusiastic chat and engagement from our guide Sea - a customer service superstar. He had a genuine commitment to making sure his guests had a great time, and everyone finished up fully satisfied, nourished, and informed.A++ highly recommended

Great food and friendly guide. Our tour guide, Nga was very lovely and also very knowledgeable about the food in Hanoi. She took us to 8 different places to try one of their dishes and also gave a list of other places which she recommended that we try (the one which we got a chance to go to was fantastic). This was the best food tour that we did in Vietnam and was also very reasonably priced.

The Top Highlight of Hanoi - Insist on it. There are numerous articles about how wonderful street food is in Viet-Nam, but there are just as many articles about unsanitary conditions leading to traveler's diarrhea. Then a friend mentioned this outfit which not only guarantees good hygiene but is also well rated on Trip Advisor. 9 out of 12 of us took the plunge and, to the dismay of the 3 scaredy cats who stayed in, it turned out to be the top eating experience from our entire 3-week trip in Viet-Nam. Hien, who also goes by Cherry, quickly won us over with her spunk, passion and attentiveness. And the food, at every single stop, is fabulous. We were introduced to a large spectrum of Hanoi delicacies. We ate from sidewalk stoops. We ate from tiny mom-and-pop shops. We ate standing in the street from a box in the back of a bicycle. We drank "egg coffee" from a lounge tucked away at the end of a dark alley. And, as Hien had promised, we did not go home hungry. We were so stuffed, we skipped the last stop. Next time, I'll make sure not to eat so much at lunch.Hien, thank you for an unforgettable evening. The food was absolutely delicious, and your passion made it exceptional. In your honor, we still yell out "sticky rice!" whenever we cross the streets.Note: If you want to book this, make sure you talk to them directly, and insist on it. When I mentioned it to our tour company, they tried to sign us up on their own tour. When I asked our hotel to make the arrangements, they tried to get us on their partner's tour.

Oh so good!. What more can you ask for... delicious street food and a 3-hour walking tour all rolled into one. We had a private tour for 3 of us, and as promised... we were totally satiated. A big pre-tour concern we had was maybe the "street food" is putting ourselves at risk for stomach issues, however none of us had even the slightest problem whatsover. One of the best things we did in Hanoi. Highly recommend it!

Wow, oh wow!!!. We love street food wherever we go, but are obviously a bit careful about where and what we eat. This tour was amazing!! The old quarter is fascinating on its own and we wandered around streets and lane ways that we probably wouldn't have found on our own. Top off that with gorgeous food over a four hour period (yes, the tour goes for 3 hours but ours went for 4), at tucked away places - this whole tour had it all. It was simple, our tour guide wasn't over the top, and the food was plentiful and delicious!! And did I say the food was delicious?? A must do ...

Great for vegetarians- excellent guide. Our group of three signed up to do the lunchtime food tour.The tour cost $20 per person and consisted of a three hour walking tour around Hanoi's old quarter with a guide, Miss Moon. Miss Moon was absolutely amazing, so friendly and accommodating. In particular, I told Miss Moon when I booked the tour that I was a vegetarian, and she ensured that I was given vegetarian substitutes at every single stop. We were given seven unbelievable courses of Hanoi's best street food, including wrapping up the tour with a visit to Hanoi's best coffee house for some egg coffee.Overall, I would highly recommend this tour. Doing the lunchtime tour allows you to really experience some of the impressive French colonial architecture the old quarter has to offer. I also would also highly recommend requesting Miss Moon as a guide- she was the best guide we have had in our Vietnam trip so far!

Must do. I did this tour on the first day in Ha Noi and i have to say it's the greatest experience i have tried in Viet Nam. I went together with 9 peoples and we get on easily. We had a lot of foods during 3 hours: noodle with pork, pho, sticky rice icecream, rice cake, dry eel, spring roll, sugar cane juice, chinese cake, banh mi, coffe trung and we finished in the beer corner with "beer for woman" and i just love all of them. Amy - our tourguide was super adorable, intelligent, knowledgeable and friendly. She spoke english very well. We also shared a lot of funny stories. Thank you Amy! You are the BEST tourguide ever!

A Must-Do in Hanoi!. We generally like to explore street food on our own, and as budget backpackers, we tend to shy away from organized tours, but Hanoi Street Food Tours was easily the highlight of our stay in Hanoi. Even if you know a lot about Vietnamese food and are comfortable navigating the city's street food scene on your own, this tour is still highly worth it. At only $20 for a group tour, it's an amazing deal. Our guide, Sea, was incredible. He was hilarious, patient, and so friendly and nice. He made the experience so much fun. We had four other couples in our group, which made for a nice and fun experience. We frequented a total of seven places, four for food, and three for drinks (one for alcoholic drinks). Each place we went to served really great food. There wasn't a single dish we did not like. And the experience of hopping from one place to the other with a local was something we wouldn't have been able to experience otherwise. Definitely book a tour with Hanoi Street Food Tours when you're in town!

Impressive Hanoi Street Food. We traveled to Vietnam for the first time and found this place from Trip Advisor. Without this tour we will not be able to find all these delicious local restaurants and test them with limited of time. The tour guide taking care of us was kind and generous. It was a great experience and very impressive.

Must do!!!. I just came back from doing this tour and I cannot say how happy I was that I chose to do this. Even if you are not a 'foodie' this is a perfect introduction to finding out what dishes are that you see written in Vietnamese and the food is incredible. And soooooo much food, 7 stops! I was going to do a cooking class but by doing this instead meant that now I know a lot more dishes, know the good spots to eat, could ask about so many more things that you see along the way and feel so much more familiar with the area. Thanks Cherry!!!!!

stellar tour, Miss Moon rocks. don't miss this excellent food tour. it's an amazing way to see the city and taste the flavors of Hanoi. very well organized. Miss Moon was very professional and knowledgeable. she is like the Jewish mother you never had (or maybe you did) - she will guilt you into eating more than you thought you could handle. but you'll enjoy it!!! don't wait, book now!

Best part of my trip! DO NOT MISS THIS!. Absolutely excellent! Would do it again without doubt. Try it for your first night so you can learn what and how to order- I've been using my new food vocabulary and knowledge all over Vietnam! - Followed a guide around the streets and alleyways of the old quarter of Hanoi with small group (7 people). Our guide "Kiwi" showed us both hidden and famous treasures of Hanoi's street food scene- eaten over excellent, entertaining, and insightful conversation. - Our guide "Kiwi" was incredible- spoke wonderful English, very knowledgable, incredibly sweet.- Food was amazing- 5 savoury and 2 sweet and 3 drinks (incl bottled water). - Perfect amount and selection/variety of food. Leave feeling well fed and happy. - Great place to meet fellow travellers and swap stories. - Fantastic local insight provided by our lovely guide on daily life, history of Vietnam, funny stories, expected prices, manners- everything! Do not miss this!!!! Worth every penny.

eat your way around Hanoi. A great tour, and an ideal introduction to the chaos of Hanoi. I couldn't speak highly enough about our guide Miss Moon (sticky rice!), as we snaked our way around the nooks and crannies of the Old Quarter sampling I think in the end 9 delicacies! Beware if you're on the morning tour do not have a late breakfast as the food is fast and plentiful and offers excellent value for money. Also know that though it's about 4 hours in length they cram a lot in - toilet break before you go and wear comfortable shoes!The tour felt something like a mix between a foodie show, a comedy and a kindergarten day out, but somehow it worked. You'll have fun trying to find the same places if you decide to go back to some of the places after the tour (we had egg coffee every day thereafter - much tastier than it sounds!). I'd happily recommend it and all credit to Miss Moon she did something I've never seen before, actually return a tip at the end of the tour. Well done

Miss Moon is brilliant. Reading the reviews below we managed to get on the 11am tour on our first day and it proved so useful! We managed to get a great feel for the best places to go, how all the streets were split up but best of all had Miss Moon taking us to the best food stalls and showing us food is never normally try! It's served us for the rest of the trip as well so couldn't recommend this more. We moved on to do a tour around Bai tu long during our stay at Hanoi and found another couple who had been on the tour and loved it too!One thing to beware is that you effectively eat 8/9 meals during the tour! Amazing all round!!

Best introduction to Hanoi and its amazing food. We went on the food tour on our first full day in Hanoi and it provided us with the best introduction to the city and to the food. There were 12 others on the tour which made it a little on the large side, especially as we tried to stay together crossing the roads. My only criticism is that we walked a very long way sometimes it felt like taking the long way around just for the sake of it. It meant the tour took 3.5 hours in total with 6 stops for food. The food itself taking less than an hour. It started with a tiny baguette with pâté, then some fruit from the night market, rice pancakes, BBQ street food (the very best place on Hang Bong!), fruit with condensed milk and then Vietnamese egg coffee. We went back to Thai Dat on Hang Bong the following evening for BBQ food which we may not have been brave enough to do without this tour. Definitely a must do!

Food glorious food!. This is such fantastic value for money and awesome introduction to Vietnamese street food! We had the lovely Sea as our guide, he was outstanding! So friendly and attentive :) We tried about 8 different dishes at places I had been walking past for days without giving them a second glance - I wish I had I known how delicious some of them where sooner! Some of the dishes we probably wouldn't go for again but they were still great to try, others we have already planned to go back to again!

Absolute gem, just do it. So you have come to Hanoi for a few days and want to sample the great variety of street food but have no idea of where to begin? I was on that boat! This tour will help you understand the basic workings of Hanoi street food, while sampling delicious bites in great company. Our guide, Hiem, was the key to an oh-so-short 3 hours plus trip around the streets of the old quarter. She added lots of context and cheerful conversation while at the same time caring for the safety and needs of the group. Highly recommended.
Do it as soon as possible. Terrific experience to sample a lot of different dishes and discover local spots and sample a bunch that we may not have tried. Highly recommended
Delicious trip around Hanoi. Great, friendly, informative guide, delicious food catered to the groups dietary needs, good value for money. Definitely recommend.

Please do it!. On the first night we were in Hanoi, my wife and I decided to try the food ourselves - how much choice could there actually be, right? WRONG!! we were so overwhelmed the first night that we decided that we have to have a guide to help us along the food in the old quarter.Lotus was our guide and we tried a whole host of foods in Hanoi, which if we hadn't been on this tour, we would never have tried out. There is more food on the tour that one can eat :) Although you are eating on the streets, have no fear, we were both absolutely fine after eating everything.The walk around the old quarter is also great to get your bearings on what would otherwise be an absolute maze!The tour is really a must do in Hanoi!

Great experience of the vietnamese/Hanoi cuisine!. Best tour for Hanoi! A great way to experience al the best/original culinary dishes Hanoi has to offer. Though we weren't shy of trying the local food beforehand, this is a great way of eating 'local' if you don't know where to go to, or afraid to try at the small streetfood shops. Our guide Lan Anh (Kiwi) was very chearfull, and besides being very knowledgable about the food she also shared alot about the vietnamese culture. Beware there is lots of food - so be hungry! :)

A must for Hanoi. We loved our tour! Our guide was Anh and she was very friendly, helpful, and informative on all the places we went too, good we ate and stories about Vietnam. Highly recommend this tour to learn more about the amazing Hanoi street food. Beware - there is loads of food! Arrive hungry.

The best $20 I spent in Hanoi ...... ......and worth every cent! The only regret I have is that we did not do this tour the day we arrived here instead of the last. Our guide was Ms. Moon and she was wonderful: knowledgable, generous, and quite adorable. We loved everything we ate. It is really good idea to NOT eat breakfast before the tour to most appreciate what is offered.

Great introduction to Hanoi. We did this tour the night we arrived here. Hanoi can be quite intimidating when you first arrive, and not knowing what direction to head in, we thought this tour would be a good start after reading trip advisor reviews. We didn't book but just turned up at the tour office. Our guide was called Sea. We had a fantastic evening and met some lovely people in our group (there were 11 of u). Sea took us to several different places we would have just walked past had we been on our own and he explained a lot about what we were eating and also about the culture here in Hanoi. We had a great evening and would recommend this tour to everyone

A Must do street food tour in Hanoi!!. After being recommended to do this tour by another traveller who had done it days earlier, we booked for the 5pm tour. We were joined by 6 other fellow travellers, and we got on really well, super fast. Our tour guide was Amy. You must ask for her if you can. She was enthusiastic, bubbly, knowledgeable friendly and funny!! She lead us across the crazy streets of Hanoi telling us to stick together like "sticky rice!" We tried bun cha, pho, rice crepes, fried cakes (spring rolls and the like), sugar cane drink, bbq skewers, sweet dessert & the piece de resistance-egg coffee. You must definitely not miss out on this amazing coffee. All the food was from Amy's favourite places & they were all delicious! Great to eat at places with the locals. Best to go on this tour with a good appetite or else you will really miss out. It was a fun & educational street food tour. Sad to say farewell to our new friends! C'am o'n Amy!!!

A must do when in Hanoi!!!. We are so glad that we did a street food tour whilst we were in Hanoi, our guide was Lotus. Lotus took us to several local restaurants where we got to sample some truly delicious local food. She shared lots of knowledge with us, it is great value for money and we couldn't give it a higher recommendation!! Definitely do this tour whilst in Hanoi.

A must do!. This tour is nothing short of amazing. So glad we did it on our 2nd night in Vietnam as we learnt so much about the food. The dishes we tried were all lovely especially the Pho Bo! Our guide Lotus was a star, friendly, knowledgeable and funny. Make sure you are hungry as its 3 hours of eating. Excellent value for money. Just go!!

Amazing!. A wonderfull experience in Hanoi! Mrs Moon is an amazing guide! Showing us the best food in the city in 3 houres. Don't eat anything before you do the tour, cause you will be stuffed when it's finished! Highly recommend this tour!

Mark Lowerson's street food tour was a highlight of our visit to Hanoi!. My husband and I had only 3 nights in Hanoi and wanted to check out the street food scene with the help of a local. Mark and his partner Tu provide private walking tours for 2-4 people. The $75/person cost for a 3-hour tour may seem high to some, but we found it worth every penny for the insider experience- introducing us to the hidden alleyways and foods we wouldn't have thought to try, but were all fantastic! Can't recommend highly enough. You can book by contacting: lowiemark@yahoo.com.au

Great experience :). I'm so happy that we signed up for this tour on our first day here! Our guide Amy was excellent and full of energy :) she guided us through the busy streets to her favourite street food spots and it was truly delicious! Make sure to build up an appetite though.. We also had the opportunity to meet other travellers on our tour which always adds to the fun of the experience! Highly recommend doing this :)

The best!!!! A must!!!. Had a street food tour during lunch. Our guide Amy was the most friendly, most helpful and most interesting guide ever!!!! It was as if she was an old friend!!! She took us to her favorite places and I just loved everything. She took us to places where mostly locals go and talked to us about not only food but about politics and everyday living in Vietnam. Thanks for everything Amy!!!! Our tour with you was the best part of our trip!!!

Miss Moon was awesome. We did this tour on the 19th with Miss Moon as a guide. Just us and another couple. The food is just incredible and the guide available for all sort of questions, food and lifestyle. She really tries to make a great experience for her guests and make us feel special. We had lots of different types of dishes, all of them very tasteful and the best in hanoi probably. She nows the local people and the city. She even refused to take a tip at the end even if she really earned it. Thank you.

Yes!. I was in Hanoi for a wedding in August and signed up for this tour whilst the rest of the group was doing something else. I hugely enjoyed it and thought it excellent value for money. The guide was not a food expert per se, but gave great info about how Vietnamese people live and eat, and was hugely accommodating. Street food in Vietnam is delicious and is delicious but sometimes it really helps to have someone who knows what they are doing show you around.

Best Introduction to Hanoi's Old Quarter. We followed the advice of other tripadvisor reviewers and began our 3-day stay in Hanoi with the Hanoi Street Food Tour. It was the best decision of our trip to Vietnam. For first-time visitors from the west, Hanoi's chaotic Old Quarter seems unapproachable. Even crossing the street in the face of a tidal wave of oncoming motorbikes is a challenge, let alone deciding where to--and not to--eat! My daughter and I booked a 3-hour private tour with Hanoi Street Food Tour on our first morning in the city. Over the next three hours, our lovely guide, Hien (whose English is excellent), showed us so much more than the world's best street food. Yes, we ate 7 different and uniformly exceptional dishes at food stalls--what pass as restaurants in the Old Quarter--that we wouldn't have dared enter on our own. Yes, we strolled the narrow, hectic alleyways that are the Old Quarter's grocery, with all manner of fresh vegetables, fruits, meats (dead and alive), and yes, insects, for sale. But beyond this, Hien gave us an invaluable cultural tour of old Hanoi, explaining the "logic" of its street layout, its history, and how today's crumbling relic of Hanoi's colonial past meshes with Vietnam's emerging modern economy. We couldn't have had a better introduction to this dizzy, fascinating city. If you go, take lots of photos of where you eat. You'll want to find your way back for more, and you won't be able to do it without a trail of bread crumbs.

An absolute must!. To begin I'd like to start by saying the only regret was that I did the food tour on the last night of my stay in Hanoi when I should have done it the night I arrived. But in saying that, I wouldn't have met the great people and shared with them the best night of the whole trip. I stayed in the old quarter and this tour really finds your bearings of the city and its bustling streets.Our guides name was Sea (as his parents named him after conceiving him on their honeymoon) and he was such a great host. Very funny, very interested in you as a person and as a whole group. There were 10 of us on the tour, all strangers and Sea straight away got us to introduce ourselves to the group and we all bonded very quickly.The tour takes you to many local eateries on corner streets, down dark alleys, places you wouldn't usually dare to enter. Usually each guide has his/her favourite spots that they frequent with their own friends. The dishes I tried were all great. I especially loved the pho chicken noodle soup, and the egg coffee! Beer corner was a fantastic way to mingle with the group and locals, and after the tour was over we all walked straight back and kept the night going. For 5000 dong per beer ( about 0.26 cents au) a shout for the group with a few rounds cost $6. A quick tip the beer runs out as a keg only lasts 24 hours. We closed 2 restaurants that night so you just keep moving on.To finish up, the street food tour is something you must experience. Do it on your first night and you'll learn a lot about the city from your guide. I'll do it every time I visit!

hanoi. like everywhere in Vietnam turn every corner and a surprise awaits you.This is a great flashback to the old Se Asia experience,it's like Bangkok 30 years ago really interesting city but keep an eye out for rouge mobeds and visit ho chi mins resting place and museum loads to see with good eateries also not such a big tip scene here like Saigon probably because the Americans didn't get here

An absolute must do!. Really interesting and yummy tour!Good value for money!Make sure you're hungry as you get a lot of food!Our guide Kiwi was really knowledgable and made the tour really good fun.You would never be able to find or identify these places and dishes on your own. Gave us lots of confidence about having street food in the future.

Whatever you do in Hanoi, do this. We spent four days in Hanoi and this was the best thing we did. Starting with the most obvious reason for taking a street food tour, the food is terrific. Moving on to the next most obvious benefit of doing something like this, our guide (Cherry) was great - informative and friendly and spoke good English. However, I think the most important reason to take this tour is actually that it's a perfect way to see Hanoi's old quarter, and a perfect way to adjust to the hectic nature of the place. You find yourself eating in little local cafés and restaurants which, without the benefit of a guide, you might never have ventured into, still less known what to order. Plus, we found that following a guide around the streets took the stress out of walking round Hanoi - all of a sudden you're no longer concerned about getting lost and you're significantly less worried about being mown down by one of the 10,000 motor bikes on every street! After the tour we felt more comfortable and relaxed for the remainder of our time in Hanoi. I would recommend that anyone going to Hanoi for a number of days do this tour on their first or second night - it's the perfect way to see what a great city Hanoi is!

Best Tour In Vietnam. I participated in this tour last night and it was incredible! I have to say I was sceptical to participate - not being one for tours and feeling quite confident to find and try Vietnamese street food independently - however, I was amazed! Our guide Sea took us on a gastronomical adventure trying 10 dishes/drinks in 3hrs. Of which I'd only previously tried 2 and the ones Sea found us were even better. He gave an insight into Vietnamese culture, encouraged trying but didn't enforce and I was so full at the end, but wanted to do it all again. Do this on your first night in Hanoi so you can restaurant repeat and have them all again. This tour was fantastic and worth every dollar and as a bonus we met other lovely travellers with a passion for excellent food!

Truly unique experience. We had Anh as our tour guide. She was amazing. Over nearly three hours, she took us to 8 different places, all of which were wonderful and would be impossible for anyone not from Hanoi to discover. Additionally, all of the other people in our group were wonderful, and she made accommodations for dietary restrictions. Anh also shared a piece of family, food and Hanoi history with us at each place, making it a truly memorable culinary adventure for anyone looking to learn about the culture!

Thank you so much Lotus. We had a ball, great insight into the Hanoi street food scene and the eating habits of the locals. Our guide Lotus was extremely friendly and shared a wealth of knowledge about the foods, cooking and customs surrounding the sometimes daunting to new comers Hanoi streets. We thought the pace was great and the spread of foods and deserts wonderful. Beer and coffee to finish off, perfect.Very highly recommended.

Great Tour! We really enjoyed everything!. My husband and I did this tour with Kiwi - she was excellent! We had a small group of 6, which was perfect. You get to try local foods (nothing too weird), with a local at local spots! We stopped at about 5-6 places total and tried everything from savory noodle and meat dishes to dessert and coffee. We had one of the best desserts we've ever had - the yogurt with jack fruit and "coffee beans." We even went back for it the second night! We also did the puppet show after the food tour. The seats were not the best - on the side in chairs instead of center. The show was short so it was fine, but if you want better seats, buy them from the theater yourself.

An absolute must.... My wife & I booked the group tour ($20USD/person) one evening during our trip to Hanoi. The night we were scheduled for our tour it was absolutely pouring and we considered cancelling. We're so happy we elected to go on the tour! Our guide was Lan Anh (aka Kiwi) and she was fantastic. She expertly guided us to 7 stops through the rain and bustling traffic of Hanoi. Throughout the tour Kiwi was informative and also sparked a lot of great conversation asking us about the food & culture of our respective countries.Come hungry. All 7 stops we made were delicious. Most importantly, the places we visited were places we would have never visited on our own. In particular, a few stops on the tour were "speakeasys" through hidden doors or back rooms.This is a must-do for anyone visiting Hanoi.

Wow...make sure you do this. We joined two other couples tonight on this tour with our guide Hien. Hien was gorgeous and was very proud or her city and country. A true ambassador. The tour was informative and the food was sensational. Great value. Definitely worth booking.

Fun, informative and very tasty!. Hien was our guide for the street food private tour. She was so enthusiastic about the food she was introducing to us, and was an absolute expert at ushering us around the busy streets safely!The food we tried was amazing, and Hien shared her knowledge of local history and culture beyond the food.It really was like spending a day out with a super interesting and caring friend - I couldn't recommend it more highly.

So. Much. Delicious. Food.. My wife and I booked in a private street food tour ($30US/pax) for our first day in Hanoi to help us know a little more about the local food for our month in Vietnam.Nga (aka Money) was a fantastic guide and shared lots of local knowledge about the food, the city and the people. It was 3 hours of nonstop eating and we were able to try anything that we walked past between the main food stops at no additional cost. Definitely the best way to know the ins and outs of the local food!

Foodie Heaven. You must do this tour! I suggest going within the first few days you arrive in Hanoi as it will give you a great overview of the food on offer. Our tour guide Trang was fantastic and we tried so many dishes on that day that we wouldn't have by ourselves. I have posted some pictures on my blog www.travellingfork.com.

Lifetime experience. We booked this food tour at our last night in Hanoi and Vietnam. And it was a great decision because it was superb :) Even before we have tried a lot of things from street kitchens but this program was the crown on our gastro trip.Our guide, Lotus, was absolutly delight. She was friendly and informative. She explained each dish to us along with introducing us a bit to local life in Vietnam. Foods was delicious and very authentic.A 'must do' experience in Hanoi.

Must do if are a foodie!. The street food tour was one of the highlights of our trip. Our guide, Miss Moon, was an absolute delight. She was friendly and informative. She explained each dish to us along with describing the sights along the way. Go hungry because just when you think the tour is over, you will go to another place to try another dish. They are all delicious and give you a real sense of the food culture in Vietnam. We have traveled to many countries and the food in Vietnam is among the best and you get to experience that on Miss Moon’s tour. Basically, Vietnamese food in the States, while good, will never taste the same. If you are at all interested in food, I highly recommend this tour. Due to the location of the places you go, an added bonus was a free tour of the old quarter.

Yummy food!!. This tour should be booked for one of your earliest nights in Hanoi - to know where the best places to eat street food is great. Many of us were solo travellers, so it was a great was of meeting new people whilst sampling some divine food. The famous coffee was delicious, although I think we had enjoyed the food earlier on in the tour too much to really appreciate the flavours!A 'must do' experience in Hanoi.

a must do!. We booked this food tour our first night in Hanoi, and was the best thing we could have done.Sea was our tour guide and was so lovely and friendly! He brought us to places you would never think to go to on your own. It’s a great way to explore Hanoi, experience the delicious street food and meet fellow tourists. We had a great group, and had so much fun.Definitely do this tour! Best spent 20 dollars!

A must!. We had this tour guided by Kiwi. She took us to a 7 different food/Drinks! it was excellent. we loved the green papaya salad! the spring rolls and fried stuffs. The desert was sooooo spot on! it was yogurt with some fruit, Jackfruit and others! and i love most the hidden alley egg coffee! you wont find it unless you are with local who knows it. Great to sample all the foods!

A great way to start. A great way to experience Hanoi - food. An enjoyable evening with lots of food that we would never try if not for this. Great guide and group - always interesting to meet other tourists. Totally worth the experience!!!

The best intro to Hanoi! . This food tour is the best way to start your visit to Hanoi. Our tour guide, Sea, spoke English quite well and told us a lot about Vietnamese food, but also shared personal stories and insights in Vietnamese culture. His explanation of the food was excellent! Every stop had local food of great quality and variety, so well worth the trip for everybody. For about $12 for 3 hours with lots of deliciousness, this is a steal. Personal highlight: the Vietnamese spring rolls! Tip: don't eat too much before you take the tour, as you get around 8 courses!

Do not miss!. It's a great introduction to Vietnamese food, pho sure! We sampled 5 main courses, 2 desserts and 1 drink. We ate at cafes, restaurants and street stalls. We walked all around the Old Quarter and all in all we ate for 3 hours and a bit. The meals we had covered a typical breakfast, lunch and dinner. Hien, the guide, was enthusiastic and knowledgeable and proud of her country's food. It was value for money, only USD20 each for the tour. I would do the tour again anytime!

Worth every penny. Just got back from our street food tour with Hiem (nickname Cherry) our guide. We decided to book a food tour after arriving in Hanoi and not knowing where to start! We were also a little worried about knowing where and what to eat after hearing warnings about some street food in Vietnam.The tour lasts about 3 hours and we tried about 9 different foods as well as the most amazing coffee/hot chocolate I've ever tried. It's called eggy coffee or eggy hot chocolate which may sound strange but it's a creamy yet light drink and it's only available in Hanoi. The restaurant is located down a small alley, one which we never would have found but clearly is very popular with the locals as it was packed when we arrived. This is definitely one place that everyone on our tour said they would revisit.Overall, the trip is great value for money and I'd recommend it as a great introduction to Hanoi's food.

Excellent, you should definetly do this. We booked the tour as a walk in and we had a great evening with our excellent guide Sea.We had a lot lot of local food including the best coffee ever which you can only get in Hanoi.It was not one of that super touristic tours, it was more like having dinner with a local friend. Really great!

Awesome!!! Highly recommend!. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour today with miss moon!!! We tried the most delicious food we never would've found by ourselves! Don't eat Anything before you do this tour, save all the stomach space you can!

Excellent Intro to Hanoi and Vietnamese Food. We joined the food tour on our first night in Hanoi and Vietnam and we are really glad that we did. There were 6 of us in total in our group and our tour guide, Lotus, was excellent throughout. She was very friendly and polite and took us to some excellent places. We visited a total of 10 different venues and sampled all sorts of savoury and sweet food, coffee and beer. For $20 the tour is an absolute bargain and we would highly recommend it to anyone who is new to Hanoi and Vietnamese cuisine.

hanoi night life. 24 hours, the city never sleeps. so many people in Vietnam, can't speak english so you have to be patient :)  the attractive place can be catch by taxi, but please very carefull, please asked local guide or your hotel about trusted taxi. i only have one book who explain about the attraction place, it so easier to find :) but the city is so crowded, too noisy in the evening till midnight

Fabulous Food Tour - Street Food Hanoi. We have just literally returned from this fabulous food tour - Sea was a fantastic tour guide and saw us safely through the crazy motorbike packed streets of Hanoi to some great eating establishments. I particularly loved the rice pancakes with pork, the spring rolls which were totally the opposite of what we have at home in the uk. The local beer and egg coffee topped the experience off. Probably the best 3 hours we have spent in Hanoi so far. Try it and you won't regret it.

Hanoi street food tour. Highlight of the Hanoi trip. We had " to die for" pho, bahn mi and rice rolls. I think the experience has spoilt me for life and I'm not going to find another gustatory experience to match this. We had an excellent guide , "sea" who was very professional and very enthusiastic. We had a fairly big group of 8 from elderly folks to kids and he looked out for everyone, helped everyone navigate the treacherous Hanoi traffic, made everyone feel included and welcome. He tailormade the tour to suit us. We would never had ventured into the nooks and crannies if it was not for him. If anyone is worried about unclean food, all 8 of us had no problems!

Hanoi street food tour. We had miss moon as our guide for this tour & she was very charming, informative & funny. It was one of the best tours we done in Vietnam, would totally recommend it to anyone going to Vietnam & the food was absolutely amazing!!!

fantastic food, great tourguide and wonderful evening. We joined the tour spontaniously at the office and it was amazing. Kiwi our tourguide led us through the streets of the old quater.we were allowed to taste great food and drinks, and the dessert, i would die for it. It was not to much walking, more feasting in different corners of this fascinating part of hanoi.Thank you kiwi, we enjoyed being with you and our wonderful group.Highly recommended, don't book from your hotel, sometimes they have more expensive tours, which will take you to restaurants and not to the real street food places.Perfect evening

awesome food, good guide and a great evening. If you want to tsste hanoi, this is it! There is no fancy restaurant or western food on this tour, this is what i came to vietnam for ( well, one of many things )!Kiwi our guide was great, she speaks english very well, can tell lots of funny things about vietnamese habits and the food, you just need to ask questions! The food itself is incredible.... i will never go to a "proper" restaurant anymore becsause this tour is an eye opener. Why expensive when great food can be such a bargain?Thanks for the unforgettable evening kiwi! I am still dreaming of the desert and the egg coffee :-)Dan

Defining Hanoi experience. If you are looking for a uniquely Hanoi experience to define your Vietnam trip, do not miss this street food tour. The money spent will be well worth it.And if you are looking for a guide that has a good command of English, is knowledgeable about the local food culture and passionate about meeting people, make sure to look for Trang, who is also affectionately known as Lotus. Not only did Lotus bring me on a hunt for authentic Vietnamese delicacies-- from street food to noodles to deserts-- through the entire of Hanoi, she also shared with me stories, of Vietnamese history weaved into personal experiences as a resident of Hanoi. It was her authenticity and openness that made the experience so relatable and un-superficial. I'd definitely recommend the tour and Lotus to anyone who's visiting Hanoi for the first time.
Must do!. Loved our evening out! Although it was a little limited for a vegetarian, I still had a wonderful time and enjoyed the experience.

Must book lunch time tour with Miss Moon!!. Just back from this tour today and currently recovering from all the food - do not bother with breakfast because you will have lots to eats! Miss Moon was absolutely delightful - she was so enthusiastic and lovely to talk and laugh with. We sampled many things - about 11 items in total. She was happy to give us local information and answer any questions we had. We really did have the best afternoon with her. Highly recommend this tour, particularly the lovely Miss Moon!!

terrific experience-great young guide. We did Hanoi Street Food Tour on our first evening in Hanoi. It was a great introduction. Got a close-up look at the Old Quarter and sampled a lot of street food at places that, on our first night, we may have been a little hesitant about. Had a small group with just three other people-all interesting. Our guide, Lan Anh, aka Kiwi, is delightful. In addition to explaining the food and a bit about the culture, she was terrific in telling us about the life of a younger person in Vietnam today. All of the places we ate at were full of Vietnamese and not tourists. We ended the evening at a coffee place that we would have never have found on our own. The entrance was just a long hallway. But when you walked in a ways and then went upstairs, it was a busy, fun place full of locals. I highly recommend this tour and I especially recommend trying to get Kiwi. She will ensure a very pleasant experience.

Fantastic experience. Had a really pleasant time on the tour, it's almost as much an insight into general Vietnamese culture. We had 'Snow' as a guide who was such a natural and so sweet, and you could see how much she loves her job. Tasty, varied food along the way. Most stops we were seated off the street in restaurant/backroom areas which was made it easier.$20 is actually really great value for 7 stops inc beer, if you included a bonus final stop at a Bia Hoi (keg beer on street, fun!)Overall a top quality night.

Great way to learn about and taste street food. After meeting our guide we walked a short way and into a narrow store. Perched on tiny little stools amongst the locals, we started with Bun Rieu Cua, a delicious soup with crab meat and tofu. We continued throughout the Old Quarter to several more stalls and enjoyed many delicious meals. A personal favourite was the Banh Cuon, rice flour pancakes filled with pork and mushroom, served with fresh herbs and a tasty dipping sauce. Our last stop was for an egg coffee which could be compared to an iced coffee, but far more delicious. We had a private tour and our guide Anh (aka Sunshine) was a delight to spend a few hours with. She was bright and bubbly and gave us a great insight not only to the local street food, but also local culture. As it is so busy, noisy and crowded in the Old Quarter it is worth paying the extra money to have a private tour, it would not have been the same with a larger group.

Unforgettable and required experience in Hanoi. If you're planning your trip to Hanoi, do NOT miss an opportunity to take this tour. We took it with the amazing Anh and had some of the most fun we had in our trip to Vietnam. By having someone guide you through the Old Quarter and the variety of food with new friends, you'll get to experience all sorts of food that would be hard to find otherwise, and have a great time.

Disappointed in quality of this tour. Although we booked a private tour on line when we arrived there was confusion and we were allocated a young uni student as a guide . She appeared to have little knowledge of local street food and we just wandered along slowly to the allocated food stops There was no explaining of food we saw along the way even though we asked. And we were given savoury food then ice cream then savoury again so our pellets were very confused. This was not value for money at $60US our guide was very polite however and did her best . I was given more information and interesting food on my previous general sightseeing tours. Make sure your guide is knowledgeable before you start.

Favourite thing in Hanoi. I had very high expectations of this tour with such a high Trip Advisor rating and I found out the high rating is well deserved. Our tour guides Amy and Lotus were very knowledgeable and friendly. They answered all our questions about Vietnamese food, buildings and culture. Zipping around on the back of a scooter was a fun way to see many sights. The food was amazing and we got to try so many new dishes and places that I otherwise would have no idea even existed if not for the tour.

A must do while in Ha Noi!. My boyfriend and I actually live here in Ha Noi, but decided doing this tour would be a good way to get to know the awesome secret places to eat around the Old Quarter! Our guide was Miss Moon (Hang) - what an awesome guide!!! She oozes personality and really gets excited about you having a good time on the tour and ensuring you are looked after. She uses the concept of 'sticky rice' for sticking together when crossing the busy streets and is such an asset to this company.We tried about 8 different dishes, including some delicious pancakes, fresh fruit, pillow cakes and of course a stop at a Bia Hoi - words can't describe how great this walking tour is...excellent value for money, you get to meet some fellow travellers and see the REAL Ha Noi (and realise you DON'T get sick from eating street food...you ACTUALLY get amazing fresh food for a fraction of the cost!).Will definitely be doing this tour again when friends and family come to visit :-)

Fantastic way to have Hanoi OldQuarter Explained as well as........ Our Tour Guide Thanh was excellent , negotiating food for us to sample, helping us cross busy streets, explaining the street system and road names, he was very well versed in this culture and his guiding was very goodwe tried foods that normally you would not try, and the food tases are wonderfullwe sat on small stools just like the localsthis is an inexpensive must do whilst in Hanoi

An Experiance Not to be missed !. Great way to eat the best Vietnamese hawker food, like the Vietnamese !By ourselves, we would not have known which stalls to visit, nor would we have chosen to sit in these small stools by the roadside. We did not have to worry too much about food poisoning, safety or being hassled to buy anything.Tour operator was late picking us up from the hotel. However, they sent 2 scooters to pick 3 of us up. Thus, we had an unexpected chance to ride a scooter on Hanoi streets - too bad it was such a short trip.The walking tour was great, though I felt we should have visited 1 or 2 more food stalls in the tour. The majority of the tour was spent on drink stalls to fill us up. For those of us who do not drink alcohol, we finished the tour not quite full. Overall it was a good introduction to Vietnamese food & drinks.We took the tour on our first night. We visited a number of streets on Old Quarter - their shopping belt and also where most of their good food is located. That was a good decision as we learnt some important things.We learned how to cross Hanoi streets, a must-learn if you want to go anywhere on your own : stick out your hand to let vehicles know you want to cross and keep walking slowly. Don't stop to wait for the vehicles to give way to you - it will not happen.SEA, our English-speaking guide was most obliging. He went out of his way to help his tourists buy emergency items on the way, acting as interpreter. As a result, our tour ended late. His office was closed. However, since they promised to send us, 3 ladies, safely back to our hotel, SEA took it upon himself to walk us back. He missed his bus home and had to take a taxi and pay out of his own pocket. His dedication is highly commendable.We were charged USD20 each for the food tour. Though some felt this is expensive given the fact that the items we consumed were very cheap, I felt it was acceptable as we would otherwise not have had a chance to sample so many good dishes on our own given our limited time in Hanoi/Vietnam. I recommend this tour to anyone who have a few hours to spare, want to see where Vietnamese people go to eat and want to try great Vietnamese food, but don't know where to go !

easy introduction to hanoi. The evening tour took around 4hrs, we visited 8 different places and was a hoot. Our guide was good fun and knowledgeable about lots of local stuff. The selection of food was easy on the western palate, but delicious none the less. Great way to start your stay in Hanoi.

Hanoi street food tour. We took a tour with Hanoi Street food tour and it was a very good decision. The food was great, and we tried quite a lot of things, from noodles to ice cream and coffee, while drinking a couple of beers. As a Portuguese, I'm very picky with the coffee, and I must say that one of the few coffees I liked out of Portugal was during this tour: egg coffee! I also want to emphasize our guide's simpathy. Money, as her boss nicknamed her, is a very good guide, and an example of how friendly a Vietnamese can be! She made our tour much more enjoyable.

Fabulous!. The first thing my husband and I did upon arriving into Hanoi was book the Hanoi Street Food Tour. We are Foodies and love trying new cuisine. Kiwi our guide did an excellent job of making each and every stop was unique. She was extremely friendly, knowledgable and spoke excellent English. After finishing our tour, my husband and I felt confidant that the rest of our stay in Hanoi would include all street food for our meals.

Best food tour. We took the lunch tour with Anh-our english speaking guide and the tour was excellent. She took us to eating places that we would have never gone to-we would have just walked by---it was great-a must do in Hanoi--a great value and when we got back to out hotel ay 5:30 we could hardly think about dinner-- great way to see Hanoi and have great food

Great tour!. This tour was an excellent way to experience different street foods in Hanoi and at places you wouldn't normally think to try. Sea was our guide and he was great! Friendly, informative and very helpful. Tour was well organised and the food was great! You visit 8 stops in 3 hours so it is a great way to see the city too. We went back to a couple of the places again after the tour.

Excellent!. We took the evening tour with Anh (Aka Sunshine) and the tour was excellent. At each stop we were provided full size meals with an explaination of what the meal was and why it was important. Sunshine was enthusiastic, knowledgable, and very excited to show us Hanoi. She lived up to her nickname Ong Anh (sparkly/twinkle Ahn) as her zest for life and all things Harry Potter was a bright spot in our trip.

Amazing introduction to Hanoi and my best night out in the city. For context, I am a very adventurous eater and am very comfortable with eating street food all over the world with a lot of hand pointing to help me get what i want.This tour was amazing. Sea was my guide and there was only one other person on the tour so we had a tour that was completely tailored to what we wanted to do. What makes the tour is that it doesn't feel corporate at all - if you want to visit more places, have second helpings somewhere or have a beer it is all encouraged and included in the price.Sea went out of his way to help us have a good night. We drank a lot of Bia Hoi to end the tour and then later went with him to meet his friends and have more drinks and cake go celebrate one of their birthdays. This was a great insight into how the local people go out and everyone was very hospitable.The food is fantastic and you can get places that you like marked on your map so that you can visit again. My top eats were the spring rolls, bahn cuon and the egg coffee.This is a great way to start your time in Hanoi, meet new people and experience things as a local would with a little assistence.Thank you Sea.

Excellent intro to Hanoi Old Town and Street Food. We got "Moni" as our guide. She was very friendly, spoke good english and was very familiar with the food and area. She was a local Vietnamese student that had grown up in the country side to the north, but now resides in Hanoi as a college student. She starts the tour with some introductions and questions about food allergies, likes/dislikes, time spent in Vietnam, familiarity with the food etc. I really appreciated how she uses this to customize the our for your group. There is no standard tour she was about to bring us on that is the same every time. She makes it up as she goes based upon the group. It was a great experience and I would recommend it to anyone as the tour is customized to your liking.

Best way to get a taste of Hanoi street food!. Not speaking the language and not having any idea of what food I might encounter, I was hesitant to try the street food on my own. So my daughter and I took this tour on our second evening in Hanoi -- it was a great choice!Our guide led us to about eight little places where we sampled banh mi sandwiches with pork, pate, and egg, street donuts, rice papers filled with pork & mushrooms, had some lovely lemon/lemongrass iced tea, some fried pork 'pillows', fried pork skin, some amazing cut mixed fruit smothered in coconut milk, some 25 cent beer (I passed, but my daughter who just turned 18 tried it, she said it was pretty disgusting), some grilled pork skewers, and some great coffee/tea.Later in the week, we returned to some of those places to enjoy them again (plus we tried the fried eel soup, too).We didn't have a reservation, just showed up about 15 minutes in advance, paid our $20, and joined the group (about 7 of us, mixed nationalities). It was also a really nice way to meet other random tourists and enjoy an evening in little hole in the wall restaurants or sitting on little plastic stools in the middle of sidewalks. The best part was that we didn't have to negotiate prices and our guide took care of paying for everything.

Fantastic scooter trip. My cousin and i booked this scooter tour before flying back Mexico with two best tourguides ever (Amy and Thuy) who are super adorable, knowledgeable, funny, best drivers. We had a wonderful time together. All of foods and drinks are brilliant. I like the lemon tea, mix noodle beef and fried vermicelli chicken most. They also took us to Ho Chi Minh mausoleum, Long Bien bridge, defending pagoda,...that we didn't have enough time to discover. Thank to the scooters, we don't have to roll back to our hotel (as Amy said before starting this tour). Stay as hungry as you can cause you'll be stuffed crazily as a chicken.

Awesome, love Johnny. Awesome, awesome, awesome.... Wish I had done this on my first night here. Johnny is just a wonderful tour guide. Love him to bits. Great fun, great variety... Went in places I would never dream of entering... Meet lots of other tourists too. Only way to experience the real Vietnam. Make sure you do this tour!!

Yummy little tour. My Mum and I did this tour in Hanoi as we had done a similar one in HCMC the week before. We met our guide at the shop and completed the tour on foot. At the end we were left at the last food stop to make our own way back to our hotels.Our guide was knowledgable on the area and took us to an assortment of food stalls (see photos).Definitely worth doing so you can try something different.Ending the night with a coffee was difficult however... not exactly a night-cap.

Excellent Tour, Great Food, Helpful/Fun Guide. We only had a few hours to sight-see in Hanoi and decided to do this food tour at night. There were only 4 of us (at USD 25/person) and it made for a nice, intimate tour where we could actually talk to one another and get to know the tour guide (Amy)/talk to her about Hanoi. The food and drinks were all excellent. There wasn't one thing I didn't like! I also thought it was a great value. The tour guide was very positive and excited about the tour, and you could really tell she loves Hanoi and loves to show people the local food. I really enjoyed myself and completely forgot about work, emails, and the rest of life. I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Hanoi.

Fabulous Street Food. I did the night time street food tour with Hanoi Street Food. Our guide was "Sea" who told us a charming story as to the origin of his nickname. We were a small group of 6. The food we had was absolutely fabulous and from authentic hole in the wall places frequented by locals. Everything was delicious. I wish I could do it again. The egg coffee is a must. Thanks Sea!

Street food at its finest. If you enjoy street foods and small talks, you definitely should try this. Not only will you taste vietnamese delicacies, you will also hear stories being told while walking and enjoying the back alleys of hanoi. Ms. Moon is a terrific guide. This is yet another reason to go back to hanoi.

You can go where you cannot go without locals. These street food place looks interesting, but not easy to try by yourself. If so, this tour is the best way to spend your time in Hanoi. From noodle to desert, you can try a lot of different types of food, even beer and coffee. It would be five-star if the guide speaks better English, although she was very friendly and tried to entertain guests. What she explained were interesting (and that is why I hope she explained as we could understand easier. Guests need to share what some of us understood with other guests). You can still visit places with good food. They avoid local but unsanitary places with a good food. They care bathroom. Worth it. You don't regret joining this tour.

Excellent experience. We were told about the Hanoi Street Food Tour by some travellers we met out at Halong Bay. We were guided by the delightful Miss Moon (Hang) who took us to restaurants, that to be honest, we wouldn't have frequented ourselves! The food we tried was really good and certainly wouldn't have tried the variety of options if we had not done this tour. Probably more suited for adults than kids though.

Eat a light breakfast!. This is a fantastic way to experience a variety of Street foods in and around the Hanoi old quarter. Don't have much for breakfast or you'll not have room for the 5 dishes, local beer, and coffee. Miss Moon, our guide, delivered an informative and entertaining commentary along the way. Definitely recommend this tour.

Best food tour!!!. Miss Moon was our guide, she was such a delight taking us to 9 different treasures in the old quarter. I would highly recommend doing this tour at the start of your holiday as it gives you a great insight in to the local delicacies. There is something for everyone on this tour. Small group of us (only 8) worth every cent (dong) and more. This was the highlight of my two weeks in Vietnam. Brilliant, I cannot recommend it more highly.

You Must Try This Delicacy !. Before we left for Hanoi for a 9-day holiday trip, I told my friend Raymond, about a boiled egg called balut that I had taken in Cambodia a few years ago. It is an egg that has a young developing chick or duck embryo that is boiled alive and taken in or out the shell . We were scouring all over the streets until the last tow days before we leave that we found a woman carrying two baskets on the shoulder selling the eggs. Raymond was hesitating and squirming trying to eat it when a a friendly passerby took a piece of aromatic vegetable, some spices from the seller woman's basket and add into the balut for him to eat. He gave up half way and I finished the rest for him !!. It is really tasty with the spices. It is a delicacy, beside Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos And Philippines You know what : when we were waiting for the airport taxi at about 6 am just outside Hotel Rendezvous Hang Dieu Street, we saw a group of elderly women having balut for breakfast!! One egg costs only 50 cents USD

Great tour :). We had Dai Duong Zanh (Sea) as our tour guide the first night we arrived in Vietnam in Hanoi. We decided the street food tour might be a great way to meet the local people and sample the authentic food, but not only did we do that, our guide was also knowledgeable, spoke really good English and most of all was a really good companion for the night. Sea was interesting and funny, and he explained every dish we sampled in detail, and showed us what to add to it and how to eat it. Our favourite part was sitting on the street drinking fresh beer with our Australian & Canadian companions, watching the world go by and toasting each other (in Vietnamese). Sea also explained a lot about the culture in Vietnam, the customs and most importantly, got me the best coffee of my life to finish with -a hot egg coffee. If you don't try that, you don't know what you're missing! A great night out, great introduction to a beautiful country. Thanks so much Sea...would recommend you to anybody.

Worth it!. For about $20 each, Amy took us and another couple to 8 different spots around town. This was the 2nd night of 3 weeks in Vietnam and this tour made it 100x easier to figure out what and where we should eat throughout the rest of our trip.

Best tour to start off your stay in Hanoi. We have been in Hanoi for 2 nights and found it very overwhelming and crazy so we decided to do a street food tour and found this one had the best reviews. It was the best experience. You definitely don't leave feeling hungry! Great food great tour and the best tour guide "Sunshine" and she was a beautiful ray of sunshine such a lovely girl and so informative we asked her many questions and she knew the answers to everything. Speaks great English and was genuinely interested in our life too! Highly recommend you do this tour and for $20 it is so worth it! Great to meet other tourists as well. :))

Perfect first day activity. We did a street food tour on 4 October 2014. This was the perfect activity for our first day in Hanoi. Our guide Sea was extremely friendly and knowledgeable. There were 6 people on our tour and we visited around 7 or 8 food and drink places. All the food/drink was delicious and I was very full afterwards. Walking around Hanoi the following day I easily located the places we stopped at on the tour. We booked the 8pm water puppet show as part of the tour; however, the tour ended just after 8pm and we needed to make our own way to the theatre which was 5-10 minute walk. This made us late to the show. I highly recommend this tour, but I suggest booking the water puppet show separately.

We love ms moon. Best way to cure the overwhelming streets of Hanoi and to fulfil the desire to get amongst it with the help of great And really sweet local knowledge ... Start the tour as hungry as u can and don't forget to sticky rice together across the road .... Best food we had the whole trip highly recommended

Excellent Choice To Get Acquainted With Hanoi. Hanoi can be intimidating, especially in the old town, which is crowded and busy. It has a different vibe. Take this tour as soon as you land and the city will be a lot more mangeable. Miss Moon was stellar. She exposed us to a bundle of wonderful dishes in a friendly, energetic manner. I won't spoil it by listing what and where, but be assured all the food was all delicious. She also generously gave some shopping advice (good place to buy silk) and answered lots of questions we had while walking through the city.Okay, dear reader, if you are still unconvinced about taking a street food tour, try this:What is egg coffee?Would you ever wrap an springroll in a leaf?Do you know what banh mi cua is?No idea? Take this tour!Oct 13, 2014

Great tour with a great guide. The street food tour was really good. We had a lot of great food and drink. Make sure you get the egg coffee at the end!Our tour guide was Sunshine who was fantastic. Very friendly and really knew what she was talking about and all the best places to eat.

Great experience - a "must do" at the beginning of your stay. We loved this street food tour. The guide - Miss Moon - was very informative and knowledgeable about street food and took us to many really great places. Many places were small street stalls that we may have walked past and not noticed or been brave enough to try but with Miss Moon we tried all kinds of great things. She explained how to add your toppings and described all the ingredients. She was also very helpful when our group stopped at a fruit stand and wanted to know about the different fruits even though this was not a planned stop. I would highly recommend this tour and do it at the beginning of your trip so you can enjoy the street food while you are in Hanoi.

The best way to discover Hanoi street food!. Friends had told us we had to do the Hanoi Street Food Tour - and ask for Miss Moon! And what a fabulous experience it was!! We had our 14 year old daughter with us and she loved it too and tried everything!!Miss Moon had the eight of us crossing the busy streets of old town Hanoi like "sticky rice" - all close together and safe. We tried all sorts of local specialities - like pho with crab meat, pillow cakes and sea crab nem (or sausages), banh khuc (sticky rice filled with mung bean paste, pork, and spices), the most delicious pork spring rolls ever, and fresh fruit in coconut milk. Our favourite was probably the bun can - a fabulous broth with noodles and pork pieces as well as pork patties, greens and (by choice) a good helping of chilli… "Nong lam" (delicious!!!)The great thing was we sat down on stools with the locals and ate their food with them at different eateries over town. The cost of this type of street food is minimal. Miss Moon also took us for a "fresh beer" - rice beer made that day. It's about 3% alcohol, and incredibly refreshing, even if you don't like beer. While we had our second beer (everything was included in the cost) Miss Moon nipped home and came back with a special treat for us - local rice wine (a bit like sake). It certainly made an impact!The tour showed us around Hanoi, and taught us about street names and prefixes. By the end we felt confident not only eating local food on stools on the street, but had some favourites we could ask for, or knew where to get! We finished the tour with a local speciality at a fabulous bar - egg coffee (Cà Phê Trứng)! Vietnamese coffee mixed with egg yolk at Cafe Giang, 39 Nguyen Huu Huan street, in the Old Quarter!
