I won't be trying it at home folks, but it was a great experience and perfect for the tour. We had a lot of fun, learned heaps and met some really nice people. You really couldn't ask for more. Do the tour on your first day in Hanoi so you know where to go and what to eat with total confidence.

best tour in hanoi. we went on the street food tour by awesome adventures they took us to eight or nine restaurants including appetizers, desserts and various main dishes they were all interesting and gave us an idea of how to recognize different specialties our guide was very informative and the entire tour which lasted almost four hours was absolutely great this is the second time i have taken this tour and we went to different restaurants both times if you don't go on this tour you will be missing not only one of the highlights of hanoi but also a great bargain go and enjoy yourself

So fun!. Just took this street food tour and had a blast. The streets of Hanoi are a little crazy - motor scooters everywhere and traffic signals that don't actually control traffic. So walking through the old quarter in a group feels marginally safer than trying to go it alone. We visited perhaps 8-10 different street vendors and all of the dishes were superb (although you have to be a fan of Vietnamese food). Later during our stay in Hanoi we went back to the old quarter and selected places to eat at random - not one of them was as good as the spots on this tour. Miss Moon, our guide, was very upbeat, and the other 4 tour participants were all really interesting people. I definitely recommend this activity. Pro tip: Come hungry and don't finish every dish early on to save room for more.

excellence. i spent a couple of days at Hanoi. Its a lively city with his food and atmosphere but im sure, if i havent got "Lotus" as my guide, than i cant enjoy the city not even half of that.She took me to beauty parks, to amazing buildings and restaurants where u always wanna go back. Im just so thankful for her help. U have to meet with her if u going Hanoi!Thanks Lotus once more

Street food a must in Hanoi. We booked the tour on our first night in Hanoi as we read such fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked a private tour which costs $5 more than a group tour. We liked the private tour as we could ask as many questions as we liked. Our guide was the lovely Thuy (Miss Snow), she was so delightful and answered all of our questions. We visited about 9 different places and they were all great. The food was delicious and most shop owners were friendly and smiley. Three hours is just the right amount of time. We certainly recommend this tour, do it when you first arrive so you can return to any of your favourite spots!

A brilliant tour with great food, sights and guide!. We had been told that we must take a street food tour and despite the fact we were 15 mins late (navigation trouble!) the office called our guide who looped back round to collect us. Sea, our guide was amazing, very fun and interesting with great English and we had lots of fun with him taking us through the town. The food and drinks were brilliant, a favourite was the lemon tea and pork pancakes! In the next few days we revisited a few of the stops for another taste and have made note of them all to recommend to people. A really great evening, eating tasty food and meeting new people! Highly recommended!

Best way to start your Hanoi adventure. My wife and I booked the street food tour on our first day of the trip and it was probably the best decision. Miss Sunshine (Anh) was our guide and there were 4 of us on the evening tour. She was very enthusiastic and so eager to share about the Vietnamese culture, food and their way of life. The places she brought us to were nearly all places that are recommended by other food review sites. It was great fun sitting by the pedestrian walkway on the low stools, eating the way that locals do. The tour brought us to 8 different local food stalls including a taster of the local homemade beer and the cafe which invented the egg coffee. Overall it was thoroughly satisfying and overwhelmingly filling! Start with your tummy empty and get off to a great start for your trip at Hanoi Street Food tours!

Excellent way to see more of Hanoi. Miss Moon was delightful; what a great way to taste our way around Hanoi. We still laugh over the instruction to act as "sticky rice" when crossing the busy Hanoi streets in a group. So many different tastes and at places where wouldn't have ventured by ourselves.

If you want to eat local food, this is a must!. We walked around our first couple days in Hanoi in awe of all the street food but nervous to try any not knowing what it was. We signed up for this and what a good decision. Ms moon took us to several local street food places and we had food we'd never had and would have missed our on. Definitely do this upon Hanoi arrival! Plus, we met other travellers which is always great!

This is a must for your first day in Vietnam. Quynh was an excellent guide. The food we ate was amazing. And our guide gave us a very informative overview of the history of the food, culture, Hanoi, how locals live, they're housing, the way they eat, how they socialise but also explained the food content, how it's made and also we got to see some of the processes to make the food as well. The egg coffee is a must. Absolutely delicious. Would recommend this tour to anyone who is new to Vietnam to get acquainted with the street food as this is where you want to eat. We found a few places we will definitely be going back to. I recommend taking a map to mark any place you really enjoyed so you can find it again.

Great Way to try lots of authentic Vietnamese food!. We did a street food tour on our 2nd night in Hanoi & I can't speak more highly of our guide Kiwi & the places she took us. The food was authentic & in places we didn't look twice at as tourists as they are local hang outs. We got to try the famous Egg Coffee which was delicious & again in somewhere we had walked straight past as it was a hole in the wall cafe. Definitely worth the time if you're looking for some great Vietnamese food.

Must do. I’ll say this up front – arrive hungry, then pace yourself. There’s a lot of food on this tour and it’s a great experience. I would say a must-do. You’re taken down back streets, through districts and into eating houses that you probably wouldn’t brave on your own. Our guide, Money, was charming and made sure we had a fantastic, culinary experience. And in our group of six she (inevitably) had to deal with some dietary issues – 2 no seafood, one no wheat. But it was no problem at all. You don’t have to be fit to do this. But you should be a walker. And definitely an eater. This is a great tour. One more thing – we did the tour that included the Water Puppet ticket. Timing-wise, it worked well. But the Water Puppets were just OK. The 45 minutes was more than enough. Hearing the Vietnamese music that went with it was much more interesting. And wear your short legs. It’s like the seating is meant for children.

Not to be missed!. Without doubt the best thing we did during our time in Hanoi!! Our guide Kiwi was awesome, she spoke perfect English and was interested to hear from everyone in the group about where they come from and what they do for a living. She also offered great little pieces of information about Hanoi and some Vietnamese history which added to the whole experience. The food was amazing! We tried 7 different dishes in total. The short walks between the different courses is needed because you end up eating loads! It was local food that we may not have tried without a local to guide us. Personal favourite was jackfruit desert with yoghurt and coffee beans! Simply, an unmissable tour!

Great tour for food lovers!. We thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with Kiwi. She took us to a variety of eateries all around the Old Quarter. Kiwi was a wonderful tour guide and she also knows alot about the city which was great. All up it was seven stops, with everything from noodles to the famous egg coffee. Walking from place to place is a great idea as it gives you time to make room for more delicious dishes. Definately would do this tour again and recommend to any food lovers!! Also, do not eat before this tour.

Delicious way to enjoy Hanoi. We loved our street food tour with Lan (Kiwi). We ate 10 unique dishes and explored the Old Quarter. We enjoyed trying new things and visiting hidden cafes. For tourists worried about getting sick from street, don't worry we were fine after the tour. We didn't book ahead of time, we chatted through their website to reserve a spot the same day and paid on arrival. This is a great way to see Hanoi and try their delicious food. Highly recommend!

Great local food tasting. Yesterday we spent several hours with Miss Moon in Hanoi's Old Quarter sampling local street foods. Miss Moon was a wonderful hostess with an abundance of energy and wealth of knowledge and obvious love for her local area. Many stops along the way to sample different foods including a beer stop and finishing off with a delicious egg coffee. A great way to become initiated to the tasty delights of Hanoi. We thoroughly recommend.

One of the best!!. I randomly signed up for this on a weekday and was really surprised. Our group was roughly 6 people and the guide. The guide spoke really well English and made the entire tour a lot of fun! Only thing I would change is to make the dessert last but otherwise awesome! Got to try a very wide variety of amazing food that I would have never even given a chance! We had some fresh made beer, spring rolls, amazing fresh fruit dessert, and a few other dishes. Every place had the right portion and it was a lot of fun!! I would recommend this as the first thing to do when you get into the city! Our guides name was Sea and overall cool dude! He talked to us about culture and really made the whole experience a lot of fun! Check it out!!

Do This Food Tour First!. My husband and I did this food tour the first night we were in Hanoi, and we're so glad we did! Our tour guide, Amy, was super enthusiastic and very adorable. The first thing she taught us was how to cross the busy streets in Hanoi. There were times when I really didn't think we could cross with a group of 7 people, but somehow we managed! The food we had was really good and the portions were BIG! We stopped at 8 different places and sampled many foods, an ice cream, sugar cane juice, and ended with some really tasty (and strong) egg coffee. Do yourself a favor and don't eat for at least 4 hours before this tour... you will leave completely stuffed!

A fantastic way to introduce yourself to Hanoi's street food!. We knew we wanted to try street food in Hanoi but felt a little nervous going it alone, as there is so much choice! This was a truly fantastic experience! Our guide Sea was so knowledgable and it was great fun as he took our small group around the best street food spots in Hanoi. If you are wanting to try the delicious street food on offer, but feeling apprehensive about where to go and what to order - do this tour! It really is a must do!

Great introduction to Hanoi. We did this tour less than an hour after arriving at our hotel in Hanoi (deliberately... and booked ahead). It was a great orientation not only to food but how to cross the road in Hanoi! Lotus was a delightful tour guide and by the end of our few hours we'd marked some places on the map to go back to, had some insights into Hanoi life and some great tips on other attractions to visit. I think these sorts of tours make a great introduction to a new city...

The cutest tour guide and so much food we couldn't finish!. My friend and I booked this tour only a few days in advance, but they were very easy to communicate with. We met our ADORABLE tour guide Nga at the tour office and right away she made us feel at ease and was so sweet. The tour included 9 stops, but we actually only went to 8 because we were so full. DONT EAT BEFORE THIS TOUR. We made the mistake of having a decent sized breakfast a few hours before and regretted it. We started off with crab meat noodles, meat sauce sandwich, young rice ice cream, rice paper rolls, lemon tea, fried cakes, sweet rice porridge, and egg coffee! ALL were amazing and Nga explained them all to us and was so patient and lovely. These were hole in the wall, local places that I never would have found on my own and have since returned to. Seriously, WONDERFUL guide, amazing food, and good times. Do it! Thanks Nga!

3 hour walking food tour. Miss Moon, you are amazing! Your English is great and you were both friendly and informative. Thanks so much, we had a great time. The seasonal fruit with coconut milk is still my favorite. And thanks for the directions to find my own passion fruit to buy. I got ten to eat!!

Awesome!!!. Really amazed by this attraction... We went with Hien, she's super nice and we ate 5 different plates :) and a dessert and a café!!! Super awesome. At the end, I talked with local people to know if the plates were really from Vietnam and they said it was the typical food of here ! :) I really enjoyed the attraction, and it really worth 20$. Just a little advice, go there without eating before !! You'll get full easily ;)

Street Food Not To Miss. We looked at a few different street food tours in Hanoi and choose this one it was exceptional Miss Moon was very knowledgeable and friendly , it was a small tour that visited 8 food spots all with exceptional local food which I probably wouldn't have tried alone.

Best decision. I'm so glad we signed up for this. Ms. Moon was super informative and friendly, we had a great time following her around and stuffing our faces, each dish exotic and amazing. I wish I could take Ms. Moon around with me all the time and have her help me cross the street saying, "sticky rice!" What a delightful experience.

Excellent - do not miss!!. We had the street food today and Ms. Moon took us through the streets of hanoi and we had 8 different courses and can t say which one was better. A true discovery of one of Hanoi's hidden jewel - strongly recommended

Great tour with Kiwi!. I did the street food tour with Kiwi and had a really fun time, had some great food and good laughs too! Kiwi is really knowledgable about the food and took us to some real gems. I would really recommend Hanoi Street Food Tour and Kiwi - it gives you a real taste of Hanoian food.

Brilliant . This was a great way to experience real Hanoi. It is a crazy city and as a tourist you tend to stick to what you think is safe when eating. This tour took us to places where Vietnamese people ate that you would never think to go. All the food we tried was amazing. Our guide Sea was brilliant and had us all bonding really well as a group. It was great to be introduced to authentic food in some weird and wonderful locations. I would definitely recommend this if I was staying in Hanoi.

Best way to start holiday. Brilliant! Learnt how to cross the road (a special skill in Hanoi) while enjoying such an amazing array of local street foods. Spent the extra for a private tour (picked up from our hotel) and walking and using taxis learnt where to buy food and what to eat.

Foodies must do!. We had just one day in hanoi before going north to sapa. We decided to go to the tour in order to explore the local cuisine and try some new things. We were so lucky to get ״kiwi" as our guide. The lovely young lady took us to the many hidden jams of the city and to try things we would never likely to find by ourself. She was very nice and made sure to answer all our questions (even not about the food) and that we are having a good time. Thank u kiwi! In conclusion- for all the foodies out there - do it!

A Fantastic Experience. We had a terrific tour. Great company, great food and our tour guide, Sea, was absolutely brilliant. I can't say enough about him. He spoke great English, was intelligent, informative, warm and huge fun. He put us all at ease and involved everyone in the group. Hanoi can be overwhelming at first, especially with the massive range of food choices. This tour really helped us understand a good bit more about Hanoi culture in a fun way and it really broadened our food horizons into the bargain.

Must do. Family of four( adult teens) had a wonderful guide "Hien".very friendly and interacted well with us all.we booked this tour on the afternoon we arrived in vietnam.we were a bit tired but thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.we ate in cafés I never dreamt we would.it made us aware of the tastes and variety of vietnamese food culture.highly recommend.
A must do on your first day in Hanoi.. Thank you"Kiwi" for your kind hospitality and showing us where and how to eat Hanoi style :) The food is fresh, delicious and plentiful.

Superb!. Our guide was a charming young lady called 'Money' and she did a superb job of guiding us through the maze of the Hanoi street food scene. There were only two of us on the tour that evening and this was definitely one of the very best things we did in Hanoi. Great to spend 3 hours with such a charming Hanoi local and have so many of our questions answered - in addition of course to the primary purpose of the tour which was to guide us through the myriad street food venues. My recommendation would be to take this tour early in your Hanoi stay as it gives you the confidence to eat in so many places you would otherwise just past by.In short, an absolutely excellent tour and great thanks to Money for being so helpful and making the tour so very entertaining and worthwhile!

Amazing!. We had Sea as our guide and he was great! This was one of the best things we did while in Hanoi. We tried food on our own, but we were exposed to a much greater variety on the tour. We had a great group and loved our experience!! Highly recommend. Thank you Sea for a great experience!!!

We came, we saw, we conquered!. My bf and I are huge foodies coming from SF, and because of our limited Vietnamese, we decided to join the food tour to get a feel of the local food and stalls. We were not disappointed with Sea and Sunshine (who is training to be a guide). They were a delight and spoke wonderful English. Crab noodles, Vietnamese pancakes, fresh cold hanoi beer from a keg and more! The 11 am tour was the perfect length with the perfect amount of food. If you're living in old Quarter, this tour is a MUST! Happy Eating!

Great intro to Hanoi/Vietnamese food. We did this tour on our first evening in Hanoi. What a great introduction to street food, which seems to be basically all the locals eat (went to a few fancier restaurants and seldom saw any locals). Our guide (Sea) was very friendly, helpful, and spoke very good English. Food on the tour was very tasty, and we got a chance to see about 10 different spots (all included in the price).I would highly recommend this tour for an intro to how the locals eat, and some of the best Vietnamese cuisine you will try . Come with an empty stomach, as you will be eating a LOT.

Great Experience to try Hanoi Street Food. The Hanoi Street Food Tour was probably the best experience we had in Hanoi. We were lucky as they made a tour just for the 2 of us, since no one else signed up for the tour at 11AM. Also, my friend and I are vegetarian and our guide paid special attention to what we can eat and ordered all the meals accordingly and explained the ingredients very well.Our guide Ms. Moon was just great, we visited 10 places and had typical Vietnamese food and drinks. Ms Moon explained not only the different meals but also gave us a lot of interesting facts about the Vietnamese culture. We can definitely recommend the tour but be sure not to have too much for breakfast before.

Friendly guide, great food, wonderful experience. Yet another glowing review for this tour. Our guide was Sea, a charming young man who kept our entire group engaged in the tour which covered everything from Pho, through to egg coffee and the best places to sample Hanoi's Bia Hoi. As a previous reviewer has said, do this early in your stay in Hanoi to get yourself clued up on the culinary delights available super cheap on the streets of Hanoi!

Highlight of our Stay. We just returned from the most amazing Street Food Tour with the charming Miss Moon. My husband and I are definitely 'Foodies' - and this tour is unbelievable value. We had about ten different food stops, including cold beers at Beer Corner, fresh fruit, and a 'secret' coffee shop. We ate at places we would not have been willing to risk on our own, met the owners and 'chefs' and ate the most delicious food. Miss Moon is a sterling advertisement for her company - smiling, friendly, very knowledgeable, helped us with purchase of souvenirs and clothing, and shared a lot of history and culture. We also learned how to cross the road in Hanoi! 'Sticky Rice' (stay close) and Miss Moon's protective hand waggle which somehow slowed traffic! I especially enjoyed the fact there were only four of us on the tour. A five star tour which should not be missed! Thank you so much Miss Moon, and Brian and Jan from Melbourne who joined us. Sandra and Gerald, Sydney Australia

Super!. We took this tour after 1 week in Viêtnam and was affraid to know a lot already ... we were wrong!
The guide (Hiem, thank you!) was really good, and know a lot about Hanoi. For food-lovers, it's a must-do.
"Sticky rice!!"

Our tour guide made it what it was!. Our tour guide was Lotus, she was fantastic! 2 of our members were vegetarians, so she tailored the tour to places where she could get them vegetarian meals as well as giving us a taste of Vietnamese food. All in all, all the food was excellent! Absolutely delicious! Definitely worth the $20 and the 3 hours to do the tour (our tour was 4 hours because we talked a lot). If you have the time, definitely do it!

Fantastic 😎. We did the tour with Lotus a lovely Vietnamese lady who took us on a very interesting tour. We tried many different foods & drinks that Vietnamese people eat for breakfast, lunch, snacks & dinner plus trying rice beer. Strongly suggest it as part of your trip to Hanoi. It is a walking tour over 3 hrs so you get to see many things explained by your guide, well worth the money you will be full at the end of the tour .

One of my favourite things I did in Vietnam. We had Lotus who was a lovely and knowledgeable guide. It was great to try delicious dishes that I wouldn't have known existed otherwise. Good value too. Highly recommended!

A must-do in Hanoi. We were guided around the streets of Hanoi 'sticky rice' style by our friendly, fun and enthusiastic guide Amy. From start to finish the tour was brilliant and the food fantastic and full of flavour. We went to some places that you wouldn't necessarily try without the aid of local knowledge and tried food that we would otherwise had missed - like sticky rice ice cream. Some of the foods were less favoured than others but all were a great taste experience that we are glad to have had. Our group was 4 people in size which we thought was great. We would recommend you do this tour early in your trip as you'll be left clued up on the tastes of Vietnam which will without doubt enhance your stay. At the end of the tour Amy was happy to guide us on to our next location and offered assistance with taxis as needed.
Fantastic!:). Best experience in Hanoi! Great food and places!:) big thank you to are guide Lotus for a great trip!:)

Great experience. I signed up for this tour and it as definitely the best part of my stay in Hanoi. Tour with with Hiem, she was informative, friendly, great fun to talk too and took us to some of the best food i had eaten. The tour Could be adjusted so when i told her i had already tried something she took me somewhere else. Real fun to meet Hiem and hope to see you when i come back to Hanoi.

A memorable night in Hanoi. I signed up for this tour And brought along two colleagues. Our tour guide was Lotus and she was friendly, charming and easy to talk to. We felt very relaxed and comfortable to walk the busy streets of the old quarter with her. By the third stop we were already full but still craving more fantastic street food. The places she took us to were accommodating and had different flavours which suited all palates in our group. Lotus provided us with background and information about each of the shops that we visited. Even in the pouring rain which came in, Lotus offered to get raincoats for us and escort us to the next destination with a taxi so we would not get wet. I am so glad I did this tour... I would have missed out on a part of Hanoi if I had not. Thank you Lotus!

Good even if you are from Asia :). Went for the Hanoi Street Food Tour and it was definitely worth the time and money. Tasted a total of 2 drinks - ice lemon tea, ice blended dessert with assorted jellies and beans, 3 main dishes - ban chu, rice flour rolls and pho, 4 snacks - pillow cake, spring rolls, pork skin roll, salted pork balls and sugar cane rolls (Bo Bia). The pho shop that we sopped by was supposed to be one of the top three pho restaurants in Hanoi. It was really good. We also stopped by the oldest restaurant in Hanoi. Our guide was very good and very accommodating.Would definitely recommend this itinerary even if you are from Asia!

Sticky Rice!. Just got back from our tour with Hiem. She was very informative and made sure we were all full up on food! The food was amazing, we are not usually very adventurous when it comes to food but we liked everything. The egg coffe was a great way to finish it off! Thanks again Hiem, highly recommended to anybody!

Crash course. To get a crash course into Vietnamese food we could not turn down, not entirely bad for the amount of places we tried. Would have preferred to try some less popular but still good Vietnamese Street food.

Best thing we did in Hanoi!. Hot tip, have a very small lunch because you'll be insanely full after this! Amazing value for money, and a great way to learn about the local cuisine. We got to try the very best of Hanoi, real street food. Clean and safe, super delicious. Ask for Amy, she's the BEST guide ever.

Great introduction to street food!. As hanoi was our first stop in Vietnam and this was out first time I'm SE Asia, we were overwhelmed and a little frightened of the unfamiliar street food and really didn't even know where to begin! Booking onto this tour was a great decision as we were able to try foods that we would never otherwise have touched. One of us is vegetarian and this wasn't a problem as our guide Hiem knew exactly what every food contained and was able to provide delicious alternatives. Hiem was lovely and very knowledgeable and we had a great time chatting to her about life in Vietnam and learning all about their food and culture. Now we are much more comfortable eating street food as we have tasted how amazing it it!

Great way to taste the varieties of Hanoi food!. This was well worth the $20, Miss Snow was a great, helpful guide, and so was her assistant who tagged along! Their English was good and the food was (for the most part) even better! Be careful not to fill up on the first couple of dishes!

MUST DO. I booked this trip on my first day of hanoi trip after reading great reviews on tripadvisor. I was the only one who booked on that time, so even though it was supposed to be a group trip, I had some sort of a private tour. My guide Nga(Money) was very friendly and helpful. She knew a lot about Vietnamese history, and her explanations were very good. She was also familiar to Korean cultures, so we had pleasant conversations. I loved every food I had and I think this tour is amazing because you get to try food that you wouldn't if you tour by yourself. It's worth of every penny you pay. I totally recommend you to do this tour if you are in hanoi.

Excellent tour, amazing food!. We decided on doing this street food walking tour after reading its amazing reviews. We could not be more happy with our decision, we would recommend it to everyone. We showed up at around 4.45pm to get a place on the 5pm - 8pm group tour departure and were welcomed by the friendly staff. To our surprise no one else was booked on the 5pm tour so we ended up having our own private tour at group tour rates! Our guide Hien (Cherry) was amazing, she was so lovely and shared a lot of information about all the dishes we tried. She even ran down the street after a man selling food from his motorcycle for us! We ended up eating various local foods at many different places that we would never of even thought to venture to on our own. Definitely know what the other reviewers say now by feeling stuffed/full by the end of the tour, I would suggest a light lunch if doing this in the evening unless you have a big appetite. Excellent tour, if you're in Hanoi you should definitely give it a try. Easily the best $40 we've spent in Vietnam thus far!

Great tour!. Ms. Moon was a fantastic guide for our street food tour in Hanoi. We had a group of six, and we stopped at more than ten places. We tried many places that we wouldn't have thought to try, and the food was excellent. We went on our first day in Hanoi for a lunch tour, so now we have ideas on what to eat for the rest of our trip in Vietnam. Ms. Moon was funny and always explained what was in the food and how to eat it. At the beginning of the tour she asked all of us about any special dietary needs, and she would have tailored the tour if we had certain needs. She also told us stories about some of the people making the food and how long they have been cooking food in Hanoi (some for many years). There was a good variety of food, and we definitely were very full at the end. It also gave us a nice opportunity to walk around Hanoi with a local and share cultures. Overall it was a great experience, and we were both very happy we went. Thank you, Ms. Moon!

Recommended!. This was our first night in Hanoi after traveling to ho chi Minh city, so we were excited to try more food. We got paired with Amy as our tour guide, who ended up being awesome!! She was friendly, talkative, genuine, and went above and beyond to help everyone in our tour have a great experience. Don't eat lunch! You get to try a lot of food! And by the end of it I felt like someone should roll me back to my hotel!

Incredible start to our Vietnamese holiday!. We'd booked this tour for our very first evening and couldn't have asked for a better start to our vacation!The tour operators picked us up from our hotel and took us to their office to complete payments etc.. On mopeds! Our immediate immersion into surviving 2 wheelers in Hanoi! :) We then met our guide for the evening, 'Sea' and our gastronomic adventure took off..Firstly, the food was incredible. I could use a whole lot of adjectives here, but I know all other reviews have covered that, hence :) We went to about 7 eateries, all lil street joints. After each place we swore we couldn't eat another bite, but we still finished off plates at the next. :) I've noticed a few reviews mentioning the lack of a dessert stop.. So we realised early enuf Vietnamese don't really eat too many sweets per se, but we were taken to this place that served cut tropical fruits with some condensed milk and ice.. Seems plain enuf, but it was yum! I finished off 2 bowls by myself (and I think this was stop #6) :D We finished with the much written off egg coffee and it did not disappoint! A few friends of mine were a lil sceptical of this, but sure enuf converted after the first sip.The food covered, our guide, Sea, was amazing. He was friendly, knowledgeable about the food and eager to converse. Not only did he take us to try awesome food, he helped us orient ourselves to Hanoi itself! Helped us get a good deal on SIM cards, showed us some stops of interest and best of all, helped us get some good deals on shopping stops we made! :) The shopping bit wasn't really planned, just us walking into stores that looked interesting. He was soo patient, no matter the fact that it ended up extending our tour by almost an hour and a half. :) Also, I ended up leaving behind a packet of something I bought at one of the eateries and Sea immediately coordinated with colleagues of his and had it picked up and delivered to us where we were! That was awesome! Thanks again Sea! :)Do book yourselves on this tour. We paid $20 pp, and that seems expensive, given how cheap food in Hanoi is.. But the experience made it more than worthwhile!

Awesome introduction to Hanoi's Street Food. My sister and I went on this tour on our first day in Vietnam and really enjoyed it. Our guide, Money, was really knowledgable about both food and the city in general, and she took us to 8 great places in the Old Quarter, most of which we wouldn't have gone to (or wouldn't have known what to order at) on our own. It was just us and a couple from Belgium, and I really appreciated the small size of our group. We loved all of the food, and went back to many of the places multiple times (we especially loved the rice paper mixture, kem com, and chatting tea). Highly recommend, especially on the first day of a visit to Hanoi!

Great way to see Hanoi. We arranged a private street food tour for myself and three friends on a recent trip to Hanoi. Our tour guide Lotus took us for a wonderful walk around the busy streets of Hanoi and we got to sample 9 traditional Vietnamese dishes at restaurants we probably would not have gone to. There was plenty of food to go around and worthwhile doing if you love Vietnamese food!

Great experience. This was a fantastic experience tasting street food we would not have ever tried on our own. Each dish was delicious. Miss Moon was a friendly guide and very helpful. We did the lunch tour and couldn't eat dinner that night,being much too full. Highly recommend this trip.

Amazing trip in the Vietnam flavours. We really enjoyed tour! We tasted the most traditional Vietnamese dishes, cooked in the places in which they were born. Hien (Cherry) was a wonderful guide among these flavours. Try this tour as soon as you arrive in Vietnam in order to open your mind to the vietnamese cousine and culture

Cool street food tour!. We had an amazing experience with Saigon Street Food Tour and were looking for a similar tour in Hanoi. Different than Saigon, where we were sitting on the back of a scooter, in Hanoi you do a walking tour. Our guide Quinh and her friend took us to 10 different restaurants, offering authentic Hanoi street food. Both were very engaging and we had a great time listening to their stories. The tour finished at a local coffee shop! You must try their Vietnamese coffee! Overall, a great tour!

Great street eats!. This food tour was great. We had 6 different "dishes." Dishes includes a sugar cane juice stop and an egg Vietnamese coffee. The tour was 3 hours (6:30-9:30) and there were a total of 9 people on our tour. We had a great group. We became friendly and went out after the tour so that was great. The tour itself was cool. We tried the "can't miss" street food dishes such as Bon cha (BBQ pork rice noodle), papaya salad with dried beef, bun cuon thit (rice crepe), Bahn da cua tom ca bo (red noodles) and ended with sugar came juice stop and egg Vietnamese coffee. I was disappointed that there was no desert food stop because I know it's a thing in Hanoi. I was not a fan of the sugar cane juice and neither was anyone else in the group. That should be cut from the tour. Other than that the guide was super friendly and the overall experience was cool.

best way to start off your vietnam trip. we did this tour as the very first thing in vietnam. our own private guide nga, called money for convenience, took us to 10+ restaurants and catered to our every wish. we ate very good, intersting foods. we had everything from main dishes to desserts to beer and coffe. it was a great way to dip into the vietnamese culture. I would recommend this tour to anyone, as the food is delicious and you probably would have a hard time ordering and eating in the places that are not meant for tourist if you're not fluent in vietnamese.

Great food tour of Hanoi!. Hien was an amazing guide on this tour. She was cheerful and took us to some fantastic food vendors. I ate some great food thanks to her. I highly recommend this tour and I highly recommend Hien as a tour guide! Definitely check this out in Hanoi. It is a great value.

Best tour!. Best tour booked during my trip. It is a must do for visitors to Hanoi. You'll be taken to places that serve the best local delicacies. Our tour guide Hien was really knowledgeable and always cheerful. You can see that she really love what she's doing.

Delicious street food experience! So worth it!. This is one of the best travel experiences I've ever had. What better way to discover a city and culture, then through it's food. Our guide Amy was very well informed, and explained to us about each and every dish that we tried. Everything was honestly superbly delicious, and it was great to see it from a local's eyes! Our favourite's would have to be the rice noodle dumpling with shrimp inside, and the egg coffee!! OMG one of the best coffee's ever! It was hidden in a hole in the wall place and if it weren't for Amy, we would never know it existed. Amy was also very sweet and caring, as my mum has a knee disability which makes walking difficult for her, and Amy graciously held her hand and kept her supported when we walked to every stop. She was also very much part of the wonderful experience we had. I'd highly recommend this food journey to anyone that visits Hanoi! An absolute must. However, eat a light lunch and be prepared to feel like a stuffed turkey but it's well worth the food coma after.

Walking Street Food Tour. Thank you so much to Hien for taking us on the tour! The food was amazing and gave us the confidence to try different foods and to go to the stalls on the street. My husband and I have just moved to Hanoi and this tour was perfect for introducing us to many delicious foods that we otherwise would have been to scared to try. Our guide Hien spoke really good English and gave us loads of information about both the food and the city. Great tour for experiencing all the hidden gems this city has to offer! Thank you!!!

A great way to taste real Vietnamese cuisine- wish we 'd done it sooner!. We did this on our last night- big mistake! We didn't realise you could eat so well and so cheaply (being a bit afraid of trying a random place before this tour). Our guide, Lotus, was friendly and knowledgable about the food and Hanoi in general. Our favourite things were the egg coffee (try it cold- amazing!), the selection of little fried savoury pastries, and the bo bia- a sugar cane sweet that Lotus ran after a guy on a moped to buy for us. I would definitely suggest doing the tour- it's a very fun 3 hours. 20 dollars well spent.

Great experience!! . I loved the tour!! As I was walking through the city, I saw many local places I wanted to try. But I wasn't sure what they are and if they are good or not. I wasn't courageous enough to just try. So the tour took us to many different places and I got to try a lot of stuff that I would not have on my own. Our guide, Sea was very friendly and with another couple, we talked a lot and had a great time. It was a very pleasant afternoon with pleasant group of people :) after the tour, I feel more comfortable trying out local stalls on my own.

Outstanding!!. First day in Hanoi, I had an enjoyable time. Our group is 5 people with a guide named Amy. She's the best guide I have ever met before. We got well on with each other. We spent a day to enjoy the local delicacies; she is very knowledgeable about Hanoi and helped me to have a better understanding of both food and culture. I have to say that dishes were so delicious with reasonable prices especially “bun cha” although I had troubles using the chopsticks. We also visited some popular hang-outs for tourists and the traffic was quite crazy with hundreds of motorbikes. But anyway, it’s definitely worth embarking on this tour.If you're a gourmet and want to discover the gastronomy city, this tour will be a good start. I highly appreciate the tour and thank you Amy for an enjoyable day.

An amazing adventure. Do it!!. For anyone who loves food do this tour. It was a great opportunity to discover the best of Hanoi delights & scenery walking around the old qtr. great local guide with an abundance of knowledge. Well worth every dollar!

Thanks Amy! Sticky rice . This was a really well run tour. Walked into about 8 little grubby places I doubt I would have stopped at otherwise but all the food was great and the guide, Amy, was excellent and explained everything taking good care of us. I literally got off the plane and this was the first thing I did and glad it was as it made me realise that in the old town the little hole in the wall places are doing the best food. I was no longer avoiding these places so thanks for helping me embrace Hanoi street food Amy! Yeah so do the tour, no regrets

Brilliant way to try Hanoi Street Food safely. We booked our Hanoi Street Food tour through Viator, it cost USD$26 per person, there were only 5 of us on the tour and it was absolutely fantastic. Our guide was very knowledgeable, he took us through the food market, we tried some wonderful foods, he explained where was safe to eat, what to look out for, we had so much fun. We went to small corner eateries, we ate from a street vendor, we went to an amazing coffee shop that you'd never find on your own and had great coffee whilst enjoying the best view of Hanoi at night, we walked through markets, and even tried silkworms, and yes they were yummy. The tour went for around 4 hours and was totally enjoyable and included all our food, which was plenty.

Great Introduction to Hanoi's Culture and Food. Our guide for todays food tour was Ms. Money. She was an amazing tour guide. She was very knowledgeable about the food she got us. She also told us interesting legendary tales and about Hanoi's culture, history, and people. She was also kind to share with us other sites to see in Hanoi for the rest of our trip. Thank you Money for such an amazing and unforgettable experience!

Great way of finding safe and delicious options. We had been eyeing the street food while walking around. This tour gave us the confidence to finally sit down and take part. Our guide was always friendly and helpful.

Great introduction to street food of Hanoi!. We booked this tour after reading good reviews on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. It was our second day in Hanoi (and in Vietnam) and it proved a great way to get to know some of the local delicacies as well as teaching us that what might look like little more than a hole in a wall can produce some truly tasty fare! We were a small group of 5 which meant that our enthusiastic guide Amy could easily speak to us all at once as we crowded around a low table on even lower plastic stools! She kept us well fed and watered throughout the evening and was a fount of knowledge about both the food and the city. We were able to ask her any questions we had about the people and the culture and she encouraged us to try foods we would not have sampled alone. Her cries of 'Sticky rice' helped us cross the roads with a little more confidence than usual. I highly recommend this tour, especially if you've just arrived and don't just want to pick your food by where there are already other tourists eating!

Excellent and worthwhile introduction to vietnamese street food. I'd definitely recommend taking this tour on your first day (as we did) as it helps to give confidence in where to go, what to ask for and gives a great insight into the culture of Hanoi street food. We opted for a private tour, and Amy was an excellent guide - she offered great explanations, and was happy to answer any question as well as helping me with some basic Vietnamese! We visited 8 different places and tried foods such as bun cha, sticky rice ice cream (kem com), bahn cohn (rice pancakes), sugar cane juice, salty donuts, egg coffee and more! You definitely don't need lunch before taking the tour in the evening and we had to leave some of the food at every stop as we just got fuller and fuller! A fantastic introduction to street food and a definite recommendation to try this in Hanoi.

Totally worth it!. If you need some confidence in eating street food in Hanoi then you must do this tour. Preferably on the first day you arrive. That way you'll be set up to continue the food adventures even once the tour is over. We we're already exploring the street food, but this tour help to step it up a notch. Price includes all food and drink. Highly recommended!

Very interesting taste experiences. The tour of Hanoi street food is a must do for visitors to Hanoi. Quan, our guide, was very informative and enthusiastic about Vietnamese cuisine. We sampled so many different foods that I would never had tasted before - not saying I liked all of it, but I loved having the opportunity to be so adventurous. Quan gave us a fascinating tour of the Old Quarter through food. The coffee shop at the end had magnificent views over Hoan Kiem Lake and the coffee was simply delicious. Thank you Quan for making this such an enjoyable evening.

Definitely worth doing.. Miss moon is the best tour guide we have ever had. She was really informative but never boring. She showed us foods which we wouldn't have been able to find on our own and was eager to hear what we thought about them. She was really open when we were being nosey about her family and boyfriend! We have been back to 2 of the soup places she took us to. She had though of everything- planning a toilet stop at a shopping centre because they were nicer toilets and breaking up the tour with beer and fruit so we didn't get too full. We passed a lady selling pigs heart as a snack and because we asked about it miss moon bought us some to have with our beer. A lovely lady and a great tour.

Money is the guide for you!. We organised this tour as two family members were coming to meet us during our travels and wanted to encourage them to eat more street food during their stay in Vietnam. They loved the tour as did we. Money is a great tour guide giving information into the foods we were eating and into the city. She even sent us an email detailing the foods we had eaten and where so we could revisit. Keep up the good work Money!

Perfect!. I followed the advice of the previous reviewers and made this my first tour. Sea, the guide, was such a good teacher and loves his job. The food places he took the group to was great! I advise everyone to book with this company. I'm thinking of doing it one more time before I leave. :)

So much good food!. We decided to try this tour after reading the reviews and weren't disappointed. Our tour guide was Money and she took us around tasting 9 different things. The best part about this tour was trying things from little holes in the wall and places off the street that we wouldn't normally have dared to eat at. There was so much food that after the third place we were already feeling full. Money was a great tour guide with great knowledge that she shared with us. A definite must while in Hanoi!

Must do in Hanoi and ask for Kiwi!. One of the highlights of our time in Hanoi. Kiwi was the best tour guide - knowledgeable and friendly. We really enjoyed spending the two hours with her and the others on our group. The tour offers a wide variety of delicious Vietnamese food and drinks in a local atmosphere.

super atmosphere and delicious food, very authentic, nice guide. This street food tour is just amazing! We had 10 delicious dishes, everything very well explained by our nice tour guide Kiwi! She is vietnamese and speaks very good english so she could answer all our questions and she explained everything. We did not just taste the food but Kiwi also taught us the history beyond every dish! I can definitely recommend it to everyone!greets from germany!

Good food, average tour. I just had a 3-hour tour with Sea (spelling?) and while the food was quite good, I think that tour itself was just okay. We ate delicious bites and I was extremely full at the end of it, but my previous tour with Urban Adventures (in a different city) far surpassed this one in terms of cultural knowledge and general vibe. My guide was so incredibly sweet, but his English was a bit limited, and he was rather timid/shy. Not the outgoing personality I was expecting for a food tour. Next time I do a food tour, I'll be going back to Urban Adventures.

excellent tour and excellent guide. Not knowing where to start with street food in Hanoi we booked this after reading such good reviews on Trip Advisor. We had so much fun! We were in a small group with fellow solo travellers and guided around my Miss Trang. She was great - really enthusiastic and fun and looked after us well crossing the (sometimes terrifying) roads in Hanoi. There are loads of stops so it's very good value. Highlights for me included delicious crab spring rolls, green tea sticky rice ice cream and egg white coffee (like raw meringue!). Would definitely recommend.

Interesting Experience!. Me and my partner had the most wonderful time with Trang on the street food tour. She not only took us to plenty of street food restaurants, catered for me being vegetarian but also helped us do some shopping along the streets and informed us of many cultural aspects of Hanoi. She even went over the allotted time but did not mind at all! We gained a friend on this tour, as Trang also met up with us at a later date to go to Ho Chi Minh's mausoleum, The Temple of Literature and the West Lake with no charge. What a wonderful experience!

Excellent tour and guide! . I took an evening tour (5pm - 8pm) and it was really wonderful, one of the best things I did while in Hanoi. The tour took us to places and ordered dishes that I never would have found on my own! If you can, request Lotus as your guide. She is so lovely, speaks excellent English, and gives a very fun tour of Hanoi, in addition to the food you eat, as you jump from place to place. It was so nice to be guided by someone that is so open, so enthusiastic about meeting travelers, and cares so much about giving a good tour. I know I have made a new friend in Hanoi. Thank you Lotus!!

Excellent, don't miss!. Our guide was Thao who was absolutely lovely. She was friendly and knowledgeable and she hosted a great food tour.We ate so much food we thought we would pop, but it was so worth it! The stalls chosen were great and you could tell that a lot of thought had been put in. The great thing is is that the tour is customised to what you can and can't eat so you won't go hungry...I even got to try something which I pointed out on the street which wasn't part of the menu. Yum!It was just my boyfriend and I which meant we had personal attention which was great too as asked about a million questions.Definitely do this tour at the start of your trip so that you can go back and eat your favourites over the next few days. Yummy!

The first thing you must do when you arrive in Hanoi. My son and I did the tour with a wonderful young lady called Kiwi. She took us to places I wouldn't have dared to try on my own. She also gave us information about additional places we may like to try later during our stay such as a BBQ and her favourite sticky rice restaurant (which we did and both were excellent). We tried everything. There was only one dish we didn't enjoy (brown noodle soup - tasteless) but that was because the rest were so delicious. We had around 8 or 9 stops which we thoroughly enjoyed. The last stop was for egg coffee, which was thick, creamy, sweet, like a coffee mousse and surprisingly moreish, the egg beer...? Well, I will let you decide. Kiwi was fantastic, we learned a lot from her. We did this on the day we arrived, the best decision we made. We went back to the roll pancake stall alone and ate some more the next day. We were very lucky to have the tour on our own, which gave us lots of opportunity to ask questions and learn more about the food and life in Hanoi. I would highly recommend this tour for all ages.

Great tour and way to see Hanoi. After staying in Hanoi for 6 weeks I decided to book this tour for the first night my brother and his girlfriend arrived as a good way to see Hanoi and be immersed into "Street Food" culture but with someone who knew what they were doing - and it didn't disappoint!We were introduced to our lovely, cheerful and funny guide Amy, who was knowledgeable and friendly. She was very chatty and made the tour a really great experience for us! We particularly liked her "sticky rice!!" for crossing the roads! We went to many places sampling all the delights of Hanoi Street Food, including a lot of dishes I had not yet had even having been in Hanoi for 6 weeks. It was a great way to see the Old Quarter too. Highly recommended!

So happy we got to experience this. My boyfriend and I did the street food tour on our last day of Hanoi. The only regret is we left it so late, we learnt so much about the amazing street food during our tour that we wish we had longer here! Our guide was Trang, and she was lovely. It cost us $USD30 each, which seemed expensive to me, but while on the tour Trang repeatedly asked us if we wanted seconds of everything, or extra drinks etc. If only I had a second or third stomach.Would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to experience the best thing Hanoi has to offer... Its food!!!

Good experience . Perfect activity to start off your Hanoi experience. Miss Moon showed me and a couple others the best street food joints in the old quarter, and it helped us screen the area and pick the best options out of the many existsing street food restaurants.

Amazing Hanoi. Our experience with this street food tour is nothing but enjoyable. Our guide, Kiwi, was very friendly and knowledgeable. She was always making sure that we would be able to eat the foods at the places she was taking us. We were in great care, down to how to cross the street or to avoid not getting run over by the motor scooters :) It was very nice to learn bits and pieces about Hanoi from the local herself and exchange our experiences. Some of the foods we tried during the tour we would have not found out or knew how to order if we were by ourselves. The tour lasted about 3 hours, we were tired but our stomach was happily full by the end of the tour. We would recommend this tour for anyone who visit Hanoi. Thank you!

A great introduction to the Old Quarter. I did this tour yesterday with my husband and 15 year old son . We did the 11 am tour with Miss Moon as our guide. We all thoroughly enjoyed it. She was really interesting and tour was informative and well paced. She was a humorous character and we all remember to stay together like " sticky rice" whenever we cross a road here now. She also explained a little about the Old Quarter and how the streets get their names etc. I certainly would have never gone to any of these places myself. My son managed to try everything there wasn't anything too out there that we couldn't eat. And yes do ask to try the egg coffee , or egg chocolate in my sons case! Do towards the beginning of your stay in Hanoi as you do cover quite a large part of the Old Quarter and French Quarter.

Nice package!. Great experience/a bit of everything. We had our tour guide "Kiwi", she was quite enthusiastic to show us around. We were in a group of 7, just about right to be taken care well. We had so many dishes and they all were very interesting, quite different from what we had at home. Overall a perfect evening.

A wonderful time in Hanoi. I found this tour by an introduction from a friend and really appreciated it. I am so jealous of Vietnamese people because their food is awesome. I tried nearly 10 dishes during the tour and I loved rolled pancake, egg coffee, fish noodle,...My guide, Kiwi, was excellent, she enthusiastically gave us very interesting knowledge about food in Vietnam, the reason why Hanoi beer is bigger than Saigon beer. Highly recommend it!

Excellent. I highly recommend this tour. Our guide (Miss Moon) was knowledgable, friendly and just great all round. The food was all delicious and explained in detail. A great thing to do on the first day to get a handle on the vast variety if street foods.

A must if you're visiting Hanoi. Although there is a vast range of street food on offer I would suggest that unless you have a cast iron digestive system the wisest move would be to put your trust in this company who specialise in taking small groups around the street food outlets. Not only is the dish explained but great care is taken to answer all questions. Our 3 hour tour at $20 finished 10 minutes short of 4 hours and 10 stops for food!! The pace was deliberately slowed for my wife and I who are in our 70's and not too fleet of foot.

Don't miss this, especially if you're new to Vietnam. My only disappointment is that we did this tour on our last day in the country rather than our first. We'd have been much more confident about trying street food if we'd done this when we first arrived, but even so, it was very enjoyable and worthwhile.Our guide (Miss Moon) was delightful - her English was great, she had lots of interesting things to say, and she took very good care of us (carefully chaperoning my hulking sons and me across the busy roads, even though she was half our size).I was surprised how much ground we covered; in the end we visited 9 different places spread all over the old quarter, sampling a great variety of food and drink.

Mixed experience, good on the whole . Did the street food tour on our 1st night in Hanoi. I found the experience enjoyable however my partner did not. I enjoyed the authenticity of the food and the tour guide was good. Some of the food I did not enjoy however this is probably more a reflection on my taste rather than the quality of the food, I generally have not enjoyed a lot of the food in Vietnam. The egg coffee however was awesome and easily my favourite part of the tour. It was a good way to see the old quarter. 4 stars from me. My partner was disappointed that there was no stand out dish that was very enjoyable for dinner. Like me she enjoyed the experience and the tour guide was very good, she also enjoyed seeing the town however disliked most of the food apart from the coffee, going as far as to say she was put off and reluctant to eat any Vietnamese food for the rest of our time here. 3 stars from her.

Outstanding value for money. Just finished an outstanding tour with Hian this evening. Her local knowledge was excellent and the quality of food was fantastic. I can fully recommend this tour. If you're worried about value for money don't be. I haven't eaten this much in a long time. A must do when in hanoi!

Good food and informative. We booked a private tour on our second night, at 6pm for $30 US per person. Our tour guide was a girl called Hien who spoke good english.She started by checking if there was anything that we couldn't/didn't want to eat, we then walked to their office (2 minutes from our Hotel), we paid for the tour and then headed out into Hanoi for approx. 3 hours. The restaurants/cafes all offered something different to try, and gave us the opportunty to eat at places where we probably would have missed. Hien was very informative about the history of Hanoi and the food along with telling us a lot about Vietnamese customs & traditions. We ended the evening with coffee from a hidden coffee house, that we failed to find again on our own!!It was a great evening and I'd definitely recommend this tour.

Definitely worth it!!. My fiance and i signed up for the street food tour with miss moon. she was so awesome. She took us to so many hole in the wall places for authentic vietnamese food. Honestly, I never would have had the courage to try some of the places she took us, but we both loved trying new dishes and getting to eat with the locals. The bun cha was so tasty and she will definitely cater to your wishes if you want to try anything special. You also get to explore the old quarter with her and hear some of the history. Don't miss out!!

Street delights. A great intro to Vietnamese food, with the added bonus of seeing the old quarter at the same time. Loads of food included with nothing else to pay, and a super sweet guide who gave us some history on the area and taught us some of the language along the way. I would definitely recommend for the start of your stay.... We now know exactly what to pick and where to go for the rest of our stay!

Food with fun in Hanoi. My wife and I booked a 5 pm tour and enjoyed the company of a young couple from Perth, Australia with guide Thuy and another guide in training. The 6 of us had a great night exploring small restaurants and sidewalk food stalls most of which we probably wouldn't have found or patronised without the help of Thuy. And the food was great!!! Most of the venues were in the old quarter. Our guides were informative and lots of fun and spoke excellent English. They were also very protective of us in Hanoi's crazy traffic which was a pretty funny sight as we towered over them crossing the streets.Overall a great experience and good value too - $20 US for 3.5 hours.

Love the Ha Noi street food tour. We signed up for the street food tour not knowing what to expect. We figured just throw caution to the wind. Result? We loved it. Our tour guide was Miss Moon (Hang is her Vietnamese name which means moon..). Not only the food was delicious we enjoyed the interaction with Miss Moon. She was the source of amusement for everyone in the group. Love the reference to 'sticky rice' which meant everyone should stick together in the group like sticky rice. The difference between a good tour and great tour is the quality of the tour guide and how adaptable and gracious they are to the guests. Miss Moon is all that. Our group would definitely sign up to go on this again. Nobody got sick eating the food.

The best dining experience in Hanoi. We did this tour on our first night in Hanoi. It was an amazing experience. It was our first introduction to Vietnam. The food was very tasty from Pho to spring rolls, egg coffee and yes we did try the embryo duck egg (well my husband did!) Our guide Hien was brilliant and she made our night very entertaining from start to finish. Excellent.

Excellent introduction to Hanoi. Recommend this tour to anyone, try to do it early in your stay and use the knowledge to discover the wonders of the local eateries. Opening the doors to local food at local prices!!

Walking with Nga Nguyen. We had a private street walking tour with lovely Nga, she could not have been more informative and helpful. Nga's knowledge of the food, streets and history of the whole area is amazing. We highly recommend the tour and especially doing it with Nga.

Interesting and delicious!. My wife and I did a private tour our second day in Hanoi and found the experience very worthwhile -- we had no idea how much great food is to be found in Vietnam! Our tour guide, Ms. Moon, was sweet, knowledgeable and enthusiastic, taking us to one place after another to experience lots of tasty food. She would often give a history of the food and break down all of the various ingredients, as well as giving general observations about both Hanoi and Vietnam. I don't consider ourselves "foodies" and my wife is actually not a big fan of Asian cuisine in general, but both of us had a great time and liked all of the food. My recommendation: come hungry! If you do this around lunchtime, skip breakfast!

Fab food fab fun!. For $20 it really is a deal. We got to try the planned out food, which was all wonderful, but when we passed other food vendors and asked about what they were selling, our guide Hien (who was just the sweetest and most enthusiastic) not only explained but happily bought it for us to try (including the duck embryo thing that I asked about - and it was actually really good!). I can't recommend this tour enough. I'd say do it your first night in Hanoi so that you know some great (and super cheap) places to eat and dishes to try. And I was totally full by the end of the tour. It was like a colorful 12 course meal with drinks and desserts and walking.

Great introduction to hanoi and street foos. Thuy and Kiwi were wonderful guides on this terrific tour. We did the tour on our first night in Hanoi abs I am so pleased we did as it gave us the confidence to eat street food for the rest of our stay in Hanoi. We visited about 8 places and had so much delicious local food. We also got a guided tour of the lake and old city at the same time. Our guides were delightful and shared with us their background and life so far. By the end of our the hour tour I felt like o had an insight into Vietnamese culture and cuisine. I would recommend to anyone who wants to try street food but does not know where to start. Great for kids too!

Our first day in Hanoi - great way to get to know the city.. Reasons why this is a great thing to do:1) It will get you out of bed in the morning; Hanoi is not a place to be lying in bed wasting the day2) You'll see parts of the city you may not otherwise venture to3) You'll learn about Hanoi, the people, the districts etc. a much better experience than trying to learn from guide books4) You'll try foods you wouldn't (don't kid yourself) otherwise in cafes, restaurants you wouldn't go in5) Coffee made with egg - yep!6) You'll meet some interesting people; amazing who turns up in Vietnam on a food tour - not necessarily people you would otherwise meet7) You'll be charmed by your tour guide - who will also spend a good amount of time entertaining your young children8) Some of this 'unlikely' food is really good9) It's a cheap way to learn and experience so much10) You'll learn the price of things - if you're then brave enough to go back to the places you're shown or buy from street vendors you know what you're doing11) you'll get courage to go back to the local restaurants and buy from street vendors12) A good bit of exercise - you'll walk your indulgences offP.S. My girlfriend is a vegetarian and was dreading the actual 'food' part, but did pretty well - it's not all snake and pork! Lot's of vegetables, fruits, ice-cream, drinks etc. for the non-meat eaters.

A must when in Hanoi. I joined them on my 1st day there (it was a Friday I believe) and I was actually plenty glad I did. I chose the 5pm session and our guide was Ms Phoenix and another lady (I'm sorry I forgot your name!). Boy did I have fun. I loved that we get to try out food that otherwise we wouldn't try because we either don't know about it, or because we don't know where to go for it. I loved the red noodles, I loved the beef salad and I especially loved the pork and mushroom in rice flour pancake (no I don't remember the names in Vietnamese either). Oh and of course, egg coffee. Didn't think I would like the egg coffee but I was wrong. It was good. We ended our night at the beer street and had us some locally brewed beer, which was good too. So yes, I had a great time. Especially because I did it on my 1st day, I then knew a little bit more on where to go and what to expect, and of course getting to know a little bit more about hanoi and their lifestyle. Take this one up. You won't regret it. If not for the food, then the company.

Ms. Moon led an amazing tour!!. I would definitely suggest this tour to anyone that is considering it. Somehow, even though this is one of the top rated things to do in Hanoi, I ended up being the only person to have booked the morning trip. You would have thought this meant that they scaled back on the tour but that wasn't the case. Ms. Moon led the most awesome tour. She was so knowledgable and friendly. I went for the lunch tour and I left so full that I didn't have dinner that night. We had noodles, beers, fruits, coffee, BBQ and so much more. Not only would I suggest this tour to anyone that is considering it I would also say to request Ms. Moon if possible. This was a highlight of my time in Hanoi.

Miss Moon, you made our trip to Hanoi !!. This was a real gem. Our guide Miss Moon was fabulous. We have two teenage boys and they also really enjoyed the 3 hour tour around the old quarters. Miss Moon was vey knowledgable on the food of which there was plenty and varied. Great morning, beers, ice cream and coffee included. best thing we have done in Vietnam so far. well done and easy to reccomend.

Love the food! Great guides!. This was my first activity upon arriving in Hanoi and it was great! Our guide was Hien (aka Angelina Jolie) and Hien (im not sure about the spelling) who is training to be a tour guide as well. Both of them were wonderful, bubbly and informative. They brought us to different places with amazing food. I would definitely recommend this tour!

do this. we spent our first evening in Vietnam with Hanoi Street foods and what a great way to see the Old Quarter and check out some really good local restaurants. the food was terrific and our guides were great fun. do this tour , you won't be disappointed.

hanoi street food tour with Thuy and turtle sidekick. We (My Gf and I - both 25 yo.) found this tour on tripadvisor and after doing this tour strongly recommend it to everyone! We rocked up at their office and booked our names for the 5pm tour. It was an easy and fast process. $20USD per person or if you didnt have USD could also pay in Dong. The price includes all the food you will consume on the tour.We were introduced to Thuy and another friendly tour guide who came along. Our group was a nice and small group and only has another older couple from New Zealand. Thuy and her colleague walked and guided us through the crazy Hanoi Traffic. It was funny having two small vietnamese girls protect us tall Aussies and New Zealanders). "Sticky rice" was the magic words to indicate we are crossing the road and to stick close to them.The variety of food shown to us was excellent. There was a total of about 8-9 different vietnamese street foods we tried. The portion sizes were just enough for each type of food and by the end of the tour we were super full and satisfied. Thuy provided not only great explanations about what we were eating and also the history of the restaurant/food/Hanoi lifestyle but also provided great chat and banter throughout the whole trip. The entire tour for us was about 3.5 hours.Overall this was a great experience and if you want friendly informative guide to Hanoi lifestyle and street food we would strongly recommend it! There is more to vietnamese food than just Pho and spring rolls! :)

Great tour & Miss Moon was wonderful!. We did a street food tour with Miss Moon on our second day in Hanoi. We were able to sample many different local specialities at Miss Moons favourite places, plus she would also stop along the way and purchase anything else we were curious about that we saw. There were 8 adults and 1 child in our group and our guide was so great with everyone, even the kid. We were absolutely stuffed by the end of the tour. A few of our favourites included the bun Cha, egg coffee, fruit with sweet milk, pillow cake and Bia Hoi. I would absolutely recommend this tour, and to go with Miss Moon (I believe she does the 11 AM departure). Our tour was approximately 4 hours long.

Delicious Hanoi. We have just returned from our street food tour with Miss Moon, and would highly recommend it. It was a last minute decision, and we turned up at their office, paid, and off we went. Miss Moon was very kind and friendly, especially to our two kids (5 & 8). She bought ice creams for the kids, and when my daughter mentioned she liked lychees Miss Moon bought her a whole bag of them! The food was incredible, and there were so many things to try. We felt very well looked after. Thank you, Miss Moon!

Authentic local food experience. Vietnamese food is great but often what we get overseas is the standard Pho, maybe a Banh Mi sandwich and broken rice with chicken or pork. There's so much more of course, and this street food tour is a great way to dive into the city's food culture.We had a lovely experience trying out eight to nine different stalls/shops around the Old Quarter over more than three hours. We like eating where the locals eat and it was pretty evident to us that we were doing just that on the tour, often eating in hole-in-the-wall places or right on the sidewalk.The food was delicious and certainly nothing was shocking or off-putting. Our guide, Thuy, was excellent, particularly with our young son, engaging him and watching out for him - and the rest of us - as we crossed the roads with the famous Vietnamese traffic. Thuy explained to us what we were eating and why, and also pointed out helpful nuggets of information related to the areas we walked in. She was professional, friendly and clearly enjoyed meeting people and introducing them to her city's food. As tempted as we were to eat more, we paced ourselves, ordering only two portions to be shared among the three of us at most places we visited, so we could eat all the way to the last stop. We highly recommend this food tour near the start of your visit. Walking around with a guide is a great way to get your bearings, and having eight to nine dishes introduced in one night gives you a good idea of what to avoid and what to get more of for the rest of your stay.
Great tour!. This food tour is an absolute must for anyone who wants to try the local street delicacies. Hien was incredibly knowledgable and was a delightful guide. Well worth the time and money!

Great tour and great value. My boyfriend and I went on this tour our first day in Hanoi and loved it. We tried tons of amazing dishes we never would have tried otherwise and really enjoyed our guide, Miss Moon. Definitely worth the money, especially since we got to try so many great dishes and had a guided walk through part of the city.

Great way to discover Hanoi and delicious!. This was the first activity we did when we arrived to Hanoi, and we are so glad that we did. Phoenix Flower/ Q was such a lovely guide and showed us some delicious dishes! She customized it based on our tastes, we wanted to try as much as we could and she didn't disappoint. She also gave us a lot of suggestions on where to go, which have all been amazing and we couldn't help ourselves but go back to the places we'd visited on the tour! I can't say enough about how wonderful our guide was and what a good time we had! Great way to start our time in Hanoi!
miss moon you a brill. Just wished we had done the tour days ago. Miss moon was fab the food was brilliant but a little to much..you definitely have to give go

So much fun!!. Having recently moved to Hanoi, we thought this would be a great introduction to the Old Quarter, as well as a chance to try street food under the direction of some who knew what we were actually getting. Our guide was wonderful with a pretty good grasp of the English language. She explained the sites we were passing and explained the origins and the ingredients of everything we ate. Be sure to go hungry. I think we ate 6 meals in 3 hours. We were all stuffed. They even gave us a list of the addresses and dishes we had so we could return on our own. This is a MUST tour at the beginning of any Vietnam visit so you can truly enjoy the culture.

One of the best things we did in Hanoi!. Our guide (I can't remember the name, but I think it was something like Quiang?) was perfect!!!! She was so knowledgable and friendly and explained everything to us in great detail! The food was amazing and as she knew the all places we weren't worried at all to pick up tummy bugs =) (We were totally fine the days after btw). It was delicious and we tried so many things we would have never touched otherwise. All food & drinks are included, so no hassle with who pays what in the end. It went even longer than we were told since we probably had one or two more beers than planned (we were a lovely group of 6 people). Anyone who's visiting Hanoi should go on this tour - you'll not regret it!

Miss Moon's tour is out of this world!. Wow! We could never have found such amazing food on our own! Miss Moon had us weaving through the back streets of Hanoi to find its hidden food treasures! Some of the best and most unique food we had whilst in Vietnam. Our tour guide Miss Moon was so friendly, happy and passionate about local street food! Our only advise is come with an empty stomach and an open mind to try everything!

Great evening. We enjoyed an excellent evening touring round the Old Quarter sampling different food. Our group had about 10 people and made a good mix of nationalities. Our guide was excellent and took us to places to eat we would never have known about. Finished up with egg coffee in a Hanoi coffee shop.

One of the best experiences in Hanoi!. We did this tour by the end of our stay and I regret we didn't do it earlier. The tour takes few hours and you get to try around 9 fantastic dishes. Our guide, Miss Moon, was great, she spoke very good English, had a great sense of humor and took us to great eating places. We ate on the streets of Hanoi before, but this tour made us realise how much we missed by not knowing where to go.I can recommend this tour to everyone - experienced food street lovers and people who are afraid to try it and need some guidance. One pice of advice: better starve yourself before going on this tour as you are about to receive a serious amount of food! :)

Must do on day one. A street food tour in any Asian city should be done immediately after check in. It gives you all the information you need for the rest of your stay. What you can eat, where you can eat, what tasts best and how much you should pay. Pick the tour with the best reputation and you cannot fail. This was highest on the list and we were all more than happy.

A must while in Hanoi. If you're going to visit Vietnam, which you should, be sure to do the Street Food Tour on your first day. Not only is it a great way to see and learn your way around the city, but it's an experience not to be missed. I would also recommend the street food over the restaurants as well.

A unique blend of street food walking tour. My group apparently had such a wonderful street food walking tour last night in Hanoi which was a unique blend of walking and trying superb local food. Although the weather stayed somehow not nice with heavy rain, our very friendly tour guide,miss Hien drived us feel extremely warm and comfortable. She took us through the busy and narrow streets eventually became the central marketplace and business area, but it retains much of its ancient charm. Our guidemade her great effort to help us buy souvenir for our family with very reasonable pricesduring the tour. We tried a wide range of fresh specialties cha-vermicelli with grilled pork, banh cuon- rice paper with mined pork, mushroom and onion, banh goi-pillow cake, nem ran-spring roll...a brilliant tour and a MUST if stopping in Hanoi !

Fantastic tour. This was the best food tour we have ever had. Our guide was very knowledgable and lots of fun. We tried some of the best food that can't even compare with traditional tourist restaurants. I can't recommend this activity high enough.
