Really good food. The tour was good. Due to the heat of the day I welcomed the short walks between food stops. Our tour guide was outgoing and fun, which made the experience even more enjoyable. The medley of tastes was quite interesting, and the flavors were delicious. We finished off the tour with a couple of beers on 'beer street'. And my only complaint of the night was with the people serving us our beers. Thier sign said the coldeset beers in the city. They served luke warm beer. I mean it was almost room temperture. And to add to the injury this resturant charged 'only the tourists' 2000 dong to use their toilet facilities.

great street food. great introduction to Vietnamese food, booked the tour but on the day it was pouring so it was postponed for the following day, the original guide (i assume it was Miss Moon) was not available and so we had Cody. the food was great and really gave us an insight into what to order, problem is we really should've done the tour on the first or second day as it would have allowed us to be more adventurous for the rest of our stay. Cody was great as he also threw in lots of information about the history of Hanoi. Definitely worth doing.

More than great street food.. Our Street Food Tour guide Hang or Miss Moon took our party of 3 and another couple on a fantastic food tour. We had arrived the night before and sampled some street food and were offered herbs and a fruit with the dish but declined them as we didn't know what they were for. On the tour Hang explained how to use and eat those ingredients. As a previous reviewer has suggested go on the tour as soon as you get there so you can experience the food on your own afterwards with confidence. Hang is so jolly and enthusiastic she explains more than just food culture. We started the tour at 11am, breakfast is not required nor was an evening meal. We lost count of how many dishes we had and they are full size. Hang also bought us breadfruit from a seller when we were curious about it. She really made the tour unforgettable. Thank you so much.

Great intro to street food in Vietnam!. We had a great time with Hien and got to try plenty of different foods - some from little places that we wouldn't have even known served food!Highlights were the steamed rice pancake, bia corner and banh da ca. The egg coffee was a treat too. Doing this tour on our first day gives us the confidence to try street food all over Vietnam for the rest of our trip. 2 of us did a private tour which worked out well as the streets where very crowded and noisy at 5pm. I'd imagine a group tour of 6 people would've made it very difficult to hear the guide.

We really enjoy the Hanoi Strret Food Tour. It is a very nice experience for us two in Hanoi! We like the variety of fresh and nice food, the busy night streets and the colourful sights of Hanoi night life our warm and earnest guide led us throughduring the trip. She was trying her best to help us and answer our curious questions to make the food tour a most worthy experience of our trip to Vietnam! It is definitely a worthy one!

fantastic. We joined the tour without any expectations. I am not even interested in cooking. (just eating)We had a guide called Moon. but in vietnamese something else of course.She was altogether lovely. She had energy for several tours, and she almoust didnt want to stop. With great enthusiasm she told us interesting things about Vietnamese cooking. We also had opportunity to taste a lot of different dishes.I can very strongly reccomend the tour.mats c

So much delicious food!. This is a great activity to do in Hanoi. Miss Moon was a great guide, taking us to various street food places that you might not normally think of going too. The tour was great value - make sure you pace yourself at the start as you will try a lot of food! My favourites were the bbq pork and egg coffee. Three hours is a good time - it allows you to relax while you eat and soak in the atmosphere. Very worthwhile.

Miss Moon Rocks!. Being foodies and somewhat adventurous, my partner and I looked forward to our walking food tour of Hanoi. Miss Moon was a delightful, high-energy guide with such a winsome manner that you found yourself just as excited as she was. If you have three hour to spare, and you really want to eat like a local Hanoian, then do yourself a favour and go on this tour. Miss Moon did advise that you won't need breakfast or dinner if you do you the lunchtime tour - and she wasn't exaggerating! Lots of great food, and finishing with the famous egg coffee (I don't drink coffee and I really liked it).We wandered past the next day and asked for a the best place to have a Pho Bo and Miss Moon gladly pointed us in the right direction - with a great recommendation. Thank you Miss Moon (Hang) for making our time in Hanoi so memorable.

Miss Moon and Sticky Rice. We met on 23 April for our tea time tour. Miss Moon was excited to meet us and show us all of the amazing food/drinks her city had to offer. We walked all over, to places we normally wouldn't eat while also getting information on the town, the monuments and it's history. We tried 8 different foods and 2 drinks. I enjoyed every piece of food we tried, even the ones I wouldn't normally pick to try myself and also enjoyed the drinks, even though I am not a beer or coffee drinker. I would highly recommend this tour. We met some lovely people and tried the best food. I would suggest to do this tour the day you arrive (if possible) so you can go back and visit the places you enjoyed the most.

Best ever!!. We have been on street food tours in other countries. This one in Hanoi was by far the best. At every turn our lovely guide introduced us to the Vietnamese culture as well as to their fantastic food. She answered all our questions, took her time, and really informed us about what was going on all around us. From the rice noodles to the pork spring rolls to the creamy coffee, everything we ate was simply delicious. When we got adventurous to eat the unusual, our guide had a good sense of what we could safely try, and what we should avoid due to "foreigner's stomach". Everyone had fantastic fun experience. We highly recommend this as a way to start your visit to Hanoi.

Don't miss this amazing tour!. Thanh from Intrepid, recently navigated us through the Old Quarter of Hanoi on the Street Food Tour. What an amazing experience, sampling the 'real' Vietnam via our stomachs. Thanh was very knowledgeable and professional and ensured our safety when crossing the busy streets. I did this tour in the evening and would recommend not eating lunch as the portions are extremely generous. Topped off by the amazing 'egg coffee', delicious!Thank you Thanh!

Hanoi Street Food Tour - Hanoi at its Best. When you take the tour you are in for a treat. Literally. The tour goes down streets that are lined with street vendors and chefs. This is Hanoi cuisine at its best. I was referred to this tour by a friend who had done it previously. She knew I would really like it. I am someone who likes to be with the real local people and this was the perfect way. Just seeing the life of the people made me feel like my visit was worth it. Being up close is the way that I like it. When I am on a tour, I’m always mindful about the time. But our guides did not rush us. When you take this tour you are experiencing the best of Hanoi. Right away seeing the street vendors, I really appreciated the work that goes into preparing the food. The food tells the story. My son and I tasted a little bit of everything. My son stays thirsty so we always had a Sugar Cane Juice in hand. Next we bought the grilled meat by stick ( 6k-10k VND) with some vegetables. We also tried the duck egg (6k-8k VND) and bought quail eggs (about 10k VND for 5 eggs at the street market). My son really like the chopped black mushroom and meat cake called Gio cake (7k-10k VND). We were really surprised that the prices on everything was inexpensive since this was mostly for tourists. After that we tasted the fruits, had a couple different kinds of cakes and some yogurt. There are foods for children and yogurts for those ladies who are watching their weight. The experience includes the way the food is prepared as well as the taste. As we enjoyed ourselves as we went through the tour, I remembered that food is an art. Well this certainly is Hanoi art. Just keep an open mind about the different foods and enjoy.Our guides were very nice. It was well worth our while. Ready for a wonderful culinary experience? This is it. Don’t be shy to try something different, something wonderful. It is a event that you won’t forget. This was one of the main highlights of the country for us. We will come again one day. I give it a top rating.

Miss Moon shed light on Vietnamese food!. I did the 11.00-14.00 tour with Miss Moon (Hang). It was a small cosmopolitan group of people (three). We were spoiled from the very beginning with generous portions of delicious fresh food, carefully selected and tastefully chosen. The "tapas" menu included bun cha (grilled pork), egg pancakes, traditional beet, Vietnamese coffee etc. It is a highly recommended experience as it will make you more confident in developing your food knowledge at "street level"! Miss Moon was very attentive to everyone's needs and paced the tour very well so there was time to sit, chat and relax as well as trying the different dishes.I was very happy with what I learned and I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Ha Noi wanting to experience real Vietnamese food. Genuine, funny, interesting way to understand a bit of Vietnamese culture.

Wonderful tour. We had a great lunchtime tour with Miss Moon. This was a real learning experience and a chance to taste all the goodies you see as you walk around Hanoi but don't know how to order or whether they are worth trying. We would thoroughly recommend.

Delicious food and awesome guides!. My friend came upon this tour on TripAdvisor and I'm so glad we booked it. It was a great introduction to authentic Vietnamese cuisine when we arrived in Hanoi. My friend and I are foodies and this was a perfect tour for us. Phuoc and Linh were our guides and they had great knowledge of not only the foods but of the culture and history of Hanoi. The tour takes place in the old quarter, which is the hub of all the street food. We visited 10 places, 8 food and 2 drink places and at first when our group heard about the number we were a bit intimidated at how much food we were about to consume but all the servings were just the right size. There were about 9-10 of us in the group and because the old quarter is condensed with motorbikes and people, Phouc had a great way of keeping us together as we crossed the streets by referring to us as, 'sticky rice,' and to keep together like sticky rice as moved through the streets. :) The tour is $20/person and if you're adventurous in trying out new foods, definitely take this tour. You won't be disappointed.

Hanoi streetfood with Hoang Le. Experiencing the Vietnamese food and day to day living was wonderful. Our guide, Hoang Le is the best. He is knowledgable and his English is good. This was a 15 out of 10 experience.

Great intro to VN. I arrived on Friday afternoon and this was the second thing I did upon arriving to Hanoi/VN (after checking in).The young lady that took our group around was very friendly and had a lot of interesting things to share about her country. Her English was excellent too.I got to taste a lot of new things and quickly figure out what was what. I really liked the Bun Cha (rice noodle with pork in a soup) & Nem (spring roll). Also had Banh Cuon (thin translucent white noodle pancake that wraps up a meat vegetable combo), simple dish with lots of flavor. Had a fried fish dish, however I didn't like this one, at least I tasted it though, haha.The 3 hour foot tour around the old quarter was also interesting. Being Friday night it was quite busy with the majority of people being locals which was great to see. Of course all the foreigners stood out.As a quick intro to VN and food, this tour was great for the first evening upon arriving in the country.Highly recommend :)

A Must Do For First Timers in Hanoi. If you are visiting Hanoi for the first time and want to try the street food but do not know which places are good to go to as a tourist and at the same time you want to sample some of the traditional Hanoi style food in the local laid back atmosphere but do not know what they are - then you should really try the Hanoi Street Food Tour. We absolutely enjoyed the three hour tour along with our tour guide 'Lucky' who took us to some of the places I would have never dared to stop and eat but aside that I would not even haven known what they offer nor that some of it is traditinal Hanoi food. Each and everyone of the places we went to was wonderful and the food delicious. I actually was somewhat disappointed that we could not go to more places after the three hours were over. Not sure if the guides always go to the exact same places but I would venture to say that all of them are good if you are willing to experience a bit and try to taste the tradtional street food in Hanoi. So I can definitely recommend this tour. It was one of the highlights of our trip to Hanoi. PS: I still think the price we paid is reasonable but you could also argue if one would know all the places they show you if you could have done it cheaper. Probably so. But I still think it is worth the money...and also fun and very tasty!! So a great evening out for some traditioanl Hanoi street food!!

Good guides made a good tour ^^. We had a big group for the night so needed to be "sticky rice" when crossing the road with crazy traffic. Ling and Phouc are good guides and they speak good english. They tried to answer all our questions, not only abt food but also abt vietnam! The food are amazing and its good to know what we are eating! (as most of the places have no english menu, not eveh have an english name of the dish...)

Need strong stomach. We really enjoyed the night out with Phuc, very nice guy. We could have walked ourselves but I was scared to eat wrong food so I joined this tour . Food was ok . Not as much ,not too full as someone mentioned before but just enough. 2 out of 4 in our family got food poison next morning. May be just bad luck. As no one mentioned before. May be ice drink we got that night at one of the street stall. I didn't want to write this so thinking for 3 weeks. But 2 of us had tummy ache for 3 days so a bit annoyed on our holiday.

Must Do!. We booked this tour for the first full day we were in Hanoi to get a feel for the food and the city. That was the best decision we could have made. Our guide was awesome and gave us a lot of information about the food and history of the area. Do not eat breakfast if you are doing a morning tour. We were so full. There is a fair amount of walking but it was good to walk between eating.

Super job!. My wife and I acompanied 7 other much younger tourists on the Hanoi Street Food tour last night. We both agreed that the 2 Vietnamese University (tourism/hospitality) students who were our guides for the evening did a fantastic job showing us the sights, local street food options and shopping districts of Hanoi. Ling and Phuc (hopefully the correct spelling :)) are great ambassadors - super job! This tour is a must do if you are adventurous and able to navigate the busy Hanoi streets and want to try eating as the locals do ...yum! The guides take great care in guiding you across the street (they called it "sticky rice" - crossing all together) and likely to preferred local food stops. BTW - they both guides spoke very good English and a bit of french.

Street Food Tour - Safe Compromise. My husband is wary of having street food in general while I am a food adventurer. This tour is our compromise. :)Plus the fact that it is our first time in Vietnam and neither of us knows a word of Vietnamese...So we booked this tour online. When we arrived for the tour (having been in Hanoi for a day), we were led to another store front down the road. I thought to myself... oh, no.....I verified with the lady that she really had our names on her list and that we're not just led away to another establishment like some of these scams we read about. Fortunately, she did have our names. However, the price was different than was agreed in the email. She changed it without fuss.While still at their office, we, together with another family of 4, were offered a rice wine (37%!) and candy.Our tour with Mr Phuoc was excellent. He spoke good English, had a great personality, tried to answer all our questions, including questions about himself :) and kept us safe while crossing the 'Streets of Hanoi Old Quarter'.Not only did he take us to places we would not have gone to eat by ourselves, but he also explained other cultural tidbits to us. We were standing by Hoan Kiem Lake eating local ice cream while he explained the story of the Lake and the infamous tortoise.We stopped by a water puppets shop, and he explained the history of water puppets. All in all, we had an unforgettable experience.

Your own personal "fixer"- worth every penny. Along with another couple and our two toddlers, my husband and I ate our hearts out with Tu as our guide. After struggling to find locations in Ho Chi Minh (which turned out to be closed), Hanoi Street Food Tour is worth the price to have the ease and convenience of a personal guide. The food choices were AMAZING! I am still dreaming about that "egg coffee". I appreciated Tu's patience in accommodating our tots-in-tow. This was indeed one of the highlights of our trip.

A must when in Hanoi!. With over 700 food vendors in Hanoi it can be overwhelming deciding what and where to indulge with respect to great local food. Miss Moon took us on a 3 hour excursion of local hotspots. Crab soup, fish with black vermicelli, spring rolls with the freshest of herbs, pillow puffs, bun cha (deliciously char grilled pork with soup) and even egg coffee. You name it, we had it. A foodie's heaven and a great way to orient yourself with the city.Miss Moon is a delightful host and I cant speak highly enough of her local knowledge and attention to detail. A fantastic experience.

Sparkling, moonlit foodtour . Miss Moon was our bright and bubbly guide around Hanoi's old quarter. Our food was delicious with surprising twists. A few places we would never have found ourselves. Excellent food, lovely guide, great way to spend a meal time. Highly recommended.

Quality Tour. This was our highlight of hanoi! It was a great way to see the sites and eat local food! 4 of us did the tour in a group of 8 and we visited 10/11 street vendors Over the 4 hours. Our guide (can't remember her name) was fantastic and made the tour so enjoyable! A big thumbs up and great value for money!!!

Sticky Rice - wow!!. My rating is actually for Mark Lowerson's 'Sticky Rice'/'Hanoi Street Food Tours' version rather than just the general heading.We had an amazing 3-4 hours with Mark on our last night in Hanoi, tasting some amazing food under the confident direction of an absolute expert. Not sure how much it cost as it was part of our overall package with Audley, but it was certainly worth it regardless!!My only 'regret' is that we did not do this on our first day to give us the confidence to be more adventurous on our own - we have been since as we move further south (currently in Hoi An), albeit with some helpful hints by email from Mark.

Do not eat too much breakfast!. Great way to visit the back streets in Hanoi and eat local food as well. Sang, our guide was very attentive, making sure we were safe crossing all those hectic roads......an experience in itself.Lots of food we would never have found on our own......also beers and the delicious egg coffee.A must do trip!

Hanoi street food at its best. Thanh, our guide, met us and immediately set us at ease as to what to expect. He was knowledgable, spoke very good English an tailored the tour to suit the groups needs. The food was excellent and in some cases quite unexpected, but all delicious. We also learnt heaps about Hanoi street culture as we wound through the markets, back streets and shops. We squatted on the footpath on little plastic stools, just like the locals and got stuck into duck's tongues, seafood, strange vegetables and flavours I had never experienced before. I would recommend this evening tour for anyone interested in Hanoi street culture, Vietnamese food or just for a fun night out. Highly recommended. And Thanh made it even better.
Walking, eating, learning. An excellent way to discover old Hanoi with food the linking theme. Make sure you try the egg coffee; sounds weird but is an amazing treat

Great food and lots of walking. Four if us spent 3 hours wandering around the old quarter going into food shops we'd never be game to normally try or find. It was a delight, as the guide explained the dishes and the correct pronunciation. The foods were varied, from pillow cakes to egg coffee and ginger flavoured cassava.We covered quite a few kilometres which helped the appetite. We saw much of the old quarter with guide providing useful information. This tour was well worth the $15 (US) cost.

Just do this. I was a bit skeptical: it's a lot of money for Vietnam and the tour was lead by a westerner...but both my girlfriend and I thought that this was among the best experiences we had in Vietnam. Mark has a great personality and the tour was well thought out and extremely informative. This completely eliminated any intimidation you might have in trying Vietnamese street food and provides some information as to what the hell you've just eaten. My girlfriend is far from an adventurous eater and came away very pleasantly surprised. Mark was really good about accommodating our dietary concerns, communicating a small hiccup we had prior to the tour and emailing us quickly after the tour with respect to some questions we had that evening. I would unequivocally recommend this tour.Pros:1. Awesome email/communication before and after the tour2. Mark - he's interesting, intelligent, and funny - just a great guide3. The food4. I was concerned about the authenticity of a Vietnamese food tour being done by a westerner. But, it actually added to the experience as Mark is able to bridge language/understanding gaps.Cons:1. The price, for Vietnam, is so expensive it made me rethink about booking it - but it's worth it.

Absolutely worth it!. Mark Lowerson's street food tour is essential for the real street food experience. For first time visitors to Hanoi, it is very difficult to know what "hole in the wall" and alleyway offers the best eats.Mark is very knowledgeable, personable and enthusiastic. He'll take you places you probably cannot find on your own and the food and atmosphere (with actual Vietnamese, not tourists)is fantastic. We took the morning tour since we had only one day in the city and stopped at five unforgettable..I'm not sure you can them restaurants as we know them. If we had an extra day we would have taken the all-day excursion, it was that great!
Perfect!. As my title, just " perfect " for Hanoi Street Food.Food in Old Quarter really cool, i tried them 03 times when i came to Hanoi.

Start your visit with this tour. We lucked out and did this the first night we arrived - it was a really good time, and gave us several places to eat that we ended up going back to. Make sure to pay attention during the tour so you can remember where you went!

Great way to try something different. We were very keen to try some Vietnamese street food but lacked the confidence/know how to go it on our own so this was the ideal way to get around that. Our guide took us on a walk all through Hanoi stopping occasionally for food, drink or an ice cream. We tried some things we never would have otherwise and had a great 3 hours. A must do if you're like us, curious about street food and unsure where to start.

Street Food Tour - fantastic!!!. Having landed in Hanoi from London very early in the morning, we decided to have some sleep and go on the evening food Tour to ease ourselves into our first time to Vietnam. We are both 30yrs and well travelled but were slightly Apprehensive, to be eating in 'locals' street food places, we decided to try the tour out anyway given the TA reviews. It was absolutely fantastic!!! And a great decision!! Chinh our guide was so personable, knowledgable and proud of her country, she made us feel really relaxed in our tour of 4 people. Being from London, we aren't used to sitting on tiny stalls with food being prepared everywhere - but the food we sampled throughout the 10 different places was DELICIOUS, we would never have tried these places had Chinh not been with us - a few places were down little ally's - which you would not know about as a tourist...we had a great tour....highly recommend!!!! The old quarter is so fascinating and having a beer watching the world go by was definitely exciting. Anyone not sure, give this tour a go it was great fun and the food so nice! We also booked the airport transfer, the driver was waiting straight away as we landed - Awsome Tours has been a great choice.Enjoy Hanoi!

Morning food tour with Brian. Had an amazing morning sampling Vietnamese bites around Hanoi!Brian was an engaging and friendly tour guide, who introduced us to many new bites. This was a great tour to do on the first full day of our time in Hanoi. We used the samples we tried around town to shape the rest of the meals we had based on what we wanted to eat again and enjoyed. I would highly recommend this tour!We can't wait to come back to Hanoi for more Bahn Mi and Bahn Cuon! Thanks, Brian!!

Just do it! Dont be afraid of the street food!. We were aprehensive about jumping on the back of a motorbike in Hanoi and eating street food, now having done it you are safe and will taste some of the best food you have ever eaten! Each vendor specialises in one dish so its very fresh and they have perfected it!

Great tour - with genuine passiona and enthusiasm.. Really enjoyed the experience. Brian is a wealth of information, fun and engaging. Great guy also, very helpful and completely committed to giving everyone the best experience possible. Would definitely recommend. :)

A well rounded tour. Oh the back of a motorbike is the best way to see Hanoi and this tour was fantastic. Brian and his crew strike the perfect balance of driving the streets of Hanoi; interesting landmarks including some hidden gems, yummy street food and useful facts and information. I sent two groups of visitors and all agreed it was amongst the best thing they did in Vietnam. Highly recommended

Great tour!. Went on the morning food tour of Hanoi with Lan as the guide. It was just me and one other person on the tour, so we were able to ask lots of questions along the way. Lan was an excellent tour guide, she was brimming with energy and she felt like a friend by the end of the tour. And the food - it was excellent, there were lots of little things to taste and she took us all over the city. It took 4.5 hours! Definitely recommended.

Gives a good snapshot of the city. I've lived in Hanoi for a year (minus long stretches of time in Lao Cai) and finally decided to join the Sunset Motorbike Tour. I was glad I did.Naturally, I wasn't expecting to be too surprised by anything. I wanted just to be a tourist for one evening. But, on the pillion rider seat, I was taken to places I had never been to, such as the B52 wreck and the Surrender Monument depicting John McCain being taken PoW. Brian had his repertoire of stories to tell and he was entertaining. Lan, his assistant, ably ensured things went smoothly, including giving me a lift from office.I enjoyed the evening. I imagine that for recent visitors to Hanoi, it would be a very worthwhile thing to do.

Craft beer tour was excellent!. Our guide, Chris is very knowledgeable about beer and has lots of information about the history of beer in Vietnam. It was definitely a well spent day getting around new neighborhoods of Hanoi and trying the interesting and new breweries in the city.

Great way to spend an evening and explore Hanoi. I've lived in Hanoi for two years, and I still learned about new places thanks to Brian and his crew. The beer and snacks were all top notch, and the team from TOH keeps the atmosphere lively and entertaining. Whether you're a lifelong Hanoi resident or just passing through, the craft beer tour is a must-do for all beer lovers.
Great food tour of Hanoi. This tour was great! We got to taste lots of different foods and learnt about the history of Vietnam!

A wonderful way to discover the old quarter of Hanoi and the fabulous Vietnamese food on offer.. Brian is an entertaining guide who leads you on a journey of discovery of both Vietnamese history and the flavoursome food that can be found in this wonderful city. Brian has a fact for nearly each street or corner of the Old Quarter and during the tour provides 30 unique tastes which by the end of the tour leaves you feeling more than satisfied.I cannot highly recommend a better way to discover the old quarter. Thanks Brian!

Enjoyable, educational and fun.. Brian has done his homework, he will educate on the history of craft beer in Vietnam and many other cultural tit-bits. As well as the beer tasting side you will get a good overview of Hanoi as you go east west north and south of the city center; you will also get to meet and socialise with the other participants on the tour. I highly recommend this tour!

Perfect introduction to Vietnam. We met Brian in the Old Quarter of Hanoi hours after landing in Vietnam. We were exhausted, overwhelmed, and a little cranky, but Brian quickly turned our night around. We were immediately able to relax, as it was evident that Brian and his team had things completely organized and streamlined so that we could taste as many delicious treats as possible--including items brought in from outside the Old Quarter, which was a bonus we had not anticipated. Brian's tour is a lot more than just a food tour--it was also a comprehensive walking tour of the Old Quarter and a history lesson on Hanoi. By the time we were sipping egg coffees at the end of our tour on a beautiful rooftop cafe--5 hours and 30 tastes of amazing food after we first met Brian--we felt like we were totally comfortable in this city we had just recently arrived in and ready to continue eating our way through it. Brian's knowledge and enthusiasm was infectious, and he was a joy to be around. Highly recommended.

Good stuff!!!. I attended the craft beer tour, and it was fantastic! Complete with the history of Vietnamese craft beer, the method of brewing craft beer, and a tour of the equipment and brewing operations, this tour was informative and fun! Good stuff! I highly recommend it to others!

Craft Beers in Hanoi. This review is of the Craft Beer tour in Hanoi.We were lucky enough to have both Brian and Chris guiding us, and it is clear they have studied up on the Hanoi beer-history and on craft beers in Vietnam. The tour will take you to places in Hanoi you won't think to visit on your own, even when living here.Visiting four places and tasting three delicious beers at each place you will have a good time for sure. A Taste of Hanoi has also made an effort to pair the beers with delicious food at each place.You will for sure have a great evening signing up for this trip!

Amazing Craft Beer tour. .A Taste of Hanoi has a "Craft Beer Tour" that I would highly recommend. Not only do you taste 12 different beers, but also the food is delicious and the itinerary is well planned. Brian has put together an entertaining trip that is quite interesting and just really fun. The craft beers on the tour are all unique and really tasty. If you are a beer lover, just want to find out more about the craft brew scene in Hanoi, or just want to have a fun day, I would suggest choosing this tour for sure.I live in Hanoi, and I will do the same tour again, especially with visiting friends from out of town.Roger

Craft Beer Tour. I really enjoyed this tour. It was well-organised and we went to a great selection of venues. I was particularly impressed with the fact that I was able to get vegan food to eat with the beers!

Very professional, well-designed tour. This review is of the Craft Beer Tour of Hanoi. I was fortunate to join the inaugural tour. I must congratulate Brian for designing it so well, despite the inevitable kinks that needed sorting out.The execution was very good. It was peak traffic and the ride to the first stop seemed never to end, but Brian entertained us with interesting stories. Lan, his Assistant, was a very friendly local and nice company.This tour suits beer lovers and others like me who are easily satisfied with one can of Tiger Beer, nothing more. But I loved the taste of the 12 beers offered at the four stops. It was educational. We toured two breweries and learnt how beers are graded. In hindsight, I shouldn't have downed all the beers. They were so good! I even took a liking for the smoked lager at Barrett's Beer, with a very high amount of hop. But, after the 10th beer, it was hard to return objective taste scores to inform Brian. But the stop at Thomas' brewery, the third stop, was memorable. Thomas from Denmark knows and loves his beers, and I was infected by his enthusiasm.The food at the adjacent restaurants and pubs were excellent. I specially enjoyed the local salami and ham.This is not a budget tour. It lasts about five hours. It's packed with value, and so it's worth the money spent.I'll definitely recommend it to friends visiting town.

Fantastic afternoon- thank you Lan!. My boyfriend and I met up with Lan on the corner of the big food market and were both immediately excited to start our tour with our smiley guide! Lan was an absolute gem from start to finish, chatting away about the food and history of Hanoi! It gave us such a great opportunity to quiz her on all the foods we had seen in Vietnam! Great mix of food- savoury and sweet covered, veggie options also available. It was a great afternoon/evening spent and would recommend this tour to anyone coming to Hanoi! Most enjoyable treats- the sticky rice and mung bean dish, egg coffee and the skinny banh mi....to be honest we enjoyed everything! Thank you Lan :)

Great guides, limited selection of foods. Tl; dr: Great tour for first timers in Vietnam/SE Asia and/or those with more limited palates. Experienced and adventurous eaters should look into other options.Let me start out by saying that the level of service and quality of the guides for A Taste of Hanoi are exemplary and have no bearing on the above star rating. For me, this was a 3.5 star/5 star experience, and I'm a harsh grader.The owner Brian picked up his phone in the middle of a tour in order to answer my questions, and confirmed my reservation within the hour.My guide Lan rose to the occasion of having only one person to show around (yours truly), displayed saint-level patience while trying to meet up with your directionally-challenged tour goer, and kept me in stitches the entirety of the 3+ hours we spent together. She's an incredibly bright, dedicated, and knowledgable young woman who I feel privileged to have met. She's accommodating, too: When we passed a vendor selling barbecued chicken's feet, she didn't bat an eyelash when I pleaded with her to stop so we could taste one, and remained in good spirits as I meticulously dissected each toe down to a tiny pile of bones.HOWEVER: I found the stops and items we ate over the course of the tour *a little bit disappointing.* For context, I have lived in Asia for over six years, am a food writer by trade, and self-identify as a very adventurous eater. Having read a little bit about Hanoi street food, I was looking forward to an evening filled with snails, eels, crab paste, and, well, a little more pungency. I was very thankful to be introduced to some dishes I hadn't yet experienced (bun bo nam bo was amazing!!), but part of me was looking forward to the bun oc, duck's blood, even an errant pork knuckle.Moreover, I suppose the crux of my dissatisfaction is that we went to places that *were* tourist destinations, *had* English menus, *could be* found without the help of a guide or food tour. Again, for context, my friends run a very successful street food tour business where I live long-term. One of their top priorities is ONLY including places without English-language menus or could be found in a guidebook. That's the expectation I have when I sign up for a food tour, especially a street food tour. But I found the highlights of A Taste of Hanoi to be the extemporaneous moments, the quick detours to man-on-a-bike-selling-snacks, the walk along the train tracks. Not the Old Quarter stop offs at restaurants with doors and tables, cheek to jowl with other tourists. I understand the limitations of logistics (boy, do I ever) but anything billed as "street food" or "hidden" should hew fast to those principals as much as possible. That all being said, I don't regret booking this tour, I do not regret meeting Lan. My favorite moments during the tour were ones of refreshing honesty, as we (I hope) transcended the roles of service person and customer. Make sure she tracks down the dried fish and green mango salad vendor, who sets up on a street corner after their landlord, jealous of their success, kicked them out and started selling his own, inferior salad. The original is best appreciated between gales of laughter while perched on tiny stools.Thanks for reading this far. Again, I think that for certain kinds of people, this is a most excellent introduction to the wonderful world of Hanoi street food. But, it could be just a little more adventurous for those of us already in the wild East.

Delightful food, brilliant execution. My wife and I are so happy we decided to take this tour. Nikita and Lan led it and took a clear delight in showing us the inside byways of the city's intricate food markets and hidden-gem restaurants we never would have discovered on our own or even with our Lonely Planet guidebook. They patiently explained the stories behind dozens of vegetables and fruits and dishes we had never seen before -- how they're prepared, what role they play in Vietnamese culture, from the times of day they tend to be eaten to the different festivals and other celebrations where they appear. Nikita in particular displayed an encyclopedic knowledge of the history of Hanoi's food origins and gave us a glimpse through her own personal story of how this fascinating country has changed so quickly in just three decades. But the best part -- if it's possible to pick one from such a pleasant experience -- was the way Lan showed up at different stops along the tour to bring us deliveries of different prepared foods for us to try. Each was a mouth-watering gift. We came to look forward to each stop when we would next see Lan, bringing yet another fantastic bite to eat, this one delicate balance of tangy and sweet, that one savory and spicy, each memorable on its own. This is a brilliant idea -- a rhythmic series of surprise-treasure snacks -- and it was executed strikingly well, with Nikita's timing leading the tour coinciding seamlessly with Lan's deliveries. It made the tour like nothing we expected and surpassed all of my expectations.One can't do anything about the weather -- it poured during our tour -- and yet Nikita eagerly pressed on, kindly furnishing ponchos for us that kept us dry the whole time.We were left happily full, both our bellies and our minds. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone seeking a glimpse of Hanoi and Vietnamese culture from the inside -- or simply an excuse to taste a stunning variety of the best foods Hanoi has to offer.

Definitely Worth It!. Brian was engaging, knowledgable, friendly, and easy to be around - would definitely recommend his tour! He catered to our palettes and offered us interesting stories about the area, his own personal experience with traveling in the area, recommendations for places to visit nearby, and of course, FABULOUS food choices that were clearly hand picked and optimal for small tastes that filled us up but didn't overwhelm us. He made wandering around the streets of Hanoi seem easy to navigate, while it was also completely obvious that if we were to have tried this alone, we would've been lost! I would definitely recommend Brian's tour and tastings!!

Top notch tour!. This tour was led by Nikita and Lan and their expert knowledge and friendliness makes this a great tour. They cover all that is great about Vietnamese food, whilst giving an overview of the culture and history of Hanoi along the way. Whether you are new to Vietnam or have spent time here already you will find this tour interesting, enjoyable.....and filling!!

Amazing introduction to Hanoi and Vietnamese food. If this is your first day in Vietnam this tour is an absolute must. It's an incredible introduction to Vietnamese cuisine, culture and gives you some initial orientation to Hanoi. My tour guide Lan did an amazing job, she is one of the happiest and nicest people I've met on my whole trip and she made a really great guide. I was lucky enough to be the only person on my tour so I got a private experience. Definitely give this a try.As a caveat, if you've already spent some time in Vietnam and Hanoi and perhaps already done a cooking course like I had a lot of the food and experiences will not be anything new. Even so, I really enjoyed the experience.

Good if you like food (and drink). As an expat, it's taken me 6 years to build up the motivation to book myself, and the rest of my expat private party of 5, on this half day evening tour. Should have booked it 5 years ago because then I would have discovered a lot about Hanoi food that I've been blissfully unaware of over the years. This has put a number of places on my food map of the city that I will reuse. Very handy. This is the first food tour I've been on so I can't compare to any others, but when I travel in future, I will be looking out for them, because eating only foreign food when you're in a foreign country means you're missing out. This tour balances 28 tastes of food and drink with a helping of history as you thread your way through the small Hanoi Old Quarter streets and gives you a real taste of what it's all about. Recommended.

must-do tour. Brian did a great job of cramming a lot into the morning tour. The logistics are planned very thoughtfully - which made for a smooth tour (no waiting around, no crowded restaurants). It was also nice to have a westerner lead the tour -- Brian understood my palate, which made explanations far more effective.For those planning a trip - I recommend completing this tour EARLY during your stay in Hanoi --- it provides a good 101 on Hanoian (and Vietnamese) food, as well as an introduction to the chaotic Old Quarter.

Food, friends and fantastic information. My partner and I booked up for this tour before heading to Hanoi and originally planned for our first day. Due to some tummy issues we had to reschedule and Brian was very patient and helpful and allowed us to reschedule it not only once but twice.When we were finally able we met a wonderfully friendly Vietnamese guide called Lan who was bubbly, welcoming and extremely informative. She guided us around the old quarter and provided information with such enthusiasm that we were immediately sure we had made the right choice.She had a great in depth knowledge of the country's history and answered all of my questions with ease and always offered interesting insight. I like data and having visited the museums and other historical sites she was able to explain things and fill in gaps in my knowledge. She was also very open and communicable and we had lovely conversations.The food was incredible and varied and our lack of love for seafood was effortlessly cared for without feeling like we were missing out or that we were being a nuisance. The food coordinators were at each stop with our dishes prepared and amazing information was provided regarding the dishes; what they were, how they are made, information of the restaurant and its history. We felt we were seeing Hanoi on its terms rather than ours and this was a huge box ticked for us.Our last stop was a beautiful secluded rooftop restaurant where we shared coffee with our guide and the food coordinators. With our bellies full we hugged goodbye and walked around the large lake to aid the digestion and felt that we had not only had an incredibly enjoyable morning, but had made some good friends too. We really recommend you do this tour, even if you know your way around the old quarter!Cám ơn, Lan, Brian and the rest of the team. --B

A VIP Experience. This is a brilliant tour, which comprises a comprehensive introduction to the incredible food of Vietnam, a brief history of the country as well as the sights, sounds & smells of the historic centre. This tour is a 'must' for anyone who has watched a TV travel show & envied the presenter as they receive a personal introduction to a country's food from a local expert.Brian, a genial American & Hanoi resident, took four of us through the bustling main market & into the maze of streets that comprise the Old Quarter. Throughout the tour he kept up a running commentary about the area's history & highlighted different styles of architecture & interesting buildings from the grandiose to shacks along the railway track. Every few minutes there were new foods and/or beverages to sample, either in places where the locals eat (i.e. no English menu!) or brought to us by his assistant Lan, who was always ready & waiting for us. Brian explained how the various dishes were made & the importance of using the right ingredients (apparently, the Vietnamese are not prepared to 'make do'). At the end of the tour we were provided with the names, pronunciations (very useful) & key ingredients of the 30+ foods sampled.I would strongly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Vietnam/Hanoi for the first time.

Awesome food tour experience!. I did a food walking tour in Hanoi a few days ago with Brian and I totally enjoyed it! It's a great way to explore the city and delve into the local way of life as the food is definitely a major aspect of the culture in Vietnam. We walked around the city and stopped in local places to try delicious traditional dishes and street food. Brian has a great knowledge of the food culture here and at each stop he told us about the history of the bar or restaurant we were at, the origin of the dish and the different ingredients...this made the experience so compete and much more interesting! it's surprising to see how many things are needed to create these dishes! One more thing that is certainly an advantage for us western tourists...Brian speaks really good English (maybe it helps that he is from the US?!?) and despite not being Vietnamese he's been living there for years and pretty much knows the city like his pockets and works with a team of local people from Hanoi. So one of the best choices for my trip in Vietnam, I definitely recommend Brian's tour with aTaste of Hanoi...thanks a lot I had a great time! And Bun Bo Nam Bo is definitely my favourite one :)

Best start of your trip to Hanoi. I would recommend this food tour to everyone who is visiting Hanoi for the first time. Brain and Lan will show you the old quarter, providing much background information about the city history and showing you spots you wouldn't have found yourself. During the walk you taste different kind of food, a very good starting point if you are not familiar with the Vietnamese kitchen.

Great food walking tour!!. I attended this food walking tour on my second day in Hanoi.I really enjoyed it with Brian.He has nice hospitality and knowledge of foods.The food was fantastic and there were so much to eat and drink.But the portion were not too big, so I could try different kinds of food in a few hours.I would recommend this tour to anyone staying in Hanoi and interested in knowing about Vietnamese foods!!ハノイ2日目に参加しました。ガイドのブライアンは親切に対応してくれて食べ物の知識も豊富でした。準備された食べ物や飲み物は種類も多くてどれも美味しく、また量も多すぎず数時間のツアーの間に、色んなベトナム料理を味わうことが出来ました。個人で行ったら、絶対味わえないようなもの‥特に短い旅なら食べる料理も限られますから‥ハノイに滞在し、ベトナム料理を堪能したい人にオススメします‼︎

Sunset Motorbike Tour. Brian showed us some really good food and gave a great background story of Hanoi and its history. We went into secret local areas with really good food and not overrun by tourists. It was really a beautiful tour. A certain hidden bonus monument 'show and tell' made me feel like we really penetrated into the heart of the Old Quarter.

The Best Tours in Hanoi!. I cannot recommend these tours enough! I did the food tour on Saturday evening with Brian but do not have lunch as the amount of snacks,main meals,and drinks are a lot but excellent! Brians knowledge of history of Vietnam is great and I enjoyed his company we had a laugh! The next tour was the motorcycle tour of Hanoi which again was brilliant! I felt safe and really loved being whisked around like a local while eating and drinking,the coffee was delicious. Just book both of these tours they are both great value for money and an excellent way to see Hanoi. Just book it!

10 out of 10. I travelled to Vietnam with a friend. Brian not just offered us his amazing tours but he organized our trip to Halong Bay. The one night and two day tour cruise, was very good value.( we met others on different cruises who had paid double for a similar package) The cruise had good food (catered for all dietary needs), clean cabins and an excellent guide. So along with the beautiful scenery made this trip very relaxing and very memorable. He also organized all our other tour transfers (not booked by him) including airport transfers. Throughout our stay he kept in touch making sure there were no problems with the arrangements etc. ........... 10 out of 10 service ................ Brian Thank you so much, all very much appreciated. Best wishes Liza

A must do for anyone visiting Hanoi. We had a great time today with Nikita on our food tour of Hanoi. I really would recommend it to anyone who wants to see Hanoi and enjoy the amazing street food! Our guide Nikita was really passionate, knowledgeable, and gave us loads of information about the history of Hanoi as we walked around, we visited a few different restaurants specialising in different dishes and her lovely colleague Cham (Chan?) kept zooming up to us on her scooter to offer us even more dishes, we tasted about 30 things in total making this a really good value experience. The dishes were tasty and we enjoyed all of them, it's a great introduction to Vietnamese food and now we know what to order as we walk around! We had our 1 year old strapped to us during the tour and Nikita made sure we had enough rest stops and shade and really made sure we were happy and comfortable. It was a great way to see the city and I would recommend it to everyone. Thank you guys!

Hanoi and the north. We used Brian's expert knowledge to organise our trip. While he offers excellent tours in hanoi and around his support services for travel tickets,transfers and advice was invaluable and excellent value for money. We didn't have much time so Brian's support enabled us to miss out the time consuming FAFF that often occurs in Asia. 5 star and a lovely guy!

What a great guide!. When traveling, it's always imperative to have someone who understands the culture of being on the go. So, when I found myself in Brian's hands, the comfort of having the combination of security and knowledge rolled into one made my Hanoi experience really fun and safe. As a seasoned Southeast Asia sightseer himself, he knew exactly how to answer every question thoroughly and to provide the perfect accentuation to his tour to make everything seemless. I don't always write a review, but this guy compelled me to do so not only because he is a great guide, but now also a valued friend.

Motor bike tour out to Mai Chau on Saturday April 30th – Monday May 2nd. It was a great time and enjoy the awesome views from the motorbike. Awesome trip and good times. Making new friends. Nice cycling together, good food, ... And safe!Brian is a great guide and friendly. We will book his tour again for sure.

Excellent introduction to Hanoi & Vietnamese Street Food. We took the morning tour with Brian on our first morning in Vietnam. We met out front of the market (an easy spot to locate) & started with a tasty morsel and tea whilst Brian told us about the history of the market. From there we explored market stalls and wove our way through the old quarter, stopping for a mix of historical & cultural background explanations along with food tastings (of course!). Brian was very well organised using an assistant to ensure we got to try over 30 different dishes during the morning session. Needless to say don't have breakfast before the tour and you definitely won't need lunch afterwards!The dishes samples included a few good breakfast options, snacks, drinks, sweets and coffee. At the end of the tour we were given a sheet listing the names & descriptions of all the dishes we tried, which was very useful for the rest of our stay.The tour ended by Hoan Kiem lake which is a central spot & easy to navigate from.Starting our trip to Vietnam with Brian's tour was the best way we could have started, it gave us the information and confidence to explore Vietnamese food on our own for the rest of our stay in the country.

Do this tour!. We tried so many foods that we would not have otherwise. I cannot recommend a street food tour more than this, as it gave us an amazing base with which to eat during the rest of our time in Hanoi. Brian knows his stuff and takes you through old train tracks, alleys and street corners in search of Hanoi's best street food. We were blown away with the amount of knowledge he shared regarding Vietnam's history and the Vietnamese people. Do this tour - preferably at the beginning of your stay. You won't regret it!
Awesome Guide, Awesome Tour. We went with Brian on a Tour to Mai Chau. He's an excellent guide and a great buddy. We had a really good time. We will definitely book with him again!

Great experience at the end of our Vietnam-trip. We booked the food tour at the end of our Vietnam-trip because we heard a lot about Hanoi´s food-culture and wanted to dive deeper into Vietnamese cuisine. The tour took around 4 hours and Brian lead us through many corners of the old Quarter. We experienced lot of food, we hadn´t eaten before (or at least not in a similar quality). The 40$ seem to be pricy at first, but you get a lot for it: you learn much about vietnamese market life, the history and many little stories of the old quarter and most of all you get to taste 25+ dishes and drinks in a very high quality. Brian was nice and funny all the time and tried his best together with his good fairy (who organized everything while Brian lead us around ) to make us a great time. They fully achieved it :)Thank you very much!Isabella and Daniel
Brian' food tour. Excellent time. Brian was very knowledgeable and has a fantastic personality. I would definitely highly recommend his food tour!

Great food / history / cultural tour. My wife and I had a great time on Brian's tour. We ate lots of great food (we were stuffed... Don't eat anything before you go), learned a lot about the history of VN, and had a great time exploring the Old Quarter. Brian is very organized and even had an assistant that stayed ahead of us on the tour to be sure the food places are all open and we had seats. I highly recommend this tour!

A food and history lover's delight!. Do you love food? Do you love learning about local culture? Then this tour is most definitely for you!We had a great time with Brian on our tour this week. The food was amazing, it was really well organized, and you get a a dash of Vietnam history as well. It was so interesting to learn about the influences of other cultures on the vietnamese cuisine yet it still has it's own distinctive flavors and flare. The food here just isn't what I imagined when I thought of street food. Everything is super fresh and flavored with vibrant herbs to please the senses: sight, taste, and smell. Touring through the markets you get to see where all these delicious ingredients are purchased and how the local people handle their grocery shopping, which is quite different from western culture. It was so interesting!I believe you learn so much more about a culture when you eat the food where the locals go but it's even better when you can get an explanation from someone living here. Brian has been visiting and living in Vietnam for years and brings a unique perspective to the food scene here; it was great visit his favorite spots. Some of his favorite dishes weren't available in the area we were in. It was an awesome surprise for a young lady to pop up and meet us on her scooter with some special dishes that were must haves. This food coordinator was like a fabulous smiling food fairy bringing great surprises packed specially for us. It was a particularly nice touch.At the end of the tour I was full, full, full, and felt like I had a great sampling of the dishes around town. Don't dare eat breakfast and you might even think about skipping dinner the night before to pack away all the great stuff you're going to sample on this tour.Clearly I highly recommend this. It is worth your time and your money! Go, eat, and be merry!

What a great way to experience Hanoi. Brian provided a safe and exhilarating tour that allowed us to experience tastes of Hanoi I would never had even thought to try. In fact two of the foods are now a must every time I go back and I even introduced them to colleagues of mine.Thanks Brian for the great day!!!

Food wonderful - entertainment for free ..... Mr. Brian greets you like a friend coming around for dinner - just the right balance of friendliness and knowledge and this guy is knowledgeable. A chef from New York and now Hanoi resident, he knows a LOT about both the food and the history of the city. You get to visit amazing markets and cafes where you get a different dish in each - just a taster, so you are not too stuffed to complete the tour. He also has a backpack of tricks, including a flask of local tea, sweet treats and a shot glass of rice liqueur - it's clear this chap puts thought and effort into what he does. I particularly liked visiting (literally) the other side of the tracks behind the railway, where those workers on lower incomes have their community and you could get your dinner for about 25p. This was an ace tour and I found Brian a great host - I hope his tour continues to be a success, he deserves it. Highly recommend A Taste Of Hanoi as it really is something out of the ordinary.

Excellent Tour. Had a great morning with Brian trying out, and learning about, Vietnamese food. Despite the wet weather it was a busy morning walking around markets, stalls and streets of Hanoi. Highly recommended, but don’t eat beforehand!

Great tour. This tour was more like a history walk that happens to have a bunch of food along the way. Brian was very friendly and knowledgeable about food, culture and history. Highly recommend this if you like history and food.

Brian was an awesome guide, he can really tailor a tour to fit the interests of the group.. Excellent tour overall, Brian knows a ton about the history and culture of Vietnam as well as local architecture which went along well with the food tour. We tried over 30 dished and the tour allowed us to try many things we likely never would have experienced on our own. I highly recommend taking a tour with Taste of Hanoi.

Most Excellent Tour we have found. My family and I are vacationing in Hanoi, Vietnam and looked for a tour guide.... Brian was recommended by a passerby who overheard us asking around..... We contacted him and booked a tour the next day,we were most satisfied with his tour, very knowledgeable of both the area and its fine food too....... Of all the tours we have taken on this vacation we all felt that Brian was the best thus far.... He really loves Hanoi, Vietnam its people, its culture and its food.....We Highly Recommend him to all***

Appealing to all tastes - discover Hanoi's delights. Exactly what we were looking for after researching lots of other options - A food tour that also taught us about Vietnamese history, culture, architecture and the local streets around Hanoi's old quarter. Interestingly the tour kicks off with a visit to the fantastic vibrant market, which we absolutely loved.Even though we'd already been in Vietnam for over 2 weeks and had spent 4 days in Hanoi, we still learned a lot from Brian. I was particularly keen on hearing some more history after previous frustrating trips to a couple of museums. Exploring the streets with a story around every corner helped us to see Hanoi in a new light. Fun, stimulating and action-packed, I'd highly recommend Brian's tour.
Private food tour with brian. Friendly and adaptive to situation as we have our 17 month old baby. Good job and is well recommended

Amazing A TASTE OF HANOI! . I really enjoyed every moment of taste trip with this. I went to good places of VN and experienced real VN. And also after this trip, he gave me some advices of VN trip since i visited Hanoi alone and i was going to travel all Vietnam. Indeed, i did and he helped me a lot. If you wanna TASTE and enjoy your trip, you better try!

Wonderful experience. Being Vietnamese, I was always think I know all about Hanoi and Vietnamese food until my friend have recommended Brian’s Food walking tour for me. He has more knowledge about Hanoi history, culture and food than mine and even my mum. That have been my most highlight of my trip back to Hanoi. We’ve tried a lot of amazing dishes and items that I’ve never taste before, awesome stops on the way. That is worth any penny and highly recommended for everyone. Thank to Brian and his staffs for me wonderful experience.

I love Vietnamese food!. I am a big food lover and this food tour is up there with the best I've done, easily. So many different local foods to try, great value for money, and very informative too.I highly recommend this tour while you're in Hanoi. Brian and his team are well organised and can easily cater for dietary requirements too. One of my favourite highlights of my trip to Hanoi and Vietnam

A Taste of Hanoi is the Best, will not disappointed. When in Hanoi, you should check out this walking tour with Brian and his crew. You will not be disappointed and will be thrilled with Brian's knowledge of Hanoi street food. Brian is well prepared, organized and fun to be with. Price is right and you will leave happy and full.
All the food groups. One of the best tours-not food- that I have been onWell organized and guide extremely knowledgeable and fun to be with

Very fun and very full!. Brian and crew did a great job of giving us a huge variety of delicious local specialties to try. Brian has organized a very efficient system to maximize tastings in a reasonable walking space. This is much more than just a food tour however. Lots of great history and culture shared. I appreciated how we saw so much and how the tour flowed with more walking in the beginning to more walking to sitting in the end. I really feel like our group had a thorough introduction to the history culture and food of Hanoi!

Amazing tour. This was an amazing tour with tons of food tasted. Well over 20 items with many stops and interesting commentary and history of the city. We covered a lot of ground and I was completely filled up on delicious food. I don't think any of the restaurants we went into had anyone but locals in them which was exactly what I wanted in a food tour.The pacing was great and we were offered water regularly which I found to be a small but nice touch. I would completely recommend this tour.

Excellent intro to old Hanoi. We participated in the evening tour and loved it. Not only did Brian share his love and extensive knowledge of Hanoi street food, but he also introduced us to the historical and cultural context as we walked around old Hanoi. Clearly he had devoted a lot of effort into preparing a customized tour - there was a celiac (requiring gluten-free) and there was a vegetarian - and Brian had arranged for substitute dishes specifically to accommodate everyone's needs. We strongly recommend this tour.

34 different tastes of Hanoi. Wow, what a morning! Brian treated us to 34 different things to eat or drink. Starting at 08:30 we ended our culinary tour at 13:00. The whole morning was extremely well organised with Brian's food co-ordinator helping by collecting items and by setting up things in cafes, restaurants and street stalls in advance of our arrival. Like other reviewers we found Brian's knowledge and enthusiasm to be top notch. The walk along the street by the railway track was especially facinating.All in all a great way to experience much of what Hanoi has to offer in the way of street food. Highly recommended.
30 different Tastes!!. Had 30 different tastes of food and drink during my Morning walking tour. If you want to try unique food while learning about the history of the area, you'll love this tour.

Wonderful tour and really tasty!. This is for the most part a street food tour with some history of Vietnam and some interesting details about Hanoi thrown in. Brians knowledge of street food in Hanoi and the ability to try small portions of a ton of dishes make this a great experience. Try about 30 dishes and a few drinks so pace yourself!

Great combination of Hanoian food and history highlights!. Brian was awesome - he talked a bit about the history of Hanoi which helped to understand why the cuisine in Hanoi is different to the cuisine in other parts of Vietnam. Brian was animated, enthusiastic and showed a genuine authenticity - he didn't just pay lip service, he seemed interested to know about us and our opinions. There was 2-way discussion, not just information being told to us. Great operator, a real people person. The food is wonderful, we went to a good variety of places and tried about 33 different things. Brian also went out of his way for our daughter (4 years) ensuring that he picked a few things up for her that were more suited to her palate. That was above and beyond as far as I'm concerned as Brian had waived the fee for her in the first place based on her probably not eating a lot. He has a team of 'food coordinators' that zip around grabbing bits and pieces that are too far to walk to and they deliver those to where ever we were. They went ahead and ordered food so we never had to wait for the food. My fave but was walking along the railway line - that was interesting. Thank you Brian and your team! You guys are doing good things!

Bright, tasty and awesome!. Brian's Motorbike tour was the first thing we did right after we arrived in Hanoi and it was really the best tour during our trip through Vietnam! Brian knows a lot about history of the whole Asia and Vietnam in particular and tells it in a very interesting way, we were never bored with him. He showed us so many nice places and each further place was like a surprise. Various food we tried was delicious! Seriously, everything we tried was just amazing. And it was very well organised through the tour, alternating with the sights. For us, it was the best way to see and to taste Hanoi - bright, tasty and awesome. Brian is also very charismatic and open-minded, he helped us to organise a tour to Halong Bay for the next day, which was great, too.Just book this tour with Brian - you will never regret!Recommendations: do the tour right after arrival in Hanoi and do it on an empty stomach.

Best street food tour-Vegetarian friendly . I am so happy I went on this tour. It was a great way to get a bit of history on Hanoi, get to see different areas of the city, and learn where all the good street food spots are. As a vegetarian I though I just wouldn't be able to eat at some spots, but the guide and food coordinator went above and beyond to make sure I had wonderful food at every stop (they did the same for another guest who was gluten free). Highly recommended!

Great food tour in Hanoi! . We spent the morning walking around with Brian and had an excellent food tour with him. We walked around for hours and he shared many interesting stories, not only about the food but also about the history of Hanoi and Vietnam in general, as well as architecture and culture. Very interesting! Every now and then his 'food coordinator' (a really sweet Vietnamese girl called Lam) showed up, just at the right time, with loads of good Vietnamese bites. A really nice tour!

Loads of bites to try it all! . Brian took us on a morning tour around markets, stalls and little restaurants to try all of the local specialties. Together with Lam (I hope I wrote that right!) who coordinated lots of little snacks perfectly, we had a great morning!

Exceeded my expectations! Great Tour. Brian's tour is a finely executed experience which combines not only an amazing array of 'insider' food experiences but a wonderful cultural tour as well. Brian includes a potted history of Hanoi, and why the food culture is the way that it is - and what's unique about it. As a solo traveler it was an unexpected bonus to see hidden parts of the city and enjoy a beer with the locals. I would highly recommend this tour if you're interested in food & would like an ex-pat's perspective on this sophisticated city. I did a more standard tour with a local operator the previous night - and although 'good' Brian's tour was far superior.

Value for Money - Highly recommended!!!. Brian is an excellent guide who takes time to explain the food tour, the history of it all at every single stop. His conversation clearly showed his passion for Vietnam and its food and you can tell he takes pride in his job and making sure that every single customer walks away learning more about Hanoi as well as them having a great time during the walking food tour. Even for me who is not new to Hanoi, I learned a lot of new things (and food dishes of course) through him, and I am very thankful to him on that! Do contact him if you are in Hanoi for work/leisure - you will learn more about Hanoi, not just its food through him and have a great tour!

Fantastic street food tour!. We were new in Hanoi and booked Brian on the recommendation of friends and we are really glad we did! Brian was helpful and informative. It was a great way to be introduced to the Old Quarter of Hanoi. We ate foods we never would have otherwise and discovered new favourites. We felt like we really got to experience the incredible food and street food culture in Hanoi. Brian and his team were really well organised and packed a lot in to the four hour tour. Highly recommended.

Something to experience. There are no words to express my gratitude to Brian and A Taste of Hanoi Team for making my food tour such a great experience. I will not write here about the places we visited because this is for me to know and for you to find out. The smells, tastes and colours of Hanoi are all reflected in a variety of food items you will try during this tour. And there is over 30 different dishes to try, so when Brian tells you that you don't have to finish everything each time we stop he knows what he is on about..., but the food is soooo yummy!!! Some of my favourites were kem and bo bia. The tour is extremely well organised and all runs smoothly. You can learn a lot of history and you are visiting places that regular tourists wouldn't even dream of seeing. The tour includes also some exercises ;) This is mainly due to size of chairs that locals seat in. On the hindsight, if you fell out of the chair you wont hurt yourself as it is never too far to the ground :) I would recommend the food tour and bike tour to everyone who wants to discover real Hanoi. Thank you Brian for making my stay unforgettable.

So patient and informative. Brian knew the history of Vietnam and has a keen food sense. I have lived here for 18 months, and he took me to unfamiliar areas of the Old Quarter. Most importantly, he was patient with the pace my parents in their 80s needed as we wandered the streets. Excellent food choices too!!

Incredibly delicious and informative!. Brian was an excellent food tour guide, very friendly, and knowledgeable about Hanoi, the whole tour was nicely interlaced with the history of the area, making it a food and history tour, and a great value.

Amazing old quarter (in addition to food) tour. I'm not a foodie but joined the tour because a few friends convinced me. The food was solid but my favorite part of the tour weren't the food. Brian knows his Vietnamese history and told us great stories along the way through the old quarter. In addition, I felt like I caught a glimpse of real Vietnamese life throughout the tour. We walked through the markets and witnessed kids coming home from school and parents picking up food for the night's dinner. Although I was on a tour, I did not feel like a tourist.

You've tried the rest now try the Best.. I'm was a complete novice to Vietnamese food and wanted to experience what Vietnam had to offer so I contacted Brian's A taste of Hanoi ,I booked a motorbike tour and a night food tour, Brian also organized our airport transfers in Hoi an and Hanoi which I was very impressed with as the Hanoi flight was delayed by 2hrs and the driver waited for us and from past experience with other airport transfers after 1hr the drivers leave ,so top marks already for A taste of Hanoi.The motorbike tour started with a pick up from our hotel and we headed out on the crazy streets of Hanoi where our first stop was to show and explain the mosaic that stretched for 4km , our other stops on the trip included the red river, west lake and few others , at each of the stops Brian would tell us a bit of history and to try some amazing food .Brian and his colleague Lubo were amazing tour guides and safe drivers.Our next tour with a taste of Hanoi was the night food tour starting at the dong Xuan market and ended at a perfect viewing point over ho hoan kiem lake/pond.During the tour you'll try 30 different types of food and lots stories and history as you walk a long the street of Hanoi I recommend you don't eat before the tour because my stomach was full.The night tour was great to experience Hanoi by foot and Brian takes you to places that you wouldn't dream of walking down so with out Brian's tour I think I would have missed out on what Hanoi had to offer.Top marks to a taste of Hanoi and I would definitely recommend this to my friends.All that I would recommend that you bring on this tour is a good pair of comfy shoes and camera.Thank you Brian and you staff for my experience one I'll never forget

A superb food tour. As a rabid foodie, a tour operator and a developer of food tour, I can highly recommend Brian and his team of food coordinators. This is a food tour as food tours should be. We took the morning walking food tour. It is really two tours in one. A historical tour of the old quarter and an exploration of the mundane and exotic foods found in this quarter. The start of the food tour in the spice market really set the tone for the tour. It was one of the most visual and extensive spice markets I have seen in Asia. Another little twist that makes the tour fun, is that Brian is always asking you if you know what some is, or what the ingredients of a dish are before he explains it to you. This really perks your awareness of the food that you are enjoying. We tasted over 30 different things on the tour, which sounds like a lot. But as the tour lasts 5 hours and you are walking around a lot, at the end you do not feel full, at least I did not. I have only two recommendations: (1) select just two sweets at the end of the tour. I appreciate the effort to give a thorough intro to the wedding sweets. But two is enough. (2) The briefing at the beginning could have included a better overview of the tour. Oh, and hot tea on a cold morning would have be lovely, as you know! Kudos on a job very well done!

Complete Vietnam experience. Booking a Taste of Hanoi tour completed our experience in Vietnam. Getting to know Brian and the history of Hanoi, along with eating which is for me one of the best cuisines in the world, was definitely worth it! I recommend this tour to everyone that comes to Hanoi. We felt very comfortable with Brian and we can say that we have a friend in Hanoi now!

Taste of Hanoi "A MUST DO". Great tour Brian knows his stuff history, foods, backstreets and markets. The samples of food we had were great. Very good variety of food types, make sure you have room for all the food that's coming your way

Even if you are vegetarian or if you don't eat pork. I had nearly given up on going on a street food tour until I found A taste of Hanoi. Brian and his food coordinator managed to get lovely street food without pork. I enjoyed every bit of it. Markets and explications of all this mysterious dried foods and vegetables, information about vietnamese cooking, tasting delicious food in small student restaurants, discovering surprising sweets and a lot of really interesting information about history of Hanoi and people's lifes today.

No need to say, this tour necessary when come hanoi. A Taste of Hanoi tour is very awesome.If these people must do do.Variety eating local food and want to find restaurants in hiding and want to know this city history.People meeting, and then olny in that country foodstuffs described and eating variety foods about 31.Finsh the tour i am so full.About 5 hours last, but i am not bored.I recommend all people with family, friedns, couple, alone and so on.

Really interesting walking tour. This isn't your average food tour - Brian also took us through a background to Vietnam, Hanoi, its history and its flavours. He's an engaging guide and has put significant effort into making it a real experience, including for my vegetarian companion. There's lots of walking and standing, so I wouldn't recommend it for anyone that's not fit and healthy. Thanks to Brian and team for an interesting and flavoursome tour.

Caters for vegetarians. This tour is excellent and should ideally be done earlier in a stay at Hanoi. Brian was excellent, providing a mix of food and history and info on current life in Hanoi. Being a vegetarian was no problem at all, I was very well catered for.

Great tour - even for an expat. I've lived in Hanoi for a few months, but hadn't got much further than some of the restaurants around my house. Brian's tour was great at changing that. Going to local restaurants is hard without speaking any Vietnamese, so having a guide was perfect. My visiting friends loved the fact that he added some explanation - so although it's 80% a food tour, there's an extra 20% of history and facts that really adds some colour.The tour itself took a bit over 5 hours, and covered pretty much everything I'd expect food-wise, with a mix of restaurants, street food and markets.Best bit was right at the end, when I was about to ask if he could email us a list of everything we'd had - the list had already been printed for us.All in all, it's a great tour, and one I've recommended already to other friends who are visiting us.
