Shouldhave done this first!!. What a great tour! and on motorbike! I hould have made this the first thing I did in Hanoi- I got so many great tips about the city, and saw so many great places! Brian really knows and loves his city. Food, history, little bit of beer, and great sights. Best you can get!

Delicious Food, Great Guide & Excellent Value. Having heard that Vietnam is one of the most amazing places for food, particularly street food, I was excited to go there. The problem is it was so hard to figure out what anything is or how it should be ordered or eaten. That's when I found A Taste of Hanoi, a street food walking tour. It covered everything from a market visit to see where the fresh produce comes from, to sampling many of the delicious local Hanoi and Vietnamese dishes and as a bonus, a lot of history and information about the area. Brian has great knowledge of both the city and food and was so enthusiastic about telling us. For the amount of time, food and knowledge you get on this tour, it is excellent value and will make the rest of your stay in Vietnam so much easier, as you'll know exactly what to order when out and about. Don't eat before heading out on this as you will definitely be sated! I recommend this for anyone interested in eating - so that's everyone!

A must do!. Despite our being late- fate was conspiring against us- Brian (who runs the show) phoned Us and waited until we got there. It put the group out but we were very appreciative and not at all disappointed in what we got to experience. It seems that nearly all the best things to eat in Hanoi involve pork in some way but Brian accommodated my inability to eat it and organised ahead of time this request. The tour was interesting and informative and we learnt a lot about not only food but the history of the old quarter. Thanks Brian for a wonderful introduction to the food of Hanoi. Thanks too to his food coordinator Nat(westernised spelling, sorry!) who was wonderful, friendly and efficient. There was no waiting at any restaurant, we seamlessly moved from place to place. Put this on your list of must dos in Hanoi!

Great food, Great tour. This morning I did A taste of Hanoi food walking tour, it is a great way to get introduced to Vietnamese and especially Hanoi foods. Throughout the morning you are feed wonderful and amazing food in and around the old quarter. You also get a brief history of the city and Vietnam and events that happened on the spot where you are stood. Brian is very knowledgeable and knows he foods well. He also has a food coordinator who scoots around town to find that one off foods that are a little out of the way on the walking tour. I had a great time and great food and got to see parts of the city that i would not have been able to find on my own. I highly recommend getting out there and doing this tour.

A great way to try typical Vietnamese street food!. Great way of experiencing typical Vietnamese food in places you wouldn't find on your own! Brian and his food coordinator Ngat give you nearly 30 different things to try, also bringing specialties to you that can't be reached by foot during the walking tour. In between Brian tells you interesting facts about Vietnams history and sites you pass on the tour. Just make sure you don't eat anything before going on the tour, there will be plenty of food and drinks to enjoy!

A great way to experience the best of Hanoi's street food!. I went on the Taste of Hanoi street food tour last week as I was a little unsure of the street food culture in Hanoi. By the end of the tour I felt completely at ease engulfing myself in what is known as some of the best street food in the world! Brian delivers a tour that is not only about the delicious food, but immerses travellers with the history of the areas we visited, which I found engaging and thoughtful. His experience as a chef helps him to select only the freshest and best street food Hanoi has to offer! I would recommend this tour to anyone interest in the street food of Hanoi! Thanks again Brian!

Great experience. Great experience in Hanoi. I love to make photo in market, street life and food, so this experience is a gem of my trip.
I recommented for all!

A superb tasting and walking tour around old Hanoi!. Had half a day to kill in Hanoi so I decide to spend the morning cruising around Hanoi's Old Quarter with Brian and a couple of others. What an excellent decision it was! I tried so many delicious dishes and street food snacks, all expertly chosen by Brian and his awesome local tour coordinator, Huong. On top of the delicious food (I lost count of how many dishes we tried), it was great to walk through Hanoi's beautiful Old Quarter and learn about the history and culture from Brian, a very knowledgable ex-pat. We finished the day by sitting on a rooftop overlooking the lake and sipping Vietnamese coffee. Perfect.

Have a taste!. I've been living in Hanoi for more than three months and finally managed to join the tour last weekend. I enjoyed it very much and would recommend it to everybody who has some 4-5 hours left. You get a nice walk around the old quarter, many stories about the places and more food to try than you can manage (around 30 items, also including drinks, sweets and small bits to try) . It's all very tasty. Enjoy Banh Mi, Bun Bo Nam Bo, O Mai, Pho Cuon, Bo Bia, Banh Trang Tron and the delicious Ca Phe Trung - just to name a few highlights. And remember to make some notes about the places because you will surely want to return. I will recommend this tour to all my friends that are going to visit me in the coming years. It's a great introduction to Hanoi and its food.

Informative and tasty!. We spent around 5hrs with Brian and his team today, and thoroughly enjoyed the tour.We decided to do the tour to broaden our horizons in terms of local food knowledge, but we were not expecting to receive such an interesting insight into Hanoi and its history. Brian provided our group with a steady flow of information relating to the city, whilst ensuring our appetites were well and truly satisfied.I won't go into detail about the food you try, but I will say that we enjoyed pretty much every one of the 30 odd dishes we tried!If you like your food, have an interest in the history of Hanoi and have a spare morning, we would thoroughly recommend this tour.

New food and places to try... even for a local!. After living in Hanoi for a year and a half, I thought I had experienced most of the different types of street food around in Hanoi...turns out I was wrong! Great selection of Hanoian 'classics' mixed in with some more unusual (but equally delicious) dishes. It was really great to take the time out for a walk through the OQ and learn something new about the food, history and architecture in the city I call home.

Fabulous Food, Fascinating Tour of Old Hanoi. We only had one day in Hanoi & we're so glad we spent half of it on this well researched & well organised tour. The tour is a great introduction not only to Vietnamese street food but also to the real Old Hanoi. Brian, our guide, took us to places off the beaten track that we certainly would not have explored, or even discovered, on our own.Brian has a real passion for Vietnamese food. We began at the market with an introduction to the key ingredients of Vietnamese cooking before moving on to a number of stalls and cafes around Old Hanoi to try many many different dishes. (So many, in fact, that for dinner we only had an ice cream)! Brian talked about the ingredients & explained how each of these dishes are created, stressing the importance of fresh ingredients and the care that goes into their preparation. Brian's extensive knowledge goes beyond the food to the history & culture of Vietnam and Hanoi in particular. So with this one tour you get both an amazing food experience and a great walking tour of Old Hanoi too. Highly recommended!

Wonderful tour and food!. A Taste of Hanoi is an amazing food tour! Brian gave us also a lot of interesting historical explanations to be able to understand more Hanoi and the relationship of the poeple to the food. Since I made the tour, I understand much more the food and product from Vietnam, it is the best introduction to the country ever. Do it when you arrive in the country!

Best tour in Vietnam. Great job Brian,I had a chance to do several tours on my stay in Vietnam. A taste of Hanoi was by far the best!!!Brain and his team give a great tour. Lots of local knowledge on the food and the historic significance of each spot you visit. I especially like how the food team shows up while your getting the tour and drops off the freshest possible treats along the way.A must do when in Hanoi

Outstanding experience. Excellent guide, knowledgeable kind and patient, great food and a lot of history! Wonderful opportunity to explore into Vietnamese food, learn about Hanoi and have fun!Perfectly organized, in addition a very keen assistant takes care of all organisational aspects such as preorder the food so that the guide can focus.... Just EXCELLENT!

Walk, eat, and learn your way through Hanoi!. This tour is a must as you eat your way through the streets of Hanoi. Brian was extremely knowledgeable about the history of Vietnam, Hanoi, and Vietnamese food. He surely did his homework as no question was left unanswered. As a native English speaker for a tour guide, I find this to be an advantage as there is no language barrier to deal with. There is so much food-sampling on this tour that you really have to turn food away because more is coming! I recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hanoi, especially on a short visit.

A cool combination of a city walk and delicious food tasting. Brian was an excellent host on this interesting city walk in Hanoi. It's a great way to taste about 30 different typical dishes/snacks. I liked the route, the stories, the variety of food and drinks. Brian put together a well organised food tour. The local food coordinator arranges the food stops and makes sure everything runs smoothly.My tip is to do this tour on your first day in Hanoi. You will see the most interesting spots and have a taste of the best food options. The next days you can explore the city by yourself and with the good background the tour has given you. Absolutely recommendable!

A great start to an amazing vacation and world class walking food tour!. We were recommended "Brian" from a taste of Hanoi by our concierge and of all the food tours we have done in our little Asia and european adventures this is the top. An enthusiastic and top notch guide, he took us through an amazing foodie tour. Highly reccomend to all! You will have no regrets.

The smells, the sights and tasty delights!. By far the easiest and healthiest way to taste a wide spectrum of food from Hanoi (with a few transplant dishes from other areas of Vietnam). Brian is a great guide with a wealth of experience and knowledge. The food on offer provides a genuine taste of Vietnamese cuisine without upsetting Western stomachs. Highly recommended! Just remember to pack a zip seal bag for all the goodies you can't fit in - there was over 35 dishes to try!

This has to be on your Hanoi menu!. What a treat it was to have Brian show us around Hanoi and its many eating places. A pleasure for the taste buds and quenching of our thirst for some local knowledge. In all I think we tasted over 30 different dishes ranging from the spicy savouries to the subtle sweets and beyond including a few special drinks. Brian even catered for my non red meat eating diet. It was such a comprehensive tour and Brian's enthusiasm shone through. It certainly gave us an insight into the cuisines, their origins and trends. I'd suggest to certainly do the tour as its a must but better still do it early on when you first arrive in Hanoi so you can go back to all the wonderful eateries.

We saw, we walked, we ate our way through Hanoi!!!. Brian's enthusiasm for Hanoi and it's culinary delights makes this a must experience. We had already been in Hanoi a few days, so this tour filled in all the gaps in our understanding of this interesting city. The best part of this tour were the tiny hole in the wall eateries you probabaly wouldn't eat in if you were on your own. Great tour Brian, and thanks to Phnat.

Great Food, Interesting Stories and a Fun Guide!. Brian was a great food guide for A TASTE OF HANOI - very interesting combination of both food and culture. Really enjoyed the walk along the railway line and getting a peek into life along it. Brian took us to great places to eat, and also pointed out good vendors for us to visit at a later point if we wanted to.The tour started on time, at an easy to find location. There was only us and a few others, which meant the experience was personalized and intimate.Definitely recommend this tour as a starting point for your stay in Hanoi. It's a great way to know the Old Quarter and the many delicious foods it has to offer.

Excellent tour! Fun, informative and delicious! Highly recommend!. I went on the Taste of Hanoi's walking food tour recently and had a great time. I've been living in Vietnam for almost 2 years now but there was still a surprising amount of dishes and information that was new to me on the tour. The tour guide is a native English speaker and very knowledgeable about not only the food but also the history and culture in Vietnam. Additionally there are two English-speaking Vietnamese employees who were happy to offer their unique insights. It was really a great experience and I recommend it for anyone in Hanoi, whether you've just arrived or if you've been here for a while. Thanks for the great tour!

Fantastic tour. My partner and I did this tour on recommendation from our hotel. It was amazing . Brian is a chef from New York with a special interest in Asian food and Hanoi culture. His knowledge was unbelievable and he showed us so much of the city, told us about the culture and history and the food was fantastic! We wouldn't have been so adventurous with food if we hadn't done this tour . His little helper Nat was delightful! If you only have time for one tour ... This is the one ! Brian was a great tour guide , quirky and a great sense of humor ! Brian and Nat , I would like to thank you for the great tour and I wish you all the best for the future ! Keep up the good work .... Anything I can change about the tour ..., nothing !! Xx ps do not eat Brekky..., we had 37 tastes lol

The highlight of our Hanoi visit. This was our first stop in our trip in Vietnam. We got a recommendation from the hotel staff to book this street food walking tour. The woman said that the tour would be led by a western guy. I was excited right away that I would get a local guide but an expat local that knows the streets and the food, but also that I knew I would be able to understand him. The tour went off without a hitch. We met up with our very enthusiastic foodie guide at the big central market. From that point Brian presented us with awesome foods from Vietnam from start to finish. He brought us on a very cool walk that has lots of fun stories all along the way. I really enjoyed the spots he took us to where I felt like there was no other tourists around, and that I was really getting a good local experience.  Brian’s passion for food really comes through on this tour. His fun collection of stories all along the way of our walk make the time go by so fast and made me feel so much better for the rest of my trip into Vietnam now too. I can order some of my own locals foods now without anyone helping me.  I would totally recommend this tour to anyone on their first day in Hanoi or their last. Very cool Tour Brian thanks again.

A Taste Of Hanoi. Brian, our Foodie tour guide from "A TASTE OF HANOI, was the perfect one to show us things we'd never have seen or experienced otherwise! This was a very interesting combination of both food and culture. We truly enjoyed the walk along the railway line and getting a peek into life along it. You can always find "tours", the difference is when you find a Tour that really shows you much more than just the "Tourist" thing! Not only did Brian take us to great places to eat, he also pointed out good vendors for us to visit at a later point if we so desired. I definitely recommend the tour as a starting point for a stay in Hanoi or as the Grand Finale, great way to get to know the old quarter and different foods on offer.

Best night street food tour. After do some scooter Vespa tour ,we love it very much .we decided to do night foodtour on the motorbike,food was great tour guide was heat English explained a lot of history and culture and especially we been to see many interesting places stop for many food ,and I love the live music on the end of tour ,i recommends this tour for you first night in Hanoi to do this tour

visiting the main attractions in hanoi. Had a very Nice trip with a very Nice and perfect english Speaking driver on a Scooter. We visited the important sightseeing places like the opera and the long Bien bridge, the ho chi Minh Mausoleum etc. and he told me ab out The history oft these places and also about whats going on in the City nowadays so i had a little insight. And on the top, a very save driver. Strongly recommended.

Best way to have a quick tour of various sites of interest. Visited various Vietnamese cultural and historical sites, all by motorbike. The tour guide was very informative and accommodating, explaining the stories behind the sites very well. Upon arriving in Hanoi, the traffic looked very intimidating, with no lights and lanes, so it was definitely a good experience being a part of the traffic for once!

Amazing! Informative! And all round fun motorbike tour. I would recommend this tour to anyone that would like to enjoy the beauty and rich history of Hanoi. The team was very knowledgeable and friendly. We felt very safe on the back of the motor bikes even in the hecticness. Fluent English speaking able to answer any question.

Explore Hanoi on the motorbike . 2.5 hour tour of the city on a scooter, so cool! We got to see many things we wouldn't have if we just walked. We saw the Opera House, ceramic wall, over the river on a couple bridges with a beautiful view, Tran Quoc pagoda at sunset!! The Ho Chi Minh Mauseleum, and drove past many other sightseeing spots. The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgable and it was amazing to see the city this way. I highly recommend Motorbike tours Hanoi!!

Fancy Way of exploring Hanoi. We checked out Hanoi by Vespa with motorbike tours hanoi and it was just Great! We haven't known anything about the City before and our guide Huy gave us a very Good impression about the City and its most important spots. In Addition he shared a lot of interesting information about the Country and its history. Furthermore moving by scooter in the crazy Vietnamese Traffic was an absolut exciting experience you should not miss.Thanks a lot for good guiding and showing us around, we would always do it again!!

Nice tour with a great guide. Perfect way to get to see the most important spots of Hanoi in only 4-5hours. Anh was my guide and was very passionate about sharing his knowledge and answering all questions I had.

Best way to explore Hanoi . I arrived to Hanoi with my wife for 1 day as a base for going to Halong and Sapa. Our impression was that there is nothing to see in Hanoi so we decided to take a motorbike guided tour in exploit our time and as much as possible, if there is anything to see (we knew nothing about Hanoi and Vietnam). We chose motorbike tour Hanoi for their high rating and reasonable price. Anh was our guide. First he was adorable, very informative, kind and friendly. Drove safely (comparing to other Vietnamese drivers). We saw the Old quarter, Opera house, the Old bridge over red river, west lake (the peaceful lake in Hanoi as Anh said), the tran quoc pagoda, learned a lot about buddihsm and mao relegion - this part was fascinating to us as we learnt a lot about something that was vague to us. After that we went to see the last American B52 plane that was dropped by the Vietnamese in their war with the Americans. Next we visited the government buildings area and ho chi minh mausoleum - again we learned a lot on Vietnamese history and communism. We would summarize this trip as the best way to explore Hanoi and know about Vietnamese history, culyure, relegions, and most importantly from the great guide Anh,and we highly recommend it for others!!!

Off the beaten trail . If you like to be immersed in the local driving it is time to join this tour. Super nice afternoon with driver and guide Anh from motorbike tours. On time for the pick up, friendly, knowledgeable , open minded , careful about his clients. If you have special request he will try his best to help .If we have to do more tour such like going to the countryside, we will ask him to drive us.

Highly recommend and brilliant guides. Just back from a motorbike tour and have to say it was a great experience. An excellent way to see Hanoi with very informative guides. If you're in Hanoi I would thoroughly recommend you use this motorbike tour company. Very friendly and professional staff. Thanks again from Mary and David from Ireland.

A fun way to explore the city!. We had such a fantastic time with motorbike tours. We felt completely safe riding on the back of the bikes with khanh and Le, despite the craziness of the busy roads of Hanoi. Khanh, our tour guide, was really helpful, giving us all the information regarding Vietnam's history, where to go and what to visit after our tour. We also had some great photos taken of our experience as well, that we will cherish. I would definitely recommend this tour. It's such a great way to explore the city!

Motorbike after dark tour . We book motorbike tours Hanoi ,the trip by Vespa ,Together with a guide you are exploring Hanoi by the sunset in the crazy traffic. The guides are driving really safe and explain about the points were you stop. Really nice when you are short in Hanoi and want to see a lot from the city! I would like to recommend this tour for you do this tour on your first day in hanoi

Best street food by the motorbike. Great tour!. My fiance and I booked this tour for our first day in Hanoi to get a glimpse of some of the important sites in the city. Best way to explore Hanoi. This motorbike tour will make you feel like a real vietnamese Person, you won't feel like a tourist anymore. What an amazing tour. After a first expérience with the Tour within Hanoï city I have decided tout repeat the expérience with Peter and his team with the Motorbike tours. Best part of our visit to Hanoï. This outing was clearly the expensive bit of our holiday but well worth it.As a family of four we were met outside our hotel by 4 drivers, on 2 motorbikes and 2 scooters right on the agreed time.Khang, the owner is a knowledgeable and professional person who has designed the tour in such a way that we were able to see the main places of interest as well as some areas we would not have had the chance to discover had we not got on the motorbike tour.We appreciated being handed cold bottles of water after an hour, as well as being offered an ice-cream and a cup of coffee at the owner's new business venture.

Excellent way to see major landmarks in Hanoi. My husband, mother-in-law and I were in Hanoi for only four days and this bike tour was the perfect way to start our trip! We booked the trip the day before and Peter, the owner of the company, was quick to respond and confirmed our tour the next day. Our tour was led by Linh, who was knowledgeable, fun and a delightful tour guide! We all felt very safe throughout entire tour. Highly recommended! Make sure you bring cash for payment as they don't take credit cards.

Really fun day. We were in Hanoi in December. I made the booking before the arrival and the booking was quite smooth. The 4 guys were very punctual when they picked us up at our hotel. We were a bit worried at the beginning how travelling will be on the mopeds in that super busy city. The first 10 minutes we were just giggling as we couldn't really believe we are doing this. The guys made us very comfortable and safe during the whole trip. We went on the day trip to the country side and we were very happy with the whole trip. Amazing experience for sure ; one of the highlights during our 2 weeks trip in Asia.Thank you for Hui and his friends , colleagues

Brilliant day out. This was an excellent and exciting motorbike tour of Hanoi city. The guides arrived to pick us up from the hotel very promptly. Peter (main guide & tour company owner) was really knowledgeable, super friendly and spoke really good English. The lunch (included as part of tour) was delicious and the 4.5 - 5 hrs spent travelling around various historical sites/temples/pagodas went by pretty quickly. At all times i felt safe and well looked after on this tour. I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to see Hanoi and feel a part of the city. Excellent price worth every dong!

Hanoi Highlight. This was the perfect way to end our Vietnam trip. I felt completely safe, even when approaching the daunting intersections. I would definitely recommend this tour as a fun way to see the city & visit the most important historic sites. Loved it!

Discover Red River. If you do one tour in Hanoi,this should be it. Away from the bustle of the city,you will see farmers tending vegetables,rice and flowers as you pass along narrow paths between the fields: see a food market where only village folk are shopping(not another tourist anywhere!) and all with Peter's stories, explanations and amazing driving. From the back of a bike there is so much more to see.Sitting by a road-side fire,eating freshly cooked corn was awesome. Just do it!

If you're a history buff this tour is great!. Touring by motorbike was a great way to see the city! The staff was very friendly and they were all safe drivers so I never felt nervous. Our tour guide was very thorough in explaining the historical significance of all the sites we saw. My boyfriend and I had a great time!

This was an Awesom tour and we had a great time exploring Hanoi!. This was an awesome tour and we had a great time exploring Hanoi! The food and knowledge in the tour was very good as well as the friendly English speaking staff. Would definitely reccomend it! :)

So Spendid Afternoon Tour in Hanoi on Motorbike. This is surely the best way to see Vietnam, Hanoi! We are so glad we did it!Initially, we were concern about safety, especially our daughter only 11 year old. Elly the team leader and her team are very careful, experience and safe drivers. This worry was off our mind right at a start when we were sitting on the motorbikes.So many to see including from beginning till the end. 4.5 hours is a right duration! The included lunch in a restaurant was excellent too.I strongly recommend Motorbike Tours Hanoi - Day Tours if you are planning to visit Hanoi for this experience:- Very responsive- Elly is cheerful, friendly & sincere - my daughter enjoyed being with herPS: Not forget to wear a mask

A beautiful Hanoi Tour!. First of all, these motorbikes and so fun, comfortable and safe. I was a little worried since I'm a bit of a skeptic, but I felt assured riding them. The weather was nice as well, and they were easy to operate.Now, onto Hanoi, it was sooooooooooooo pretty! The tour guide was funny/witty and answered all my questions with tact and intellect. Some of the places we stopped at was just for the view, and some were an experience! Stops where we got to eat were the most fun.Honestly, this was one of the things I'll remember most about my trip to Hanoi. I'd recommend it! And don't forget your cameras!

Feel the vibe of Hanoi on a motorbike. First of all, thanks for the good services of our guides at Motorbike Tours Hanoi, they made our trip a wonderful experience. We're no strangers to Asia but we've never been to Vietnam before. I like to book a tour of where I'm staying to get a feel of local life and culture. At first I wanted to take a bus tour but then I found this motorbike tour company. Riding a bike makes you feel and smell the atmosphere like no other means of transportation. I could ride, but my friend was scared of the traffic around here. He opted for piggybacking with the tour guide, I rode a supplied bike.The trip was awesome. We did a daytour of the sights, you can book morning and evening if you like. We started with a lunch, I would have planned the lunch a bit later but we had plenty of time to snack along the way, the Ngoc Lam fresh market is fantastic! You get to see places like the Pagoda, Mausoleum and Opera House.We felt very safe during the trip, the guides were very friendly and provided us with a lot of background about the places we visited. I'm really glad we booked a motorbike tour instead of a boring tourbus. And if you don't ride yourself don't worry, you can just hop on with a guide. They really put safety first. Thanks guys, hope to see you again, I'd love to go back to Hanoi, great food, nice people and a welcome atmosphere!

Amazing experience! A must-do!. We had an amazing experience with Peter and his whole team, from the booking to the end of the ride. We've got to see some amazing places and our guides always had some relevant information to give us about history and local culture.They both spoke good English and went out of their way to make our experience unforgettable. We stopped at many places and had some delicious local food and our guides became our official photographers, taking pictures of us everywhere.Half way we saw a very interesting shop and asked them to stop there, so we could buy some stuff, and they helped us to communicate with the man at the stall. At the end of the ride our guides gave us some nice insiders tips on where to go and where to eat during the rest of our stay in Hanoi.We would surely recommend Peter and his team - the ride it is well worth the money.

Fantastic motorbike tour around bustling city of Hanoi. I was recommended to go on this tour in Hanoi because it is a good way to see a lot of the city quickly. I was nervous of going on the back of a motorbike/scooter but our tour guide helped us feel at ease.The tour stops in lots of different scenic and historical spots and the drivers were friendly and easy to understand. Their English was fantastic. I would highly recommend this tour.

Great way to get a taste of Hanoi, meet some locals . Peter and David made us feel very safe and gave us a great tour of Hanoi by moped. Both had great English and were happy to tell us about local attractions as well as answer all of our questions about them and local life. Is be happy to repay the tour and recommend it to others.

Hanoi Motorbike Tour. Took an amazing tour around the sites and locations around Hanoi and explain the history behind everything. Our tour lasted around 2-3 hours with regular stops and temples, historical locations and attractions.The staff are friendly and speak very good English and I saw sites that I wouldn't have seen otherwise.They took us for an amazing Vietnamese lunch too.This is the best motorbike tour I've taken in Asia - highly recommended!

Countryside motorbike tour. Peter and his collegue drove us through the countryside. We crossed the red river driving on the oldest bridge of Vietnam. Then we visited the citadel from 250bc. Great way to see Hanoi. I spent my first morning in Hanoi doing a motorbike tour. Elly was my tour guide and was excellent. She was very knowledgeable, but also just a great person to talk to. Call to book the Tour one day before we come to Hanoi , Peter and one driver took us on a very nice and interesting scooter tour through Hanoi , we visit Many places around Hanoi see temple and beautifull pagoda , Peter tell us a lot of history of Hanoi and Many interesting story .it so much fun and enjoy VERY much , we get very safe on the back of the bike ,this Tour we can see Some thing different Some places with no tourist and see real local We highly recommend for Every one to do this Tour

Hanoi after dark - Great way to see Hanoi!. If you ever wanted to see Hanoi by motorbike but were too afraid to drive in the chaos, this is the tour for you! Hanoi is a beautiful, bustling, historic city and riding on the back of one of Peter's motorbikes is a safe way to experience it all. Peter picked up my girlfriend and I at our hotel and first drove us to the old French opera house. Then we went to an incredible traditional Vietnamese outdoor restaurant by the river--we had a hot pot fresh seafood dish and other local appetizers (jumping chicken). Peter knows a lot about the history of the city and explains it in detail which was great for us. Next we tried the famous egg coffee and it was delicious! The tour then heads to a live music bar where a band plays cover songs and accepts requests too. Next we went to a Vietnamese live house where we witnessed an acoustic set from a well known Vietnamese artist. After, Peter took us back to his coffee shop and explained to us all the many tours and cruises that are available in Hanoi. Overall, it was a wonderful 4-5 hour tour of Hanoi at night where we got to experience the excitement of safely riding a motorbike amidst the chaos of Hanoi traffic, sample the local food, listen to the local music, and learn about the area's history from Peter, our awesome tour guide. Would recommend this tour! Friendly, safe, delicious, and fun!

Fantastic way to see real Hanoi.. We arrived into Hanoi and wasn't sure what to see first but met Peter who took us on an amazing bike tour that took in many of the main sights of Hanoi but also some hidden gems that I wouldn't have seen if we had wandered ourselves. The experience of riding around Hanoi is incredible and I would recommend it to anyone. It looks at first like it might be quite scary but our riders Peter and Lieu were excellent and we felt incredibly safe. The whole trip lasted an afternoon and I feel we saw so much in that time without it feeling rushed. We got plenty of time to soak in the atmosphere and see the real Hanoi.

The best way to tour Hanoi on the back of a motorbike.. I booker a tour with motorbike tours Hanoi. As I didn't have enough time for tour so he suggested a tour at my convenience. Best tour in Hanoi. Me and my friend booked a tour with Peter and his sister Leo and were not disappointed. In fact it was one of the most enjoyable afternoons in our two weeks in Vietnam! The tour covers great ground, from all the top spots like the Mausoleum and Palace to the Opera House and beautiful pagodas and temples dotted around the city. Off the beaten track. Me and my girlfriend did a motorbike tour with Peter and his sister, visiting the lesser known areas and sights of Hanoi. Experiencing the insane traffic of Hanoi on a motorbike is also something you have to have done, would definitely recommend the tour!

Great fun, best way to see the city!. Myself and my wife were on our honeymoon and had a couple of days to kill in Hanoi before heading home so I decided to book this tour. Very professional. Great tour around the streets and lake of hanoi. The bikes are a mix of vintage Vespas and brand new scooters. I was on the Vespa, it had a back on it which made me feel at ease. My partner had the new style scooter. We both felt very comfortable as the drivers where very skilled at navigating the roads. We had a delicious lunch at a local restaurant and iced vietnamese coffee. Such a great morning, such a highlight of our trip!!!

Amazing way to experience Hanoi!. Peter showed my friend and I around Hanoi in this unique experience, as we didn't feel comfortable renting a motorbike ourselves. His English was very good and easy to understand, and his knowledge of the history of Hanoi was evident from the minute we left. The tour lasted a few hours and the price we paid was great value considering the other options available. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who is planning on visiting Hanoi!

Great motorbike tour!. Really nice tour with scooter through the old and new Hanoi. We've been to places we wouldn't have thought of going to and the comments of the guide were interesting. I learn a lot of history, I would definitely recommend it!

Fun way to see Hanoï. We made a motorbike tour with Peter on a Tuesday morning and really enjoyed it! He took me and my friend on his motorbike with his sister. We passed some remote areas that can be visited only by motorbike! We went over two very nice bridges, several lakes, a market and stopped at the main monuments of Hanoi. Peter and his sister are very professional and informative. If you have only a few days in this city, it's a good way to discover it in one morning or afternoon!I would definitely recommend this tour to my friends and family!

BEST way to see Hanoi!. After coffee and conversation, Alan did an amazing job teaching our group of three how to drive our own manual bikes. We practice for about an hour before heading out on our day tour. We drove through rice fields, banana plantations, and muddy roads. We had an amazing local lunch and ended with a few beers by his shop. Hands down the best thing I've done in my life, and best way to see Hanoi. You get to escape the city scene for the day and have a blast on the back of a motorcycle. Alan also videos the trip on his GoPro and shares it, along with pictures, from the trip! SO MUCH FUN!! Alan is the BEST!

What a way to see Hanoi! . We were told of the Vespa tour by our hotel - Essence Palace in the Old Quarter. Huy and his fellow rider (can't remember his name - sorry Huy) picked up my wife and I at our hotel at 8am sharp. We donned our helmets, had a safety brief and off we went! We were with them for over 5 hours and took in such sights as:Opera House, Long Bien Bridge, Ceramic Rd, West Lake, Phu Tay Hi Temple, Van Nien Pagoda, new Hanoi, French Quarter, a local market and a drive by of Ho Chi Minh mausoleum. If this wasn't enough, we were then treated to a fantastic lunch in a local restaurant in the old quarter - one hell of a spread which was delicious! Huy was a font of knowledge who displayed such enthusiasm for the role. We learnt so much from him about the city and the country as a whole. Their driving was first class which is commendable in the crazy traffic that is Hanoi! I would strongly recommend this trip as you get to see things and experience the madness of the roads that you simply wouldn't get with other trips! Thanks to you and your Vespa partner Huy and good luck for the future! Neil & Alison

The best way to discover Hanoi city. This is the best way to do sightseeing in Hanoi city! With your own tour guides you get to learn a lot about the Vietnamese history and localstyle. Even though the traffic is crazy in Hanoi, it felt more safe sitting on a motorbike than as a pedestrian.

Great Morning Spent Riding Around Hanoi. This was a terrific tour. Our guide riders, Peter and Leo, both spoke good English and were competent and safe drivers. We visited a number of the main tourist attractions (e.g. Hanoi Opera House, HCM Mausoleum, and Long Bien Bridge) as well as other, lesser known sights (e.g. Local Markets, West Lake, and various temples and pagodas). Peter provided an interesting narrative throughout the trip and shared personal insights into everyday life in Hanoi. This is a must do tour to orientate yourself with the city and to absorb the culture, cuisine, and atmosphere of Hanoi. Thank you Peter and Leo for such a great morning!

A Fun Way to Experience Hanoi. The motorbike traffic of Hanoi is perhaps one of the most memorable things about this city, and after this tour I'm convinced the back of a motorbike is the best way to explore and experience Hanoi! Peter is kind, professional, and incredibly knowledgable about the city, and he took us to some really great sites. We saw so many places we probably wouldn't have made it to, including a lotus farm and a lacquer painting studio. I'll admit I had reservations about getting on a motorbike here (watching the traffic can be super intimidating), but once we got going, all hesitation vanished! Peters drivers are safe and cautious. It was incredibly fun and exhilarating, and lunch was absolutely fantastic! I would highly recommend!

Excellent walking food tour. Four of us took a private walking food tour around Hanoi Old Quarter, and had a great time. Peter collected us from our hotel and took us to sample some great street food, including pho, spring rolls, sticky rice with pork, a sweet jelly drink, bia oh on beer corner, and egg coffee. Peter was a great guide with excellent English and lots of local knowledge. He was also able to answer all of our questions when we got into a discussion about Vietnamese history! I'd highly recommend the tour (but don't eat for a few hours beforehand!).

Great tour. We visited different places around Hanoi on the motorbikes. We always felt very safe and have learnt a lot. The food was excellent and the guides were very friendly and helpful!It was the best start we could imagine. Our favourite place was the flower & local market.

FUN & THRILLING TOUR!!. My friend and I just arrived into Hanoi and weren't really sure where to go when we saw Peter's tour. He explained what we would be doing and I was sold! What better way to experience Hanoi than with a local on the back of a scooter! Since we were too scared to attempt the roads ourselves this was the next best thing. Peter and Elly were extremely knowledgeable on the history of Vietnam and Hanoi, and were more than thrilled to answer any questions we had! The sites and landmarks you stop at are exactly what we needed to experience Hanoi at its fullest and is something we would have not been able to do or known to do on our own! I would 100% recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see Hanoi with fun, caring individuals who want nothing more for you to see their city and have fun with them! They genuinely enjoy what they do and that's what impressed me so much! I hope to stay in contact with both of them as we became great friends on our tour!! Thank you!!

Excellent Food Tour around Hanoi Old Quarter. Peter gave us a food tour around Hanoi's Old Quarter. He took us to a bunch of really interesting places and we got to sample lots of delicious local street food. It was a great introduction to the area and the foods you can enjoy there. I would thoroughly recommend taking the tour even if you only have one evening in Hanoi. Peter also took us to his coffee shop at the end and let us sample some of the different coffees. he was a great guide and it was very good value for money.

Great way to see Hanoi. We had booked tour from Internet and it was really great and fun . We had see many beautiful places of Hanoi by motorbike . If we go for a walk by myself we can't visit so much places . So to see Hanoi by the motorbike is the fastest way to open Hanoi for you and it is really excited . Also we had launch and it was really tasty , two guys who shows it were very informative and we recommend you to book this tour with them )))))

Best way to see Hanoi. I can't recommend this tour highly enough. I have done many tours over the years, and this is one of the best tours I have done. We had already spent a few days in Hanoi, but found that we spent most of our time in the old quarter. We picked this tour, as it took us out of the city and showed us sights that we would have otherwise missed. Our guides were very professional, and peter has excellent English. He really knows a lot about Hanoi and it's history. I loved the story about the west lake, and will continue to look for the buffalo!! It was amazing to drive over the long bien bridge with the locals and I especially liked the tour around the local market. The sights and smells were insane!! It was great to sit and have a local drink (Che thap cam) in the market and then go to a local restaurant for some of the most delicious food that was all included in the price. I would not hesitate to recommend any of these tours, and when we come back to Hanoi, we will definitely take another tour with this company.

Fun night. All food & drink included.. Went to a couple of local food places first. Heaps of food and seafood hotpot was brilliant. Then a couple of bars. Both places live music was great, could have stayed all night. First was solid party music & second was swing . One bloke had electric violin & he was fantastic. Definitely recommend.
Excellent organisation - Perfect idea to discover Hanoi. 3 hours drive, good opportuinity to discover Hanoi, lakes, temples, markets, bridges, JUST GREAT !!!!!!!! Security ok, team excellent.

the best experience we did in hanoi. me and my friend travel to vietnam for 1 month get recommend from my friend do motorbike tours hanoi ,it easy to book via on the website by online ,we take morning tour it so amazing to see hanoi ,the places where we been never see on our own ,we learn a lot of history from our guide ,our guide was speak very good english and give us a lot of information around hanoi ,nice to see long bien bridge and temple and pagoda with out tourists ,our last stop at local restaurant food was so good ,every truth thing to see hanoi we have big recommend to every one come to hanoi take this tour

An efficient and original way to visit Hanoi. Walking around Hoan Kiem Lake, we met Peter by chance and we were indeed very lucky to have come across him. We started talking together and the first thing we appreciated was the fact that he speaks good English since most Vietnamese people we had met before did not speak so well. We then asked him some advice about what to see in Hanoi and that's when he told us about his Motorbike Tour and we were immediately interested in discovering Hanoi in such an original way.So the day after Peter and his co-worker picked us up at the hotel at 8am, and we went to see most of the main places and landmarks in Hanoi : Cau Long Bien, Ceramic Mosaic Mural, Tranh Quoc Pagoda, West Lake, some temples, the Museum of Ethnology etc...Peter was lovely. He is a really good guide and he knows a lot about Hanoi history and legends. Moreover he is from one of Vietnam's ethnic minorities so we learnt many interesting things about Vietnam thanks to him.In a nutshell, everything was perfect : a cool team, a great city tour and a really good lunch!We definitely recommend Peter's motorbike tour!

Hanoi by night. Peter's scooter tour is one of the best way to explore Hanoi by night. Not only because you are sitting on a bike as a local, feel the breeze on your face as you roll down the narrow streets or crossing the bridge. But you have the chance to taste the best street food, meet local people and access the bar night life of Hanoi. Probably you will have the chance to meet others and make new friends, who enjoyes this tour just as much you do.Thank you Peter for this wonderful evening, you made it really special!

Have a blast riding the streets of Hanoi. LOVED IT LOVED IT LOVED IT!!!I had an awesome time travelling the streets of Hanoi riding with my experienced tour guide. I went on the Morning Tour which was a 4-5 hour tour that picked us up at 8.00 in the morning and took us through to lunch time. We travelled as a small group of 6 motor bikes which was perfect because I got to meet people from around the world but still feel a personal experience. We rode to a range of popular tourist destinations and learnt about the interesting culture and history of Hanoi. We also made stops in areas little known to tourists and got to experience Vietnam as a local. I really enjoyed going to a hidden market where there was a variety of fresh produce - I even tried jackfruit for the first time and loved it. At the end of the tour we went to a restaurant that specialises in local cuisine. The food was delicious and the beer refreshing. It was great to sit and share a meal with the group and recount the experiences of the morning as well as learn a bit about one another.To start with I was hesitant to go on a bike tour because I felt unsafe amongst the traffic but I am so glad that I gave it a go. The guides at Motorbike Tours Hanoi were very reassuring and friendly, and knew how to navigate the streets safely on bike. I would recommend this tour to anyone. You get to experience the exciting sights and smells of Hanoi with the thrill of being amongst the rush. You couldn't do better if you tried.

Great experience with Motorbike Hanoi City Tour. My friend and I were interested in motorbike tour, and this was hands down the best tour we did while in Vietnam! The driver and tour guide picked us up at our hotel and we started our 4,5 hours tour of Hanoi City. We took the morning 'Amazing Race tour which was a great way to get us to interact with the locals and learn more about history and culture. Our guide spoke very good English, was very informative so we learnt a lot about Hanoi and Vietnamese street food - we did have great lunch at authentic local restaurant with great food! Once you spend some time in Vietnam, you'll notice that traveling by scooter is the way of life and for an adventurous urban tour it is both novel and exciting. More importantly, if you were to tour by a bus or car, it would take you so much more time as the roads are mainly occupied by motorbikes. We only had a weekend in Hanoi so this was the perfect way to see the city in a half day tour. There are many different types of tours available with this company and booking this tour online was very convenient. highly recommended!

Awesome tour!. In the past couple of weeks I have done many tours in Vietnam and this one is definitely at the top of my list. It was great to experience Hanoi without 100 other tourists. This tour was very private, unique and personal. It truely gave me and my partner a very memorable experience and we cannot recommend it enough to anyone who wants to see all the best parts of Hanoi in a short amount of time. Our guide had wonderful English speaking skills and had a brilliant knowledge of the city, it's history, culture, daily life and religion! Not only did we get to see and take pictures in many places but we also learnt a lot. I felt very safe on the bikes for the entire duration and the local food we ate for lunch was fantastic and included in the price! Thanks to our guides for a great day! Will recommend again and again.

See Hanoi by Motor Bike. We are approximately 70 years of age. We have been to many places around Vietnam from Saigon up to Hanoi. This time we tried a tour by motorbike which was recommend to us by a guy who took a motorbike tour. We emailed to book this tour and received a quick response.We did a morning tour of Hanoi, 4.5hours and definitely a highlight of the trip - being in the thick of the Hanoi traffic lets you understand the system (yes it may not seem like there is one) that exists within the organized chaos. We feel that it demonstrate the values and qualities of the people of this country.More importantly, if you were to tour by a bus/car, it would take you so much more time as the roads are mainly occupied by motor bikes. We only had a weekend there so this was the perfect way to see the city in half a day. Our driver was fun and spoke some English and we felt very safe on the back of the bike. Mr Minh, our guide took us off the beaten tourist track (exactly what we liked) and he really did manage to show us a lot of places in the short space of time. He was very knowledgeable and warm, and spoke very good English. He brought us to a really nice local restaurant with good food, so good we thought it the best food we had on our trip in Vietnam. We highly recommend this tour for everyone! When we come back to Hanoi we will do another tour with Motorbike Tours Hanoi. We would like to do Hanoi after dark tour too. Thank you very much Motorbike Tour Hanoi for a great time.

the most amazing experience. I was recommended this tour from hotel ,and i wanted to learn about something about Hanoi and its vibrant city, the lifestyle of its people.and wanted to see some thing out of tourists area. we took Hanoi morning tour Hanoi city isn't too large, but if you want to learn about this historic city by yourself, you must spend some days to know clearly, if any one didn't have much time to stay in Hanoi, but want to learn and see more about Hanoi , I've spent just one day to go to some beautiful and nice places in Hanoi with Motorbike Tours Hanoi . our Tour guide show us a lot of hanoi history and knew alot about local peoples daily life On the tours we went to a lot of places and learn so much history from our guide like ,Hoan kiem lake Long Bien Bridge ceramic wall ,west lake ,Tran quoc pagoda ,around west lake ,huu kiep lake when is B52 downed in 1972 and see new Hanoi city at some much different with old Quarter ,and stop to take photo at mausoleum ,and see the most beautiful road in Hanoi ,amazing to see 1000 years lod citadel .we stopped to eat the Vietnamese traditional food ,the food was amazing so much food oh, It really made me have an idea to come back more and more. Motorbike is the best way for you to travel around in Vietnam I personally think , I even drove motorbike a lot in my country, and now I got good experience about traffic in Vietnam. so I also have chance to sit behind driver and spend my time as great. I could see the scenery very well. that was nice trip - nice tour for me in Hanoi.can not recommend enough this tour for any one come to Hanoi should do it

The best tour I had in Vietnam. This my second time in Vietnam. We booked for Hanoi night tours with motorbike tours Hanoi. Right from the very first meeting when we were picked up from our hotel, everything with motorbike tours Hanoi was impressive. I can safely say this was the best organized and most efficiently run tours of our entire 4 weeks in Vietnam. Our guides' English was great and they gave us a lot of information about Hanoi. Lovely to hear about Hanoi 1000 years old history, so interesting to learn from our guide, impressive in their attention to detail, safety on and off the bikes around the streets, and information. If not on this tour we would not have seen Hanoi like this.The food was excellent and (believe it or not) we felt completely riding with them and weaving through world famous Hanoi traffic at night. By the end of the evening we were pleasantly stuffed and had learned a lot, not just about Vietnamese food but also life in the city and the people that inhabit it. So interesting at the bar swing bar with live music, we enjoyed the drinks and had big fun, we will do it again on our next trip to Vietnam.A fun and unique way to experience excellent Hanoi night tours. Highly recommended!
5 Day Tour of North Nam. Best place to rent bikes, hands-down. Best prices, excellent bikes, helpful owner with good grasp of English who knows just about everything about his business.

Solo travelling around Vietnam . What can I say about Thai, he has treated me like family and has been more than helpful with my solo trip around Vietnam for the past 2 months. Thai helped get my bike into shape for the long journey and also organised my trip to Halong bay which is breathtaking. I'm very impressed with the time and effort he has put into my travels. I highly recommend Thai/his company for any advice and trips around Vietnam. I will definitely be back!
Best service, nice owner . Very great service, the owner is professional and nice. Their bike are in good quality. I want to join the trip someday.

Amazing guide, great tour !. We had a sudden change of plans in Nha Trang and wanted to find something to do for the day. We had seen the motorbike day tour to Dalat and back so we called to see if we could book very last minute (half an hour from pick up time) and he said it was no problem and told us his friend would be there in 10 minutes to discuss our day. It was too late to go out to Dalat and back so he customised our day and showed us around Nha Trang with a waterfall swim and lunch at a local restaraunt. It was the best way to see some of the outskirts of Nha Trang and visit local villages, I need helped make a woven mat

The best in Hanoi. . Living in Hanoi and now the owner well. First days I rented my motorbike here. Later he helped me buying a new one. Last week he was our guide to Sapa. Great time and beautiful scenery. Perfect driver also for the private rented (brand new) car ;-) See you soon for a cha da!! Regards Rick.

Great for the nervous rider. I was very hesitant to ride a motorbike around Hanoi. But Tai (the owner) made sure I was well looked after by an English speaking guide. I went on a 2 hour motorbike ride around Hanoi, on the back of a bike driven by the guide. Very good driving and excellent knowledge. I felt safe the entire trip and I highly recommend this as an authentic way to see and experience Hanoi.

Motorbike Tour of Northern Vietnam. Awesome experience!!!!! 13 days on a motorbike tour of North Vietnam with Thai from Go Bamboo I can highly recommend. Thai provided the bikes, organised the accommodation and meals and suggested the itinerary. He was able to gauge our interests and tailor the trip to incorporate these. The bikes are in excellent condition and well maintained. Even though I did not have much experience in riding bikes he was able to guide us safely through the busy and frantic city traffic to the very winding, narrow and mountainous countryside. The accommodation was a mixture between hotels and homestays. Each homestay presented a different culture and accommodation style and the owners were more than friendly and welcoming. Thai was very particular with the meals that were put before us. Quite often he would present at the kitchen to check that the food was fresh and suitable to our tastes.The itinerary is tailored to incorporate the interests of the clients. The scenery is spectacular, the people have a multitude of traditions and cultures, and the activities are varied.I very highly recommend Go Bamboo Trek. Thai is very generous, helpful and committed to his guests so that they have a very enjoyable experience in Vietnam.

Southern Tour of Vietnam. Hi, just got back from a two week trip of South Vietnam with Go Bamboo Trek, it was absolutely brilliant.After a few emails and a phone call, our ideas had been transformed into a plan by Thai. His suggestions and advice on length of time to spend in each town, whether or not some attractions were a repeat of something elsewhere, showed his knowledge of his country and an understanding of our wants.Our trip started in Hanoi and basically followed the Ho Chi Minh trail. This took us to Ninh Binh, Phong Nah, Hue, Da Nang, Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh City and The Mekong Delta.Meals and the accommodation that Thai organised for us were fabulous. We also found that we were kept busy although when we needed time to do some shopping our requests were catered for.If you are thinking of traveling in Vietnam don’t hesitate to contact Thai, he will give you a trip of a life time.

Hanoi to Da Nang with some hiccups but a great trip in the end.. A little late with the review but wanted to get out there and share it. We met Thai a day before our trip was to take place. He had do a couple rides around the block to get us used to the trip out of Hanoi. We started a little late the day we were going to take off due to our friend who that got extremely sick. We found him a doctor and told Thai he would not par-take in the trip and would meet us in Da Nang. Thai offered to refund his deposit and had his wife take our friend to the hospital, wait with him, took him for food, then brought him back to our hotel. We were very surprised by this and appreciative. That evening he talked to our friend and they figured out a way for him to meet us on the next leg of our journey. The trip was very nice and stopped at some cool places like, Mai Chau, Phong Nha, and Hue. We missed Khe Sanh but not sure if it was because of the two days we started late due to sickness or miscommunication between Thai and I. There are things that bothered us barely but I feel it was more due to a difference in cultural norms than anything else, and I can not knock down his rating because of that. All meals were included made it easy to try new Vietnamese meals I have never tried before. All in all we felt that the services provided were good and minus a few hiccups I would recommend Thai and Go Bamboo to others. Forgot to mention that the bikes were top notch and taken care of, I had the Honda XR 150 with no troubles.

Awesome experience. Highly recommend these guys. I met the owner at a restaurant across the street. I ride every day back home and was missing being on two wheels. I mentioned I have a 15 month old baby and the staff were happy to accommodate any kind of request.We organized for two of us to ride, two pax with their own drivers and 7 pax in a van (oldies and kids). We toured Nimh Binh which I highly recommend. The tour was excellent, regular breaks, amazing scenery, patient and knowledgeable staff helped to make this one of the best highlights of our three weeks in Vietnam.The tour lead, Sy, spoke excellent English and articulately spoke about the history and culture of Vietnam. Some of the group needed to return early and the staff easily arranged this.We were provided with full face helmets and bike jackets (if you want them), lunch was excellent. Bring money for any drinks you want to purchase, and a small tip (~50,000vnd) for the sampans.Tour consisted of a long ride through the countryside, a tour of the Ninh Binh ruins (first capital), a lovely sampan ride through some limestone Kharsts with a few caves (avoid the hawkers) and a nice brisk ride home.Highly recommended!

Fantastic Service with a smile. I needed to rent a bike and I found Go Bamboo Motorbike Trek. I spoke to Mr. Thai to get the usual information regarding rental. Mr. Thai was very helpful and gave me all the information I needed to know. So I called him later on in the evening to reserve my bike and he said it was no problem. I came to pay the deposit it was a quick and easy process. I came on Monday morning to collect the bike I had reserved and it was perfectly ready and waiting for me. I quickly filled in the necessary paperwork and signed the contract and provided my passport as normal. The bike came with extra tubes and brake and clutch cables should I have any problems during me trip, I did not have any issues at all. I went to Ba Vi and back, the bike was amazing and performed 100% as expected. When I returned the bike my passport was returned to me and I jumped on the back of my friends cafe racer to go back home. I can definitely recommend Go Bamboo Motorbike Treks and will be going back hopefully soon as I have fallen in love with my Honda XR 150LThank you Mr. Thai for making my trip so easy and more enjoyable. Hopefully I will see you soon again.

Thanks for saving our holidays. 4 days of bike riding in Vietnam is short. So there is no time to waste in fixing bikes or stressing as riding on the roads, wondering if a part is going to run off the bike while overtaking a truck on a bumpy path...Well GO BAMBOO saved us those troubles! The bikes we rent were just new and perfectly set for the same price than some other renting place that would let you take the road with Vietnamese random trafic with ageless bikes litteraly falling apart. Beside the warm welcoming, the manager speaks a perfect english and has wise advices to give.I recommend warmly!

Living out of my dreams !!. This was our 2nd trip with Thai Tinh. The last trip was 3 years ago. This time we were on a 10 days trip to the north east side of VN.The trip was amazing just like last time. Thai Tinh was always attentive to our group of 8 riders. We enjoyed the home stay. It was very special feeling to see how the local lived. I enjoyed the food that they served to us. The sceneries was amazing. I love Ba Be national park. The Lake was amazingly beautiful. I would love to do more trips in the future with Thai Tinh. He was very knowledgable about the history of VN and he was a fun guy to spend with.We feel very comfortable with him as the team leader :)

Accommodating Motorcycle Tour. We did a day trip to Ninh Binh from Hanoi. The owner met us in the hotel to go through the details of the tour before the day of the tour. He provided good communication and answered all questions I asked by email which is important to me.Safety equipment was offered including good helmets and motorcycle jackets.Our guide, Kevin, did an amazing job.Highly recommended if you are looking for adventure but open minded

Most Amazing Experience. I spent 2 weeks in Hanoi and during that time I went on 3 different tours with Go Bamboo Trek - around the city for a couple of hours, a half day tour to Bat Trang and a 3 day trip into the mountain villages of North Vietnam. I am over 50, was travelling on my own and don't ride a bike so on all the tours I rode pillion. Go Bamboo provided a jacket, helmet and rain gear (just in case). I found the tour guides to be very experienced, safe riders, they spoke very good English and their knowledge of the area was excellent. Their happy outlook made it obvious that they enjoy work and showed great respect to their employer. Thai, the owner of the business was truly fantastic, and a great help with organising my tours and in fact anything I needed to know about Vietnam. He pointed out the best places to eat or go shopping. He even directed me to a pharmacy, and then came with me in case I couldn't explain what I needed (how do yo say band-aid in Vietnamese?).Thai runs a very professional business and I highly recommend Go Bamboo for all your motorbike tours in Vietnam. I understand he can also arrange large group tours for a week or more. Absolutely fantastic!!

Awesome Day!. Apologies for the late review. My husband and I hired a road trail bike and a guide in April 2015 for half a day. The guide was knowledgeable and helpful. He took us way up into the hills to a Pagoda where they hardly see Westerners. It was magnificent to say the least. We then rode a different way back to Hanoi and went to a Pottery Market and Long Bien Bridge that was bombed during the war and is still standing! When we got back to the shop, the owner and guide took us over the road to get "the best Vietnamese BBQ in Hanoi. We sat on the street and ate a beautiful Vietnamese soup which contained noodles, meat patties, chilli, garlic and a few other ingredients which I cannot remember. It was delicious and interesting conversation hearing about the shop owners life in Vietnam and their customs. He was lovely and when we had finished our meal, he refused to let us pay and instead brought us lunch. I would highly recommend Go Bamboo Tours to anyone interested in exploring Hanoi. There are options for scooters (which are easy for anyone to ride) or trail bikes (for the more experienced). The traffic is a little scary but as long as you don't hesitant and use your horn, you'll be fine. AAA+++

17 Day's Best of the North Vietnam -- 6 Stars. No day tour for this guy. 17 Days with Ta Trieu. Everyone wants the boss "Nguyen Thai Tinh" and rightly so. But he had a previous booking and so i was given Ta. My trip started off arriving at midnight and there was Thai and his driver waiting for me. Felt like somebody special my name on a sign board. I have spent three weeks in each of China, India, Laos, Thailand and Myanmar and this was the first time i felt i needed a guide. The roads in the north of Vietnam are not well marked and down right adventurous. I could not have been happier. While i sent exploratory letters to three tour agencies Thai's responses were quick and the most helpful. I told him what i was looking for and he responded with a personalized letter outlining his suggestions for a 17 day experience. I spent day one in Hanoi getting used to his excellent bike. A reliable bike was a must for me. All of Go Bamboo bikes are in excellent shape. And i would end up putting mine thru its paces. Good to see many of the local sites. Day two i was introduced to my guide Ta and we were off. The next 15 days were awesome. Could have been warmer for my blood but that's on me. My trip basically think of Hanoi being at the 6 oclock position on a clock and we went counter clockwise up to Sapa then east a bit to the Chinese border then made our way down thru the spectacular mountains and back to Hanoi. Then a over night boat trip to Halong Bay and my trip was complete. I choose Go Bamboo because of the excellent reviews here on trip advisor and that is why i am taking the time to write this one. From my travels you can see i am no rookie. I am sure you could pay more but i do not think you could ever get any better service. I wanted to experience first hand the people of Vietnam. I wanted to talk with people about their lives and what was the lasting impact of our war against them. I wanted to see the lands beauty and taste its great food. All of which i did. There we so many things i would have missed if not for my great guide Ta (did i mention his name before :) ). Some of my posts on Facebook are public. Kurt Gamlin... look them up. The pictures and the experience was great. I am already planning a return trip, longer stay, starting in Hanoi going over to Cambodia and i will hope to use Ta, Thai and Go Bamboo again.

Driving in the clouds. My motorcycle club takes annual trips around the world. This year we are in Vietnam. On a good friends recommendation, we booked 7 motorcycles through Go Bamboo. One of our members knew the northern mountains of Vietnam but had to cancel his trip last minute. We have never hired a guide on any of our trips but were left in a predicament. Go Bamboo arranged a guide name Hoan for us. We were initially opposed to even the idea of having a guide. We enjoy doing stuff ourselves. Little did we know, motorcycle guides in Vietnam are trained in university for their job and come from the local villages we visited. The level of professionalism with Hoan was exceptional. He listened to our needs and planned us just the right amount of off-roading and unmapped country roads. We spent almost no time on major roads. We only had five days and there's no amount of planning that we could have done that would have led to a similar trip. We stayed with his family for two nights and couldn't have had a more welcoming and authentic experience. He also knows all the best food spots and tailored our cravings. I've seriously never had such amazing food. I'm talking food I'll never forget. I must mention that the 150cc off road bikes we rented were top notch all around. The tires all had proper tread depth. Chains were lubed. We didn't have one problem. That's never happened on any of or annual bike trips. Scrapping for a negative to make this review more authentic? Hmmmm, I guess some of our members wished he would have driven faster however I trusted that he had our safety in mind. Only once did our pack get split up. And that's a good thing in my opinion. Wish we had longer Anyways, all in all, I would 1000% recommend Go Bamboo and please request Hoan as he wont let you down. Before I could publish this review I decided to go out with another friend for 5 more days. Rented the same 150 dirt bike. Was solid as a rock. Had a very, very close call at high speeds. Thankfully the brakes, tires, and my attention were all working 100% or I'd be at the hospital right now!Thai is the man! Go Go Bamboo!!!!!
Best Trip Ever. We made a very nice tour with 6 bikes to the North mountain area of Hanoi. Service, bikes and tour guide very professional. It was awesome trip!

The Trip You Imagined. I was looking for a motorbike tour company in Hanoi, I've never had such a good stroke of luck as when I came across Go Bamboo. The front wheel of my bicycle had fallen off and a nice guy helped me fix it and told me his uncle had a motorbike tour company, he then introduced me to Thai, it was destiny!I did a 3 day tour with Thai the manager of Go Bamboo Trek and on of my friends. It was really incredible. We went to Mai Chau which is to the west of Hanoi. Thai had recommended this as a really beautiful place to visit and in fact it was so amazing I've been back two more times since. I ride a bike in the UK and I can assure you that the bikes you get from Go Bamboo are well maintained, safe and a pleasure to ride. The 150cc Yamanha's are really good fun! Thai and the other guides are a really great bunch, I live in Hanoi and Thai has helped me out a couple of times when I have needed directions or help. My friend hadn't ridden a motorbike before so Go Bamboo also provided a day of lessons to make sure he was confident and safe. You will be taken care of very well on a Go Bamboo tour, eat, drink and laugh all day. We stayed in a homestay where Thai had arranged for the locals to do a traditional dance. The few days I spent on this trip will stay in my memory for ever!I recommend Go Bamboo to any of my friends and family that come to visit Hanoi!

Third trip with Go Bamboo... best one yet. Having written a review for my trip in 2014, I felt compelled to write another... and I don't often leave reviews, good or bad!The team at Go Bamboo hands down made my trips to Vietnam the most incredible experiences I could've imagined.I spent 7 days biking towards the south (where it is a lot warmer in January than the North), having flown from the beautiful Phu Quoc to Hanoi. We were in Hanoi for the coldest day for 30 years (apparently!), but were enjoying coffee with Thai and his friendly staff at Go Bamboo in no time. In a crazy city of a million bikes, busy pavements and at times a feeling of complete chaos, it's very comforting to have some people you can rely on for local advice, a sim card, suggestions for trips...etc... without getting ripped off (which unfortunately is a common story for holidaymakers).Put simply, biking in Vietnam is the best, and arguably only way to see the true nature of the country. I've added some photos that I took on my trip which hopefully demonstrates the epic scenery that you encounter every single day.As I mentioned, this is the third trip now with this company and wouldn't consider going with anyone else. The ability to customize an itinerary based on what I wanted to see / do, along with suggestions and recommendations is perfect for me... I hate the idea of going on exactly the same journey as a million other tourists. I barely saw any Westerners on my trip (admittedly did try to avoid the usual tourist hotspots) and it really felt like I was discovering the place before anyone else!In terms of the bikes available, they were decent models, with a lot of them new and visibly well maintained. The guides are excellent and their local knowledge very useful... especially when ordering food and chatting to people along the way. I felt safe at all times despite the obvious "excitement" of the Vietnamese roads!!Anyway, wasn't going to leave a long review but there you go. Can't recommend Go Bamboo enough (ask to speak to the owner Thai, he's awesome) - you won't be disappointed!

Amazing 13 day motorbike trip through Vietnam.. The trip was amazing. Thai is such a good guide, let us do our own trip and really made it easy and comfortable the whole way. Couldn't ask for a better trip. the roads a scenery he showed us will stick with me for a lifetime. very highly recommended.

Best part of our Asia trip. My wife and I went on a 7 day guided motorcycle trip through the mountains of N W Vietnam (Sapa, Dien Bien Phu, etc) with Go Bamboo and it was marvellous, the highlight of our 3 month trip. Scenery was spectacular, food and accommodations excellent, the ethnic mountain people very friendly and fun to meet, and our guide, Vinh, did a great job of eliminating the stress of travel. Vinh kept us on course and translated so we were able to communicate with the people in the small villages we visited. Having a good guide makes the trip effortless and much more fun. And most importantly, Vinh removed cultural barriers and helped us understand what we were seeing.The pace of travel was good, with regular breaks at scenic spots to stretch and take pictures. The bikes were in excellent shape with perfect tires for the conditions (about 90% paved secondary roads and 10% dirt or gravel) fairly new Honda's with manual transmissions and low mileage. (Go Bamboo has a variety of bikes, including automatics and semiautomatics.) We travelled on twisty mountain roads and averaged about 55 - 60 kph or 35 mph.We enjoyed the trip and our time with Thai, the owner of Go Bamboo, so much we spent an extra week in Hanoi. Thai really takes care of his customers and helps in many ways, recommending other tours, making sure we weren't overcharged, arranging hotel accommodation, even having our laundry and boots cleaned after the trip.I plan to return to Vietnam next year for a two week trip with Go Bamboo.

What a day!!. Myself and 4 friends went on a guided day trip out to Thay Pagoda and Ba Vi peak on motorbikes. This was by far one of the best experiences in our short 4 day stay in Hanoi. Our tour guide Sy and Thai were extremely lovely and knowledgable. The food was delicious and the scenery was breathtaking. We would highly recommend this to any travellers passing through Hanoi. Thanks, Tiarni, Alex, Dan, Dan and Jackson

What an experience!. Had a 12 day/11 night trip with a scooter in the northern parts of Vietnam with the tourguide/mechanic Hoan. We traveled safe and saw a lot of beatiful scenery. I met alot of nice people along the way.Be aware of the weather during the "winter", it can be cold, foggy and rainy so bring the right clothes.I can really recomend Go Bamboo for other services, as booking day tours or if you just need help with finding a specific place. Thai and his family are very friendly and funny, even if you will not book a tour with them. Just go to their office and take a coffee and have a chat.

Drive North Vietnam. The privat motorbike trip, from 6th of December to 15th of December 2015 with Thai throughout Nordvietnam from Hanoi to Sapa - Bac Ha - Ha Giang - Hanoi was despite we experienced rain absolutely breath taking, we enjoyed it very much. Thai has a hugh knowledge about the history of all regions as well as the ethnique minorities in the north. His knowledge ranges from road conditions, geography, history to good hotels as well as restaurants. Indeed he introduced us very well into vietnamese as well as ethnique minority culture. We can honestly recommend his trips.René and Beatrice Spörri, Switzerland

7 day Family Adventure on Motorbikes. this was an private tour and a great adventure holiday, it was great to be able to change the plan during the trip and see exactly what we wanted to see. This was our first motorbike experience and Thai (our guide) made it a great holiday. We were a bit unprepared for the weather so consider the weather gear as important to sort out ASAP. Waterproof shoes, gloves, face mask and rain gear are necessary. Thai catered to our vegan and expermenting food tastes and was a great person to hang with and have a few laughs on the trail.i suggest that everyone use the home stay option whenever possible, much nicer than the cheaper hotels in the hills, and the family are really lovely and considerate!
