Its interesting to see how other families live in the different parts of the mountain villages.Thai picked us up at the airport and handled EVERYTHING for us - nothing was too much trouble and he really made it a stress free holiday for the whole family. The trip cost delivered exactly what was promised and Thai made sure we were happy campers even in the wet weather - He introduced us to 'his street' of Hanoi and the locals treated is really well, the people are friendly and the prices were great!a once in a lifetime family experience that we will be doing again in the next couple years.thanks Thai!! we will book with you again soon!

"King of the Road". This was our first road trip in Vietnam having both fairly recently passed CBT and Mod 2 in the UK - it exceeded all our expectations! The bikes were in great condition which was the first thing I noticed as previous hire bikes across Asia commonly have 300,000 on the clock and have been to the moon and back! The Go Bamboo bikes were not like this, they were well maintained and well presented. Leaving Hanoi is a bit precarious but as we followed our guide called 'Thai' the tarmac changed to rice paddies and the views got ever more spectacular. Our guide helped us with bike riding tips, navigating cafes and restaurants as well as engaging with the local Vietnamese and minority groups all of which we would have struggled with had we simply just hired bikes and forgone the guide. If there was six stars I would rate this six! Thank you Go Bamboo!

Fantastic guide and tour!. We went on a four day trip around North West Vietnam and had an amazing time. Thai, the owner of the company, was our guide and he was generous, cheeky, energetic, full of wisdom, honest and fun. He did everything to make sure we were safe and happy and introduced us to local food, customs, events and people. He is interesting and entertaining to talk to, so spending four days with him was a pleasure. As for the tour and the bikes: Thai makes sure his bikes are good. He buys them new and changes them after a year or so, so they are in good condition. We didn't have any problems at all. He rides at your pace and makes sure everything is fine. My husband is an experienced biker but it was my first time on a proper road trip (I haven't yet passed my Mod 1) but I always felt safe and happy. And the trip itself was fab! Loads of beautiful scenery to be wowed at (though longer trips will show you more amazing stuff - we're hoping to come back and do a longer one taking in Sa Pa). The two homestays were really cool. So all in all, brilliant!

Everything you want from a bike tour and more!. I travelled to Hanoi as a solo traveller after leaving my friend in Da Nang.I felt lost at what to do when I arrived in Hanoi, as I love to go on tours/ trips off the beaten bath, to see things most tourists won't get to see and I was on my own, which made me feel less adventurous.Thankfully I bumped into Go Bamboos office in Hanoi central and arranged a one day motor bike tour and was given the experience of my life!The motor bike was clean, safe and in excellent condition. My guide Nguyen (Thai) spoke amazing English and gave me a real view of what it is like to live in Vietnam, along with an insight into the history and culture.After the one day tour, I booked a half day tour of Hanoi as I was flying back to the U.K in the afternoon, Thai tailored a tour to suit my needs, requirements and time frame and was yet again a perfect tour and experience.Vietnam has so much to offer, I will definitely be booking a 2-3 week tour with Thai in the next 12 months as I feel safe and secure in the knowledge that I am being taken care of by a good and trustworthy person who has exceptional knowledge of the History of Vietnam, 16 years of experience of taking tourists on long tours, a very good command of the English language and a good team of professional tour guides.I would strongly recommend Go Bamboo to anybody!

Best motor tour ever!. I'm a Vietnamese but never been in Northern part especially places in the mountains! We took the trip to Dien Bien Phu, our tour guide was so fun, great stop over! So enjoyable holiday!!!!

Just do it, you won't regret it. Touring by motorcycle with Go Bamboo is one of the great experiences in my life. Incredible scenery, incredible people, incredible experiences. The guide was pretty bloody funny & we had no dramas or issues. He knew all the good roads. Set a great itinerary with good mix between riding & resting & sight seeing. I cannot pick any negatives at all. Highly highly recommended. I cannot wait to go again to a different region.

Amazing bike tour. I went into this tour not knowing what to expect but had a blast, honestly the most fun thing we did while we were here. We took the one day tour that went to the Pagoda and the national park, both places were beautiful and well worth the climb up.Alan who was our tour guide spoke excellent English and was hilarious, him and the other driver on our tour made for an excellent experience Definitely check it out !

awesome ride of north vietnam. awesome 1500 kilometre ride of northern Vietnam . i hit the lon (pig) and the lon won . our guide was very good with first aid , and did not charge for damage to the bike , highly recommended

Go Bamboo!. We had the best times of our lives on these scooters :) Amazing bikes! Great service and so reliable! No problems with them at all and we travelled the whole of Vietnam on these. I can really recommend this company :)

The best Vietnam experience!. After reading all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor we dropped by the office in Hanoi. Immediately we've got a warm welcome by Thai, the owner of GoBamboo. Initially we wanted to do a one day bike tour, but Thai convinced us to do a two day tour, we would see a lot more of the countryside and spend a night in a homestay. We agreed and two days later we went! Our guide was Hoan, young, enthusiastic and really nice and attentive! He knew a lot of great backroads and took us to some amazing places with beautiful views. I could't wish for a better way to spend the two days. The homestay we spent the night was great, we got delicious food, they cooked a special vegetarian meal for us. Big thanks to Hoan and Thai, thanks for having us and giving us such a wonderful time!

GoBamboo bike trip!B-) . A wonderful experience, wonderful welcome, wonderful people Thai and his family. Ive been to Hanoi before but this time I was put on adventure mode from day one. I did a seven day trip solo with my guide and friend Hoan (Ho me do) great guyB-) from Hanoi to Sapa and back. We had a little rain for the first few days, exciting stuff! This rates up there with the best things I've done in my life and I would recommend it to anyone, young or old, I am 55 years young and i had not rode a bike for thirty years. I'm back in Birmingham U.K. now and maybe its time to dust off the old leathers. Can't wait to see the guys again B-) GoBambooP.S. You guys always have a bed in Birmingham!

Perfect. I don't ride a motorbike so I went as a pillion and a the most fantastic experience! I was fortunate enough to have the owner of the business himself take me on a half day tour through the countryside around Hanoi. Thai was the perfect guide, very knowledgeable and informative and dedicated to running an excellent business. He is a ver experienced rider, I felt very safe and I understand he expects the same of all his staff. Thinking of a bike tour in Vietnam? Don't choose any other company!

Fantastic day out of the city!. Great motorbike experience to take us out of the hustle and bustle of Hanoi's city streets. The guide, Thai, and the other driver, Hun, we're both excellent. We were both inexperienced riders and we went as passengers on the back of the two guides' bikes. We were accompanied by another experienced couple who drove themselves. We all had an excellent day and were treated to the delights of Vietnam's stunning scenery. Although busy getting out of the city, we always felt safe and secure on the back of the bikes. Once in the countryside, we could really appreciate all that Vietnam has to offer. Thai spoke excellent English and accompanied us on the boat trip in Ninh Binh which was part of the tour. Returned to Hanoi feeling exhilarated and filled with great memories. One of our favourite days in Vietnam so far-I would definitely recommend Go Bamboo, Thai and Hun.

Our Best Day in Hanoi - None of us can ride bikes. There are a lot of motorbike tour opperators in Hanoi and we only had one day spare so we did a bit of research the night before. Very happy we did!Thai was the manager and owner of Go Bamboo, he responded to our enquiry in minutes and from the start wanted to know everything he could about what would make a day trip perfect for us. We were impressed, headed to his office in old town and were greeted with complimentary tea, brochures and testimonials. I believe we were lucky to catch Thai in person as he also offers bike tours of Vietnam, Cambodia and Loas (if you have the time and money then I syeongly urge you to email him about it). However, the office was manned constantly by a friendly crew who also spoke English so you will always be in good hands.Our group was comprised of seven people who couldn't ride bikes. Not a problem, Thai got us all drivers with only a few hours notice. Some couldn't speak English so Thai organised games and funny group photos at our first cafe stop off so that we could all get to know each other. We loved it. One young driver loved Eminem, as did one of our group members, so we had to endure hilarious rap battles at every stop. You can choose to be picked up from hotel or start from their office. You can also choose your own timetable. We left at 8am to cram in as much as possible and returned before dark.The day tour is customizable but we wanted to see villages and mountains. Thai took us to a national park which has stunning views (and a short but hearty climb at the end). We stopped in a beautiful town on the way with an acient pergola for drinks. Thai gave us history and cultural lessons at most stops which was excellent and unexpected. Lunch was included in the price and was very good, more than we could eat.The only negative was that one of the bikes had issues trying to asscend the mountain. This was our own fault, had we booked earlier we would have avoided a few older bikes (which we had been warned of prior). However, Thai organised for two mechanics with tools to be drivers so we were back on the road in no time. Outstanding day trip and highly recommended.

7 days, 7 bikes , 700 kilometers at least!. We rented 7 bikes and rode throughout Northern Vietnam to Diem Bien Phu and Sapa just to name a couple of stops. The motorbikes were in excellent shape with no issues, mechanical or otherwise.They will even help you with the logistics of your trip if you go it alone. We had it arranged to have the bikes placed on the train; we picked them up in a small town about 4 hrs. outside of Hanoi.We had no problems at all. We were given a couple of spare tubes, just in case.This is a first rate operation; they will even provide you with helmets.Kudos to Go Bamboo Trek Motor Bike Tour.

It was great experience in Hanoi.. First of all, thanks to Thai that give us the chance to have a great experience of the other side of Vietnam.I was so sad that we had only 1 day trip. I definitely will arrange another trip to join Gobamboo Trek!!!Wish you a good luck and see you soon.

There is no better way to explore this beautiful country. I went on an amazing motorbike tour of northwest Vietnam with Thai! My two friends and I met Thai in the summer of 2011. Thai was very professional throughout the entire planning process, and he organized a 5 day tour starting in Hanoi, through Mai Chau, Son La, Dien Bien Phu, Tam Duong, Lai Chau, Sapa, and finally Lao Cai. I had ridden a scooter before, but never a full manual bike. The first day we met Thai, he arranged for us to get our bikes, and we learned to ride in Hanoi. Learning to ride in Hanoi rush hour traffic was one of the most stressful and exhilarating experiences of my life, but I nevertheless got the hang of it. It was at least enough to leave Hanoi the next day and make it to the rice field valleys in Mai Chau. I really couldn't describe to you in words the awesome scenery and the places we stayed. Just google these cities... Despite not knowing initially how to ride a bike, I felt quite safe with Thai guiding us. The food stops we made, the hotels/guesthouses we stayed at, while not 5-star at every destination, were nevertheless beautiful and inspiring. That being said, some hotels were very nice. I felt like I got a candid view of Vietnam, rather than the touristy crap one experiences in a large city. The roads aren't always paved, my friends and I slipped once or twice, but it was part of the grand experience for us. If you are at all considering visiting Vietnam and if you have the slightest inkling of an adventurous spirit, I urge you to contact Thai and speak with him. While he may have started as our personal tour guide of Vietnam (he knows the country like the back of his hand), we became great friends by the end of the trip and still talk. I reminisce about this experience the most of any of my travels. Do yourself a favor and explore Vietname on a motorcycle with Thai. It will change your life.
Bike rental. Been renting a motorbike off thai for the past month, pretty much brand new bike, never had any problems. Deffently recommend renting a bike off him if you go to Hanoi!

2nd time round equally as good as first. This is the 2nd time we have used Thai and Go Bamboo and once again Thai met all our expectations.This time Thai had an active part in our whole trip to Hanoi. He arranged our visa letters for us, picked us up at the airport, arranged for us to stay in the Gondola hotel which is in an excellent location to the old quarter and even gave us an impromptu walking tour of the old quarter on our arrival.Our previous tour of Northwest Vietnam was by motorcycle and arranged by Thai, this time our wish was to tour Northeast Vietnam by car - whilst Thai specialises in motorcycle hire and tours this was not a problem and he arrange for us to have a very adequate car, driver and himself as guide.His knowledge and love for his country is very evident from the start, he arranges excellent accommodation (just loved the homestays), helps to choose a variety of local dishes to eat whist being conscientious of dietary needs and likes at mealtimes. He is happy to stop at every request to take photos and usually knows where the best views are to be found.If you choose to tour the Northern regions of Vietnam be it East or West be prepared for an adventure - be open minded about being outside your comfort zone, don't expect 5* accommodation DO expect the most stunning scenery, the change to "mingle" with minority people and to be blown away by the way they liveWe had an amazing time and certainly will not hesitate to make it "three in a row" should we visit again - thank you again Thai it was fabulous

Very tidy bikes. Lots of choice, sorted us out very quickly, extremely good English, put up with our crappy Vietnamese. Bikes in very good nick, lots to choose from, from scooters to dirt bikes. Much better looking bikes than the one just down the road that claims to be the provider for the Top Gear Vietnam special.Be aware that they like to charge full days for part days. e.g. 12 noon to 12 noon the next day, 2 days charge. He dropped the extra charge though, as I didn't think that was fair. Charged 3 days for 72 hours hire. (I think he wanted a good TripAdvisor review!)

Motorbike rental to go to nw vietnam. The motorbike (automatic one) was perfect for the 7days tour to north west from Hanoi! Absolutly none problem! Before departure, thaitinh advised us for the schedule to follow to be on Time in lau cai for the train which had been réserved by himselfIt was So simple !! Know mains Town where to stop - contact to drop off the motorbike in laucai - méga confort bed in the train! We recommand his agency at 20000% !! Thanks again thaitinh!

Amazing experience. A perfect experience for adventure seekers looking to get away from the tourist scene and see the beautiful countryside of Vietnam. In addition to miles of beautiful scenery this trip gives you the opportunity to interact with the locals throughout the countryside and learn about their culture and way of life. Also the food is fantastic throughout the trip. I did a five day ride to Sapa. I recommend spending a night a Dien Bien Phu as the city and war museum offer an in depth look to Vietnam's struggle for independence and how that influenced modern day life in this country. Thai is a wonderful tour guide, filled with knowledge and expertise about riding motor cycles, Vietnamese culture and tourism. Thus, Thai plays several roles for those interested in traveling to Vietnam, including tour guide, travel agent, and general adviser. He is worth contacting if you are traveling to northern Vietnam even if you are not interested in a motor cycle trek as he can point you in the right direction for places to stay, tour groups to use, and even make the bookings if you want. Prior motorcycle experience is not necessary, though as someone who never rode a motor cycle before doing this trek, I recommend practicing in your home country before you arrive in Vietnam. All in all this trip was a fantastic experience and was worth every penny.

Northern Vietnam frontier visit with Go Bamboo Trek . If like us you are looking for a great adventure and are confident travellers but still appreciate the security that a good guide can give you I would throughly recommend Go Bamboo Trek and Thai our guide. We travelled for five nights and six days around Meo Vac , Don Van and Ha Giang with the highlight of driving and walking through the Ma Pi Leng pass in the frontier. Being in our fifties we chose to travel by car instead of bikes and for us it was the right thing although progress on some of the mountain roads was slow. The scenery was amazing and we could stop whenever we wanted and in extremely picturesque areas we often walked through rice paddies and farms met and interacted with the minority people and were able to observe their customs first hand. We were travelling in an area where permits and visa were needed and our Gide sorted all this for us as he did our home stay accommodation. This was fantastic for us eating together and often all sleeping together in the same room in little cubicles separated by beautiful curtains. Only do this trip if you are looking for and willing to take part in the Northern Vietnam experience. We are what the locals ate because there was nothing else. Again our guide helped us through a strange mix of different dishes. It's important to remember that we were quite an attraction to many of the people we saw with numerous photo stops for them to pose with us. With our input our trip was arranged and organised very efficiently by Thai to give us the experience we wanted in an area where in the six days we only saw a handful of western travellers. I am 100 % convinced that if we were travelling without our guide we would have missed most of the most memorable sights views and tastes of the trip. To conclude I would suggest planning your trip with Thai well in advance and let him know what type of experiences you want then like us you won't be disappointed.

Motor bike tour NW Vietnam. Our experience with Gobambootrek started with great pre tour online contact with Thaitinh's so that visa on arrival formalities were sorted. Working in the travel industry, our request for an authentic Vietnamese experience was certainly met. A variety of local cuisine, accommodation and traffic/roads ensured a great adventure, though not for the feint hearted. The motorbikes were all in very good condition and organisation meant a hassle free trip. Thaitinh's and his wife Lien were excellent company and great embassadors for their country.

Amazing!. I can not speak highly enough about Go Bamboo Trek. I wish TripAdvisor had a rating above excellent.A very unique experience that each of our group thoroughly enjoyed. Thai is a fantastic guide and could not have done more to help us. Even planning lovely ways to celebrate our birthdays. Thai's wife even joined our trip and she is the most beautiful woman going out of her way to ensure we were well fed and comfortable (so much wonderful food).The homestays are a great experience - a nice way to enjoy time with Vietnamese local people and get away from tourist crowds. Motorbikes are surely the only way to see Vietnam.We are already planning our next adventure with Go Bamboo Trek.

Go Bamboo. A friend in Hanoi put us in contact with Thai Tinh, the owner-operator of this tour company. We had an amazing five day motorcycle tour of Northern and Central Vietnam with Thai. I could not recommend Thai highly enough and look forward to my next tour.

10 days in the mountains of northern Viatnam. Thanks Thai Tinh for an amazing ride through the mountains of Northern Vietnam. Thai was a great guide to travel with, he knew the road, the area, where to stay, where to eat even where to pull over for the best photo. He was very professional and fun the be with. He was always looking out for our best interest and making sure that the trip was everything it could be with our interests in mind.Thanks again Thai, we'll keep in touch and will be back!!!

Great motorbike trip . We heard of Go Bamboo online and when in Hanoi we went in to visit, and glad we did! Thai and the team at Go Bamboo were happy to help us organise a self guided trip through the North East of Vietnam and also took us on a practise tour of a village just North of Hanoi before we started our trip. During our week up North Thai was easy to contact and helped us over the phone with any direction or accommodation advice. it was great to feel comfortable driving long days through amazing scenery knowing that if we needed accommodation when we stopped we would have help to organise it! The bikes were reliable and Go Bamboo was awesome to organise through!

Gobambootrek. I visit Vietnam frequently and have been on trips with gobambootrek a few times now and i can only say great things about this tour company. Thai Tinh and his wife are great people and i can highly recommend Gobambootrek to anyone who wants to experience Vietnam.i am looking forward to my next adventure there.

Amazing Motorbike Tour. The Tourguide Thai and me spent three great days in the Mountains around Mai Chau on Motorbikes. He got me in contact with the locals and introduced me to the Vietnamese culture. Exploring the country on a bike is highly recommended. The people will welcome you with great kindness. As an Mechanical Engineer and passionate Biker I can tell that Thais bikes are in a very good condition. With Thai as a Guide you can expect a save trip and definetly no scams!!! He is a very nice guy who really wants to offer a great time to his customers. In the end we became friends and after the trip we spend some leisure time together in Hanoi.

An Awesome Adventure in Northern Vietnam. We rode in a group of four riders with Thai through much of Northern Vietnam. The roads, scenery, food, people and experience were fantastic. Thai is a very experienced guide and he kept us on solid ground at every turn. Through single-lane roads, goat trails (complete with real goats), and villages along the way Thai was always prepared for whatever came next. Our trip to Vietnam really demonstrated why our friends say that a trip with Thai is like a trip with a friend through their hometown. Thai loves his country as much as he loves riding with new friends and showing them the best of Northern Vietnam. We heartily recommend his services.

highly recommended scooter rental in ha noi. if you´re looking for trustworthy rental service in ha noi go bamboo is a good place to go.i stayed overnight across the street at dragons hotel and was delighted by friendly and easygoing services of thai´s rental business. if you´re familiar with scooter driving have a try in ha noi. best way to get around - if you´re confident with you drinving skils (go easy that way you see more).

A good man and a good tour guide!. I've known Thai for 4 years now, I met him when I first arrived in Hanoi, and throughout the two years I lived there, he has always been a good, reliable person and friend. He even helped me navigate the difficult process of buying a motorbike in Vietnam! You will have a good time on his tours too, he is very knowledgeable, and understands Western culture well!
Memorable fun trip with an outstanding guide. Thanks to Thai Tin we had an unforgettable time in Vietnam. If it wouldn't be so far away we would come back every year.

We had sore mouths from Smiling!. My husband and I did a 2 day bike tour with Thai our guide in 2013 .This truly was the asian experience that I had always dreamt of.We really did have sore mouths from smiling lol.The scenery , the people and Thai were all amazing. To get out of the city and explore with a guide who seemed to know exactly what we wanted was truly something we will never forget.We have promised we will be back to join Thai on another adventure,this time for longer.Cant wait!

Unforgettable motorbike tour of northern Vietnam. My friend and I did a 12 day motorbike tour of northern Vietnam in 2011 with Thai from Go Bamboo trek. Thai personalised the itinerary for us, taking us on a spectacular route from the west to the east of northern Vietnam - allowing us to fully experience the diverse landscapes, people, food and cultures of Vietnam. Thai is a champion - an exceptional host and guide! We always felt like our comfort and safety was a priority. We broke up long days on the bike with numerous coffee breaks, taking advantage of amazing photo opportunities and visiting markets. Of an evening, the food and accommodation that Thai organised was simple, authentic and clean and often allowed us to chat with our hosts or socialise with the local people. Unwinding of an evening with a beer, having a laugh and talking about the day we had was just brilliant! Northern Vietnam, particularly Ha Giang province, is one of the most beautiful places in the world. Traveling here by motorbike is an experience you will never forget. I highly recommend Go Bamboo for anyone looking for a unique and truly unforgettable experience. Thanks for the memories, Thai!

Amazing trip with Go Bamboo Trek. Having done an incredible 2 day motorbike trek with Go Bamboo to Mao Chau about 4 weeks ago (which featured a very picturesque homestay in the countryside & traditional dancing for which the whole village attended!), I had no choice but to ask for a 10 day motorbike tour from Hanoi to Nha Chang.I happened across the shop after my friend's pedal bike's wheel fell off, which they were more than happy to help fix on the spot! I was also fixed up with a SIM card and a great coffee... perfect!Put simply, my tours have been amongst the best experiences of my life. I couldn't think of a better way to see Vietnam and wouldn't dream of booking with anyone other than the team at Go Bamboo.The locations we've visited have been breathtaking, and I've learnt a lot about the true history, culture and language of Vietnam from my guide and the locals we st along the way.Starting in Hanoi, we visited the Angel Fish stream in Cam Thui, then Tan Kay, after which we stopped at Phong Nha National Park to check out the beautiful caves. We then made our way to the War Memorial, a very peaceful area dedicated to the memory of women who lost their lives. Other highlights included exploring the tunnels of Vinh Moc, riding down the beaches of the east coast, the beautiful city of Hue, and finally ending in Nha Trang.They also arranged a tour to Halong Bay and Cat Ba Island which was brilliant & without complaint.I have had an incredible time in Vietnam, largely thanks to Go Bamboo, and would highly recommend them to anyone for tours, motorbike trips (no matter what your skill level) and coffee in Hanoi!

North Vietnam. I was on a solo motorcycle trip in Northern Vietnam when I met Thai and his Australian friend ( I was lost). I followed them for three days and had a great time. He is a great friend and guide, I learned alot during these days. I can without a doubt highly recommend him to anyone that are going to Vietnam. Thanks Thai.
Fabulous trip down the Ho Chi Min Trail by motor scooter. This was my first trip to Vietnam in 2014 for two weeks. Great food, Thai was a super guide and host. I would travel again with Bamboo Trek!

Most memorable days of our backpacking trip in SEA. Our 2011 trip to SEA would not have been as memorable if not for Thai and our motorcycle trek through Northern Vietnam. Quite frankly one of the best weeks of my life. A fantastic tour guide, organizer, planner, and friend. Thai and I still keep in touch after all these years! Without a doubt, his trips are highly highly recommended

rất tốt ... Very good trip with Thai. Great trip with Thai, after be-friending Mr Thai Thinh @ Bia Hoi cnr Luong Ngoc Quyen and Ta Hien, we planned a trip together for when my father and sister arrived from Fremantle, W.A. Australia. Great Experience through many regions of the mid and north parts of Vietnam, many small tiny little rocky and bumpy roads we navigated ourselves through on this bike trip with Luisa taking care of the old Russian MNSK bike Thai with Mike on the back of his scooter, and Meagan on the back of mine we traversed through Hanoi down to Thanh Hoa, Ninh Binh, and up to Sapa right to the china border. Great experience, story's, and memory's from this trip. Music, RIce wine, muddy puddles, heavy downpours, dancing, laughing, trekking, joking, and history, culture all to be expected from a holiday adventure with GO Bamboo!!!

Superb experience with Thai, year after year.. My first trip to Vietnam in 2012 I chose GoBambooTrek's Thai to be my guide based on his excellent trip advisor.com reviews and also based on his timely and detailed responses to my emails. Much trust was invested in this new relationship from the beginning and the rewards have paid dividends year after year with Thai. He is a good man, reliable, knowledgeable, and patient. As a woman traveling on my own, I was always grateful to have Thai protecting me and looking out for me. I returned to Hanoi in 2013 with a buddy and Thai led us on a ten day motorcycle tour of the North-East of Vietnam. We had a fantastic adventure with Thai seeing local people, waterfalls, and outer worldly scenery. Everything is made so easy with Thai handling all of the hotel logistics and meal ordering and payments. I would never do a trip to Vietnam without my good friend Thai. He puts his whole heart into his work. He is a beautiful person. It is an honor to have such a wonderful local guide.

Wonderful time in Hanoi with Thai. Thai and his wife made our trip to Hanoi - they took us places we would never have seen, we ate food we would never have eaten and we learnt the history of this amazing people - and he is a great shopper - gives excellent fashion advice and if you asked "do I look fat in this" and if I did - he would say "yes" ! Great for translating with tailors and knows the best seamstresses in Hanoi.

five day tour, highlight of our trip. We did a five day tour with Thai from Go bamboo. We went from Hanoi up to Sapa, Thai had everything planned, we saw absolutely amazing scenery and met some lovely people. Thai ensured we stopped whenever we wished for photo opportunities, of which there was many. We crossed hanging bridges and visited small villages staying in stilted houses with local minority families. We are now planning another trip with Thai, this time to North East Vietnam and look forward to travelling with him next May

Bike Trip north vietnam. Me and my friend were doing a motorbike trip in north vietnam for a whole month, and its hard to find the best words for it... cause awesome or "decent" dont really fit :DIt's just impressive if you see those mountains, waterfalls, those lakes and villages with your own eyes and meet these incredibly nice people of vietnams countryside !I think you can really notice the shop-owner "Thai" is coming from one of those villages. He and the others are really relaxed and helpful, they arent pushing you to buy buy and buy l(like a lot of people in the capital); -they are just there to help you out for any kind of questions. When I needed help on my trip (also in Hanoi) they've been there to help me. They took their time to get a plan for me and my friend where to go in vietnam and which spots to see (without even asking for any money :O! ) and after an hour or 2 at smoothies and beer, we had the best travel-guide possible, with numbers of cheap homestays and everything !also you get quality food for really good prizesI recommend to all my friends who travel to vietnam, to jump in at Go Bamboo, have and have a chat with honest Vietnameese people who speak great english. If you dont know for 110% what exactly you want to do in vietnam, go there, and you'll find out.(if you do have a plan already go there and get a better one haha)It'y definitely worth the visit, just spend some good time with good people.

Hanoi - City Tour and Waterpuppet - Halong Bay. This is the "guy" when it comes to good planned trips and tours! Here we talking à la Carte tourism. You name what You expect! And You will get it and some more!If You want to coustomize Your stay. Contact Bamboo!Everyone was very pleased. We was 6 persons. Age 14, 16, 39, 41, 51, 69. All was pleased during the whole concept and how it was managed. From Airport pic-up to hotels and tours all the way back to the airport last day! Can only highly recomend!

Excellent way to experience North Vietnam. I enjoyed a 6-day trip through the Northwest Loop with Taitinh / gobambootrek.com . It was one of the greatest travel experiences I have ever had.Taitinh is clearly experienced: he has taken this trip over a hundred times. While not cheap (by Viet Nam standards... very reasonable by Western standards) I had the luxury of having TT as my personal guide. He is very friendly, knowledgeable, and offers great insight into what you see: everything from history, to spiritual life, to geographical knowledge. The trip becomes a lens through which one can learn about the country as a whole.The trip was a "complete package deal" with TT organizing every aspect and providing all materials. As someone who has never ridden a motorbike, I had requested a lesson before we set off. TT promised one, but it never happened, which made the first trip in the rain, through Hanoi traffic, a little trial-by-fire. At the end of the first night, I was offered a chance to see a "traditional indigenous show" which, though good, cost me the full $75 as I was the only person in the tour group! In retrospect, I probably wouldn't have done this again.Those two things aside, the trip was amazing, and TT a great guide. I would definitely recommend him to others, and will travel with him again the next time I go to Viet Nam.

10 day Northwest dirt bike trip. just got back from Hanoi after an amazing 10 day ride to the far North and West of the countryrode with good bikes from Go Bamboo, and an excellent guide (Hue) who took us on every off road track he could find.as all 4 of us are experienced dirt bike riders we demanded as much off the beaten path as possible and were not disappointedstayed mainly at homestays, great scenery and one of the most fun rides I have done in SE Asia, and I've done plentygoing back for more soonRod

paloma girls and guide were excellent.highlight of our time in Hanoi. we loved the whole evening. really friendly bike girls who spoke drove fantastically, great english. guide was really knowledgable, loved the entire experience. food stunning, loved the visit to the jazz club and flower market' great introduction to Hanoi.

Great way to see Hanoi on limited time frame!. I was in Hanoi for a business trip, and wanted to explore the city in a couple of hours. I bought this tour because I wanted the experience from a motorbike, which is one of the most popular methods of commuting around the city. The tour was a little expensive for my budget; however, I was able to fit many activities in a few hours! We had Vietnamese coffee, and then drove to different places around the city. My tour guide Linh was very nice and knowledgably about Vietnam. The bikes are very safe. This is a great tour for someone with time constraints!

Motorbike food tour. The ride around the city starting from the Old Quarter, stopped by a local cafe for the egg coffee; though the coffee was too sweet and creamy to my liking , it was a great experience. Then my wonderful and friendly guide Ha Trang took me to several historical sites and building. We also enjoyed a delicious local lunch at Bia Hoi Restaurant near the West Lake. Thanks Trang for such a wonderful n unique experience I had around the city !

Only way to see Hanoi. Booked this tour for the first day in Hanoi and had a great time. Our riders Linh Vu and Giang were wonderful and made us feel welcome from the get go. Linh Vu is a great tour guide and had some fantastic tips for the rest of our week in Hanoi. I think this is the best way to get your bearings in Hanoi and if you're lucky enough to get Linh and or Giang you're well on your way for a great time.

Brilliant!!!. I was very unsure about taking part in this experience, but I was so glad I did it was brilliant. Excellent organisation, Wonderful team of female drivers and team leader. My driver was Ruby and she was just lovely, very helpful, attentive and a pleasure too meet and get to know.We were 2 couple that are middle aged and it was something I would recommend anyone to do.Fabulous experience and I would have the Paloma Female Motorbike Team Tours every time.Brilliant Girls!!!

Last night in Hanoi. The mototbike tour was a great way to finish out trip to Hanoi. The motorbike ride was great fun and we felt safe with our drivers. Thanks to everyone in the group being locals we got to try some new dishes we hadn't tried before and everything was delicious! They also showed us the original café Hanoi egg coffee was first made in and we'll miss it a lot back in the UK! Besides seeing some more landmarks it's a great chance to find out more about the culture and the people. We'd definitely recommend it!

Last minute tour with a great ending. . I booked this tour with less than 24 hours notice. I wanted to see Hanoi from the vantage point of a local - a scooter. Nhung met me at my hotel and didn't disappoint. She cheerfully expertly maneuvered me through Hanoi traffic to sites I wanted to see. And we ended with a great meal of bun cha. A great way to spend a Sunday morning! On another note I also really appreciated Paloma's offer of a self created tour.

Breakfast Tour. First morning and excellent start - Good morning Vietnam! Exhilarating weaving through the crazy traffic - taking in the sights of this amazing city. Safe drivers, knowledge, friendly guides. Delicious food. Highly recommend.

Amazing motor scooter adventures. Spent half a day cruising Hanoi traffic, drinking egg coffee (a must for coffee lovers). Lee and Anna were incredibly helpful and had incredible English. They were so enthusiastic it made us want to stay and experience more. Highly recommend this tour...

First Night in Vietnam. What a wonderful way to start our time in Hanoi. Trang (my rider) was wonderful. Confident manoeuvring amongst crazy traffic. Funny and very open talking about her life and culture. Mark our host was great. Both had a good level of English. Egg coffee to die for. Food was freshest and most flavoursome have had so far (now five days in). And finishing at jazz club an unexpected bonus. Would highly recommend as a must do activity.

Amazing and breathtaking sights. Had an awesome tour with paloma. Brought us to areas with deep war history. Went to have some food. Great experience overall. Definitely worth it. Best 4 hours spent in Hanoi.

Half Day Tour with kids. It was a great half-day tour. Mark was an excellent guide and kept things interesting for my two boys. Although I would have liked to see more museums my children definitely would not have. So the blend of food and sites was perfect. I also must mention the girls who drove us were amazing, navigating the traffic and we always felt safe.

Hanoi by night with Paloma Motorbike Tours. I had the greatest adventure in Hanoi thanks to Linh from Paloma Motorbike Tours.I booked a night tour and it was one of the best ways to see how Hanoi comes alive on a Friday night. I began my adventure in the French quarter where Linh expertly navigated through Hanoi’s peak hour traffic to have a light refreshment. Drink of choice was between an egg coffee and something akin to a green tea smoothie. I choose the green tea smoothie and it was delicious. We had a great chat with Linh and I got to know more about the Vietnamese culture.We then travelled along Long Bien Bridge where we stopped to take in the sites and take a few photos. I got to see Hoan Kiem Lake and enjoyed one of the best dinners at a local restaurant in Hanoi’s Old Quarter. The service was quick, atmosphere electric and the food bursting with the most amazing flavours. After a hearty dinner we were back on the scooter where I got to appreciate some of Hanoi’s historical buildings. I was fortunate enough to witness the march at the Ho Chi Minh complex and it was amazing.Westlake was glittering with the city lights and despite the hustle and bustle of Hanoi we were able to enjoy a peaceful moment.We travelled via the night market to the Binh Minh Club where I had the pleasure of enjoying live Jazz music.The last stop of the evening was the Opera house.What made my adventure truly spectacular was Linh. Not only did she ensure my safety but it felt like a long time friend was giving me the tour. Linh’s very knowledgeable about Hanoi and Vietnam’s history and I loved her passion.I would highly recommend Linh and Paloma Motorbike tours to my family, friends and anyone wanting to experience the beauty that is Hanoi.

4 Hours Private Motorbike Tour. We did a private bike tour on 2 Days ago. It was an awesome experience! Our guide Linh Vu and her colleague was so experience and accommodating to our request. Without them, we would not be able to cover so many tourist attractions on our own. They brought us for some very nice local dessert and food which we would not have done it on our own and even help us get the things we wanted to buy. Overall the 4 hours was amazingly thrilling on the bike and a great experience which I will definitely recommend to my friends!

Favourite Part of our Trip!. We saw a group of matching scoters parked outside a hotel one evening with a group of ladies in matching traditional outfits. Just had to ask them what was what. That's how we found out about this fantastic tour company. Went back to our hotel that evening and booked them for the next morning. We chose the customized tour since we had already seen most of the 'must see' sights and wanted to have a more local experience. Linh and Coco (?) met us at the hotel at 9 the next morning and we came up with a plan for the day. They took us through some lovely neighborhoods, over the famous bridge, past the Ho Chi Minh park (which they knew was closed for maintenance and that the body was away in Moscow for 'maintenance') unlike our hotel staff. Linh then suggested the Museum of Ethnology (?) which was lovely and she was a great guide. Her love for the museum and her country's history was very apparent. Their English was fantastic and I even got to practice my Mandarin a bit with Coco as she had spent a year in China. We also requested some Pho and coffee and so they took us to some great local spots...both were absolutely delicious. My friend was extremely nervous of the traffic but Linh quickly put her at ease and we both enjoyed the trip enormously. Without a doubt my favourite part of our trip to Hanoi and would definitely recommend it to anyone. Great for seeing the usual spots but even better to get off the tourist trail and see some genuine Hanoi neighbourhoods. Thanks so much!

Novel way to experience Hanoi. Linh and her guides were great - we always felt safe on the bikes and they took us to places we'd never have ventured to on our own. They could even accommodate special dietary needs for the dinner portion. Highly recommended!

Paloma Motorbike Tour - Hanoi. We did a personalised bike tour of Hanoi. It was a half day tour which was the perfect length as we saw many of the city sights and enjoyed 2 meals with our tour guide and drivers. I would highly recommend using Paloma.

Girls on wheels!!. This was our second trip with Linh and Nhung from Paloma motorbike tours. This time we focussed on art galleries, special shopping and local food. We went to some lovely galleries including the Manzi art gallery. We spent a great time at the Chula shop. Amazing clothes, fab host. Lastly we had street food to die for!!! Amazing. Linh made sure that everything was perfect. She even took my allergies into account. Definitely give these guys a try. If we were here just a bit longer we would have gladly gone out with them again.

Utterly Brilliant !!. Having spent the first 48 hours nervously crossing the road in Hanoi - we entered the fray courtesy of the expert motor biking skills of Linh and Nhung - what an amazing experience -one of the best tourist things I have ever done !!In addition to their biking skills -Linh is an accomplished tour guide with great English and made our tour so enjoyable. We chose the tailor made tour and loved it so much we're going to do it again !! This time street food and shopping !
Excellent. Both Riders were very safe and talked alot about Hanoi and its history. Its a great ride around the city see lots.

An amazing way to see the sights. We saw the sights of Hanoi with Linh and her crew on the back of motorbikes. We did a private tour for our family - 2 adults, 2 kids. We were allowed to personalise the tour - see the sights we wanted and flexible start time. We all had the best day - the hosts were knowledgeable and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. A fantastic way to sight see, fantastic value for money and I totally recommend Paloma!!

Good way to see the sights of Hanoi. My friends had a fun time touring around Hanoi just like the locals. Our drivers were all lovely and very friendly. They shared with us lots of facts and information. They accomadte to your interests and made sure you were happy with your experience. We enjoyed stopping for refreshments and sampling Vietnamese food and coffee. Thank Paloma Bike tours especially LiLi and her colleagues.
Great motorbike tour!. We enjoyed the motorbike ride. Felt save at all times. Really good tour guide. Money well spent.....
City tour with Ling. Really informative, Ling spoke very well about history, habits, historic places, food and she drives her motorbike very well.

Palomar tours hanoi. I had a lovely guide called ling who took me on a scooter tour around Hanoi. She took me for egg coffee which was really delicious. She took me on a tour to places I hadn't seen before. Her English was excellent. I felt very safe riding on the scooter with her. Was an excellent tour.

Same Same, but Different. Trang (Sarah) and Nga (Gabby) did a wonderful job of showing us all of the same same Hanoi sights in an incredibly different way. We were able to customize our private tour to include everything that we wanted and they also added in some great stops to try some of the local delicacies and cuisine. We always felt safe in the potentially hazardous sea of motorbikes. Their English was good and their attitude was great. I'm still not sure how two people can smile for 5 straight hours. Overall, we highly recommend.
Absolutely brilliant . Great fun, very informative and lovely stuff! The best way to explore Hanoi and mingle with locals and experience the proper Vietnamese hospitality. Can't wait to do it again.

Fantastic Tour. What a fantastic tour. The food was delicious and exceptional, the ride safe and secure, and the location and knowledge of our tour guide made this an absolute joy. Do yourself a favour and take this tour, you will not regret it.

Great Tour. Had a fantastic experience on the tour. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to get to see Hanoi and its rich heritage. Our tour guide, Linh was great at providing so much information about Hanoi and was a lot of fun. My driver, Huyen was skilled at navigating the city and was very nice. This was one of my very favorite events for my Hanoi trip and I would do it again.

Canadian Seniors' First Time In Vietnam. Awesome!!! Fabulous service, very knowledgable and went over and above expectations. We highly recommend their service. They are also very good motorcycle riders :)))

Paloma Bike Tour. Our hostess Linh and her assistants Trang and Ngau were fabulous.Linh's knowledge of the history of Hanoi was exceptional. She asked where our interests were, then planned the tour around what and where we were interested to go.Our safety and comfort was a priority to her.It was the highlight of our 3 day Hanoi adventure. She took us to neighbourhoods that we would have never experienced in any other type of tour. Linh is a wonderful tour guide and we would highly recommend her and Paloma Bike Tours.

take the chance. Great experience. Wanted to see the city like a local. Took the motorbike tour from our hotel all through town. The guide was great, my driver, Ruby, was very knowledgeable and friendly. Food, drinks, snack s were all included inn the price. Went to some local restaurants, food was good, coffee great, the company was also very enjoyable. Personalised attention was also great. I will definitely do this again if i get to come back. I've been to Hanoi before but i was able to see more of the city this way and was able to experience the motorbike first hand. Great experience will do it again.
Girl power. Excellent tour. very informative. The girls were lovely. Experienced local foods. A choice of activities . 5*

A fantastic time.. I enjoyed this tour last night - it was such fun, and I had many opportunities to take fabulous photographs of the magical lights of Hanoi after dark! My driver's skills were fluent in the mad traffic, but she took no risks, and I had every confidence in her abilities. Chan (Sara) was also friendly, informative as we passed landmarks, and as we stopped for treats - such as the delicious egg yolk coffee, she was really helpful in ensuring I was safe and unhelmeted. The girls were all chatty and it was a great trip full of fun and good humour. The culminating meal was fabulous and it will remain a real highlight of my holiday. I would recommend this tour highly.
Attractive. The tour was a great combination of significant spots and good food. The egg coffee was a highlight, very tasty and special.

Very fun and informative. It was a great experience to ride around in the heavily congested city on the back of a motor bike. You really get the feel of being a local. The 4 hour tour took us around the city stopping at several popular destinations and the guides were very knowledgable of the history for each stop. We had local coffee, food, and really got to see an inside look of Hanoi that we wouldn't have experienced without their help. I would recommend this tour to anyone that enjoys learning the history of the city and trying something new without having to do much research on your own. Thanks Linh and Chang for the awesome experience!!

Hanoi by motor scooter & delicious food!. We booked this tour through our travel agent before we got to Hanoi. It has been the highlight of our trip so far. I have kids aged 15, 13 and 9. My youngest was apprehensive about going and about 5 minutes in he was showing me how he was riding with no hands. Needless to say, the drivers were excellent! Very cautious, courteous, adorable, informative and extremely upbeat. The places we went to eat were delicious and we returned today to drink more egg coffee/hot chocolate/matcha. Here's a shout out to Gaby who drove me around and was very kind and funny when I kept bumping into her helmet! Linh was fabulous, extremely personable and even sent me a list of places around town to eat. All the girls were wonderful! We all wish we had more time in Hanoi to do the tour with them again! Can't say enough good things! Thank you!!

Much Needed and Definitely Worth It. It's was a great tour! Trang Sarah was very warm and welcoming. She is very knowledgeable on the city, its history and the food. She showed me alot of why the city is such a popular tourist destination and I definitely recommend this tour and tour guide Trang Sarah to anyone coming to visit! Five stars for Trang and Paloma motor tours! Well worth it!
hanoi holiday. Great way to spend an evening, with expert scooter driver in the cooling rain and a good mix of on-road and off-road time.Highly recommended.

Best tour by far on our Vietnam holiday. Even though we had light showers on this tour it did not diminish the overall enjoyment of our tour. The girls (riders) were very careful and had our safety in mind at all times. their attitudes were delightful at all times and took us to some normally unseen places in Hanoi like a cafe serving egg coffee , another serving snake for morning tea (don't miss it ) and we all joined together for great lunch at local restaurant. Top marks for great tour. Thank you girls , and we loved your ao dai dresses

Great way to see Hanoi. What's better than to see Hanoi than being on a scooter (with a pretty girl) and be part of the insanely crazy weaving traffic of Hanoi? The feeling is simply indescribable. This tour is definitely worth the dollar spent as it also includes local snacks, drink and local food. Kudos to my tour guide Linh Vu and my pretty scooter driver Trang (Sarah). They were fun, friendly and very knowledgeable. Thanks for the wonderful tour.

Great food tour. We did the night food tour with Linh and Trang and had an amazing time! We stopped off for egg coffee first and my partner had egg hot chocolate as she's not a coffee fan. Both really good. Then a quick ride round to some of the best tourist spots in Hanoi before some amazing appetizers. Then another ride round, quick stop at the flower market where we saw the calm before the storm. Then onto the main meal which was delicious. Loads of food! Make sure you're hungry. Linh and Trang were amazing - Trang was free the following day so she showed us round the rest of Hanoi on foot. Really professional company too with smart uniforms and nice comfy bikes!

Best day out. I'm so glad I booked this tour, it was one of the best tours I've had in a long time, I think it's the best way to see Hanoi, at 1st it was a little bit scary but then you start to relax & really enjoy it, it was very safe, my driver was excellent, if you are in Hanoi book a tour with Paloma motor bike tours they are one of the better bike tours around & they really look after you

Best way to experience Hanoi. Wondering how to best "see" Hanoi in just a day, my hotel recommended Paloma Motorbike tours. And what a great way to do it! Hanoi traffic is crazy at best, and I am not one for sitting in a taxi all day, and it being almost 40 C (104 F), motorbike is was. I was picked up at the hotel by the driver/guide, and traveling solo, she turned out to be a great companion as well. A very good (and safe) driver, knowledgeable about both Vietnamese history and Hanoi as a city, and also very updated on current affairs elsewhere in the world. I had the best time combining the sights, being "part of" the crazy traffic, and having interesting conversations about this and that. Ask for Linh Vu - you can't find anyone better to safely show you this amazing city. Thanks for making this day fun and memorable.

Thankful that we got to experience this! . On our last night in Hanoi, my friends and I signed up for a night motorbike tour with Paloma - our only regret being that we didn't do so earlier! The tour was comprehensive, we caught sunset by the Long Bien Bridge, visited several local eateries serving authentic local fare, and stopped by attractions like the Opera House, Mausoleum etc. Our tour guide, Tuan, is a veteran and was extremely knowledgeable. Our drivers - Andy, Ly and Nga were friendly and we enjoyed our conversations (as well as our safe ride!) A terrific experience.

Highlight of Hanoi with 8 and 11 Year olds. We had pre booked a scooter tour in Ho Chi Minh and the whole family loved the scooter experience we made a last minute enquiry with Paloma for a booking in Hanoi. Their response was prompt and they were able to accommodate us with the chosen date. We had no idea what tour would be suitable because of the children so Paloma suggested a private tour option for us. We did a 5 hour tour which took us to some main scenic attractions and some off the track tourist spots. The food stops included were great and even the children enjoyed majority of the food.The all girl driver crew was fabulous. We had Elly Thao (main guide), Mary Dong, Andy Quynh, and Gabby Nga. We took the video option so Rose Duyen and camera man Cuong also followed us on the tour. The video option was great as we didn't need to worry about getting coverage from the tour. That night, photos were emailed and a week later, we received the video with music of our choice.All in all a fabulous tour. I highly recommend Paloma Tours to everyone who visits Hanoi. The traffic will seem daunting at first, but with such a competent team, you need not worry about your safety, and just enjoy yourself and soak up the atmosphere.

Fantastic tour. Ling and Rose provided a great evening of sights and food for a couple of older bike novices. We ate like locals at some hidden venues that we would never have thought to try or even found on our own. The girls were both so friendly, patient and considerate of our inexperience that we felt very safe in their capable hands. Absolutely recommended.

Fantastic street level tour!. Our family of 4 (2 kids, 12 and 15) spent a fantastic half day buzzing around Hanoi on the back of motorbikes. Despite the crazy no rules traffic, I felt safe and confident with all of our drivers. They were friendly, eager to engage in conversation, and our trip guide was an enthusiastic leader. We stopped at various hotspots, and sampled local foods in places that I would never had known existed without our guide. It was all very professional, organized and well done. Even our 12 year old that hates everything gave it 10/10.

Awesome experience!. We had a tour with Elly and Ganbby and it was amazing :) We got to see the old town of Hanoi and eat delicious foods. I always felt safe on the back of their motorbike. Definitely a bit pricy as far as tours go, but worth it since you get to interact with a local and learn closely about the culture.We got in late, past the official start time of the tour, but we kept in touch via whatsapp, and we were able to take the tour no problem.. They're super responsive amd accomodating.

A fabulous night out in Hanoi. Elly and girls picked us up from hotel around 6pm and took us on a 4 hour spin around the city. Riding on the back of the motorbikes was exhilarating to say the least and a highly recommended way to see the real Hanoi. We visited authentic local eateries and ticked off both secret sights and main attractions. It was the perfect introduction to Hanoi. Elly and the girls were incredible - knowledgable, friendly, expert drivers - we can't recommend them highly enough. Elly even kept in touch and gave us the names of places to visit in both Hoi An and Saigon after the tour which was much appreciated. Overall the best tour of our trip.
Great Tour!. My husband and I had a great time on the tour. Elly and Gabby were fantastic guides, drivers and hosts!

Money well spent. We booked an afternoon 2pm tour on scooters for a 4 hr tour around sites of Hanoi. It was a great start as the girls arrived on time. The lovely girls Linh and Lee who drove us around were wonderful. They took us to places around Hanoi we would never have seen. They even took us for the traditional famous egg coffee and an ice cream at the end. The girls were very knowledgeable spoke very good English and were fun and we felt very safe. Definitely recommend this tour

First time on bike, great fun!. Thanks Elly so much for a wonderful tour and letting me try to drive. I really enjoyed riding the bike. I will practice at home and maybe on my next trip I can drive by myself.Let's make a choice. You won't regret for sure.

Street level Hanoi. Crazy cool!. If you haven't been on a bike in Hanoi this is by far the best way to get on one! Enjoy the hard-to-find small locations that serve great local Vietnamese food, and see the sights of Hanoi at night, all while on the back of a scooter driven by one of the local, insightful, professional young ladies.
Great experience . We had a great tour with our two driver/guides would recommend to anyone, friendly, efficient and good fun Eddie and Annette

Excellent tour of Hanoi Nightlife. One of the highlights of our vacation, and the best way to crunch the hustle and bustle of Hanoi into an even wilder experience. Many thanks to the girls as they made every minute personable and enjoyable!

Great morning tour. We had an amazing time out with Paloma bike tours. Great way to see Hanoi with lots of great advice about seeing the city further. Food stops were amazing, places we wouldn't have went in without the local knowledge to go there! Loved every second!

Awesome night sightseeing and food tour on motorbike... Was very impressed with Paloma cruise and took onto Motorbike tours from them to explore the city since we have 4hrs in hand before getting to airport. We were treated by cute and young girls Elly and Gabby at the hotel to take us on motorbikes. Loved the overall experience. The tour was totally worth it. Both Elly and Gabby are smart, knows their city and very friendly. They rode the bike extremely carefully. Showed us the place with great love and passion. Got us to do some shopping.Loved the food. The first stop Pho chicken soup was out of the world. Vietnamese coffee was mind blowing. both spoke excellent English and take pride in showing their city. Great memory of Hanoi because of these girls. There is no way tourist like us could find such hidden gems without these girls. Will definitely go back to know more about the city. Love u guys.

Best way to explore Hanoi. My friend and I only had 48 hours in Northern Vietnam. Most of this time was spent in Halong Bay with Paloma cruise. Since we had some spare time after the cruise and before leaving for the airport, we decided to try Paloma's motorbike tour. Two female guides, Elly and Gabby took us on this tour. It was my first time riding a motorbike. At first I was afraid to get on and sat stiffly on the bike. Since both guides were very reassuring, I learned to relax after a few minutes and actually enjoyed the ride. They took us around the city. We had a wonderful time in spite of the rain. They even came prepared with rain coats for us. The food stops were great--we had 4 food stops for chicken noodles, egg coffee, dinner and bo bia (dessert). I enjoyed the food as much as the sights. The best part is overcoming my fear of riding a motorbike and feeling the wind on my face as we rode. It's definitely an experience I will never forget and will recommend to anyone visiting Hanoi. Thanks Elly and Gabby!

Motorbike day tour!. Arranged the motorbike tour. 4 young ladies Elly, Giang, Oanh and Dung turned up. They are superb in manage 4 big man behind their bikes in the chaotic traffic of Hanoi. Visited several places of interest and tried local speciality food. The guides are attentive and good in explaining to us on the many questions we asked. Thumb up for all these young ladies!

Fantastic night tour of Hanoi. This tour was absolutely fantastic , and our highlight of Hanoi. Elly our main tour guide, and our drivers Gaby and Ly, were all friendly, knowledgeable and allowed us to feel safe in a busy city. Allowed us to get out of the old quarter and see the wider sights of Hanoi we would have not seen on our own. Highly recommended this tour to all.

Very Kind Guide and Cute Drivers. Last May 28th, I applied for Motorbike Tours in Hanoi, Vietnam through our hotel front.After then, I and my friend met 2 cute and younger drivers and our tour guide on PM. 2:00 at the hotel.Our guide Elly had good English skills and high pride as the interpreter of Hanoi, Moreover, 2 drivers (Nya, Jiang) are the university students who have tourism management, So, they strive to supply us good service for our best satisfaction.We went around all of Hanoi city for 4 hours. I thought that our time passed too fast.Moreover, they sent us many photographs which we took pictures in various places by e-mail after our travel.Maybe, these photographs will remain unforgettable good memory in Hanoi forever.

Great way to sample Hanoi!. I highly recommend this tour! We were picked up right on time at our hotel, introduced to our drivers and guide and off we went. Despite this crazy traffic here in Hanoi we felt safe the entire time. It's not just great food it's a cultural adventure. You learn so much, Elly our guide have us so many insights into Vietnamese culture. Our drivers he got and Lee were experienced drivers who were caring and courteous, this tour makes you feel like you are a Welcome friend visiting instead of a tourist.It's a great way to see the city, taste the food and act like. Vietnamese person for 4 whole hours. We loved it, do yourself a favour, take the tour and enjoy! You won't regret it.

Great experience & Very useful time !!!. I was by myself to join this tour. My first visited in Hanoi. I wanted to see everything whatever could see. In the morning, Ms. Linh Vu came to pick me up at the hotel and I hopped in the motorbike. It was so excited and a lot of fun with her. We started to have a cup of egg coffee, breakfast,snacks and lunch. Where she took me, there are all locals which tourist can not find themselves. All of them are so good mood.... This is not only food tour but also very interesting in food experience..I enjoyed them so much. She explained so much about life of Vietnam. She also took me the most of sightseeing spots where tourists have to see. She was so knowledgeable, friendly and kind. I highly recommend to take this motorbike tour. You will really enjoy the moment of Hanoi

Highlight of our time in Hanoi!! Brilliant!!. I cannot recommend this motorbike tour highly enough! More than just a food tour, Peter our local guide took us around the main sites in Hanoi, sharing his in depth knowlwdge, with a professional photographer too who sent photos of us in these locations after our trip (all included in the cost).Our motorbike drivers Thang and Thang (Sarah) were very good drivers, we felt safe for the entire trip. Sarah was excellent too, we chatted the whole time like old friends, which was just lovely as she was saying all about her views of and life in Vietnam. The food itself was delicious! They took us to places we wouldn't have known existed otherwise, and they provided us with a range of new dishes.5*+ - I'd do it again if I could!!
Wonderful :) . If your in Hanoi you have to try this bike tour ! Super safe , super guides ! We couldn't have asked for more ... :) I wouldn't look anywhere else , you need to go with Paloma !

Awesome Tour!. The tour was so worth it - it was the first time I'd been on a moped and I felt very safe and had a great time! Sarah, my driver was so sweet and funny! Our guide Linh was awesome, great sense of humour and very knowledgable, we learnt a lot about Hanoi and Vietnamese culture.And the food .... Oh the food! So good! You HAVE to try the egg coffee! My friends and I really had a great time on the evening tour, well worth it!
Great tour, great guides!. Everything on the itinerary including the food was amazing! We were three women and we appreciated that the drivers they sent for us were also women.

Amazing evening . A group of four of us did this tour in Hanoi. At first I was a little nervous about how safe it would be after seeing the traffic madness in Hanoi. It was extremely safe and professional and we all had an amazing time. We loved trying the food and coffee around and the guides were all helpful and lovely. Couldn't recommend this more!

Exiting and fun tour!. Me and my wife really enjoyed the motorbike tour. We met our tour guide Elly at a very nice coffee shop where she gave us to try the delicious egg coffee, which is very nice and i will probably try to do it also by myself :). Elly and the girls were wonderful. They are very good drivers and they know what they are doing, so don`t need to worry. They made the tour interesting and gave us a lot of information about the history and key attractions in Hanoi. We had a short break at a cute little restaurant for some traditional vietnamese food and local beer which was very very delicious. The tour ended at lunch time at a very nice restaurant overlooking the red river where we tasted more delicious food. We had a great experience and was a very good choice to book this tour. We could not do it on our own for sure. For anyone going to Hanoi, don`t hesitate and book this tour. Thank you Elly, Quỳnh, Cải and Paloma Motorbike Tours!

Amazing experience !. Team makes the difference and the girls are great ! they are explaining the culture, monuments and food with a good english level and good historical knowledge. The start with egg coffee was a nice experience to fuel your body before the tour. So do not afraid of going around with scooter and dive into Hanoi ! well done girls

Exciting Tour with the Best Guide. The Paloma Motorbike Tour was the most exciting education I've ever received. I was almost in disbelief at the traffic procedures there in Hanoi and at first nervous about the tour. Doing it was literally grabbing the Bull By the Horns.It didn't take long to become completely comfortable on the bike after realizing how much harmony there was to the seemingly chaotic movements of the other motorists.Once that was settled, the fun began. We were shown traditional sights as well as locations completely off the radar and the stories behind each were incredible. The food at each stop was delicious and would have been the highlight of the tour if it wasn't trumped by our amazing Tour Guide. A young lady named Mickey.She won our hearts the moment she greeted us all in our native languages. Mickey takes the crown and really makes doing the tour all the more worth it. She was knowledgeable, fun, very patient, and eager to answer every question we could come up with. Her energy definitely lead the charge.If you're reading this, Take The Paloma Motorbike Tour. You won't be disappointed. And to really get the most out of it, request Mickey as well!
Magic on two wheels. Great tour with great guides. We had our own private tour and experienced sites and food we wouldn't have done on our own. Simply amazing.

Hanoi in One NIght. My husband and I were in Hanoi for one night before heading off to Halong Bay for our cruise. We wanted to book a tour that would allow us to experience Hanoi and the food and our hotel recommended Paloma. We did a motorbike food and sight tour and it was the best choice we could have made. We rode on the back of two motorbikes and went all around Hanoi to see the famous landmarks and try delicious local food for 4 hours. Nam (sp?), our tour guide, and our drivers were superb - friendly, knowledgeable, and personable. We told them we were on our honeymoon and they surprised us with a small gift during our tour - too sweet. The tour coordinator also followed us around and took great pictures of us, which were emailed to us a day or two after! I would wholeheartedly recommend the motorbike tour. These guys are great.

Paloma Motorbike Tours rocks! . Joining Paloma Motorbike Tours is a fantabulous experience especially if you are visiting Hanoi for the first time! It's all about doing the things the locals do :) Big ups to Elly whom is our tour leader who made all things possible. The motorbike drivers are very experienced and careful, friendly and they speak perfect english. Not only we got to visit the wonderful historical iconic monuments but we also got to experience some of the best local snacks and meals that we will never come across ourselves! Paloma Motorbike Tours has made my visit to Hanoi a truly memorable one and I hope it will make yours one too :) You will only regret not joining :D

Sincerely Yours, Hanoi. The best way to blend into the local culture is doing what the local's do in their daily life. Riding a scooter exploring the city of Hanoi is the best way to do so. Our scooter angel, Elly and Quach never let us down. They never fails to answer all the curious questions brought up during the entire tour. We get to visit most of the historical site in just 3 hours. if you want to feel Hanoi heart beat, try to book a motorbike tour with these professional bike angel. You never regret . Good job ladies.

Great fun with Paloma bike tours. We had a great time with the staff at Paloma bike tours Hanoi we felt safe in such a busy city our tour guide Mikey was great and made the tour fun.definitely recommended. Alan & julia

Fabulous food tour of the city lights. Paloma Tours Offers a unique perspective on Hanoi after dark. Zooming through the city on the back of motorbikes, eating food in off the beaten track locations. It's well put together and a must-do when visiting Hanoi. Excellent time.

The Best. The motorbike was the highlight of our trip. We were able to view the beautiful city night scene with the professional beautiful college motorcyclist young ladies. All dress in vietnamese traditional dresses. I highly recommend this tour.

Hanoi like a local. I booked the tour last minute for myself and my husband. Paloma Motorbike tours confirmed the booking for the next day within the hour. We were nervous and excited in equal measure about what the next day had in store. Elly our guide met us with such a friendly welcome in our hotel reception and introduced us to our drivers Quynh and Rose - who gave us our all important helmets! Off we went on our mopeds - and I thought it might take us a while to settle in but our drivers, Quynh and Rose are so experienced - we felt really safe right away!...which was a surprise having seen the Hanoi moped madness the night before in town!We visited local food spots for eats and treats we could not have found ourselves, delicious bun bo nam bo noodles; egg coffee; zipping through spaghetti junctions and past beautiful lakes for some fresh spring rolls and delicious salad. We stopped off in the literature museum, a local food market and drove across Long Biên bridge for a tasty lunch across the other side of the red river in a lovely local family restaurant. We picked up lots of information along the way from the lovely Elly and the whole thing just felt like we were hanging out in Hanoi with friends. We were on a high afterwards! And I can honestly say it was the best tour of a city we've ever done. Totally recommend it. And I just wish there was a Paloma motorbike tour every place we visited! Such a brilliant way to see a city. Thanks Elly! And thanks Rose and Quynh for keeping us safe x

Amazing tour with friendly people. My mom and I did the night time tour, which is an absolutely amazing experience. You get a helmet and a walkie talkie, so you can communicate during the ride. We started out at a small but popular coffee bar, the kind you don't easily enter as a foreigner. There we had our first Hanoi egg coffee (very good) and got our vriefing for the rest of the night.It was the start of a wonderful experience. We ate amazing dishes and got tips on how to eat them from our guide. The drivers are incredibly careful and skilled. I had the nicest driver ever, we had very nice and funny discussions while driving through Hanoi traffic.The guide told us interesting information and took us to places we wouldn't have found otherwise.So a big thank you to Paloma Tours for the amazing experience! If you want to experience Hanoi from a different point of view, book this trip. You won't be sorry!

Highlight of our time in Hanoi. We were a group of four adults with 2 pretty large men who were a bit worried about riding on a scooter behind a small female. Fortunately for us, there was no reason to worry at all. Our main guide, Elly, and her team of Alice, Trang, Dung and Thu were absolutely excellent. They were confident motorbike riders and made our experience riding through the very busy streets of Hanoi truly one of the highlights of our time in Vietnam. And to top it off, all of the food and tour stops were perfect! Couldn't recommend this tour enough!

Hanoi Food tour by 6 Aussies. Fantastic night of fun with our wonderful guide Ellie and her 6 young riders that doubled us around Hanoi last evening . Ellie met us at our hotel and welcomed us and then introduced us to our riders . We had a fun informative evening . First stop was to have egg coffee which is traditional to Hanoi. We loved. Each stop that we had , Ellie chatted about the food, the culture and the area we were in. This was a more personal tour riding across the bridges and touring around Hanoi that we had not seen on more conventional tours . The riders were lovely and we enjoyed talking to them as we went around . We had great laughs and was a highlight of our 5 night stay in Hanoi. Than was my rider and she was fabulous negotiating the roads . Thanks Ellie and all the girls for making our night special ! We loved our tour and meeting you all ! Totally recommend as a fun way of seeing and experiencing Hanoi

Fantastic tour! Perfect mix of sites and food!!. Brilliant tour - just the right amount of time spent looking at the sites but also plenty of time to explore the less touristic parts of beautiful Hanoi. Delicious lunch and snacks along the way with unlimited beer at lunch!! Would recommend to anyone who wanted to see the real Hanoi!!

excellent motorbike tour of Hanoi. Very well conducted tour , very friendly drivers,always smiling and helpful.We visited markets , busy Hanoi streets ,restaurants with good food.Very knowledgeable/helpful guide . We also visited some important land marks in Hanoi City.Overall a very pleasant experience.

Great night out. My experience with Paloma was great. My guide, Hoai took me on a private tour and was very warm and friendly and had fantastic knowledge of the city. She was willing to accommodate any of my interests in the city and took me to THE BEST food joints in Hanoi that I would never have known about. She had great knowledge of the story behind each place and had great pride in her city which made the tour that more special.I would recommend this tour.
Just do it. Best tour ever! A must if in Hanoi. Elly was a great guide and all the girls were wonderful. Very safe riders.
