excellent tour and friendly service. A great way to visit Hanoi. Very friendly service. very informative. We really appreciated the fact that they came directly to our hotel. No hassle. Nice stopovers especially in one of the oldest cafe in Hanoi. Nice dinner with a great selection of Vietnamese food.

Mr Paul . What an awesome experience , would highly recommend the night tour , has to be the best organised tour I have done in the whole of Asia ,our tour guide was an absolute gem and the girls that took us on the scooters where so friendly and informative , made our night one we won't forget , thank you so much for making a part of our holiday so special . Mr Paul ,, Australia

A terrific Insight from a New Perspective. Wonderful and exciting journey into the mosh of Hanoi traffic. Safely become one of the movers rather than one of the dodgers as you zoom between your various sidewalk food stops. Safely eat good food at a sidewalk café surrounded mostly by local people. We were lucky enough to be taken to a local house for a taste of what real Vietnamese eat. Eat only what you want, no pressure to clear the table. We also got to see things that were out of old town. Hanoi has much else to offer. Plus our drivers gave us a lot of unique cultural information as we drove. I'd do this trip again next time I am in town. Yes you wear a helmet. Gord and Carol 70+

Definitely a must to see Hanoi !!!. We really enjoyed the motorbike tour and our experiences in Hanoi is highly enhanced by great tour guide and glamor drivers.That gave me a glimpse of the joyous and lifestyle of Hanoi people. Also I did take a lot of photos of dynamic, vibrant streets, went to egg coffee shop, which is an original one and ate so many local food. Thanks again and this is an absolute must do in Hanoi!!!

Nightlights and Food Tour a Highlight. Despite the fact my husband and I had not been on a motorbike for over 40 years we thoroughly enjoyed this tour. We were picked up on time at our hotel, in the old quarter, and taken to the original egg coffee shop to meet the other members of our tour. There were six of us all as pillion passengers. After a safety briefing and outline of the evening by our fabulous guide we were off. We were picked up at 6.30 and dropped off just before 11pm. Our tiny female drivers were extremely competent drivers. Despite the frantic Hanoi traffic we felt very safe. We saw the night lights near Lake Kiem, West Lake, Old Quarter, the mausoleum and visited the flower market. About 8 pm our trip was punctuated with two dishes of food and at about 9.45pm we stopped again for a set menu dinner. There was plenty of food and drinks included in this tour, lots of laughter and chatter between drivers and clients. Thuy, was a fantastic driver and lots of fun. I would recommend this tour to people of all ages.

Wonderful day in Hanoi. When I read on-line that one of the best things to do in Hanoi is a motorbike food trip I was all for it. First, I love food and second I love food. I was a little concerned since I have three kids (11, 15, 18) and after living in Asia for the last 15 years and watching locals drive motorbikes. My youngest two were definitely nervous. After thinking about it, I thought why not. We can always stop if it scares them. Fast forward to the day before our tour, OMG watching and walking in Hanoi can be dangerous. Motorbikes are everywhere and drive unlike I have ever seen. It made me second guess the plan and my middle one was not liking the idea AT ALL.The day of the trip came and it was a beautiful winter day, I had two very concerned family members. When the bikes showed up, immediately I saw my daughters shoulders relax. Our drivers, all ladies, had such a sweet and friendly smile and attitude. Our guide was relaxed and kind. The drivers proved a quick safety lesson and helmets. We stayed very close to our first stop so it gave the kids a few minutes to get comfortable. The kids LOVED it. It was the highlight of the trip. The food was fun, we saw so much of Hanoi - I doubt you could see as much any other way. I highly recommend this trip.

An amazing and unforgettable experience! . This was the highlight of my holiday in Vietnam!! With the little time we had in Hanoi, this tour was the perfect way to showcase and experience what the capital city is all about. Elly and the girls could not have been better tour guides and company to spend Christmas Eve with. I was blown away by their friendliness and how well they lifted our spirits from being exhausted after traveling to Hanoi to suddenly having all the energy and smiles in the world on this tour. The local food and drink experience was out of this world. I am so grateful to have had this opportunity and would recommend it to anyone and everyone. Do yourself a favour and don't miss out on this amazing experience!! Thanks again to Elly and her team!

Awesome and marvelous Paloma motorbike tours. It is an interesting and amazing adventure with Paloma motorbike tours. It allows my family members to enjoy the night scenery of Hanoi which we are unable to reach thru walking or taxi. This is really awesome and the girls drivers are very polite, knowledgeable and friendly. A big clap for the girls.

Best way to see Hanoi. What a way to see Hanoi!! The city is so vibrant and exhilarating, this tour shows you around the crazy streets of Hanoi stopping at various points to eat and see the sights. The night we were on the tour it was raining a lot but this didn't dampen our experience the guide was amazing and so knowledgeable (they give you earpieces to wear so you can hear the guide and talk to each other). We were in Hanoi for only a night and day and I've got to say this was the best way to see the sights, experience the bustle and try foods/restaurants that you just wouldn't manage/find as a non Vietnamese speaking person. Just unreal, and still can't get over how good the drivers are! Thank you :)

Excellent. Absolutely fantastic, exhilarating, unique experience. Elly and her team went out of their way for us.. A "must do" on your itinerary. An experience not to be missed. We experienced local cuisine and had good, interesting discussions on local food, culture and life in Hanoi. The Paloma team went out of their way to make our experience unforgettable, and we wove in and out of the Hanoi traffic like real Vietnamese. We had our first taste of egg coffee in a local coffee shop, then some local starter cuisine at a popular Cafe. We ended off with a delectable traditional dinner in our large group with all our drivers. It was great getting to know them.

Private Motorbike Tour with awesome guide Elly. I did an night tour with Paloma Motorbike tour. It was great experiences on the back of motorbike behind a beautiful guide Elly - wearing her traditional dress. She took me to so many different parts of city and tried Egg coffee which I've ever had before. It was amazing. Just a short time - 4.5 hours but I felt like I've lived here for such a long time. She told me a lots about culture, history and daily life of local people. This is one of the best experiences for me. I highly recommended this tour to everyone. Thanks again Elly - great guide, safe driver.

Great motorbike tour of Hanoi with Paloma. We did the half day city tour (am) with Paloma and had a great time ! Our kids aged 11 and 13 had a ball, despite (or maybe because of) the crazy traffic. All the drivers were chatty, and looked a picture in their uniforms. Towards the ends of the tour, we left the city and went to a village location, where we shared a lovely lunch, eating all together, which was a first for me and very enjoyable. Elly was our guide and she was very knowledgeable and friendly - the kids loved her fun loving attitude.

Night Time Fun in Hanoi. What a wild fun ride it was! We stopped at various restaurants along the way for appetizers and drinks, we driven over the old bridge and to the edge of town to get that perspective. Drivers were fun and great and view spectacular. A must!

Breath, taste, live Hanoi with the ladies of Paloma Motorbike Tours!. I was wondering what to do on my last day in Hanoi when my hotel concierge recommended Paloma Motorbike tours. My friend and I booked a morning tour of the city. The ladies were prompt and were all smiles. I really loved their tradition clothing, it's just a beautiful sight as they ride along the city on their motorbike. Our tour guide was Elly, she is an amazing lady. Elly is professional, knowledgeable, and her enthusiastic smile is contagious. Our drivers were Thuy and Nguyen, again very professional ladies. They spoke English well and were eager to practice their English with us. We took Hanoi Fabulous Food and Sights Tour which took about 4 to 5 hours. We had Vietnamese coffee, ate delicious food, saw beautiful historical sights but the most thrilling part was driving through the traffic on the motorbike. It's an experience that you won't forget.

Custom Palmoa Tour. We customised a tour to include some unforgettable activities, including a 10 course dinner at a snake restaurant. The staff were fantastic from the time of booking, the tour very professional and we were not rushed at all. I can highly recommend this to anyone as a highlight of Hanoi.

Motor Bike Tour. Awesome Epic Memorable Motor Bike Tour, We travelled to Hanoi (6 Guys) and did a 5 hour tour, On booking in Australia we added a few things on the tour and they were very accommodating on booking. Great trip A must do

Best way to see Hanoi!. This was the first tour we took in Hanoi and it provided a great overview of the city and sights to revisit later. I was a little scared being on a motorbike with hundreds of others on the road, but our drivers were excellent and I felt safe. If you're not familiar with driving a motorbike in a city like Hanoi, this is the best way to go - don't even try renting your own scooter. Special shout out to our guide, Elly - she was fantastic at explaining the history of the sights and providing ideas on where to eat in the city. You can hear the great pride she and the driving team have for their people's culture and history. We started with a few photos at the Opera House, then spent a good amount of time at the Temple of Literature. It was crowded on a Sunday because lots of students were there to celebrate their graduation with friends and family - it may be less crowded on a week day. Then we walked past the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum - affectionately called Uncle Ho, he body was being refreshed in Russia that month so we didnt get to see him. We drove down "the most beautiful boulevard" which was lined with French-style homes that were taken over by the government after the French were kicked out. Then we went over a bridge built in 1901 to the suburbs where we had a local meal with a view of the old bridge. This was the best way to see Hanoi
Girls on Bikes!!. Excellent service and knowledge of the area, great fun!! It would be a mistake to not do a tour on the back of a bike around Hanoi and do it at night when it is more comfortable...

Fun trip around Hanoi on motorbikes. My daughter(21) and I did this trip while the boys did something else. Very enjoyable and good to get commentary from locals as there is much we don't understand about Vietnamese life when just observing. We tried a number of different local foods and saw much of the city including the west lakes area. Our drivers and guide were very friendly and spoke good english. A very enjoyable half day!!

A fun way to see the sites of Hanoi. My mum (who is 60) and I did the morning sites and food tour with Paloma Motorbike Tours In September 2015. My mum was a little anxious getting on the back of a bike and her driver, Tu, took amazing care of her, reassuring her the entire time. After the first 10 minutes, Mum was just having fun! Our tour guide, Nam, was excellent - very knowledgeable and friendly and his english is great. As you are on a motorbike, you can cover a lot in four hours and we saw a lot of outer Hanoi that we would not have visited otherwise. Both drivers, Tu and Ling, were fabulous and safe, and they enjoyed chatting to us over lunch as much as we enjoyed chatting to them! We got to eat some amazing food over the course of the tour, everything was delicious! At the end of the tour, our guide recommended a place for us to buy some Vietnamese coffee to take home with us (we had mentioned that we wanted some) and the drivers went out of their way and took us to the shop on the way back to our hotel. What an experience, to be on the back of a motorbike riding through the streets of Hanoi. I would highly recommend this tour, we both had a lot of fun!

Perfect way to see Hanoi!. We did the morning half day tour of the major tourist sights of Hanoi. We loved it! It really is the only way to see the city. We felt perfectly safe on the back seat of our scooters. Our drivers spoke good English and were so friendly and cared so much about our comfort. A walkie talkie is provided to each guest which was awesome! The tour guide was also on the back seat of a scooter and was able to talk to the group giving us information and history. He also asked our group if there were certain places we'd like to see. Paloma did everything they could to make sure we were satisfied. Our lunch spot was excellent...a small local spot on the river looking back at the city. It was so much fun! I highly recommend one of their scooter tours!
Pretty good experience! Highly recommend!. I had very good time and good experience with Paloma Motorbike Tour. Come to hotel on time and provide good service. Highly recommend!

Just lovely. My husband and I had a fantastic time in Hanoi with a scooter tour in Hanoi. We booked Fabulous Food and Sights Tour. Everything went out in amazing way and we had perfect weather. Our driver , Linh spoke very good English, are friendly and always ready to help. Her drive is so safe so never felt nearvous to sit behind. Food is very local and delicious. We had a lot. Love the coffee too! Never had it the same before. We visited many places and corners in the old quarter, learnt a lot about Hanoi and people here. We definitely will recommend Paloma Motorbike Tours for all people we meet. A must do in Hanoi.

Fantastic Experience and So Much Fun!!. We did the Hanoi night lights food tour and it was one of the most amazing holiday tours I have ever done - we visited several major tourist spots in the cool of the Hanoi evening and stopped to eat at several places. Our tour guide was great and kept up an informative dialogue of what we were seeing via our walkie talkies! The ladies driving us did an excellent job making us feel safe on the back of the mopeds - despite being half our size ;). All the staff were so funny and nice and friendly! I cannot imagine a better way to explore this city than on the back of our chauffeured mopeds. I really cannot recommend this tour enough! ( oh and thanks for teaching us how to cross a road in Hanoi - this information has proved invaluable!!)

Fantastic from start to finish :). We did both the morning sightseeing tour and the evening food tour. Both were outstanding. Scooters are omnipresent in Hanoi so this is a great way to get around whilst immersing yourself into what the city has to offer. The team at Paloma were knowledgable, flexible and enthusiastic. We saw districts and sights in Hanoi that I would not have even thought to visit. Overall this was one of the major highlights of our trip and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Hanoi either as a first-time visitor or someone who wants to see a new side to a city they think they know!

Top day out. This is a great day out, and a brilliant way to see the city.We took kids, one of whom was a bit nervous before but that lasted about 10 seconds.You get a great feel for the place on the back of these bikes, the guides are very good, thoroughly recommended.

Fabulous way to explore the city.. Thoroughly enjoyed our motor bike tour around Hanoi with Nam as our tour guide and two lovely girls as our drivers. All of the staff that we met were extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. We got to see some great sights. It was exhilarating going through the old quarter and through the city on with all the traffic and people. The drivers were very good and cautious where necessary. I felt safe at all times.

Fabulous tour. Great day Paloma Motorbike Tours. Great for the whole family, exciting, fun and we learnt a lot as well. Great idea with the headpieces so we all knew what we were looking at as we drove through the streets of Hanoi. Just riding on motorbikes through the streets was exciting enough, but we also did sightseeing as well! Can't fault anything about this tour, and it finished with a great lunch overlooking the Long Biên Bridge. Enjoyed the Hanoi Hilton. A must do in Hanoi.

You Must Do This!. I did the Fabulous Food and Sights Tour with my friend and her two children, 14 and 12. It was amazing and we loved every minute of it. So exciting weaving through the traffic! The guides were fantastic and everyone is fitted with an intercom so we could hear the commentary and also ask questions. Visited the Opera House, The Mausoleum, The French Quarter, Hoan Kiem Lake and Tran Quoc Pagoda. It was great being taken across Long Bien bridge! Loved the sights! We learnt heaps and ate lots of incredible food, it was simply the best. Thank you so much.

Awesome. What a great way to see Hanoi!I`m a regular traveller to Vietnam but decided to try a bike tour with this company.Loved it- drivers are awesome and felt in very safe hands.Loved the opportunity to see a different Hanoi ,apart from the regular tourist spots.Also loved that the girls ate with us and had an opportunity to spend time talking to them.Will be back and thanks Paloma.

Superb way of seeing Hanoi for the first time. We arrived Friday night in the dark having booked the 8.30am morning tour round Hanoi the next morning. The girls from Paloma turned up promptly and having never even sat on a motorbike before felt completely at ease getting on the back of a scooter and weaving our way through the chaotic but organised Hanoi traffic.First of all you stop for a coffee and briefing and then you get on the back of the bike and see the real Hanoi side streets as you navigate your way through to the main attractions. All the time I felt very at ease on the bike and every time we got off to see an attraction the girls made sure we were ok. Their English was good and they told us a lot about the history of the city that we didn't know.The tour stops several times for food and by the time we stopped for lunch with a fab view of the Long Bien Bridge we were already full but got to try some authentic Vietnamese food - which having never been to Vietnam before was so good to eat.This tour really helped us learn about the city and give us the confidence to walk around on our own as we could ask the girls anything at all. If you are a single traveller, in a group with others or just experiencing Hanoi for the first time I would recommend this tour to you in order to give you the "wow" factor and let you see the real Hanoi. The girls restaurant recommendations were also superb and would like to thank them both for a superb introduction to Hanoi. If I went back to Hanoi again I would definitely go in one of their tours.

Brilliant way to see Hanoi. Arrived in Hanoi on Friday night and had a Paloma tour booked for 0800 Saturday morning. our drivers met us at the hotel on time and we got straight onto the scooters. There was two of us and we were the only ones on this tour. Had no idea what to expect and this turned out to be a brilliant, fun, crazy experience. Crazy because you are right in the middle of the Hanoi traffic, but there is no better way to experience Hanoi. Our drivers were amazing, handling the scooters with ease. They were friendly, fun and made sure we had a great time. The coffee and lunch stops were very good, and a great way to sample local food. I would highly recommend this trip - its the best way to get your bearings and understand how the traffic works in Hanoi.

GREAT WAY TO EXPLORE THE CITY. This was such a wonderful tour! I went with 2 other girls and we got lucky that it ended up the tour was just us! We had just gotten into Hanoi and were not staying for long so this was the perfect tour in order to see the whole city! We were so scared to get on the motor bikes but once we were on them the guides were so nice and so safe that none of us were nervous at all! They did a great job navigating the side streets, highways and bridges. We saw so many great sites and the places they took us to eat were absolutely incredible! We started at a really cute coffee shop. Then we got these local snacks and beers (which could have been a meal in its self) and then we went to a bbq place where they had the best duck I have ever eaten along with at least 7 other dishes and more beer and water! Nam was on his own bike and talking to each of us through walkie talkie thoughout the whole tour so we knew everything we were seeing. He was so knowledgeable and really cared that we had a great experience... which we did!! We made the perfect number of stops that kept the tour exciting and educational the whole time. After this tour I had completely fallen in love with the city and am so happy we chose such a great adventure!!

WELL WORTH IT!. A few years back, I wrote of our XO Foodie Tour of Saigon/Ho Chi Minh City; Paloma seems to have copied that tour for Hanoi.The Hanoi tour is a day tour and includes visits to a number of the main sites in Hanoi in addition to a sampling of Vietnamese cuisine, Hanoi style. My wife and I were passengers on the back of motorcycles driven by our guides, two young ladies in traditional 'ao dai'.We toured the old city and various areas in the newer sections to see the sights of Hanoi. All along the way our guides explained anything and everything about what we were seeing as we drove along. We stopped at the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and grounds, the West Lake, a number of temples, pagodas and markets. It was a nice way to spend the morning. We finished with a lunch that included an assortment of area specialties and received T-shirts and pashmina scarves as souvenirs. The tour cost about $59 each and was well worth experiencing when you are in Hanoi.

Awesome! Highly recommended. I am an expat living in Ho Chi Minh City. I have traveled to Hanoi many times and Paloma Motorbike Tour is highly recommended by one of my friend who is living in Hanoi. I had booked an excursion to go outside of the city, visit ancient temples, countryside and meet local people in the villages. The lady who escorted me in the tour was great, teaching me a lots of Vietnamese culture, traditions. All the arrangements were well organized though the weather was not so good. A bit cold and humid but we were absolutely satisfied with the service provided. Highly recommended. Love to come back again to take another tour with Paloma. Thank you.

A great way to see Hanoi City. Travelling alone in Hanoi, for the first time, and wanting to learn about something about this vibrant city, and the lifestyle of its people. Someone suggested Paloma Motorbike Tours..My initial reaction was..Me? At the age of 71, on a motorbike, in a strange city. I dont think so! It was then explained, I didn't have to to do the actual driving. All expected of of me, was to sit tandem behind a charming young woman in national dress, and let her worry about the driving and traffic, whilst I absorbed myself in the energy, beauty and night life of Hanoi..  I was picked up from my hotel, fitted with an helmet, and taken for coffee at the Opera House cafe to meet the rest of the people on the tour. We were then linked with an intercom system, allowing us, not only to hear the commentary, from our knowledgeable and experienced young guide, but also to ask questions and interact with observations made by the others. After a safety check, we mounted the bikes and off we went...There is so much going on in Hanoi, to see and absord, and just as I was beginning to feel I needed to stop and take it all in, we stopped, dismounted at the first of three scheduled stops, and invited to a sample a refreshing drink, and some delicious local food.The tour is comprehensive, catering to all tastes, and nearly 3 hours long, but so cleverly scheduled, with stops to break the ride, interesting sites, efficient and friendly staff, it all seems like moments.Never at any time was I anxious, about the traffic, or uncomfortable, and it was fun! This is an Hanoi experience you cannot afford to miss.SINCERELYVAL LEHMAN

Fun scooter night tour. Fantastic way to see Hanoi at night. The bikes seemed new, everything was well organised. We only booked by telephone when we got there, and there was just 2 of us, so it was essentially a private tour. At USD68 per person, we got a crew of 4 in total, a tour of about 3-4 hours, dinner, snacks, drinks, a free t-shirt and a scarf for each of us - I would say very good value. Good explanation by the guide Nam, who took really pictures of us as well! He was very chatty and great to talk to. The guide and drivers were freelancers, so it was interesting to also talk to them about their day job - one works in media, one is an entrepreneur and another is a budding designer. Food quality was so-so, but loved the ride across the bridge. It's cold in Dec, especially on the bike, so dress warm! This was a highlight in our trip - highly recommended.

Great way to experience Hanoi. We did the city lights and food tour. The female drivers were all very professional and friendly. We felt safe on the back of the scooters. The tour provided many stops at food venues with plenty of food (we were very full by the end of it). As the night progressed on the scooters, the winds made the night chilly, so I would recommend bringing a jumper. Nam (our tour guide) was very professional and easy to understand. It was a great experience and we would highly recommend this tour to other people.

Excellent 1/2 day tour of Hanoi. Safe, interesting tour of places of interest around Hanoi. Driver/guide had great English language and wealth of knowledge. She was very friendly, a great traffic navigator and I felt very safe st all times with her and the male rider who accompanied us at all times.

Amazing fun tour with great food!. The idea of hopping on a motorbike in Hanoi was a little intimidating, but the drivers were all fantastic and the bikes seemed new and good condition. My boyfriend and I had the BEST time on the tour - my favourite experience in Hanoi hands down. The city looks beautiful at night but sometimes it's hard to appreciate because of how busy it is - from the back of a bike it's actually easier to relax and look around. We stopped at a few highlights like the opera house and the Ho Chi Minh mausoleum which were really pretty all lit up at night. Our guide, Nam, was th ebest, so funny and friendly with great English and loads of funny facts about Vietnamese culture. There was a structure to the tour and lots of relevant info but we also just chatted a lot and Nam would share whatever popped into his head - which was a great way to find out more about the culture!The food was absolutely fantastic - loved the coffee shop to start, the fresh spring rolls, and the final dinner - WOW! SO much food - delicious!The staff were wonderful, we loved the drivers. Had an absolutely amazing time from start to finish. Don't miss it!

The Only way to see the City!. City & Food Tour $65, fantastic way to see the city and get amongst it like a local, eat and try there local food too. This was unreal! Pick up from the Hotel, there was even a photographer there too. We stopped for coffee, local snacks then the most amazing local dinner ever! It was such a great way to see the city. We all had ear pieces as well to communicate , by far the best money I spent on our one month in Vietnam :-)

Gourmet History. I was a little hesitant about doing thi stour because I thought I had to drive the Scooter that I was taken around in.But no, Nyuen, a fantastic guide with excellent english was a great driver, and tourist guide. I had fun even in the poring rain that hit our tour when we where going to cross the Gustave Eiffel designed bridge.We were short stopped because of the weather and could not visit all the restaurants as planned, but since I had enough to eat already, that was not a problem.I have the best photos and videos from Hanoi from this tour. Take it and ask to be guided by Nyuen. You will meet the nicest, helpful and knowledgeable guide.

Great fun and entertaining. Have no doubt - do it.A great introduction to Hanoi on my first evening of arriving. Brilliant way to get the layout of the city with very charming and professional guides. They are extremely cautious and safe drivers and was great being a pillion, the drivers are very capable.The selection of food is good. You will never leave thirsty or hungry. We loved the food so much, that we never had room for the last stop of deserts. Another night.......Have no fear or doubt, and enjoy the experience if life (on the back of a scooter with lovely guides, good food and great company).LG - life's good.

Hanoi on motor bike!. Travelling alone in Hanoi, for the first time, and wanting to learn about something about this vibrant city the lifestyle and its people. Someone suggested Paloma Motorbike Tours..My initial reaction was..Me? At the age of 71, on a motorbike, in a strange city. I dont think so! It was then explained, I didn't have to to do the actual driving, simply sit tandem behind a charming young woman in national dress, and let her worry about the driving and traffic, whilst I absorbed myself in the energy, beauty and night life of Hanoi..  I was picked up from my hotel, fitted with an helmet, and taken for coffee at the Opera House cafe to meet the rest of the people on the tour. We were then linked with an intercom system, allowing us, not only to hear the commentary, from our knowledgeable and experienced young guide, but also to ask questions and interact with observations made by the others. After a safety check, we mounted the bikes and off we went...There is so much going on in Hanoi, to see and absord, and just as I was beginning to feel I needed to pause and take it all in, we stopped, dismounted at the first of three scheduled stops, and invited to a sample a refreshing drink, and some delicious local food.The tour is comprehensive, catering to all tastes, and nearly 3 hours long, but so cleverly scheduled, with stops to break the ride, interesting sites, and friendly staff, it all seems like moments.Never at any time, was I anxious, about traffic, or uncomfortable, and it was fun! This is an Hanoi experience you cannot afford to miss.SINCERELYVAL LEHMAN

Wonderful fun tour. I did night tour, Hanoi Night Lights & Food Tour, with Paloma Motorbike Tours. It was recommended by Bestpricevn.com where I booked my tour in Vietnam. I have to say this tour was the highlight of my stay in Hanoi. The drive and tour guide, Linh, was wonderful, funny and easy to talk to. The coffee stop was wonderful as this was my first time to taste Vietnamese Coffee which was great. The two food stops also very good and delicious and plenty of food was provide. The tour covered a lot of ground, Old Town, Hoan Kiem Lake, West Lake, Opera House, Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, and many more sites. Overall, I highly recommend the tour, it provide very good overview of the sites, food, night life of Hanoi.

Interesting tour if you are short on time!. Came across Paloma on Facebook. Booked for 5 pax for the food/city tour. Was pleasantly surprised as they (all 5 lovely ladies & 2 tour leaders) turned up early at the hotel and arranged a customised Pho Bo breakfast (not part of the tour) for us. Certainly does go the extra mile to please customers. The tour guide was very enthusiastic (Thang if I recall correctly) and my motorbike driver, Mic was very entertaining. Had a very good tour around the city on the motorbike which is unique and covered more ground in 3 hours than we would have if we went on foot. Good introduction to Hanoi with the tour leader doing an amazing job over radio to the 5 of us on separate bikes. The food choices could perhaps be improved as I have tasted better food than what was given on the tour. The Vietnamese coffee stop was the highlight - in terms of meals. 1 Hang Manh & 49 Bat Dan should definitely be on the list. Lastly, I felt bad for the motorbike drivers as they had to wait for us in most of the food stops (except the last one) when they should be joining us at every stop. That way it would facilitate more interaction between the tour guides and the tourists.

Loved it!!!!. My husband and I booked a last minute motorbike morning tour with paloma, they were very accomodating and easy to deal with. The tour guide, Nam, arrived on time at our hotel and all the staff were very professional and friendly. All the staff made the experience what it was and we couldn't have asked anything more from them. It was an amazing way to see the city and we got to see some sights that we would've missed otherwise!!! We agree with other reviews that it would be good to do early in your stay as you can return to some of the sights later if you wish. It was fantastic trying local cuisine and having someone explaining the food and life of locals. Riding the motorbikes through the city is an experience in itself. Absolutely loved this tour and would highly recommend it.

Awesome motorbike tour in Hanoi!. We stumbled across Paloma by chance, and are so glad that we did! On our last day in Hanoi, we did a day time tour and it was a real highlight, and worth every cent. The historical and cultural narrative via headsets was very informative and quite fascinating. The tour around the old quarter was great and West Lake even better as we had not had a chance to see it before. The best would have to be going to local eateries though, and really feeling part of it all. The tour guide and riders were excellent, and I highly recommend, one of our highlights from our two week trip for sure, and definitely would do it again! I'd recommend doing it early in you stay if possible, as it gives you a really good overview of the place.

A great tour in Hanoi. We did this really great tour in Hanoi on the back of the guide's motorcycles on our first day. It was so much fun and it gives you a great overview of the city and local food. The guides are so nice and flexibles, making each trip a personalized experience.

Motorcycle off road tour. What an amazing trip ... from accommodation, sights etc (north western Vietnam.... ) Alans guides and backup crew were on their game all the way ! This trip is a must for all motorcycle enthusiasts...Thank you Alan

Vietnam in 9 DAYS...WOW!. This is a great experience. Sometimes it scares you because of the danger involved...but then you realize all you need to do is calm down and go slower.Stunning views, great crew!
Great!!. I really like it;) But i'm kind of hate it because it feel unsafe and scared. The staffs was friendly and doing their job.

Fabulous 6-day motorbike trip!. Alan and his team do a great job from start to finish, taking care of your every need. Very reliable and dedicated to your needs. If you want a great motorbike experience and want to see the real Vietnam, where you will meet very friendly locals that have rarely seen foreigners, along with some stunning scenery, then go with Vietnam Motorbike Tours. Allan's team will tailor make a tour based on your itinerary and level of experience. We did 6 days on dirt-bikes, riding 7-8hrs every day, covering over 1100 kms, and saw more interesting things then I can even begin to describe here. The "home stays" with local families are highly recommended! This is where you will experience true local hospitality. Amazing is all I can say!

Fantastic North Vietnam. We were 4 friends that planned this trip together for 10 months, building up expectations. And yes, our expectations were exceeded by a mile! Our route was to Ha Giang and lasted 6 days. Alan Chiens's service attitude and responsiveness at any time of the day for any questions we had was highly appreciated. Vuong Ngo's gwas our guide and he arranged everything for us on the trip. We could really enjoy the ride. The bikes were all in great condition. The route Vuong planned for us was good, a lot of small and hidden back roads. We could even have had more off-road! It starts and end with people and good service. North Vietnam has so much to offer and to see the people and country side from a motorbike gives a lot more. Highly recommended!

6 day Sa Pa trip. Me and my buddy did a six day motorbike tour to Sa Pa and back. We had a fantastic experience. Alan was very easy to communicate with organizing the tour and he was very flexible with our schedule. It was a real pleasure having Hoan as our guide. Great guides, excellent equipment and amazing riding. I look forward to coming back.

"Awesome experience". What a great experience. From the moment I spoke with Alan on the phone to arrange the tour right through to the finish it was such a pleasure to deal with real professionals. We decided to do the 5 day Ha Giang ride on Honda XR250L's which were great little bikes and suited the terrain perfectly. Mr Lee was our very knowledgeable guide for the tour, not only did he shows us around the countryside he answered all of our questions and met all of our needs, including having an icy cold beer for us every afternoon to wash the dust down. The accommodation was a mix of home stays and hotels, which all were very good. The food was also great and a few times we had requests, which was met with 'no problems'. The riding was superb, great terrain, very diverse and spectacular scenery. I would have no hesitation recommending Alan and his team for the ultimate motorbike tour. Thanks again Alan and Lee for making our tour such a great experience, we will be back.

5 day motorbike tour starting in Hanoi. Myself and six mates decided to head to Vietnam for a mates 40th birthday to celebrate with Vietnam motorbike tours. All I can say is WOW we all had an amazing time riding through the beautiful landscapes of this historic country. The veiws and sceanary was incredible, for me this is the only way to see Vietnam. The guide Lee was very professional and also his mechanic and driver of the support vechicle were all very helpful and fun to be around. At the end of each day we had the opportunity to sit around in very comfortable accommodation i.e. Home stays and hotels with a couple of ice cold beers and talk about the days ride with beautiful food. the experience was a lifetime full of memories. Also a big thanks to Mr Allan who is the owner of this amazing tours he had everything in place for us to worry about absolutely nothing at all but just to enjoy what was ahead of us. We will be back in a couple of years to do it all over again and would like to take the opportunity to thank Alan, Lee their mechanics and driver of the support Vechicle with these boys we all now have memories for a life time which we can't wait to get back and enjoy some more of this incredible fun. From myself and the boys. Cheers

Very professional company that makes sure you have a great time!. We decided to do a one day tour only as that was all that we could fit in on our (too) short 4 day trip to Hanoi. We had both never ridden motorbikes before but were looking for a challenge and some adventure, and also to see the real Hanoi... and we weren't disappointed! Alan was very helpful from the start re booking, etc. right until we came back exhausted from our day, chatting and having beers. We will definitely come back and do this again, but for a longer time, hopefully a 6 day'er. This is a great way to get outdoors and see the back country of Hanoi, get to eat some local food, and see some history along the way. I think everyone should do this as long as you are confident and looking for some fun! Just definitely take some sunscreen as we got stupidly burnt.. woops! Otherwise the day was amazing. Thanks Alan and Co. for a great day out. We will see you soon!

Absolutely Fantastic Company. I don't where to begin! When researching which company to chose there are many in Vietnam but from the moment I spoke with Alan on Viber I felt at ease.We decided on the 6 day Hi Giang which suited the budget and time frame I had. Thon is an absolute champion and very knowledgable with the region, answering all 'touristy' questions we had! Nothing was a problem and he bent over backwards for us from start to finish.The accommodation was fantastic and varied which makes you appreciate the different regions. Each morning Thon gave the brand new bikes a quick once over and sprayed a bit of chain lube before we headed out. The XR150's were a bit of an adjustment from what we are used to in Australia but did the trick.Thon let us set our own pace each day (fast and slow!!) depending on how many rice wines we had the night before and he even found a challenging trail he hadn't done before so we were quiet privileged.Stop and take as many or few photos as you like and Thon knows all the great spots to pull up for beautiful scenery shots and wicked GoPro footage.All in all, a fantastic professional company with relaxed feel, quality equipment, organised staff and very adaptable. I would be happy to recommend or answer any questions via message!See you next year boys, thanks again!!!!!!

9 Day North Vietnam Motorbike Tour. Absolutely Amazing Moto Tour. Will definitely come back again in the near future. The trip was so well organised. The bikes were perfect, Quality Honda's which were Brand New. Our guide Lee was fantastic. He was very knowledgeable, good rider, excellent english and good photographer. All the food we ate on the trip was top notch. Vietnam is such a beautiful county. This was by far the best Motorbike tour i have done. Ever. Fantastic trip with a bunch of mates. Thanks heaps Alan
a good way to travel. you go enjoy and discovery the city in th best way been have ... but be careful the traffick is crazy
Bike trip. I had a great time with great company and good guide but too short . Looking forward for the next Trip with Alan . They provide great bike , mine was brand new !

Vietnam SAPA 3 days MX tour . We had a wonderful riding experience in SAPA With Vietnam Motorbike tours. Everything there is a whole new world to explore . We have been well taken care of by our tour leader and guide .thank to Vietnam motorbike tours .3 days of riding tour is a bit too short . We eagerly wanting explore more . We will be back soon .good trip!

Wonderful Experience: Very Unique. The experience was wonderful through and through. From booking, throughout the tour, and even after.First, the owner Alan, was awesome to work with. I called last minute, the day before I arrived in Hanoi. Alan took time to meet me ahead of time and we even had some Pho and coffee when I arrived to plan the trip.During the trip, Tom was awesome. We covered a lot of ground together and Tom is a great rider. He captured some great footage and knew the terrain and towns very well. From mud, to gravel, to pavement, to dirt roads and single track trails, we had some great riding . We even had the chance to stop and watch a lightning storm. Thank you again Tom! The bikes were great, brand new Honda CRF250. Perfect bike for the tour, and easy to handle in Hanoi traffic on the way out and back.At the end of the trip, Tom and Alan and I hung out a little and they even recommended some cool things to do by my hotel. Alan, edited a custom video of my two days riding and sent it to me within a day after we were done. I would definitely go out again and do more than a two day tour. Can't wait until I am back in Vietnam!

Amazing 3 Day tour, total beginners.. My girlfriend and me did a 3 day tour, it was amazing. We were total beginners and were given high quality protective gear, plenty of time in the quite area by the office to get used to the bikes and a fantastic guide Tan. All of this made us feel as safe as possible. The tour itself was so much fun, perfect guide, friendly locals, incredibly scenery and great accommodation. Definitely the best way to see the Vietnamese landscape and get off the beaten track. Thanks so much Alan and Tan, can't wait to come back and try some bigger bikes and off road adventures!! :)

Excellent trip in north vietnam. The best way to visit Vietnam without any doubt. Everything very good organized and explained by the agency and our tour guide. Really nice experience for the places that we visited, the locals that we met, the food that we tasted, etc.Totally recommendable.

An amazing one-day scooter trip. I was traveling with two other friends in Hanoi this August, and this one day scooter trip has become the high light of the all. We didn't want to only see the city in Vietnam but also its beautiful countryside and natural landscape. I talked to Alan, who was also our tour guide, on Skype and he recommended us this one day trip, which is a perfect fit for beginners and who only have limited budget and time. As it was a rainy day in Hanoi, we were a bit worried about the trip. But we soon got to enjoy our ride after we met Alan and got fully protected by his well-maintained equipment. Before the main trip, we had a chance to practice our driving skills with the scooters, which were all well maintained. We soon started off to the countryside, and the rain stopped. The road type on the trip was very diverse including high way, concrete countryside roads, muddy small roads in the rice fields, mountain and coastal road etc. On the trip we also visited an ancient temple and Alan was very knowledgable and able to answer all the questions about the local culture and history. The lunch was perfect with all the varieties of meat and vegetable and was offered in a family style village house. (It was a unesco village.) The view on the trip was fantastic with the mountains, old villages, rivers, rice fields, bridges etc.The tour guide is responsive, skillful, friendly and speaks perfect English. I highly recommend this trip if you want to have an understanding of the countryside in Vietnam and you only have limited time and experience in motorcycle. They also have longer trips too.

Excellent trip around North Vietnam on bikes . I thought the trip was great. It was something different. The tour guide, Vuong Ngo was excellent showing us around and looking after us. Allen made the whole process easy, organizing it all. The bikes were excellent and I'd do it all again.

Book at trip with Alan - Fantastic adventure!. This was the most fun thing we did in all of Vietnam, hands down! My wife had very little experience on two wheels, and was nervous in general driving around Vietnam. I explained this to Alan, and he designed a day trip for the two of us around showing her how fun the independence of a motorcycle is! She took a fully automatic scooter and I hopped on a CRF250. We spent the whole day traveling through the country side, both off and on road, and seeing, smelling, and feeling amazing things. We even got to experience some hectic Vietnam traffic on the way home, with Alan leading/blocking for us. Overall, highly recommended for a few things: flexibility of payment methods, taking the wife on a training run in the morning to make sure she was comfortable, taking tons of photos/videos all day and providing them within 24hrs, supplying clothes and shoes, bikes in great condition, quality of route, frequency of breaks, giving us beers after a long day on the bike, and most of all the great attitude.

Off the beaten path with Alan. My friend and I booked a one day tour with Vietnam Motor Bikes. Our guide was Alan, who was an enthusiastic tour guide and a patient teacher. He taught us how to ride 125cc Honda scooters and we took off for the country side. Alan tailors each ride to the riders' experience levels. He took us through back roads that were fun but challenging. It was a perfect ride for two beginners who wanted to develop their riding skills. While on the tour, we saw temples that you would expect to see on a bus tour of the countryside around Hanoi. We also saw small villages and countryside that are inaccessible by bus and too far to reach by pedal bike. I'd recommend this tour to anyone. Alan is a pleasure to work with.

Honeymoon Vietnam off road adventure. Being on our honeymoon and an experienced enduro rider, I thought it would be nice to introduce my wife into the ways of off-roading.Alan, with his boundless energy and local knowledge put together a route that was challenging enough to entertain but no scare my newbie pillion.Highlights were;- brand new bike (CRF250 Honda)- plenty stops for snacks and the amazing Vietnamese coffee- cultural stops visiting a 1000 year old pagoda and a Buddhist temple- the incredible lunch which way outstripped expectations- being on the edge of Hanoi allowing us to 'dip our toes' into the waters of Hanoi rush hour traffic - an experience not to be missed for the assertive rider!- Alan, who was funny, knowledgable about the culture, professional and just plain great host. Not to mention cameraman (he never misses a photo opportunity!)- visiting the paddy fields and working areas along with all the wild life that you could ONLY ever experience as a tourist by dirtbike (you'd never get to these places on any other means of transport other than foot)- Sharing a mini- keg of beer at the end of the day and laughing about the days goings on.Overall, the best day out you could imagine. From meeting Alan over a coffee in the morning to sharing a beer at the end of the day. And ... My wife Karen loved her first motorcycle pillion experience. Looks like a touring trailie could be required soon!(And a trip back with some mates to take on some more extreme terrain)Cheers Alan, top job!

Best motorcycle tour in Vietnam . I found Vietnam Motorbike tour Asia when I did a Google search last year. I got to ride just last week in the northern part of the country. Wow, what a beautiful time visiting with my guide Lee and the awesome people who I came in contact with. The best riding I have ever had, both paved and off road. I hope to come back next year and do some riding south of Hanoi. New bikes to rent, no worries about anything breaking down. Highly recommended for an adventure of a lifetime!!

Off road with Alan . Once in a lifetime experience. Spent a full day with Alan riding brand new Honda dirt bike for the full day. I never had an experience like this. Alan is so full of energy and he made a beautiful route through paddy fields and quaint villages. And on the tip of that he produced a wonderful video through his GoPro. Alan you are an amazing person. You should seriously raise your rates. I could have paid double of what I paid for this experience. Arvind

A fun daytrip to the countryside of Hanoi. We only had a few days in Hanoi and decided to book a daytour. This tour was one of the highlights from our time in Vietnam and I highly recommend it! Our group had limited scooter experience and were allowed to take a couple of trips around the blocks to get used to it before the trip. During the trip, we drove through villages, rice fields and stopped at different cultural places - places you would not be have visited otherwise. This was a great day and Alan, our guide, was professional and knowledgeable. The tour was well-organized and well worth the money! :)
Nice but better to drive in rural area. motor bike is nice, but it would be dangerous for non-accustomed persons in big-cities drive in Vietnam.

Excellent 6 Days, north to Sapa and back to Hanoi. Tom our guide must be acknowledged as one of the best guides my wife and I have had the opportunity to travel with. He selected roads to match our riding skills and never failed to order the perfect lunch and dinner. Very accommodating, very attentive. Thank you Tom!Alan is a top notch planner and communicator. His bikes are current and in great shape. He also offers a good selection of riding gear should you decide to travel without your own gear or forget something. Our trip was a 6 day loop from Hanoi to Sapa. Traveling by motorbike, I don't think there is a better way to experience the scenery, people and culture that the Vietnam countryside has to offer. Small village stops for coffee in the morning, cool drinks throughout the day and simple but incredible lunches. Home stays with local families top off the cultural experience.Other than a really sore backside after 6 days..... There is nothing about this trip that did not exceed our expectations.Thanks Alan, hope to see you soon.

Female rider solo tour of Hanoi countryside. I was a little nervous at first but I need not have worried. Alan took me out for an excellent day's riding to the west of Hanoi in the beautiful countryside. It was my first time riding off road on a dirt bike and apart from having slightly longer legs :-), I couldn't have wished for a better day. I felt like I got to see real Hanoian life and drove through villages and beautiful scenery. I also saw some cultural places too and the food was excellent. It really was a great day and Alan my guide was very patient with my slow off road driving! I will def be booking with this company again, although I think I will stick to tarmac! lol. Hanoi to Saigon road trip, here we go! :-)Come on ladies.....get on yer bikes! :-)

Wonderful tour of northern Vietnam. Fantastic eight day tour on Honda 250 trail bikes. Saw things we would never have found on an unaccompanied tour. Our guide, Thon, was a great rider and really friendly.One of the reasons to recommend this particular operator is the quality of the bikes. Mine was brand new. 250s are rare in Vietnam and having more power than the millions of 125s is definitely a safety advantage. And you definitely need a safety advantage!!
Best day ever!. I booked this trip for my husband, he had an amazing day! He was given a brand new bike to ride and got to see the countryside of Hanoi that most don't. Amazing. Highly recommend

4 day Motorbike tour departing from Hanoi and traveling through the northern countryside. This was an experience and adventure of a lifetime! I did the 4 day motorbike tour departing from Hanoi and it was definitely the highlight of my two weeks spent in Southeast Asia. Lee was my guide and did a fantastic job of organizing our days - whether it was the little known, beautiful back roads we took, the places we would stop for lunch, or just recognizing when I needed a break for a cold glass of water. The service and level of attention to detail was excellent. I would highly recommend them.
North vietnam motorbike tour. . I love this place. These guys are awesome. Johnny and fook are great. I highly recommend this company to anyone who loves adventure and motor bike.

Very funny and exciting motor trip. It's a very good experience to ride a motor bike round Ha Noi. Our guide Alan is very nice and helpful. All the motorbikes are brand new and function very well. Overall the trip is very funny and would recommend all of you to try.

The Way you go into Local Vietnam Honoi. If you want to free style and travel Vietnam in a cool local style, this is the way, a recommended method for doing so.You may consider the cost of the trip a bit higher than other local bike tour, but you will find it worth as the Motorbikes are really brand new!Mr Alan, the guide also the founder of this motorbike tour dose serve the best to the people who desire a better motorbike trip. one example is here that he would contact you from the day one you are interested and left an email to their company. Alan did called an international call to me for the trip advise, and thus, I can even ask him for the Whole Vietnam trip information, THIS IS MORE THAN ONLY a MOTORBIKE TOUR, but a comprehensive one.I recommend this to my friends and to you. I wish to come again for a longer journey with Alan. Thanks.

Day journey into the country side. As a solo female traveler, I cannot say enough positive things about this company, and Alan in particular. I was in Hanoi and having a hard time adjusting to the time difference so I was on Trip Advisor looking for what I was going to do when the sun came up. I stumbled on to this and knew I wanted to do it. Most companies in Hanoi will allow you to be passengers but here you can actually operate your own vehicle. I emailed Alan that morning and was pleasantly surprised with quick emails and a plan for the day ahead. Alan called my hotel and even spoke to the cab driver to ensure I got to where I needed to go to meet up with him at his shop. We spent the day riding around the country side and stopping at various locations to eat and drink (all included with the price!)We rounded out our day with a swim at a local beach on the Red River where it began to rain a little and a beautiful rainbow followed us for the rest of our ride home. The rain, the traffic, the country, the people were all things I wouldn't have been able to see without this amazing opportunity. Now that I am back home in the States, it is still one of my biggest highlights of the trip, next time I will make it longer, I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone, with any experience. I had grown up on dirt bikes but after years of not using a clutch I actually had a hard time getting back into it, so we both decided to be on the safe side and I rode an automatic scooter, and it was a blast knowing I was safe and in control. I don't feel like I missed out on much. A true highlight of my time in Vietnam. THANK YOU ALAN!

Very nice and professional service. If you want a real experience how bike trip will be, come to this company. They will help you to pick up very nice route and give you unforgettable moment! Suggested to my friends!!

DRIVE A MOTORBIKE!. I drove a motorbike in Hanoi - probably the busiest places in the world to ride one and it was one of my highlights in the city. It was so amazing to really weave into their culture and do as the locals do. Remember to put your left foot down and not your right when you approach a stop light...you may get yelled at otherwise (and for good reason)!

Motor bike day trip from Hanoi to Duong Lam. The team (Alan and Sy) are exceptional. They treated me like family during and after the trip. I did the 1 day trip to Duong Lam (a historic village) and back along the Red River north west of Hanoi. The route they created is exceptional. You won't see tourists and it's very authentic in terms of the sites and stops for morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea. The route goes mostly off-road and therefore going by car can't compete with what you'll see by bike. It's a great compact way to see a whole lot of VN in one day. I personally found the route along the flood bank of the red river back to Hanoi just as interesting as the countryside and villages we visited. The bikes are top notch and new. I highly recommend this trip and you will be in great hands. They speak very good English.

If you have ANY questions, do not hesitate to reach out to this company!. A+ on just pre-trip details, logistics, and answering questions!I have never been so impressed with the response and communication of a company that I felt I needed to write a review BEFORE going on the trip. If our 2 day trip that we just booked through Alan is anything like the high level of communication and preparation he has shown us already, I know my wife and I will be experiencing nothing but the best. I will update this post or write another post following our experience.

Amazing Experience!. I did a 1 day tour with Alan as my guide. It was well thought out and a great way to see and experience Hanoi. We had no trouble with booking or finding the place, and it was easy enough to pick up scootering even though I had little experience. Helmets, elbow pads, and knee pads are also provided for extra protection.Alan was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. You definitely get to see Hanoi from a more local perspective with this tour. It was one of the highlights of my stay in Hanoi and I highly recommend it!Thanks Alan!

Fantastic Day to West Hanoi. I only had two days in Vietnam and spent one full day with Alan on this tour to West Hanoi. It could not have been any better and I will definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see the beautiful countryside scenery avoiding the tourist crowd. We visited two pagodas and one Unesco local residence house with 400 year history, had coffee breaks and fresh Bia Hoi, and experienced the busy Hanoi rush hour traffic. The tour is worth every second and every penny! I have never ride a dirt bike before and only had scooter experience. On the day, Alan patiently tutored me on how to start the bike and how to change gear and we head to the road after I learnt how to ride. But for non-motorbike riders, the shop has scooters available as well, for a more relaxed ride. Strongly recommended!!!

Best way to experience Hanoi. My boyfriend and I decided very last minute to sign up for a day of motor biking on the outskirts of Hanoi. Alan was very quick to respond to emails and answer all of our questions. We would ride the following day with Alad and one other rider. We stayed in the old quarter and getting to Alan's shop required a 30 min taxi ride (plan for between $5 and $8 depending on traffic, Uber is a cheaper option). Make sure you have some way of contacting Alan on the way...his shop is a little tricky to find.Before setting off we chose our bikes and gear (he has autos for those not comfortable on manual bikes but this limits the terrain you can ride through). We had about 15 min to ride around a quiet block to get comfortable with the bikes before setting off. We had a fantastic time atop 125cc dirt bikes, riding through rice patties and local streets and alleyways (complete with cows, geese, buffalo, kids), and last but not least full on Hanoi traffic!There were many stops, for example a visit to a 1000 yr old temple, a delicious lunch in a UNESCO designated house, a roadside stop to watch people at work planting rice, not to mention a few refreshments along the way (coconut, Bia Hoi). Alan was friendly, knowledgable, and took great pictures and videos of our ride. The bikes were in fantastic condition, as was other gear (helmets, gloves, and optional shin and arm guards). We were a group of three, all with limited dirt bike experience (my friend and I had taken a two-day course several months ago, that was the extent of our dirt bike experience), and so Alan kept the route at a level we could all manage. A word of warning however: no matter your level, any ride in and out of Hanoi requires spending about an hour riding through city traffic...I found this quite challenging and a bit terrifying. In the end it was exciting, I did just fine, and I'm so happy I got to experience being part of the crowd of motorbikes on the road. But before you sign up make sure you're aware of this and comfortable with the risk. Thanks so much Alan for a memorable day, one of our best in Vietnam!

Excellent Choice for Motorbike Tour. My friend and I wanted to take a day trip from Hanoi. We contacted Alan last minute and he was able to arrange a day tour of the countryside for us. Having never ridden motorbikes before, my friend and I were both a bit apprehensive. Hanoi traffic can be intimidating to say the least.We met Alan bright and early. His shop is on the outskirts of town near the university. It's a much quieter part of town and a great place to learn. He matched me up with a manual bike, and my friend with an automatic. After some quick lessons and a bit of practice in the area around his shop, we were on the road within 30 minutes.Our day was fantastic. Alan took time to explain all of the sights and to answer all of our questions. We had a fantastic lunch in a small village, saw some temples, and enjoyed a great ride. We finished our trip at a small eatery near his shop for some snacks and beers.Definitely the highlight of our trip. Alan is a stand up guy (and a great photographer), the bikes were in great shape, and the countryside was stunning. Will definitely be looking to do another ride to Sapa should I find myself returning to Vietnam.Thanks Alan!!

Could not have been any better!. Going on a motorbike tour was a completely last minute decision for me. I left my last day in Hanoi unplanned, and on my ride home from Halong Bay, second to last day, I was scrolling through 'Things to Do' in Hanoi. I love a little adventure, and wanted to get outside of Hanoi and see a bit more of the countryside. I shot Alan a message, and was surprised to get a response within minutes. Booking with Alan was easy - he's very organized and succinct, and a great virtual communicator. Alan walked me through my bike options, and sent me details and cost of a one day trip. He did not require any deposit, just a 'yes,' and we made a plan to meet the following morning. The heat is intense this time of year, so we decided to meet very early, and get on our way. Alan did a great job of coordinating with my uber driver to ensure I got dropped off in the right place. He was ready to go when I arrived.Alan himself is a great guy - he's got a youthful energetic spirit, and is very enthusiastic about motorbikes. He was pretty excited to get me out on his new 2017 250cc Honda. He's also a bit of a character - he's quite into dressing up and taking funny pictures. As a result, he ended up hauling funny kids rice hats and toy spears all the way into the country side so we could do a funny photo shoot - not really my thing, but it was quite endearing how serious he was about it. Sadly, the hats didn't survive the journey back into Hanoi, as they got pulverized in his tire.The trip itself was awesome - I'm not a huge biker, but have definitely ridden bikes before. That said, navigating Hanoi morning traffic was a thrilling experience in itself. Alan is extremely conscious of his riders, he literally turned back to check on me about every 30 seconds. As chaotic as it was in the city, I always felt well looked after and very safe.The ride through the countryside was great. We made serveral stops to get local tea and coffee, and had one of the best meals for lunch that I had while in Vietnam. The heat was brutal, but that's Vietnam in June! I really loved my experience with Alan and Vietnam Motorbike Tours, and am actually considering a longer trip with him. I'd definitely recommend this, even for the not-so-serious rider, it's such a great and exciting way to get out of Hanoi and see the country a bit.

Fantastic days in Sapa. Alan and Lee prepared a fantastic and customized tour around Sapa for me and my girlfriend. It is incredible how many places you can visit in one single day by motorbike, since waterfalls to caves seeing local villages, riding around rice fields, bridges, off road paths... an authentic vision of the deep Vietnam completely recommendable.We had the opportunity to do a Homestay with a family in a traditional house at a local village in the middle of the valley. So nice to get in contact with locals and experience a bit they way of life. Also we had the change to go to a local spa where they use water at 40ºC with medicinal herbs to have the best relaxing experience after a workout day on the bike.Definitely for our next visit to Vietnam we would love to repeat for more days.PROS: Everything!!! Off-road paths, hidden villages, real local food (delicious), local Spa, contact with locals, homestay, Lee (tour guide), GOPRO videos provided (with high quality), actually every minute was an awesome experience.CONS: Too short, we had only 2 days. Next time I would spend at least 10!!!Don't be afraid if your riding skills are low, After 10 minutes on the bike you'll feel really comfortable. After 1 day you can't wait for more.Thanks to Alan and Lee for your effort.

Highly recommend . Fantastic 4 days in North Vietnam with our guide Qyunh. Top quality bikes -- brand new 250cc Honda for me and 150cc for my fiancée. Well organised schedule, mixing on and off road through countryside and mountain passes, and great local accommodation (and rice wine!). Fantastically well looked after throughout, particularly as we aren't the most experienced riders. They supply Go Pro with guide but take your own gear if you have it. Looking forward to the vid and the Facebook Group. Overall a great adventure, enjoyed hanging out with other riders in the evening and top quality outfit to ride with. Alan, Quynh and team are top blokes too. Highly recommend both the tour and Vietnam Motorbike Tours.

2 Days in Sapa. I spend 2 Days in Sapa with my Boyfriend doing a Motorbike tour. Alan and Lee, managed to send the Bikes to Sapa for us, and Organized in a very little time an awesome tour around Sapa. The tour was totally adjusted to us, when you ride an off-road bike you need to be aware of the risks and your riding skills. Lee made a super nice personalized tour accordingly to our riding skills. We saw Towns, Rivers, Caves, Main Roads, little Roads and off-Road paths.We slept in home stay with a local family and we had and awesome shower in the public baths near the house in a very little town, we did not see a single tourist around. I've been traveling many years in many countries, and I found that this tour was totally different from the others, so we did experience more real Vietnam. If I can repeat again I would definitely take a much longer tour, so it finished so fast.

Best adventure. I have just returned from a 6 day ride from Hanoi to Sapa. This has been an amazing trip with my sister and father. The views and people were tremendously friendly. A few homestays along the way which made the experience all the better. Ive learned so much from this adventure. The organiser Alan was extremely accommodating and friendly. Our guide Hoan made it an absolute pleasure, he has alot of knowledge and great humor! The bikes were maintained well and were comfortable, the roads along the way were a well mix of easy dirt/offroad and also tarmac. The whole experience will stay with me forever. I'm looking forward to another adventure with you guys in the future! Highly recommended.

April, Hanoi to Hai Giang. As a technical novice i was a little apprehensive about the tour but from the outset Alan and Lee were helpful and informative.The experience of riding through and out of Hanoi was one i will never forget and the contrast of where we started to where we stayed that night (the home stay) was remarkable.From then on the scenery was immaculate, and i am not your typical scenery chaser.The riding was fun without being too challenging and Lee was an excellent guide who showed remarkable patience.It is definitely the most personal way to see such a beautiful country and would recommend to anyone.David Fenton

Hanoi Bikers Vietnam - 5 day bike tour through North Vietnam. Sensational......couldnt recommend it enough!!!Both Alan and Lee couldnt do enough to help. The bikes were well maintained and problem free and the tour was very well organised. Lee made every effort to make sure we had a great ride.All the accomodation was very good - particularly the homestay on the first night. The scenary is breath taking and when riding into some of the villages it is like a picture out of National Geographic’s. If there is one thing I would recommend is add an additional day and have a rest day in the middle to enable you to have a bit of a relax or just do some short tracks around the local area.Lee apologies for being late every single morning! Alan thanks again mate for all your assistance and effort - It really was a brilliant trip.CheersChris

Hanoi - Ban Gioc Waterfall - Hanoi. We knew this would be a great trip when we were given our bikes on day 1 (brand new Honda CR250's). After this the trip just got better as the roads, scenery, accommodation, food and organisation were all superb. We used Vietnam Motorbike Tours 2 years ago and were so impressed we went back for more. If you like motorbike adventures then this is the company for you! Highly recommended.

Excellent way to see northern Vietnam. I just concluded a six-day motorcycle tour from Hanoi to Sapa and back. It was fantastic -- beautiful scenery, well-maintained and comfortable bike, a great guide (Vung). One definite highlight was the homestay in the Dzao village. I also loved riding on the smaller roads and trying a bit of light off-roading. I was travelling solo and had never ridden a manual motorcycle before this trip. Vung gave me some helpful tips and was patient with me throughout the journey, and he even snapped a bunch of cool photos and video with his iPhone and GoPro. Alan, Vung, & Co. are solid, honest, good people, and I would highly recommend their business.

7 Glorious Days in Vietnam. What originally was meant to be a 4-man trip down the Ho Chi Minh trail ended up just myself and a buddy. Regardless, Alan gave us his full attention when booking and coordinating the trip.Our tour guide was Lee, who was absolutely fantastic and chose some fantastic roads and routes for us from Hanoi to Hoi An. We had a couple of days of hard riding up front, but that allowed us a great balance of riding and sightseeing. He was friendly, great to hang out with, and generally very open to everything. My favorite part of the experience was the degree of flexibility we were able to have. Midway through we changed the route to visit the seaside, and shorten our time in Hue to spend more time in Hoian (which I recommend). Lee was very open to all of this, and there was obviously quite a bit of support going on in the background, as we were seamlessly checked into hotels the whole way through.The bikes we rode were great (the crf 250s) and well maintained. They obviously have great pride about their bikes, and it's unusual to see 250cc dirt bikes this well maintained in Vietnam.Will definitely be coming back, next time for the gorgeous looking off-road in Northern Vietnam.

See the countryside of Vietnam. The tour guide for the motorbike trip was excellent. He was able to keep the ride broken up with frequent stops for water, food and photographs. Also, the home stays arranged were inviting and comfortable. The tour was well organized and motorbikes in excellent condition. I would highly recommend this experience for anyone seeking to see the countryside of Vietnam. Adding to this, it was the first time I was on a motorbike.

Fantastic Day!. I can't rate this tour high enough! I did the 1 day countryside tour with Alan Chien and had a fabulous time. I not a confident rider but Alan looked after me giving me advice and by the end of it I was weaving my way through the chaotic traffic and intersections if Hanoi city.I got to spend a lot of time riding on different surfaces, including muddy tracks, gravel, sand and roads. Alan takes lots of photos and makes a video for you, ensuring you can share this amazing experience with others.Everyone should try this. You won't be disappointed!

Ideal way to experience Vietnam. 3-4 day 600 kilo tripMy well-traveled buddy signed up our group of 3 for this trip having zero experience on a clutch motorbike himself. We had no idea what to expect about 1) Vietnam 2) motorbiking through a new country, which began in the intimidating hyper-cycle town of Hanoi and 3) "homestays". I must say the owner Alan and our personal guide Heon made us feel comfortable and relaxed every step of the way... minus the Hanoi rush-hour traffic, which they tried to avoid! Vietnam is a breathtakingly beautiful country with a contrastingly gorgeous countryside opposite the bustling city of Hanoi. There was something about gliding through the streets and side roads on a motorbike that magnified that experience. I felt like I was a more connected part of the city and the villages, not just a passer-by on a bus staring out a window on a foreign land. After a few hours of "sea-legs" on the motorbike, the shifting, the throttle, the brakes all became second nature and I began to enjoy the sites more acutely. And just when your buns begin to tire from the saddle, you park your bike at a HOMESTAY, shower and enjoy home cooked fresh Vietnamese cuisine. We would call it "farm-to-table" in the states, but in Vietnam, the family grows the rice/veggies/meat, harvests, prepares, cooks and serves it up to guests daily just like they do for themselves. It's an incredible way to experience family, culture, food, village-life, and an entirely authentic Vietnamese slice of life. (Including Heon's wonderful family where we had the best food, rice wine and enjoyable overall overnight experience) I've run on enough about this, but I've told everyone that will listen in the states about my trip, and I cannot wait until my next longer, more rural trip with Alan, Heon and the gang. Alan & Heon (and all your support staff), you've captured magic in a bottle, keep it up!! Sincerely,Jeremy

Honestly recommended. We had a 9 Day tour to the North of Vietnam: From the start to the end all is verry well organised. The Hotels and homestays where all fine and the Guide was always supporting and planed in advance so it all was a pleasure. We had a lot to lough during our Offroad and after when we relaxed us at the villages and homestays. The bikes where well maintained . Many thanks to Alan and his team . TIP: visit the north in October when all the rice fields are golden.

9 day northern tour. Well organized trip led by our guide Hoan. Ate local food at local village venues and nobody got sick ! Accommodation at hotels and homestays was acceptable. The route included some challenging dirt tracks, steep climbs across mountains, river and lake crossings by boat, some excellent road riding. I'll be back. Keith

Off the beaten track!. Our 3 bike motorbike tour was splendid. Our guide knew all the twists and turns as we snaked through and around the water buffalo, goats, chickens and 22 wheeled trucks. Our guide kept an easy, sensible pace and was always professional and supportive. The lodgings were homestays--very comfortable and friendly with tasty Vietnamese food. Thank you Vietnam Motorbike Tours! :)

16 Day north to south Vietnam motorbike tour. i liked my trip round the north so much last time,i came back to do it again and added on the Ho Chi Min Road this time. My guide,I made sure i got the same guide,Lee again. A lovely guy who i still keep in touch with. Ill be back in a few years once my son is old enough to ride

Alan is awesome. Just did a one day countryside tour with Alan, and it was really great! I came in with 2 days of motorbike experience, and feel like I gained a few months' worth :) This was a much more real sense of Hanoi than I got in the old quarter. Endless rice fields, ducks, dogs, super friendly people along the way - I loved the feel of it. Alan took me down a few easy but fun off road trails, and knew all the roads very well, so I felt like I was in good hands the whole time. And he was patient and helpful with navigating, making the route back as easy as possible (the last 30 min getting back to the city are a bit tense because of city traffic, but manageable - you'll feel accomplished by the end). The bike was pretty much new, in excellent condition and comfortable, which helped a lot - infinitely better than the standard motorbike rental fare.
