Alan is a really knowledgeable, thoughtful and friendly guide. He takes awesome photos and GoPro movies, too :) I'll definitely be back for a longer tour!

9 Day Motorbike Tour - North Vietnam. This was the first time I had done anything like this in my life I have ridden bikes all of my life but nothing like this, I knew the planning that goes into organising a trip like this would have to be spot on so my first contact with Alan proved that this was a well organised trip run by very experience people and every detail had and would be looked after. The contact with Allen from day one was excellent and always made contact with me to make sure I was ok. So from day one of the trip I felt very comfortable and was pleased with what we were about to do and it was a trip of a life time!! From time Cuong picked me up at the hotel to the time he dropped me off I had the time of my life. Coung was the best guide and looked after every need we had his local knowledge is second to none and we went to places most people wont get to see, the accommodation was excellent and the local food was beautiful. If you haven't ridden a bike before in heavy traffic then you need to practice before you arrive because it can be a bit over whelming but the guides will get you through. If you ever want to test yourself and put yourself out of your comfort zone and still have an amazing trip then this is for you. The bikes are in excellent condition and we did 1500klms and only had two flat tyres so they are very reliable and you also have a very good mechanic with you as well. I will be heading back within the next year to do it all again. Thanks Alan for a great trip!!

9 Day Tour. Just back from a great 9 day tour of northern Vietnam, organised by Alan Tour. We were a group of 6 plus a very knowledgable tour leader and a highly competent mechanic, riding a a rear gunner at the back of the group.Initially we headed west out of Hanoi and towards Laos and soon picked up some great mountain roads. Cold for the first few days in the mountains but by the time we reached Sapa and nearer the Chinese border the riding conditions were ideal with sunshine, challenging back roads and fabulous mountain scenery.Heading east and tracking near to the China border the mountain scenery becomes even more dramatic with unique geogological rock formations and everywhere hardworking small colourful communities scratching a meagre living from the hostile terrain.Communication, route finding, local meals, accommodation etc are all sorted out in an efficient and friendly way by our excellent Vietnamese tour guides.Highlights were Sapa with its dramatic tea plantations plus cable car to the indochina highest peak, visit to the China border at Lao Cai, miles of off road tracks around Dong Vang, river crossings , time with the remote mountain communities and an early morning cruise on the amazing Ba Be lake.Alan Tours are a great company for a motorbike adventure trip! highly recommended, Jerry.

Best Ever. This was our fist experience of Asia, it will not be our last!Everything went to plan........Alan's company came highly recommended, we weren't disappointedWe had a ball, our guide was a "Belter"I can only say.... "Go For It" book now and see for yourself, I'm still grinning from ear to ear weeks after I've arrived back homeThis is a 10/10 experience "Thanks to all @ Vietnam Motorcycle Tours"Steve Clark from Scotland

9 Day Motorbike Tour - North Vietnam. This was the second motorcycle tour with Alan. There were 6 of us, plus our guide Cuong and mechanic Tu. The north of Vietnam is a very stunning place from the scenery point of view. The mountains are beautiful and rival many mountains in the world. The roads we were on are challenging and not boring. Cuong is very knowledgeable about the roads and we did about 20% off road. The accommodation along the trip were very good. After the trip 4 of us went to Ho Chi Minh city for 3 days of sightseeing. It was all arranges by Alan which made the traveling easy. Everything went smoothly so you could enjoy Vietnam and not worry about the details. I highly recommend Alan to anyone wanting to visit Vietnam. Touring on motorcycle is the only way to see it all.

9 Day Motorcycle Tour of North Vietnam. Our recent 9 day tour was set up by Alan extremely thoroughly and carried out superbly by our Guide and Mechanic, Cuong and To, who catered to the needs of our group of 6 with as much consideration as you could wish for. Nothing was too much trouble, regardless of the circumstances.We saw the most beautiful, hidden parts of Vietnam conceivable and met the friendliest local folk, that most likely 99% of other tourists could not imagine (or get to without an off road bike?) and overall, it was an exhilarating experience, one that I hope to repeat in future, if only for the nightly "Special Water" rice wine!Neil Martin - UK

Hands down- one of the BEST experience in Hanoi. MUST TRY! 2 day tour was not enough. Alan was amazing to book with. He worked with us and provided a quick response in quote. No hidden fees, very convenient to pay the deposit up front and allowed us to pay the rest on the day of. You can tell he cares a lot about his business and the customer service is top notch.We were very lucky in having Vuong as our tour guide. I use the term tour guide loosely as I felt more that he was an old local friend who was showing us around! Vuong picked us up from the hotel and even brought us to an amazing coffee shop by their office. We got to meet the team and try a local breakfast. They also educated us on the different coffee grades in Vietnam.Once we arrived, they got us equipped with riding gear and assessed our riding abilities. We had 3 guys who were fine and 2 girls who were complete newbies. Us gals determined that we did not feel 100% confident in riding in the rain during Tet Traffic so Vuong allowed for us to ride along as passengers. (VERY NICE as I know 6 hours with a passenger can be rough haha) We embarked on our 2 Day journey to Mai Chau for a homestay.Once we got out of city traffic, Vuong knew the back ways to get to Mai Chau. It was BEAUTIFUL and so scenic. Very enjoyable. I went in winter so it was actually pretty cold. They are very good about answering questions so feel free to ask what you should pack and expect.Vuong is funny as heck. It was really great having him as he is so well informed but also has a great sense of humor. We went dirt biking a bit as the rain provided us with some nice mud to play with. VERY FUN! We also loved the fact that he is very go with the flow and always asks what you prefer to do. The food and coffee stops along the way are also quite good! We got to eat with the locals eat and they do ask you of any preferences or cravings if you have any. Being Vietnamese, it was really comforting to see the home cooked meals at the home stay.When we arrived to Mai Chau, we were given the option of staying in the home stay or doing the hotel for $30 more. DO THE HOMESTAY! Pics below. We did both and I will tell you that the homestay area was far more comfortable than it looked. The blankets provided are super nice and toasty, wifi was stronger out there, the experience itself is just fun and the bathroom is NEW and clean! The only thing is on the 2 day trip, I don't feel like it was a true homestay as you aren't necessarily staying with a family but you do get wonderful service. The staff made sure you were happy and fed! You were still getting authentic food and they also gave us the sweet rice that is cooking in the bamboo- hard to find in the city! Breakfast was amazing too- they made delicious Vietnamese Banana Pancakes and we never had those in the city either!Vuong was not only a great and versed rider, but he doubles as your photographer also. He took GoPro footage for us and they make sure to get you the footage immediately after the trip. He also has an amazing eye for angles and took some breathtaking shots for us.Bike Quality- GREAT! Very safe and you can tell they take care of themTour Quality- Wish we were able to do it longer and go to Sapa! We are all going back for a longer trip and added it to the bucket list!Vuong Quality- 10. Like I said, the dude is amazing.Food Quality- Really good and nice that they were included in pricingI will note, this was a pretty long ride but to me it was worth it! They will often ask if you need breaks along the way or if you want to just stop and look at stuff. The guys enjoyed the trip thoroughly and had a ton of fun.

The only way to truly see Vietnam. In a word, amazing. Had an epic time with Alan exploring country side Vietnam. From the chaotic rush hour traffic of Hanoi (by request of course) to the peaceful lush rice field farms. Alan was always cheerful, enthusiastic and made every effort to make riding second nature in such a foreign environment. I even got a taste of local sweets, drinks and food - all included. Highly recommend this tour. Well maintained bikes that are practically brand new, can't go wrong.

One day country side tour of Hanoi! . Had an excellent time with Alan seeing the rice fields on the outskirts of Hanoi. The bikes were practically brand new and very well maintained and cared for. Alan knew all the right trails and little spots along the way. Definitely a day well spent!
Five Stars. Great day long tour with Alan. He showed us Hanoi like no one else could. I would definitely use Alan and his company again.

6 day on road Motor bike adventure. We chose this company above others as they could tailor a package to suit my husband and I. Alan was fantastic at answering all our queries quickly and completely. We did the 6 day ride from Hanoi up through Sa Pa. Our guide Huan really looked after us and was able to answer our million questions. The home stays were a highlight and were accompanied with walks around the village and rice paddys. Both our bikes were late models and in good condition. It was a memorable experience and one that we thoroughly recommend.

Excellent program with great adventures.. My expectations for this trip were high, and the were met! I had browsed through the different companies providing this kind of trip in Vietnam, and i fell for the new CRF250L-bikes this company offered. The program was well planned with lots of riding, on and off-road. Bumpy gravel roads, mountain trails, river crossings, hairy single-tracks, you name it. This eleven day trip had it all. And the scenery, amazing, it changed every day. The hospitality and friendliness of the Vietnamese people were surprisingly high, always smiling and waving.Our guide, Lee, was able to tailor our trip so we could get the most out of it.I rarely write these kind of reviews, but i feel i owe it to these people who made this trip possible for me and my friends. They did a stellar job!

Trip of a lifetime. If you're looking for the trip of a lifetime with real adventure. This is it. This is Vietnam you will never be able to see any other way. Bikes - CRF 250's are perfect for this trip with endless trail opportunities.Guide - Lee was amazing, funny, always engaged with the group and became a real friend by the end of the trip. He took us to places only accessible with these bikes.Food - excellent and plenty of it.Accommodation - a good mix of home stay and hotels.Roads - the highways can be a little hairy but the off-road, mountain trails and mountain tarmac roads are absolutely amazing.Vietnam Motorbike Tour - Alan is a lovely guy, very easy going and flexible.We did an 11 day tour of North Vietnam with our guide Lee - 4 of us in total. We are all experienced riders and Lee exceeded our expectations with on-road, off-road, mountainous trails, food, home stay, karaoke and more. Each day was unique and had its own highlights. My personal favourite being day 5&6 - the off-road and mountain trails near the Chinese boarder heading to Báo Lac.If you're looking to do a trip like this I would suggest a minimum of 6 days. Ideal time, 8 days. Anything more is a bonus.There are so many spectacular and amazing things to see, I cannot recommend this trip enough. Trip of a lifetime.

Offroad trip in North Vietnam. 100% adventure!We made an eleven-day trip in northern Viet Nam with our guide Lee. Everything has been really good and very well planned. The motorcycles were almost like new and we had really run very offroad with them! This trip has been above our expectations and it must be experienced! I highly recommend this trip!

Great Adventure & Well Planned. I did a trip with this outfit and it was pretty amazing experience. Everything was well planned out and the bikes were in great condition. Alan took care of us and I would highly recommend this to anyone interested.

Great ride through the countryside of Hanoi. My wife and I did the 1-day tour through the countryside of Hanoi. Our guide Alan was awesome! He chose a great way through rice fieldso and authentic villages, and showed us beautiful pagodas. The bikes and the gear were very good and the food along the way delicous. Thank you, Alan, for an unforgettable day!

An absolute MUST for anyone travelling to Hanoi. Where do I begin? The entire experience was flawless. I contacted Alan the night before my boyfriend and I wanted to go for the day trip and Alan responded straight away with all the information about the day trip. He even spoke to our receptionist at the hotel to ensure we had directions to the shop written in Vietnamese for the taxi driver. My boyfriend chose to ride the bigger 250 bike and they were in immaculate condition. I rode of the back of Alan's bike as I have never rode a bike before and was happy to sit and take pictures. Being on a motorbike is something very far out of my comfort zone, however Alan made me feel so safe, I was never worried about my safety, even riding through the busy Hanoi city. We had some amazing stops along the way including seeing areas of the country not possible without a guide. Alan spoke excellent English which was great to speak to locals. Alan was so thoughtful, always checking if we wanted a drink or a snack and there were plenty of opportunities to stop for a talk about the area. He also pointed out different crops and things that were happening along the way. The lunch was AMAZING, there was so much food and it was delicious, so were the stops for hot chocolate. I even had a turn riding on the back of my boyfriends bike which was a lot of fun. All in all, it is such an amazing experience and absolutely worth every dollar. We have been travelling through Asia for a month and this was by far the best thing we have done in our trip. You don't need to be a huge motorbike fan, like me I know very little about motorbikes and I had an absolute blast. As for our guide Alan, he was such a kind and genuine person. We decided he was the nicest person we had met on our trip. Even after the tour was over he took us for coffee and a snack and also waiting with us until we were in a taxi. He was so helpful and you could tell he really cared about us, the local people and he cares very much about making sure everyone has an awesome day. We both could not stop smiling all day, even after we were sitting in the taxi my boyfriend and I could not stop smiling. We are so glad we decided to do the tour, it was a once in a lifetime experience and I urge anyone who is thinking about doing it to give it a go and definitely use this company. The company exceeded all of our expectations. We are heading back to Australia so I can learn how to ride a motorbike, we will practice lots and then we will be back to do at least a week long tour. We just cannot get enough of it. Thank you Alan for being such a great person and we will see you again soon :)

6 day Ha giang motorcycle tour. I did 6 days bike trip from Hanoi to wonderful Ha-Giang province. Alan was quick in his responses right from my first email to him. He made sure all my queries were answered and upto my satisfaction before booking the tour especially when I was riding motorbike with two pillions (my wife and my 5 yo daughter). Sounds crazy…isni’t it? :)Nevertheless, Alan gave us the confidence before booking this tour and Lee Pham, our guide and companion for 6 days, made sure that we were safe and getting the maximum out of these 6 days. Lee was friendly and patient with our hundreds of questions. Knowing that we were 3 riding on a bike he mostly kept us on-road yet made sure that we don’t miss out breathtaking scenic views that the north most Vietnam had to offer. We did a little off road too on our 5th day which made our trip more memorable. The almost new Honda CRF250 could cruise royally whatever comes it’s way, be it bumpy or muddy roads, riding steep uphills or on narrow bamboo bridges. All the lodging including Homestays was above our expectations and our special requirement of vegetarian food was also very well taken care. This was truly amazing and lifetime experience for all 3 of us. I will highly recommend Alan and team to anyone wanting to add an experience to cherish lifelong. Thank You guys. Hope I come back soon for a offroad biking experience again.-Kawal

3 day trip. This trip is by fare the best thing I have done in a long time. The only thing that I regret is that I didn't book a 6 day trip or longerIt is a very good way to see Vietnam from a different point of view and for sure something I will have to try again.If there is anything to put a finger on it would be that I like the Homestay more then a Hotel.

Awesome. Myself and 3 mates did the single day tour and it was by far the best thing I will do in Vietnam! Best way to see the countryside and some pretty cool sights and attractions!! Tour guides are very helpful and knowledgable! Well worth the money!!

A fun, engaging day trip from Hanoi. We (six friends) did this on a whim. We were casually skimming what to do in Hanoi while sitting at a cafe and we came across this -- a day trip out of Hanoi and into the countryside on bikes! And the tour was great. We crawled and bounced through paddy fields, mud tracks, villages. Our lunch was at a UNESCO heritage village and it was most superb. Best beef dumplings I have ever eaten. But what was the best was Alan, our guide. Helpful and ever-smiling, Alan is a great guide. He knows all the roads like a map in his head and is the best to have around when your bike is stuck in mud. Because he will just laugh it off AND help you dig the bike out.Just one note -- probably better to take a motorbike than a scooter because we had trouble navigating scooters on the muddy roads. Have fun!

Incredible!. I did the one day tour outside of Hanoi with Alan and it was absolutely incredible. Definitely the highlight of the trip! Alan was fantastic - made everyone feel comfortable and tailored the ride perfectly. We saw some rural areas (a nice change from the city) - complete with baby cows running in front of us on the road. The go pro video Alan provided at the end was an unexpected bonus. No matter what your experience level - absolutely recommend this tour. I only wish I had time to do a longer trip

Everything you've always wanted!. We had an amazing time with Vietnam Motorbike Tours. Right away we were contacted and they set everything up for us. All we had to do was fly to Vietnam! Alan and Hoan run a great business and they are incredibly friendly. Their English is fantastic. They will go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and having a good time. The tour itself was amazing. We did a three day Northern Vietnam trip. Picture yourself on a bike on mountain roads, dodging the occasional chicken and water buffalo. Try not to smile when you pass groups of children all cheering as you pass by their village! The scenery was breathtaking and the people were some of the nicest we've met in Southeast Asia.The food was delicious. We ate home-cooked meals that were as fresh as you could get. We stayed at a beautiful homestay and an upscale hotel for the two nights on the tour. They were wonderful.The bikes were in superb condition - you can tell they take pride in their bikes.All in all, if you're coming to Vietnam, I highly, highly recommend doing a motorbike tour through this company. If you don't have a lot of time, they offer even smaller trips than our 3 day trip. Or if you're interested in longer trips, they do those too. We had a once in a lifetime experience and it was all thanks to Vietnam Motorbike Tours! The only regret was that we didn't book a longer trip!!!

1 day Hanoi tour. Me and my gf are novice riders and went on the 1 day tour. After a bit of practice your out on the roads which at first is daunting but is not as scary once your out there, quite exciting actually!!Your out the urban area in 20 mins and rural Hanoi has Great scenery and get to drive through local villages, with friendly locals, buffalo and other animals. Is good to be out the city and you won't be disappointed by the views, even visiting a beautiful Padoga.We got a few stops for snacks and water, Lunch was fab in a small place, we never would have found it in a million years in the middle of the countryside. We stopped for plenty photos and Alan took lots on his camera and GoPro and sent me a video of the day. Coming back into Hanoi at rush hour is definitely an experience but you soon see there is method to the madness that is the Hanoi roads!As total beginners this was challenging enough to still be great fun and my gf who is scared of everything loved this day out and we would both recommend itAlan is a great guide, chatty and funny and speaks good EnglishChris

Our favorite day!!. Wow, wow, wow, what a great experience! My husband and I did a one day countryside tour on November 9, 2015 and loved every minute. From the minute we hopped on the bikes it was an adventure. Unfortunately, it was raining in the morning and we got soaked as we rode along but it did not dampen our spirits and eventually the rain and our clothes dried up. My husband rode by himself and I with Alan. As we rode along Alan pointed out different tidbits I would not have noticed if not riding with him. We rode through the city and into the countryside where we did not see another tourist for the rest of the day!! We rode through small trails, some that we even created ourselves, dirt roads, small bridges and paved roads where we met locals, farmers and children. We stopped and ate lunch at a wonderful homestay and had some of the most delicious food of our entire stay in Vietnam. On our way back into the city we rode through a flower village and into Hanoi at peak rush hour which was a thrill and adventure in itself. We ended the day by having a beer with Alan and rehashing our amazing day. This was our favorite thing we did during our entire month long tour throughout Vietnam, Cambodia and Thailand. We loved Alan's enthusiasm and love for what he does. He tries to make each tour different and took us on new trails/routes he had never driven before where we met some of neatest and excited people. Overall, an amazing day and experience. We'd love to do it again!!

All highlights of Vietnam in one day. We did a one-day tour to the countryside of Hanoi. Little villages, water buffalos, a lot of schoolkids, off road driving, yummy Vietnamese food, we all loved it! Alan organised it very well and it was easy to communicate with him. It is a bit expensive to Vietnamese standards, but we highly recommend this tour.

The Highlight of Hanoi. There is a reason why Alan is rated so highly: a motorbike tour with him is the perfect experience from start to finish. Neither my wife nor I had riding experience. That didn't matter. After some training, I felt comfortable navigating both the streets of Hanoi and the countryside. And my wife decided she felt more comfortable riding with Alan, which allowed her to take in more of the sights.Alain took us to towns that were not on most tourists' itineraries. We saw pagodas surrounded by water. We stopped for Vietnamese coffee, bananas and coconuts. And we rode on narrow country backroads, passing ducks, roosters, cows and water buffalo. At every stop, the locals knew (and cleared loved) Alan and couldn't have been friendlier to us.A few things in particular stood out:- Because it was a few days before Christmas, Alan dressed up as Santa Claus. Needless to say, children were delighted as he sped past them on his motorbike.- Alan understands that everyone wants photos to post to social media and share with friends. He made sure to document every moment of our trip--even capturing video and taking selfies while we were riding.- If you show some proficiency as a rider, Alain will take you on more challenging trails. On one narrow curve. I took a spill. I was worried he'd be upset or concerned about the bike, but he couldn't have been nicer. He joked that I wasn't quite ready for my Vietnamese license yet, helped me up, and we were on our way.Yes, it's a little more expensive than some other activities, but worth every penny. Motorbiking with Alan is the perfect mixture of adventure and sightseeing. Highly recommended.

11 Day North Vietnam Mountain Tour. Absolutely unforgettable experience. Bikes (250cc Honda), roads, hotels, scenery - nothing compares; and the food - different every day and always delicious.I came without a license, hadn't ridden a bike for over 40 years but our host and guide made sure that I was competent and comfortable to ride before we ventured out for real. I could ramble on for ages about details, but I will simply sum up by saying great value for money and I would happily do it all over again.

6 day tour to Ha Gieng district. 4 mates all aged late fifties and above took the tour with our very capable guide Quinny leading, we blended into the Hanoi morning peak hour, I thought it would be difficult but with great bikes and good organisation it was easy to do as the locals do on the road. Our accommodation was in home stays and hotels which were clean and had hot showers waiting for us at the end of each day. The days were not long or tiring with lots of breaks to take photos,have morning tea or sumptuous lunches, I never thought I would see the day when us boys would not finish all the food placed in front of us, there was so much! and good food it was to ( oh! Those crispy pork ribs). The dinners just as good with cold beers and no rush to find our beds, Quinny would leave us to wander the town and find somewhere for coffees ( or more beers),meet locals who were so friendly. The scenery on our ride was amazing and changed each day with some off road riding to take us to places off the beaten track, we crossed over rivers on bamboo bridges and over mountains where the clouds were below us. Our trip was safe and comfortable thanks Alan ( and Quinny) for a fantastic trip I shall not forget.Tips: wear sun glasses especially if you ride with the visor up (I do that).Film everything, every time I turned off my Go Pro I wish I didn't.

11-Day North Vietnam Tour. This was the trip of a lifetime. Many thanks for Alan's organising and the excellent service from Lee our guide for the tour. The Honda CRF250 bikes were new and ideal for the job, needing their power to overtake safely and becoming a hoon in powering around some of the good corners.The scenery around this part of Vietnam is breathtaking, with Dong Van area being best of all.Our tour guide Lee did whatever he could to make life comfortable for me as a Lupus sufferer with joint pains. The hard mattresses in Vietnam were something I was not prepared for, but many places had doonas which could be doubled over and used for mattress padding. Our travel route was not a set itinerary, and Lee changed a few days to avoid the rough tracks off-road being too uncomfortable for 3 blokes in their late 60s...also it looked like rain around Sapa. A hint for old buggers like me...buy a small cushion for your bum on the wooden seats at coffee and lunch stops.

8 Day motorbike tour of North Vietnam. This was a fantastic experience, Alan and his crew were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The bikes were practically brand new and in excellent condition. I would highly recommend Alan's Tours to anyone who would like to see another side to Vietnam. I really enjoyed the roads that we were shown and would never have found without our excellent guides

Highlight of my trip to Hanoi!. I booked a day tour with Alan for a friend and I after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Alan was fantastic from the beginning, he responds to emails quickly and is so helpful and friendly. It was honestly the highlight of our two week trip through Cambodia and Vietnam. I had no experience riding so he recommended I go with an automatic scooter. Alan has a lot of experience with newbies, I was comfortable and felt safe on the bike from the beginning. Navigating through Hanoi’s traffic is insane but honestly half the fun when you realise there is order to the chaos! Within 20 minutes of taking off, we were out of the city centre and riding along rice fields and around cows. It was surreal. The whole day flew by so quickly and the countryside was beautiful. We really got a sense of what village life was like and everyone we met was so friendly. We went through villages where motorbikes weren’t that common and the kids were so interested in how the bikes worked. Lunch was the highlight of the day at the Ancient Village. So much food was brought out and it was true home cooking. We had many stops throughout the day for breaks, snacks and photos. He introduced us to food and tea made in the area at each stop. Alan also knows exactly where and when to stop for the perfect photos. I wasn’t sure when I booked because I’d never even been on a bike but can now say I am definitely going to on overnight tour with Alan again on my next Hanoi holiday.

Great Trip in North Vietnam. I had a great time with Cueng on my 3 day excursion to visit several National Parks in North Vietnam. We stayed in a hotel one night and homestay one night inside the National Park. Both accommodations were comfortable and clean and the homestay was a memory I'll never forget. I really enjoyed making new friends, trying new food, and seeing how people live in a different part of the world.The trip was amazing and I was well taken care of throughout. I saw great scenery and enjoyed the backroads of Vietnam on a Honda 125. I must say that the bike seemed brand new and was in great working condition.If you are thinking about doing a trip like this - just do it!

8 day motorbike tour out of Hanoi. Fantastic 8 day trip out of Hanoi with excellent guides. Great fun on well chosen and generally quiet winding mountain roads with stunning scenery. Great choices for accommodation and meals along the way. Two flat tyres which were dealt with quickly by guides Vuang (sp?) and Lee while we took in the scenery (thanks guys !!). I would highly recommend Alan and his team.

8 day motorcycle tour of northwest Vietnam. Well organised operation, friendly and helpful guides, good bikes and stunning scenery. Would definitely recommend Alan and team and would love to do it all again sometime!

8 guys 8 days N Vietnam on CRFs. Found Alan on web and he offered the most professional package, gear and timely coherent responses. Eight 40 to 50 year old guys from Oz, Italy, and England booked eight Honda CRF250's and follow truck, plus we got 2 guides one leading out front and one sweaping up at the back. All great.Roads were truly world class, snaking corners were the norm, with both smooth, bumpy, deadly and everything in between. Followed rivers, ridge lines and drove back roads and lanes. Wore protective clothing and good boots. After 8 days we pulled up back at Hanoi, all safe and spent, but with retired brains and infinitely the richer for the experience.The tour went real smooth with the guides Vuong and Lee both working hard on our behalf, with Fouk in the truck lifting loading and following some serious track.Bike days were long, but for so connected to your inner soul that we arrived more enlivened that when we left. I would advise you encourage the guides to stop more and talk to locals, its worth it. If you don't want serious hours of bike time, maybe take bikes on train to SaPa and start there.Bring a go pro or similar plus a 1 terabyte hard drive to download the cards. The views are everywhere. Don't overthink it. Just book, pay and go. You won't be disappointed.

Fantastic!!!. My boyfriend and I spent one day to join the offroad bike tour. Our overall comment is very good. But honestly, the charge is a bit expensive. But we would still recommend friends to join. We booked online before we depart in Hanoi. Since they didn't provide pick up service, we have to go to their shop by ourselves. However, the contact person instructed not so clear, by just asking us to tell the taxi driver to send us to the University. On our way, we use our mobile phone to call the shop and let him communicate with our taxi driver. We assume they gave a very clear direction to the driver. (That spent us few dollars for IDD call) But unfortunately, when we arrived in University, no one show up. We lost in University. Even worse, due to poor signal, we cannot dail to the shop. Finally, we were lucky that we found a student to help us make the call to the shop (Vietnamnese is helpful and friendly actually ). Alan then came to pick up us. Originally I plan to give 5 stars but given this poor start, I remove one stars by only rating Four finally. I would say, if they could provide pick up / drop off service that would be much better. Besides, I would like to say thank to our guide Sy. He is a very nice guide, with very good service. He helped us take a lot of beautiful photo to make us trip more perfect.

Recommended. We joint the 1 day tour to the countryside. The honda xr125 is in good condition. Full face helmet and glove are provided. The guide mr. Sy did a good job. Nice and experienced. And the organiser Alan replied our email query promptly. No deposit is needed for booking. Highly recommend. Unfortunately there is no pickup service from the hotel.

Truly professional riding tour in Vietnam. Impressive, safe, friendly and really professional - all i can say about Alan Motorbike Team - We joined him in a day ride to Duong Lam village - a beautiful ancient village of Hanoi. On brand-new motorbikes, Alan guided along rural trails free of traffic, through untouched villages. it is really interesting route to drive. We very much enjoyed the scenic landscape, visiting farms, talking with locals and experienced fantastic food in the village.

Best day in Vietnam!. Me and my my boyfriend woke up one morning in Hanoi and decided to see if we could book a motorbike tour for the day. Within less than 10 minutes, Alan replied to my email and we were on our way. We rode the Honda 250cc, virtually brand new and so much fun to ride (or so my boyfriend told me as I rode on back). We spent the day with the very informative and laid back Sy. He took us to parts of the countryside in Hanoi we would have never been able to explore without him. Plenty of stops to takes lots of photos, drink breaks and an amazing feast for lunch! We visited pagodas and temples and got back to their office at around 7pm to be greeted by Alan where we had a beer and talked about our great day! Seriously worth the money. A day in Vietnam that we will not forget and definitely the highlight for us! Thanks Sy for a great day and thNks Alan for being so organised and making our last minute decision to go for a ride a possibility!

Amazing experience..... Me and my husband decided we wanted to get out the city but was unsure if we could manage the traffic in Hanoi. Alan , our tour guide gave us time to get used to the bike (I rode pillion). It was an amazing experience, one that we will never forget.... We saw parts of Vietnam, that we would never have seen and ate some amazing food (as well as having a cheeky beer ). I would recommend this trip to anyone and everyone. It is one you won't forget in a hurry!!!!! Thanks Alan. We will be back x

Awesome day!. The highlight of our trip to Vietnam! My friends and I booked a one day tour exploring the countryside around Hanoi. We rode literally off the beaten path, through rice paddies and along rivers, never seeing any other tourists, just the local Vietnamese population. I was impressed with the guys from the outset. Alan was always very prompt in replying to emails (sometimes only a matter of minutes). Neither myself or my friends had any experience of motorcycle riding, but this was not a problem. Alan gave us automatic 125cc, a 'boy's bike' as he put it! They were essentially mopeds and very easy to handle and drive. After a quick 20 minute drive around the office area, we were off, and on some pretty busy roads out of Hanoi!Our guide for the day was See (i'm sure I've spelt this incorrectly). He was very knowledgable and also fun. He was always happy to stop whenever we wanted and take our pic. There were plenty of stops along the way; temples, villages, beer breaks etc.Driving back into hanoi as the sun was setting was one of the most exhilarating hours of my life, a great trip and great memories. I hope I can come back again and do a longer tour. Thanks guys!

Amazing moto tour in Vietnam. We had an amazing experience with Vietnam Motorbike Tours! First, quick and efficient booking and preparation remotely from Singapore with Allan.Then arrived in Hanoi, our guide picked us up at the hotel and we went for a breathtaking 2 days' tour up to Mai Chau in the west of Hanoi. Mountains, fields, small villages, lakes, etc. Night in a home stay in the middle of mountains and rice fields.I can only recommend Vietnam Motorbike Tours!

Boys trip to Vietnam. We took a day trip on bikes around the plantations and paddy fields outside Hanoi, abley guided by Alan Chien and his awesome team. Great food & beer stops too. If you do one thing in Vietnam, do this!Reasonable riding skills required.

The best way to see the countryside and people in Vietnam. If you are wanting to get out into the countryside and experience the 'real' Vietnam without hoards of tourists, then you'd be mad not to book a Motorbike tour with Alan and his team. I can't ride a motorbike so opted to ride pillion on the back of Alan's bike whilst my husband spent 20 minutes refreshing his biking skills before we headed out. Alan's knowledge of the roads and trails is amazing and we saw parts of the countryside you'd never see by car. There were plenty of opportunities to stop for refreshments (all included in the cost of the tour) as was any entrance fees to the temples we visited.Alan made the tour really interesting and ensured he tailored it perfectly to our needs. We found the Vietnamese people we met throughout the day incredibly friendly and hospitable - everyone has a smile for you.Our only regret is we didn't have time to do a 2 or 3 day tour but definitely plan to come back to to do a longer trip.

Two Day Mai Chau. I was only able to provide Alan with 24 hour notice, but he had no problem arranging a quick two day trip for me. Within just a few hours, you're outside of the hustle and bustle of Hanoi and into the beautiful mountains of the north. The homestay in Mai Chau is excellent as well, with a hot shower and good meal after a long day on the trails. Highly recommended!

Great experience. Totally recommend Alan and his team. From the prompt responses from Alan to emails to the attention to every little detail on the tour, every expectation was met. Oh, and did I mention the great bikes and scenery on the tour? It was a memorable experience and the highlight of my time in Vietnam.Thank you Alan and Hoan.

Ha Long one day trip and shortened one day motorbike tour. I had been in communication with Alan for about two months for my short Ha Noi visit. Since the get go Alan was most helpful and accommodating to my interests and how to customize his tours to my needs.Finally we first did the Ha Long Bay one day tour, with Duong Tien Sy, a friendly, fluent in English & knowledgeable tour guide. The trip back and forth to Ha Long was around 3 hours each way, which we did in a comfortable SUV they sent with its own driver. The whole Ha Long experience was magical, the weather was good, the yatch we sailed, the gorgeous views of the bay and the food served in the yatch.It couldn't have been any better. I strongly recommend both the tour guide and the company for arranging these trips.The next day I did the motorbike tour, which I wanted shortened due to my time limitation, yet Alan, who came along with us this time, made the best out of the day. Driving in Ha Noi and on the highways to the countryside it was yet another great experience, which for me, I had only ridden a Vespa in Rome a while back, yet he was able to guide me and teach what i needed to know yet making it interesting and adventurous to my friend Gonzalo, who is an avid bike rider.Enjoyed very much going through the neighboring farmers villages, rice plantations...and the a heavy downpour of rain came...even in muddy terrains, for this inexperienced motorcycle driver, it was fun and safe...I will do it again..but not as short...perhaps do a couple of days of touring...with Alan of course... I highly recommend this tour as well.Thanks for everything Alan!!! i will surely be back for more... Good luck!

Highlight of our visit to Hanoi!. Wow, what a unique experience! We had the pleasure of riding with Alan. From start to finish, he was patient, knowledgable and accommodating. We went off-roading in wet rice fields and narrow dirt paths, navigated through local traffic like a pro, ate a delicious and hearty local lunch at the Duong Lam Village and ended the day with some beers. One day is simply not enough time! Will definitely return again for a longer motorbike tour. Thank you, Alan!
Must have experience in Hanoi. Thrilling yet exciting trip we had in the tour. Old village, ricefields, pagoda, river, all is the beauty of Hanoi you shouldn't miss!
Immersive experience. Excellent way to see the area around Hanoi. A bit tiring if you're not used to riding a bike, but the tour guides take good care of you and are friendly and accommodating.

Best part of the trip to date. We booked this trip after seeing it on trip advisor and having a couple of days to spare. We done the 2 days trip after reading reviews about the 1 day not being long enough and my god we are glad that we did. The rides isn't that challenging, just local roads but the views are superb. The bike was nearly brand new and good quality, more than up to handling the terrain. The home stay (although we chose hotel) was amazing. One of the nicest places we have stayed and the food was delicious. Our guide was really friendly and funny. 2 of us done this trip, 1 as a pillion and we never regretted it. We enjoyed it so much we are already discussing coming back to do a longer trip

Amazing adventure. We had a 3 day short trip to Hanoi and decided on this at short notice after doing some searching on trip advisor.Alan the owner and luckily our guide for the tour responded very quickly to our enquiry and confirmation.We started our trip 730 am. We are novice at motorbike ride. Had an hour of practice and I decided to be on back of Alan's bike cos not confident to handle Hanoi traffic.My husband was much better at this and he rode on his own.We were in the countryside within half hour with beautiful paddy fields duck farms water buffaloes en route. Had lunch with good local farm food.Alan is gps himself as we went offroad amazing..... A most enjoyable adventurous ride through sun and rain.Thanks Alan for a memorable trip to see the other side of Hanoi.Highly recommended.

BEST way to see Hanoi!. After coffee and conversation, Alan did an amazing job teaching our group of three how to drive our own manual bikes. We practice for about an hour before heading out on our day tour. We drove through rice fields, banana plantations, and muddy roads. We had an amazing local lunch and ended with a few beers by his shop. Hands down the best thing I've done in my life, and best way to see Hanoi. You get to escape the city scene for the day and have a blast on the back of a motorcycle. Alan also videos the trip on his GoPro and shares it, along with pictures, from the trip! SO MUCH FUN!! Alan is the BEST!

Great Tour on short notice . We had a great motorbiketour with our tour guide Alan. He is a very competent and versatile tour guide. We got around more than we expected and had a great ride in the surroundings of Hanoi. You get to see places you normally wouldn't. Definitely a no brainer.

touring on best motorbikes in Hanoi. Did a tour around Hanoi area. Alan's off-road motorbikes + equipment are top and him and his partner Chung are good fun.I wish I had more days and I would have definitely gone with them 5-6 days riding from Hanoi to the north. Next time!

Awesome. Just awesome. . My wife, my friend, and I had a great time with Alan. We only did a one-day tour.None of us had ridden a motorcycle before. Alan was very patient and taught us well before we set out. He took us across rice paddies to a very old pagoda. We ate lunch at a centuries-old village where the residents served us a feast. Cruised through the countryside and several small towns on our way back into Hanoi.Alan took great care of us the entire time. We were not expert riders by the end of the day, but Alan had given us the tools for a wonderful adventure.We will talk about Alan and our ride that day for the rest of our lives. If we are ever back in Hanoi, we will arrange a longer tour with Alan.

11 day tour of North Vietnam!! Spectacular!. There are adventures, epic experiences, once in a lifetimes and then there is this. This may get kind of lengthy but I believe our (my brother and I) experience/skill level will appeal to many so please read if you are considering. We did the 11 day tour of northern Vietnam and we booked 2 days before we decided to go. I don't recommend that as most book months in advance. We did our trip on the fly and Alan was incredible throughout the entire booking process. First off, my brother and I have never rode a motorcycle prior to this trip, correction the day we booked this trip we went on a day tour of Vietnam with another company on semi-automatic scooters/"motorcycles", basically the majority of what you see around Vietnam. So that was the extent of our riding experience. We told Alan that we are truly beginners and he responded "no problem, we will practice before you go". Li (our tour guide for the trip) picked us up from our hotel and we met Alan at the shop. By the way, Li is absolute incredible from a tour guide perspective and more so as a person, more to come later. Luckily Alan had motorbike pants and some boots (life savers) that fit both of us. We practiced around a stadium for about an hour, stalling, shifting, downshifting, braking, all that you would guess. And then...we were off! Sounds crazy right? One hour of practice and then we were off on this 1,100 mile journey over 11 days. Well, I have to say it was the most incredible "thing" I've ever done and experienced in my entire life and will say it will be almost impossible to beat. Each day we probably rode 100 to 150 miles or 150 - 240 km, averaging around 100 miles most days. We were not experienced enough to go off-roading, which was completely fine. We drove through heat, rain, construction sites, rivers, over-flooded roads, rocks, dirt, mud, everything under the great blue sky. I'm going to guess 70% or so of the driving was up and down mountains. We stopped along the way to take in the incredible sights. We took breaks every 30 miles or so to stretch our legs and give the rear end a break. We stopped in small villages that otherwise tour buses,etc. would not. My brother and I are Americans but Indians (from India) by origin. Many of the people have never seen Indians before and were so curious and just amazingly welcoming. We stayed at 6 hotels and 4 homestays, one of which was with Li's family in Sapa. Li's family is just incredible as Li. We played with the little kids, ate great home cooked meals, took a herbal bath (absolute must in Sapa). Li also picked great spots for lunch and dinner. Ok, so the obvious questions that we had that I'm sure if you're reading you have. Is it dangerous? Relatively but also not. I can't explain it but after a few days you definitely feel more comfortable but trust me when I say this, you will be reminded of your inexperience very quickly. You will constantly over take semi's, cars, bikes, buffaloes, cows, etc. I had to dodge a massive jack fruit that came rolling down the mountain. Sometimes you'll ponder "why did that rooster just run right across my bike!?!" Well, to get the other side of course. Simply put, there are inherent dangers but Li does a great job understanding your skill level and what you are comfortable with. Be smart and be confident. I tipped over on a sharp uphill hairpin turn (day 5) because I did not downshift as I came to almost a complete stop making that turn. My bike stalled and I simply tipped over. My first "fall". It messes with your head a little bit but you have to get back on and shrug it off. Of course, medical help is far and few between. I'm not trying to scare anyone but that is the reality. So just be smart with your riding decisions. This trip is worth cancelling anything else you have planned and booking with Alan and co. What to bring? Since Alan had riding pants for us we wore those every day. We brought a few long sleeve dry fit type shirts. 5 pairs of underwear, 3 pairs of socks (bring more pairs of socks if you can). Pair of shorts to sleep in and couple t-shirts. Alan also gave us rain jackets, thank god! Oh! Bring a pair of comfortable light pants. When you are relaxing after a long day at the hotel/homestay it would be nice to have your legs covered. I left my pants back at Alan's office and just got bit up by mosquitoes. Bring repellent, goes without saying. Boots were key and once again we got from Alan. You can probably purchase some gum boots or something but for these long trips it is highly recommended that you have something better than sneakers. At least that's my suggestion because we drove through mud, rain, a river. Eventually it will all get wet but just feels more stable. A scarf! or something that wraps around your mouth/nose. We did not have a scarf and it would definitely have been helpful to over the nose and mouth. The helmets cover both but the dust and smoke from cars/bikes, etc. Overall, this was just something I can't explain until you do it. It is worth every penny and I mean it when I say to cancel whatever else you have and book this trip. I believe the 6 day is the most popular out of the longer day trips but if you can stretch it out to 11 days...this is it. The scenery after Sapa and the ride is just incredible. If you can get Li...get Li. Book in advance so you can secure his services. You ride about 6 hours a day. Leave around 8 or 9am and get to the next "city" around 3pm. A lot of time to talk and get to know Li (it was just the 3 of us on this tour). He's an incredible person and answered all of our questions about Vietnam, his life, struggles, etc. This is were the experience takes its true value. The people, the culture, the food, what you get to see because you did all this on a bike. You'll never regret it. Work two jobs when you get back home if you have to but if you are even remotely thinking about taking this trip...just do it! Hope this helps! Oh, and pack some toilet paper in your backpack and hand sanitizer.

Great day in the real Vietman! . We booked a one day tour with Alan Chien and I wish we had of planned better and gone for a longer tour. We were apprehensive about it as we drove through Hanoi in our taxi to Alan's shop... There's millions of bikes on the roads and it looks scary! However, Alan gave us time to get comfortable on our bikes before heading off into traffic, and to be honest once you're in the traffic it's not so bad! So if you're worried like we were, don't be you will be fine. The countryside outside Hanoi is beautiful and really peaceful, the people out there are so happy to see foreigners (which gives you a warm fuzzy feeling inside!) and in general they are just lovely people and for me they were the true highlight of the day. We would never had these interactions on a bus tour, we only came across 1 other small group of tourists at a unesco site and that was it. I cannot recommend it highly enough, do yourself a favour and just book it but do more than one day- you won't be sorry!Alan is great and he did so much for us today, we didn't have to worry about anything at all - He took loads of photos of us throughout the day and also a video too. Thank you so much for an amazing adventure Alan!

Unforgettable Day. My fiancé and I booked a 1-day tour on a whim based off of the Trip Advisor reviews. Our experience, from start to finish, was wonderful. Alan brings years of hospitality and tourism experience to the table and it really shows. He doesn't just give you a tour, he genuinely cares about showing you a good time and creating memories that will last a lifetime.If you are like me and have never ridden a motorbike in your life, don't worry. The tour ramps up at the perfect pace, so you learn as you go (I was terrible at first, but was given ample time to ride around for awhile to learn before we started). If you are also like me and hate tours in general, don't worry. The tour is not a touristy-tour, it's more like going on an day-long joyride with a good friend who is flexible to your needs.We had a seamless experience doing something we have 0 experience doing, thanks to Alan's expertise and professionalism.Tips: Don't forget to bring extra sunblock like I did (Alan was kind enough to take us to a shop mid-tour to buy sleeved clothing). Also, they are nice guys so feel free to actually hang out with them!! I assumed that this was a very transactional experience (pay the guide, he shows you the sights...the end, let's never speak of this again), but slowly realized that they are a lot more casual and fun :)

nothing short of fantastic. booked this tour based on other reviews from Trip Advisor, looking for something different to do as a family. have spent time in Hanoi previous to this trip myself, and never envisioned motorbiking as a safe experience. Was I ever wrong! we had a great day - ranging from the pre-orchestration setting expectations via email, all the way to the finish. we started off safely, given little to no previous experience. after the appropriate guidance on using equipment, we set off. we did a little of everything, going over 'buffalo trails' to roads in remote villages, several stops at temples and pagodas (my request), rest breaks at quaint locations, fantastic lunch at a historic family restaurant, finishing the day feeling like experts. met local people who were very excited to engage with 'foreigners'. took pictures better than a professional!wouldn't have been able to achieve this without local knowledge, amiable tour guide who clearly loves his job and cares about people. he really related to my kids, periodically taking them on the back of his bike to give them a change of sceneryin our 2 week journey across multiple countries (TH, SG, HK, VN), this was rated by the entire difficult to please family as the best outing. they can't wait to come back and do this again!

Two thumbs up!!. This tour does not disappoint: our tour guide, Alan, has enthusiasm for popularizing off-road motorbiking as well as passion for preserving the rural beauty of a rapidly industrialized Vietnam. Each path, each stopping points, are carefully selected to highlight the beauty & uniqueness of Vietnam. The unspoiled beauty of ancient pagoda, the rusticity of a 400-year-old unesco-grade restaurant, the narrow muddy path through the rice field or the winding road filled with buffalo going home after a long day in the field are worthy of a memory of a life time.Most of all, the care & service he demonstrated for our 5 year old child has turned her into a life time fan of motorbiking. We will be coming back!!

Best Option in Hanoi. We arrived to Hanoi, and the next day we headed to Offroad to enjoy our 2days 1 night to Mai Chau. The experience has been really nice. If you only stay in Hanoi, you can't barely see the beauties of Vietnam.We hit the road at 8am and finally arrived to Mai Chau after a few hours of riding. Such a big effort, but it was totally worthy. The guest house was really nice and quiet and the landscape was really stunning.After having a relaxing and enjoyable night, we went back to Hanoi through nice roads. Our guide Le knew the good paths to go to Mai Chau and back to Hanoi so we couldn't suffer the traffic of Vietnam. A lot of time we were almost alone in the road, and this is something that you have to enjoy in Vietnam.The bikes provided by Alan are really nice. Have to say that were really new and they were working perfectly. I hope to come back to Vietnam again and enjoy a longer trip with these guys.

Sick trip. Alan is awesome! He patiently waited for two of us to get comfortable with the bikes, and when my friend wanted to change to a moped, he was more than nice enough to switch. We rode out all day, and he took us through awesome areas in Hanoi and the countryside. Awesome lunch spot too. He also took cool pics of us as we rode and had a go-pro and sent us the videos and pictures afterwards. Highly recommended for a fun ride with a cool guy.

Great way to spend a rainy afternoon!. Because of the torrential rains over the last week, our Halong Bay trip was cancelled -- so we were scrambling for a last minute trip. Alan came through on short notice and got us a delightful 1-day tour of the countryside to the west of Hanoi. It rained all day but it didn't matter -- we had a blast! Although both of us were novices (first time on a motorbike) we felt confident and well cared for the whole time.Great scenery, excellent guidance, friendly locals, delicious food -- nothing but excellent things to say about or experience! Now let's see how long it takes my toes to dry out....

Only way to see Vietnam!. Took a one day tour of the outskirts of Hanoi. Wish I could do a longer tour! Bottom line is you need to do this. Whether you've never rode before or if you're a long time rider, expect to have the best time and see things you wouldn't if you were on your own. Alan is the man! Just do it!

The BEST trip of my life!. I just finished the six day and five night trip to Sapa. Was honestly one of the most fun weeks of my life! I was a little nervous about riding a motorcycle in Vietnam and Alan was very reassuring and let me come a day early to practice. Alan is such a terrific guy and kept in contact on Facebook to make sure that I was all ready for the trip. The motorcycles we used were terrific. Dirt bikes are not common in Vietnam so everyone looks at you like a celebrity when driving though small towns. Booking the longer trip allowed me to stay in really cool locations. The home stays and hotels were so nice. This is the real way to see Vietnam. It felt weird to come back and see all the western tourists. In the countryside the scenery is incredible and the people are so friendly. One of the highlights was definitely the food. It is included in the trip price and every meal is a feast! I got to eat so many incredible things and ate so much! Vietnamese food is of course delicious. Our guide Cuong is such a terrific person. He is so friendly, intelligent, and responsible. He kept us safe and happy the whole time. Really see if you can have him as your guide if you book a trip. (You should!)All in all, this was some of the most fun I've ever had. Vietnamese people are so friendly and welcoming and this trip is one of the best ways to experience the country. You have to do it!!

1 day tour - must do in Hanoi. We spent the day with Alan on a one day motorbike tour which we will never forget. Saw the true Vietnam countryside and enjoyed the beautiful traditional lunch. It is a must do if visiting Hanoi and a must do with Alan and his company, great guide and company. We had the most wonderful day and highly recommend this tour to everyone.

The BEST trip ever on bike. Best trip ever from the top to the bottom. FANTASTIC when in land and down to the ocean and back in again and places that where fantastic food was great the guides where great the mechanic was great cant wit to do it again

The BEST way to see Vietnam!. Booked a one day motorbike tour of North Vietnam after reading the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor. I wanted to get away from the touristy areas of Hanoi and see more of the real Vietnam. I also wanted to avoid a standard mass bus tour.Alan was very fast to respond and provided a motorbike that was suitable for my skill level and experience. He took us into the countryside and to local villages and temples. Alan's knowledge of Vietnam was extensive and he provided great insight into the Vietnamese culture. It was a hot day but we had lots of breaks to rest and try the local food. I particularly enjoyed the lunch and sugar cane freshly cut from the field. I did find the traffic at the end of the tour a bit intimidating but Alan was very helpful and patient with guiding us through it. Heavy traffic only lasted for around 10 minutes. I had a fantastic day and would love to do a longer trip in the future to see more of this beautiful country.

Amazing trip through the countryside. Hanoi is great, but the truth is that most of Vietnam is the countryside and the best way to see the beautiful countryside is by motorbike. Alan's tour took us through the countryside around Hanoi, visiting rice fields and other agriculture, as well as temples, pagodas and a local swimming hole for a relaxing afternoon cool down. All of these would have been almost impossible to reach without the bike. While we were beginners, the bikes were very easy to ride (we had automatic) and riding in the crazy Vietnamese traffic for a short period at the start and end was not too daunting. Alan took us at our own pace and was always ready to help. Best of all, Alan is very down-to-earth and personable with a great sense of humour! Highly recommended to anyone who wants to see REAL Vietnam away from the standard tourist haunts.

Motorbike Vietnam - trip of lifetime. What the amazing day! All day long offroad driving and seeing the original Vietnam, a perfect mix! Alan feel you, you can go easy or hard, up to you.Do you scared it cannot be enough as experience? You don't! After this just sleep.Highly recommend Alan company

Vietnam Motorbike tours - Private day tours. Even though I am an experienced motorcyclist - I knew that I was not equipped to handle local conditions as well as navigate my way around Vietnam.I contacted Alan and he was both extremely helpful and flexible in arranging everything for me. As my planning progressed with him he was always very responsive and was also helping with organising accommodation before the trip airport transfers storage of luggage etc - this made things really easy.The actual tour itself was nothing short of fantastic - exceeded every expectation and I could never have seen and experienced as much without the expert guidance of Lee - my Guide - we were joined by another tour guest from Colorado and this made for the perfect groupI was also supplied a brand new Honda CRF250 - smaller than I am used to but it is the perfect bike for this purpose - can go anywhere with ease and comfortable for longer stretches.I have recommended this to all my riding friends and am definitely going back for more

Great trip. Had a fantastic day with Allen on the bike tour. Had a brand new bike - was very easy to ride and saw some amazing countryside. Allen was a great tour guide. Liked it so much I might go again when I get to Hoi An. Would highly recommend this tour to anyone.

Happy long day Vietnam motorbike tour. Where to start. Lots of fun with Alan Chien. Warm welcome at beginning and hit the road to the countryside of Hanoi. He took us to the west part of Hanoi, we ride through duck farms, beautiful rice paddy fields. Arrive the ancient village ( Duong Lam ), prepared lots of food, the best food in Vietnam. The way back we swim in the red river, I turn the clock back 100 years. The Honda dirt bike is 100% new. highly recommended Alan and his company.Thank you so much

Best Way to See Vietnam - Motorcycle Tour. I must say that Alan & Duong were amazing tour guides! This tour was the last tour we booked on our 2 weeks trip through South East Asia. Unfortunately for us we were delayed on one of our other tours which shortened the motorcycle tour for from two days to one. Regardless Alan was excited and ready to take us on his tour. My friend was not well versed with motorcycles and Alan expressed to him not to worry, he would be giving him a lesson a couple hours before the tour. This already gave showed me that Alan was a cool guy and was looking just to have some fun. After sizing us up for our gear (Helmet, Gloves). My girlfriend needed to get used to her moped so Alan went through the controls with her and had her ride up and down the street a few times before we left. So that she was comfortable before we embarked on our amazing adventure. I jumped on my new Honda CFR250L amazing bike! (going to buy when I return home). So we traveled through a low traffic University campus then through a few low traffic lights. Alan leading and Duong following up the rear to making sure that no one was left behind. About 10min later we were on dirt and heading right down the rice paddies. AMAZING!!!! 6 more hour of remote off the beaten path riding through many small villages, rice terraces, bridges, ducks, cows, eating a snack at a local store, pagodas, temples, taking a break and eating lunch at a historical house, up close and personal with water buffalo, did I saw rice paddies?, playing soccer with locals on their field, having a drink on the side of the road, swimming in a secret spot in the Red River, sunsets to die for!! I can go on!!! Let me just tell you where I went wrong... Settle in the town for a day then go directly on this trip 2 day or a week if time permits. This ride was so amazing I kick myself for not giving myself the time to spend the full two days. We got so much out of the one Day, that my girlfriend and I are talking about our return trip and 1 week tour with Alan & Duong. I can say that this tour alone will show more around Vietnam that you can do in a vehicle or on foot in a week. You also get a chance to escape from the crowds and experience the people and culture one on one. Alan and Duong are very knowledgable about their lands and tons of facts and history to share. Duong always is there with the camera so you can put yours away and just ride, just taking a few shots when we stop whenever you feel like stopping. I can't wait for my next tour!Advice on items to bring:• Sunscreen • Mini backpack (waters + stuff + extra clothing & swimsuit)• Sunglasses• Long sleeve shirt (Breathable / Thin)• Camera• Scarf• Smile

VN OFFROAD - motor Bike tours. I just got back from Vietnam last week. A group of friends & I used VN OFFROAD to take us on a tour of north west Vietnam. VN OFFROAD were very professional to deal with when booking our tour from Australia. They would always get back to you within one day and answer all your questions. Nothing is too hard for the crew at VN OFFROAD. Our guide (Michael Hue) is a man who is very passionate about Vietnam. He is a very experienced tour guide and made our trip better than we imagined. Michael Hue would organise everything from meals, to hire bikes, mechanic, drinks, trips to museum, help with shopping where there might normally be a language barrier - whatever request we had Michael Hue would deal with straight away. I cannot recommend VN OFFROAD highly enough for your trip to Vietnam. Whether it's a walking/shopping tour of Hanoi - or a hard core dirt bike adventure. VN OFFROAD are the crew you need to speak to. Trust me when I say VN OFFROAD are not happy until you are happy!http://vnoffroad.com/

Epic last day in Vietnam!. A friend we were traveling with had found and arranged a day tour with Alan and we were more than happy to get in on the action. My only experience riding a scooter was in Chiang Mai for about an hour, 6 years ago! That being said, I killed it! haha Even when we rode home in the twilight and my headlights were sporadically turning off, our other guide Sy led us carefully back to the shop on calmer streets, as we returned to bustling Hanoi. I always felt safe and looked after and am now eager to learn how to ride a manual dirt bike before my next visit - so I can get even MORE ACTION on a longer excursion.I had an absolute blast tearing up the backroads we were taken on, through rice paddies and duck farms and small towns with the most beautiful, uncrowded pagodas. We had lunch at a local family's 400yo home and it was delicious. I still think about that pumpkin! I haven't heard of any other tour that gets you this close to the real Vietnam. And Alan is such a pleasure to ride and talk with, very knowledgeable and encouraging, he's the perfect tour guide. I think we will be friends for a long time.Our tour ended with a dip in the river at sunset. SO BEAUTIFUL!!! I thought I must be dreaming. It truly was the best day and fully encompassed my newfound love affair with Vietnam, especially Hanoi and the north. I can't wait to return! Thanks again, Alan and Sy. You guys ROCK!

Hanoi motorbike 1 day countryside tour. Weeeeeeee!!!! Alan shared the true Vietnam countryside with me. Loved every minute of it and would recommend to all!!! I just got my motorcycle license but soon became very comfortable with the almost new dirt bike. Wish I could give him more stars, but I know where I'll be going when I return to Vietnam. Thank you very much Alan. Habs bear also had a helluva time!!
Awesome trip. This is definitely the best experience I had in vietnam! Must try in vietnam even for non rider! The boss Alan is friendly and patience, riding is safe with him around.

Amazing Experience. I was nervous after only contacting the business about 3 days in advance of the tour I wanted to take. I shouldn't have been nervous at all! The email that I sent was replied to in perfect English, and all of my questions were answered clearly and promptly. On the day of the tour our guide Cuong was very nice and patient, and gave us as much attention as we needed to feel comfortable. We had an amazing 1 day tour in the countryside. I would definitely recommend this activity to anyone visiting Hanoi! As long as you are brave and adventurous I think you will have an amazing time! Be careful though! You will ride through city traffic and that part did feel borderline dangerous, but everyone got through just fine!

Our favorite activity in Southeast Asia to date!!. My husband and I, along with one of our friends, took a day-long tour of the Hanoi countryside with Cuong. The trip from start to finish was world-class. Cuong gave us lessons on how to operate the dirt bikes prior to leaving, and let us practice in a nearby neighborhood before heading out. I was nervous as I had never driven a bike before, but he was patient and helpful!Once we got out to the countryside, we were greeted with sprawling green views of the rice paddies and surrounding villages. We never went too fast and always focused on safety. Cuong spoke fantastic English and gave us the history of each location we stopped at. We saw a 1000 year old pagoda, rice fields being planted, ate at a 400 year old guest house, and saw the tomb of a king during our trip. We got home and there was a cold bottle of water and a beer waiting for us. If you are looking for something to do outside of the city, and you want to take a break from the hustle of downtown and get back to nature, this is the trip for you. It was worth every single penny and I would do it again if I had the chance!
The only way to see Vietnam . Great tour, great guides. Very flexible. The only way to see inaccessible areas of Vietnam. Food, sugar cane, guest houses, and speed. Absolutely recommended.

11 day Ho Chi Minh trail - trip of a lifetime. Great way to cover the most rural and beautiful parts of Vietnam, including the local culture, history, food, scenic routes and a lot of incredible views. I was a beginner and Alan was very helpful in answering numerous queries via email prior to the start of the trip. My guide Le was exception throughout the trip - extremely helpful with everything, great local knowledge of the best roads to travel and the most interesting places to visit. I had a very memorable trip and would highly recommend Alan and Le

This tour is as good as it gets!. Alan took my family and I on a fantastic motorbike tour out of the city and in to the 'real vietnam'. We visited an ancient Pagoda, zig-zagged through farm land, stopped in at a temple, had a beautiful meal cooked for us by a family living in a 400 year old home where we sat to enjoy the delicicious feast, swam in Alans 'secret swimming pool' in the red river to cool off and weaved our way through the back streets. A great combination of on road and off road riding seeing and understanding the history of the city, Alan is a fantastic guide and I would definitely do a longer tour should I ever come back to Hanoi. Thank you for this experience

Best way to see the real Hanoi.... Our last day in Hanoi was made truely great by spending that with Alan and a day tour with Vietnam Motorbike Tour. It really is a safe and great way to see the real Hanoi. Alan is a tremendous guide and really ensures everyone is happy. An absolute experience that the family will cherish for a very long time. Thoroughly recommend.

Tully's on Tour. We spent 10hrs with Alan. He collected us from our hotel and took us to collect the motorbikes. Then the fun began. Alan lead us through Hanoi Streets and into the countryside. We passed through farmland, villages, visited an ancient Pagoda, had lunch at a roadside cafe (delicious food), rode along dykes, through country lanes in fields. Alan was very conscious of our varying riding skills and directed us safely through each aspect of the trip. I would fully recommend this as a way to see the true heart of Vietnam life, outside the hustle and bustle of the city.

Amazing experience with Alan. Booked a one day trip in Hanoi with Alan and I can't recommend it enough. He was professional and helpful from the first email contact up until we part ways at the hotel. I was surprised how much we squeezed I to one day I really feel like I have seen Hanoi and Vietnam now. We took 250cc hondas and the bikes were practically brand new and were fun throughout. I am planning to come back in a year or two and do a longer trip. If you are looking for a bike tour in Vietnam, look no further than Alan and Vietnam motorbike tours!

Best day ever!. The title says it all. Alan took us (my boyfriend and me) out on the most incredible adventure. Through city roads and empty country paths, even "buffalo" tracks to a 1,000 year old Pagoda and more... I'm not really confident on a bike, no problem, Alan put me in the back of his and I sat back and enjoyed the most beautiful country. Lots of photo opportunities, a splendid feast for lunch, swimming in the Red River in a tropical storm and a couple of beers on the way home made for a grey day. Alan's knowledge of the history and culture of the country is unparralled, if you want to see Vietnam and its people without any hassle and have a thrill at the same time, call him! GO!
Day trip. Calling all bikers if your in Hanoi this is who you need to contact! Fantastic day riding around the countryside with a guide and my son.

Once in a lifetime. After a day with Alan riding through the vieatnamese countryside on his honda xr 125s, swimming in the red river during a tropical storm, and visiting ancient villages and pagodas, its hard to imagine a better or more incredible day in vietnam.

Amazing day in the hanoi countryside. What a fantastic day. I am a female traveling on my own and wanted to do a motorcycle tour. I had e mailed a few companies and Alan responded to me pretty much immediately and continued to do so from them on. I have never road before but Alan was happy teach me and show me the ropes, I decided to go on the back of his bike 250cc brand new dirt bike (only 8kms on the clock!) In the end, and I'm glad I did! I even changed my mind on which tour I wanted to do at the very last minute and it was absolutely no problem. We headed out of Hanoi into the countryside, main roads, off road, through the rice fields, following the rivers and streams, visiting temples and saying hi to the local buffalo and ducks! We even had fun getting the bike across a little stream!All the time Alan was filming on his go pro and he's also a pretty good photographer, so I got some awesome pics!We had regular breaks for sugarcane juice, green tea, coffee. Then we stopped at 400year old home stay for what I would describe as a feast rather than just lunch, it was delicious, I even had a bit of rice wine!As the sun was going down we stopped by the lake for a swim and a drink before heading back for a compulsory beer back on beer street in the old quarter of Hanoi.This trip was just what I had hoped for, I felt safe at all times and trusted Alan and his knowledge 100%. I'd recommend this trip for anyone of any skill level, he'll adapt it for you.. Alan what a legend ☺

Hanoi to Mai Chau. We alloted two days while in Hanoi to a tour outside the busy City. I contacted Alan, finding him through TripAdvisor. Response time was immediate from that moment on. He sent us his recommendations. Picked up at our hotel, given bike/gear and Tour Guide and off we went on an adventure. The route and Mai Chau was amazing. We stayed in a stilted homestay with food and drinks. We came home a different route the next day. Stopping for food, picture taking. Tour guide, Lee Pham, was experienced, knowledgeable and friendly. We had a lot of fun with him, good sense of humor. Contact Alan!

Fab time thank you!. There in March 2015. Brand new yamaha 250s. Loooooovely. Alan was a great host. Well though out. I did single day and regretted it. Should have done at least 2 days. So don't be shy. Go for it. 2-3 days. onestly I'd go for 5 or 6 if I went back. Also Alan has sent me all the phtoos and video he took which am really pleaseed with. GoPro. He's also a pretty good photographer so you''ll get some good shots. Thank you
Awesome Tour of Hanoi. Alans motorbike tour was an amazing way to see and explore Hanoi. Alan strings together great experiences with very fun biking along the way. I highly recommend him!

Amazing Hanoi motorbike tour!. Did the one day Hanoi motorbike tour! Highly recommend! Alan and his crew look after you throughout the entire trip. Very organized, safe, and thinks of all the little things. Great day from off road in the rice fields to the mayhem of coming back to Hanoi by night. I've ridden a bike for 3 years in Sydney but nothing prepares you for the craziness of coming back from the countryside to the city by night. You see some phenomenal sights I will never forget. Highly recommend doing this trip with Vietnam Motorbike Tours!
