#grinningfromeartoear - 1 day Hanoi countryside with Alan!. Where do I start?Professional, warm & friendly email communication with Alan, followed by the most awesome day out since I began travelling 3 months ago. Alan collected me from my hotel at 8am sharp and we headed to the office to get set up. I don't have any riding experience but he was more than happy to show me the ropes and gave me the option to either ride my own bike (taking quiet roads and going slowly), or being a passenger on his amazing Honda CRF 250cc (going quicker and having fun) - I opted for the latter of course! We saw beautiful countryside and the real Hanoi outside of the city - a total mix of modern and traditional life that I've totally fallen in love with. It was HOT so we took lots of breaks for drinks and ate a delicious Vietnamese lunch at a lovely local restaurant. Then on to more spectacular views, more off roading around farm land and villages, more Vietnamese iced coffee, and a refreshing swim in the Red River with local kids.Alan took no risks during our trip and I felt 100% safe - which is a good sign considering my only experience on bikes has been on a few motorbike taxis around Asia. I'm already checking my diary to see when I can book my next tour! Thank you Alan! <3

In Vietnam for an adventure? Then do not miss out on this !. Before today, I'd never ridden a motor bike.But after a brief lesson, we were on our way. From scrambling up hill sides, speeding through rice fields to weaving through small town traffic. This has been, hands down the most exciting experience of the trip.

Best thing in Hanoi!. Great company, Alan the guide was amazing. All the bikes are brand new, great condition. Alan taught us how to ride and then took us an an adventure! Saw loads of amazing things and Alan was extremely knowledgable about everything. The cost includes all snacks, drinks, lunch and loads of photos and videos. best day of our Vietnam trip so far! Can't recommend this highly enough. Cheers Alan!!

Best Tour Ever. Very god Company. New motorbikes especially very god Honda 250 cm, CRF. Perfect for offroad. No problems. Good guide. He find a lot of funny backroads and offroads. I Will 100% recomment this compagny

Motorbike Tour - 12 days. unforgettable experience - the best motorcycles to conditions - new and well-run - great tour guide - flexible and with top service - perfect variation with offroad - Back Road - mountains - forest - rivers and the sea.

Amazing arrangement! Stunning landscape with excitement!. Joined the one day Hanoi motorbike tour, visiting the country side of Hanoi is just amazing! I am a newbie bike rider myself, but Alan gives a great tutorial and guidance, which makes my day! In fact this is the best event through out my trip! Highly recommended!

Awesome motorbike trip. With just a day to spare in Hanoi I optomistically emailed vietnam bike tours about the 1 day Hanoi trip as single person. Alan replied very quickly with everything I needed to know (meetin location and the best way to get there from my hotel plus what to bring with you and costs etc). As Alan says everything is inclusive and that is absolutely delivered he pays for all expenses and breaks which occur during the trip of which there are many.1 day Hanoi trip is unbeatable for first time bikers (as long as you go in small groups or alone as lots of newbies are hard to manage for one guide) - let him know you are new before hand and he will be very patient in teaching you how to ride safely in the quiet university grounds. Alan will make sure you are will looked after during the trip always keeping and eye on you and warning you well in advance of any hazards ahead. Roads are very quiet in the rural area with a few slow driving locals, however you will have to go on the busy highway to get there. As long as you are always keeping an eye on the road Alan will do everything else for you. Alan and all the locals are extremely polite welcoming and patient with you.The trip takes you into real Hanoi where the tourist buses seldom go so this is the best way to see Hanoi. I am extremely pleased to have been lucky enough to come across this exceptional bike company don't look anywhere else. Bikes are all top notch quality to (if you're new go for the 125cc)I end the trip enlighted by The pagodas and Alan's information about them, and a much more expierenced bike rider who's had an absolute blast.Alan films the whole things with go pros and takes great pictures throughout which he sends to you at the end. His english is the best i have heard in Hanoi. Im sure the other drivers are good too they all speak great english.Unmissable

trip to Mai Chau. Hi, 2 days motorbike tour to Mai Chau, it was excellent, Alan was very responsive and organised the tour at the last minute in no time, and that was a great experience with our guide Johnny who bring us along amazing roads and landscapes

The Ultimate Way to Experience Vietnam. Took a one-day tour out of Hanoi with Alan in early May, 2015, and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Touring by motorbike gave us access to sights that I will remember for the rest of my life, most of which would not have been possible to see on any other type of tour. Having a guide as passionate about his work and as knowledgable as Alan made a good trip great. The only thing I would do differently is to book a longer trip! Fantastic experience, one which I cannot recommend highly enough.

Awesome motorbike trip. I've learned how to ride a manual motorbike with Alan. At first I was a bit hesitant, because I've only tried semi-automatic before and wasn't used to the clutch. In the end, I've decided to give it a shot anyway. The trip was fantastic. We visited the beautiful countryside of Hanoi and explored the rice-fields. Off-road riding was challenging and definitely tested my skills. We made a few stops on the way - at the ancient village and at a pagoda which were remarkable as well. In the end of the day, already after dawn we we fighting the evening traffic at the entrance of Hanoi, this was the most difficult part of the journey, and probably the most exciting. Overall, regardless of you enjoy riding a motorbike or not, you won't regret about taking this tour.

Memorable motorcycle trip in Vietnam. Hoan took my girlfriend and I on an unforgettable trip through every terrain imaginable and through some of the most gorgeous locales that we had ever seen. The bikes were more than up to the task! Hoan really knows what backroads to take based on what kind of adventure you would want to have. And the restaurants and stays we had were all fantastic. Would definitely highly recommend this tour, and will definitely look them up again next time I am in Vietnam.

One of the most memorable tours we have ever done. Highly recommended.. My wife and I joined a one day trip with Doung but, we had such a fantastic time that we are planning to come back to for a 6 days tour.Doung took us around Hanoi countryside to visit temples, agricultural areas as well as local villages via local dirt tracks and rice paddy fields . We got to see and experienced so much more of the real Vietnam than we bargained for! Everyone we met asking the trip are so nice and friendly, they have pantry if time to stop and chat to us.Doung is a fantastic tour guide. He is adventurous, fun and knowledgeable. He goes above and beyond to make your trip as enjoyable as it can be. He is a real people's person.We are looking forward to coming back and joining a 6 day trip in order to see even more of the untouched countryside.It is worth noting that I'm not an experienced rider by any means. I have had limited (very little) experience on manual bike. However, I did not have any issues with the trip.

Unbelievable & must-do experience in Hanoi!. Had an amazing 3 day, 2 night experience with Vietnam Motorbike Tour in April ’15. My only downside was that I book such a short trip and wished I booked a longer trip!Right from the start communication was established and my emails would be answered very quickly and extensively; everyone at Vietnam Motorbike Tours made sure we were comfortable with everything, booked everything smoothly, and made a good transition with the visas at the airport to our hotel. Amazing communication!Since there was only 2 of us plus a guide, the rate was very reasonably higher but we got a private tour & a great bonding experience guide and all!The bikes were newer models in great condition, super durable and very comfortable to ride on – I was so surprised! Will definitely miss those bikes :)We were recommended a package since I had a hard time choosing from the many options what to do on our limited timeline – but it did not disappoint! We got to see so many things throughout our 3 day trip and our stay overnight in the homestay was so welcoming with amazing food and hospitality.Our guide was professional and extremely knowledgeable of the roads and provinces we explored, but also was riding more as our friend than guide :) He also knew all the great food places to stop by for lunch, for a snack or even for drinks whenever we wanted to stop. I had some of the best food on that trip and not in the city! Our guide was also very patient with me since I have a bad back, so stopping was encouraged whenever I needed it and made sure to stop by great viewpoints for taking pictures. He was also very patient with us riding in Hanoi as we were very nervous but made sure that we got into the office before the crazier traffic hit; what an experience!I would definitely be back for more riding and longer trips in the future with Vietnam Motorbike Tour! If you have a gopro, make sure you bring it and your accessories - they have parts attached to the tops of some helmets already, you just need your mounts! I can’t wait to come back to Hanoi and experience even more thrills, beautiful landscapes and soaking in the history & culture. I highly recommend booking with Vietnam Motorbike Tours, without a doubt!
Wonderful Traveling Vietnam. Thank you and Alen helper professionally organized and executed this day, I can recommend a wonderful memorial.Anyway, we got to places where you probably never.

Great experience, offered much more than we expected and will be returning for more. As we only had a week in Vietnam we only booked a one day tour, however if it would have been our first day we would have cancelled our other plans and completed a 6 day tour (which we now plan to come back to do next year).Alan and his team were a pleasure to deal with and Alan was very quick in communication s including passing information to our hotel to help us out.The equipment was second to none, I was relieved to see that the helmets were the same standard as you would receive in the UK and that the bikes were the best on the market and almost brand new, clearly this company takes pride in itself.As for the trip, once we had made our way out of the city we were guided through country lanes to see local life, taken to Pagodas where the culture was explained and across off road sections to push us safely to our limits. We would stop and chat occasionally while Alan compiled a series of Go pro videos and pictures for is to remember the trip too. We stopped at a nearby village and received the best meal that we have eaten during the week here too before continueing the trip stopping for the occasional coffee.All in all an amazing day which I would highly recommend to all. Alan and his team can cater for the expert rider down to learners or can take pillion passengers for those that want the experience but do not yet have the confidence.Cancel your other plans and fit this in!

Amazing tour, wish I could to stay longer. What an experience! I can't emphasise how good this was, by far the best thing I have done in Vietnam, real Vietnam seen from two wheels! Alan and his team are all excellent, very helpful and full of great local knowledge! Give it a go, you won't regret it!

Bikes, Cows and Rice. March 21th 2015, went on the single day tour from Ha Noi with Alan. First off, scheduling was a breeze, as a traveler you are in and out of wifi but Alan was quick with the emails. He was on time in the AM and gave me a ride to the office. I got set up with gear and a sharp looking 125CC dirt bike. I knew how to ride so there was not a major tutorial but I would imagine he is very patient with new riders.Started off in the streets of Ha Noi, and within 30-40 mins we where on calm country roads. After that we road through small towns, farms and some off road trails. Alan would stop for local food and Pagodia's if desired or would ride through for the more avid bikers.After a fun day or riding, we got back to the office, and I was treated to a beer and some snacks. Alan offered to give me a ride back to Old Quarter on a crazy saturday night, which was great cause a taxi would have taken forever.I highly recommend for beginners and seasoned riders. Note, you can customize what you want to do. Just be upfront with Alan off the bat.

Wow! We had a ball!. Our group of six experienced an awesome 6 day 1040 km ride up to Ha Giang and back to Hanoi. This included two fatalistic nights at authentic Vietnamese home stays "Mot, hai ,ba Yoh!". Alan arranged our pre and post ride accommodation and a great trip on Ha Long Bay, which made it easy for us to finish off a great trip to Vietnam. Our guides Lee and Ang looked after us very well on the ride, they were great and ensured we were comfortable and safe every step of the way. Strongly recommend Vietnam Motorbike tours to everyone that wants an excellent adventure!

Ho Chi Minh Trail. Allan is a very good operator, he is true to his word and delivers what he promises to do, I used his company to arrange accommodation and tours while I was in Hanoi before the motorcycle tour, all the arrangements were excellent. Coming from New Zealand using Alan to arrange everything made things very easy, his charges are a lot cheaper than if I had booked myself from New Zealand, and he only required a 30% deposit and did not accept full payment until I was happy with everything.The ride down the Ho Chi Minh Trail was excellent, lots to see, Quinn the guide was excellent, great food, good accommodation, and Allan's motorcycles are very good, the bikes are near new and well maintained.I would recommend Alan at Vietnam Motorbike Tours to anyone who want a hassle free motorcycle tour of Vietnam.Alan has my email address and I am happy for him to pass on to anyone from NZ that want any further information

A memorable experience!. Allan was very quick to respond to my inital inquiry. He is a very confident rider and very well spoken and courtious. Also very knowledgable with history and informative with Vietnam cultural traditions. My husband and I did the day trip out of Hanoi, and this was the highlight of our trip in Hanoi! Highly recommend!!! Thank you for an amazing day, we will be back for a longer ride!

Motorbike Ride Hanoi, Vietnam - a day to remember. March 2nd 2015.For my birthday (58th) I went motorbike riding on a Honda 125 and my wife chose to ride as a pillion passenger with our guide Alan as she had never ridden a motorbike before. It was a day trip from Hanoi out into the countryside, riding the back roads through rice fields and remote villages, through spectacular countryside. Our guide Alan was competent, well informed, extremely safety conscious. Real Vietnam, real freedom.We started on the outskirts of the city, where I got to experiance riding in the manic Hanoi traffic, what fun!. Within 30 min of setting off we were riding on back roads and out into the country side. Alan took us into the paddy fields where we rode along narrow tracks separating the fields. Everyone we met was so courteous and welcoming, we got a great sense of how hard the people work and what rural life is like. We visited pagodas, eat in a traditional restaraunt and learned about the family traditions and life in Vietnam - it was amazing and defiantly worth doing.Alan's company offers

3 Day Mekong Delta Scooter Trip. This company was excellent with the communications and setting up the tour. Once we arrived in Ho Chi Minh we were met by one of their guides - Luu. From there Luu was great and helped us scooter through the busy streets heading South in to the Mekong Delta. He was very informative, funny, and spoke great English. Luu looked after all the details and made us feel very welcome in his country and was genuinely interested in showing us a good time.We stayed in a home stay on the first night, food and accommodation were great, don't expect the Ritz, but expect authentic living and it's clean and the food is prepared fresh! We then stayed in a hotel in a city further down in to the delta. Rooms were clean, and slept very well. We ventured on to a small boat and visited a the floating market which was a great experience.Travelling along country roads, and highways we were never far from good ca fe, phu, and a relaxing hammock. The trip was one our favourites to date. The country is beautiful, people are friendly and Luu was absolutely incredible. Highly recommend to everyone! Thanks Luu!Thanks Alan for organising.

Hanoi-North East Tour. What an awesome 5 days with Alan through untouched terrain. Absolutely loved every bit of it. He took us to the best pho place in all of vietnam somewhere on the way to the chinese boarder, took us to x-mas mass in a place that felt like we had time travelled and always made us laugh. Luckily we did 5 instead of originally 3 days and left out the crappy halong bay boats.

amazing 5-day roadtrip as a couple!. During a 3 week trip in Cambodia and Vietnam with my husband, we decided we wanted to organize a short 3 day trip on motorbikes. That's how we met Alan, who in a few hours had given us a proposal and different options. That's where we were convinced 3 days would definitely not be enough and we embarked on a 5 day roadtrip to the north of Hanoi and chinese border. It was an amazing and breathtaking experience. Offroad Indochina is very well organized and at the same time gives you the freedom to plan the trip as you wish. All accomodations are taken care off and chosen in a way that you feel emerged into an authentic vietnamese experience. Meeting local people, no other tourists in sight, eating the best food Vietnam has to offer, breathtaking landscapes and adventurous off-road options is just a glimpse into our amazing adventure. For sure 5 days is also not enough and we would definitely like to explore the coastline and the south by motorbike next... We truly recommend Offroad Indochina for their professionalism, organization and flexibility. At the same time safety was a must for me and thanks to our very cool guide Lee, we felt super secure and taken care off at all times. Definitely a must-do when in Vietnam...even as a couple!

one for the bucket list.. Alan and his team did a great job. We did a Dads & Sons 3 day trip through the majestic countryside & mountains of North Vietnam. All road conditions were experienced from highways to off-road tracks. A memorable experience, especially through the winding mountain passes and the lake crossings. In hindsight we should have extended & customized our trip. Alan is very flexible and can tailor your journey accordingly. Suggest home stays - a wonderful way to meet the friendly locals, and, shorter daily sectors - allows you more opportunities to stop and admire the scenery. Hospitality & cuisine.....unforgettable.

Vietnam motoX trip. Had a great time. what a fantastic way to genuinely see, discover and experience vietnam. well organized, super friendly and highly recommend doing it with Hoan. he was fantastic and the best guide you can hope to have. food was great along the way and the home stays were the only way to do it and so much fun.

Great motorcycle tour & holiday. Thank you to Alan for organising the 5 day trip in Vientan, myself and 3 friends all had a fantastic time. The destinations and places we stayed at were all amazing and the food was even better. Traveling the North West side of Vietnam on motorbikes, was the best way to see it.The bikes performed flawlessley and our tour guide and friend Le, was brilliant, you could not have asked for a better guide on the holiday. Thank you for the experiences and i will look forward to traveling with you again. :)

Unforgettable North Vietnam riding of 6 days. We decide as is urgent and started travel but it was very good selection.Decided justly with friends after select schedule and bike with Alan.250 bike was way in 2014 that have the best condition and run well without causing any problem during 6 days.A day day, fathom that go the north was so fantastic and guidance of guide le Pham immersed us by a delight.All foods were good coming sleeping place and kindness and simplicity of natives made to love Vietnam.The weather not fined, but fantastic natural landscape that hesitate us to lay next once Vietnam whole riding plan be make to .

Great 1 day tour. Myself and my wife went on a 1 day trip from Hanoi with Alan as we didn't have enough time to do more and my only regret was that we didn't go for longer.Firstly Alan is a top bloke. Secondly the bikes are very well maintained. Thirdly I would go back for more if I had the time.We both thoroughly enjoyed seeing a side of Vietnam we wouldn't have otherwise seen if we hadn't gone on the tour (even though we went to Sapa and Halong Bay).

5 day trip. A great way to see the beautiful Vietnam countryside. I did the 5 day tour of North Vietnam with 2 homestays and 2 hotel nights. Great scenery and experienced every type of road surface from tarmac to gravel to greasy mud, from motorways to winding mountain tracks. Great for beginners and experienced riders especially with our helpful guide Le in charge.

Motorcycle day trip through the back-roads of Northern Vietnam. My wife and I didn't have time to try out the 5/8/11 day tours that Alan had to offer (though from our interaction with him, it seems he literally could organise absolutely anything you wanted - and more!) so we stuck to the day trip visiting an ancient town and taking in the gorgeous scenery and experience en route.Things which I felt made this one of our best trips ever:1. Tour guidesAlan and his team really know their way around, from the best food and coffee stops to off-road riding routes suitable for any experience level. Alan himself took us for this tour and provided nuggets of information that made topics clear, concise and engaging. If you're a culture nut, they've got you covered. If you're big on thrills, riding the great outdoors of vietnam and soaking in parts of the country very few tourists really get to see, they've got you covered too.2. The bikesWe rode on brand new motorcycles that looked fresh off the factory belt. Alan shared his philosophy with us and made us feel very assured that safety and reliability was of paramount importance to him and his company. At no point did we feel that the brakes/chain/suspension might give way, and the bikes took everything we threw at them when we had the chance to kick up some mud down the beaten track.3. The foodHe made sure we had exactly what it was we were craving for. We said awesome fried spring rolls, and sure enough that's what we got when lunch was served. He called the restaurant beforehand to make the request, and special attention to details like that (instead of just following a fixed menu like so many other tours) really made us feel like well-taken-of tourists. and oh the coffee...4. The rideWe took the tour in December when the weather was a little chilly, dropping to a low of 11 degrees. The combination of cool, fresh air, the sun on your back, miles and miles of plantation fields ahead of you, the honking, the staring, the crunch of sand, mud, rock and grass under your wheel, winding trails that took you past villages, cemeteries, temples, narrow bridges, back alleys and the eclectic mix of aromas coming from coffee shops, street food, cow dung and the odd slash-and-burner all made for what was truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience for the both of us. My wife particularly loved the rest stop which was off road, across a sprawling plain with just our bikes, our coffee & chocolates, the mountains and some playful cows nearby.Alan has made the start of our trip so, so difficult to beat that I'm sure I'll be utterly bored when i'm lying in my cabin on a cruise in Halong Bay tomorrow. We will most definitely be back again for the mountain tour next time!

Excellent trip, best trip ever.. We booked the motortour for 4 days to the north of Vietnam. First there was the pick up al the hotel by our guide Le. Then we left with the bags on the (new)motorcycles. After a few minuts driving we were in the countryside. The view is beautiful. Later on when we drove more and more to the north, we stopped at local villages for a lunch or dinner. Everything was taken care off. Also the whole tour we have learnt a lot about the culture and habits from Le our guide. We could stop anytime to make pictures or just to drink anytime we want. The sleeping was really good in hotel or homestay. Everything was pre booked by organisation, so we didn't have to worry about it. We would highly recomment booking a motortour with this company. Everything was perfect. The organisation was perfect, the tour was perfect, the food and so on. In the future we want to book again by Alan Chien and his guide Le who was great. We want to thank Alan and Le for giving us a unforgettable time in the north of vietnam.

The best part of my trip. I did a 7 day tour, seeing the north east and north west part of Vietnam with amazing people and our amazing guide, Le. It was by far the best part of my holidays. Even if I was travelling alone, I felt like with my family the whole time. We have explored parts of the country with almost no tourists, and an amazing sightseeing. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Beautiful way to see Vietnam. Vietnam is probably the best country to motobike in the world. And Alan and his team are the best guys to organize it for you. The bikes are brand new. ( no mechanical issues what so ever), Great english and all round good guys. I did a solo tour of the north west with Le who knows Vietnam back to front. I never would have seen some of the places without him as a guide. Really funny nice guy to. Helped me a lot and taught me a lot about Vietnam. I would definitely go with these guys again. Thanks again guys.

Amazing experience!!. With having no idea what to really expect I was absolutely blown away with the tour. Bikes were new, house stays were great and the food was incredible. Everyday there was something new around every corner that would make you say WOW! in amazement. Alan and his team have really got this tour down pat. From pick up from the motel all the way back again, everything has been thought of. Thanks again and I'll be back very soon for sure!

Trip of a lifetime. this trip was easily the best I've been on in a long time, Alan and his team were great, they catered for our every need, the bikes were brand new and always serviced. The tour guides speak and understand English well, and the tour it self was amazing, the scenery was beautiful, all the house stays with the families was amazing and they were all very friendly, but I also owe it to my guide hoan vulinh, he was a great guide with excellent knowledge to gain the most out of the tour, thanks to the boys from Alan tours, and I shall be back soon for another trip :-)

Excellent and Perdect Tour. As promised by other TripAdviser reviews, Alan delivered a superb tour that was well planned and organised. The service was 6 Star and the experience is once in a lifetime. Bikes and tour guide were excellent. Bikes are brand new and always serviced. All our needs were catered for and the tour guide helped us in absolutely everything we needed. Alot of attention to safety and comfort. I would recommend this tour to everyone if you want to see the best of North Vietnam. You will not be dissapointed. Alan and his team are dedicated and passionate about this experience and service. They are definately the best operator in Vietnam. Thanks.

7 Day Northern Vietnam Motorbike Tour. If you are looking at doing a motorbike tour through Vietnam then this is the company to go with. Alan is very professional and it was a great experience from start to finish. The scenery was absolutely amazing from day one and Le said it would get better and it did. The accommodation was good, the food was good and the riding experience unbelievable. Our tour guide Le was excellent and added to the overall experience.I will be back to do another tour without doubt.
awesome. was an awesome trip with a good bunch of tour guides!! the accomidation was very good, would recomend this to anyone wanting to explore vietnam on a motor bike

Exceptional service, great tour. Having already spent a week in Sa Pa, and other private tours I did not think there was any thing more Vietnam had to offer me on this trip, that is until I met with Alan and my private guide Hoan.Even before I met Alan, I was kept informed of my ride, it happens I was the only rider, but to their credit they were still happy to take me out so that I did not miss out on my experience. Alan even arranged my accommodation and taxi transfers.As for the ride - what can I say - it was one of the greatest things I have even done, I was a little apprehensive but Hoan made be very comfortable and led the way through light Hanoi traffic. once we were out of the city, the scenery, the people, the children, the homestay host - it was all perfect.There was a pleasant surprise at every turn.I did the 2 day Mai Chai tour (now wish it was longer) but It was as if the route was specifically designed for me. It is the best way to see the real Vietnam.Returning to the traffic of Hanoi - I wasn't bothered at all - in fact enjoyed that as well.I was looked after from start to finish and made to feel very welcome.I would have no hesitation recommending Vietnam Motorbike tours and look forward to returning for a longer ride.

Amazing Vietnam Tour. We choose a 4 days Babe lake tour... The route was amazing! The bikes are ok (CRF125) and the guide (Quynh) was very nice! He take care about us all the time, and he drive like angels!The homestays are awesome! And the food are home made! Simply the best!Alan, the owner, help us in everything, and he booked for us the best excursions when we have finish the tour.So, if you want to discover a Really Vietnam, do it with them!

8 day motorbike tour with the family in North Vietnam. Amazing experience, especially the organised home stays! Such beautiful people, food and sights! Would definitely come back, and recommend Mr Allans company. Great communication, we were happy with all aspects of the tour.Only thing I advise is that you bring the suitable clothing with you as we were told we could get FOX gear in Hanoi but we struggled to find anything suitable for on motorbikes. And bring your own first aid kit as the guide didn't have a very good one, and chemists aren't always available!
Family motorbike tour of North Vietnam. Fantastic experience, especially the home stays! Amazing people, food, scenery, and such great guides!

Alan and tema did great.. I reached out to several tour organizations for a short notice trip to teh mountains in N. Vietnam. Alan was the most responsive and timely of all the companies. This attention to detail continued after they had the reservation. They even arranged a bit of a customer tour for me as I was interested in many more km/day than normal as I had only as short time and particular goals of what I wanted to see. They did great, the bikes were great, and a great experience all around. I would use them again in a heartbeat and recommend them to anyone.

Great afternoon out biking. Got the info from Tripadvisor and called Mr. Allan for a half day afternoon bike tour on the country side.The bikes XR125's very well maintained and reliable, full face helmets as well as Fox riding gloves provided.The tour guide (Mr. Cheng) speaks very good english and made our experience totally enjoyable, not rushing us at all, briefing us about all the sightseeing places and surroundings and specially looking after us all the time.!Refreshments were provided and included with the tour.All and all a great experience.Totally recommended.

Hanoi Day Motorcycle Day Trip - Event Manager's Perspective. We hosted a conference group in Hanoi early June 2014 and must recommend this company and their staff for Motorcycle Tour arrangements around Hanoi.Whilst I did not personally ride on the tour, feedback from the delegates was all positive for their half day tour of Hanoi. The tour was a tailor made half day tour, encompassing the madness of Hanoi traffic to the calm of the farm lands, before visiting the local Snake Village. From an Event Managements perspective, Alan was very attentive to fulfilling all requests prior to the tour date. Tour arrangements is such a small portion of what we do, it helps when the provider is on the ball and able to be available to answer and questions. Well done to yourself and your team.

Hanoi - Sa Pa 6 day round trip. We were collected from our hotel driven across Hanoi to collect our XR 125's to start a 6 day round trip. We met the team and our guide and we were off. The guide's English was excellent along with his sense of humor we all got on great. Our request was to take in the scenery and avoid the main routes where possible all of this was delivered. Our guide answered all of our questions regarding local life and he was particularly watchful that we remained safe and together through out the trip. Vietnam Motor bike tours arranged a trip that was tailored to meet our requests accommodated all of our needs at a very reasonable price and went the extra mile with out any trouble to collect us for the hotel, drop us off and made further arrangements through out our stay in Vietnam on our behalf booking accommodation and arranging other tours. Alan also drove across Hanoi in the early morning prior to our departure to ensure that we had copies of photos and Go Pro camera coverage of our trip.Excellent service, excellent guide, excellent adventure highly recommended. Thanks Harvey

Hanoi rental for local sightseeing. Have rented several times, so far for local getting around not tours, but the bikes have always been reliable and safe and the helmets are proper not little plastic caps that many ride with in Vietnam. Given the chaotic traffic in Hanoi a proper helmet, fortunately never needed yet, is always a good idea. Hope to do a tour one day, but if you are visiting and want to get out on a bike it is a great experience and I highly recommend this company.

11 Day Ho Chi Minh Trail Motorcycle Tour. We got to see a lot of the countryside and experience a variety of roads. The most unique experience was the traffic rules. It took time to get used to that. We ate local foods and all of it was very good every place we ate. The accommodations were good, no complaints. Alan did a very, very good job in paying attention to the details. He was very receptive to all of our needs and answered our questions and offered suggestions for additional things to do, like a Hanoi city tour, and suggesting the Ha Long boat excursion. Our motorcycle tour guide did a great job in taking care of us on the road. He was very knowledgeable and a lot of fun. We intend on returning to Vietnam in the future to tour other parts of Vietnam on motorcycle we did not see on this trip (like the Northwest). I would highly recommend Alan's tour company.

Ho Chi Min Trail Motorcyle Tour. An extremely interesting and thoroughly enjoyable tour. The whole tour, starting from the taxi pick up at Han Hoi airport to the taxi drop off at the end of the tour was organised impecably with great attention to detail, well done Alan very impressive! Our guide ( Coung) was very knowledgable, very friendly and spoke excellent English, he also did an excellent and very professional job and looked after us extremly well. The country was great with a surprise around every corner (almost). The variety of the roads and surfaces we rode on was such that you never had the opportunity to get bored. The accomodation ranged from acceptable to reasonably high standard but on the odd occasion where we didn't have aircon it was a struggle to sleep with the high temperature and humidity. We found all the the food we had on the tour was very good and the beer prices very acceptable, 15 pence for a glass of draft beer in one place we ate. We intend to come back to Vietnam in a couple of years time to do the North West but will try and arrange this earlier in the year when the temperature is better. The bikes we had were okay (XR125) but I would have like something with a little more power particularly on the twisty sections of the mountain roads, however they were light , manouverable and did the job. Riding in the towns and cities is not for the faint hearted but having said that I wouldn't hesitate recommending this tour for the experienced rider.

Excellent Motorbike from Lao Cai- Ha Giang- Dong Van-Meo Vac - Ba Be Lakes- Hanoi - Just Amazing. We started cycling from Hanoi then changed in Lao Cai - offroad Indonesia also known as off road Vietnam tours run by Mr Alan Chien is a professional well organised company that we cant rate highly enough. We asked for and were given an english speaking guide. For the cycle we also had a support van and driver - driver spoke no English but did understand us and we had a lot of laughs. Our guide Guan was excellent, our bikes were checked and refueled every night, Nothing was a problem, we did a variety of off road and sealed roads.Scenery and passes were just spectacular, You don't need a lot of clothes, It was warm but we did wear jackets for safety and light trousers. They supply full face helmets and gloves.The bikes 125 trail , mine had 6000 kms on and my partners had 21kms on so basically brand new. easy to ride and despite normally riding a 1000cc bike my partner found it excellent. The roads you are on these are just perfect. Our accommodation and food was all pre paid and arranged via Alan's company. I found the company on line when what was on offer at travel agents didn't meet our requirements. This company will arrange trekking, cycling and motorcycling and you can do a few days of each if you wanted.It was so easy to do. I did wonder if the company was real when I was emailing from NZ. Alan always emailed me back so quickly often within minutes.We paid a small deposit and the rest was paid on arrival. Alan arranged our visa's picked us up from airport and dropped us off. He took us for a meal on our return to Hanoi and was just an excellent host, organised and runs a good company. Guan the guide talked very well of Alan saying what a good employer he was. Vietnam has a lot of tour guides that work free lance for the tour company's. Alan employs them to fit the tours people want.I would not go past this company - we have friends who are looking at going early next year and they are going to go with Alan. Highly recommend if you want an exciting trouble free trip where you get to speak with the locals, live with them and photograph the amazing views.I am vegetarian and they catered for me at every stop. Nothing was a problem.We met some lovely people.Thankyou Alan for making our trip so good - If you think a tailor made tour is expensive it is not. We were surprised - our tour included all food, and accommodation which was mainly hotels but did have a couple of homestays which were lovely - really got to experience Vietnam. Also included 2 boat trips. All transfers etc.and you get to go where you want to go and when you want to go.Thanks again Jan and Stu

BEST TRIP EVER!. I had an amazing, safe, and really fun time with Alan and Chung as my guide. They were top notch professionals, and I was able to see a non-touristy side of Vietnam on my motorbike. I can with no previous motorbike experience (though I had a license), and they took great care of me. Can't recommend them enough!!!

Sa Pa tour. I enjoyed the tour very much. The chance to mingle with the hill tribe people was extremely interesting and the amount of trekking just right for me. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly and the opportunity to help her with her English was fun for me. The hotel was comfortable to stay in and the staff very friendly and helpful. The tour was good value.

indo china expeditions. thanks to our agent alan and the team for the great support. we wont make it without you guys. we have a great experience riding in vietnam. offroad is challenging. but the trail is awesome.

13 day Ho chi Mihn trail Hanoi to Na Trang. Had a great trip good guide great places to stay on route, good food , great bikes, Thanks to Alan and Quinn for a great experience and good value. will hope to see you again on a return tour.
A great and relax tour. We choose hanoi and halong bay, the trips is well organised. Food that arrange is quite good as well. Driver is is friendly and tour guide is helpful. Stronly recommend

Great trip in a beautiful country. If you like motorbikes then this is the perfect way to see the real Vietnam. Do yourself a favour and give Alan a shout and let him organise the trip of your life. I'm booking again for next year

MOTORBIKE TOUR NORTHERN VIETNAM. We booked a short Northern Motorbike Ride with Off-road Indochina – Vietnam Motorbike Tour, We come from the States. Vietnam Motorbike Tour provided an amazing service, excellent guides & very brand new bikes. They were very experienced, knowledgeable and fun! We had a fabulous motorbike tour in Vietnam. Thank you ! Justin from Houston Texas

Best vacation ever.. I went on the nine day northern Vietnam motorcycle tour and had an amazing time. Each day was a great ride. The tour I was on provided a good mix of rough trail like conditions and good road conditions. That being said I think this was the perfect tour for my riding experience. I would not neccessarily do this as a brand new rider. The bike that was provided was almost brand new and worked like a champ. The towns we stayed in were awesome and the countryside was beautiful. They also have a good balance of homestays and hotels. My guide was amazing as well, he gave me a good history lesson on Vietnam and also showed me all the amazing foods it has to offer. I went on the trip in late October and it was the perfect time of year. The temperature was perfect and there was only a little bit of rain the first two days. I can't wait to go back and do another trip someday. If there was one thing I would change it would be to take someone with me to enjoy the experiences with a friend. Also, if you go make sure to take a jacket and a good pair of riding goggles.

Phung Van Hai is the best tour guide!. If you're up for an extreme, intrepid adventure, guided by a cheeky, charismatic, knowledgeable man- look no further. I have recommended this trip to many people. The scenery is insane, the people and culture are out of this world.
Do it!
Hi Chi Minh Trail. Fantastic trip. The bikes, the scenery, the food, the accommodation. Hai planned a fantastic itinerary and fun was had from beginning to end. Would definitely do it again.

Great time with bikes and a good Vietnamese friend!. I had a great experience on 1 day tour on a Minsk. Hai, my guide, was perfect. Not only he did everything to make the motorcycle part of the tour enjoyable, but he also took me to eat great food, drink true Vietnamese coffee and even took me to a coffee shop to buy some good coffee at the end of everything, in Hanoi. Always in a good mood and hardworker. The motorbike is rough, but that's the deal, part of the fun! I recommend.
HA NOI - SAIGON motorbike trip. Good route advice, amazing scenery, best way to explore Vietnam. Hai was very helpful and definitely knew his stuff.

Hanoi to Vung Tau. I rode with two other guys from Hanoi to Vung Tau over a distance of 2600 kms for 14 days.We had a combination of homestay and hotels and most of the route took in the Ho Chi Minh trail.The entire trip was mind blowing and the Honda XR 150 bikes performed beyond expectation.They are ideally suited for the conditions of Vietnamese roads,trails and tracks.Hai,our guide,is a legend to say the least.Nothing is a problem to him and he just goes out of his way to make sure everything goes smoothly.I thoroughly recommend We Ride Vietnam tour company to anyone contemplating this sort of adventure.

Tour of Vietnam. My wife and I were part of a tour group with Hai as the guide. The tour was great, the bikes were good, and the scenery and people were just fantastic. One of the main things that made the tour so wonderful was Hai himself. He has a great sense of humour, wonderful personality, and a huge knowledge of Vietnam. Nothing was too much trouble and he reguarly took us away from the normal tourist paths as we explored the back county on broken roads. Definitely recommended.

Northeast Vietnam. My father and I rode the Northeast with Hai on 125 Minsks. Its hard to summarize how awesome it was. DO IT. Hai works hard to make the trip great and he really knows the roads/tracks well. I can't wait to go back and do a longer trip.

Ho chi min trail. Hai took me and a friend on a motorcycle tour from northern Vietnam to south on motorcycles....he showed us things and places too beautiful and historically important to say with words. We were welcomed by all and would recommend to anyone....great ride Hai!
Incredible adventure. Hai our guide was entertaining and knowledgeable . He looked after us all really well ( and the bikes) and took us to the most amazing locations- off the beaten track.

Rich H. We completed a ride from Hanoi to Sappa up to the Chinese boarder. We encounter the worse weather possible with monsoon rains and landslides like I could never imagine but we were in great hands. With our tour guides great personality knowledge of roads and places to stay we had to change our path on the go and change our accomadation. It was the best experience of my life. We got a challenging ride and we made a great friend in Hi our guide. I would recommend this company and ride to anyone. And I plan to travel to Vietnam and do another ride with we ride Vietnam.

Venture Into Vietnam. Northern Vietnam by motorbike. 16 days of adventure, starting with 2 days exploring and sightseeing in Hanoi City, followed by 10 days riding with one rest day followed by 2 days at Halong Bay.To set the scene, I am just past 50, female and it had been many years ago that I rode motorbikes. However after a couple of trail rides and an hour on a road bike, I decided to ride some 1800 km around Northern Vietnam. Our group included 3 couples, 2 Urals and 2 Honda 125cc. We were joined by 2 blokes from Auckland on 125cc. The tour staff were all fantastic with good English. The tour leaders were Kiwis - Britton Adventures. We had a van for gear and emergencies and 3 support bikes.The tour started and ended in Hanoi City. Getting out of the city was white knuckle stuff with 3 lanes of traffic travelling on the wrong side of the road. Thoughts turn to wondering if you may have made the wrong decision to ride - least favorite part. Once the motorway was behind us, it was great fun. Some long days on a variety of roads and tracks with just as much variety in the weather. Hot, steamy days, rain, torrential rain and thunder storms. Expecting the unexpected is a good way to ride. Hazards included rocks, animals - cattle, dogs, chooks, pigs, ducks, a snake and more, children, people, bikes cars, buses, trucks. I hated the buses and their Yabba dabba doo horns the most. They owned the road!! Good thing is the speed is conservative, making this safe and do-able.Our accommodation was a mix of hotel and home stay, giving us an authentic Vietnamese experience.The food was mostly OK. Loved the baguettes for lunch, fresh salad, cheese, salami, ham and garlic paste. Rice wine was an acquired taste. The people in the country were happy to see us and friendly. They live a sustainable lifestyle and work very hard. Our travels - Hanoi - Ba Be Lake - Dong Van - Ha Giang - Bac Ha - Sapa - (Sapa Rest Day) - Mu Cang Chai - Phu Yen - Moc Chau - Pu Luong - Hanoi City.To complete the ride, a good dose of confidence is required with a bit of competency added in.Photography opportunities are amazing. I used a good point and shoot when riding and a pro camera for walkabout.The sensory experience is complete with sights, sounds, smells and tastes to boot.If you can tick the boxes for an adventure like this, it is well worth it.We were very well looked after and kept safe in a country that would be difficult to navigate alone.
All of Vietnam. Awesome place to go and see with an equally awesome guide. Totally worth the experience. Am hoping to return and do it all again. Look out Hai.

Amazing Vietnam. Amazing Vietnam! During our 9 day tour of NE Vietnam we developed a saying “There’s a surprise around every corner”. It could be: the breathtaking scenery of mountain ranges or limestone hills or terraced rice fields; the local Hmong Tay or Nung children waving as you ride past; the brilliant twisty mountain roads; the subsistence farmers; the village markets that sell every conceivable food; the sudden appearance of buffalos, dogs or chooks; helping each other get the bikes through as a landslide has taken the road away. Yes, riding in Vietnam is amazing.Hai, the director of We Ride Vietnam, runs a very professional operation. Nothing is too much trouble as he sources excellent local food, supplies quality home stay and motel accommodation and has a thorough knowledge of and passion for his country. With a tourism degree and over a decade of experience leading tours Hai is bound to make your Vietnam trip a memory that you will treasure.Our route took us from Hanoi to Lang Son then West for 8 days to Sapa before the overnight train back to Hanoi. We were definitely off the tourist track as we saw very few westerners for 4 or 5 days. The riding suits adventure riders with lots of twisty bitumen and some rocky/muddy trails thrown in. We had some days of heavy summer rain that limited our off road adventures. My next trip will be Autumn/Spring. The Honda XR150s did a great job and are very suitable for the local conditions. In Australia we are used to bigger bikes but the 150s do well in the twisty/ rocky terrain and never missed a beat. Plus they have a comfortable seat - a big deal after 7 or 8 hours.We saw a couple of other tours during our trip and Hai’s quality set up made them look decidedly dodgy. From excellent advice on what to pack, quality riding gear including jackets with armour and BMW pants, water-proof panier bags, to life saving tips on local traffic conditions, Hai from We Ride Vietnam provides an excellent guided bike adventure you will remember fondly for a very long time.

Great Day Trip/Ride in the Outskirts of Hanoi. Had a GREAT day riding with Hai (We Ride Vietnam) in the outskirts of Hanoi. I only wish I had had the time to travel farther outside the city and surrounding area. But if your time is limited, Hai will show you a wonderful time. Visited major tourist attractions, including Ba VI National Park, featuring the tallest mountain in the region with an awesome view of Hanoi; traversed rice paddies, canals, backroads, and even visited a thousand-year old city and took in a glimpse of the past! Hai keeps things balanced (adapting to the riders' desired pace), with stretches of fun riding, but also plenty of stops for picture-taking opportunities, Vietnamese coffee breaks, and good local cuisine. I highly recommend We Ride Vietnam and will definitely be back for a longer ride, with more challenging terrain and rural/off-road trails. The most challenging part (from a riding perspective) of this ride was navigating the traffic as we left the city and returned to it at the end of the day - but the rest of the ride was easy-going and relaxing. For a day-trip/ride, it was well worth the price!!! Thanks Hai for a wonderful day, and for meeting me for coffee the night before the ride to chat a bit about the upcoming tour. Hope to ride with you again soon!

Our excellent adventure! There's a surprise around every corner!. We just finished our ride from Hanoi to Sapa and putting the little XR150'S on the train now. Hai was very professional for the whole tour, while keeping us entertained with his knowledge of local customs and the best place to get a great pho for breakfast, or where to buy authentic local products at a good price. He also loves a laugh and a joke. The scenery he showed us was a constant source of amazement.. be prepared for scenery overload. Theres a surprise around every corner, often the scenery, but sometimes the buffalo, chickens, dogs, goats, landslides, crazy bus or a scooter loaded to the eyeballs. The northeast ride was excellent, hardly saw another westerner for 4 days and the offroad sections were nice. We loved the local food, but did get 'the bug' for a few days _ maybe we brought it from home.. maybe not. If you come now (august) be prepared to get very hot or very wet. Or both like we did.. This ride suits adventure riders of average experience up or Hai can tailor to suit. Lots of sweeping corners that can turn into a rocky pothole, we could have done more offroad but the weather was not always kind. The little XR150'S handled the job admirably, i thought they would be too small but for the tight roads and rocky offroad were perfect. Any bigger and riders would just dig up the local tracks. Hai looks after the bikes well and they are well thought out with the 2 leather panniers more than enough room. Unless your like me and took too much- really only need a few pairs or socks undies tshirts and shorts. Once here we hardly spent anything except for beer and souvenirs, Hai covers all other food, soft drinks and water. We enjoyed the homestays and the food was really good. Some of the beds are a little hard.. i usually sneaked another nattress from somewhere... We would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone looking to experience this amazing countries food, culture and awesome scenery.

Ride through Northeen Vietnam. Hai was our guide from the very north down to Central Vietnam. Not only was the food and Accomodation excellent, Hai found us some great off road tracks and scenery. Thanks mate, look forward to the border run

Custom N Vietnam Trip. Had a great trip with Hai in early 2015. If you're considering this you already know how beautiful Vietnam is, so what I can say is that Hai is a fantastic guide; he put together a customised trip for our group to match what we wanted to do and how long we wanted to go and was a constant cheerful presence of our trip, organising everything and making it super easy to get away into backroads you'd never see otherwise.

Awesome motorbike and jeep tour. Had the most incredible time on this tour, a must if you want to truly see what Vietnam has to offer. Definitely the highlight of our trip, Hai is a wonderful guide and most of all his tour in fun! I could not recomend the motorbike tour more, from the beautiful landscapes to the charming villages every moment is amazing and you will leave wishing you could do it all again. 10/10

Most amazing motorbike adventure of my life! . Hai was the best tour guide anyone could ask for as his knowledge of the wonderful northern Vietnamese terrain will take you through routes that are truly breathtaking and definitely not on any maps. Had the best 7 days of my life!! Must do if you're a motorcycle enthusiast!

North East Tour. After doing a tour with Hai in 2014 I just had to come back and see more of Vietnam! I recently completed the North East Vietnam tour with Hai. Hai always went out of his way to discover amazing new roads, many that you would never see on an unguided tour! I highly recommend "We Ride Vietnam" to anyone. Hai's good nature, sense of humour, and local knowledge and history will always leave you compelled to come back and see more of Vietnam! I'm thinking about my next tour already!! Thanks again Hai for an amazing tour. So many great memories, laughs, and experiences.

Weridevietnam motorbike and jeep tour. Truly the most fabulous holiday with an excellent host. A must for adventurous families who like the road less travelled. Hai's vibrant personality and careful attention to detail made every stop an experience. The home stays selected were an exceptional standard with outstanding and interesting food and hosts. We loved hai's Vietnam, a very real journey through stunning landscapes, interesting villages and agricultural experiences. The jeep was a great way to travel close to the roadside people, we followed my husband and Hai on the motorbikes. My 18yo son and 16yo daughter also truly loved this trip. Without a doubt the highlight of our Vietnam visit, we cannot recommend this more highly.

Stunning motorbike tour. From the very start of planning our trip Hai made the whole experience very easy. He is so professional & tailored the trip to our requirements. Communication was great and everything was organised for us so we could just concentrate on enjoying the amazing scenery, the riding (3800 kms over 18 days) & the accommodation. We went to places the average tourist would not visit. It was a magic trip & we would do it again if we could. Very highly recommended.

Best holiday. It has been almost 4 years since my ride through the north of Vietnam, but I still remember it as my best holiday to date.Hai was (and still must be) a fantastic tour guide who took us through the most beautiful villages and sceneries. He took the worry of organising anything out of us, which gave us all the time to simply enjoy the ride, the air, the people, the Country. He was also patient and gave us all the time we needed to stop and take photos whenever we felt like.I still dream to eat those super tasty spring rolls that a local woman made for us for dinner, when we stayed at an home-stay. Being able to spend an evening as guests of local people in a village in countryside Vietnam was a unique experience. Everything about that holiday was so unique.I would not hesitate one second to recommend Hai as a motorbike guide through anywhere in Vietnam.Davide

Motorbike adventures in Vietnam. "Weridevietnam" is the best way to see Vietnam. We (a group of 4 all girls over 50) have just done our 2nd ride in the back blocks from of rural Vietnam. Guided by the very professional owner of the company. Hai organises every detail from our bikes, Helmetsj, jackets etc to the excellent home stay accommodation and the itinerary. This is an adventure which should be on everyone's bucket list. For the dirt bike boys who want off road then this can be organised as well on Honda XR150's. Or for the less adventurous a convoy of open jeeps with drivers to these remote regions as well.

"Ride of your life". Me and 3 mates created a custom 5 day tour on the XR 150 ' s.The ride was an absolute once in a lifetime adventure, travelling from hanoi, venturing to the laos border and then upto the China border. The off road sections differed everyday to give us great variety. The knowledge of the tour guide was second to none, and wouldn't recommend riding vietnam any other way.Absolute wicked time!!!

Wow. Wow what a experience, From the largest cities to the deepest jungle you will experience it all. I have completed three trips and still want more. Great company to travel with well organised good people. Until you experience it yourself you will never know.

Unforgettable. 3 years on, and I am still dining out on this trip. If you want a combo of adventure, culture, authentic food, and epic landscapes then this is unbeatable. Hai took us on an exeptional adventure, he is a fantastic guide, with great sense of humour and flexibility to make it perfect for our interests. I am already planning the next trip with him.

Honest - Best Moto Trip Company. I looked on trip advisor to find a company to tour motorbikes around Vietnam and stumbled across We Ride Vietnam. Couldn't be happier! Went on a one day ride to Ba Vi National Park and also saw an ancient Vietnamese city. It was epic! Tan and Hai are the best tour guides, very responsive and helpful - they make everything really easy and are extremely knowledgeable. We Ride Vietnam rocks!

THE EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME. I recently did a 12 day motorcycle tour of NW Vietnam with weridevietnam and am changed irreversibly! Hai pulled out all stops to ensure EVERY day was memorable. His bikes are immaculate and extremely capable. His English and knowledge of the areas and history is perfect. Hai has an intimate passion for the cuisines of the area and every day blew us away with taste sensations that makes your mouth water! Our trip took us to some of the most beautiful places on earth! The North is the highlight for me, particularly the home stays. Every day was an adventure. He made us feel like no corners were cut and all stops were pulled. I am amazed he is able to do it so cheaply. Please put this trip on your bucket list. You won't regret it! I am already planning my next one with Hai for the North East Vietnam which is apparently even better. Not sure how that is possible.

It Just Keeps On Getting Better. This is my third ride now over a period of 4 years and it seems to get better each time. The scenery, the food and the culture of this amazing country are beyond belief. We just completed a hassle free 12 day ride from Lao Cai to Hoi An covering over 2000 kms on Honda XR 150 bikes and to say the least were suited exceptionally well for the type of terrain encountered. And of course I have to mention the expertise of the owner/operator , Hai. His knowledge , professionalism and humour just make the adventure so much more enjoyable as everything went to perfection. I'll be back.

Nth West to Ho Chi Minh Trail - Amazing Vietnam. So I've been back from Vietnam for a week now trying to figure out how to put my experiences into words... I must admit, it's hard unless you have been there yourself to really capture this fascinating country.!What I do have to say though is that if it wasn't for our amazing guide/owner of the motorcycle touring company "We Ride Vietnam", I wouldn't have half the memories I do. Phung Van Hai, you are great at what you do and a fantastic ambassador for everything Vietnam has to offer.Hai puts together great itineraries, the bonus that the tour is all inclusive takes financial travel expense stress out of the equation & now that he is stocking his fleet with the Honda XR150 bikes, the stress of breakdowns is minimal with the added bonus that with bikes under 200cc, for a traveler from Australia, Travel Insurance will have you covered without additional premiums.!!!!Anyone who thinks that turning up to this country and buying a bike to travel independently is going to be easy is kidding themselves. Having the experience of a guide is the most essential part of getting the most out of this type of adventure.In the 12 days we were on tour we travelled to such remote places that without Hai's knowledge (and language) we never would have attempted, he made these experiences so stress free that we could just feel immersed in the local culture to experience it for what it was.As well as his professionalism and knowledge of the history of his country, Hai also carries a charming, witty personality with him that you can't help but enjoy. Hai mate, you are a legend.There's no doubt that I will travel with Hai and We Ride Vietnam again, I urge anyone reading this to also, you will come away with amazing memories that will last a lifetime....

Motorbike tour May 2016. This has hands down been the best holiday I have experienced. We had great personalities and guidance on the trip from Tan and Hai. There was a good combination of on and off road adventures and the food was wonderful at each and every hotel/ home stay. I have recommended this trip to everybody who asks about my time in Vietnam. I hope others reading this review has the opportunity to experience this trip also.

Living the dream with a first class guide! :). 3 of the best days I've ever had travelling & without doubt the best 3 days riding I've ever been on! I've always dreamed of riding the area around North Vietnam and I wasn't let down, mostly as Hai was a first class guide from start to finish & the route he chose from Ha Noi looping round across the mountains, through Pu Luong Nature Reserve & back up the Ho Chi Minh was both spectacular & challenging.The views we're absolutely breath-taking & the roads were generally clear of traffic as we took the lesser travelled path pretty much the whole way. When we did get stuck behind a bus or lorry something the bikes had more than enough to get round them quickly & we didn’t run into a single technical problem the whole way (you can tell they really look after their bikes, was a joy to ride!) I know it's a cliché but we really did go off the beaten path and through the dirt roads, farming villages & small towns off the main roads (I don't want to use the term the 'real' Vietnam as it's all real but this was definitely the non-tourist route!) We genuinely had people flock to see us when we'd stop off for food & I got so caught up in waving back to people on the way through anywhere inhabited I nearly came off a couple of times (there are WAY too many animals with no traffic sense out that way lol) The most difficult part of the ride was focusing on the road as the views were always so spectacular but Hai was always happy to stop anytime so I could just take it all in / rest / answer natures call.The homestays on route were both incredible, the hosts always fantastically hospitable, the food always delicious & plentiful and the beers plentiful and cold! Even got to try some grasshopper & I'm defiantly a fan! I really can't recommend these guys & specifically Hai as a guide enough, I'm already planning my next trip over for a much longer ride and I already know who I'm going to book with! :) Thanks guys!!

Hanoi to Danang on Urals. Had the greatest pleasure to have Hai and Phu take me and my brother in law for a 12 day trip from Hanoi to Danang. Right from the get go we were treated like kings.Everything was catered for and organised by Hai. Our bikes were looked after by Phu if ever there was an issue.North Vietnam is breathtaking, people friendly and food fantastic.Highly recommend a longer stay in Sapa.Would do this again in a heartbeat.

4 Girls Ride the High Country in Vietnam. My three friends and I have just done our second motorbike ride with this company. We were very spoilt to have had the 'boss', Hai, as our guide. Back by popular demand !! At the rear of our group we had the marvellous Kwong ( spell check ?). He had our backs at all times and on occasion was in demand to lift fallen bikes..... but not too often!! Suffice to say it was just a ton of fun. We laughed our way around the North West. Our final run was to Sapa. As beautiful as I remember it from 2008. Met some gently lovely people on the tour and witnessed some sobering scenes. Homestays were a wonderful way to spend the nights with sublime food on offer and gorgeous families only too happy to oblige. Top trip all round and all due credit to Hai who runs a schmick show.

Too much fun. A group of five friends left their husbands & kids behind & took one of Hai's customised tours up to the Chinese border in north east Vietnam on Minsks. It was a fantastic trip staying in authentic homestays enjoying culinary & cultural delights in rural areas. We saw very few non-Vietnamese over the 5 day ride but spectacular scenery & fabulous rural markets & all that they offer. I couldn't recommend Hai's "We Ride Vietnam" tour company highly enough with his humour, picnic & mechanical skills along with his exceptional English & knowledge of the areas we visited. We are going back next week for a second trip this time off the beaten track to Sapa with the best guide in Vietnam! Bring on the adventure!.

An absoulutely amazing trip!. Hai was a very great guide on our 7 day trip from Hanoi through the north of Vietnam. It was a real eye opening experience to see rural Vietnam and all its beauty, both in nature and the locals we came across along the way. Food and accommodation were really good and taylored to our budget and expectations. We went through jungles, rice paddies, on dirt and butumen roads on some great 125cc repowered Russian Minsk bikes. No better way to see the real Vietnam!

What a fantastic adventure. Hai and his motorcycle tour company was recommended to me by a friend who had done two previous tours through North Vietnam I decided to do a 6 day ride from Hanoi to Sapa through the North East and to say the least, the experience was unbelievable.The scenery, the people, the food were all beyond expectation and I was saddened by the fact that the ride had to end as I had limited time.Hai's organisational skills and knowledge of his people and cultures is truly remarkable and I will be looking later this year into doing it all again for 12 days.Thank you Hai for eveything. Keep up the good work.Graham.

Can't wait to do it again. I had been wanting to go to Vietnam for quite a while. I had mentioned it to some colleagues and one recommended going with Hai, as he had done a year earlier. I sent a little "feeler" e-mail to him, and 24 hours later, we had a 10 day trip in the North East of Vietnam all planned out. Hai was very accommodating. He was able to book me in on less than two weeks notice; and as a solo trip, at that.The entire process couldn't have been easier. I arrived in Hanoi with a hotel already booked in the hotspot of the city. I met Hai the next day, and we packed up our saddle bags and took off towards the North. The 10 days were incredible. Hai's knowledge of the land and culture was as good as it could get. We ate amazing food, rode down beautiful paths, and saw some mind-blowing scenery. We stayed in a mix of hotels and home stays, which were my favorite. The local families often treated us like their own and invited us to join them for evening meal. Hai knew people everywhere we went, and it felt good being treated with such kindness.The people of Vietnam are incredible. Humble and curious. I loved interacting with them. The food was some of the best I'd ever eaten. The scenery was as beautiful as you'd expect, and the riding was some of the best I'd ever done. I would highly recommend doing a trip in Vietnam, whether for 2 or 12 days. I'm confident Hai will make it worth your while.

Highly Recommended. Hai is a great bloke , with a through knowledge of the countryside he takes you to. He is able to customize the route to suit the riders , and is able to create interestingriding through the most amazing places.He showed us places with very few tourists (if any )places we never knew existed .Wow ! Ive ridden twice in the North , and as soon as I can , I intend returning. The food is excellent .Hai goes above and beyond what you would expect to make sure you have a great time.Heaps of fun !

Great local knowledge . Hai was our guide in 2010 for a boys trip and we had an amazing time doing a 6 day north east tour. Hai's local knowledge was first class. In 2015 it was time for a father / son mbike tour ... And this time we went with Hai again .. We only had 3 days and Hai recommended a south west loop including 2 home stays ...Needless to say the experience was first class, Vietnam style .... And the key is local knowledge .. Hai and his extensive network of connections and can customise any tour requirements, and it's delivered with a classy local Vietnamese touch .... Hai is a great ambassador for Vietnam ... Highly recommended

the perfect way to see Vietnam. This was a first on so many levels for me visiting Vietnam to go ride motorbikes. It was my boyfriends second adventure with Hai and my first and it was absolutely amazing. After hearing about my boyfriends previous motorbike tour with Hai a couple of years earlier, l went out and got my motorbike licence and a bike just so l could experience travelling through Vietnam on a motorbike and l am so glad l did. We booked a 5 night/6 day tour from Hanoi to Sapa via Mai Chau with Hai and from the minute l took off on the bike heading out of Hanoi, l was in heaven. It was just the 3 of us, Hai, Jens and l and it was perfect. The scenery, the roads, the sights, the smells, the beautiful and friendly vietnamese people and the feeling of knowing we wouldn't have been privileged to see these parts of Vietnam if it wasn't for Hai's knowledge and expertise. We went on roads that no car or bus could go on and l don't know how many times a day l was taken back by the breathtaking views. We stayed in 2 homestay's, 1 at Mai Chau where we experienced beautiful home cooked vietnamese and l even tried fried grasshoppers for the very first time but l cant recall the name of the second homestay village. We worked our way up to Sa Pa over the next few days and rode through villages where we were constantly greeted by smiling and happy vietnamese people, it was these moments that l will never forget. These people have pretty much nothing, yet they are happy, their smiles light up their face and make you feel privileged to be visiting their part of the world. Travelling through Vietnam with Hai has been one of the most memorable adventures l have had, Jens, Hai and l have continued our friendship and we will be planning another trip with Hai at a later date. Hai is proud of his culture and loves showing you the hidden gems of Vietnam, we wouldn't have had the amazing experience we did if we didn't experience it on two wheels. If you are looking for the best way to explore Vietnam, give Hai a call at 'We ride Vietnam'. Hai can cater for all skill levels and his experience and knowledge makes you understand why he is the best person to ride you through Vietnam.

2011 Minsk Trip To Hà Giang Region, Highly Recommended. In the late summer 2011, my best friend Steve & I were fortunate enough to have the opportunity to ride Minsk for a week in the Hà Giang region of Northern Vietnam. The region, punctuated by it's incredible relief, tribal cultures and vast Hmong historical centers, had only recently been opened up to tourist. I had been there a few years before on a government trip, but it was in the Winter, by car and I had a minder the entire time. This time it was just the two of us and our excellent guide Hai (Phung Van Hai). He took us everywhere! We asked for "off-the-beaten-path" & back-roads that is exactly what we got. We also requested to keep timing in mind b/c one of the things you do not want to mis out on when you are up there are the markets, they are based on the Lunar calendar, so it can be very difficult to line up locations. He was excellent at this. Finally, don't miss a stay at the French oasis in Hà Giang, Pan Hou Village, right in the heart of The Dao (pronounced Zao) people. Great trip, you will enjoy the company of great guides and incredible scenery. Thank you Hai!
Nice Cute and Helpful. I met Hai last month He is a guide from We Ride Vietnam He nice and so cute!. He help me many useful information to travel in Vietnam easier. I Like he so much lol

Great riding in Vietnam. A group of us rode motorcycles with Hai as our guide, from Ha Noi to SaPa, then headed along a winding and fantastic trail through towns, homestays and villages ending at Hoi An. Vietnam is a great place to explore and the people are so friendly and receive strangers with huge smiles and warmth.Hai was a great guide and along with the team of assistants and a mechanic, we all arrived safely with huge smiles on our faces.So long as you are prepared to leave the 5 star type holiday comforts and accept more basic but clean accommodation, you will have the best outdoor holiday.

I'll be back !. Hai's motorbike tours to the north provide a cultural and geographic adventure. You find yourself saying .. "Am I really here doing this?"Home stays, hotels, meals and transport - there's nothing to worry about on these tours, Hai takes care of everything. Very highly recommended ..... CJ.

Excellent adventure; trip of a lifetime. We loved our motorcycle trip in North Vietnam. Our fav things were the impromptu picnic lunch breaks and the opportunity to experience traditional culture and cuisine in home stays, markets, harvest fields, and roadsides. It's a beautiful land. Vietnamese people are interesting, kind and thoughtful. Hai's enthusiasm and good humour are highly infectious and made the trip even more memorable!

Excellent Moto Trip. The scenery...the knowledge of our guide Hai was excellent. The homestay...the food...most importantly the riding was challenging but fun.If you are into exotic locations and adventure this is the tour for you.

One of the best adventures I've ever been on . Myself and 4 other ladies did a week ride on motorbikes with this company, it was sensational and we looked after beautifully, what an awesome experience !

Awesome experience. Went with a group of mates, and we all ride dirt bikes, race, tour and everything else on two wheels, and without a doubt would go back and do a tour with these guys again tomorrow!!Well organised, entertaining, great trails, endless scenery, just a great adventure with a great guide and a top team!Couldn't thank Hai enough when we had to leave

One of the last great adventures. This was the most amazing holiday/adventure I've ever taken, and it's really hard for words to do it justice. Seeing this country by motorbike took me to places every day where it feels like a tourist has never been, it challenged me so much mentally and physically (and inspired a lot of cool cred amongst the friends back home).Hai is such a funny tour guide and is so knowledgable, and Long (a.k.a the Vietnamese Mark Wahlberg) our mechanic saved the day so many times, they were a pleasure to ride with and the would always have your back. We were a group of 4 girls in our twenties - so don't let age, gender or experience stop you. We always felt safe (okay so the roads were a bit dodgy but everything else was sweet as) This really feels like one of those great, hidden adventures that not many people will get to experience. So much better than hours on a bus - we passed a few of those and they looked green with envy... or it could have been the hours on those roads. It was pretty challenging so I'd advise offroad and onroad experience before you go; that said none of the 4 of us had our licenses, and 1 of us we banned from driving as she's the WORST, so Long pillioned her the whole journey. If you're thinking about it and wavering, just do it. You'll never regret the experience.

Coatesy68- Caloundra, Australia. 5 day Tour.. This would have to be one of the best holidays I have experienced. Our guide, Hai , was fantastic. He was extremely organised and knowledgable , has an excellent command of the English language and a great sense of humour. The scenery in North Vietnam is spectacular and the experience on the bikes brings you so close the Vietnamese villagers and their culture. This was my second tour with Hai and would thoroughly recommend touring with him.

Second time and still perfect!. This is my second tour with Hai, as I requested him personally.
