Street Food evening tour. This tour by foot mostly around Hanoi's old quarter was brilliant, our guide was Cherry who had excellent English skills and a real depth of local knowledge. Seven courses in seven venues, every one a winner. Mindful of allergies and preferences. We were a "small group"of three and had a fantastic time.

No better way to taste Hanoi. This was one of the best food tours I've done. Jay was great and we ate some amazing things that we wouldn't have known to order if we were on our own. He was flexible and changed the tour along the way, adapting to what our tastes were at the time. He also had great local knowledge and answered all our questions about Hanoi and Vietnam! I was most appreciative of the email following the tour with the list of dishes we tried so I can find them at home. Thanks Jay!

Amazing food you would never find by yourself. First off our tour guide Sunny was a darling! Always happy and smiling, making sure that were OK and enjoying ourselves. Besides telling us everything about the food we were eating, e.g. how its made, where in Vietnam its popular, ect she took the time to give us loads of information about Vietnamese culture, specifically of Hanoi. Now for the food, we had 9 different courses as we walked the streets of the old quarter in Hanoi in addition to bia hoi (fresh draught beer) and egg coffee (you dont need to have the egg coffee but I highly recommend it! She took us to Giang Cafe 39, nguyen huu han street, owned by the family who started making egg coffee!) It was all amazing, the tour was meant to go from 11 till around 230 but she kept taking us to more and more places and we finished at 4 o'clock! Half a day of great eating and seeing Hanoi's Old Quarter. After the tour was over she even took my friend and I to the local market to get some good chillies to take home. Later on she emailed us a list of the names of all the dishes we had so we can order them again! She even added us on facebook and invited us to stay with her next time were in Vietnam!I could not reccomend this more, made me fall in love with Hanoi.

Amazing walking food tour. On our first evening in Hanoi, we had Mr Ha as our food tour guide who did a great job introducing all the food that we tastes and area that we stopped by. Great variety and delicious, we were all full at the end of the tours. We have ate at least 14 dishes. He took us to places that we would never went without him. Mr Ha is very attentive made sure that there will dishes with no meat for one of our group who does not eat meat. He also taught us how to cross the streets which we will lost just by looking at it. A must try.

Number 1 for delicious fun!. We did a street food tour with Jay last week and it was absolutely fantastic! Delicious food all round, we tasted plenty of variety and really got a feel for the way the locals eat. Everything including dessert is covered and we got a great feel for the city at the same time. Would recommend doing this on your first night to get a feel of things. Big thanks to Jay for his expertise - would definitely recommend! Only wish I had a second stomach..

Great tour. My husband and I did a good tour with Ha, he was absolutely fantastic. So knowledgable and took us to great hidden places. We would never have tried all the street food we did without him.There was a lot of food. We were very satisfied.Highly recommended to all!

Hanoi Street Food Tour - Fun and Tasty!. We were intrigued by all of the locals eating at the little tables and plastic stools, but we did not know which street foods to try, so we thought we would try a street food tour. Our guide Mark Nguyen was great! Mark is friendly, polite, energetic, knowledgeable, professional and has great English. Over three hours we tried eight different street foods and tried things that we never would have tried on our own and went to different spots that we never would have found on our own. A highlight of our time in Vietnam! Highly recommended! It was a lot of fun and Mark is good company as well as being a good guide.

Food tour with Duy. My husband and I enjoyed a street food tour in Hanoi with Dui. We enjoyed several dishes that we would have never tried on our own. We especially enjoyed walking thought the small alleys, street markets and learning about Vietnamese food and culture. Sipping fresh beer and eating noodles on tiny tables and chairs was a treat! Do add this experience to your trip itinerary. A must-do!

Fantastic Food Tour. My first night in Hanoi I went on this tour with Mr Ha, he was absolutely excellent in every way. He arrived promptly and we started eating straight away with a delicious egg dish cooked on the corner of the street I was staying in. The knowledge that Mr Ha imparts not only about the food but also the history of the area was excellent. The variety of food I was able to try along with just being in the wonderful atmosphere of the those eating on the street was a great way to start my first trip to Vietnam. This is a must-do tour and I'm sure you will love every single stop. Make sure you try an egg coffee or hot chocolate it's simply outstanding. Thanks Mr Ha you were a wonderful guide.

Ha Nguyen evening walking tour and street food - Hanoi Old Quarter. Do not miss this walking, and street food experience in Hanoi's old quarter with Ha Nguyen. Ha treats you to some cultural, and food experiences you will not be able to enjoy on your own. He is knowledgeable, and funny, and the man to show you where to to eat the best of Hanoi's street food. Ha Nguyen even followed up the next day with an email listing the foods we ate, and a recipe for egg Coffee. Many thanks for this most enjoyable experience of my South Asia trip.

Great food and culture tour. We enjoyed this more than we thought we could and learnt about all the stuff that we couldn't understand the previous 3 days. If you visit Hanoi you must go on this tour. Thanks Ha.

Excellent tour!. My husband and I had a lunch time tour with Duy. The food was fantastic, the perfect introduction to Vietnamese food and a great tour of the old quarter. Duy was the perfect tour guide. Did a running commentary on all of the food as you would expect in a food tour, but also explained a lot about the Vietnamese culture. I would highly recommend the tour, and Duy in particular. One tip, eat a small breakfast.

Nguyen Ha of Viet Mind Tours Day Food Tour. Hanoi is all about the food. My guide Nguyen Ha of Viet Mind Tours took me through a one of a kind gastronomical journey. I highly recommend booking him if you are heading here. I got to eat in many restaurants within 2.5 hours. Nguyen Ha has a thorough knowledge of Local Cuisine and the History of Hanoi.

Walking Street Food Tour. We very much enjoyed our evening walk Street Food Tour. Great value 40US per person for a personal tour . Great guide. We tasted so many different dishes and highly recommend if you are travelling to Hanoi.

Great Street Food Tour!. We booked a street food tour through our Hotel and had Ha as a guide. He was fantastic. He was very knowledgeable and very cheerful. He brought us to both the most popular spots and some more secretive local spots as well. It was a great way to get a feel for the Old Quarter - we highly recommend it and suggest you request Ha as a guide!
Street food tour. I had a fantastic time on my street food tour with Duy. The food was amazing and it was an excellent introduction and insight into local life in Hanoi. I highly recommend this tour.

Street food you can trust. When visiting countries with street food traditions and with a soft Westen stomach I have always been afraid to try street food for fear of Hanoi belly or montezumas revenge or whatever, but longed to try the delicious smells on the street.Here was our opportunity.From the flyer in the hotel we booked with Ha and his 6:00 pm street food tour had not only had a fabulous time but also got to sample some of the superb street food on offer in Hanoi's old quarter.From eating on kiddies tables on the sidewalk to deep fried banana and sweet potato cooked beside the teaming motorcycles and all kinds of regular street food we loved every minute of it.In all we sampled food and drinks from about eight establishments, finishing with the warm egg chocolate drink (too late for coffee).Best of all we didn't get sick and it gave us places where we could eat by ourselves another night.

Duy Le was a great guide. Fantastic guide during our trip to Hanoi during Tet - Lunar New Year aka Chinese New Year. He brought us to places we would have otherwise never known. Delicious food and great experience.

Learned a lot about vietnamese food and culture!. This was a great tour! We booked this tour through our hotel so were not sure what to expect. But everything was perfect. It was relaxed and Duy taught us a lot about Vietnamese culture, values and of course the food. Duy took his time answering all our questions and showing us around. We really enjoyed this tour and recommend booking with this company!

Street food tour. Our guide was Duy, and he took us to the best places. It was an excellent culinary experience, and great introduction to Hanoi. I particularly liked sticky rice ice cream, and egg coffee. Duy also gave us lots of interesting information about Vietnamese life and Hanoi.

The grazing was amazing!!!. I arranged for a one on one tour through my hotel and was totally happy!! "Ha" showed up at 8am we had a brief discussion of what I wanted to see and eat and learn about, then we were on the moto and off to Ha's favorite eel restaurant. The soup was amazing, the eel sausage was even better and we sampled a few pork sausages steamed in banana leaves and dipped in a fresh made chili sauce...AWESOME!!! From there it was onto the dry beef noodle shop, then onto roast pork belly with sticky rice ,bun cha, sweet black sticky rice and on and on. In all we sampled 18 different things as well as going to 2 different markets and a relaxing cruise around the lake on the way home.I,ve done lots of cooking classes throughout asia that have a mini market tour built in, but this was hands down the best. With my background in food, Ha was engaging and was interested to learn what I would do with certain items....it was a great day, and a great way to learn about Hanoi and the super nice people living there. I would highly recommend this tour company

amazing street food tour. Fab evening street food tour. Our guide Nhung (Rose) was extremely knowledgeable not only about the food we were tasting but also about the history of Hanoi & Vietnam. The food Nhung selected was excellent. The evening was a highlight of our stay in Hanoi, we had great food, met some lovely people and had the pleasure of meeting a delightful young lady called Nhung who shared her love of Vietnam with us. This tour is a must....ask for Nhung you wont be disappointed.

Delicious and fun Hanoi Street Food Tour. What a great way to experience Hanoi walking through it's very colourful and busy streets, with expert advice on hand and scrumptious food and drinks along the way. My friend and I were blown away by the variety and tastes of every dish, as well as hearing about the history and stories added to the adventure. Our guide Duy Le was very entertaining and the hours flew by way too quickly, our only regret was going on this adventure on our last day and not our first day in Hanoi. Highly recommend the tour and our guide to all our friends, for a local experience of delicious noodles, donuts, spring rolls, green sticky ice cream and egg chocolate, and many more. As it was the week of Christmas 2015, stopping by the St George's Cathedral towards the end was truly beautiful.

Night food tour. Wow! What a great time I had being introduced to new Vietnamese delicacies! I was even treated to a solo tour because there was no other people who booked the same timeframe as I did. Duy Le was an awesome tour guide who spoke English very well and made sure I had a great time. He is very knowledgable on the whole Hanoi city and will tell you some great places to go!Thanks & I'll definitely recommend you to everyone!

Much more than we were expecting. We booked through our hotel, the leaflet said at least 4 kinds of street food, we had 8 dishes plus beer, green tea, egg coffee and rice ice cream. Our guide Duy was very informative about the area and about Vietnamese customs & culture. A great evening in Hanoi.

Great introduction to Hanoi with our wonderful guide. We booked the walking food tour through our hotel (the La Siesta) and we are so happy that we did! A walking food tour is such an excellent way to get introduced to both the city and it's wonderful food. We had come from Thailand and taken a few food tours there, however we were simply surprised by how much better this one was. The true highlight was our guide Nhung/Rose! She was extremely friendly, funny, knowledgeable, and entertaining throughout the entire evening. Everyone in our group of 6 had a great time and a lot of that was thanks to Nhung. She is truly unique in all of the best ways and we are so thankful that we got her as our guide for the evening.In terms of the food, it was delicious. It's hard to remember everything we had, but it included fish spring rolls, an egg dish, bahn mi, a sugarcane treat, BBQ pork broth, vietnamese egg coffee, and a few more I can't remember. It was a good mix of food to introduce you to Vietnamese cuisine, and it was all really tasty too! The tour was also spaced out appropriately so that you never felt too full or heavy like you can on other food tours.Overall it was simply one of the best food tours we have had the privilege of going on.

Amazing tour with the fabulous nhung. My three friends and I didnt know mich about vietnamese cuisine, so we decided to do the food tour. Nhung was our tour guide and she was so lovely. Would highly recomend her. My friends and I dont eat seafood and only some meats. Nhung took all this on board and we tasted.many different dishes with the egg coffee being the highlight. We really enjoyed trying all the tasty food but Nhung really was the making of the tour. She had so much energy and was fun to be around. It felt like we were hanging out with a friend and she even went out if her way to show us to places we wanted to go etc. She was just so helpful. Would definately highly reccomend thos food tour and Nhung.

Amazing insider tour of Hanoi. I didn't want to do the "typical" tourist visit of Hanoi, so I asked my guide, Ha if he could show me something different, local and authentic. For the next few hours, I learned about the history, culture, people and places in Vietnam and Hanoi, all through a unique perspective, storytelling and experiences. Ha was awesome - we became friends by the end of the tour and he was so passionate, helpful and eager to share his culture. For foodies, his knowledge of local cuisine, traditions and the stories behind each dish and each food item are second to none. I can't wait to come back to Vietnam and go on a new adventure with Ha.

Amazing street food tour with Bien. I would highly recommend taking a tour with Bien. We had a great night going to various places around Hanoi and had some of the best food I've ever eaten at places we never would have found. We even went back the next night to some of the places we visited on the tour to eat again.

Street food. Excellent tour guide: Sea. Great way to get acquainted with the street food of Hanoi. Do it early in your trip so you can revisit the stops. Sea was very knowledgeable and fun. Highly recommend.

A great way to try Hanoi's street food, with an amazing guide!. We booked this tour after being recommended by some other travellers and it didn't disappoint! Our guide was Jay Z (you won't forget that one!) and he was so friendly and knowledgeable that we didn't just learn about the food that we were eating - but also a lot about Vietnam in general and the people.I believe this tour only takes small groups (we were a group of 4) which meant we could visit the smallest and most original street food places and it was much more intimate.We had a great evening, ate some amazing local specialties (including Bun Bo Nam Bo, Bun Cha, Egg Coffee amongst much more) and a had a great introduction to the food Vietnam has to offer!Great tour, great guide, absolutely recommend to everyone!

Mr Ha walking food tour. Mr Ha was simply amazing. He knew all about the food and where it came from. He took us to many different peoples restaurants but also down back alleys where tourists would rarely venture. The variety of foods and his knowledge of their origins was extremely good. In fact one restaurant he took us to we went back to three times it was so good. (47 ma mai) in old Hanoi village - have the beef bbq!!! The variety of the things we tried on our walking tour was fabulous - so same old spring rolls either and there was so much to try Ha advised us to pace ourselves. The egg coffee was weirdly good too. Even though we paced ourselves we still could only manage to share a juice at the end of the tour. Mr Ha walking food tour was the stand out of our week in Hanoi.

Exactly what I was hoping for!. Booked the evening street food tour through my hotel. I was supposed to join some other people but they cancelled because they were late, so I was lucky enough to get a private tour from Duy (Johnny). I hopped on the back of his scooter and he took me to 7-8 different spots. Not only did he show me a lot of various different dishes, explaining how to make them and how the flavors of all the ingredients work together, but he also took me to a authentic Vietnamese coffee place and bar so I could really experience the local culture. We exchanged a lot of stories and experiences, which made the evening very fun and enriching. I would say this tour is a must do if you are interested in Vietnamese food and culture in general.

Fantastic way to spend an evening in Hanoi. We decided at the last minute to go on a food tour, we booked and Ha went out of his way to accomodate us. it was great night Ha's philosophy of all the food and drink you can eat and drink was fantastic. We went places and ate food we wouldn't have known about and certainly not tried. We had one fussy eater and he loved it. Ha also showed us around Hoian at night so it was much more than just a food tour. Could not recommend this tour more highly and we will certainly be telling our friends about it.

Food on Foot tasting tour in Hanoi Old Quarter. We booked this thru our hotel and loved it. Duy, our guide, was very informative and helpful both on the food we tasted but generally providing an insight into daily life in Hanoi. We tasted a great variety of interesting dishes we wouldn't have found let alone tried if we had just wandered the streets on our own, including the amazing egg coffee (plus of course the more traditional dishes). Highly recommended.

Street food outside the eyeline of most tourists. Nhung (Rose) was our trusty tour guide on 3-hour street food tour through the old quarter of Hanoi. We called her our "Little General" because she marched us efficiently through NINE locations to try the most delectable Hanoi specialties (banh my, bun cha, egg coffee, etc.). Some of the locations were restaurants inside a warren of family homes that you'd never find on your own as a tourist. She made sure to ask about our preferences/dislikes and customized the tour based on our requests. We were stuffed by the end and loved every moment.

Hanoi Food Walking Tour - Excellent!. We just finished an amazing Vietnamese food walking tour around the Hanoi old city with Ha. Soooo much great food in unusual tucked away places. Along with the great food, Ha entertained us with stories about the history of Hanoi, his family and his life. We came away with a real sense of the culture - and VERY full and happy tummies. I would thoroughly recommend Ha and any of his tours. Thanks Ha.

An Excellent Food Walking Tour. I joined three others for the Street Food Walking Tour and found it to be excellent. Our tour guide was 'Jay Z' who catered the tour on the fly to meet the preferences and interests of the participants. He was friendly and informative.We had nine food stops over a period of about 3.5 hours, allowing us to get a very good introduction to traditional vietnamese cuisine. All of the food was delicious and there was plenty of it!A couple of days after the tour, Jay Z e-mailed a food diary list to us, so that we had a written record of the foods that we had tasted. A nice touch!Jay Z will only do small groups which makes sense. Larger groups wouldn't be able to get seated at some of the small family-run establishments that we visited. The personal touch would also be lost on larger groups.Highly recommended.

Hanoi street food tour. Nhung (Rose) was our guide for our street food tour in Hanoi. We had the best time tasting all the local delicacies from wormwood omelette with kumquat sauce, grilled fish wrapped in a spring roll, to Vietnamese sandwich and egg coffee. To the food lovers out there, this is an experience not to be missed! I m glad we did this with Nhung, who speaks fluent English and is very passionate about people, food and travelling.

Excellent Street Food Walking Tour. My friend and I booked this tour on the recommendation of the hotel we stayed at. It was excellent - a great way to try traditional Vietnamese food. Our guide was Mr Ha and he was fantastic. we had a great time with him. He was funny and knowledgable and we had some amazing food in and around the Old Quarter. By the end of the night we were full. I would highly recommend this tour and Mr Ha to my friends and family.

Most excellent food tour guide. Nhung (Rose) is a super fun, passionate foodie who speaks excellent English and really listens to her clients. She is smart and funny, more of a friend than a guide. She took us to eat everything from wormwood omelet to the best banh my in Hanoi. We would never have tried or found any of these places without her, and every one we visited was notable and delicious. I think we hit 10 different spots in 3+ hours - until we were totally stuffed!

Hanoi Food Tour: Highly recommend. Delicious food, hidden gems, an amazing tour guide,well fed and great value. We had only just arrived in Hanoi and were keen to sample lots of food. Not speaking the language and with Hanoi being pretty manic we felt a food tour would be a great place to start. Our tour with Nhung (Rose) was amazing. In three hours we sampled more than seven different types of Vietnamese food in so many different settings. There is no way we would of found these places, or had the confidence to go into them, Rose didn't hold back. For example she took us to this little place, which no one would have known of or been able to find, it was the original place of 'egg coffee', founded in 1946. To follow up Rose has sent us all of the places we went to and further suggestions for the rest of our time in Hanoi, and Vietnam. Great way to start our trip, we are now well informed for three weeks of good Vietnamese eating!

Street Walking Food Tour. We had the lovely Nhung as our tour guide. She taught us all about the culture, history of the old quarter of Hanoi whilst taking us to many little eating places we could never have found on our own, tasting and sampling some wonderful foods and sauces. She made the whole experience so exciting, fun and taught us how to "negotiate" crossing the streets as well -she was the best guide ever! ! Thanks so much Nhung

Street food tour = yummy!!. Nhung was very lovely and friendly to us. She took us to many amazing spots in hanoi for all different types of food. We experienced foods such as the best pho in hanoi, pillow cakes, pancakes and buin cha!. She answered all our questions and gave us lots of information that we didnt know previously. Nhung spoke very good english! And recommended other restaurants and spots for future eating. Thank you for a great tour !

Do dare to drive!. My boyfriend and me rented a Yamaha Nouvo just for a day. We drove all around Ha noi (rain included) with no problems at all. Very good way to know the city despite of the traffic. We paid 9$ for a full automatic. Would have rented it more if we had more time available. Very nice experience.

Amazing experience. We rented a bike (Honda future X 125cc) for 15 days to travel own by own around Vietnam. They gave the bike in Saigon and we dropped off it in Hanoi. We paid a fee for it but it was amazing experience. They speak English very well, they gave to us a VERY VERY new bike and we have NO problem with it. We dropped off it one day before in hanoi, and they returned to us a 3% of the reservation and the deposit money on the go. They was very kindly and very professional.We rented it from Spain (by mail) and made a pay (a percentage of reservation) via onepay.vn without problems.For our experience, we recommend flamingo travel and this route (Saigon to Hanoi).

There are much more better in Hanoi than flamingo. I rented a motorbike in HCMC and dropped off in Hanoi. I really take care of the motorbike, never had an accident and I paid a mechanic for a check before to give it back. When I gave it back they found some random problems on the bike and tried to find some excuses to get more money from me. I had to pay 500 000 Dong for no reasons!!
Eoic Ride. Rented kawa 250,no problems,helpfull and serviceminded staff,24 hour helpline,did a 7 day ride in the north with the kawa and it worked perfectly

Great bikes, service and adventures!. Did a self guided tour of the great North-East Loop (Lao Cai, Ha Giang area) in a 125cc Honda Future scooter. Best time of my life! Had saddle bags and everything we needed for the trip. They even put the bike on the train for us. (approx 40$US for bike transport ticket) Something I recommend if you want to get in the North faster. They can also arrange train tickets for travellers. Service was great before and during our tour. It is truly the best way to explore Vietnam if you feel comfortable riding there. No problems with the bike but they do offer 24H help line. We enjoyed it so much that we are coming back next March to ride on the HCM trail and will be doing business with Flamingo again. Thanks for the opportunity!

Superb. Not the cheapest but the best! Super knowledgeable about all around the country and even neighboring countries. Having done motorbike rental for 20 years they are also the most experienced in hanoi! My experience with them has always been with the extra. A plus that even many of their mechanics speak very good English too!

An amazing must-do experience!. My fiancé and i have just completed the two day one night self guided ride from hanoi to mai chau. we rode the XR250 which was easy to start and ride and cruised very well over all the terrain that we were faced with. we experienced flooding rivers, mud bogs and puddles, animals all over the roads Friendly smiling and waving children in every village - it doesn't get much better than that! The hosts at the homestay were very friendly and provided plenty of food although they don't speak english haha but we found ways to communicate. the accom is basic but clean and all part of the experience. the GPS was essy enough to follow although having met the team at flamingo i recon doing a guided trip would be fun cos the guys are so helpful and friendly but having said that we had no issues at all on our trip other than a flat GPS battery but we just stopped at a little village and we're able to buy some AAs for a few dollars. the scenery and countryside we rode through is world's apart from the city of Hanoi and it is well worth your time and money to get out there and enjoy it on a flamingo tour

Hue is an AMAZING guide!. My friends and I are regular travellers, sometimes on business, and sometimes for various adventures. For this trip we chose to do 7 days in the North West of Hanoi with Flamingo tours, specifically on Honda XR 250's. We were not disappointed!Our guide, Hue (pronounced "hway") was very experienced, safe and went above and beyond to ensure we all had a great time. He's great with people and has a genuine interest in making the trip memorable. All of our bikes were in good working order and were appropriate for the job. Our hotels were of varying quality, but that was all part of the adventure. The Home stays were always excellent (and our preference over hotels). If you're going to do this trip, go for the XR 250's, they are worth the extra coin, and request Hue as your guide. You will have a ball!

Saigon country side travel to My tho. Testimonial from Singapore city; My bf and i are amateurs and riding long distances for the first time from Saigon. We took a 1.5 day bike trip with Nam from flamingo travel. Nam took great care of us and we really enjoyed the off the beaten track rides and travelling thru the beautiful country side. The bikes we rented were in good condition and gave us no problems at all, we travelled smoothly over 200km a day. And Nam is a really excellent rider and its absolutely assuring to leave a pillion under his care.Their trips are customised to suit our preferences and fitness state but Nam the tour guide is very experienced and knows what to do. He takes pride in his job and our safety. We are truly in awe of the team at flamingo travel. These passionate people as well as the operators in flamingo travel will go the extra miles for your satisfaction and finding out information for you. Super like and Yes i would use their services again. Their prices are fairly reasonable too and they actually speak good metropolitan english for a change! Awesomely yours, Shirley and her partner from Singapore 1.5 days road trip from saigon. 6 to 9th August 2016 ps: I just realise the on/off button has been fixed on my smartphone. Thanks to the management in flamingo for that! My phone was faulty and i didnt have any contacts in vietnam to fix my line so they offered to help while i was away on my ride! Appreciates loads.

Fantastic Biking Experience. My boyfriend and I rented 2 honda futures from these guys for three weeks.We rented from HCM and drove to Hanoi where we could drop them back to their second office.The whole experience was fabulous. Staff in both offices were extremely helpful and friendly (and had perfect English). We were given a free lesson from the guys in HCM as we had never driven semi automatics before. The bikes themselves were perfect, we were given bungees to tie our bags, rain covers and some basic spare parts. We never had any problems with the bikes mechanically or otherwise.We also paid a little bit extra to get a guide to bring us out of the city when leaving HCM on our first day. He showed us where we could get petrol and brought us the whole way to the ferry and made navigating the city much easier.Overall we had a brilliant three weeks with two very safe and reliable motorbikes. We would definitely recommend flamingo travel for rentals!

Motorbike Tour (South of Vietnam). I recently rented 2 motorbikes from Flamingo Travel here in HCMC. My brother and I decided we wanted to do a tour but without a guide. It was fantastic, we travelled from HCMC - Bao Loc - Dalat - Nha Trang - Mui Ne - Vung Tao - HCMC. A total of nearly 1200 Km in 4.5 days. Ms Tram Pham was very helpful in the process. She advised how many Km's to do each day and also recommended places to stay on the trip. Their mechanic also provided us with key spares for the bikes which was excellent. We actually didn't need anything other than one inner tube due to a nail in a tyre. The bikes ran beautifully and my brother who was visiting VN for the first time had an absolute blast. The best part for me was over the mountain pass from Dalat into Nha Trang however the coast road when approaching Mui Ne was also fabulous.

Mekong Delta motorcycle tour. I had wanted to do a motorcycle tour or Vietnam for some time and booked a bike and accommodation package. I had thought I would use GPS but I was surprised to find I had a guide just for myself. As it turned out I am very glad of my guide. He turned out to be immense value. Nothing was too much and he was very knowledgeable about the Mekong. We spent 7 days buzzing about the Mekong Delta with many adventures. Mostly completely off the tourist trails. The bikes were old and small (125's but not scooters) but well maintained and the guide paid for everything. Ferries, drinks, accommodation, petrol meals etc. All in all I found Flamingo well organised, easy to deal with and excellent value. Just a note: small bikes or at least narrow bikes are a good idea in the Mekong. Don't even think about running a big BMW or something like it. Take local advice on everything. Just a wonderful trip overall. Thanks Flamingo and KC(King Cong) the excellent guide.

Long time rental&Guided Tours perfect! . I lived in saigon for nine month and Rented a yamaha ybr125cc for the whole time of my stay by Flamingo travel. Great Service and great people. Anytime i needed them for oilchanges or fix little Parts of the bike i just called and they did what needed to be done. If you look for good and Friendly Service Flamingo travel it is! The owner Hung is in Hanoi but you get in Touch with him via Mail and he will help you with your questions. Everybody speaks fluently English which makes it easy to communicate together. On top they offer Guide Tours as well. I went on a two Day Trip to Mekong delta and it was awsome go and Check it out. Thank you so much for everything im Glad We met and Thanks for your Support send you lots of love and good luck for your future. Stay healthy and happy. Kate (Kathrin), Germany

Friendly and Professional. I've rented bikes from flamingo on a number of occasions and each time the transaction has been transparent and straight forward. The bikes are always in mint condition and if you run into difficulties Hung and the guys are extremely helpful. Highly recommended,Repeat Offender :)

You pay more but for good reasons (safety, no mechanical problem, assistance,...). I rented a motorbike in the HCMC Flamingo Branch. It was more expensive than the others (220 VND per day against 150 VND in cheaper place for a Honda Win Detech 125cc) but the motorbike was in perfect state, well maintained. (+ full helmet at the right size, all the stuff required to attach my big backpack...)The service (very good English) was excellent providing me few basic but essential spares and also advices. The check up is made by professionally too. At the end not even a flat tyre in 7 weeks riding the Mekong Delta. No problem with the deposit even if it's a bit annoying to get 400$ in cash when you are about to leave the country with no need of $. Not a big deal but considering the supplement by the banks it's an additional cost to consider...

Chris and Andi XR200. My wife and I had a wonderful time on the 4 day 3 night self guided gps tour. They had a very nice bike for us to ride. It was a total adventure for us. We highly recommend this to anyone comfortable riding a motorcycle. Mr Hung even added some extra off roading for us to keep our heart rate high. (Don't do unless you are a skilled rider). Alex helped us in figuring out which bike we were going to use. Flamingo was very accommodating and even put us in a nice hostel the night we returned to Hanoi. Highly recommend this journey. Great opportunity to meet amazing people and see the country side without being on a tour bus. Cheers,Chris and Andi Smith

Most expensive, lied about value of items. Having read about Flamingo from guide books, I went to the office in Hanoi, they tried to equip me with a bunch of unnecessary gear for instance a GPS that they said cost $600 in Vietnam. However, when I pressed them to find that model for $600 being sold in Vietnam all of a sudden it was now $400. Also the cost of the motorbike was the highest I encountered out of 5 shops in Vietnam.

Very old motorbikes. Not maintained and very unsafe.. Very old motorbikes. Not maintained and very unsafe.I rented a motorbike for more than 10 days and I experienced only troubles.I wanted to change the bike, but he refused to replace it. I had to pay for all the repairs (more than 200 USD) and Mr Hung, the owner, promised he will refund the repair cost at the end of the rental period.Once I returned the bike, the staff and Mr Hung were pretty scornfull and refused to refund the repair costs.Avoid Flamingo Travel at all costs. There are motorbike rental companies much more reliable than this one in Hanoi, Vietnam.

Awesome experience. The best bike rental experience I have ever had. Everyone at Flamingo was super helpful and the bikes we got were perfect! Definitely recommend for anyone who wants to explore Vietnam by motorbike.

Great bikes and great service. I rented a semi-automatic Honda to spent my last days in Vietnam on the road. The bike was recommended by the staff for the trip to Mui Ne. I can not thing of anything negative to say about the service or the bike. I had a great ride along the coast and it was no problem to return the bike a day later than planned since I decided to stay a little longer in Mui Ne. For everyone who does not want to buy a bike in HCM this is the perfect solution.
Great motorcycles. Flamingo travel provided us with great and well maintained motorcycles for reasonable price. I would definitely recommend this company for everyone traveling to Vietnam.

Motorcycle rental from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi. Flamingo Travel is awesome and trustworthy. I just recently rented a Honda Future X from them and rode it from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi. The bike was practically brand new. They supplied us with two full face helmets, bungee cords, a luggage rack, spare tube, etc. They also shipped my girlfriends big suitcase to their office in Hanoi, and held it there until we made it. 5 stars all the way. Carl

Trustworthy. I rented a Honda Future X from Flamingo Travel for 11 days to ride around the northern regions of Vietnam. The people I interacted with at their office and garage were genuinely helpful and kind. If any problems come up during your journey you can contact them 24/7. I would not hesitate to use their services again.

Best guided tour I had. I took a 3 day guided motorbike trip from Hanoi to Sa Pa area with Hue Dangxuan on a pair of Kawasaki KLX 150s. I didn't know what to expect since it was the first time I took a guided motorbike tour. It was simply an amazing experience. Hue was highly professional and took care of every detail with the greatest attention and constantly did his best to make this a great experience for me. From the choice of roads and side tours, to carefully picked stops on the way for food and accommodation, everything was more than I hoped for. This was the best way to spend a weekend in northern Vietnam away from tourist herds and get a taste of the real thing. Two thumbs up!

Professional and friendly. I've rented bikes twice for myself and friends and they get my warmest recommendations. They are friendly, efficient, knowledgeable and got a great range of bikes in good condition. Personally I've rented bikes only, but they also do guided tours. Solid five stars in my book.

The Definition of Customer Service 😎. I booked a self guided tour with GPS and a Honda XR 650, from Hanoi to Sapa. We were two, with my GF riding on the back. From the first email, I knew it was going to be a good idea. Responses were quick and detailed, optional routes were offered and the deposit was easy to make online. I also changed my start date without any issues. When I arrived, I met Mr Hung, the owner. He was very accommodating and explained the details of the route on his laptop using the software Basecamp. He explained the GPS tracks, how to operate the unit and provided contact names and numbers for the provided accommodation each night, which was pre-booked for us, including meals. Mr Hung also called each day to check on our progress and ask if everything was ok. I didn't expect this, and it was a very nice touch! We had no issues with the bike, which also included a spare parts kit in case of any problems. There was no time when I felt that Flamingo was just in it for the money. It's obvious they really care about your experience and I will not hesitate to recommend them to others, and I will be happy to return again. Thanks so much team Flamingo!

Outstanding Service. We've just returned from a 6 day tour of NW Vietnam as pillion passengers with two of Flamingo's riders and we had a great time The itinerary was interesting and the route very scenic but what stood out for us was the service we received. From first contact to the day we left everyone in the company was so helpful.We arrived on a night train and they let us go to their hostel to shower and grab a drink. We were then collected on mopeds, taken to the office to complete the paperwork then taken to their garage to pick up the bikes. As we were hungry they stopped to collect some breakfast on the way.Throughout the trip our leader, Hua, provided great information on the things we saw and the people we met and at each hotel, carried our bags and ensured we were settled. As we wanted to spend a couple of days back in Sapa at the end of our ride they moved our bags to our new hotel in the morning, dropped is in Lao Cai (the finish point) in the afternoon and saw us onto a bus.Tram, the booking agent, even moved our overnight train to Hanoi to the end of our stay and offered to book us into a hotel in Sapa for the extra nights.When we did return to Hanoi we were, once again, allowed to shower in the hostel but the biggest help was when we found we'd left a tablet pc on the train. We made a call for help to their office and within an hour a guy on a scooter appeared with the recovered tablet. All above and beyond the call of duty.Great service A big thank you guys.

Motorcycle rental with one way drop off from Hanoi to Saigon - Excellent Service. I hired a Kawasaki KLX150 to travel from Hanoi to Saigon. It was the only rental service that provided one way drop off and with good reliable reviews. The motorcycles must be hired for a minimum of 14 days for this journey, and is long enough to complete the journey. The motorcycles are well maintained and in good condition. They are serviced prior to your departure with new engine oil, chain, brakes and tyres (if necessary). There are also a bag full of spare parts that are provided for your journey in case of break downs that you may encounter. These include clutch plates, levers, brake pads, throttle and clutch cables, and sprockets. Although these parts were provided, the motorcycles are relatively new with less than 15,000km on it and still mechanically A1. I encountered no issues what so ever.The staff are very helpful and communicate very well via email prior to my visit. All questions were answered and no miscommunication occurred and made the formal documentation procedure very streamline upon arrival. They also provide me with a big list of mechanics throughout the country that can provide you assistance if any mechanical issues are encountered. I opted for the 1000 USD cash deposit instead of the passport and I had no issues upon dropping off the bike in Saigon. Few questions were asked, the motorcycles were inspected and the deposit was returned (in cash) on the spot. I would highly recommend flamingo travel who wish to hire reliable motorcycles!

The best tour agency EVER!. The people were very communicative right from the start. When we were trying to reserve plane tickets from Romania (6 months before the trip) we talked to them and they recommended a lot of places to visit, even if they did not provide services in some of those places. They also helped us with getting used to the life style in Vietnam, they gave us a lot of tips regarding the culture. Anything we wanted to know, they told us. Those people know a lot of things about Vietnam and its history. What I have also seen is that these people are very versatile and adapt to any situation and any type of tourist. They really are the best in their field! Maximum Respect! (If you get there, ask for Dăng Xuân Hue to be your guide, you will have the best experience.)

Adventure in the South West surroundings of Hanoi. I am writing one week after a lovely "long" weekend riding in Vietnam along with a friend and tour guide Hue, which was very kind and helpful all the time. He gave us professional guidance advise as needed and made our journey a treasure to remember.

3 day self guided tour from Hanoi. Flamingo really tailor their service to suit what you want to do. I was hoping to kick off by myself and just explore for a few days around Hanoi by motorbike, but a bit nervous without much language or local knowledge. You just want to know that there are a few fallback options — even just a number you can call and speak to somebody in English. Flamingo provide that and more, suggesting places I might want to go as well as accommodation options. I was cursing the dirt-bike at first, especially for the punishment it was giving my butt, but it really is the only way to go, even on main roads — in Hanoi traffic, you've got the option of taking the potholed routes that all the scooters are avoiding! (but I'd advise to taking extra cushioning).

Flamingo Travel, Bike Hire and much more. My wife and I flew out to Ho Chi Minh City with the intention of hiring a bike and travelling to the central highlands. We did not pre-book the bike as I like the chance to look at the bike before signing up to hire it. If I had just booked in advance our trip could have been a lot different. If I was able to organise the trip with the benefit of hindsight I would have no hesitation in hiring from Flamingo Travel. The reasons for this are many. We wanted a 250cc bike as we are European sized people carrying luggage so would need the extra power. Larger bikes are not routinely carried by the bike companies in HCMC so obtaining one was difficult in the short term when we arrived. Tram at Flamingo Travel worked tirelessly to obtain a bike for us which suited our needs and was able to get us a fine Honda XR250 for our trip. Throughout our search she kept us updated on progress. Tram also helped us obtain a Vietnamese mobile phone for use on our trip. 5 days into our trip my wifes' bag was stolen with our two passports in it. This meant that to stand any chance in obtaining the travel documents to leave the country as planned we had to return to HCMC. Tram at Flamingo travel helped us all along the way in dealing with the Police, giving advice over the phone and finally obtaining an express service for the exit visa we needed to leave the country. This is going to sound like an advert but is absolutely true without reservation. We were hired an excellent motorcycle which performed perfectly during the time we had it. The additional service we were blessed to receive went well beyond what anyone has a right to expect and reflects the very best of the Vietnamese people. Generous, friendly, hard working, resourceful and inspirational. Tram Pham and Flamingo Travel thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

3 Day Motorbike Tour to Tam Coc & Mai Chau. I did a 3 day guided tour to Tam Coc and Mai Chau and it was great. Our guide, Hue, was always very helpful and in a good mood. The bike, a Honda CRF 250, was in good condition, performing well both on and off road. Overall it was a great experience and I can only recommend Flamingo Travel and our guide Hue for a fun, hassle free motorbike tour in Vietnam.

Great service!. I did a 16 day Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh guided tour with Flamingo travel and I must say it was great!I opted for a Honda 250xr which performed flawlessly during the trip. The bike had a few miles on it but was well maintained. A 250cc is plenty in Vietnam as traffic and road conditions don't justify any more. My guide Quynh was knowledgable about sights and Vietnam in general and spoke English very well, at least for a non-native speaker like me. On top of that he was an all around great guy and was fun to ride with. The owner Hung customized my trip to my wishes ahead of the trip and checked in multiple times during the trip to hear if every thing was as expected. He really made me feel like a valued customer.All in all a very good experience and a fantastic way to see this beautiful country. I will definitely be using Flamingo travel next time I'm in Vietnam

Ask for tour guide "Hue" for a great Vietnam tour. My experience with Flamingo travel was great. I emailed multiple times during my planning stage and always received a prompt reply. I went on the North Central six day tour. Hue was my tour guide. He spoke great English and always explained things in detail the best he could. He knew all the hotel and restaurant owners and after a couple of days he knew exactly the type of food I preferred. It was nice arriving at a restaurant after riding multiple hours and not having to stress about the food and preparation. The bike was great. I took the KLX 150. Next time I'll ride the Honda 250cc. It's an overall larger bike. I'm 6'5". The extra suspension would have been better. However, the 150cc had plenty of power. The tour pretty much covers everything I was looking for. Don't hesitate to reserve your tour of Vietnam with Flamingo Travel. Ask for "Hue".

bike hire. Just rented a bike from Flamingo in Hcmc for 3 weeks. Very good to deal with and great bikes, if you want a trouble free ride hire from this company. I did see some cheep hire bikes painted black but you also see them getting repaired lots, not what you want when on a back road with no one speaking english..spend a bit extra for that good hire bike its worth it from flamingo...huskyboy.

NAM BUSTERS 3. If you love motorcycles and want to have a once in a lifetime ride, taking in both road and off road, these guys will give it to you in spades. Not words I would choose normally but it can be a life changing event.

Guided tour of North Vietnam. I joined a group of 6 people who had used Flamingo twice previously for guided tours of Vietnam and I can see why they returned for a third time. They are all very experienced bikers and 'adventurers' so their expectations are very high. Hung, the guide and manager of Flamingo, gave us a totally bespoke service, modifying the trip on a day by day basis to ensure the group got the absolute maximum from the tour. Suffice to say it was an incredible tour which would have been impossible without the faultless performance of the bikes (mainly Honda XR 250s) and Hung's local knowledge and fantastic service.

Highly recommendable agency. As we had rented motorbikes (200 and 250ccm) in Laos (3 times), Thailand (twice) and the Philippines previously, we can say that Flamingo was the best company overall. We had 125s this time, which are perfectly light and manoeuvrable in offroad sections. The lack of power on fast onroad tracks is inevitable. The maintenance of the bikes was the best ever, as virtually everything was working properly - including the speedmeter, which never worked on all previous bikes. We had to exchange one battery on the trip - the nice young lady at the HCM branch gave us the money back without any negotiation, even though we did not have a receipt. Perfect customer service.

Halong Bay. Fantastic trip, 2 days one night. 5 course lunch,5 course Dinner, Breakfast and Brunch. The food was exceptional, don't know how the chef manages to cook great food in such a small kitchen. Lovely cabin,great staff

Thirty three days of trouble free biking.. Our plan was to ride from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi from January 21st to February 22nd and it was successful thanks to our plucky Yamaha 125 rented from Flamingo travel.Their efficient service, good price, reliable bike, spare kit, loan of helmets and waterproofs enabled us to be totally independent and to go to places off the beaten track.We were very pleased with everything, (except the weather at times) and highly recommend this professional agency.
Motorbike Rental. Easy to get along with motorbike rental. Reasonable pricing and motorbike was in good shape. They provide helmets with rental.

19 days in paradise riding a Suzuki DR650. . Flamingo travel gets a 10 from me as they gave me a well prepped bike and a comprehensive list of spares in case I came into trouble. 1st time Vietnam and I wanted to travel the HoChi Minh Highway but also the coast so I wanted a bike that could keep me on the road and not wasting time at the repair shop. Also I wanted the enjoyment of riding and not just the scenery so for me that meant the bike had to be bigger then 400cc. Settling for the DR650 was a blessing. Thankyou Flamingo travel for providing me with a top notch bike that performed perfectly for the 4500kms traveled in 19 days. Couldn't of done this on anything else. Will be getting another bike from Flamingo to tour North Vietnam in their warmer weather

Good, reliable and very professional agency. I've rented a Honda future for a couple of days from flamingo travel. They provide you with all the information and help you planning a trip. The bike was really good, they give you some additional spare parts, 24/7 technical assistance. I didn't have any problem with the bike and there are no hidden costs!Definitely recommend flamingo travel. Thanks again Paul

A glance back at the past. I recommend this for first timers to Hanoi as it shows the elegance and grandeur that was prevalent during the years that the French occupied Indochina. The architecture is indicative of the time and its an interesting hour of your time.

Rented 3 bikes for 3 weeks in Ho Chi Minh. We rented three bikes in HCMC and rode for 19 days without a problem. The staff was really friendly and helpful, they were kind enough to keep our luggage for us during our trip and after we returned the bikes while we had a short trip to Cambodia, and for free :)They could have done nothing better.

Good bikes, great people!. We rented 2 bikes to travel to the north and this was the best experience in Vietnam if you ask me! Since you can rent a bike almost everywhere in Hanoi, you don't really know where to go for good quality. Search no more, this is the place to go to! Cheaper is not always better if it comes to safety, and Flamingo Travel has different types of bikes for different prices. They explain everything in good english and show you how the bikes work. After you sign a contract they guide you to their workshop where proffesionals check the bikes before leaving. The bikes were in good condition and we didn't had to call the office once during our 5 days. The freedom you'll experience on a bike is what makes it all worth while, and I would recommend it to everyone!

A Dreamy Night on Halong Bay.. We organised cruise for one night on Halong Bay from Hanoi. They picked us up on time. Guide very courteous.Paid a bit extra for a room with a balcony which was really worth it as it gave you some privacy to enjoy the magnificent scenery. Even though it was drizzling still beautiful. Bus trip a bit arduous, especially coming back. Not much leg room in bus.

Best place to rent Moto bikes in hanoi. There are a few places to rent motorbikes in Hanoi. I did a 10 day solo trip and was very beautiful.. the owner can answer any questions you have relating to motor biking in Vietnam. I paid $25 usd a day for a 125cc dirt bike - I thought was expensive but I guess that's the going rate...over all was a good expierence with helpful staff

4 week motorbike rental without a problem!. We rented two motorbikes from flamingo travel in HCMC for our 4 week holiday in Vietnam and regretted nothing! Staff was very kind and helpful from the start! The bikes were in a good condition (not brand new but you can't expect that in VN) and brought us all the 2000 km around the country without any problems at all! If you're looking for a hassle-free motorbike rental for your Vietnam trip: flamingo is a good shot!

Self Guided Tour North Vietnam. The team at flamingo gave excellent service, good bikes, KLX, no problems, fantastic trip, lots of back roads, advise to have a GPS for self guided, hotels good that were recommended by Flamingo also places to eat, make sure you come back into Ha Noi on the old main road, and the road from Dien Bien Phu to Sin Ho, high lights of the trip, stunning, if you have any problems Hung and the team will sort out when the language barrier is a problem.

Excellent bike rental. Very professional and capable team. Not pushy at all, which is very refreshing. Their prices are also reasonable. We rented a Honda X from them. It was in good condition and they provided good extras like a proper helmet, side bags and spares (useful when we encountered a flat tyre). We enjoyed our bike so much that we extended it for a trip up to Sapa. Highly recommended.
Very pro and reliable. Very pro and reliable bke renter and tour organiser. I have used them a number of time and they never let me down. Hung is a great guy and those working for him are too.

Self-guided tour to North Vietnam with Honda XR650. Excellent organization, good route, nice hotels, perfect bike - phantastic trip!The trip for 7 days was perfectly planned by Flamingo Travels. The daily routing was on average 150 - 200 km, just perfect for this terrain. My Honda XR650 was perfect for this trip. The hotels were good.Thanks a lot Flamingo Travels.

Hanoi to Danang. We were in Hanoi end of last year & needed a vehicle to drive us from Hue to Danag/Hoian & accomodation. Once again Flamingo Travel came to our service with great advice and bookings organised. We have used them twice now and have found them exceptional both times, very friendly, great service.

Great motorbike rental. Excellent service, good prices, very friendly and helpfull people. . The Flamingo people provided me with a lot of extra's which I might need o the road. Then, when I crashed on a mountain road, they assisted me 100% (talked to the local mecanic) what to do, and how to get back to Hanoi. Their repair prices were very reasonable. My very best recommendations.

28 day Motorbike Rental. We rented a Honda XR400 for 28 days to explore northern Vietnam. Bike was running great and we got a lot of spare parts with us, just in case. But we didn't need them. Bike was equipped with two saddle bags and a strong luggage rack.You can book a GPS-Self-Guided-Tour with prebooked hotels/guesthouses, breakfast and dinner. But unfortunately, it is not possible to get only the GPS-Tracks and enjoy the freedom of traveling!!!!!! So you are not able to stay where you want or to discover additional things. This is even more worse, as there are almost no detailed maps availabe for Vietnam and navigation on dirt tracks is sometimes really difficult.But despite that, rental was great and price was okay.

Great staff, great bikes, great services: the best!!!. I have rented a Honda Future X 125cc (10 Hp) for a 21 days self-guided motorbiketrip through the north-west of Vietnam in from 15 november – 5 december.I had done some research and decided that as a not very experienced biker this was a good bike for me. Not too much power and easy to handle and perfect for the mountain area.. After a brief conversation with the very friendly, professional and efficient girls in the office, they agreed on this. Everything about the rental procedure was explained very clearly and I even got some discount because of renting for 21 days.The bike was in a good condition (it was checked and maintained the day before my departure) and had a low mileage. The mechanics also tied a rack onto the back and gave some bungeeropes to tie my luggage bag to it. I was provided with a good and strong integral helmet with a visor (good protection for face, ears etc.). Also a list with hotels, guesthouses and homestays was included.The staff is 24h available on the phone to solve any problems such as mechanical problems, accidents, police controls etc. This gave me a good feeling.So off I went and had a great trip. On 2200 km. the bike was really reliable, no problems at all (just starting and running). The only thing I had to take care of was after each 800 km. to change the oil, oil the chain and check the brakes. This costs just 80.000 – 90.000 VND each time and it was easy to find a repair shop (b.t.w.. I had this written on a paper by the staff in Vietnamese).Unlike other rental companies, Flamingotravel will not charge you for scratches etc and are extremely reasonable about bike conditions upon return. And my deposit was waiting for me when I returned.I was very satisfied with Flamingo: the staff, the motorbike and the other services). So if you want rent a motorbike in Hanoi: Flamingotravel is the place to go!!!!So a lots of thanks to the staff and mechanics of Flamingotravel, keep up the good works and hope to see you again.Freddy Koekoek, The Netherlands
Bike on Rent. Provided Yamaha 150 cc bike for 2 days at a reasonable cost. They insist on keeping your passport so keep a scanned copy with you just in case as you have to deposit original here.

Flamingo Travel made our trip possible & without them we would have been B******d so I will be using them again.. We asked Flamingo to deliver bikes to Da Nang so we could ride back up to Hanoi. They did the job, no worries, delivered to the door of our hotel by Mr Duncan Pitfield. Duncan took us to the petrol station & showed us how it all worked & then we all whizzed off for a beer & he gave us a few tips that really helped. Flamingo Travel made our trip possible & without them we would have been B******d so I will be using them again. I'm looking forward to my next trip from Ho Chi Min city to Hanoi as we are staying 2 months instead of 2 weeks this time :-)

Motorbike tour northeast Vietnam -Ba Be Lake HaGiang district Xia Men to Bac Ha and Lai cai . Getting off the beaten track and taking a motorbike tour for 6 days around Northeast Vietnam mainly Ba Be and Ha Giang was well worth it and a memorable experience. There was only me and my rider Cuong who has years of experience and looked after me very well. I felt safe with his riding skills and knowledge of the region. I also was reassured by Flamingo travel who checked in now and again to see how the trip was going.

Friendly and good service. We went two weeks with motorbikes from flamingotravel and had a lot of fun.The Bikes are in good condition and the service from the Flamingotravel was very friendly,helpfull and more as nethersary.Thanks a lot and we would do it with flamingotravel again!!!best regards Dani and Andrea

Probably the best motorcycle rental in the Old Quarter. Me and my girlfriend rented 2 motorcycles for 8 days to do our own tour of north Vietnam. (Hanoi / Ninh Binh / Mai Chau / Son La / Dien Bien Phu / Sapa / Yen Bai / Hanoi)We got a very good service: well looked after motorcycles ( we didn't have any problems on the way) / bungee ropes / spare parts ( that we didn't need ) /helmets / and the very helpfull staff even guided us to the nearest gas station to fuel up !All in all, we had the trip of a lifetime , so big thanks to Flamingos for making this experience possible for us!

The roads to heaven or ........ Northern Vietnam. I would just like to start off and say how professional the whole team at Flamingo travel is . We rented a couple bikes for 11 days and did the northern loop , for the first two days we had the best guide you could imagine . Michael Hue he set are minds at ease,from fuel , food , accommodations and of course the rules of the road and culture of the people .I would highly recommend Hue to anyone interested in a guided tour of Vietnam ..... Good person , great rider.... Cheers Michael !

Ha Giang Tour. We had a great few days riding Flamingo bikes being guided around the northern highlands. Dong Van - Meo Vac was a highlight for us. Don't miss it!Our guide was Tan and he was excellent. Very enthusiastic and has a love of riding bikes that is infectious.

This is a must for any motorcycle enthusiast !!!!!. You haven't done any riding until you have tackled the northern loop of Vietnam !!!We rented Yamaha 125That is plenty for the roads you will tackle unless you have a passengerThe office ladies are great and our guide Hway, not sure how to spell was great We combined part guided and part gps on our own which for 12 days was great. I would have Whay the whole time if u r only doing 3-5 or if you don't ride that much or travel He was great!!!!! Thanks Vietnam, what a great country , people food and all the culture that is part of it, cheers to flamingo travelNorthern mountains in pic and Vietnam road block

great trip. We booked the hire of a Honda xr200 from Enland a few months before we arrived in Hanoi,the staff helped us choose the perfect bike for riding two up.The day of the trip we arrived at the office and were welcomed by the staff and asked of our plans for the seven days we had hired the bike for,we hadnt any clear plans so they recommended a route and places to stay along the way.The trip was a once in a lifetime experience with the staffs recommendations spot on everytime particulary the home stay visits(hotels were great but cant compare to the homestays).We had no problems with the bike it just kept going! reliable and solid.Staff so helpful,friendly and welcoming.

Great company great bikes Awesome guide . We did a group booking 5 days to north east vietnam and found the girls in the office very professional and extremely efficient when responding to our enquires via email. After arriving there and meeting our guide Dangxuanhue aka Mike he made us feel right at home and with a last minute addition of an American lad we met along the way who had minimal riding experience set us up with all our bikes and gear and took our new mate Tom under his wing and guided us from Hanoi to the Chinese border and back again unscathed and without incident. Even though it was belting rain for the majority of the trip our guide Mikes attitude and outlook was upbeat and inspiring this guy is passionate about bikes travel and meeting new people to share his country with. So to sum up if you want to book a fantastic tour and if you want the best guide ask for Mike (Dangxuanhue) you will not regret it.We will be back again Mike if you don't make it to Australia first.Cheers mate

perfect way to visit north vietnam on a motorbike. Hung the manager of the office in Hanoi took us on a 6 day trip through the north of vietnam on his motorbikes (Honda CRF 250 -Kawasaki 250 and even a lowered Degree Honda for my wife)fabulous trip ,i recommend to do it with a guide because once you are 50 miles from Hanoi ,no-one speeks English and finding the right way will be difficult.Especially if you like to do some off road .Marvellous scenery-rural life at its best -mountains and rice fields -road to Sapa trough Tonkinese alps ,highest pass in Vietnam ... to much highlights in one day ,imagine what 6 days will bring. Not for the shy ,but an experience you'll never forget .Flamingo Travel will do everything to make your trip like you wanted it ,and service is high standard,and prices much lower then booking with foreign companies.

Great Experience, Friendly Folks. The trip was amazing, the folks at Flamingo were friendly and at the end they gave us a free t-shirt! Miichael Hue was our tour guide and he did a good job. Overall a great experience, I would definitely do it again.

Great ride... great time coming back pho sure!!!. Hung and the Flamingo crew made a 2 day trip last a life time. Put us on new bikes and took us on a combination of back roads, then into the dirt for double and single track fun!!It was a mini adventure and Hung made sure to keep it all together no matter what came our way. Great attitude and LOTS of laughs!! Highly recommend Flamingo Travel for you 2 wheel Viet needs!! We will be back Hung me and Mr Broken!! ;) Thanks again!

Exceptional service along with bargain price. From the get go we received a service that no other motorbike rental company could even inch towards. They provided us all the tools and advice to make our journey an exceptional one. At first we were put off by leaving a passports with them, but after a short discussion they put our minds at ease.They provide you with a 24hr help line number but thankfully we did not have to use it. Although knowing this gave us peace knowing we were taken care of.

For my money, the ONLY place to rent or buy a motorbike in Vietnam!. I visited Flamingo's Saigon branch when I visited VN for the first time in December 2013. I bought a Yamaha YBR from them and rode it to Hanoi where the HQ office bought it back from me for a VERY fair price. In May 2014 I returned and bought a Yamaha Nuevo scooter that I rode until I left in July. Instead of selling it back to them, I gave it to a friend who still rides it. Now that I live in Dalat, VN and own bigger bikes, I do less business with Flamingo, though I still visit every time I'm in town. I also recommend them without hesitation to everyone I meet (and sometimes even someone just walking down the street). Earlier this week, I wrote a blog post with some information about buying a motorbike in Saigon and again wrote glowingly about Flamingo Travel. I'm a big fan.If you buy a motorbike somewhere else and later regret it because you ignored Flamingo's overwhelmingly positive reviews here and elsewhere, it was probably because you thought buying the cheapest would save you money. It never does.Buy or rent from Flamingo. Period.

Best of the Best. We have rended 4 New Kawasaki for a month in Vietnam, so i hightly recommend Flamingo travel, Good service, fast and always on time. The girl in Saigon" Tram" is very friendly and beautiful.

Wonderful services - Highest recommendation. I highly recommend Flamingo travel!It's the second time we use their services and it has been a no trouble trip!We rented twice a dirt bike for 4 days to travel in the northern region of Vietnam.- The bike are in perfect condition (we didn't had any problems even after having driven more than 1000km).- The staff is 24h available on the phone to solve any problems you may encounter (police controls, passport registration, mechanical problems) and they are very helpful - I am not sure I have found any better "touring agency" so far. - As mentioned, it's more than just a bike rental, they assist you for any requests: train & bus tickets booking, assistance to put the bike in the train or in the bus, provide personal driver to pick you/drop you at the airport... We were even upgraded for free in the train (from Lao Cai to Hanoi)!They also have an office in Saigon, which is very helpful!Bravo to the management and the staff for this very very reliable business!Matthieu, resident in Vietnam for 2 years

Great service! Reliable bikes.. We have rented 2 Honda XR 250 cc for a 18 days self-guided motorbiketrip through the north of Vietnam in Oktober 2015. On 2.500 km the two bikes were really reliable. We only had minor problems like a blown fuse or light bulb on one of the bikes. None of these I would not have expected at home with my bike on this distance under same conditions. The bikes were in excellent technical condition. A 24h Helpline, a detailed briefing on our route and a big package of spareparts including oil gave us he necessary safety to make our trip. The cost for a damaged odometer that we have caused were handeled under very fair conditions after our return.No hidden cost for replacement of parts after return! Thanks to Hung and his team for the excellent service!

four days bike tour. Tan was an impecable guide for our 4 day off road bike trip. He went the extra mile to source softer seats for our wives who were riding pillion ( happy wife - happy ride). Knew his routs and was able to adapt them to the ever changing weather conditions. Would definatly ask for him again on our next trip to Vietnam.

The rental bikes are junk and are put together with all kind of pieces. Totaly unsafe.. Rented 3 bikes from him in Hanoi for 2 days. The bike where scratched, broken mirrors and basically junk. We made a mistake of taking the bikes with out signing on the damages as the girl says it is ok. We will not charge you for the damages on the bike. When we returned the bikes they claim that we lost 1 peg and made us pay for it. How can a peg comes of the bracket is the bike is not dropped ? But no signs or scratches of dropping the bike were found on this side.The helmet that we got was unsafe as one of the straps came off the helmet, as it was totally rusted. I don't think what would happen if we got involved in an accident. I would go other places to rent and take pictures of the bike before you sign on anything as they will get you. Gas, they give you a total empty tank good maybe for 2-3 miles. You fill it up and give it back half to full as you would not like to go to empty. They sell the gas to next costumer.

North Vietnam Morotcycle tour. Great bunch of guys and excellent service. This was our second trip and each was brilliant in its own way. The fist trip was to Sapa with return train trip and the second was the north back roads to the china border. Each option offered spectacular scenery and exciting riding with lots of opportunity to meet the locals (homestay). We had no trouble with the company or staff and would recommend to anyone considering this type of trip. In particular our guide Hue and Mechanic Ting were excellent and if you get the chance request their services do so.

A lifetime experience. Thank you Hung !. I got Hung's contact from a friend. He is the manager of Flamingo Travel and of great help. We rented a Yamaha YBR 125 from the Ho Chi Minh Agency for 40 days to cross the country, go up to Sa Pa and come back to Hanoi. We did 4000km my gf behind and myself driving the back. What and adventure, one of the best things I've done in my life ! I really enjoyed driving the bike, especially in the mountains going up to Sa Pa. The lands there are absolutely amazing, beautiful green mountains endlessly dominate the landscape.We had a serious problem with the bike after 30 days of travelling (4-5h of driving every day more or less) and Hung helped us out a lot, he was always available on the phone to speak with the mechanic and try and solve the problem. He speaks good english. It costs us about 500,000 VND to fix the bike (it was an engine problem) and costs us a day of travelling, since we were stuck in a small town in the mechanics. We also had a small crash with another bike, and broke the plastic cover of the front tire. Since it was more or less the same price, Hung called it quits, so he is a fair man and you can trust him.I would 100% recommend this company, they are experts.THANK YOU FLAMINGO TRAVEL ! I will make a video of the trip, I filmed it in 60fps 1080p :)

Vietnam Adventure Motorcyclining. In September 2015 I did a 4 day adventure motor cycle trip in Vietnam with a friend and the owner of Flamingo Travel, Hung, and one of his Flamingo guides, Tan. We rented two Kawasaki KLX 250's from Flamingo Travel in Hanoi which turned out to be the perfect size bike for the terrain. At home I ride a KTM 1190R and found the smaller lighter bike on the more technical rides very forgiving. We rode from Hanoi to Mai Chau and spend around 8 hours per day for the next 3 days in the mountains and countryside around Mai Chau. Around 50% of the road were single tracks through spectacular lush green scenery, amazing waterfalls (where I cooled off) and quaint little villages. Tan kept the riding exciting by varying the tracks between rocky mountain, muddy, two track dirt, single track forest and concrete paths through rice paddies. He managed to find magnificent little "restaurants" for lunch every day where a delicious meal with 6 - 8 different dishes would set you back a couple of dollars. Our wifes and my 4 year old daughter spent the 4 days relaxing at the Eco Lodge in Mai Chau and we joined them in the evenings upon return for "dinner and dancing". Our ride was for those with some experience but the routes cater for all levels of riding for those comfortable on dirt tracks and Tan will quickly gauge the skill of the riders. Having traversed Africa and South America on motorbike I can honestly say that this experience ranks right up there with some of the most spectacular rides I've ever done. I can strongly recommend it. Just check the timing with Flamingo in Hanoi as it would be very challenging in the rainy season and extremely hot around mid year.

Flamingo tours ( Exceptional ). Oh my god this company is amazing, there organised every thing, trip to hanolong bay, and 15 days of the best motor bike riding ever, every thing was included and the customer service and tour guides where a very valuable part of this great company, 10 out of 10 and I will be back and will highly recommend this company to anyone who wants great service.

Ho Chi Minh to Hanoi. I hired a kawasaki 125cc for 10 days to ride from ho chi minh to hanoi. The bike was in excellent condition and i was suppiled with all necessary equipment as described on website and more. The team in ho chi minh were fantastic, they supplied me with a guide for the day 'nam' who showed me how to navigate the road system and gave me a top up lesson on the outskirts of ho chi minh. The team also extended my visa through a small fee. Everything they did was professional and with a smile. Brilliant company, i can strongly recommend them to anyone considering bike rental in vietnam and visa extension. Thank you flamingo.

Excellent service to enjoy a good ride in Vietnam. We rented a scooter 125cc and Honda 150cc for three days in Flamingo, to go from Hanoi to Halong Bay.Their choice of vehicle is large and the stuff helped us to pick up the most convenient regarding our trip and driving experience.They helped us to set up luggage on the bikes, just the garage can help you go to buy gas and exit Hanoi, asked for 7USD you don't need it as city indication are easy to follow and you have gas station everywhere. Their staff was very nice when we returned the bikes and I highly recommend Flamingo, quality and confidence provided there are what you look for when it's about riding in Vietnam.

2 days motorbike trip Hanoi Mai Chau. I did a 2 days motorbike guided tour, from Hanoi to Mai Chau, with 1 night in Mai Chau.I had an amazing week-end: good bike, good itinerary (mainly off-roads), skilled and friendly guide (Tan), wonderful landscapes, typical food and accomodation.Definitly recommend it.

Good quality motorbike and excellent service. Based on recommendations of others we rented a Honda XR 250 CC for two days for a trip to Mai Chau. Upon leaving we received any spare parts that could possibly be needed during the trip. The bike was in good condition, handled well and sounded like a proper motorbike. We were expecting some rain during the weekend but as soon as we were outside of Hanoi we all got soaking wet up to our underwear. Trying to warm up and looking at the weather forecast we found out that from here on the weather would only get worse and Mai Chau may end up being more of a suicide mission than a nice trip. We decided on a day trip to Ba Vie instead. It was a very wet day but we nevertheless had a wonderful trip. The dirt roads lined with potholes filled with water added a certain dimension to our trip and where no problem for this bike.
