Upon returning the bike one day early Hung, the representative from Flamingo, offered us a full refund on the bike for the second day as he felt sorry for us as we had bad weather. I was very surprised by this but gladly accepted this offer. Flamingo is not the cheapest place to rent a motorbike in Hanoi but in my opinion well worth the investment. For the next trip I will definitely hire a bike from this company again.

Only rental company worth using in Vietnam!. Myself and 3 other friends from Scotland stumbled into flamingo travel, with the intention of buying a motorcycle in Hanoi to ride down to Hoh Chi Minh City.After a brief conversation with Chris, and English employee in the Hanoi office, he had managed to convince us to rent. Most people tell you that rental companies are out there to rip you off and to make as much money from inexperienced, naive tourists as possible and to an extent they are correct (personal experience has taught me this) but flamingo travel are different. If you are on a tight timeline like we were (21 days) they will rent you bikes in Hanoi and provide transport for them from Hoh Chi Minh to Hanoi upon arrival. We rented 3 Honda lifans (125cc) and a future - moped for 175 dollars each for 21 days. At first this seemed very expensive and with the thought of them requiring a passport that would be sent from Hanoi to Saigon made us very apprehensive but we made the decision to go ahead.In the evening, we went for some drinks with Chris and the owner who sat us down with a map and suggested the best routes and attractions to visit on our journey - making the experience a lot more personal and friendly. This was extremely helpful.The bikes were in good condition with very low mileage. We had several experienced bike mechanics with us that were able to point out any faults and the mechanics would fix before departure. The mechanics also tied racks onto the back so that we could tie our large luggage bags to them Aswell as providing large saddle bags (or they offered to transport your luggage to Saigon). Once we were happy with the bikes and both ourselves and flamingo had taken photos and documented each bikes condition we set off. Flamingo have a 24 hour mechanic on standby that can speak fluent English and Vietnamese and can translate problems to local mechanics which was very useful.Unlike other rental companies, flamingo will not charge you for scratches etc and are extremely reasonable about bike conditions upon return. Although buying a bike was our intention, renting from flamingo saved us a lot of time buying/selling (not as easy as you think - no matter what way you do the trip most people lose a lot of money) and also breakdown time as these bikes were extremely reliable.Upon arrival in Saigon, the bikes were checked by mechanics and our passport was returned with no damages incurred.All in all, it was a trip of a lifetime made all the more enjoyable by an excellent company.Thanks so much Flamingo travel.Mark, Hamish, Josh and Jonny.

Travel services.... We didn't hire bikes from Flamingo but we used them to arrange the transfer of our big 20kg bag from HCMC to Hanoi while we travelled up the coast by train unhindered!After struggling to find out any information online about sending a bag on ahead of us we finally got lucky with Flamingo. They sent and held onto the bag for us, arranged train tickets and even sorted out a sim card for us on our arrival to HCMC. They were friendly, helpful and prompt at replying to email, which seems a rare thing in Vietnam.

Not the cheapest, but inspired confidence in quality. We rented four 125cc Honda Future bikes at Flamingo Travel in order to travel around the northern part of Vietnam for 7 days. We had found deals elsewhere in Hanoi for Honda Waves for around 6 dollars/day, but at Flamingo we were convinced that a larger bike (larger wheels) is more suitable for the roads outside of the city due to potholes and such. I am glad we made this choice since the roads could at times be demanding indeed.In summary, Flamingo was not the cheapest deal we could've had, but I am glad we chose for them since we had no mechanical breakdown during the trip (with quite some mileage), which I attribute to proper prior maintenance of the bike by Flamingo. I also had confidence that any mechanical issues we would've encountered along the way would've been solved in an honest and fair way, though we did not put this to the test since we, as indicated, did not encounter any mechanical troubles. The Flamingo team was friendly and helpful in their dealings with us.

Great bike rental company!!!!!. Me and my mate hired 2 bikes, a CRF250 and KLX250, and rode from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh City. Bikes were great the whole trip. On the first day the CRF had a slight sound from the engine, I called up Hung and he immediately called his mechanics who fixed the problem while we had a coffee. We traveled over 2,000kms on the trip and the bikes were flawless the whole trip. Had to tighten the chains at about halfway, which is to be expected, and Hung supplied is with a great tool kit to get this done. He also sat down with us before we left Hanoi and gave us some great tips on places to visit. They also have a service where you can rent the bikes in Hanoi and drop them off in HCMC. I would definitely recommend using Flamingo travel for your bike rentals in Vietnam!!!
Great honda!!. Following the advice from the employee, we rented an Honda FutureX 125cc. Great bike, we did the northern loop to Sapa!! All great!!

Reliable bikes with a great support system. We rented a Honda XR250 and a Future X 125 for a self-guided loop around the mountainous North of Vietnam. Both bikes were well used but reliable. Service was prompt and excellent, and we got very useful advice and information, as well as a 24-hour help line (which we were fortunate enough not to need). Although we had a minor break (the pin holding the kickstand up on the 250 sheared off on Day 2), we were not docked any of our deposit. We also were able to return our bikes to the company at the Lao Cai train station which allowed us to take the overnight express train back and return the saddlebags to Flamingo the day after our last reserved day of bike use, at no extra charge. Very friendly. Great website. Keep up the good work, Team Flamingo! I'll be sure to use this again if I venture north again.

Good times. We rented a Honda XR 400 in Hanoi, they then put the bike on the train for us to pick up in Lai Cai. It worked great for the most part, little glitches here or there , some language barriers at the train station in Lai Cai,, some difficulty finding the gas station to fill the bike etc, nothing horrendous but a better map could have made stuff clearer for us, but hey, its vietnam. The bike itself could have used more upkeep but all in all it worked fine. Flamingo travel were very good about handling all transactions and getting our deposit back quickly. I would use them again.

Hanoi and north by train to Lao Cai and East.. Let me start by saying that I can not fault Flamingo at all. We started with a night train from Hanoi to Lao Cai. The bikes were put at the station and they took us there from their office. I recommend the night train, nice. From Lao Cai we went north-east up into the mountains and followed the Chinese boarder to Ha Giang, Yen Minh, Méo Vac, Nguyén Binh, and over to Ban Gioc Waterfalls.Here is a tip if you go to the falls in the dry season, go after 11o'clock cause that's when they turn on the water so the tourists can see them in their full glory, it's true. Our rout took us to some pretty remote villages where we had a break down with one of the bikes. It took awhile to find the problem (Loose wire plus new battery). We called Flamingo's hot line and they approved the repairs and we were on our way. We were reimbursed for the cost with no questions asked back in Hanoi. Even though we were a little off the main tourist routs Flamingo gave us a list of hotels in the villages where we were going to stay. As I said at the start, I can not fault them them at all.Bob from Belgium

Faultless service and experience. We had such a good time with these guys, they planned a route for us and sent us off with a lovely guide. He showed us some amazing sights, the bikes we used were smaller than we ride back home but perfect for the slower speeds you do in Vietnam, they were nice and new and worked perfectly, I used a Honda CRF, I now want to buy one for myself. I can't wait to come back to Hanoi and do another tour with these guys. Highly recommended.

Great Place to rent bikes!. My friends and I rode motorbikes roughly 30 hours up to the Vietnam border and back to Hanoi, and the bikes had no problems at all (we rented the Future Neo and Future X). Flamingo gave us extra tools and parts and oil just in case something were to happen too. They also provided helmets for free and GPSs that you could rent. The prices were very reasonable. I would suggest bringing cash to pay your deposit, otherwise you will incur a 3% credit card fee (on top of whatever your bank charges). The people were friendly and very helpful, would definitely recommend to anyone looking to go on a motorbike trip.

Great rental company for motorbikes, no issues. I travelled with a group of friends to Vietnam and we decided to spend 3 days and 2 nights on our own "self-guided" tour up to Cao Bang and Ban Gioc. We went with Flamingo based on our hotel's recommendation. We had no issues at all with the bikes and probably travelled around 800 km on them. Flamingo made sure we had spare parts and their emergency phone number but it was never needed. With our group of 6 it did take about 90 minutes from initial office visit to being on our way so keep that in mind. For self-guided tours a deposit is required, but we were not aware that it would be given back in cash. In the US at least I am used to an amount being put as pending on a card, but it looks like that cannot be done in Vietnam. Not a big deal, but would just want to make others aware.

solo through mekong delta. I went solo through the south. i was going to head north from ho chi minh to hanoi but i didnt have time. i had only two weeks left on my trip through asia. at first i thought buying a bike was the way to go. but the problem was reselling it with limited time. as well, you never know what you get. so i found flamingo travels by chance on craigslist and man what a great service!!! they rented me a 2015 Lupin 125 ( a chinese dual sport with knobby tires!!!) that came with saddle bags and extra parts. the biked kicked butt!!!!! i think i did like 500 miles plus in 10 days riding... my whole experience was great. the lady in ho chi minh city was very kind (even helped me out with some Vietnamese language lessons ;)) as well as both the mechanics. i was a bit nervous about renting in vietnam, but they put me at ease completely. they guaranteed to pay or reimburse for repairs if i needed any. really the only thing i was worried about after i got the bike was the ho chi minh traffic( wow!!) anyway, i highly recommend these guys. thanks to them, i had one of the best experiences traveling ive ever had. (thanks tripadvisor for making me reedit this 4 times to family content)

Highlight of our trip to Vietnam - the best way to see the countryside!. My partner and I did a guided tour with Flamingo Travel and we would thoroughly recomend it to anyone who is looking to see rural Vietnam. We did the northeast tour (one of the shorter ones on offer), but would love to come back and do a longer tour.Our guide (Pinky) was excellent. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Would recommend!

Our adventure with Thanh Cong. If you are traveling to Vietnam, Cong is the absolute best guide. He is relaxed, comfortable, informed, and knows the country very well. He brought us to places that were amazing, and made our trip the very best! It was my lifetime dream to visit Vietnam, and Cong made it perfect. I can't wait to book my next trip with him!

Ten day independent motorcycle rental of North Vietnam in April. Excellent.
Everything we expected plus a lot more. It was an experience of a lifetime.
Nothing but praise.
Thank you Flamingo Travel.

Great motorbike rentals. I had no problems with my bike, and true to their word they have number that you can call with any problems outside of business hours. I met the owner, and he is very committed to his reputation and earning return customers. I'll look no further for motorbike rentals if I return to Vietnam.My only issue with Flamingo was the visa extension service the people in the office insisted on providing me. I needed a 5 day extension and they quoted me significantly more than another agency. I told them, "No thanks, it's much cheaper elsewhere." Without any real pressure on my part they dropped the price closer and closer to what I'd already been quoted (40 bucks). Finally they matched the price and I agreed to go through them. When I got my passport back the extension stamp stated the actual price of the stamp which was ten dollars. I realize that someone had to bring my passport to the immigration office and fill out a form, but 30 dollars? And grudgingly at that? This experience tarnished my otherwise great experience with Flamingo.

Cheap & cheerful bike tour!. Myself & my girlfriend went on a 3 day guided tour of the south West of Hanoi, First thing is first... you have to remember you get what you pay for. So if your expecting top of the range motorcycles, luxury hotels & 5 star restaurant food don't book one of these tours. But if your looking for a authentic vietnamese experience this is a must! By authentic i mean ride bikes like the vietnamese ride ... wear helmets that the vietnamese wear... sleep were the vietnamese sleep & of course eat were the vietnamese eat. We were guided though some fantastic landscapes by a extremely friendly & knowledgeable guide called Tan. We slept at reasonable hotels. all food, accommodation, some drinks & Petrol was included. I think your experience will depend mostly on the guide you get as you literally spend all 3 days with this guy! So i can recommend Tan! ask for him! As for the bikes they are reasonable, we didn't have any problems however they are aged / worn ect... but like i said you do get what you pay for & this was a very reasonably priced tour.

Straightforward Business. We had bought a motorbike from a backbacker. originally the bike was from Flammingotravel. We went there after our trip, they checked it, made a testride and bought it back. Owner speaks english and was straightforward. We had dealt with a lot of businesses in Vietnam and this was definitily one of the best ones. People which are buying chinese copy bikes for the cost of 10% of what a a similar bike in the western world would cost should accept and understand the limitations of quality. You get what you pay for. There are always some issues with these bikes, there is a good reason why you find mechanics everywhere in this country. If you go with a good company like Flammingotravel you can reduce your risk for problems with these bikes but generally dealing with some issues is part of the adventure in this country!

Rent motorbike in Vietnam. Thanks flamingo travel for the perfect condition of the bike, we drived 2755km without any problems !!! From nord to south Vietnam was à wonderfull experience !!! Jan and katleen

Expensive and malfunctioning. I never normally post reviews on tripadvisor, but I felt compelled to after the experience that my friend and I had with Flamingo. We bought two motorbikes from their office in Hanoi to drive down to Ho Chi Minh. We bought two Honda Wins for $410 USD each, primarily on the basis of the sales pitch from Flamingo (they employer westerners to stand out front and entice the tourists) that their bikes are better even if they do cost a little bit more. Our thinking was that we were willing to pay just a little bit more to ensure that we are able to get down to Ho Chi Minh on mechanically sound bikes. Being relatively new to third world bikes (we both drive bikes in Australia), we didn't spot many of the problems with the bikes when we inspected them and each time we came upon an issue, they played around with the bikes and found a quick solution. Reluctantly, we ended up taking the bikes, perhaps they saw a rabbit in the headlights as they was little scope of haggling with them. We started our drive to Halong Bay and we didn't even get outside of Hanoi before the bikes started failing. By of that day, it became apparent that the gearbox and the clutch on one of the bikes was so bad, that unless you kept it in 3rd gear or higher it would stall. This proved to be extremely dangerous on a number of occasions. On the same day, the key to one of the motorbikes flew out of the ignition whilst it was driving stranding us in the middle of nowhere. Long story short, we got in contact with a friend who is a local and he readily informed us that we had bought duds. Both bikes required extremely expensive engine rebuilds to make it down the country. By the end of our trip after talking to many locals and other tourists, it was apparent that we had paid well over the market rate for our bikes.While I should say that during their sales pitches, they are very friendly and appear to offer lots of help with things like routes, maps and wet weather gear. When we went to pick these things up, they were very reluctant to give them up.I would advise anyone considering buying bikes to do this trip look buy from anyone but Flamingo.

Great service, bike and crew. I rented a Honda XR250 for 2 weeks to ride across Vietnam into Laos and return. The team in Hanoi; Hoa, Thuy, Thuy and Hang where wonderful in communicating prior to the ride, had the bike serviced and ready to go. The bike was reliable, just right for the trip I undertook and I felt supported by having enough spares should I have needed them on the road. I've know the Flamingo crew for many years and am always impressed by the quality of service they provide; both with the bikes as well as advice and support in Hanoi. First rate.

Helpful staff. We rented a motorbike from Flamingo Travel for a week to travel the north of Vietnam. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. They gave us good tips and even had sim cards available so we could use Google maps on the road (essential!). The bike seemed to be small for the purpose but it was a tough 125cc that managed quite well with both of us and our stuff on the challenging roads of the mountain villages. We only had a small technical problem that they helped us sort out at a local xe mai. They gave us the money back straight away when we returned the bike.Definitely would recommend to others and would use again if we come back to Vietnam.

Great staff, great service!. Bought a motorcycle from that place and we had the best service ever. They were extremely helpful and managed to do everything they told us they would do. Paperwork is clean and we feel safe leaving Hanoï for our trip in the country. Would recommend to everyone.

Excellent motorbike trip with a very professional guide. My Dad and I booked a 6 day guided Northwest Vietnam motorbike trip from Hanoi to Sapa, we were joined by two others so had a group of four. In the lead up to the trip, Ms Thuy in the office was really helpful and very responsive to emails which was much appreciated.Pinky, our guide, was outstanding and really made the trip. I didn't have a lot of experience riding a motorbike but Pinky always made sure I was comfortable with the traffic and the speed, as he did for everyone in our group. He managed the trip so well by letting more experienced riders go ahead if there was a difficult bit of terrain, and I was really impressed by the way he managed to make sure that everyone was getting what they wanted to out of the trip. Pinky was working the whole time, throughout the days he was guiding us, giving us rain gear, giving us time to stop and take photos and making adjustments to our bikes and at the end of the day he was finding local places to take us for dinner, helping to pack and unpack our bikes and doing maintenance on them. Pinky really cared about everyone on the trip and making sure they enjoyed themselves, he was very funny but also very serious about safety.The only issue we had was that we had organised for our Mum to come up to Sapa and do a two day trekking tour with Flamingo before we arrived. This didn't really work out very well as it didn't seem to have been organised even though it was all confirmed, so there was a lot of confusion when Mum arrived in Sapa. This was disappointing and seemed out of character for Flamingo Travel, especially given the otherwise excellent level of service we received.Thank you again to Pinky for his care and professionalism on the tour, it was above and beyond and really made for a memorable trip.

Recommended. Just came back from a motorbike trip in Vietnam. Had a very good experience with flamingo. They have a 24 hour hotline. They sent a replacement bike to the nearest city when my bike broke down. Nice people. Recommended!

great trip in north vietnam. First of all, motorcycle trips in north vietnam are definitely recommended - almost any road you take has awesome views, and the people are very friendly. The XR250s that we rented were not new and understandably during more than 1500km over different roads/terrain had some issues - and here is the thing, Flamingo helped over the phone, talked to the local mechanics and took the support seriously for any issue that we called about. Which to my opinion is very important - you don't really want to be stuck 100s of km away with some problem and not getting that support. Which by itself is a reason to recommend Flamingo. Besides that, they are nice :) and you will get advice about the route.

stunning scenery. lovely people.. 8 days private trip to north vietnam, 4 ppl (xr 250). bikes where about 8-10 year old in a decent condition (but naturaly not without problems). all issues we had with the bikes were delt with promptly and fairly by hung (flamingo owner). the trip was an overall great experiance and is highly recommended!

Amazing Motorbike Rental Shop. I've used Flamingo Travel since 2006. Hung runs a great shop. He's personable and always looking to put the rider(s) first. His bikes, by my account, have always been in good repair. There's nothing 'hidden' in the rentals with Hung. My wife and I rode 1,000 miles together, her on her own Minsk. We're back in Hanoi, after seven years, to rent from Flamingo Travel again and get back to the great Vietnam North.In some of my previous rentals with Hung, I required some "roadside" assistance, and Hung was always a phone call away and quickly helped me solve my issue(s).I highly recommend Flamingo Travel.

Motorbike Rental - the north and Hanoi to HCMC. Renting/buying motorbikes in Vietnam can be a daunting prospect, so going with a good company can save you a lot of hassle and money. We started in Hanoi and had originally planned to buy bikes and then sell them on after we had been to the north and down to Ho Ch Min City. We were recommended Flamingos by Hanoi Backpackers. As soon as we walked in to the Hanoi office we were greeted by Chris (from England) and after an extremely honest and helpful (.....and long!) chat with him going over all the options, we decided to rent two 125cc Hondas @ $13 per day to explore the north (Central & East) for 6 days. The bikes were absolutely fine and we had no problems at all and were very happy with them. You definitely need at least 125cc for the north and some of the roads are tough going.We then also arranged to take up Flamingos' rental deal to go from Hanoi to Ho Chi Min. For $185 per bike you have up to 21 days to do the journey on a 110cc Honda Win (note pretty much all the Honda bikes are Vietnamese copies!), which is extremely good value. The bikes were noticeably not as solid as the bikes we rented for the north, but we soon got used to them. The roads to go south are mostly in very good condition though, so this was not really a problem. My girlfriend had no real problems with her bike the whole trip. I had to have the suspension and clutch disks replaced. The problems were easy to fix though and Flamingos' provide you with a useful selection of spare parts. They also provide a 24hr breakdown phone number, so if you have any problem you can call them and they can speak to the mechanic to establish the problem and importantly a fair price. Overall we were very happy with the service provided. We drove almost 3000km and to only have a few problems is pretty good for this price. Along the way we met many people who had bought their bikes (generally between $200-250) and they were in the mechanics on a daily basis with all sorts of problems. If like us you don't know much about bikes, renting from these guys is a really good option. It is in their interest to keep the bikes in good condition, whereas buying is a bit of a gamble. All the staff, particularly Chris and all the girls in the Hanoi office definitely deserve a mention. They were very helpful arranging to have our bikes put on a train to the north and generally giving helpful, honest advice. Thanks a lot...we had an epic adventure! Nick & Andrea, London

Great MotorBike rental place. We wanted to do a trip to Mai Chau but didnt want to pay the exorbitant cost to take the tour so we decided to do it on a motorbike and end up at this place.Their service is great and they even help us get to a gas station to fill up the bike.The motorbike was in very good condition and cost us 18 dollars for 1 1/2 days. They provided us with a map, helmets and a rope to tie our backpacks to the bike.They even recommended places to stay which is easy to find when you get there since there are a lot of HomeStays in the area.Good people and good service. Will use them again in the future for sure!

A wonderfull way to discover Vietnam differently. We booked a 2-day guided tour from Hanoi to Mai Chau with Flamingo for 2 persons on one 125 semi automatic bike. We really enjoyed it very much as we discovered a completely different aspect of Vietnam. Our guide, Minh, spoke English very well and was really passionate about making us see a lot of different places and small roads where we did not cross a single tourist.The sites were beautiful, preserved from any discomfort of intense tourist activities. We saw the real way people live in the small village of country side. It was a moving experience indeed.The bikes were in good shape and we ride them with no problem.The homestay in Mai Chau was great and far from the tourist village.Thanks to Minh we had warm exchanges with local people, something that would not have been possible on a self-guided tour. We also had thanks to our guide very interesting information about Vietnam and excellent meals everywhere we went!This was the best 2 days of our 3-week trip in Vietnam.

Motorbike trip Saigon (HCMC)/Hanoi. I did motorbike trip from Saigon (HCMC) to Hanoi in this October (2014). I bought Honda Win with Sufat engine (Vietnamese engine). I paid too much for the motorbike - 450 USD, usually it should by around 200-300 USD (maximum). I didn't want to pay that much, because I know all my Vietnamese friends will laught when I will tell them the price. But I got promise, that in Hanoi I will get 250-300 USD (depend on the condition of a bike when I arrive) back. I tried a few more bikes, but only this one was in my eyes good enought to take all the way. And it was. During the road I had no problem with the bike, except electronic starter (which I managed to repair with a friends help in Hoi An). Finally in Ha Noi, I little bit doubt that I can get full price, even the bike was still in a perfect shape (and I clean, change the oil, fix the chain and check again everything). But at Flamingo Travel, they positively suprised me. At the end we agreed on 280 USD for the bike, so very good deal. Guys at Flamingo are nice, friendly and from my experience trustworthy. I can definitely recommend.

Roadtrip. A buddy and I used Flamingo (Hanoi) to rent a pair of 4 stroke Minsk 125's with luggage panniers for a 2 week unescorted tour that ended in Ho Chi Minh City.I was initially very unimpressed by the 2 bikes they brought to the shop for us, as being an amateur bike mechanic myself, I was able to instantly tell that along the line someone without spannering skill had been let loose on these machines, as many of the nuts and bolts were rounded off. A few of the bike's electronics were broken, such as the high beams and front brake light switches, but everything else (except for both speedometers) worked.The bikes themselves were a bit tatty and had obviously had long hard lives, but the engines were sound and ran really well.I am happy to report that cosmetic concerns aside, both bikes covered over 1500 miles under our custodianship, and they both ran on and on without let up no matter what we put them through.Flamingo themselves were faultless. The lady that runs the Hanoi branch was very knowledgeable and drew us up the perfect itinerary, and arranged all our train transfers and bike transport (we took a couple of over night trains with the bikes due to distances involved) which went smoothly, and the agents that she arranged for us in other towns (Lau Cai and Hue) all came though for us without problem. We had to lay out $500 deposit for the bikes, which seemed steep as I wouldn't have paid that to buy one of them, and I was initially worried that the HCM city branch would try and stiff us out of it, but my fears were utterly unfounded. The HCM branch were quite literally stood outside of their shop waiting for our arrival on the day we were due to arrive, and after a cursory look at the bikes, they returned our deposits on the spot.In my travels around Vietnam, I found the people to be good, decent and honest and will go out of their way to help a traveler out. Flamingo travel embody this cultural ethos, and I have no hesitation in recommending them for your motorbike touring needs.Only the less than expected condition of the bikes keeps me from giving them 5 out of 5, and for information, the bike I used was the very same one in their main photo on this page, but it's looking a bit tired since this pic was taken, but it did the job so I can't complain to much.Here is a clip of me using the bike in the stunning northwestern highlands https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VsAp_kGzFCU

Very good prices to very good service. I wasnt quite sure where to go when I decided to travel with a motorbike through Vietnam. My schedule was fixed: I had about 20 days to drive from Saigon to Hanoi, together with my girlfriend and some luggage. Of course everybody should know that this is an adventure, which is unlikely to be topped easily. I hoped finding a suitable vehicle wouldnt be such an adventure with unknown risk etc. Flamingo turned eventually provided the safety that I needed. With a simple contract, which bonds you to a certain deposit in case you crash the vehicle, they let you go. Also, they give you all necessary knowledge whcih you will need for the tour. How to approach mechanics, what to do what to say, and a bag with most needed quipment, which is likely to replace, wrecked prior parts. I also required their telephone help twice, since mechanics often try to rip off - those guys negotiate over the phone with the mechanics in case of doubt, which will happen.One exceptional case made me happy about the enterprise. One day before we returned the Bike in Hanoi, we had a wrecked part in the back tyre, changing and parts cost me approx. 700000 Dong, which is 35 dollar and rediculously expensive, compared to usual prices ( 5 dollar for instance for a big job). As I called them, I said its one day left of my contract, so Iasked them to reimburse the money, which they did by 50 %, that was ..awesome! Not because of the money, but the principle, those things do not usually happen in Vietnam . (BTW I rented the bike in Saigon and returned without problems in Hanoi, thats part of the thing)So nothing bad to say. Really good , really happy ! :)

Excellent place to rent a motor-bike. Rented 2 400cc bikes for about two week to drive from Saigon to Hanoi. Can't compliment Flamingo enough. The bikes were in great shape, the staff was super helpful and friendly, and the itinerary they gave us was amazing. We got to see much of the country: small cities, large cities, villages, small roads, big highways, etc. Flamingo event shipped the bikes down to Saigon for us at a small fee so we could ride north instead of the usual south. I recommend these guys 100%.
I was all wunderful. It was an excellent experience. Staff was very helpful and charming! The bikes were in good shape and we didn't have any problems

Great Bikes, Service and Overall Experience. My buddy and I rented the Suzuki DRZ 400 and Honda XR 400 to ride from HCM to Hanoi. Very easy to set up the reservation from abroad as Flamingo was extremely responsive to emails. Bikes were ready and in great condition upon arrival. Staff in HCM gave us an excellent itinerary that was absolutely picturesque and avoided congested highways while being able to see beaches, jungles, villages and more. Staff stocked us with all necessary tools and parts but the bikes did not have a problem during 13 days of riding. Drop off could not have been easier or friendlier. All told, loved the bikes, the ride and Flamingo's top notch staff and service in both HCM and Hanoi. Highly recommend this company to anyone interested in renting bikes in Vietnam. Can't wait to show off my new Flamingo Travel shirt!

Perfect place to rent motorbike. This is the second time I've rented a dirt bike with Flamingo. The first time in HCM to drive to Hanoi on a Honda XR250. The second time in Hanoi to make a loop in northern Vietnam on a Honda XR400 with my girlfriend on the back.Both times have been great. In terms of bikes, service and the staff in general I'm really happy with what they've provided. They also gave good tips on where to drive to and which roads to take (or not). As they do guided tours too, they know exactly where to go.Would definitely rent here again when I come back.Thanks guys

Excellent dirt bike trek. Practically nothing to complain about. Professional excellent service at a great price, very friendly. The owner is definitely enthusiastic about what he is doing. Highly recommend for anyone wanting an adventure, we went without a guide but would the guides would surely be great.

Great staff, excellent service, very trustworthy.. I live in Hanoi and will definitely rent from them again. The motorbike was well maintained, the staff was very friendly (and spoke English), and they have a mechanic that will come out and help if the motorbike breaks down. They even gave me bungy cords to strap down my stuff and two inner tubes in case of a flat tire.

Great Place for renting a bike!. It was really easy with flamingo travel. After telling them that we want to travel for 12 days through the north of Vietnam they offered us two really good bikes for a good price. We didn't have any problems at all (just a flat tire). If there was, they offer a 24/7 hotline for emergencies which works pretty well!All in all: if you look for a motorbike in Vietnam, they are probably the best choice!

A great start to our Vietnam trip. Me and my partner Sam had been told that the best way to see Vietnam was on Motorbikes so we decided to do exactly that. We were recommend flamingo travel by two guys staying in the same hostel as us and told us that it was professional and friendly. We got exactly that when we met them ourselves an organised a 6 day hire for two bikes (one for me and one for my partner) we did North West where we would end our trip in sapa and catch an overnight train from lao cai to hanoi. The flamingo team helped us in more ways than one. We didn't realise there would be no ATM's in Muong Lay (although we were told there would be) and had no cash for our hotel. We contacted The flamingo team and they dealt with the hotel to sort out payment for the room, food and extra cash til our next ATM stop. On my second day I had a crash which resulted in a broken mirror. I felt so bad but the flamingo team told me not to worry and enjoy the rest of my trip. Also, we decided to stay in sapa for an extra two days and they were perfectly fine with it! Thank you flamingo team for helping us with our unique adventure though out the North!

Rescue and rental experts. I originally bought a motorcycle from a local in Hanoi so that i could ride West to Mai Chau and then up to Sapa. Along the way my bike broke down and could not be repaired.Hung and Chris at Flamingo arranged a replacement Honda XR250 motorbike to be shipped to Mai Chau where i was staying and then take back my broken bike. I rented a superb bike that was better than what i had bought.When i go tback to Hanoi i went to the garage to check out my broken bike. Whilst i was doing this, i saw them immediately stripping down the rental i had used to carry out a full service on the suspension, engine and wheels.I was very impressed with their services and ability to help me even though i did not originally use them. Their rental bike also came with basic tools, 2x spare tubes and other common to break parts for replacement if needed.5 star company and services. They have plenty of tours and rental bikes of all sizes available.

Loved it. Our Ha Long bay cruise was cancelled from a typhoon. Someone at our hotel just got back from a motorcycle tour with Flamingo and recommended it. Having seen the way people drive in Hanoi, we were hesitant, but decided it would be too great an experience to pass up. We took the 2 day/1 night tour to Mai Chau. What a fantastic way to see the sights of North Vietnam! Our tour guide, Pinky, was great. Our first stop was at his own home, where his wife made us a delicious traditional Vietnamese lunch. He made sure we were always taken care of and comfortable. We were loading him with questions throughout the journey, and he was very informative. Our accommodations overnight were at a Thai stick house. They made us dinner, and then some local villagers performed a dance ceremony for us. The bathroom and sleeping accommodations were rustic yet adequate, as we expected. I rode a Yamaha 235cc and it worked great the whole time. We experienced rain, but they provided all the rain gear we needed. I don't recall seeing a single tourist along our journey. If you have a sense of adventure, and want to see the beautiful sights of the north Vietnam countryside, you will not be disappointed.

Bad motorbike in Ho Chi Min. We have rented a motorbike in ho chi min!When we spoke with the girl at the agency she was very kind and of course she told us that their motorbike were perfect!The day after we left the hotel very soon and as we arrived at the agency, she gave us two plastic soft bicycle helmets!I tried to explain that we had to drive for 700km and that safety is the most important thing for us! She didn't wanna hear me and she was very rude with my girlfriend giving her some orders! As i quit the agency she came to me telling that they were going to buy a new helmet but threatening me that i had to repaid it as new if just a scratch has happened!After 20km the electric starter crashed and the back tire was flat!We came back to the agency, they made a bad short circuit and they said everything was ok even for the tire!We had to inflate the tire every 50km because it wasn't ok but perforated!After 300km in the middle of nowhere the motorbike stopped and i had to spend by myself some money to change air filter amd other parts that were very very old and no one gave me back my money!!!!!!That was our experiemce with them!If someone needs, I also have pictures of all parts while mechanics were changing!Excellent in HANOITERRIBLE in Ho Chi Min

Best two days of our holiday in Vietnam. We booked two tours with this company. Both times we were accompanied by the guide Tang. His English, knowledge and sense of humour really made our tours something quite special. My daughter had never sat on a motorbike before and my biking days were in the long and distant past but straight away, we felt well cared for and in the hands of professionals. We asked to see the real Vietnam and Tang understood exactly what we wanted. On the second tour, he and another rider travelled 2 hours to pick us up at our hotel and took us to Cuc Phoung. We had a brilliant ride there and then rode in to the centre of the park. Nothing was too much trouble or rushed. Learnt more about Vietnam in 2 days on the bikes than during the rest of our stay in this fantastic country. On both tours lunch was included and Tang found authentic places to eat.

Really professional. Really professional and helpful staff! Rented a motorbike there. The motorbike was in really good condition. Unfortunately I had an accident. The 24h assistance phone helpline really made my trip back to Hanoi much easier under such conditions. They were really fair as to the price of repairs. I highly recommend Flamingo Travel.
Excellence. All I can say is, you will not find a more professional company of its kind anywhere.The level of English is good, service is good, motorbikes are good; highly recommended.Terence

Motorbike Hanoi to HCMC . A late review but I owe it to the guys in Flamingo to pass on the good word. They did a superb job at all times. We rented 2 ybr125cc, a yamaha 125 scooter and a van with driver for our journey south. Despite experienced riders we had an unfortunate incident with gravel and one rider broke his hand. Flamingo were brilliant. They took the bike back, we paid fair and local rates for repairs and continued on our way. Honest, reliable and fair. Top marks guys. Shane

Amazing experience. We did a full-day motorbike tour of the Hanoi area with Minh and Hip (sp?) and it was a wonderful experience. Two of the adults rode their own bikes, while my 15-year-old daughter and I rode with drivers. A word to the wise: if you choose to drive your own bike, you won’t get much of an introduction to riding, and first thing you’ll ride across a crazy busy street to merge onto another crazy busy street. Not my cup of tea, but both my husband and friend who did it said at the end that although it was terrifying, they would definitely do it again.Our daughter rode with Minh, and he completely made the experience for her. He talked to her the whole time they were riding, telling her about Vietnam and what it’s like to live there, talking about what we were seeing, etc. She’s not a kid who warms easily to adults she doesn’t know well, but she was completely taken by Minh.We spent a little more time in Hanoi than we would have liked – I mean, right in the city. And I think the regular tour spends even more time in the city than we did, but we told Ming we really wanted to see the surrounding area, since we could see all the Hanoi sights on our own, and he was happy to oblige. I thought the motorbike aspect would be a little nerve-wracking, but after the first few minutes, it wasn’t scary at all. We went to a pottery village where we saw the “factories” (I use this term so, so loosely). We went to an agricultural area where we tasted some sort of fruit from the trees (I can’t remember what it was). And we visited the house/studio of an artist who happened to be home and was gracious enough to talk with us for a long time, give us a tour of his home and the grounds, and serve us tea. And we saw lots of the countryside, just seeing how people live day-to-day. The whole thing was an amazing experience.If we're lucky enough to make it back to Vietnam, we'd love to take a multi-day motorbike tour!

Fantastic way to experience the real Vietnam.. We signed up for a 3D/2N tour around northern Vietnam and were presented with an itinerary and guide that exceeded expectations. Our guide Minh had just developed a new tour that took us up mountains and valleys through the north where we passed by incredible views of country life. Both nights we stayed with local ethnic minorities, and were warmly welcomed into their stilt homes.The food was excellent and we tried fantastic "home-style" cooking. The sights were outstanding - we couldn't have asked for more. We went for hours and hours without seeing another tourist and were treated to the excited 'hellos' from children delighted to see a foreigner passing by.If you want to see a part of Vietnam that exemplifies the simple country life, Minh will guide you there. Minh was professional and helpful throughout. The only part of the tour that we found a bit tough to navigate was through some wet mud. But if you're OK with getting a bit dirty at times, then you're gold. Overall - I would recommend Minh and his tour for a unique and adventurous way to explore the incredible scenery, culture, and people of Vietnam. Thanks Minh! "Keep going, never give up!"

Day trip outside Hanoi. We had a good time with the team for our day trip to see the more rural areas outside of Hanoi. It was slightly challenging navigating the traffic to get out of town, but if you ridden a scooter before and are not too timid then it's a breeze. There is method to the traffic madness in Hanoi and it's not hard to figure it outWe are not mad motor bikers, but figured this might be an interesting way to see the countryside in slower time and enjoy some of the sights and we were right. We went to a pottery factory, a wood carving village and then out into the countryside where we had a great lunch and some nice riding along country roads. The bikes were fine, both automatic, albeit one sounded like it might need some attention soon. It didn't detract from the experience though and we had a fascinating day. Recommended for a slightly different view and a different pace of tours around this fabulous area.

great crew. Rented a bike, got on the Lao Cai overnight train. Headed to Bac Ha and had no problems with the trusty honda for the entire trip. Not even a flat tire. The crew checked in on me periodically to see if all was well. The road from Luong Phinh to Xin Man is not a road and not even a cow path. Beware its 35km of hell. Better suited to an off road bike. Worst road of the trip. Breathtaking scenery beyond Yen Minh through Meo Vac afterwards onto Bac Me and back to Ha Noi was typical.

Best help in distress. I will use this review to express My personal help and gratitude to the Flamingo crew at the time of My utmost distress.We were travelling upto Mai Chau from Hanoi late January 2014, unfortunately I got Myself involved into a freak accident and broke a few bones just short of Mai Chau. Since it was "Tet holidays" medical assistance didn't come by easy. I must compliment Flamigo team in Mai Chau for taking care and right guidance. They were instrumental in My transfer from Mai Chau to Hanoi (Also can't forget the dinner pack kept in the taxi for My broken journey back to Hanoi)Chris and team keep the good work on and thank You again. Love You Guys and will see You again

Excellent Guided Motorbike Trips. My husband and I went on a 5day 4night northwestern vietnam guided motorbike trip with Flamingo Travel. The staff are very helpful and professional from Chris and the ladies in the booking office to our tour guide Minh. The bikes were in excellent condition and our guide continued to check them during our trip as some of the roads are quiet rough. The scenery is fantastic and the only time we saw other tourists was when we reached our hotel each night. Minh found lots of great vietnamese dishes for us to try at every meal and explained a lot about the lives of the local people and his own experience growing up in Vietnam. If you are looking for a fun and safe trip to see the "Real Vietnam" I can't recommend Flamingo Travel highly enough.

Great trip with Flamingo. Our group of three did Flamingo's 6-day northern tour and had a great time.Booking via email was easy and upon arrival the final paperwork was quickly dealt with. We were then shown the bikes and upon our request some small adjustments to the bikes (mirrors, seats etc) were quickly carried out by the mechanics.We used a new Honda CRF 250, the Suzuki DRZ 400 and the Honda XR 400, we took the overnight train to Lao Cai and then eastwards from there.I have ridden quite a lot in Thailand and Laos but have hardly seen such breathtaking scenery as in north Vietnam, truly amazing and well worth the effort.Our guide was first class, he clearly knew the routes very well and also found us great food both for lunch and dinner no matter where we stopped.At one stage my clutch cable broke and the guide quickly went to fix it with the tools and spare cable he had with him, he was clearly prepared for this kind of stuff and upon our return in Hanoi the bikes were handed back without any fuss.This was surely one of the best trips I have done in south-east Asia and the service from Flamingo was excellent, if you are into this kind of adventure then I can only recommend them.my DRZ performed well and when at one stage the clutch cable broke the guide had the tools and spare cable with him to carry out the repair and tried his best but the cable routing on the Suzuki appeared quite tricky so we needed help from the local workshop after which all was fine

A honest business. I did the trip from Saigon to Hanoi with 2 friends. I rented a sufat 110 cc. They bought their bikes somewhere else. In the end I will probably have paid more. But I was the only one who drove a bike without worries, and repairs. And the only one with the confidence that my bike would last the full 3000km. It was ironic that I was the one who had the proper toolkit (provided by flamingo) and at the same time the one who didn't need it. Finally, and the most important thing to know: Flamingo is a honest business. It's easy to underestimate how important this is especially when you don't have experience in traveling or riding and maintaining your bike.

SevenMotorbike tour. Mr Hung, Pinky and the boys have done it again. And girls sorry!Can't really add more to what has already been said, but if every travel company conducted themselves with the same proffesionalism and attitude there would be a lot less whinging going on out there!

Off the beaten path, Hanoi to Saigon, by Tim Hughes, UK. Awaiting Chris McBride's arrival to provide me with info & discuss my plans I was told he was an "expert" here we go I thought!!Well let me tell you now. Not only is Chris extremely knowledgable on biking throughout the whole of Vietnam, he is an absolute Gent & went out his way to answer any questions I had, sorted me out with a map & helped me plan out my route, giving me contacts for accommodation along the way (that he knows personally) sorted me out with a Vietnamese Sim card making sure my data was up & running so I had Gps (an absolute necessaty as far as im concerned) after which we had breakfast together & swaped numbers so we could keep in touch along the way. Chris being true to his word called me regularly to see how everything was going. Now how's that for personal service!? As for the trip itself, guys do it, you'll see & experience things not in the guide book, and it will make your time in Vietnam a very personal one. But take my advice do it with Flamingo Travel. They also have a sister branch in HCMC with a great team ready to welcome you from your trip or gear you up to head north in the other direction.5* outfit for sure!!

Ride the Wave, baby. My girlfriend and I were interested in a 3 day, 2 night guided motorbike trip and Flamingo delivered beautifully. From the orientation on the bikes to allowing my girlfriend to ride on the back with the guide (I don't blame here, getting in and out of Hanoi is a bit like riding in a pinball machine), to taking us well off the beaten path, the experience was amazing.Hue, our guide, was incredible. Trying to drive (dodge & weave) and follow a map would've been too much for us. Besides, Hue took us down mountain trails that were on no map giving us an opportunity to see some breathtaking scenery. Hue's personal story combined with his local knowledge and fun-loving nature (though always making safety a priority) won us over.I'll definitely be back to do another trip, this time on a larger CC bike. That said, the 110 cc Honda Waves we rode were more than up to the task at hand.

The place to go for a bike tour.... Incredibly friendly staff, who were super helpful. We wanted a custom trip, sans guide, and they mapped out the whole 10 days for us. Had an incredible time touring N.Vietnam. Bike was reliable, plus they give a bunch of the most common spares and tools. Check this place out if you are considering any sort of motorbike trip through Vietnam. Prices were very reasonable.

Unforgettable experience. Fantastic tour, with the team from Flamingo. My Aussie friends and i had a terrific day out with the guys, taken off the beaten track. We wanted to go out of the comfort zone. Shared lunch & had a few beers . I would highly recommend this company , great value for money, made ever lasting friendships. A special thank you goes out to Hue , whose riding skills are exceptional. Who was always concerned that i was ok and hanging on!!! So glad that they were recommened to us, I wasn't real keen on bikes but after spending the day with Hue, I'm now hooked and will be back for a longer and new adventure. And hi to Chris who is also one of the crew.Cheers guys!From Wendy, Tracey, Di & Dean.

Exceptional Value & Service. I can personally recommend Hung, Pinkie, Chris and the team at Flamingo Travel.My three Australian friends and I had the pleasure of a five day tailor made bike tour into Nth West Vietnam. Our tour guide Pinkie took us to places where most tourists don't go or see and well away from the tourist traps to experience the true scenery and people of Vietnam. The service and knowledge these guys provide is fantastic. There are so many motorbike tour companies to choose from but I am so glad we found Flamingo Travel. They always went above and beyond to make sure we were safe and happy at all times.They must have a lot of customers but they go out of their way to make everyone feel like you are the number one priority. Thank you, you have given me great memories and will be my friends for life. Cheers Greg

Top Gear Trip. Like many we were inspired to scale Vietnam on bikes after watching Top Gear. We did very little planning and thought we'd do it all on arrival. Flamingo Travel were brilliant. They helped us organise the whole trip and gave details on: routes to take, KM that could be covered, dangerous roads, biking etiquette in Vietnam, rough petrol costs per KM, accommodation costs in towns. They even gave us a sheet of paper with useful phrases we may need on an A4 sheet of paper with the Vietnamese translation below, and told us to phone them if we got stopped by the police and were in a bit of bother.The bikes themselves were brilliant as well. We took out a Honda Wind, Honda Wave and a Honda Future. Had no problems with any of the bikes on the whole trip other than a couple of unavoidable punctures. Route we took was Ho Chi Min - Mui Ne - Nha Trang - Qui Nhon - Hoi An - Hue and then boarded a sleeper bus from to Hanoi with the bikes as cargo.Could not recommend Flamingo enough. Vietnam is full of people trying to rip you off in some way, but this company is run by genuinely nice people who want tourists to have a good time!

Flamingo Tours Hanoi - exceptional. October 2013 four Aussie mates did the Hanoi to Sapa tour. All communication prior to the trip was done by email and a deposit made. Attended the shop 3 days prior and sized up helmets and jackets (brought own gloves). Made instant friends with Chris and Hung (the owner) and shared a few meals and beers before heading off. Our guide was Pinky, an absolute champion of a bloke. Getting out of Hanoi was an incredible experience but riding our 4 stroke Minsks through the Vietnamese country side was unforgettable. Night 1 was a home stay with one of the best meals of our lives. Pinky introduced us to the local rice wine and the rest was history. Day 2 was even better riding around the lake until disaster struck. One of our mates came off his bike after hitting a dog. He managed to make it to Son La until we realised the full extent of his injury - a badly broken leg. This is where Pinky came to the fore. Son La is as remote as it gets. He got us to the hospital, went beyond the call of duty in getting us treated by various doctors, helped find crutches, arranged for us to get back to Hanoi and rang every day to follow up how we were going. He continued on with the trip to Sapa with two of our group and they had an excellent time.Arriving in Hanoi on the sleep bus Hung was there to meet us at the bus station. He got us into an alternative hotel. He took us to the hospital. He helped make arrangements. He showed genuine concern for our mates welfare. He visited us every day and couldn't do enough for us. We were having the time of our lives on this bike trip to Sapa (which I highly recommend) and Flamingo Travel in general were excellent. But both Pinky and Hung were outstanding when it came to helping out an injured and stranded tourist and customer. As a result I cannot recommend them enough. Both Pinky and Hung are men of outstanding character and their efforts in helping us will never be forgotten. If you are going to do a bike ride in northern Vietnam, go with Flamingo. You will not be let down.

See the real Vietnam. We had a one day tour with the flamingo crew and it was the most incredible experience. Going through villages with little to no touristy attractions allowed us to capture the essence of Vietnam. The riders were so experienced and I had full confidence in their abilities. They were attentive and courteous throughout the trip and their only concern was that we were having a great time. Definitely a highlight of my Vietnam holiday and I would recommend flamingo without hesitation. Next time we visit we will go to flamingo again but spend a 5-7 day trip to truly entrench ourselves in the Vietnamese culture. A big thank you to Hung and Hue. Hue you are an inspiration and a true joy to be around. Thank you for the wonderful memories

Ride it, it's different!. Excellent experience, very nice county and very nice people. We rented a Honda XL250 from Mr. Hung and toured Vietnam. It was a 12 day tour from Hanoi to HCM. Unforgettable Journey.

15 day north vietnam loop. My wife and I on our first overseas trip flew into Hanoi very green and nervous, we proceeded to get quotes from the local companies and stumbled on Flamingo. We opted for the highly reliable Honda XR 150 little bit more expensive than a minsk or a win but gave us comfortable hassle free trip. The honesty and openness of Mr Khang and Chris placed at ease and sealed the deal, nothing was to much trouble, they even rode my wife's bike 60 plus Ks out of the crazy city traffic. The guide accommodated my wife's riding capabilities and our food intolerances(fish) superbly, thankyou, hotels and homestays were great. New helmets, safety clothes, nothing was too much trouble. After our trip finished they just got better, helping with shopping even chauffeured by Mr Khang, suggested retail prices and true friendly advice not commission driven like others. I doubt they have much true competition. We are already planning our next trip, they are great ambassadors for Vietnam

Safe, honest and reliable.. Myself and 5 friends decided that we wwanted to travel from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh on motor bikes. 3 of us discovered flamingo and bought our bikes from there. The guys were honest avoit the state of all the bikes, let us know what repairs we would nee, all free of charge and even gave us spare parts to go with. Planned a route for us and helped us out with luggage transfer and helmets. Our other 2 friends decided they wanted different bikes and bought from a smaller private dealer and got ripped off completely. Both bikes broke down seriously and had to be left. One within 50 k of leaving and the other under half way. All bikes from flamingo have been faultless.

super!. Good tour, off the main (tourist) road to see the real vietnam. Good food, nice homestay (clean and good bed).Beautiful scenery, good offroading. Good bikes, reliable.Very good English speaking tourguide (Minh), ask for him.

Flamingo is the best!. Me and my partner wanted to do something different during our time in vietnam, and since we love riding motorbikes, it was an easy choise. We rented two honda 250cc at Flamingo and also wanted to rent safety cloathing. When they couldn't find anything in my size (i'm a size s girl) they actuallt bought a new jacket so i could use that one. They helped us whith planning a 6 day trip, and he told us all the good roads and places to stay. Since we didn't have time to ride the bikes to sapa they helped us with booking the night train for us and the bikes, and also droped the bikes on the train for us.Whenever we had a problem we could call them and they could allways help, even if it was just to translate something for us. I highly recomend flamingo to anyone, they are awesome in every way.

Excellent place to buy and ctd support. I fell compelled to recommend Flamingo to anyone who's looking to buy motorbikes in Vietnam for touring trips. The typical problem people find is that the bargain bikes are in bad condition. Our group used Flamingo in Hanoi and bought a Minsk motorbike from them as well as servicing other bikes with their mechanics before we left. Their level of work was excellent and moderately priced, which is reassuring instead of quick/cheap fixes.The best part of our experience was when we were 3000km into our trip and having some mechanical difficulties in Laos. The mechanics in Laos didn't understand our bikes and communication was terrible. The owner Mr Hung was amazing - I called him and with simple explanation of the bike's symptoms he narrowed the problems down to a few things and then talked to the Vietnamese speaking mechanic. Bish bosh bash we had bikes working well again. In summary you can save maybe $50 by trying to buy from another backpacker, but will lose money with repairs needed before you leave and on the road. You also avoid frustrating communication problems further down the road by having Mr Hung on call as support.

Look no further !. If you are looking for a motorbike tour while in Vietnam look no further !Hung and his staff will go above and beyond to make it a really special experience !Great bikes good value and fantastic people as well !One of the highlites of our trip !

hanoi to the NE then Saigon. Me and a mate hired 2 400cc trail bikes off Flamingo to do this trip. They couldn't have been more helpful. Helped us with transport to Hue as we were running out of time and came to our hotel to take the helmets,keys in Saigon. If only they could've done something about the suicidal tendencies of the local drivers it would've been a dream! V easy to deal with. Highly recommended!

super helpful. i can't rate flamingo highly enough for turning our idea into reality.... we told them what we wanted and the catered exactly to our need.... one way bike hire to Sapa over 4 days. sending the bike back on the train and sending our luggage to us in sapa. we actually changed our plan 2 days in and they quickly helped us book ourselves onto a train back to hanoi. when the bike made an odd noise we took it to a local garage, called Hung, who actually knew the guys at the garage and spoke to them himself... the bike was fixed while we ate pho next door!we had a brilliant trip, and would use flamingo again.

Hanoi - Ho Chi Minh Road Trip. We decided we wanted to ride from Hanoi to HCM on motorbikes and did some research on the best way to do it. The most common way seemed to be buy a bike in Hanoi and sell it in HCM. We didn't really favour this option as not knowing too much about motorbikes we didn't know what to look for in a good bike and also didn't want the hassle of having to sell the bikes again in HCM.Flamingo provide an excellent alternative to this. The people at the shop were really helpful, even suggesting a route and list of places to stay.The guys at the garage were equally great, giving us some practice on the bikes before we set off and giving us confidence in the bikes. We had a few hiccups on our journey but this was our doing not that of flamingo (punctures, getting lost, rain storms!) in fact we were confident in the bikes and Flamingo for the whole period.On arriving in HCM after a couple of hours riding in the traffic we found the hotel and were finished with our trip.A quick call to the HCM branch to give them our location ad they came to check over our bikes and collect them.This was an excellent service with documents and deposit returned readiily. My bike had some damage from a fall which resulted in the loss of a small amount of the deposit but this was very reasonable and fully justified.Over all I would highly recommend Flamingo to anybody who wants a bike but doesn't want the hassle of buying and selling one, also having confidence the bike has been maintained in good working order. Nice powerful bikes too!Over all loved them and couldn't recommend them more.

Gotta ride a motorbike in Hanoi. This one-day tour was great. DId not have time for multi-day trip but this tour took us in HN traffic, in the country side, hand-mde ceramic, prints, villages, etc. Stopped at local resto fo lunch. There is no doubt that we would have not seen these places if we had not taken the tour.Not recommended for someone who never rode a motor bike but a must for all others.

AWESOME!. We did the North West with Hue as our guide and I have to say these guys come highly recommended! The bikes were perfect for the journey (XR250's) well maintained and with Tien as our mechanic for the 8 days we had no problems. Flamingo are by far and away THE best value for money trail bike tour company in Vietnam. They look after every detail and make your journey very special, thanks guys.Pete Cockram Adelaide Australia

Fantastic!!. So it started in Ho Chi Minh City from the branch office, we rented 4 Honda wave RS 110cc. All of them were in good condition. We set out on the journey to Hanoi. The bikes did not miss a beat. 10 days after we set off we arrived with no problems from any of the bikes even after so long hot days of non stop riding. After this we went to Sapa on 2 Honda XR250, They booked us on the over night train and changed the flight for the girls. They also took us to a snake restaurant stayed there for 2 hours. Amazing service.. Above and beyond!! Needless to say the XR250's were amazing on the mountain roads around Sapa and the north of Vietnam. Thank you Flamingo travel

We just rented some awesome bikes. We rented 3 Honda xr 125, two of which were expanded to 150ies as we had two on them and it cost $25 a day per bike, we did a four day track in North Vietnam and it was one of my things to do before I die so I loved it. The bikes were fantastic and they gave us a quick course in maintaining the bike and fixing tyres, gave us tools and spare parts and tubes all just in case lucky we didn't need. The guys there were also very helpful

Crazy mad adventure!!!!!. If you're after a proper adventure, I'm sure you'll enjoy a trip with Minh and hue!!!We travelled 5 days from Hanoi to sapa then back to Hanoi on the overnight train.Everything was well organised and our trusty xr250's didn't miss a beat...The scenery was amazing, the locals very friendly and the whole experience left us talking about it for weeks after we arrived home!!!So much so I'm going again in October!!!!!To Minh and hue, see you soon!!!!!

Great Great Bike Rental in Hanoi!. Recently rented 2 offroad motorcycles for myself and my buddy.Toured the North-Eastern region of Vietnam from Hanoi to Sapa and back.Mr Hung (the owner) will personally check your bikes before you move.They remembered who you are when you turn up (I turn up one month after paying the deposit) and it seemed they have a good system! Impressive!The bikes condition were simply good! It handled the route safely.(The roads can get really treacherous!!!)No breakdowns, no drama - JUST RIDE.And a phonecall away, you will get asssistance SHOULD you encounter any problems, Mr Hung and his team will be on standby and me being a control freak, I NEED THAT.Flamingo performed to my high expectactions and I surely recommend them to anyone who wanna do the Vietnam bike tours (guided or unguided, I took the latter)GREAT EXPERIENCE!!

Great Reliable Rentals. Thank you Flamingo for the hire of your bikes for our recent trip of Nth West Vietnam. It was an absolutely fantastic time. Your bikes travelled well and everything went to plan. Great roads and places to visit...apart from the road construction over 60ks from Sin Ho to Lai Chau....now that was a ball banger.Thank you so much for all your prep and great service and thanks to your staff for their help..

upgrading my motor bike with ALU Xplorer Koffer-/Topcase hepco becker. I asked the garage of flamingo travel to weld a rack to attach the ALU Xplorer Koffer-/Topcase Series from hepco becker.They were able to do this as perfect as you could think of.The rack looks as the original one. Now any tour with the future will be no problem with any lugage.Thanks a lot

Great Moto Rental central in Old quarter. We compared the biggets copanies, but this one looked good and had BEST PRICE:
VEry helpfull people, good service and we had a reliable moto!

Hired a 125cc Minsk and didn't have to leave my passport!. Myself and girlfriend hired a Minsk off these guys for an 8 day trip up around Sapa and Bac Ha and back to Hanoi. The thing I really liked was we left an amount of cash as security and not our passports, I don't remember the amount but it was reasonable and felt much better than handing over a passport. Flamingo were helpful and professional and they even put an extra rack on the back of the bike for our bag, they gave me advice for the bike and riding in Vietnam and took me to the gas station to show me which oil to get and how to mix it up. All in all the bike was great, but one day the gears started to play up until it wouldn't change out of second. We stopped at the first mechanic and they pulled it apart, welded something and put it back together in about 40 minutes, it cost us less than $10 USD and we were on our way again, great fun. I think it was a couple of dollars more expensive per day to rent from these guys, but for us it was worth it.

One of the best motorcycle rental places on the planet !!. Hung was recommended to me from a guy I found on Craigslist . Small world . We got an xr250 Honda dual sport and love love loved it . Fun ride to sapa . And fun zoom thur Hanoi . We have a bit of a spill ( driver error ) Hung was understanding and more than fair about it !! Wish we could still keep riding !! They have small bikes scooters and guided tours or go out in the 1000 deep scooter traffic on your own , we did and was super fun , just get in the flow and ride slow ,

Great bike, friendly staff and trustworthy.... Rented a Xr250, an it did the job well for the 16days I had it.. know problems with the bike at all, but probably should have gone the 400 as it was a little hard to pop monos on the 250... HahaStaff was really friendly and gave me good ideas in where to go...I did 2000kms in 16days and was sick for 2....Good trustworthy company...

Couldn't be any easier. I live in Sydney Australia and wanted to ride from Hanoi to HCMC after seen the top gear episode on tv. I did it and it was so simple with the help of flamingo. I choose them because they let me pick up in Hanoi and drop of at HCMC something that no one else would let me do. They were super fast in replying to my emails and help full beyond belief. Because of the distance I was doing the bike I was given "a Honda future X" was in perfect condition and was trouble free all the way. They even arranged accommodation for my time in Hanoi and gave me maps routes address and phone numbers of people and places to stay along the way. If you need bike riding gear they will sort you out with that also, I got mine of them as it saved me carrying it with me before I got to Hanoi. I don't know about the tours that they do but if your doing a trip by yourself don't waste your time looking around for days like i did and just call these guys because they will sort EVERYTHING and take the worry out of it all for you. As for what it cost, well that was just a joke, form memory "cause it was June 2012 when I done my trip" for the hire for 2weeks and leaving it in HCMC and getting them to arrange putting it on the train back to Hanoi it was about $200 AUD "It would cost you more to not wear your seatbelt in Sydney for 2mins"Honestly they are champions. If I can be of any help to any future guys doing the same you can get me on +61424236525 or seanocillin@me.com

Scooter Hire. I haven't reviewed many businesses in Hanoi as excellent in the 12 months of living here but Flamingo deserves it. While I haven't been on any of their tours my girlfriend and I have hired scooters from them for around the city over a number of months before eventually buying some. Mechanically they were faultless and were still subject to monthly services that kept them ship-shape. Flamingo aren't the cheapest in the city, however they are the best value, as they offered sound safe motorbikes but more importantly an excellent understanding of customer service. I was unlucky to be involved in an accident (not on their bike) and was unable to ride my hired bike for 2 weeks - they allowed me to extend the hire period to allow for my time 'out of action' at no extra charge. They were also understanding and trusting when I turned up a week late to pay one month because I'd got my weeks mixed up.Unlike many motorbike businesses elsewhere in Vietnam and Asia they are honest and make pains to deliver good service, instead of many other businesses that try and rip you off for imagined scratches etc.

Hanoi to Sapa. This was simply the best activity I've ever done!I arrived at the Flamingo office the night before just to check everything was in order for the trip to Sapa the following day. I was greeted with "Hello Mr. Carl" (as if he knew me already) everything was in order so the next day we set off.The Flamingo Travel team helped me fit my GoPro camera to the bike and we were off, cutting through the crazy Hanoi traffic.My guy, Son, was very cool. Very good English, very knowledgeable about the local areas and a great guy to boot!The first night Homestay was so good, got quite pissed on the banana flavored rice wine, it was clean, hot showers, great setting on the lake. And because it was only Son, myself, the homestay family it was truly memorable experience with just the four of us. The food was great and there was plenty of it.The next day we headed up to Sapa, spent the night there in the hotel that Flamingo Travel had organised which was awesome.The following day we headed around the villages in Sapa then headed off to get the night train from Lao Cai back to Hanoi.In summary, great guide, great company, good bikes and a very special experience. Highly recommended.

Amazing bikes. I was very nervous at first to attend the nothern loop alone during the rain season, especially the part ''getting out of hanoi''. However, a guide took me out of the city for 15$, a good investment for staying alive.I have no knowledge at all in repairing mechanical problems, but I never had any issue with the motorbike (future neo). No flat, no motor-breaking. The bike conditions were perfect when I rented it and, even if I would of have any problem, I knew I had 24/7 assitance. This is without condition the biggest higlight of my trip. The scenery is as beautiful as Halong bay and the feeling of driving in these mountains are truly awesome. If you have 10 days, I suggest you to do Dien bien phu - Sapa - Hanoi. If you have some more days to spare, you should definitly continue after sapa to Ha giang, then to Cao bang. Do NOT get to Cao bang by Lang son. The roads are in bad conditions and very boring and this is the only part of my trip that I regret. Prepare yourself to see no other tourist, except for Dien bien phu and Sapa.

More than I expected. Hello my name is Bernd and I am from Germany. I was very unsure about getting on a motorcycletrip around Vietnam because of all the scams going on in Hanoi. By accident I went to Flamingo travels. At first I was a little suspicious cause that's just who I am. I don't like getting ripped off. But my concerns went out of the window when I met Hue. We talked about the trip and and all the alternatives and then I booked a tour around the north west. It was awesome. This is not some agency just looking for your money. They really take care of you and my 250 Honda was just perfect. They have a workshop for their bikes working 24/7 to make sure you have a reliable bike. I do not want to go into detail about the tour because it would just be too much but when I had a flat tyre we had everything about to fix it. I was very impressed by that. When you book a tour ask for Hue as your guide. He is a little too careful at first but once he realises that you can ride he trusts you and he gives you more space if you want to. But he will always be at your side and help you or order food for you or whatever. He knows a lot of local people too so if you like travelling of the beaten track like me he is your guy. I know this sounds probably like some faked recommendation cause it sounds too praising but trust me, this is the agency to go to. Have a save trip

Minsk riding through Vietnam. I have just completed an 11 day tour of northern Vietnam on a Minsk motorbike, courtesy of Flamingo Travel in Hanoi.What an amazing experience. It would not have been the same had i done it either by car or on a different bike. Flamingo Travel had updated the Minsk from a 2 stroke to a 4 stroke engine and it more than coped with everything that Vietnam had to offer. It did break down once, but Flamingo were on it and sent the spare part right away and refunded me the labor charge upon my return to Hanoi. They were kind and courteous and very helpful. I would definitely recommend them and use them on my next trip back here.

Absolutely epic ride!! Not to be missed!. I have to say, hands down, the most awesome ride ever! Everyone visiting Vietnam should take a ride through the north. The most amazingly stunning scenery and friendly people. It's safe everywhere, there is no problem finding petrol and everyone is a mechanic! Flamingo travel, and Hung in particular, was perfect. Good advise on everything, affordable and was there to take calls anytime we had an issue. We took a Honda 250 which was perfect.Marco

Honest & reliable. Hired a 125cc bike off these guys to travel to the far north of vietnam for 16 days and I have to say the bike I rented was the most hassle free/reliable bike that I have rented out of the 4 times I have travelled in Vietnam.These Guys also have some great travel ideas and give you good honest advice.Well worth paying a couple of dollars more to have piece of mind,safety and no breakdowns.Well done & thanks to all at Flamingo Travel
