It’s definitely worth it to ride with Frank, and if I’m riding in Vietnam again (probably from Hanoi all the way to HCM city), he is the person I’ll go to.

4 Day motorbike tour of north Vietnam. We undertook a four day tour riding from Hanoi to Sapa & I highly recommend our guide Frank (a.k.a selfie!). He made sure we saw the real Vietnam meeting with local people in their homes away from the usual tourist traps & was extremely knowledgeable, highly entertaining & made the whole experience a journey to remember. Thank you Frank we have some wonderful memories & photos.

The best way to discover Vietnam . If you have an adventurous spirit and want to create an unforgettable experience you should definitely go with Franck and his motorbike discover the wonders of Vietnam ! I spent 2 days with him on the road to Sapa in the mountains and it clearly was the highlight of my trip. Franck is a positive person, always smiling, always trying to help you in any situation possible and of course very friendly and funny. I had a lot of fun with him and I really got to see the local people, stop at their house to have tea, we also stopped at every beautiful see sight to take a picture and he made me feel really safe on the road (I had never had a motorbike before in my home country). He created a beautiful memory for me and I am sure that he will do the same for you too ! I now have a really good friend in Vietnam and this is priceless. Thank you Franck for everything you are an amazing person ! :)

To the Village and Back on a bike.. The experience was awesome and authentic Vietnamese village feeling. Frank was a good friend and very easy to get along, he went out of his way to make feel welcome and at ease.The bike was okay the views even better, if you can get the 125 cc you get value for money.Good trip and I would recommend this to anyone psyched about touring on bikes, the only downside was that I had limited time to tour more on the bike.Asante sana Frank

Tour de Vietnam. I heard about VMR from one of my friends in Seattle who has worked in Vietnam for a number of years. I've traveled to many other countries but I'd never been to VN before and so I was a little apprehensive. Vuong and his wife met me at the airport and made be feel welcome and relaxed the minute I got off the plane. Vuong's English is amazing - especially given that he's never been outside of Vietnam - and his energy and laugh are infectious. He and his wife escorted me to my hotel in the Old Quarter and then took me out for some street food straight away. While getting over jet lag, they showed me all around Hanoi - introducing me to various artists, cafes, and eateries. Afterwards, they took me on an incredible journey around North Vietnam: Ha Long Bay, Hung Yen province to visit their family, Sapa, and so on. It was clear that he had researched all the places we stayed in advance and showed me many things along the way that were very special and unique. It was one of the best trips I'd ever been on and would obviously highly recommend VMR to others. I always felt safe, well taken care of, and learned an incredible amount in such a short period of time - 10 days.

Fantastic tour!. We really enjoyed the night time food tour where our friendly guides took us to places we would never have managed to find on your own. You really got to live like a local the entire night! Highly recommended!

Great fun, great people and LOTS of food!. Booked this tour after a recommendation from a colleague and was not disappointed! Frank and the the three girls were very friendly, great tour guides but most importantly lots of fun! We stopped fro delicious egg coffee, saw some great sites that we would never have seen otherwise and ate delicious local food in local places that again we would never have know to go to. Not to mention that Frank refused to leave our glasses empty!A great way to see the city with only limited time available.Much fun, lots of memories and highly recommended!

Fantastic experience - private motorbike tour!. Frank truly made sure that we were able to experience as much as possible in the short time we spent in Vietnam. He speaks excellent English, is such a kind and genuine man, is SO knowledgeable, and treats everyone like family! Frank went out of his way to ensure that we had the best experience during our trip. We went on a private evening motor bike tour where we were able to see much of Hanoi and eat at the absolute best restaurants until we could eat no more! Along the way, we made several stops to see sites, take pictures, and listen to Frank share a wealth of information with us. We felt so safe the entire ride, had an absolute blast, and left Vietnam with wonderful memories, all thanks to Frank!

Vietnam wouldn't have been the same without Frank. My girlfriend and I went to Hanoi, Sapa and Halong Bay in Vietnam. I can't imagine our trip without Frank. We were honestly anxious about the language barrier the food and the safety but he put all our concerns at ease almost immediately. His hospitality is only outweighed by his kindness. He went out of his way to make sure we had the best time possible. Our ride was great - felt very safe the entire time and had a great time exploring the city. We went to every must see spot but nothing that you would ever read in a guide book. Had the most amazing food - saw the real culture of the different parts of Hanoi and Vietnam and had a huge advantage on all other tourists that didn't have someone that spoke the language. Frank was able to upgrade our hotel,cruise train car versus what we would have paid anyway. He was sensitive to my inability to eat seafood and made sure at every restaurant we went to that we had the best (even sending things back when the freshness wasn't up to his standards). Lastly I cant say enough about Frank's positive mentality and warmness - he is the kind of person you meet for 5 minutes and you immediately would feel safe letting your kids stay with. I hope others have the opportunity to meet frank and enjoy his services. I highly recommend!!

Great experience with a local's insight!. Frank and Elly treated us like family on our recent visit and I could not be more satisfied! I had never ridden a motorbike before but learned quickly and had the time of my life! Frank arranged great accommodation and took us to the best places to eat.

Learning to ride a motor bike in Hanoi. had a great day with these guys who taught us how to ride bikes in a safe and quiet location for a couple of hours before setting off to Bat Trang for the day. Bikes were great and the guide, Frank, was super friendly and patient. Amazing day and experience.

Vietnam Motorbike Rides - Amazing Experience. It was an adventurous experience for the both of us. Thanks to Vietnam Motorbike Rides Team, it was so much easier. Frank sent the bike to us to our hotel and the Motorbike was in excellent condition.  The bike did not give us any problems what so ever.You must be brave enough to ride a bike in Vietnam....nevertheless it was a wonderful and adventurous experience.Thank you once again to Vietnam Motorbike Rides Team!!! Kudos Frank!!!

Immerse in local Vietnamese culture. Frank and Elly are superb and full of enthusiasm! They are more than just guides, they are great friends! There was never a dull moment with them. It's interesting to hear about their personal stories and about Vietnam history and culture. And not forgetting the countless wefie we took together! I'm really glad that I managed to sign up for this day-long tour in exploring the scenic countryside and visiting places which I would otherwise not have been able to. We went to several temples and pagodas, had delicious sticky corns and drinks along the road (see picture), was warmly welcomed with a savoury lunch at Frank's relatives, toured the ancient village of Duong Lam and tried some local snacks at one of the remaining historical homes. Overall, it was a truly fun-filled day with Frank and Elly. What a great trip through the countryside and a chance to experience a rural lifestyle. Definitely a wonderful experience raw and real! Get out there, see the world through the eyes of the locals. Thanks Frank and Elly for such a wonderful time together!

The most amazing motorbike experience with Frank!. Before signing up for the tour, I had no idea what to expect! However, by the end of the day, I was completely amazed by Frank and elly (his co guide) for their constant ability to go the extra mile to ensure we got the best experience possible!The day stated off with frank coming to pick up us at our hotel and then moving out to the countryside with me riding pillion behind frank. I couldn't have felt more safe with frank at the controls as he expertly navigated through Hanoi's streets.Once in the countryside, frank brought us around to view different temples and pagodas where elly then explained to us the history. For lunch, we visited Frank's relatives to have an awesome lunch (see picture)! After awhile, frank allowed me to have control of the bike while he rode pillion back to Hanoi! It was a most amazing experience that I won't forget! Thanks frank and elly for the best experience and hope to see you again soon!

Day-long private tour of Hanoi and surroundings. My 19-year-old son and I spent three-and-a-half days in Hanoi. I am a novice rider and my son was an absolute beginner. Frank spent several hours with us the day before, making sure that we both felt comfortable on the bikes. We spent the next day visiting various sites in and around Hanoi with Frank and Elley, one of his top guides. We saw and did far more in that one day than in the other two-and-a-half. Both Frank and Elley speak excellent English and were extremely knowledgeable about the city, the country and their history. They steered us to restaurants and sights that we would never have found on our own and explained the ways of Hanoi and its people with great humor and insight. Being on a motorbike allowed us to see a lot in a short period of time. And slipping in and out of the river of motorbikes that pulses through the city made us feel much more a part of its life. Thanks Frank and Elley!

unforgettable tours. Touring with Vietnam Motorbike Rides is a unique experience and one that you will struggle to match. Mainly due to the amazing tour guide that is Frank. Frank is a one of a kind, he has an amazing knowledge of everything he shows you and is always willing to go the extra mile to make your trip special. If there is anything you think you might want to try whilst on your trip then Frank is your man. It doesn't matter what it is he will get it for you.

Best tours in Vietnam!. Having never ridden a motorbike or scooter before this trip, my friend and I were apprehensive before leaving. Looking back, it was certainly for nothing. A few days before, Frank took us for lessons to show us how the bikes worked and allowed us to ride until we felt comfortable. It really wasn’t an issue when following him from behind. For the two days we were on the tour I saw some of the most beautiful countryside and interesting goings on I have ever came across. It is truly stunning and something to rival anything in the world. In regards to seeing the local life in Vietnam, Frank showed us that. Small fishermen catching fish almost by hand, watermelon farmers, locals in the rice fields. It all felt authentic and real. It wasn’t a show. Frank showed us how these people were really living. He’s an excellent tour guide and this is something you can tell he’s genuinely passionate about.The place we stayed couldn’t be faulted; nor the food; nor the people who were there. It was superb. And the evenings entertainment was a good laugh.All in all, a fantastic two days and I couldn’t recommend it more.

I had such an awesome time! Thank you. :). I had a wonderful time in Hanoi, Vietnam, and a lot of it had to do with meeting Frank and going on some motorbike tours with him! I didn't however ride my own motorbike because I didn't feel comfortable enough with my riding skills, especially since I've never been on a semi automatic bike where the brake is by the foot. Nonetheless, Frank was very helpful, so initially when I wanted to try riding a motorbike, Frank picked me up at my hostel and we went to an area closeby so that I could practice. I decided after riding for a bit that I'm not confident enough, so instead I went on a country side tour of Hanoi with Frank, while sitting at the back of Frank's bike. I had a really lovely time. We went to visit a pagoda, and although we didn't get to spend too much time there due to time, it was still a nice and peaceful place to visit. We then rode to another village and ate some delicious local food. I enjoyed my experience of riding with Frank because he's such an awesome person, and I really believe that experiences are so memorable and wonderful when shared with others (although I have great experiences while being on my own too haha). I went on two other tours with Frank - the street food tour, where I was stuffed and stuffed until I had a food baby! But my goodness the food was so delicious, and I definitely would not have eaten the food I ate if it weren't for the tour. Locals always know the awesome local food. And I also went on a Hanoi city tour which was nice because I saw more of the city centre, and it's just faster to see everything via motorbike. Plus I was riding behind Frank, so I didn't have to worry about the traffic or watch out for cars, people, bikes, etc so I felt relaxed and could enjoy the views of the city. I would highly recommend one or more of the many tours Frank and his company offers! There is a lot of professionalism, and I was treated like family :). Thank you so much for making my time in Hanoi very enjoyable!!
A new experience. This is probably a new kind of experience for me when I finally get to visit Vietnam. On my bucket list for sure :-) :-)

The only way to see Hanoi. My boyfriend and I went for a day's ride in the countryside with Mr Frank. We met the previous day for an hour practice, as I wasn't the most confident of riders, but Mr Frank was extremely supportive and made sure that I was comfortable before our day's ride - I didn't feel pressured to do anything I didn't want to do. Mr Frank gave us helmets and knee/elbow pads and gloves, so we felt pretty well kitted out. I would recommend wearing long sleeves/trousers as well as it can get a bit cool on the bike in the wind.On the day itself, we set off early at about 7.30am to try to miss the traffic. Hanoi may seem chaotic, but actually I never felt like it was dangerous - everyone is driving quite slowly and watching out for one another. We set off into the countryside to look at some stunning pagodas - it felt like we were really heading off the beaten path. Just driving along countryside paths was a huge part of the experience.We really appreciated the frequent stops we made during the day - stopping at places we would just never have stopped at! Mr Frank gave us lots of different types of Vietnamese food and snacks to try, which just added to the experience. We had a superb lunch with his relatives in a small town, and he was a real pleasure to talk to. We felt like good friends after our trip!!All in all, it was a fantastic day and a real highlight. I think it'll be one of those days that I look back on and go "wow, I went motorbiking in Vietnam!". It was fantastic as well that Mr Frank acted as our own photographer on the day - we didn't take any valuables out with us, so to have photos for the memories is really special. Thank you Mr Frank!
Nice trip. i want to do it once morejust i may do it every yearno way to forget the smile they od it on your face

(Vietnam Motorbike Rides Tour To Ha Giang 7 Days). We found Vietnam Motorbike Rides Tour on Trip advisor, and we dicided to contact directly Mr Frank Luong, We did a 7 day tour, seeing the north east and north west part of Vietnam with amazing people and our amazing tour leader guide Mr Frnak Luong.It was by far the best part of my holidays. Even if we was travelling, we felt like with my family the whole time. We have explored parts of the country with almost no tourists, and an amazing sightseeing. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Thank you to Mr Frank Luong and your team for making to us the wonderful memories

Great Motorbike Tour Of Hanoi. We found Vietnam Motorbike Rides Tour on Trip Advisor, and we are decided to book directly with them, Mr Frank Luong really excellent tour guide leader, friendly and has full knowledge to show us the hidden charm of Hanoi, truly good way to get experience about Hanoi by motorbike tour and specially about traffic. Motorbike tour gave me the chance to know how Hanoi people live and treat, they are very kind, and my guide is also friendly and has full knowledge. Good driver for me and safely tour, even traffic in Hanoi was crazy. Thank to Frank Luong and his team for the wonderful memories

Excelent days with Frank in Vietnam. I have to say that my expectations were high, since if you join both Vietnam and motorbiking sounds extremely good. But after the 2 days trip to Mai Chau, Monk Chau and the Lao border, I have to say that I am really impressed.Also I have to say that travelling with Frank make the things easy. He is very flexible, open and kind. You always feel that he manage every situation..I highly recomend not only for friends and familiy but for business people who have to spend the weekend in Asia. This was my personal case... Next time I will go with him to the cost..

Great Experience with Mr Frank!. I was greeted by Billy at the Hanoi airport by his smiling face, warm greetings and amazing attitude towards my adventure ahead. My motorbike trip with Billy was to a place called Mai Chau. The trip was an amazing experience which provided me the opportunity to see beautiful country of Vietnam. I was constantly provided with the opportunity to use restrooms, have superb vietnamese cuisine and interact with locals. Our home stay was wonderful example of life in the area and was beautifully located near some rice fields with mountains as our backdrop. I definitely recommend this tour for anyone who wants to witness the beauty of the vietnamese landscape.
19 days trip with Loung (Mr. Frank). We had a great time in Vietnam with lots of fun. Loung did a very good job to take care of us and we saw many interesting things.
Superb Service. We really enjoyed the service provided by Frank.. Highly recommended for everyone.. Don't miss out on this one. Esp Frank as a guide was very helpful and friendly

Great tour of hanoi and halong bay . We bought a tour to halong bay from here, it was great everything was as planned and the activities were fun.
Also frank took us around hanoi for street food and it was great, we got to try some of the best Street food places. Totally recommend it.

Great Evening Tour of Hanoi. It is always great when a tour guide turns up early, sits you down, asks you what you want to get out of the evening, shows you a map and lets you know what to expect. Frank did all of that which got the evening off to a great start. He appeared to make it his mission to ensure I had a great evening - which given that I was in a party of 1 (!) meant a great deal to me. We went to the bridge for sunset, saw the Opera house, went to the old town, had some fantastic street food, and went to the roof top egg cafe. And all this in the hustle and bustle of the Hanoi night. Truly a great evening and would strongly recommend it to anyone wanting to see some of Hanoi at Night. Thanks Frank

Private Evening Motorbike Tour of Hanoi - Frank is the best!. First off, Frank is the most genuine person I have ever met in my life; you will see why when you meet him. Thankfully, we have a friend who is currently living in Vietnam who introduced us to Frank. We told Frank the days we would be in Vietnam and he literally set up everything from the airport pick up, Halong Bay cruise, motorbike ride, to the airport drop off. I sent him money beforehand through Western Union to cover the tours and airport transfers. (I was a little worried at first sending money but as I soon found out, well worth the initial worry) Like I said, the most genuine person I have ever met.We only had a few days in Vietnam with most of them in Halong Bay leaving only an evening in Hanoi. Although it was only an evening, it was an everlasting evening which Frank planned entirely. Frank speaks very good English so you will not have any problems communicating. I do not want to spoil the experience for you, just know that Frank will take great care of you and show you Vietnam the way it should be seen.I recommend this for everyone! I currently reside in Chicago, Illinois. My first time travelling to Vietnam.

Amazing motorbike adventure. A group of us joined Frank's tour on the recommendation of a friend, and we were not disappointed! Our trip included a Friday night motorbike tour of Hanoi (starting with an hour or so of training), an all-day Saturday motorbike tour of the countryside, including a small village, and he took the group out Saturday night to experience Hanoi's nightlife. At each meal he introduced us to the local cuisine (even working around some dietary restrictions), including the best Pho any of us had ever eaten.All in all, Frank made our experience in Hanoi an absolute pleasure. He treated us like family, and made the city come alive for us. In fact, we are all planning a longer motorbike tour of North Vietnam later this year with Frank. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to experience the real Hanoi, and embark on an exciting adventure.

Amazing Hanoi experience. This experience, which was brilliantly led by our tour guide Frank, was the most amazing and authentic experience I've had of all of my travels to Asia (and I’ve been to 8 countries during my Southeast Asia travels this year).One of the great wonders about Vietnam (specifically Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh) is the organized chaos of motorbikes in the bustling city. If you want to truly experience either one of these cities, you absolutely have to see it from the perspective of a motorbike - whether you ride it yourself or are a passenger on the back. I learned this by taking a "back of the bike" tour during my first part of the Vietnam travels in Ho Chi Minh city (HCMC). After HCMC, my brother and I flew to Hanoi. I did not plan much with the exception of Halong Bay and a tour around the city with Hanoi Free Tours (both experiences were great btw). Frank was the receptionist at our hotel (Oriental Central hotel – highly recommended) upon arriving in Hanoi. Frank spoke very good English and taught us all of the things we needed to know to have a safe trip in Hanoi, which is crucial info to get if it is your first visit. We told Frank how much we enjoyed riding on the back of the motorbikes in HCMC, which is when he informed us of his Vietnam Motorbike Rides business.I was pretty hesitant of the idea at first because I had never ridden a scooter, let alone a motorcycle, in my entire life. Riding on the back as a passenger is one thing, but then to think of the streets of Hanoi as my first time learning experience all seemed a bit crazy. But Frank assured us that he had confidence and that he would teach us everything we needed to know.So we decided to be adventurous and give it a try and do the "Traditional Motorcycle Rides" tour with Frank. We met Frank at his mechanic shop where he introduced us to his lovely family. From there he showed us how the motorbikes worked. They turned out to be extremely easy to ride, as they are automatic and soft on the acceleration. Frank also had other bikes to choose from (manual 150cc, 250cc, etc.), however we obviously weren’t experienced enough to ride those. As soon as we entered the streets on our bikes a rush of adrenaline hit, as we were now part of the chaos. I suddenly grew an appreciation for the honking horns, as bikers are just letting you know that they are coming from behind. Everyone just seems to go with the flow and naturally avoid each other. Even as pedestrians cross the streets, you quickly understand why you should always walk straight and never stop when crossing the streets of Hanoi – bikers are depending on you to keep walking so they can slow down and/or maneuver around you. We always kept at a slow pace with everyone else on the streets and Frank guided us every step of the way. Its such a reassuring feeling once you realize just how easy and natural it is to ride the streets.Once we got comfortable with riding, we left central Hanoi and went over Long Bien bridge, at which point we pulled to the side to take in the amazing views. We then drove through the countryside until we arrived at Tu Dinh church. This was in a very nice little village, much different than what we had been used to seeing in the more touristy areas of Vietnam. We then rode to Bat Trang, which is a pottery village and finished our trip with the red river Song Hong. Once we got back to Hanoi, we returned our bikes to the shop then Frank took us out for some beers and very nice street food.I can’t recommend this activity enough. If you love motorcycles, he has some pretty sweet choices for you. If you’ve never ridden in your life, he has the tamed scooter bikes that are super easy to learn and ride. I promise you it will be an unforgettable experience, and I can’t imagine a better way to see the real side of Vietnam.

Great Experience!. I took a 2 day tour with Vietnam Motorbike Rides, first day was a Hanoi city tour at night and the second day was a full day tour into the country side. Both experiences were fantastic. Frank was very good at making sure we all knew how to properly handle the bikes before he took us into the city traffic. He was able to guide us through the traffic very well. Frank knows all the best spots to stop for food as well. He took really good care of us. If you are nervous about driving a motorbike in Hanoi don’t be, it’s surprisingly safe once you figure out how it works. Frank will make sure you are well taken care of. Highly recommend his company and private tours. We will back for a Northern Vietnam longer tour.

Weekend motorbike tour of Hanoi and Vietnam Countryside. Though I have traveled a lot around Asia this past year and often rely on TripAdvisor for ratings of hotels and travel services I use, I have never actually taken the time on this site to write an actual review. I felt it was important to write my first review to acknowledge Frank and company at Vietnam Motorbike Rides for the wonderful service and hospitality that me and my travel buddies received this past weekend during our short trip to Hanoi, Vietnam. I was referred to Frank through one of my friends who had the pleasure of experiencing one of Frank's motorbike tours a few weeks before me and said that it was a MUST DO activity for my upcoming trip to Hanoi. Being extremely busy in work and my personal life, I didn't have a whole lot of time to research and plan my own itinerary for this trip other than the fact that I knew we wanted to do a motorbike tour and experience as much of Hanoi as we could in the short weekend trip we had planned. I contacted Frank a few days before our trip and must say that I was very impressed with his level of professionalism, quick follow ups, and more importantly, instantly felt a sense of "trust" with him. Frank put together an itinerary for us that consisted of pickup / transfer to and from the airport, a Friday evening motorbike tour of Hanoi city, and a full day countryside motorbike tour on Saturday.I’ve never ridden a motorbike before and Frank and company made us feel very safe and comfortable with the instructions, ongoing supervision, and practice sessions that they had us do before attempting to move on to the actual streets of Hanoi city. Being able to see Hanoi city, the North Vietnam countryside, ancient villages, temples and pagodas on a motorbike is an experience that really blew me away and I am already planning a longer trip back out to Hanoi later this year with Vietnam Motorbike Rides. Frank really does go above and beyond in his service and made us feel as if we were a part of his family.Thank you Frank and team for the wonderful experience and for allowing me and my friends to experience the “Real Vietnam”. It is an experience I will remember for the rest of my life…

7 day-motorbike tour through the jungles and mountains of north west Vietnam. As we arrived in Hanoi, the only thing we had in mind, my boyfriend and I, was to do a motorbike tour in north Vietnam to meet the minority ethnics and have a real look of Vietnam.After one day of intense research, we had though to totally drop the idea because all the companies we went to offered prices too expensive for our budget or without any guide.Our randomly getting the number of Frank Hoang (through friends who had just returned from a trip with him) was our greatest luck!We called him, with no particular hopes because we didn't have much time left to organize our tour, and he immediately set up a meeting to present us his offer: not only the tour he offered was exactly what we had in mind, the prices very generous and reaching completely our budget, but also he could organize it so quickly that after only one day of training with the bike (not mentioning the meals he generously offered us), we were off to a 7-day private tour with a guide in north west vietnam. The prestations of the tour included two motorbikes, all of our meals, the nights in home stay or hotels and the competence and carefulness of our guide.We first went to Mai Chau, a lovely village with spectacular views of rice fields, where we stayed in a home stay, meaning sleeping and eating local food at Vietnamese's house.On the second day, we headed to son la, riding through the beautiful landscape of mountains, regularly stopping to take pictures and visiting interesting history places on the way. On day three, we rode to Dien Bien Phu where we enjoyed a wonderful familial meal at a Frank's relative's house.Day four, we went to Lai Chau, taking a bath in a river on the way, crossing bamboo bridges and having a drink at an old vietnamese veteran's house.On the fifth day, we headed to Sapa, where we arrived very soon to have the possibility of visiting the city and several beautiful rice fields, talking and walking with the inhabitants of several small villages.Day sixth, we headed to Thac Ba, enjoying an adventurous "off road" ride through the jungle. There, we went on a boat trip around the lake and enjoyed the hospitality of a vietnamese homestay with great food.On day seventh, we headed back to Hanoi, having time to stop on the road to further take pictures, visit some beautiful localities, and enjoy a last local meal with our guide.Frank didn't just left us there after the ride: not only he welcomed us in his home to have a shower, pack our stuff and eat a great meal cooked by his wife, but he also offered us the taxi to Hanoi's airport where we had to take a plane back to Ho Chi Minh city.As a resume, we could say that we went to a life time experience tour, meeting the beauty, kindness and generosity of Vietnam, accompanied by Frank, a very competent, careful guide speaking perfectly english and who offered us the best experience we had in Vietnam.

Vietnam Motorbike Rides. Frank Luong provides a fantastic service. He is a guide with lots of knowledge and experience. We were late with our booking because of a flight delay. They arranged another guide for me to catch up with the group in a different place. That was really nice of them and a good way of thinking in solutions. We did the tour to SaPa and got back to Hanoi by night train, really good arrangement. They put the bike on the train also, and you can drive the bikes back once your back in Hanoi.We joined the group and had a wonderful time. Everything, and I really mean everything, is included! I got a motorbike jacket, pants, helmet etc. Included. So you don't have to bring your own gears.Further the accommodations are really nice should you want an overnight trip. Hotels, home stays all perfectly clean and nice. All foods and drinks were also surprisingly included, what a service/deal!Frank Luong did also some video capturing with his go pro hero camera. Awesome footage! And he does this while driving and hooding the camera holding in one hand and steering with the other, where I really needed to get a grip on my bike, haha he's a pro.I highly recommend to book with Vietnam Motorbike Rides Tours. Thanks Frank, Laura and Graham

An exceptional experience. From the moment you contact Frank to the time you part ways, the staff of Vietnam motorbike tours strive to ensure you have the most memorable and positive experience possible. Over the two day private country side tour I did with Frank, I was able to experience what life is truly like for the people of rural vietnam. Not only did he encourage interaction with the local people but also invited me to stay with his family at their coutry farm and to share dinner with them. In my two months travelling south east asia I have yet to have a tour as authentic as what vietnam motorbike tours was able to provide. No matter what your budget, timeline or interests are, Vietnam motorbike tours will ensure your complete satisfaction. If you are at ALL considering doing a bike tour (on scooter or bike, on your own bike or on a guides) I strongly reccomend talking to the staff at vietnam motorbike tours. They are an amazing group of people who treat their customers with the utmost respect and kindness.

The best part of my Vietnam Trip. The tour of Hanoi was one of the most memorable experiences in all my travels, thanks to Frank. I had no idea what I was going to get out of this tour but it was excellent, we went to all the main tourist spots of course but the ones off the beaten path made it the amazing trip it was. Frank's local knowledge added so much to the trip, it is a so worth to get a hold of Frank and book a tour!

The 'real Vietnam' adventure. Landing in Vietnam can be overwhelming – there are so many things to do, and so many people offering tours and experiences. I didn’t just want to be one of the ‘heads’ on a busload of tourists – I wanted to see, taste and explore the county-side and meet the people. Teaming up with Vietnam Motorbike Rides, we were able to personalize our experience to exactly what we wanted – the guides were professional, so honest and had a level of knowledge that went beyond the guide book.Biking through the city streets, motorbiking through the country-sides and walking through the small villages – we’ve got memories and photo’s to last!Visited December 2013

A must do experience!. I had an amazing time, and this experience was really the most memorable part of my visit in Vietnam. The tour was designed just for me, with my time constraints in mind. I had never been on a motorbike, so mine was semi-automatic and very easy to handle. We saw such a wide variety of terrain and sights, making the trip truly memorable. Hikes up beautiful mountains to serene temples, rides through roads surrounded by jungle, stops in carefully selected local establishments for refreshments and delicious meals.I highly recommend Vietnam Motorbike Rides Tours.

Authentic, memorable experience. My trip through the north of Vietnam was an unforgettable experience. I saw sights that would have been impossible without the expertise of our guide, Frank. The journey itself was exciting, but the fact that we were with a local the whole time who know the route, where to sleep, the best places to eat, and history about the area made it a very enriching experience. Frank quickly became a wonderful friend and we gained an immediate trust with him as we ventured out into the countryside. Truly a beautiful experience. My boyfriend and I couldn't have asked for a better trip!

Vespa Tour. Fascinating tour. We really recommend it. Our tour guide Anh explained a lot about country & culture and we had a lot of fun. Best way to see Hanoi. Must try: egg coffee - really delicious.

2 hour Vespa Tour of Hanoi . Hung provided me with a great Vespa tour around Hanoi! He really has authentic Vespa's to rest which is a great way to get around the city. Some of the of the destinations that we embarked on were the infamous French quarter Opera House, Long Bien Dragon bridge, west lake, old pagoda, Ho Chi Min Mausoleum, and citadel. I definitely recommend this tourist company to get an authentic tour of Hanoi!!!

Best way to get a feel for the city!. With only a day in Hanoi, this 2hour tour was perfect to see the main sights with a very knowledgeable tour guide! Also very flexible with times. I would highly recommend!

Great way to see ALL of Hanoi!. It's a 4 and half hour bike tour of all of the best bits Hanoi has to offer, which include snippets of History, Culture, Religion, Local life/markets and concludes with a tasty lunch (if you take the morning slot). The tour guide was knowledgeable and had good English and all the drivers very accomplished. The roads are crazy yet you never felt in trouble on the back of these bikes!

Great way to see Hanoi. Six of us had a great half day out around Hanoi on the Vespers. Our guides we're knowledgeable, sharing lots of information about the history and culture of Vietnam. I would definitely recommend them.

4.5 hour Hanoi tour. This was one of the best tours I have ever taken - and a brilliant way of seeing Hanoi. On the back of a motorbike was both a practical and exciting way to get around the busiest parts of the city, but the excellent itinerary also took in some incredibly quiet and beautiful spots in the city - where we were the only visitors. Our guide K was very knowledgeable, but the best thing was that he ascertained our particular interests and ensured his commentary responded accordingly. He was also great to chat to about life in Vietnam more generally. I'd really recommend the trip.

Great way to explore Hanoi!. Anh was our tour guide and he and his fellow drivers did an excellent job giving us a fun tour of Hanoi. All were excellent drivers and even the most nervous of us relaxed and enjoyed the day. We visited temples and other highlights around Hanoi and learnt about the history. I would highly recommend this - the experience navigating the streets of Hanoi by Vespa is awesome. We had a good lunch at the end of the tour in a local family restaurant. Thanks guys.

Amazing experience . Would recommend this to anyone visiting hanoi. The tour gives a very authentic and diverse insight into the city of Hanoi, Vietnamese history and culture. Our tour guide Anh was very knowledgeable and could answer any question, he spoke perfect English. Plus the vintage vespas are a lot of fun to ride around on.

Great way to see the city!. My girlfriend and I were taken around the city today on their beautiful vintage Vespas. Great way to see so much of the city, and learn a lot about the history and culture in a short time. Anh was a great tour guide, really informative and being around our age it was easy for us to easily dive into discussions about what we were seeing. It is the most authentic way to see the city, and although the Vespas can be troublesome, it adds to their charm. Great value, and definitely recommend!

The best way to see Hanoi. We experienced two Vespa tours during our time in Hanoi - the night-time street food tour and a morning trip outside of the city to see the surrounding countryside & temples. Both were fantastic - Vespa is a great way to see the sights (surprisingly feel very safe despite the crazy traffic!), and our tour guides/drivers were very knowledgeable & friendly - special thanks to Hoang, Khanh & Khang. Highly recommended!

Great way to see Hanoi. Great day out on a scooter enjoying the wonderful sights of Hanoi. Highly recommend this tour to anyone wishing to experience The city from a different perspective. The tour guides are. Wet informative about the different sights and look after you along the way. Fantastic tour!!!

Awesome Tour of Hanoi. Awesome tour. Extremely nice and informative tour guides. The tour was a good length and we got to see many sights in Hanoi. We received nonstop information about the history and sights of Hanoi even during the vespa rides from each sight. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wishing to learn more about Hanoi and its beauty.

Loved the sunrise tour!. Great early morning tour with Duy as my guide. Watched the flag raising ceremony at Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, nice ride over Long Bien Bridge - excellent breakfast and amazing egg coffee! Great guide with excellent English and a passion to share his love of Vietnam. Wonderful trip.

Fancy Vespa tour in Hanoi !. Me and my travel-made were looking for an alternative Citytour and I promise we found the perfect one! Kan was our man! We tooked his fancy vespas for 2,5 hours. He showed us different hotspots around here. In the end we had delicious lunch were Obama went too.
Thanks man for guiding us and for all information.
Cheers, Jan

Unique and unforgettable experience . I spent a wonderful time visiting Hanoi on Vespa, the guide was very friendly and brought us in all the nice places of the city and in local restaurants.i enjoy the tour very much ,I would like to recommend this tour for everyone to do this on the first day in hanoi

Brilliant guide with great English. On my first day in Hanoi I found this tour, and thought it would be a good way to be introduced to the city. I was not disappointed! The guide Kan spoke very good English (fairly rare in Vietnam), and was very knowledgeable about Vietnamese history. We were taken on the mopeds to various stops, including the Opera, the bridge built by the Eiffel tower architect, the pagoda, the mausoleum and finally, to a brilliant restaurant for authentic Vietnamese food! It was a great day out, and a crazy experience to be in the bustle of the Hanoi traffic!

Great day with Anh :). Really enjoyed the 4.5 hour tour, got to see so many sights and it was really enjoyable to have Anh sharing the history and personal anecdotes along the way, he was super friendly and very knowledgeable. Thanks for a fantastic day, I would strongly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see Hanoi in a few hours :)

4,5 Hour sightseeing tour. We had a great time on our motor bike tour of Hanoi. We felt safe and Duy and Le our guides were fantastic. Duy's English was excellent so we were able to chat and laugh while we learnt a lot about Hanoi Would recommend

Awesome tour guide and great tour !!!. Highly recommend!!!!! I was a little skeptical at first as I have never been on a vespa before and didn't know what to expect . But I'm so glad I opt'd for hanoi vintage vespa tour. My tour guide Duy was so awesome!!!!! He spoke really well english, very welcoming and easy to talk to. He was also very informative of all the places we went to. Very professional and always making sure that i was conformable on the bike and a safe driver. Should you ever come to Hanoi give them a try !!!!

Fun 2.5 hour tour on vespa. We started the tour from the office each one of us (me and my husband) on a vespa with a driver guide. First stop was at the opera house with several stops ending it with ho chi minh mausoleum.My guide Kanc was very nice.To whoever is worried about the dangerous streets of hanoi, don't be. They drive very calm and safe. We had only one day in hanoi and this tour helped us see and explore as much as possible with short time. I don't think we would have got to see these places if it wasn't with the tour.

The best tour in Hanoi. This has been the best tour we've had in Hanoi. First of all, our guides have been friendly and shared all their knowledge about Hanoi with us, showing us places we didn't ever think they were there. My motorbike was driven by Anh, who has drived safely at all times and not only has given us many explanations about the city, religion, people and culture, but also has been the most friendly guide we had in our trip around Vietnam. Don't hesitate and book now!

Best way to see Hanoi. It was a great Tour. They pick you up at the hotel and then you visit Different Places. You also get Information about the stops and After all They bring you back to the hotel. Even in the Trafic in hanoi which isn`t easy to handle they drive carefully and bring you savely from one place to the other. Their english ist very good. You get to know hanoi from a very friendly way and everyone could do such a Tour.

A beautiful Vesper tour through Hanoi out of the normal tourists paths. We passing through the old city and found this small office inside a little coffeestore. The people are very kindly and friendly so that we decided to make this trip. Our wish to pass although the literature temple was no problem and so we started. The drivers are farseeing and considerately that we feeling sure and portected in all of the crazy traffic in this motorbike city. It was a great experience to passed a lot of places further the oldtown and learned something over the vietnamese history. We passed bridges over the Red River, a pagode the Westlake and other parts of the city. We drove 2,5h on the bag of the vesper with a localdriver and could catch a lot of impressions of the city further the foodtpath ways. Thank you for spending this time with us!

Outstanding guided tour beside main touristic ways. After some very cheerfull recommendations in our hostel we walked in a tiny coffee shop where Khan offers his Vespa moto tour threw Hanoi.He and his partner drove us on two Vespa scooters threw the city beside the main touristic ways. Both of them Are very good drivers and Khan, who leads this tour, explained us ton of interesting facts about our surrounding so that we felt very comfortable all the time.Thanks a lot to Hanoi vintage vespa tours team!

A can't imagine a trip to Hanoi without this experience!. My family of 5 (kids aged 15, 14 and 12) took an afternoon tour with Huy to many of the main sites around Hanoi. We were picked up at our hotel in the Old Quarter and taken to a perfect little restaurant on a street that we never would have discovered on our own. I am a vegetarian and they did a great job at making sure I had delicious food to eat. Huy was an awesome tour guide and customized this trip to our interests. The drivers were extremely safe and respectful. I loved everything about this. It was the best way to see the busy streets of this awesome city.

Fun Trip!. The Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tour was an awesome way to get around and see things we otherwise wouldn't have experienced. 4 of us booked the Red River Countryside tour. They picked us up at our hotel right on time and brought us to their office in the Old Quarter. We paid, and then we were off to explore the areas outside of hanoi. Our guide was knowledgeable and friendly, and all of the drivers were professional, helpful, and had smiles on their faces. We visited pagodas, rice fields, and the Eiffel Bridge. We ended our tour with a delicious lunch back in Hanoi and a drop off back at our hotel. I would highly recommend this company to anyone wanting to see more of Hanoi, or wanting to get away for a day.

A truly remarkable night to remember!. This tour is a foodies dream! We did the Hanoi by Night Vespa tour in September 2016 and we had one of our best nights in Vietnam. The manager Hoang personally came with another rider from his team and picked us up at our hotel. I can say that he is a true gentleman who looked after us very well. We felt safe in his company and enjoyed his hospitality and insight into North Vietnam culture. The food was amazing! We had authentic North Vietnamese speciality dishes such as Bun Cha from reputed joints, one where even President Barrack Obama had visited and enjoyed. We also had authentic dishes where we could not find elsewhere in Vietnam. Do yourself a favour and do this Vespa Tour when you are in Hanoi!
Excellent tour. We loved our Vespa your to the countryside. It was great fun and informative. Khanh was excellent and took some amazing pictures for us!

Excelent Tour Guide. This was a highlight of our holiday. Our tour guide, Khanh, was amazing. His English was fantastic and he was so knowledgeable about the history of Vietnam. Any question we had, he was able to answer in detail. He was also able to read our personalities and cater to our interest. When we first booked, I was a little concerned about being on the back of a Vespa, however, during the adventure, I felt completely safe. I can definitely recommend this to anyone.

Scootertour hanoi. The guide picked us up at our hostel. We wanted a tour about 2 hours through hanoi, we were about to decide how long. Saw the opera house, the west lake, ho chie minh mausoleum, long bien bridge and the citadelle. Our guide told is a lot about every attraction and answered all of our questions. In total it was a great tour, would do it again for instant.

Sightseeing Tour Hanoi on a Vespa. The Vespa tour through Hanoi was awesome. We drove on a Vespa with two really nice vietnamese guys, who brought us really safe through the busy City of Hanoi. We visited the Opera House, the West lake, the Long Bien Bridge, the old citadelle and the Ho Chi Min Mausoleum. Even the rain didn't disturb this Trip, it was really really cool and authentic to get through the City like the Vietnamese.

Amazing Hanoi/Ride/guide. I just finished the National Park day tour with Old Pagoda and lots of driving: totally recommended, esp if you look for self driving. Was lucky to get K(hanh) as an amazing Guide (try to get him with you:)) with a lot of Knowledge and no other People apart from the Two of us.The Vespas are going Good, Tour was adjusted spontaneously according to my interest and we just came back in time for some pre-rush-hour-driving. Loved it.Just how i would like a driven-escape out of Hanoi. Thanks guys!

Vespa tour. This is the best way to see Hanoi. Great lunch followed by an amazing tour guide, Khahn. He knows so much about the city and explains it so well. He knew all the answers about my random questions too!

Great way to see the city. Vietnam is a country that must be seen by bike and Hanoi is no exception. These guys are great at doing bike tours. I turned up in Hanoi clueless and found their office. I turned what would have been a wasted day into a great sunset tour. I got to see the red river, Eiffel bridge, Ho Chi Minh mausoleum, and the sunset over the west lake was beautiful. And all of this was with great info from the guide. I would definitely recommend it.

Vespa City Tour Hanoi. My friend and I had a great experience doing a motorcycle tour around Hanoi with Hung! We were taken by two vespa drivers to the Red River and the oldest bridge in Hanoi, the western lake, the Opera, to the Kings palace, the Ho chi minh mausoleum and more. The tour is about 2.5h but Hung is flexeble to your request. We had a very good time on the vespas which were safe and comfortable, and Hung was very nice and well english speaker. The egency is in the old city next to the lake. A very good way experienceing this big busy city! I recommend to start your visit here:)

Hanoi Sunset Tour. I only had one day to spend in Hanoi and wanted to see some of the best parts of the city without spending too much time or money, so I so I dropped into this booking office and got this tour recommended. I havent seen anything of the city yet except the central so Im glad I took this tour to see some of the outer parts as well.It seemed to be my lucky day because the view was perfect and so we stopped at the old Bridge and the West Lake to see an amazing sunset.The guide spoke perfect english and seemed to know his way around the city well. On the way you can ask him anything from where to eat or go for drinks.All in all I could recommend this tour to anyone who wants to get a good first impression on the city, whether they just arrived in Vietnam or as a last thing to do before leaving this beautiful country.

Real way to experience Hanoi. We found the Vespa Tour agency next to the hotel and we decide to ask about the tour, which best way to know a city with 5 millions motorbikes? We started in the agency and we visited the opera, the Eiffel Bridge, the west lake, an American plane destroyed during the war, the mausoleum and the citadel. What more can I say, in one your we visited all the important places in the city and we felt how Hanoi people do their life each day. The guide, Mr Hoang, is the kindest person we met in Hanoi, he also speak Spanish perfectly! He made us to feel not so far from home. If you are visiting Hanoi, this tour is a must.

Fun & authentic way to see Hanoi! :). The trip with Hanoi vintage Vespa tours was excellent. Taking a vespa enables you to see the city in an authentic way, like one of the many many locals. Additionally, the tour guide was able to inform us about Hanoi's history, he drove us to special places we asked for and he helped us when bargaining for some shopping items. With the Vespas we drove on top of cool bridges crossing the red river, we saw the governmental part of Hanoi, explored the west lake and its temple. Overall we really recommend the tour and we thank Vintage Vespa tours for a cool afternoon. :)

Excellent tour in Hanoi. Me and my friend had an excellent tour in Hanoi with a really competent perfect english speaking guide. We drove to many beautiful places in Hanoi and also had good possibilities to make many photos. We were driving on really nice and new Vespas, which also were comfortable to ride on. Me and my friend can totally recommend this trip to everybody who wants to learn a little bit about the culture and the city of the Capital of VIetnam.

Very fun. We did this tour our last night in Hanoi. For those of you who've seen the traffic in Hanoi, you know how scary it was to two 60 year old Americans to hop on the back of a Vespa Scooter, and go of on a search for Vietnamese street food. Khanh Vu was our tour guide, and did the most amazing job with the traffic, the scenery, the discussion and the food. It was the perfect way to end our trip. Thanks, Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours!

Not to be missed. At first when we heard we had been booked for a nighttime Vespa tour we were all a bit taken aback. We had seen what driving in Vietnam is like and thought it could be a bit dangerous. We decided we would go anyhow and we were all glad we did. The drivers were very safe and we had a thrill of a lifetime. We went to places we would have never gone on our own. The small nightclub with singers was very romantic. Don't order any other drinks but beer as the wine is terrible and mixed drinks are not drinkable.

Amazing. Today we made a great Tour in Hanoi on a Vespa, with a good speaking English guide. First we tought it was a crazy idea to travel on a Vespa, but it was the most amazing way to see Hanoi! The guide was as i told you speaking good English an told us a lot About the culture, relegion and Hanoi. We went to the lake, the fitst bridge of Vietnam, the presedentional garden and more!

Vespa Tours . I would 100% recommend this vespa Tour. The best way to get a real feel and experience for Hanoi is to do as the locals do and get on a bike. Our guide, Khanh, was very insightful and we enjoyed listening to the long and complicated history of Vietnam. We felt completely safe in Khanh and Le's , the other driver, hands despite the chaos that is hanoi's roads. They catered to our wants and interests and we highly enjoyed the whole experience. Khanh also took some fantastic pictures for us. Thank you vespa tours!

2,5 hours Vespa Tour. This Vespa Tour shows you all the sightseeing of Hanoi together with the hysterical but typical traffic madness. The guide informed me very well we learn a lot of the history and visited many places like the west lake and mad nice photos of sunset ,visit old bridge and many more places .... and it was a well recommended tour. 2,5 hours is just about right, and it shows more than a day hitchhiking or taking a bicycle-taxi. Professional and organized, so it's well recommended!

2.5 hour Vespa tour . We did the 2.5 hour tour around Hanoi with Hanoi vintage Vespa tours. The tour guide spoke great English and went out of his way to talk about the history behind Hanoi & Vietnam. I would really recommend doing this tour when in Hanoi, a great way to experience the city with a local, at a very great price.If you have experience in riding bikes they will let you ride outside of the busy Hanoi old town.

Loved our late afternoon tour. We loved our tour around Hanoi. We got to see loads of sights, the west lake and even had pictures taken for us.The tour guides spoke great English, knew so much about the city and were great to chat to whilst exploring.The Vespas are really safe, comfortable and we were even able to ride one for ourselves.The two hours is a perfect amount of time to see everything and the west lake during sunset was beautiful.Would recommend for anyone staying in Hanoi wanting to see more of the city than you can on foot.

Great 2.5hrs spent exploring Hanoi! . We spent a fantastic 2.5hrs with Khang, Trung and Le! Khang commenced the tour but let Trung take over and we're so glad he did! Trung was so funny, very informative and such a lovely guide to show us around Hanoi! He really made the tour something special! We saw so much in the 2.5 hours and didn't spend too long in any one place which we really liked. The vintage Vespas are so cool and fun! Definitely a great experience winding around the streets and roads of Hanoi on the back of these! Felt very safe the entire time if anyone was nervous, I wouldn't be. The lunch was some of the best food that we had while visiting Hanoi. It was so so tasty and we left feeling faaarrrrr too full purely cause we couldn't stop eating! Our guides joined us for lunch and it was lovely being able to chat to Trung about life in Hanoi and a million other things!Would definitely highly recommend to anyone wanting to explore Hanoi the RIGHT way (on a Vespa!) 5 star tour!

Good way to see Hanoi. We have had a 2.5 hour tour with Mr. Hiy. He showed us all the nice places Hanoi has to offer. Because of our limited timeframe we first didn't plan to go to all the highlights, but then we ran into Mr. Hiy. We jumped on the back of a vespa and got to see everything after all! Mr Hiy knows a lot about Hanoi and its history and is able to tell you everything about it. After all we are glad that we did ran into Mr Hiy so that our time in Hanoi was spent at its best!

Hanoi in one afternoon . Great way of visiting Hanoi if you have a limited amount of time. I toured with Trung and he was super helpful and a great guide--overall, a nice way to visit the city. Watch out for the rain!

Vespa's sunset route. An amazing tour with amazing drivers! We started the trip close to Hoan Kiem Lake and the shown us lots of places outside of the city center, like crossing the old bridge, the presidential palace and the opera among others to finalize it drinking the famous egg coffee in a typical Vietnamese cafe. I would recommend this vespa sunset trip 100%, the old fashion vespas, the colors, the life, the views... Totally different and great experience!

Great vespa tour in Hanoi. I had a great tour with this company! The guide was absolutely great- well English speaker (better than me LOL). He took us to great spots ( in Hanoi and well explain.i learn alot of history about hanoi,the trafic very clazy but seat on the back of vespa with driver very carefully i feel very safe ,on the tour we see. Alot sight of hanoi like opera house ,bridge ,west lake and many an other place ,the tour i enjoy very much thank you for the tour ! I hightly recommend this tour for every one want to see hanoi

Motorcycle tour. We were 2 friends that took 2 guys with vespas to make us a tour around hanoi, it was very nice, they where very kind for us, it make us know the ather side of the city, where we could not go by wallk. We saw a beautiful bridge and beautiful pagoda. I recomend to do it!

Vespa city seeing. We had a great time on the vespa. Saw alot of different places of the city Hanoi. The guide knows alot about the history of the city and speaks good English. Really recommend this trip! Especially we visit a lot of beautifull places like the Opera Building was impressive and to see the old bridge, saw the ceramic wall and we've been to the big the lake in Hanoi. Very much fun, a lovely afternoon tour!

Vespa tour. We have done this tour last few days agoThe people are very friendly!! They know a lot about the city and tell you everything you want to know. Its a good way to see the city. They show you all the highlights. We have seen the bridge long bien, ho chi minh museum and a lot more. It was a good experience!

Great way to discover Hanoi. We had a private family tour for 4 hours the same day we landed from Europe. It was just enough time to see the key interest points in Hanoi. Our team was really nice and our guide very knowledgable. The Vespas are quite old and we had couple that broke up, that's understandable. However the guys are well organised, had one extra driver on the tour and the guide on his motorcycle, so they just took over when needed and we did not loose any tour time. Overall the experience was really fun, the streets of Hanoi are a total driving chaos and being part of it was a bit scary at first. But the vespa drivers manage it well somehow and after few chaotic crossings you just get used to it. Highly recommended.
Night tour of Hanoi. This was awesone fun, great guides & food, egg coffee a 1st & surprisingly tasty, highlight of our stay in hanoi

Must do, fun way to explore Hanoi. We booked the Vespa tour to fill in half a day before flying south. It was one of our best experiences. The guide and drivers were awesome, super friendly and lots of great knowledge to share about the history of Hanoi. They took lots of photos and shared with us at the end. The lunch was the best food we have had in Vietnam!!

A pleasant afternoon. This was a very pleasant afternoon, but not a highlight. We enjoyed the cool created by riding on bike (much cooler than walking), we enjoyed having a view of lots of Hanoi however unlike our Vespa tour in HCMC which was a wow this underwhelmed. On the other hand food at lunch was so good we asked for the card of the small local restaurant in the Old Quarter (big plus). I always enjoy the vignettes of SE Asian living: shaving bamboo, scalding de-feathered rooster, cooking over a brazier, but there was not a lot of value-add this afternoon. We did enjoy it but they certainly could lift their game.

Brilliant bike tour!!. One of the best things we did during our holiday in Vietnam! Wanted to see outside Hanoi so we booked the river delta tour - picked up at 8am on vintage vespas at the hotel, and then a beautiful drive around! Lots of stop offs for photos. Our guide was really great, told us all about the history of the area and some local legends! All brilliant drivers and really nice guys - big thanks to Xui, Kan, Aoe and Ki!! Would definitely recommend :)

Best way to see hanoi on vintage vespa. This has been a great tour. Driver is super friendly and funny full of anecdotes and stories about hanoi city. Speaks good English and Spanish and takes you to the heart of Hanoi. We visited many places like Opera house, West Lake, Dragon Bridge (my favourite), the pagoda by the bridge, the cidadela. Magnificent tour. Very recommendable.

Nice sunset tour! . We were looking for a quick way to see the most important sights in Hanoi...and the Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tour has it all! We saw the opera house, crossed the almost antique french bridge which is only opened for motocycles, the citadelle...since this tour starts around 5 pm, the guide times the sunset really nice so you can see it at the biggest lake of Hanoi. The english speaking tour guide is really nice and shows sights of the city you probably wouldn't see on your own. So have fun!

Sunset Tour. Really nice tour! You get a nice overview of the city. You see nice places in Hanoi like the old bridge, the lake during sunset and other spots. Its a good way to see much in short time.The Vespa is really nice and you sit really relax. The guide is really nice and speaks good english, he knows a lot about the history of Vietnam.

Fantastic tour for short overview . Normally I don't comment some tours at tripadvicor - now my first comment. Me and my girl were very sceptical at first with riding on a Vesta. But you don't have to be. Because Khan and his driver did a really good job driving us through Hanoi... we were never nervous or something. The short tour (around 2h) goes to the dragon bridge, French quarter, Ho Chi Minh mausoleum and some temple. Anyway Khan told us about Hanoi's history... For just a short stay in Hanoi is that the best way to get a overview. Make sure you find the real Hanoi Vespa tour - the guys wear green / yellow shirts. See pics.Let's go and explore Hanoi by a Vesta with Khan.

Great Vespa tour!. We did the Vespa tour with Khan and it was great fun. I did feel safe all the time, he and the other guide are real good drivers. He showed us the Dragon bridge, the Opera House in the french quarter, the Tran Quoc Pagoda, the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and some other interesting spots of Hanoi and explained the history of them. In total a really good tour I can recommend, definetly the best way to explore Hanoi!

Vintage Vespa tour!. Was a really quick and fun way to see Hanoi. We started at our hotel- having been picked up on two vintage Vespas- in the old town before going to the opera house in the French quarter. We went across dragon bridge, and also saw the impressive ceramic wall! The driving at all times felt safe, which seems impressive in the Hanoi traffic! On the 2.5 hour trip some of the sights involved Tran quoc pagoda, Ho Chi Minh mausoleum and lots of the narrow streets which you wouldn't see otherwise. Guy was a very knowledgable, friendly guide and made the tour very enjoyable!

2.5 hour tour around Hanoi . Excellent way to see Hanoi quickly. Guy picked us up from our hotel with two Vespas, which we rode on the back off. I felt very safe despite the busy Hanoi roads. Guy was very informative about the history of the city and eager to answer any questions. Highlights of the tour included seeing the Red River from dragon (Eiffel) bridge, the crashed B-52 bomber and the Ho Chi Minh mausoleum - amongst many other things! Would definitely recommend this to those looking for a quick, safe and fun way to explore Hanoi!

Thay Pagoda and Ba Vu National Park on Vespas.. My wife and myself travelled with K (nick name) and Mr. KHANG from Hanoi Vespa Tours. We actually went to the office to book a 6 night Sapa tour which we start tomorrow and also on their suggestion tried the Vespa day tour. The tour was well run and they made us feel safe as they travelled the country side. The Thay Pagoda was the best we have seen. We were the only people there from overseas.The trip up the mountain to the National Park was spectacular the views were magnificent with many photo opportunities. We highly recommend this business. They try very hard to suit your needs.RegardsRon

Too expensive. Tour was not bad but for the price ( Around 100$ per person) we expect really something better.The scooter is old and not very well working, we had to stop on the way to fix the brake and the rear tire.

Best tour experience in my life (I don't say that casually). My girlfriend and I were wandering around Hanoi on a hot day unsure of how to spend our afternoon when we stumbled upon this flyer in our hotel lobby. It seemed like it was the only afternoon tour that was more than just the city of Hanoi so we decided to give it a try thinking it was just an opportunity to ride vespas around the countryside. We were picked up by two well dressed tour guides from our hotel and hopped on the back of two vespas unsure of what was planned. They immediately whisked us outside of the city deftly and safely driving us side by side with the rest of the good people of Vietnam. (They drove slower and far safer than the other drivers of Hanoi, so need to worry at all about safety). They took us to five separate stops along the way in the area outside of the city, (all of great importance in Vietnamese history/culture) giving us expert guidance and information. One of the best parts of the tour was once we left hanoi's old quarter, I did not see one other tourist the entire time. It was a pleasure to travel and see important sites and be in the company of real locals who were slightly amazed and surprised by our presence. One highlight was sitting under the shade of Co Loa, the ancient citadel and capital/king's palace, with a group of five Vietnamese women eating freshly picked and cut jackfruit, and talking with them through our guide's translating skills about anything and everything you could imagine. This was a purely spontaneous happy coincidence and was an experience worth much more than the reasonable fee charged by the tour guide. Our tour guide was also fantastic and is a true relatable person (not just someone that talks at you) and we learned about his life and exciting new tour guiding business. He is an extremely smart and hard working, young new business owner who has put together the perfect travel experience. It was honestly the best tour I've had in my life and I've been on many tours in many countries that charge much more and offer far less. It is the only tour I've experienced that removes the awkward "outsider looking in" perspective that one usually encounters while traveling. I am excited for the future of the company (and tour guide) because it is on the verge of tremendous success - there is a reason everyone rates this five stars and writes a review. FYI this is the first and probably only review I will ever write because I feel that strongly about my experience. Do yourself a favor and do this tour before you do anything else in Hanoi!

Best way to see Hanoi. The visit of Hanoi on a lovely old fashioned Vespa has been the best experience in Vietnam so far. The drivers/guides are very kind and full of useful information about the city and its history. We visit opera and the old Bridge, and see beautifully of West Lake and pagoda. B52 and also ride pass ho chi Minh mausoleo I suggest the experience to all the people visiting Hanoi!!

Special experience in Hanoi!!. I made the tour on Vespa motorbike in the Hanoi area,the trip was so funny and also organized very accurately The manager of the tour is very reliable and professional.This is the best way to visit the chaotic Hanoi in the Vietnamese style,you can have the chance to see all the city in a nice and very cheerful way.Don't miss this experience in Hanoi,otherwise it will be a pity!

Fun way to see the city!. These vintage vespa's are fun way to see all the sights this city has to offer. Kan was very friendly and spoke fantastic English, pointing out different areas of the city on the way and stopping off at the main attractions including west lake, ho chi Minh museum, long bein bridge and many more! Would highly recommend this company, I felt very safe, they were very welcoming and had a fantastic trip. A must do in Hanoi!

2 hour tour of Hanoi on a vespa. great tour! Stopping at the mausoleum, west lake, pagoda, long bien bridge and more!Interesting to hear nuggets of information about all of these sites in a concise tour, ideal for those who are time limited or who would prefer and overview of the main sites in Hanoi.Very friendly drivers, welcoming and informative. Great fun to ride on the back of a Vespa!Would recommend!

Vespa street food tour. There were 4 of us on the tour each riding on the back of an original Vespa!We visited 4 different street food places around Hanoi and the food was great! Ended up in a night club where live music was played and had a drink there! We also visited the Ho Chi Minh museoleum and watched the flag changing ceremony.Overall a really great tour with very friendly tour guides! Highly recommend.

Amazing City Tour. if you want to experience the city in a local way, this tour is the perfect choice! You get to see the whole city, you get a personal driver for your Vespa and the tour guide is very kind and speaks perfect English and knows a lot about the city and its history. The Vespas are very comfortable and we really enjoyed the tour! 10/10 would do it again

Great fun, great way to see Hanoi. Just in Hanoi for a weekend - this was a great way to see the city. Traffic seems chaotic until you are part of it. Drivers know how things work. Super friendly staff. Very memorable trip! Special thanks to Khanh!

Amazing sunset tour - see the city like a local on the back of a Vespa. Throughly enjoyed our unforgettable experience seeing the city highlights whilst on the back of a Vespa. Our guides were extremely knowledgable of the sites which included the opera house, Ho Chi Minh Moslem and the palace. We finished our tour on the long beam Bridge watching the beautiful sunset. Overall an amazing trip, highly recommend this company as they were such lovely and friendly people. Thank you for a wonderful day!

Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tour. Kanay has just taken us on a wonderful tour of Hanoi. His english is fantastic and he explained in great detail all the historical buildings and landmarks around the city. Driving on the back of his Vespa was mental but so much fun, the traffic here is crazy!! I would so recommend building this two hour tour into your day it's a fun way to see the highlights of Hanoi and talking to Kanay has given us so many great ideas of other places to go and visit. The service was so friendly.

Vespa tour Hanoi!! . We went with the vespa tour at 5.30 pm. Suy was right on time! We have seen another part of the beautiful city of Hanoi. The drivers drive really save true the total chaos of traffic. It was rainy so they had poncho's for us wich we really needed. We have seen some highlights. In dispite of the rain it was a good experience. I would recommend it for your first day at Hanoi, just do it!!

So much fun!. Had such a lovely time this evening on a night time vespa tour with Vu Nguyen Khanh. Before our tour we were a bit nervous about the Vietnamese traffic but felt safe throughout tour. Really enjoyed stops at places that we would never have found ourselves. Won't spoil the surprises but highly recommend. Thank you!

Outstanding trip. I want to thanks Giang, Nam and Le for the outstanding scooter half-day trip today to Hanoi countryside. My son, which is celebrating 20th birthday, and myself enjoyed it very much. It was excellent and the lunch at the little hanoi restaurant could not be any better. It was a tasty local food representation. You guys were very professional and nice. Villages stops for water and corncobs were very good options. It is something different from the typical city tour. Going to countryside is real sightseeing adventure. Keep it up. Truly recommend it.
Awesome. We had an awesome trip. Our guide Khanh showed us amazing places outside the city Hanoi. Realy an experience to never forget!

Easy way to Explore Hanoi. We did a day tour at Hanoi Vespa tours. We really enjoyed it! The drivers are very friendly, speak good English and Can tell you everything you wanna know. The drivers drive very safely. Exploring Hanoi on a Vespa is very nice, because you Can see a lot of things in a short time. We Went to the opera house, went on the two old bridges across the Red River and also seen some Pagodes. On our way back, our guide told us the stories about the citadel. So if you want to exploring Hanoi in a unique way, we can really recommend you to book this tour!

Vespa Tour Hanoi. The tour is very nice. We have seen a lot and get enough information about the different places we have visited. The guides were very friendly and gived us also some tips for our stay in Vietnam. If you have some time in Hanoi you really have to do this, it's a lot of fun and you see a lot of Hanoi!

Great experience! . In a couple of hours you get to see as much of Hanoi as possible! My guide Hung was amazing and his English language was outstanding! They drive very safe which is important in a big chaotic city like Hanoi. By this tour i've got the feelig that I saw as many as possible of Hanoi in one day!

Amazing way of exploring Hanoi. We only had 1 day in Hanoi, and this tour enabled us to see as many of Hanoi as possible. We visited places and sights you normally would not see and the expertise,kindness and knowledge of Hung made the experience perfect. Joining in the chaotic traffic of Hanoi is impressive and due to the safe way of driving by the guides in this tour, we could enjoy it to the fullest. I highly recommend this tour! Especially to people that don't have a lot of time in Hanoi.

The best way to see the city hanoi is on a vespa!. Today we did the vespa city tour! It was a great way to see the city because, you see places where you only can get by scooter. First we went to see the opra house! Next stop was the long bian bridge. From here you have a very nice vieuw over the city! Then we went to see a 1000 year old pagoda very intreseting to see! We also saw the american airplane that wanted to bomb hanoi in the war. I can recommed everyone who wants to see more from vietnam this tour!!

The fun begins here.. This motorbike tour was so much fun. You have not seen Hanoi if you haven't tried this one. The fun begins here and our first stopped was coconut juice testing while enjoying fresh breeze from the lake. (This is life) Vespa Tours picked us up from our Hotel at 8am. we've had chances to enjoy the views at every stopped. I was anxious to drive myself so I decided I don't have to do anything but sipping coconut juice behind at one of our tour guide's motorbike. I brought a traveller's mug with me and I was pleased. Unfortunately I was very ill at mid-day (due to a night before) I could not complete my venture but Vespa Tour dropped me off back to our hotel and they had carried on the tour without me. At the end of the tour when everyone returns back Vespa Tours sent me a message making sure I was alright. Very professional. Thank you!

A brilliant way to enjoy Hanoi. I booked the morning tour to the countryside arround Hanoi. It was an excellent trip with many mpressions and nice stories. The guides did a good job despite of the heat (37 degrees).Thanks again!

the highlight of our trip. we did the half day city highlight tour. I did the tour with my 14yo daughter . My other daughter was unwell so the company organised a car tour with my wife and younger daughter as well . we all had a brilliant time . we had a driver for each vespa as well as an english speaking guide on a separate bike. The vespas are from 1962. It is an amazing experience zipping through the tiny streets of the old quarter and around the city . it is hyper real at times being so close to everything , smelling everything . we saw lots of sights. the guides were brilliant ,very open and informative.The drivers were very good and safe and I felt safe at all times . It was such a buzz I could not recommend it more highle and you will never meet a guide nicer than Jackie.
