Safe, fun and friendly guides. Exploring this busy city was amazing with the vespa tour. We got to see how the locals eat and live by day and by night. The guides were very friendly and ensured that all our requests were fulfilled. I would definitely try this again and thank you Mr Khang and friend for bringing us back to the hotel safely:)
Fantastic tour!. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Got to see more of Hanoi than you would normally see on the tourist trail, and the guides were very friendly and knowledgeable . Highly recommended!

Great trip around the city. We had a great trip around the city on the back of the vespas. Very comfortable seats! Great way to see the city! We went around just before the sun set, beautiful lighting on all the views. We saw the opera, the Red River and Hanoi's oldest pagoda. We also enjoyed the company of Hunc and Le - very nice and Hunc was great at explaining all the sights. He is very kind and speaks good english. We enjoyed the ride with a beer in our hand we can definitely recommend it!

AMAZING!!. This is the best way to explore Hanoi! Goes to so many beautiful places that we'd of never made it to on our own. Kan was the best tour guide going, gave us so much information on the history of Hanoi and it's beautiful colonial old buildings. Couldn't recommend this enough!!

Best way to explore hanoi city on a vintage vespa. I and my friend travel 3 months round asia ,this my first time do vespa tour ,get recommend from our friend ,we book this tour in last minute call to book 2 hours before tour start, they arrange for us tour so quick ,we get 2 beautifull vespa come to pick up us on time ,our driver and tour guide tell us very detail and carefully how to be safe to seat on they bike, our tour guide speak very good english he tell us lot of history of hanoi,we learn a lot ,they take us to many beautifull places ,we see opera house ,the old bridge ,and west lake where we visit a beautifull pagoda,so fun we do take a lot of photo,in the end of the tour we have very vietnames food ,we love this tour very much ,i would hight recommend this tour for every one come to do this tour

Loved it. Did this tour with a friend on our last day in Hanoi and wished we had done it earlier! It was a really great experience and we got to see parts of Hanoi other than just the old quarter/area where all the tourists stay. The guide is so nice, speaks English well, and was great to get to know. Riding on the back of the motorbike is a blast and the restaurants we went to were delicious (seriously - I had the best spring roll I've had in Vietnam on this tour). I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Hanoi.

Hanoi vintage Vespa tours. I had an incredible experience during my tour. I was a little nervous about riding on a Vespa (especially after seeing the traffic in Hanoi), but the drivers made me feel so safe and I had a blast. I was able to take tons of pictures during the ride, and when we stopped at the various sites on the tour. The tour guide, Khang, spoke English very well and was able to explain the sites we stopped at. The food we had during the tour was the best food I ate during my time in Vietnam. I only wish I had booked the tour earlier so I would have known where to eat. I went for the 2.5 hour sunset tour which was very scenic. The time flew by and if I were to go again, I would sign up for a longer tour. I definitely recommend taking this tour; it's a fun and interesting way to see Hanoi!
A great day out travelling as a local!. The guys were awesome! We had an amazing time weaving through the traffic to some lovely out of the way places. Very exciting!!

Unforgettable!. The only way to see Hanoi! I was a little nervous about entering the unpredictable traffic on a bike, but our lovely guides were very considerate and accommodating, made me feel safe at all times. The hustle and bustle was so exciting and i really felt like i got to see every angle of Hanoi. Our guide Khanh and his team were highly knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. I cannot express my amazement at how well they drive and assess all the traffic - they knew exactly where to go and how to get through it all! They were very responsible and took great care of us. Was a truly wonderful experience, i would highly recommend seeing Hanoi this way, you definitely won't regret it....and definitely won't forget it!!

Best Hanoi City Tour! On a Vespa!. We recently travelled to Hanoi and took the Hanoi Vespa tour. I highly recommend this to any visitor to Vietnam as it a great way to view the city sites. Our guide Khanh was very polite and knowledgable of Vietnamese history and the city and Hanoi. Khanh and his team were responsible and safe drivers who all spoke very good English. Riding the Vespa is the great way to get a an understanding of Vietnamese life in the heart of the city of the bustling Hanoi city. Really unforgettable experience that I recommend to everyone!

Hanoi vespa tour. The vespa tour was excellent! Kang and his group took us to the most important and interesting landmarks around Hanoi. To end our very fun afternoon tour, he took us to his coffee shop where he made us try coffee from his farm. Such a great experience!
Vespa Tour. Khang is amazing! He helped me make my Vespa tour dream come true! He was very helpful and accommodating!

Vespa scoot through Hanoi!!!!!. What an awesome afternoon cruising through the streets of Hanoi with the cool air blowing through my hair. Kan the tour guide had a lot of interesting knowledge about the dramatic history of this city. I felt very safe on the back of the groovy vespa scooter. Highly recommended to all visitors to hanoi!

Best way to see Hanoi!. I absolutely loved going on this tour around Hanoi! I went on this tour on the first day I was in Hanoi and can't think of a better way to be introduced to this beautiful city! The guide was very informative about each destination we visited and never once did I feel unsafe! Would definitely recommend this to family and friends, thank you Kan!
Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours. Was a great way to see broader Hanoi in a short space of time with Khang and his friendly team, in true Hanoian scooter style!

Brilliant vespa tour Hanoi. This tour with Khang was the highlight of my time in Vietnam. I have traveled many times to Indochina and prefer to be an independent explorer. With a short time in Hanoi and the wonderful reviews I chose to book the morning tour at short notice. Khang was prompt and very helpful with enquiries.We were the only couple on the tour and found out so much about the history and culture of Vietnam.we had a wonderful visit to the local markets (not a tourist in sight). He has established this company, has fluent English and employs uni students from the country to help support their studies.I highly recommend this tour/company.

Great Way to See Hanoi. Hanoi was the last stop on our photography tour of Vietnam and we wanted to make sure we saw the best of the city in our short visit. The vespa tour is the way to do it. They take you to areas you wouldn't have known to go to and introduce you to the unique foods of the country. The guides are very friendly and speak English well. Driving on vintage vespas in the chaos of the streets is an added bonus that makes this tour much more exciting than a walking tour.

Great tour of the city in a short time . I visited Hanoi with my husband in June when it was sweltering! We usually like to tour by foot but we were only able to cover two attractions in a span of four hours due to the heat as we took constant beverage breaks in coffee shops. We decided to do the vintage Vespa tour in the evening time. The first thing you will notice in Hanoi is the melee of scooters buzzing about- so why not be a part of the madness! Kan, our guide showed us many sites in a span of 4,5 hours. He shared a lot of information about the monuments and attractions. We saw the opera house, dragon tail bridge, a long stretch of ceramic wall art, a gorgeous sunset at the west side lake- the largest in Hanoi, pagoda, Ho Chi Minh mausoleum, French district, and rode through the markets in the old district. It's was a great trip!

Hanoi in a day. Had one day in Hanoi before leaving for sapa, found the best way to get a feel for the city was being one of the many motorbike riders you find in the city. Hanoi Vintage Vespa tour gave me a quick but detailed experience of the city. The guide speaks good English. We saw the opera house, the guide also is a good photographer too! We got some good couples shots taken all along the tour. Rode across the long bein bridge, got to see the ceramic wall art, west side lake, and learnt a lot about the historical monuments, buildings and even a 1000yr old citadel in the city. The tour concluded in good time. Was a fun ride and a much better option than walking in the scorching heat. Would recommend it!

Great Vespa tour! . This tour was great, staff is really nice and explain everything. They speak English very well. You can stop where ever you want. We stopped at the opera, to learn many history of Hanoi and we visit the beautifull bridge long bien ,rider to west lake ,temple and pagoda. It's also really safe. We took a lot of picture's with the nice drivers! It was a nice experience! I recommend this Hanoi Vespa Tour.
Great Experience! Awesome tour. The half day countryside tour is so fun, the staff are very friendly, scenery is beautiful, a great experience in Hanoi! Highly recommended.

Great fun tour! . Very safe and fun tour! Tour guide was very informed and we had fun riding around in rice parties and seeing different pagodas. We ended the tour at a wonderful restaurant with many delicious courses! Do. It. Now.
Great tour!. We had a very fun day visiting the countryside of Hanoi on Vespas. Afterwards we ate a delicious lunch in town! Definitely recommend.

Great way to experience Hanoi!!!. We were thrilled with this tour! An exhilarating and wonderful way to get to know the city in half a day. We visited all the important points, learned a lot from our tour guide, drank delicious Vietnamese coffee and had a wonderful lunch. Totally recommend the experience, very unique and fun!

Nice vespa tour . We did the vespa tour with huy on our last evening in Hanoi. He brought us to some nice places and gave us a lot of interesting facts about Hanoi and its history. He is a very nice and involved guy and we felt very safe sitting on the back of their vespas. He also took us to the place where they sell the best egg coffee in town. That was very nice and the taste is excellent. A good opportunity getting a view around Hanoi and also nice during night. Thanks for the awesome tour.

Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours. Great service and a lot of fun! In a few hours we have seen all the places that are worth visiting! Our guide took great care of us. At first, it was a bit scary to be on a motorbike because of heavy traffic at rush hour but in half an hour you can get used to it.

Top highlight of my visit to Hanoi. I did this tour with a group of 5 on our last full day in Hanoi after a 4 day visit. It was one of the best things I did whilst in Hanoi. All the drivers were super friendly and wore high visability vests which was good to be able to see our group in the traffic. In the crazy Hanoi traffic, I felt completely safe as my driver knew the roads and was very good at reading the traffic. It was wonderful to get out of the city and see things that I wouldn't have had the opportunity to see otherwise. Our drivers were great tour guides, giving us a detailed history of the city and it's landmarks so it was very interesting. And to finish the tour with a cold drink and delicious lunch just capped off a brilliant few hours. I can't recommend this tour highly enough to all visitors to Hanoi. Well worth it. Thanks Khang and the whole team.
Half day tour. Great half day tour of Hanoi with Khang. Courteous, punctual, and accommodating to what you prefer to see.

Amazing Tour. Hands down one of the best tours we took during our time here in Vietnam. The tour was nice and safer than we had originally expected. We left during rush hour and the experience was awesome since we had the chance to navigate the organized chaos of Hanoi. Highly recommend the tour to anyone who wants a unique and adventurous time!!

Amazing experience. This is another way to visit the city with some visits including. They are professional and at least our official guide was good. I already recommended to some friends that are going to visit the city. They also have this experience in another cities.

See Hanoi as a local on a Vespa. In a city of 7 million with 4.5 scooters, its controlled chaos. Somehow everyone weaves their way through the intense traffic to their destination without running into each other. This is a great company with caring drivers and its the best way to really visit Hanoi.

Great Tour in the evening. We had a great tour with Huy our tourguide in Hanoi City!We did the Tour around five pm so that we saw the City in the beautiful sunset!We saw the old bridge, the West lake with the oldest pagoda in town and also the B52-Wrack and the Mausoleum! But just the drive trough the city was worth it!We would never drive by our own trough the city, but the giude made it really easy and we enjoyed every minute!!!!!!

Awesome City Experience. I am very happy that I got this tour. Upon my arrival in Hanoi, my hotel offered my this tour to see the real Hanoi. Upon learning about the company, I asked if I was possible that they follow the itinerary that I prepared for Hanoi. They had no objections and 30 minutes later we were already going around Hanoi. I had my own tour guide and photographer in all the sites that I personally wanted to go to while my driver with the others vespa waited for our at the entrances. I even went tho the Bun Cha restaurant where President Obama and Anthony Bourdain ate and my guide was very much willing to accompany me there. I even has egg coffee at Cafe Giang with my guide. I was able to visit the Ho Chi Minh mausoleum, Temple of Literature, War museum with the the real Mig-21 and B-52, Ceramic wall, Long Bien bridge, Tran Quoc Pagoda, West Lake, Hanoi Citadel, and various temples.I am extremely satisfied with the the service of Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours. Bring your own personalized itinerary and let them guide you around Hanoi.

Crazy traffic but a lot of FUN!. We had a choice of a city tour or a countryside tour. We chose the country and it was good to get away from the bustle of Hanoi! Four of us, each on the back of a scooter. The guys picked us up at our hotel, provided helmets, and we took off for about 4 hours. This was a great day trip. Included lunch in Hanoi. Stopped for coffee. Stopped at roadside market, fabulous photo ops! Stopped at a very old temple. Rode through rice fields on narrow paved trails wide enough for 2 scooters to pass. Our guides were very knowledgeable, eager to answer our questions. We went back to Hanoi for lunch, nice place, good food on a very narrow street. Apparently so narrow that one of our bikes was allegedly illegally parked. We watched what looked like local police carry that bike away along with my personal helmet. No worries. It all worked out. These guys were fantastic and excellent riders. Check it out!

Unique way to get to know Hanoi . The tour is absolutely perfect to see Hanoi from a different side. I stayed in Hanoi for 5 days and did the tour on my last day and still saw something new. We went around Hanoi when it got dark and seeing Hanoi at night was absolutely perfect. That is also a chance to get into the crazy Hanoian traffic without being scared of getting into an accident because the drivers drove really slow and save - that is also great for taking pictures and to look around!! Huy the guy who took us around spreak English very well and knows a lot about the sights we visited as well .. Just a unique way to get around in Hanoi so I highly recommend Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours and it was definetly worth the money.

Excellent Option to see Hanoi's heart. At first I had doubts my it turn out to be amazing. You get to see beautiful spots in the city in a vintage Vespa in Hanoi :) I felt completely safe all the time and was a lot of fun! The guide new many details about the city and its history. Perfect option when you are spending one or two days only in Hanoi. Definitely doing it again.

Vespa book this tour!. This was a last minute booking and what a great find!! Khang was very quick and good to communicate with and we got it all set up in no time.The tour started off with pickup right at our hotel. from there we hopped on the cool Vespas and went for a pre fix lunch- which was very tasty and plentiful! small tour which was great- it was just my husband and I and another couple and their adorable little one. being on the Vespa felt like a private tour anyway :) the tour hit all the great sites with a taste of local action and seeing parts of Hanoi you might not get to by foot or taxi. it's mesmerizing the way traffic moves and I never felt uncomfortable on the Vespa. a must do!!

The real Hanoi. Vintage Vespas was an amazing way to see Hanoi as many others do by zipping about on a Vespa motorbike. I got to see many key sites and places I wouldn't normally have gone to, sat down for a coffee enroute or cold sugar cane as needed, and Khang adjusted the route and plans to take into account what I had or hadn't seen. It was a brilliant experience and I was made to feel supported and confident on the bike as well as being able to have an amazing experience. Your tour of Hanoi isnt complete without doing this!

Fantastic afternoon out. Had a great afternoon out on a couple of scooters, Kan was a very good tour guide and was very helpful. He has very good spoken English and was able to arrange everything we asked for. I would t hesitate to go for a day ride with him and his colleagues if you want a friendly and relaxed way to see a bit of Hanoi and the countryside

Nice way to discover Hanoi. On a scooter is the best way to discover Vietnam, so is Hanoi! Suy takes you to some places you woulded see by foot, we really enjoyed. He speeks good englisch and can tell a lot. It was fun too, to drive trough the city and all the traffic.. but I did feel save on the back of the bike. I really recommend this Tour! Thanks for the nice trip!

Diffrent but fun way to discover Hanoi!. Me and my friend wanted to see as much as possible of Hanoi but we had just a few days here, so we booked a trip with Vespa Tours and consulted with the staff what we wanted to see here. The guide is brilliant and speaks english fluently. The vespa is an exellent way of getting around as you can see so much on your way to the sights! We ended up visiting the opera house, dragon bridge, an old pagoda... And learned a lot of history as well!I would recommend every one who get the chance to do this tour!

Fab guide and tour. Really enjoyable trip out from Hanoi across red river to the countryside. Drivers were very confident,safe and had great English, so friendly and relaxed. Cool to hear the vespa engine too!

Best way to see the city of Hanoi! . This is the best way to see the city of Hanoi, and to make it even better with the best tour guides! Lots of laughs, great information about the city and history. I would recommend that if you are in Hanoi do this tour. You will see a lot more and learn a lot more than if you were to just do it by foot. Very safe, fun and all round great experience. Must do!!!! :)

Best way to see Hanoi city!. One of the best tours I've been on We saw a lot and learnt a lot of information about Hanoi city! The drivers where great very safe and know there way around the city, definitely a must do when in hanoi. I recommend this tour for everyone.

Great way to see Hanoi. My wife and I took the trip with Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours and it turned out to be a private tour as we were the only two booked on the trip that morning. We were picked up at our hotel at the pre-arranged time. Our Guide, Kan, spoke great English and was very knowledgeable about all of the sights we went to see. It is so much fun zipping round on a Vespa instead of trying to avoid them. We sam lots of areas that we wouldn't have seen had we looked around on our own. The tour lasted about 4 hours and was finished off with an amazing lunch. We would recommend this trip to anybody visiting Hanoi

Tour around Hanou. My husband and I did the tour and oh my word....amazing! Kang and his partner are absolutely great and showed us Hanoi City in 4-5 hours...the tour included a lunch...typical Vietnamese food - delicious indeed and on route drinks! We felt safe in their very capable hands around this busy traffic and had an awesome time! Highly recommended!!!!

Best way to see Hanoi!. This incredible experience elevated my view of Hanoi and the staff, stops and views were all incredible. It's the only way to see this magical city and there is NO WAY to get a local feel as quickly. A must do in my opinion!

Awesome Vespa tour. My husband and I did a 4.5 hour tour with Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours. From the time I requested the tour on line, Khan was very thorough in his email communication and arrangements with us. Khan and his 2nd driver were courteous and great hosts. We felt we had a very thorough tour of Hanoi. The tour was a lot of fun and despite the crazy traffic in Hanoi we never felt unsafe amongst it. I would recommend Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours to anybody wanting to see a bit more of Hanoi.
Great way to see the city . It's was a fun way to see everything in a short period of time. I was the only one on there so it was nice getting a private tour.

Better than a red top bus tour. Kang was a brilliant host, their service and understanding of Vietnam was fantasticHighly recommend. They are indeed the best drivers and food was amazing. Afterwards they spoil you with the best coffee in town with added ice.... Yummy!Him and his driver are very kind and friendly and a must-do in Hanoi....

Best way to explore by vintage vespa. Me and the missus came to Hanoi and booked with Vespa tours. The friendly guide was very welcoming and gave a fantastic tour around the city. We learnt a lot about the history of Hanoi. Would highly recommend this tour for those wanting to learn more about the history and culture of this city. Refreshing to have a guide who is knowledgable and being a petrol head the ride on the Vespa really put this tour above its competetors.

Complimentary tour!. Was shopping for coffee and got a complimentary tour around the city. Saw some very interesting sites with good background info to understand what I was seeing. It made the city of Hanoi seem much more interesting of a place. Very good English speaking guide, definitely worth the time for the whole paid tour.

A tour on the kings of the road!. Being a Vespa rider for over 30 years this was on my must do list for Hanoi. Ok, it was my honeymoon & my wife was a little anxious at first! However, the tour was great (we did the 1/2 day countryside) & even though it was a little pricey compares to regular tours it is worth it. Khang the owner was one of our guides, his knowledge of & enthusiasm for the locations we visited was a pleasure to witness.The guys are very safe & careful riders & even my wife soon felt totally at ease & enjoyed the whole tour. The lunch which is included in the tour was lovely.If you are thinking of doing something different then sitting in a air conditioned minibus then do this -fresh air & Vespa's - can't beat it!!

Perfect way to explore and feel the city! . Would recommend this ride to every one who stays in the city!! Really good way to explore the city. You see all the highlights and can feel the atmosphere of this big city on the back of a Vespa. The guide speaks really good English so you always get details about the things you see. We saw the Opera house, the old bridge, the parliament, the mausoleum and the west lake all in just one day.

Beautiful way to see the city. Really beautiful way to get introduced to the city of Hanoi. The tourguide speaks good English and shows you the highlights of the city, you can take photos and videos at the back of the vespa and feel the atmosphere of the city. We went to the oprah house, the old bridge, the parliament, west-lake and more! Enjoyed myself a lot. I really recommond doing this tour for everyone who just arrived in Hanoi and wants to know their way around!

Best fun and interesting tour to see hanoi night life. This my second time to visit hanoi , I did a night tour because I had such a good time with this tour company on my previous trip to Hanoi. We ate local food and seen beautiful areas of the city. My night ended with live music and good company. High recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Hanoi. Thank you Hanoi Vintage Vespa tours for a great time :D

Vespa motorbike tour . Best way to start the holiday with this Vespa motorbike tour! so much fun and saw so much of the Vietnam culture. Very nice guides and a very fun day! great way to know Hanoi and to find your bearings! Loved it so much! Very recommended. !!

good day out in Hanoi. I had a enjoyable ride around the city the guide was very friendly spoke good English and was most informative about history of Hanoi and surrounding areas i would recommend this company to anyone else.

Fantastic way tour Hanoi!. This was an amazing way to learn more about the city and become orintated. We had a brilliant time and the staff were beyond helpful. They made sure we had a great experience. The motorbike riders are very safe and Linh our tour guide was so much fun! She was able to talk with confidence about all the landmarks of Hanoi and the history. This tour is a must for all tourists!

Evening Vespa tour. 4 of us used Khang and his guys to take us out and about to see some sights and eat in Hanoi. Felt safe and comfortable, and the drivers were professional, safe, and polite. Enjoyed the bars, and restaurants we visited. Dont' miss the coffee stop, it was amazing.We actually drove in the rain, which can make me nervous on the back of a scooter, but felt completely comfortable

Best day of our whole trip. This is the way to see Hanoi. Firstly it is great fun. Secondly the vespa drivers are good and know the traffic and also many sights most tourists do not know about.Linh was our guide and she was brilliant. Her English was exceptional and she took us to some really interesting places.I would absolutely recommend this company on this tour if you really want to see Hanoi.

Perfect way to discover Hanoi. Thank you very much Linh and your drivers for the very nice tour today! We had great fun, discovered interesting places, had very good lunch and learned a lot about Hanoi and Vietnam!John and Anne

Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours is a MUST while in Hanoi!!!!. I cannot recommend Khang and Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours enough. We were a party of 10...ranging in age from 10yrs old-50yrs old. Hands down...our time with Khang and gang was the highlight of our stay in Hanoi. Prior to our arrival Khang was in touch with me...confirming location and pick up time. He and his staff greeted us right on time in the lobby of our hotel. We chose the night tour and experienced the hustle and bustle of driving around Hanoi at night on a Vespa. We saw incredible sights and eat amazing local food along the way. All the drivers were professional, friendly and did I mention the food was AMAZING!!!

Vespa Tour was Amazing!!!!. My friend and I seen this tour once we arrived to Hanoi... It wasn't a pre planned activity, but so glad we did it. We saw so much of Hanoi that I don't think we would of seen otherwise. My tour guide was awesome! They were so so nice. I highly recommend this tour.

Vespa tour of rural Hanoi .. I was picked up from hotel and had a great lunch. After lunch we drove out into the rural area and passed through rice and vegetable communities. We also went to Pagodas and temples. There were seven scooters and it was a relaxing and safe adventure. All the drivers and guides were attentive and friendly and knowledgeable. I would recommend this trip to everyone.
Great tour. My family had so much fun on this day tour, it was a riot zipping around town on these vespas! Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to visit Hanoi

"Hanoi Hip...Ride Baby Ride" by Juana of Wilmington, NC. Golly Gee...Go! It's a wild ride. I prayed to God, Vishnu, Buddah, and my ancestors glad that I'd raised my children, divorced my husband of 30 years, and that no one was dependent on my life so I could enjoy zipping through the maze of bikes and feeling my long lost hippie life of the 60s. I'm vintage but this tour is modern Hanoi hip. If a thrill is what you seek, you won't be disappointed. The food is the best you'll eat in Vietnam and the pit stops at bars you'd never find on your own. Ride baby ride.

An awesome tour!! . We had an incredible 1/2 day tour with Peter, Win & Lucy!! We went shown unique parts of Hanoi that we never would have seen on our own. We saw some temples, mausoleum, Eiffel bridge or "dragon tail bridge", a local market where Peter bought us some bananas, apples, and pineapple. Peter then took us to a fantastic place for lunch! It really is an incredible tour and really worth the cost!! Thanks Peter!!

4 hour motorcycle ride. We enjoyed getting out in the city and seeing the sites. After a riding through the the city and seems no the sites, we stopped to have the best meal ever. We then went on to a coffee cafe followed by two clubs.

Fyll day vespa tour city and countrysite. I booked the tour 2 month before caming. Everything was awesome, starting with being on time at every place, very proffesional guidenance that take care about every aspect of our trip. We felt very secure and well informed. Really we did not expect such outstanding and very friendly stuff. I really recommend vespatour!

Great fun and a safe way to battle Hanoi's traffic. Lovely to see the city by night plus the food stops were fantastic and off the tourist trail. Could have done without the cowboy bar but am just showing my age...
Our guide Khang was a delight.

Hanoi by bike . This tour was so much fun - Khang and his staff were so helpful & this tour was a hidden gem in Hanoi. We whisked through the streets of Hanoi & surrounding sights- along with a delightful lunch & coffee to end the tour. Just do it!! Great tour for Hanoi !!

The Real Hanoi. If you want to get out of the hustle and bustle of Hanoi, the Red River Valley half day your is a great way to see (and taste) some of the real Vietnam. After a great lunch (the best food we ate in Hanoi), we set off on a four hour tour of rice paddies, temples, farms and countryside. There's really no better way to see Vietnam

4hr trip. Great way to see around the city on a vesper. Great tour guide and drivers felt very safe on the back of a local driver. Saw a range of attractions such as temples, war monuments, history sites, opera house and other interesting places. Great local food provided on the tour and trying an egg coffee. (Amazing) highly recommend this tour!

Vesper city 4hr best tour . Did this review with my fam was so good! Staff were very lovely and spoke great English. We had a great meal to start at a local restraunt and started the ride. We saw a range of attractions and they gave us history on everything. This was the best way to see the city would definitely recommend to everyone! So much fun!!

Great City & Countryside Tour on Vintage Vespas!. We booked the City And Countryside Full Day Tour for our first full day in Hanoi.What a great tour! We were met at our hotel right on time by our drivers and pretty much instantly felt comfortable on the vespas provided. When you are new to Vietnam you want to feel safe on the roads!Our tour consisted of an overview of the city, then lunch and then out into the countryside for a ride around, stopping for some streetfood on the way.We made quite a few stops for Khang to tell us about things, and to take a look around. Some of the stop included the Opera House, a farm, a street market, some pagodas / temples, one of the main bridges, some streetfood corn...The day ended back at Khang's shop for a coffee and an opportunity to buy some coffee at good prices.All the drivers were very friendly and professional, and safe on the chaotic streets of Hanoi!I would definitely recommend booking with these guys!

What a ride!. We just finished a half day tour with this touring group and had an amazing time! The guide Khang was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and all of the drivers were very reliable and friendly. We would highly recommend this group for anyone wanting to see Hanoi.....especially if you like riding motorbikes or scooters! Thank you guys :)
Hanoi Vespa day tour. What a great way to see the best parts of this city. From start to finish a wonderful experience-I can't wait to do it again!

Only way to experience the Real Vietnam!. This is a Great way to experience the countryside& culture of Vietnam.The guide is professional & friendly. He will accommodate your needs to give you the awesome experience to make it an unforgettable day!Doing the cooking class adds a different dumb soon into the experience!

Hanoi the way the locals do it!. If you notice one thing right away is that 90% of people move through Vietnam on Scooters, and that's a lot of scooters! Hop on the back of a vintage Vespa and get one of the best tours of Hanoi! Get from place to place with ease as you wind your way through the city to see all of it's beautiful architecture – Temples, Churches, Local Markets, Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, and other historic landmarks. The tour guide was great and provided us with so much information about the places we visited but also about the culture of Vietnam. All of the drivers were so friendly and shared their own personal stories and asked about our stories! My drivers name was Thien and he was awesome! Lunch was delicious, our whole group sat and ate family style. The waiter told us about each dish and even showed us how they prepare and eat spring rolls!My girlfriend and I were the only two doing the full day tour so we said our goodbyes to the group and continued on to the countryside. Open roads, rice fields, a 1000 yr old temple and some road side boiled corn rounded out what was an amazing and educational tour of Hanoi.

Great way to see Hanoi. My wife and I had a small window in Hanoi and really wanted to take in the sites and local action the best way, and we found the perfect was with this tour.
We saw the sites but also went to local areas that allows you to see Hanoi from a locals point of view.
Highly recommend this tour.

Awesome way to see Hanoi. We had the best time on the vintage Vespa tour through Hanoi. Khang was a fantastic tour guide and was very informative. He took us to local markets where it was only the local people, and we got to try some of the fresh produce. Nothing was to much trouble, we would definitely recommend people to do this tour.

Hanoi city trip. Hey everybody, we re so glad to choose the service of Vespa Tours! We had the very amazing time over the day, all expectations came real:) we ve seen the city of Hanoi and beautiful countryside. The guys that drove us were so kind, told us so much infos and showed us so many great places. We totally recommend the service of the company;) Anna

Amazing tour!. Made the right choice to see the city and the countryside on a vespa (a vintage one which attracted much attention). Not only do I feel like one of the locals on a motorbike, it was the best way to hop from one place to another. We visited temples, pagodas, lakes, even the wet market and the fields. What a variety of places! Our tour drivers were very approachable and helpful throughout, and I felt safe and at ease with them. Thank you for the amazing time! I'd love to come back again and have another trip with you all

So much fun!. My husband and I booked an all day tour and loved every minute of it. What a great way to see the city and countryside, on the back of a vintage vespa. Our drivers were very friendly and knowledgeable and we always felt very safe with them. We saw so many sights; the opera house, the Citadel, temples...you name it, we saw it. We stopped for a great lunch then headed off into the countryside where we saw working farms and even stopped on the side of the road to eat fresh corn on the cob. Once back in Hanoi, the owner took us back to his little coffee shop and made us all Vietnamese Coffee and we were able to buy some wonderful beans to take home with us. If you're looking for a great way to spend the day, this is it!

Fun Fun Fun!!!!. We opted for the whole day tour. The morning was spent checking out the city, and in the afternoon we headed out of town. Although I first thought the asking price was expensive, when I look back at all we packed in, it was well and truly worth it!! My driver for the day, Loocj, was just great. Khang, the person who makes sure our tour run smoothly, was a fountain of knowledge and always on the lookout for things to enhance our experience, such as trying tasty treats from various markets. I can't recommend this tour enough. I LOVED it!!!
Great evening. This was a great way to see the sights - charming guide and fun evening. Recommend to anyone.great stops for food and egg coffees too :)
Enjoy Hanoi form another point of view. Fully recommended if you want to explore Hanoi from another point of view, stopping on incredible places only reachable by Vespa.The best, their guides!!!

Michael . South Africa. Being a soloscooterist , I had to try this out , imagine my excitement , seeing Hanoi on a vintage scooter. I was met at my hotel by Khang with a smile both broad and kind , wow what amazing afternoon it was going to be. It is the only way to see this amazing , seemingly chaotic and vibrant city. You feel so close and part of it all , riding pillion in veins that feed this city from one side to the next. We shared a great lunch , fantastic touring and to end it all coffee at Khang's very own shop. Jump on , ride free , see Hanoi and just be.Thanks Khang for a spectacular experience .

Great way to see Hanoi!. The only way to see the true city of Hanoi is on the back of a classic Vespa. Thanks to Kan an Khai for giving us that experience. I definitely would recommend this tour, you can only see so much on foot and it doesn't take long in Hanoi to see the Vespa is the life blood of the city.

Hanoi highlight. Such a glorious way to end our trip to Vietnam. Very relaxed way to see the city, I would definitely recommend it to anyone. I felt completely safe even though it looks terrifying when approaching every major intersection or traffic circle. Loved it!

Best way to experience Hanoi. Had the best day - such an excellent way to see the real Hanoi. Can recommend this tour to anyone. Kicked off with a fantastic lunch followed by visits to many off the beaten track sights.

BEST WAY TO EXPLORE HANOI. We were in Hanoi for a few days, and have walked in old quarter, taken a cab, but this tour by far was the best way to visit not only places in the Old Quarter but also in the other districts of Hanoi. Khang is very knowledgeable about the city and Vietnam in general, we got to talk about the history of Vietnam while stopped at many of the historical places on our tour. Definitely try this tour, you basically ride on the back of a vintage Vespa which is surprisingly comfortable and enjoyable. You get to see cool local street food places and quite a few historical sites as well.Lunch is included in the tour we picked, and it was a heavy duty lunch, not in a bad way either :) we had some great food and at the end of the tour Khang offered to take us to his coffee shop and serve us some fresh Vietnamese coffee, which was definitely one of the highlights of the trip.

Short visit in Hanoi. It was a great trip in the afternnon. Give us in a short time a good overview. Our drivers are carfully on the roads. Thanks a lot to the Vespa Team. I can recommand this trip.....do not try to drive by yourself in Hanoi. Best regards Juergen

Joy Ride!. We booked this tour after reading the great reviews from past customers. We booked the morning tour of Hanoi and we were not disappointed! The vintage vespas were a true treat to ride on and easy on your butt :) After driving around the city to see the sights we stopped at a local markets - such an experience and an eye opener! The product was SO fresh and lovely! To finish the day we had lunch at a local restaurant and then Vietnamese coffee. Highly recommended for couples, friends, and families with teens looking for a great adventure!

Great way to see Hanoi!. Had a great experience with Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours. This must be the absolute best way to see Hanoi. Aprrecieated going around the large lake and also passing by some of the important landmarks of Hanoi. Our guide spoke very well English and knew quite alot of local history which he was eager to tell.My only complaint is the lunch, which was set at a restaurant which did not serve very interesting food. If you are picky with food, then talk to the owner when booking about choosing a place with genuine and tasty food.But, all in all, I can really recommend this tour, I loved it!
Awesome day. I recommend this tour to anyone visiting Hanoi who wants to see the city and countryside intimately! The tour included an excellent lunch, egg coffee, and roadside corn. Great job!

Wow...this is the only way to see Hanoi..I loved it. Firstly I was busting to see Hanoi on a scooter..then I found a place that had Vintage Vespas...my father used to buy and sell Vespas when I was a kid...so I was sold already.Khan the owner operator tuned up early, the Vespa was beautiful, and the places we ventured into varied from back streets, to main boulevards. We had a great dinner, we went to a bar and saw a famous singer belt out some tunes (can't remember her name) and then went to an off the beaten track coffee house...he also let me drive the Vespa...all in all the best night I've had so far!! Do yourself a favour do this..I also felt very safe at all times. Thanks Kerry

Amazing experience. Love this tour!!!. Hu Yen and Loc were our drivers for the day. They were superb and took us out to experience some really cool stuff which was a complete sensual overdrive. We visited many places and get to see, taste, smell, hear and feel the Hanoi countryside as well as interact with the locals. It was a truly gratifying experience for my husband and I. We strongly recommend this tour if you are visiting Hanoi.

The best way to explore Hanoi. My first visit to Vietnam. They gave me some tour suggestions and sounds quite interesting so I booked a full day tour.In the morning we rode on the old Hanoi street, I found this is the coolest way to explore Hanoi. They took me to many must-see places including traditional market to see how local people live.They speak good English and know the history very well. In the afternoon, we visited a temple outside of Hanoi. They told me the story and then I found the story was written by antithetical couplet in Chinese character! (they don't understand Chinese) Amazing!If you come to Hanoi it is one of the coolest thing you cannot miss!
Great fun and informative. Was a battle about what was better - being in the great vintage Vespas traveling through Hanoi or stopping and seeing the sights with our guides

Best way to see Hanoi. Thang is the best host to take you around Hanoi on a scooter. He is a good driver and so was Lui the other driver. It was a fantastic experience and one that I would recommend to everyone who is interested in experiencing Hanoi!the Vespa is a super comfy scooter and the four hours just zip by! With great food stops and friendly locals at each street this is a must do in Hanoi.

Zip around Hanoi in style!. Fantastic hassle free way to explore Hanoi! The bikes are cool, the sights were varied and what better way then to zip around on the back of a vintage Vespa! Our guide Khang really looked after us well and took us to see a lot of interesting sights in a relatively short space of time. He also introduced us to some excellent street food and the best Vietnamese egg coffee...coupled with lots of interesting stories along the way! Big thumbs up to the Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours team. Highly recommended :)

Lovely day out in Hanoi. We randomly booked this tour last minute, and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the tour. It had delicious food, a safe but exciting scooter ride through the city, and some valuable historical information. They were very helpful in regards to helping us take photos and any other questions and help we needed regarding Hanoi. We would recommend it to other travelers!

Best day out in Hanoi! . We were looking for something different to so and this tour did not disappoint. We were picked up by very friendly and skilled drivers!Lunch was amazing too - best food so far! We saw so much more of Hanoi than we would have on our own. We were shown temples, the whole lake, the opera house, the north door and more! We both had such a good time - totally recommend it!

Vintage vespa tour riding around the city. Me and my friend did a vespa tour, we got picked up at the hotel right on time (non-Vietnamese style haha). It was a good experience to sit on the back of the vespa. The driver was very skilled and we both felt safe. The guide took us to many different places around the city like temples and the pagoda and also to the local market. The level of English of the guide was above standards in Vietnam and he could tell us quite a bit about the history of Hanoi. In general I would advice this to other people.

Amazing Hanoi Tour! . Hanoi Vintage Vespa tour took me for an amazing experience. We rode through Hanoi's countryside, city, temples, farms and stopped to eat delicious local food. Khan the owner was very friendly, kind, informative, and professional.The vintage vespas are fun and comfortable unlike some other motorbikes. I highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting this city! :)*sidenote: I'm buying a vintage Vespa when I get home. :)

The best way to visit Hanoi. I am working in the tourism business and i have to say that i was very impressed by the services provided by this company. The Vespa tour is fun, informativ, safe, and the guide was talking a very good English. It's also great in order to see area of Hanoi that are not for the tourist and it's even more interesting than the downtown. The tour was personalized depending on my wishes. I have looked at all the option possible for visiting Hanoi in a private way, and i highly recommend Hanoi Vintage Vespa tour to enjoy the real Hanoi. An experience that i won,t forget.

What an amazing way to see Hanoi!. We did this tour at night. We were a little apprehensive as the traffic here is so chaotic, but within seconds we realised our drivers were more than competent. We were taken for a fabulous meal in a restaurant we would never have dared try on our own, then an "egg coffee" - again something we wouldn't have tried. Then we went to 2 different (and pretty unique) bars. Of course we also went flying around the city seeing all the wonderful lights and famous land marks and learning all about them from our excellent guide Linh. It really is the ONLY way to see this wonderful city!

Amazing way to see Hanoi. Things are meant to be ... we bumped into a guy in Hoi An and he said 'when you are in Hanoi, go for a one day trip with Hanoi Vespa Tours'. That was such great advice! We were picked up at our guesthouse at 8am and were given the most wonderful experience on vintage Vespa scooters. The morning was spent in the countryside, visiting markets where we were welcomed as novelties by local people and we sat and ate at their stalls. On to temples, farms, paddy fields and vegetable gardens. We sat on little stools by the main road and ate sweet corn and we rode over Vietnam's longest bridge. This was followed by a really lovely lunch at a friendly restaurant. Then part 2! Through the city, round West Lake. More temples and a lap of the French Quarter. Although our time was probably up, it was no problem as we battled through the traffic of the Old Quarter and round Hoan Kiem Lake via the Opera House and back to our guesthouse at 4.30. Wow! Khang and Kai were brilliant. Really safety conscious, professional and confident. Very knowledgeable and full of great stories. I took so many photos that the battery was running low on my phone but Khang even had a power bank to re charge!! So, if you are wondering whether to go, it might sound pricey for a day (or half a day), but it's the best way to see and experience Hanoi and some neighbouring countryside.

Wonderful tour . We took the "North Of Red River" vespa tour. Our guides were Huy (main) and Kai. We started the day by visiting a market before travelling through the backstreets and roads of Dong Anh just outside Ha Noi. Huy was very friendly and helpful in explaining the background of the places we visited, recounting many stories to help us understand the history of the place. We found the tour to be eye-opening and educational. Despite the cold and rainy weather, the tour was also thoroughly enjoyable due to the hospitality of our guides. Highly recommended!

Vespa countryside tour. It's our first time to visit Hanoi and to cap off our last day here,we took a VESPA tour. Our tour guide Khan,picked us up at our place. He speaks very good english,thank god for that! The place where he took us was very unique,away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We ate corn by the road which was freshly picked. And on our way back we passed by the longest bridge in hanoi. It was a good experience for me and my friends. I highly recommend it. Look for khan :)

Vespa Countryside Tour. We had a lot of fun with Khan, Lieu and the rest of the Hanoi Vespa Tours gang. Saw interesting places like ancient temples, passed through rice fields, capped the trip off with a great lunch in the old quarters area. Highly recommended! :)

The best way to see Hanoi and it's surroundings, period!. After enjoying a half day Vespa tour in Saigon, the first thing I did when I arrived in Hanoi was find this tour and book it. The first attempt at the full day tour was thwarted by rain and much cooler temperatures so rebooked for the next day. Huy was prompt at arriving at the hotel and off we went through the morning craziness to get out to the countryside. To say I felt safe was an understatement as Huy is an accomplished driver. The countryside trip was amazing and I felt like I had every attraction to myself, because I did. We saw things including a 2000+ year old temple and Huy had an historical Vietnam fable to tell at every one which made everything so much more amazing. Then after an incredibly filling lunch and joining up with 5 others we hit the central Hanoi tour which was very special including a 1000 year old temple, a circumnavigation of West Lake and then the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum. It was an incredible day, thank you Huy and I cannot recommend this adventure to anyone more highly as it was a highlight of my 3 month trip to Vietnam. Enjoy!!!!!

Brief overview of Hanoi. Main attraction of tour was the vintage Vespa ride. Whilst you do see many of the attractions in Hanoi, there is little information on each site and you simply ride by. The main attractions, e.gHo Chi Minh Museum, etc. were not even mentioned. If you want a historical/informative tour steal clear of this one. It Was however an interesting and safe way to ride scooters in busy streets with local.

Amazing way to see hanoi on vintage vespa. It was a great time verry friendly and so funny:) and open for my wishes :) es isch e mega schöni fahrt gsi loht sich wirkli falsi namal do ane chume gahni uf jedefall namal zu ehne

Excellent way to see Hanoi. We did the Vespa tour of Hanoi this morning. We are two seniors so were a little unsure if this tour would terrify us! But we enjoyed it very much. A great way to see all different parts of the city. We went all the way around the lake, over the old and new bridges, to a couple of temples, went by ho chi minh's tomb and had a delicious lunch. Our drivers were very careful driving and we stopped in numerous locations to hear about Vietnam and Hanoi. Would highly recommend this tour!

Vintage Vespa tour . A great tour of Hanoi with fantastic local knowledge. Hesitant to book the tour at first because of riding a vespa but thought we would give it a go. Felt totally safe going through the traffic. Would recommend you give it a go totally worth it.

Delightful Experience. This tour is recommended for those who love to know Hanoi better. Not only the vespa ride was fun (being part of the crazy chaotic traffic buzz in Hanoi), but the tiur guides were insightful. We were given complimentary tour to the village, and it was good to see the simpler side of Hanoi (which reminds me of my own hometown). Then we took the city tour for short while. The tour guides were very friendly, big applause for Mr. Khang and Ms Linh (who shared the same coffee craze with me and my friend). Highly recommended ☺

Great way to see the city. My friends and I booked 2 tours, one during the day that showed all the hightlights and one at night. A great genuine ride through Hanoi on a Vespa with a guide that speaks good English. Riding on a scooter is much easier to manouver through the traffic, the guys are very good drivers.Explain and show everything you ask for, very detailed information about not only Ha Noi but Vietnam also.We went to a local place to have a fantastic lunch, and at night we experienced true Vietnamese food at a local restaurant.Thank you

Original way to discover Hanoi. We had an excellent day with our drivers. We visited the most famous place in Hanoi and a lot of originals ones. The guides are very friendly, safe drivers and knows all the history of Vietnam. We recommend this tour to everyone who want to spend a nice day and discover Hanoi. Thanks to our guide who also speak a very good English. We enjoyed our journey in Hanoi's street on vintageVespa.

Best tour of Hanoi. Mr. Khuy took us on a great tour of the city on some really cool looking Vespas. We stopped at several of the cities most interesting and little know sights such as a crashed American bomber. Mr. Khuy had a great knowledge of all the places we went and taught us lots. If you're looking for a super fun way to get to know this city this is the tour to do!

Fantastic tour. Friendly and safe drivers, knowledgable owner and the best way to see Hanoi - on a vintage vespa like the locals. I was a bit worried about being on a scooter with this traffic, but it was a lot of fun and I never felt as if we were at any risk. Thanks so much Mr. Khuy for an amazing tour, definitely recommended. Really enjoyed seeing the b-52 lake, longbien bridge, and old pagoda as well as just overall views of the city.

Best way to experience Hanoi on Vespa . I book this tour get recommend from a friend, A great genuine ride through Hanoi on a Vespa whit a guide that speaks good English. Take you to places that are hard to experience on your own.Explain and show everything you ask for.And took me to a local place to have a fantastic lunch. I would recommend this for everyone that are new I Hanoi.

The best way to see Hanoï by Vintage Vespa. We spend a really good time in Hanoï, was interested to visit this beautiful city by Vintage Vespa, we felt safe and our Guide was really friendly, I enjoyed so much the view of the lake and the Opera !I recommend this tour if you want to discover the authentic Hanoï.

1 year anniversary Hanoi vintage vespa tour. The best way to see the city and get a feeling of this busy, noisy but beautiful place. We have seen Hanoi's hotspots in a short time with a very experienced guide.

Vespa Tour of Hanoi. Highly recommend this tour. We are a family of 4; our daughters are 9 and 6. This tour is the best way to see the sights of this amazing city. Booked the tour 2 days before and they were very accommodating and safe for all.

Great fun. We really enjoyed doing the evening tour. Khang is very knowledgeable and took us to interesting places that we would not have visited on our own. Just the experience of being part of the traffic was amazing, while feeling totally safe. A highlight of our trip so far. Thanks Khang and co.

Across the Red River. I stumbled on Hanoi Vintage Vespa tours by accident and what a find it turned out to be. I visited their shop and booked up the Red River tour. I wanted to see life in the countryside outside of Hanoi. First stop was the vegetable farms and I briefly helped some of the local farmers in their fields. They even offered to give me a job for $5 a day! After visiting a local market, I was then shown how they make rice paper. Next I was taken to observe local candy being made. After a delicious lunch with a local family we crossed the Red River on a local ferry and went on to a furniture factory. Most of the pieces on display were for temples, made by highly skilled craftsmen. This was such an interesting and varied trip that it is a must do while you are in Hanoi. I am 62 but had such a blast on the vintage Vespa. Khi and Katherine were brilliant, both very professional and knowledgeable. This was the icing on the cake of my stay in Hanoi and I would definitely recommend you try this.

No heart on this tour.... We went on the night tour and had cancelled our day trip earlier just to save energy for this evening tour as we were promised a lot however there was not much delivered... The food was average, we had tasted better in the street food tour. We felt rushed about from place to place we couldn't relax in any one place that we were brought to. We weren't given any time to take photos nor was there any commentary at all from our tour guide Mr Khang who was more busy on whatsap throughout the duration of our tour rather than to ensure we were comfortable. It just made us feel like he wasn't interested and it was just a job to him where he wanted to complete the tour as soon as he could. We were told that there was a lot of food and unlimited drinks this is not the case the food is very limited (as we had to order room service when we got back) and the drinks were one if you even had enough time to drink it at one place.By the time we had got to the last bar (Swing in the French Quarter) he had indicated after my first drink that I would have to buy my own . I have no issue in this but he shouldn't advertise the tour incorrectly or mislead customers. But what really put a bad taste for us was the fact he didn't bother to provide much commentary on the tour however by the last leg of the tour he went on to tell my partner of how much he loved money for about the fifth time during the tour and that is why he was in the tour business which just made us feel uncomfortable. It was no wonder that this tour was rather expensive however he didn't take the time and effort and care to ensure he we had a good time or properly show us the city with some conversation. His assistant however was very nice and made a more of an effort. I think Mr Khang has a lot to learn if he wants his business to become a success. The nature of his business is that he has to be friendly and attentive with customers and not to make them feel like they are a burden. Mr Khang stay of your whatsapp at least for the duration of the tour…that would be a step in the right direction!

1/2day Vespa Tour. Great way to experience the sights of Hanoi. Excellent tour guide and driver. A must do in Hanoi. The owner, Khah, speaks e cel lent English and is very knowledgable of the history of his country

Fantastic experience!. This was a highlight of our stay in Hanoi. What a fabulous way to get a better feel for the city: weaving through the traffic, visiting areas we wouldn't have otherwise seen, hearing Khang's stories of Vietnam's history - all on beautiful vintage vespas. It is absolutely thrilling to be in the thick of the traffic. I felt 100% safe - despite how crazy the traffic looks, it is actually much more orderly than elsewhere. This tour (Insider Morning Tour) not only gives you a view of Hanoi, it is so much fun! I have no doubt that the After Dark tour would be great fun as well. Highly recommended.

Red river tour. My girlfriend and I were picked up early in the morning and taken outside of the city about 45 minutes to an hour. We went to a rice paddy, vegetable farm, flower farm, and local market to try traditional Vietnamese foods you might not find in the city. We saw how rice paper is made, and Went to a local candy factory to see how the locals make sweets. After we tried stopped at aCafe for drinks and a local families house for lunch with fresh delicious traditional Vietnamese food (banana salads, meat and potato soup, spring rolls, "jumping chicken, vegetables, fruit, rice and fried pork). Next we crossed the red River on a barge and drove to a furniture factory where we watched how they made incredibly intricate wood carvings. Then we rode into the urban part of hanoi, saw the apartments, and a laquer art gallery. The whole tour was about 6.5 hours in total. It was safe, fun, delicious and a great way to see the REAL Vietnam and how the locals live outside the city. Great tour!

Most spectacular way to see Hanoi. Best experience in Hanoi - seeing interesting places, less touristic, spiced with local atmosphere. Vespa tours is the best, friendly guide, good driver in the busy traffic of Hanoi.we been to many places and lot a lit of hanoi history AND WE GET very safe on the back of vespa Highly recommend it even to those afraid of motorbikes :)

Vespa Tour in Hanoi. Very interesting way to visit the city and learn about the culture and local customs. Don't need to drive in the chaos of the city, safe drivers take you everywhere and explain about the different places. Today we visited rice and vegetable fields, rice paper shop, wooden furniture shop, a local market and had lunch in a family house. It was great to interact with local people. It rained in the afternoon but we had raincoats and it was no bother at all. Absolutely recommend!

Great Hanoi Vintage Vespa tour. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour today for 4 plus hours on the Vespas travelling around Hanoi. We felt very safe and found our guide khang's commentary very informative and went to many different places. These included the Old quarter, the French quarter, around West Lake, to the markets and with many photo opportunities. This tour ended with a delicious Vietnamese lunch. Thanks Khang and Leo, the tour was great.
The best thing I did in Hanoi. . This was the BEST way to see Hanoi. Cool restaurants, amazing ride, great company. I'm a cheapskate but this was worth every cent.

Best time. Hanoi streets suddenly become non chaotic and absolutely fab. Had the best time whizzing through the streets on the lovely Vespa. Peter looked after me and took me to places I would had never found myself. Great night, great food and great company. Thank you vintage Vespa :)
Fantastic !!!. Very nice tour showing the places local people go. Nice restaurantes, bars and very nice drivers !!!Totally recommend!
Very very nice tour. Guides are very friendly and kind, on the night tour they took us to many nice places with very good local food. We had very good fun!

Best night tour with hanoi vibtage vespa . I and my friend did night tour ,book this tour from hotel , we could like to see hanoi at night get recommend by hotel , we get pick up at the hotel at 6 pm. It so safe to seat on vintage vespa it have a lot of fun , look hanoi so different on day time , we eat many food the food was very good, our tour guide so us a lot of vietnam traditinal food , it so much fun for us at local bar , we enjoy very much the life music this is the best fun tour and we enjoy the most if our trip 10 days ib vietnam Recommend for every one this tour

Great Vespa tour of Hanoi!. We managed to find this gem of a tour from guy and trung which was fantastic. They took us to various Hanoi pagodas, the west lake, around Hanoi centre and the French quarter. Absolutely amazing people, great drivers, knowledgeable about the history and extremely friendly. Would highly recommend for anyone looking to spend a couple of hours exploring this amazing city.

Vespa Tour the best way to see Hanoi. We did today the vespatour in Hanoi and it was just amazing and so much fun!The vespa were really comfortable and we felt very safe.We are here since one week and we still saw a lot of new things. The tourguides speak's english very well and knows a lot about the history.When you are here, don't miss the vespatour!!!

Te best to see hanoi nighlife . My first night in hanoi get recommend from my friend to do vintage vespa tours , i take tour 4 hours afterdark , it was so fun to see hanoi nightlife ,food was very Very good , we eat at authenttic restaurant with vietnames traditional food , i am so much enjoy the music at local car , make us stop at two bar have free drink included in the tours recommend this tour for all my friend Thank you for me the best night in hanoi

Best way to see Hanoi, and the most interesting tour of our trip. Best way to see all of Hanoi. Very nice and helpful staff. They speak good english and tell you about the Hotspots of the city. I also liked the old vespas they have, they are very comfortable, in short time we see a lot of city, we been to 1000 years old pagoda and tour take us get off the beaten path, and outside of tourist, we very enjoy the tour can not say how much fun we have, love it very much, could recommend this tour for every one to do this tour thank you very much to give us the best time in Hanoi

Best night, and the ride of our lives, during our 5 week trip to Vietnam!. Just do it! My husband was a little wary as at 46 he had never been on a scooter and had decided that Vietnamese traffic was crazy, but he soon felt at ease & safe when we were picked up at our hotel by Huy & Theo and the first thing he said at the end of our trip was 'can we do it again?'. Our first stop was the opera house, then past the mural wall, over the bridge and stopped for our first 'food' stop where we watched the sun set as we looked over the Red River and ate the BEST prawn & squid hotpot of our travels. We had lively and interesting conversations with our guides as we ate and got back onto the scooters and over the old bridge and passed the beautifully lit West Lake onto our second food stop where we really ate with the locals. Next we stopped at the cowboy bar where we enjoyed the 'house' band doing great covers of Ed Sheeran, Cyndi Lauper to name but two then onto our highlight the 'Swing' club where the singers were excellent. This tour was also an excellent way to see Hanoi lit up at night. We both wished that we had done this tour earlier in our stay in Hanoi as we would have done at least one of the day tours too. We cannot recommend Huy and his company highly enough - you can't fail to enjoy!

Great way to see Hanoi. We had an afternoon tour of the city with Huey on his vintage vespas. It was great fun to see some of the less well known landmarks of the city and we were given all of the history at each location. Great value, highly recommended!

Amazing Vespa Tour! . We had such a nice time with these guys! Had a wonderful lunch first and saw a lot of the city while sitting on the vintage vespa's! Their English was good and we got loads of insides you wouldnt see if you went by yourself! They gave a lot of information and were really helpful. Definitely would do this again!

Brilliant and friendly tour!!!. My friend and I found hanoi vintage Vespa tour near hoan kiem lake. We got some coffee and juice before starting the tour. suy, our tour guide, explained where we were going to go. We started at the opera house and went across long bien bridge. Everyone stopped for lunch with the best set menu. This was probably my favourite meal in Vietnam. Great selection, fresh and tasty. We also visited 2 6th century pagodas. There weren't many tourists which made it even better. Stopped many times for photos and learnt a lot about the history! I highly recommend this tour. Definitely worth it and would do it again :)

Vespa adventure. Just back from doing the Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tour with my friend. It was a last minute plan on our last day in Hanoi. It was great fun and a fantastic way to see the city including parts outside the tourist areas. Suy our tour guide and driver made us feel safe and was very friendly! We had a delicious lunch at Yin Yang restaurant, a set menu prearranged for us. The tour lasted about 3.5 hours in total and was well worth the money! Thanks Suy we highly recommend you and wish you every success!

See Hanoi in style! . This tour was recommended to me by a friend and though I was a bit skeptical, my friend and I decided to go for it. Definitely worth it! Huy, the tour guide, and his assistant were very safe and careful drivers and we got to see parts of Hanoi that are less touristy, but amazingly beautiful and enriching. It was fun to be right in there with the locals in traffic and felt like we saw so much more of the city than we would have otherwise. Huy is very knowledgable and has fun stories about Vietnamese history and culture. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wants to see a whole lot of Hanoi in a relatively short period of time!

Amazing hanoi after dark tour. We book vespa tour from hotel ,get pick up us at the hotel ,ride around city and we stop at some places before have dinner ,the food was so nice at local authentic food .food was very good we love the food very nuch stop at 2 places for food ,very interested at cowboy bar very nuce and lovely music ,the second bar also nice vietnames song ,we have great night ,i could like to recomnend this tour for you do this tourThank you very much to give us best time to see hanoi night time

Hanoi Motobike. Great tour all around the city to see the famous sightseeings. Funny tour guide and cool vintage Vespa's! We see many places around Hanoi city 1000 years old pagoda , long bien bridge , west lake .. We learn a lot of history from our tour guide , get very safe on the back of Vespa , tour was very nice , I could like to recommend for every one come to Hanoi want to see large of Hanoi city come to do Vespa tourThank you very much Hanoi vintage Vespa tour We hope do our next trip for night tour

THE way to see Hanoi!. If you want to experience the true Hanoi, look no further! Sat on the back of some beautiful retro Vespas with our lovely local guides, keen to show us the lesser-seen side of their city.We saw beautiful pagodas and temples and heard their fascinating back stories. We visited local landmarks (such as the two dragons) and a local market and were the only tourists in sight! The tour also included stops at the more well-known landmarks, including the presidential palace and the HCM mausoleum and left us feeling like we had fully experienced this wonderful city after a few short hours.Couldn't recommend it more highly, jump in and experience Hanoi the way it is meant to be seen, from the road!!

Best Way to see Hanoi!!. Came across this brilliant Vespa tour completely by chance when looking around Hanoi on our own. The tour guide was very friendly, knowledgeable and had great communication skills. On this tour you will see more than just the surface of Hanoi, you get taken deep into the lively heart of the city. We visited many beautiful pagodas and learnt some very unique and interesting facts about each one. Following this we were lucky enough to jump into a local market where we were the only tourists in sight and sampled an array of colourful fruits. Being on a vintage Vespa allowed us to really feel a part of Hanoi and the expert tour guides ensured we were safe and comfortable throughout.If you require one tour of Hanoi don't look further than this one!

Must do!. I did the vespa tour at night with my boyfriend and it was awesome. I recommend it for anyone that is adventurous and wants to experience the local life. It was my first time to ride a vespa and my first time to visit Hanoi. I really enjoyed the dinner across the river where it only the locals hung out. I really loved the food tour and being able to taste local cuisine. Mr. Khang and his team were really awesome and made me feel safe and relaxed. I hope to visit them again in the future!

Adventurous way to see Hanoi. Taking a Vespa around Hanoi is the best way to explore Hanoi and see and experience many things that most people don't get to. Hanoi Vintage Vespa tour was very convenient and exciting. Experiencing the city while riding on a Vespa was more interactive than riding on a bus or car. The tour guide and everyone at Hanoi Vintage Vespa your was very friendly, knowledgeable, and hospitable. I highly recommend Hanoi Vintage Vespa tour if you want an exciting way to experience Hanoi!

Hanoi City Vespa Tour. I had 24 hours left in Hanoi and I really wanted to take a tour of the city on the back of a motorbike or Vespa. My hotel recommended this company to me and booked the tour. I was very happy I did the tour. In four hours we cruised around the city, stopping at historic locations (tourist free). Lunch is included and we had a seven course meal at a local restaurant. The food was amazing! It's a great way to see the city and learn some history from the guide. I'm going to do the night tour this evening before I leave tomorrow morning.

If you like motorbike is the best way to see hanoi. Customer were really nice people, is good for seing all the city in a short time and travelling like the local people. You can enjoy your time in the city with this option!

Hanoi Nights & Lights. What an incredible experience! My husband & I decided to book this tour as a way to see Hanoi by Vespa. It felt like the most authentic glimpse into life in this charming, historical, and colorful city with so much depth. Khang, the owner, put so much time and intention into our visit and designed the most perfect night. We were picked up from our hotel and then had the most delicious fresh fruit in a wonderfully busy and bustling narrow side street we would have never known how to navigate on our own. To feel the wind blowing in your face as the lights and night life was harmonizing around you was unbelievable. Khang explained the historical significance of each sector of town. We then crossed over the river to have a seafood dinner- we had an assortment of seafood and river fish which was delicious. Vietnamese cuisine is an art form, and it was an honor to learn more about it. We then drove across the bridge and lover's lane back to town and to have Pho at a place where the local Vietnamese who live in Hanoi enjoy going. This was such a treat, and the Pho was beyond! We then cruised around town and saw families out enjoying the parks and beauty of the city, drove around the lakes and ended up at an American Western bar where we enjoyed some karaoke. Khang also sells weasel coffee at his shop, so we absolutely had to try some and loved it and of course had to purchase some for savoring at another time. Khang is dedicated to making a memorable experience for those who are up for an adventure and an in depth look at the life, pace, beauty, and colorful energy that makes Hanoi the amazing city that it is. We highly recommend the night foodie tour, although I'm sure any tour would be fantastic, Khang, and the Hanoi Vintage Vespa Tours company to anyone that is visiting or residing in Hanoi! Cảm ơn Khang!

Why stifle your experience of Hanoi when you can get in amongst it and be part of the action. I travel a lot with work and had 1 day to do something interesting in Hanoi. I decided to book the 4 hr personalised Vespa tour but then the storm came and with it torrential rain. I made the call to push on and do the tour and I am so very glad that I did. If anything it was more fun and Khanh was an enthusiastic guide. You really feel part of Hanoi on the Vespa as opposed to a car or worse still bus - you can go anywhere and the travelling between points A to B. Is just as much fun as actually arriving. The lunch at Ying yang was great the team were very friendly and Khahn told some wonderful stories about the history of the area. I would highly recommend this and it represented great value too. Don't let rain put you off just embrace it as part of the adventure. Enjoy.

A Little Bit of Everything!!. We spent our last night in Hanoi doing the Night Vespa Tour, it was awesome! Well worth the time and money. We spent 4 1/2 hours cruising around taking in some of the sights, also visiting a couple of local restaurants and bars. Sampling some local food, entertainment and Vietnamese night life. The tour included dinner at the chosen restaurants which was really tasty and a drink of your choice at each venue. It included a little bit of everything, we really enjoyed it and would highly recommend it.

Evening tour of city includes food and drink. We booked this trip at the last minute after a recommendation from someone who did something similar.Khang arrived on time with a colleague on their gleaming Vespa's. After a quick chat about the itinary,we set off for a tour of the city and soon got used to the traffic chaos. Both of us felt very safe! We then visited a couple of superb restaurants to eat which included drinks before moving onto a bar and swing club where again drinks included. The you took over 4'hours and did not feel rushed. We thoroughly enjoyed the evening. The only area which my wife pointed out was that her driver did not speak much English so she didn't have an opportunity to ask questions as we rode around. It did not spoil her evening however. Highly recommended & worth the money.

Great vespa tour in hanoi. We booked two days ago this awesome tour. It took us about 4 hours. The guide is also the owner of the company and is called huy, he showed us beautiful hidden places where no other tourists have been. He worked for a long time as a tourguide in whole vietnam and he told us very interesting things, especially about hanoi. We made the morning tour, but there are also an afternoon tour and an evening tour.

Vespa riding in Vietnam - my highlight!. I did the night tour of Hanoi and loved it so much that I booked the countryside tour a few days later. I would have preferred to drive my own scooter but so happy that I had a driver - Hanoi is not a place to try out your driving skills. Loved the Vespa! Khan has put together a great night program - very knowledgable about the history and sites. I really enjoyed getting out of the touristy old town to visit and eat and drink at some great local spots. The countryside tour was equally great except that it was extremely hot. Loved the market and cruising the countryside - I learned a lot about Vietnamese culture. My fault for picking the hottest time of the year to go. Highly recommend this tour company!

Ultimate way to see Hanoi!. What a fantastic afternoon with Mihn and his other driver (sorry I forgot his name)! They picked us up from our hotel and were so friendly the entire time. We rode around the streets and saw the sites and then stopped in at a lovely place for a delicious lunch (included).
